column13:
You don't know pizza until you've had Lou Malnai's Pizza. This place easily beats out any pizza joint I've ever had. Nothing compares!!!

We ordered a small Malnati Chicago Classic with pepperoni and a family size house salad. The pizza takes about 30 minutes or more to cook, so I recommend ordering an appetizer. The house salad was huge, could feed 6 people easily. After snacking on that, the pizza came out just as we were get antsy. It was perrrrrrfect. Crispy, gooey, doughy, meaty, saucy, everythingy. I've literally never had anything like it before. A small was enough to feed both of us with a slice leftover. 

Y'all, I don't know why the waitress didn't tell us that the family size salad was going to be huge when we ordered it, especially when it was just us two. But when we ordered a small pizza she tried to push us to get a medium. Just sayin', she could have warned us. 

Overall, I would highly recommend trying this iconic place if you're visiting! I wish they had a Lou Malnati's in Austin so I can indulge more often!

Generally when we get Lou's it's from a carry out location but once in a while we go to the dine-in locations. We went at about 8 pm on a Thursday night and it was a bit crowded at first. The service was a bit slow even though the crowd had seemed to die down. 
Over all the food was great, and we enjoyed the festive Halloween decorations and the Cubs decorations! 
I would defiantly return here... so much crispier getting a pizza at the restaurant vs bringing it home.

Not having been here for at least 30 years, we thought we would give it another try.  We didn't come back for that long because back then the sausage was an entire layer.  Don't remember if it was deep dish or thin crust but anyway, my opinion has changed.

We ordered a thin crust sausage and mushroom 15 minutes in advance to cut down on the time.  Then when we arrived we ordered the combination platter appetizer.  When we sat down, we started the timer. (many said makes no difference if you order ahead)  Well 35 minutes later the pizza came.

Summary, Pizza and appetizer was very good, we'll definitely return on that note.  Very good flavor on the pizza.  Combo platter was also very good,
Service was a bit slow, I would still order in advance, maybe they just prep the pie but don't put it in until you show.
The porch is very loud, everyone was shouting at the table just to hear each other talk.  Next time we do the dining room.

We will definitely return.

My 1400th review shall go to no other place than Lou Malnati's pizza. I finally came back to the Chicagoland area after having moved 6 years ago. Lou Malnati's is my favorite pizza. The crust is perfect, the tomatoes and sauce and the toppings.

For years, my friend had sent me Lou Malnatis pizza in the mail through TastesofChicago.com. I finally got to eat it with her in person.

This Lou Malnatis location has gotten bigger since I last was here. They have a new outside addition. Very nice.

My deep dish pizza did not disappoint whatsoever. We got green peppers and pepperoni. I also had some of their salad. All were heaven.

Our server was terrific. She brought me a birthday dessert. Crazy how something simple as pizza can make me utterly happy. It sure did!

So happy to celebrate my pre-birthday here. I also did make sure to get Lou Malnati's again before I left Chicago.

We came here for lunch and got the Malnati salad for an app and two personal pizzas. One was the Lou and the other was the Malnati with added hot peppers.  Wow talk about chessy heaven. Both did not disappoint, they were delicious. It was great that they offered personal size as well. The salad was equally delicious and a great way to start the meal off. This filled me up for the rest of the day.

Restaurant review
1 word BUTTERCRUST! I did not buy into this for many years, but my palate has slowly shifted away from Gino's East and I think that I have fallen head over heels for the Lou. This is essential one stop shop for deep dish pizza. Although it is not a stuffed pizza like Giordano's you cannot go wrong with a crispy butter flavored crust with large sausage patties. I only recently discovered the beauty of ordering ahead. Forget about waiting 30-40 minutes for your pizza. If you know you are going for lunch, call ahead so they can have your pizza firing in the oven before before you arrive! You won't go wrong if you try this place. 

Pros: Chicago's Best Deep dish, buttercrust

Cons: Long wait times for pizza to cook, if you show up later you may have to wait even longer for a seat!

Hidden deals:
The Lou includes the butter crust without the additional cost

Being away from Chicago is a bummer. But coming back here always cheers me up. Good beer selection, great pizza, good wings and a big family style restaurant. We arrived for an early lunch and got their special, which was a small deep dish personal pizza and a drink. Not a bad deal. 

After a little bit they started moving tables together and sure enough an entire basketball or soccer team came in and sat right in our area. Considering the restaurant wasn't crowded it was kind of irritating they didn't seat them elsewhere. So it was extremely loud from then out.

My last time here, we had a similar problem in the covered sun-room seating area. The sound echoed and it was extremely hard to hold a conversation.
So if you come here for lunch or dinner, be prepared to yell and repeat yourself a few times.
I've ordered delivery two different times while I'm Schaumburg and it is so, so good. They were my first experience with Chicago style pizza and I have it every time I'm in town.

Lou's is always my go to pizza joint when I visit Chicago. This time I was in town for business and brought a co-worker along with me. Now mind you, he is a 6'4 230lbs dude but I still warned him that there would be a lot of food. He insisted that he was going to "plow" some food though. Needless to say, he ordered his own medium pizza with both sausage and pepperoni (this is overkill in my opinion. And I swear years ago you could only get one or he other), a pasta dish and a salad...you should have seen his eyes when the brought it all out.  There was no way he was eating all that. At least the company was flipping the bill.  Since he didn't want to split a pizza I decided to get a medium pepperoni and salad myself knowing I'd take pizza back to the hotel with me.  

Everything was excellent as always!  This was my first time at this location but it was clean, the staff was friendly and attentive and the quality was as I've come to expect. If you are looking for a good Chicago Deep Dish in the area, look no further!

My friends and I came to Chicago and decided leaving without trying out a deep dish pizza would be insane. We went on Yelp and chose this place to be where we would get the famous pizza.

We ordered a large pizza with sausages, pepperoni, and mushrooms. Between four girls, we couldn't finish it. It was delicious in that the pizza was really good but the crust was super thick to me and I decided maybe deep dish isn't exactly my cup of tea. It started getting really heavy in the end and we just couldn't do it.

The service was really nice and I really enjoyed our time here. The pizza did take really long though, about 20-30 minutes. I would recommend first timers to come here but I can't compare this place to other deep dish pizzas in the area!

Famous classic Chicago pizza

The place is packed at 6:30pm on a Thursday night.  Looked mostly like regulars and locals. I had to park in the back 40 and sat at the bar. 


Minestrone soup - 2 days to develop rich taste

Leinie's Summer Shanty- light blond ale with refreshing almost citrus notes. Great for a hot summer day. They offer 8 beers in draft. 

I noticed that they serve Rodney Strong Cabernet by the glass.

Butter crust is phenomenal. Sauce is rich and the topping (Italian sausage and mushrooms) are perfect. 

The two place had a nice vibe and energy. Lots of families, and a few out-of-town business folks. 

I'll go back, when I'm in town.

My husband and I went to Lou M's last night when in Schaumburg. When we walked in, we were greeted by a friendly and helpful gentleman. Since there was a wait, we took a seat at the bar to wait. While no one else was waiting for a drink, the bartender stood with his back to us on his cell phone until I greeted him! I'm glad we were quickly taken to a table. From that point, the service was great. The price was very reasonable, and the "Lou" delicious.

Best pizza!! We've driven through Chicago on our way from west coast to east and lous is ALWAYS our go-to place. 

People may pick Ginos over Lous, but they're both up there, separated by 1 percent five or take! Love Lous!!

We've had multiple deep dish pizzas....
and Lou Malnati's  IS *The Best* Deep dish pizza! (And really some of the best pizza we've ever had!)
Why? 
1.) Crispy Not soggy flour crust
2.) Amazing Quality Mozzarella (Not mixed cheese garbage like other places) 
3.) Flavorful meats and toppings
4.) Excellent Sauce that is made from what are obviously the best tomatoes! 
(i.e. real tomato flavor/ texture with a quality Italian flavor i.e Not red flavorless goo with a ketchup consistency!) 

We will be back!

We stopped here for lunch on our way to Minneapolis from Ohio.  Although I typically prefer thin crust around Chicago ya gotta go thick.  We arrived hungry and traffic was ugly but once we arrived we found free parking. They greeted us immediately and seated us .. all the staff were great .. attentive and friendly without being intrusive. We both go the lunch special of a personal sized pizza and cup of soup. Their minestrone was really good but the star of the show is of course their pizza which is on lists as best in Chicago area and usa.

We'd read about the crust being buttery and my husband said their crust wasn't usually so crunchy.  All know is it was VERY crunchy and I really liked it. The chunky sauce is on top of the cheese so the crust didn't get all soggy and gross. I really liked it and would totally go back if In the area.

Every trip to the Chicago area means a visit to Bacinos for deep dish pizza. We were too tired this trip so we asked our hotel clerk for a recommendation and she raved about Lou Malnati's. I called to make a reservation and they have a strange process - you pre-order your deep dish for a specific time and show up. Then you are kind of priority seated.

When we arrived our waitress, Alma, greeted us and that is when we had our best dining experience EVER. The pizza was very good but Alma was the highlight. She spoke to my Down's brother by name, hugged him and asked him what he wanted. You probably don't understand how truly exceptional this is. My brother glowed. Alma kept all of the beverages filled, checked on us regularly but didn't hover and engaged Larry with every trip to the table. 

The The Malnati Chicago Classic (Lou's lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on Buttercrust) was very good. My only complaint was that the sauce had a slight canned aftertaste. The sausage had great flavor and the buttercrust was excellent. I also added olives and garlic. MMMMMMMMMMMM

The spaghetti and meatballs and meatball sandwich were heartily recommended by the men in our group. Tiramisu for dessert capped a perfect evening. 

As I watched Alma with other customers I was impressed with how warm and engaging her service was. Our first trip to Lou Malnati's and we lucked into a fantastic server with a warm heart. 

Ask for Alma - we will be back on the next trip.

We came by here this past Sunday due to a request from a good friend. He told me, you haven't had Chicago Deep Dish til you've had Lou Malnati's so we obliged. He was right, while not as dis-proportionately better than every other joint I've tried as he so described, I can't deny it was the best I've had. Being from Wisconsin I don't take this lightly, their deep dish had the best cheese I've tasted on any pizza. That and the crust I think truly make this pie rise above the rest, the toppings while good I think were the weakest part of the pie followed by the sauce. This does not mean they weren't good, that is just how I rank this pizzas amazing flavor, cheese-crust-sauce-toppings. Can't wait to stop back again.

Oh and their dessert pizza cookie thing was great too 5/5!

Ben S. recommended this place while at a UYE with him so I bookmarked it since I knew I will be back up here in less than 6 months. Today was the day and I was quite excited to try it out, to be honest.

I have to mention a couple of very important things:
1) I hate crust.
2) I decided a long time ago when I first tried deep dish that I hated them due to the doughy consistency of the deep dish pizzas I have tried from places supposedly known for deep dish.

I started with the Malnati salad which had a wonderful flavor overall. Then the Lou Malnati pizza which was actually not bad. The crust isn't as doughy. It was more crisp and thin underneath and the pizza wasn't swimming in sauce as I have previously experienced in the past with deep dish pizzas.

So the crust did not overwhelm me and it actually worked. The pizza wasn't extra saucy but it was quite cheesy. I don't mean that in a bad way but when you take a slice, a whole entourage of cheese wants to come along. Nevertheless, it was good pizza! 

Service was great. No wait, whatsoever. The place is clean and the experience was quite fantastic!

not sure why - but manager will not turn the bar lights down or off. my face is burning up !!!! i had a stroke in past - cannot take the heat ...  !!! dont know why??? leaving soon --- too hot for me!!!!

Great pizza. A fine establishment that will probably withstand the tests of time. I can feel the fat add to my thinner frame but the sweet sauce and the gooie cheese make me crave more. Hometown favorite, I am glad its not all over yet. Thank you for many many good pizza eating years Lou!

I always wanted to come here for the longest time! One day, my best friends and I unexpectedly stopped here for dinner while we were in town and we were definitely not disappointed! We all ordered our own individual deep dish pizza's! We also ordered Calamari for an appetizer. This place by far has the best calamari I've ever had yet! So fresh & crispy, lightly battered. The pizza's took about 40 mins or so. The wait was really long but we'll worth it. The flavors were all well on point. Next time I'll get a regular sized pie because I heard it tastes so much better that way!

Chicago deep dish pizza, ambiance, and tradition.  We go to South Barrington annually for the Global Leadership Summit at Willow Creek and our group always enjoys Lou Malnati's.  Sometimes we'll try another pizza place, but so far none come close.  See you again next year.

This was probably the best pizza I've ever had in my life. I came to Chicago for the first time and had to try some authentic Chicago deep dish. My friend who was born and raised in Chicago said she knew the perfect place and brought me to Lou Malnati's. Even though I am a Connecticut/New York girl at heart, I have always liked deep dish, but this was on another level. I think I'll be dreaming of this pizza for years to come. We got regular cheese deep dish with a butter crust, I was starving but could only eat 2 pieces because it is that filling. We also had a deep dish chocolate chip cookie for dessert which was equally as amazing. The only thing that could have made this experience better would be if they had outdoor seating, we sat on an enclosed patio which was nice but not the same as enjoying the fresh air on a beautiful day. Either way, I am now a true Lou Malnati's Chicago deep dish pizza fan!

A staple to Chicago! Best deep dish pizza! Butter crust is to die for! Pizza is filled with toppings and the cheese is perfectly cooked. Tomato sauce is a chunky tomato sauce. Always hot and fresh and made to order. Definitely a fork and knife kinda pie! If you're visiting, it's definitely a must go to spot to enjoy a delicious slice of pizza! Don't forget to wear your stretchy pants because you'll definitely need the room!

Not really getting it.
$30 for a medium with three toppings.  The cheese is so thick that it grabs any toppings on the pizza and pulls them off with your bite.  Be ready to grab the hot toppings and sauce off of your plate and stuff them into your mouth with every bite of the dough itself.  I'm not sure what the draw is to this.

I was in Chicago for work and was strongly suggested by my Project Manager to check this place out. We got a Malnati salad at the suggestion of the server and it was very tasty! Unfortunately, we couldn't say the same for the pizza - we got the Malnati Chicago Classic, which was a sausage deep dish and it didn't taste like much. It was bland as can be! Maybe it was because of all the veggie toppings my wife decided to add to the pizza, but if it's that bad it shouldn't be allowed. The service (Rebecca) was great though!

Went on a Monday for dinner with my husband. We were seated right away and our server was very friendly. 
We ordered the bruschettas (there's like 8 of them!) and the thin crust pepperoni and and sausage pizza. The bruschettas weren't worth it, but they were ok, just a bit lacking on actual flavor. The pizza was good, very thin and the sauce was tasty, but nothing to write home about.
The real issue was the noise level, although we quickly realized it was due to a group of 20 with very restless children running around the place.
Overall it was ok, but I probably wouldn't go back.

Came here with the family to have one of Chicago's well-known deep dish pizza and was disappointed.  As I had fondly remembered their downtown location on Wells St. had better tasting pizza.  We had ordered the "Malnati Chicago Classic" which is made with sausage, extra cheese and tomato sauce on a thick buttercrust.  I start off by saying the pizza did not come out piping hot as I hoped it would, so that made the toppings on the deep dish pizza just warm.  Also the crust did not taste as buttery as it once did.  I found it to be flavourless and too hard.  It tasted almost like a frozen pizza.  The tomato sauce was also too salty.  The only positive thing I can pick from our dining experience was the sausage in the pizza which was well seasoned and lean, plus the extra stringy, melted mozzarella cheese. I'm surprised the quality of the food has not kept up to par with its usual standards.
Great Pizza. Went with the medium 6 slice with sausage... a little to much pizza for 2 people with a pitcher of beer. Perfect late night snack during the second half of Monday night football.

We love the food here and the service is always great.  It is a treat for us to get together with our relatives and this is the place we choose to do it.  However, the problem we had the last two times coming here ,( 10/2/2016) was being seated on the porch with a large party going on.  It was so loud on Sunday that we couldn't even hear each other speaking.  If you are going to put regular customers on the porch with a large baby shower you should at least have a temporary separation or screen up.  Or maybe you could inform your customers that a large party was on the porch and give them the option to sit somewhere else.  We were not the only customers who were upset by this.
Most amazing pizza on the planet!
You want deep dish, it's Lou's.  You go anywhere else, just leave the city... you're not welcome.

I was in town from California for my niece's wedding rehearsal dinner. It was scheduled for 5 PM, and we arrived about 10 minutes late. The rehearsal ran a little late, and we were the first to arrive with the rest of the wedding party arriving a few minutes behind us.

When we were taken back to our tables, the area was set and ready, with bowl of house salad and dressings along with pitchers of soda and ice water already on the tables. Once everyone arrived, the staff started bringing out pizzas. Absolutely DELICIOUS! Being a Chicago native, I'm no stranger to Lou's and occasionally get them shipped to the west coast. However, my cousin had driven in from Maryland. Yesterday they had eaten at one of the competitors downtown. Uno the one, there's a card game with the same name as them...   Well when asked which one he liked better, he and his wife both agreed that Lou's is numero uno!

Along with the pizza, bowls of penne pasta with marinara sauce were brought to the table. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce had good flavor. The staff even offered to bring us a different sauce if we preferred. After everyone had their fill of salad, pizza and pasta, we had the fresh fruit platter. While all the fruit was good and tasty, the pineapple was sweeter and juicier than you usually find anywhere.

As far as the staff and service, the group that they had waiting on us were all extremely polite and willing to go out of their way to make sure we all were happy. Between offering to bring us slices of pizza to quickly clearing away any finished plates, they were quick on their feet, always with a smile! KUDOS to Lou's for their delicious food, excellent service and helping make my niece's special weekend one to remember!

I love pizza from here!

We came to this location for a family party. The two young men who helped us where wonderful despite the children that where bouncing off the walls. We didn't get to wait at all for pizzas and they kept bringing more and more and asking if we needed anything. 
It was very pleasant coming here.

My favorite Lou's beside the one downtown . Excellent food and excellent pizza. Service is great staff is super friendly. Butter crust is the way to go for the pizza sausage and pepperoni are my favorites . Lou's is the real deal for deep dish pizza and at this location they do it right

Hands down.  That's all I'm saying if you disagree you're wrong lol.  I'm a self-proclaimed pizza snob and the deep dish here is worth the drive from another town, or the wait if you decide to eat in. My favorite is spinach with pepperoni.   

The parking can be a little tight especially during peak hours but I wouldn't fault this place for that, because you can always find a spot, you just may have to walk a little bit.

Eating inside is nice, the place is very clean, the staff is quite accommodating.  The pricing is expected for this level of quality.

I had been waiting to try Lou Malnati's for a while now.  There aren't any around my usual stomping grounds, and my girlfriend had talked it up quite a bit.  The parking at this location is a little inadequate, so make sure you show up with time to find a spot.
     We ordered a deep dish with green peppers and pepperoni.  When our pizza arrived, our server informed us that they had accidentally made it with green peppers, pepperoni, and onions.  She asked if this was ok, and despite my dislike of onions we told her it was fine (the girlfriend can't get enough onions, so she was thrilled).  I tried a slice, and despite the onions it was pretty good.  A couple moments later, the manager came out and informed us that she was having another pizza brought out (made to match our original order).
     After a couple more minutes, our second pizza was brought out.  I have to say, that it was delicious.  Not quite worth the wait, but very good.  Usually, I'd be subtracting stars due to the service errors that occurred here.  However, I appreciate that the staff tried very hard to make up for it, and at the end of the night we got two pizzas for the price of one.  And my date even got her beloved onions!

Ahhhhh, we've lived in our Schaumburg home for 4 weeks and have already had Lou's 3 times. I love their Thin Crust pizza with pepperoni and/or spinach (half and half, or one or the other). It's just SO good. The best part about this location in particular? It's consistent. We'll get it delivered "just right" each time and it's always perfect. We've ordered from other Lou's where the quality is just so different each time. I won't lie, I'm not one for Deep Dish pizza (even though I'm a born Chicagoan), so this is just a review for Thin Crust. But the thin crust is just to dieeee for... Butter crust... Yummmmmmm (*insert drooling Homer Simpson here*)
Always go to Lou's when we come back to Chicago  torn between the Chicago thick and thin with sausage. Both really good so we got both.

Legit deep dish spot! We were disappointed at the all famous *other chains* in Chicago. You can't go wrong ordering their deep dish here. Friendly staff and delicious food. We had a party of 6 where we paid separately and the waiter gladly accepted the split. There is a parking lot in this building so parking is not an issue. 

Bonus: drinks selection is good too, can't go wrong!

it would have been five stars except for what happened after the meal. Our company meal consisted of deep dish pizza, salad, pasta alfredo with chicken and a mini cookie sundae. At the point of eating, all items tasted great. The deep dish though seemed deeper last time I visited the area because I was able to chomp down a slice with only my hands. Alfredo was rich and loaded with white chicken strips and salad had a ton of ingredients to truly make it an original item.
  Post meal though I experienced an hour of toilet time directly related to one of the items just consumed obviously. This won't deter anybody I know from going to a legendary place, but just a heads up with my experience and a few of my co-workers.

Pizza is great - 5 stars.  Wings are ok - 3 stars.  I would have given this place probably 4 stars but I had to drop it down to 2 due to my delivery experience tonight. 

Everyone orders delivery from pizza places, and their drivers always have change, right?  Wrong!  My total bill for my order #295 made on 2/25/2016 at around 7pm was $24.28.  The delivery guy came and I had two $20 bills; no other sized bills in my wallet.  I always tip well, usually between $5 and $10.  So as I handed over the $40, I asked for $10 back, which would be a $5.72 tip.  Well, I ended up tipping him more because when I asked for $10 back he said, "sorry I have no cash on me, I can't give any change".  I didn't feel like arguing and I had nothing but some change inside, so I just gave him the $40 and said, "well it's your lucky night, $15.72 tip, have a good one!"... Now I am a nice guy like that, but, I find it extremely odd that a food delivery person would have NO change, not even a couple bucks?  Not sure if it's some type of scam he plays to get more tips, or if he was honest.  He seemed like a nice guy so I'll give him the benefit of the doubt.  But, this location needs to make sure their delivery drivers have change!

Sadly, I will now only order from this place when I have an abundance of different bills in my wallet.  If I only have $20's and my bill is around $25, I'll have to order from elsewhere.

Unbelievable pizza. If you like deep dish it is the way to go. The best way to order is a sausage with butter crust and uncut. By getting it uncut you maintain all the juices until you get the 
Issa home to cut and eat. Awesome pizza. Have ordered for years and will continue to order.

I hear the food is good but they don't treat you good here.  I called 45 minutes ahead got transferred 3 times to pre-order. I was asked for my name and number and how many was in my party.   When I arrived I was told I would have to wait another 20 minutes.  Why ask my number is you are not going to call me to let me know you were running late?  It's been 33 minutes still not ready..  But if you value good food over your time go for it.  I won't be back.

Their Chicago deep dish was really delicious in my opinion! I especially liked their crust! Very different from many other places. We also had some leftover and they still tasted surprisingly good after being stored in the fridge overnight!

Their famous deep dish Chicago style pizza is quite tasty and a large portion to dive into for the faint of heart.  The desserts are delicious.

Service is great with friendly and helpful staff.

This chain is very successful for a reason.

I cannot wait until I am back to Chicago to dine ther again!

BEST PIZZA EVER

Helps that their customer service is 100%. Ordered out a pretty complex order (Medium deep dish half Lou half Sausage Mushroom, Gluten Free thin crust Lou add Sausage) and they messed up, not only did they comp the gluten free pizza, they also gave me a free pizza to redeem for a future order and a free salad. 

No complaints here. 100% all the time.

I have to be in the mood for Lou's to dine here or carry out. But when the craving for great deep dish pizza hits, Lou's hits the spot, by far! We've also tried the low fat cheese, which is drier but still good. Mushroom and spinach combo is great. Not a fan of the giant sausage patty, but you can order "easy sausage." Tried the special Lou's baked mostiacioli too and it is delicious but enough for 2-3 people to eat. I have order Lou's to be sent to my brother in FL and he loved it!
Every time I pass through Chicagoland I have to get Lou Malnati's. The best pizza ever! Nothing, not even Uno's can compare.

I went there while I was in Chicago, mainly because many people I talked to insisted for me to try this Chicago symbol... I have to say that I was not disappointed and that I had the best deep-dish pizza from my time in Chicago there, even if it is a chain.

First, their pizzas aren't very expensive for what they are and they are very good. They take a long time to make your pizza, but I guess it is necessary to get a good one. The service was otherwise fast and efficient.

This location does offer parking, and it does not seem to get too crowded, even during the rush hour. The restaurant was pretty packed when we got there, but we didn't have to wait to be seated.

Overall, my experience with Lou Malnati's Pizzeria was very positive and I would recommend it if you are in Chicago and want to try a deep dish pizza. Feel free to message me for any additional details that you may need!

Wow! Yummmmmmmm! Real pizza! The buttery thick crust was beyond delicious. There is no pizza like this in Cali anywhere that I know of. The sauce = savory and rich. Ingredients = plentiful and fresh. The pizza pie= big, hot, and fulfilling. I found this place online. I'm kind of bummed the frozen pizzas are so expensive. Otherwise, I'd order them...regularly! Lol

Can't wait to visit Roselle and eat here again.

Love to be able to walk in and sit at the bar, have a drink (thanks to John) order a pizza and relax! Our usual Thursday night stop. Most recently we have been out of town due to a family issue. You know you are in a great neighborhood place when John and others say "hey, it's great to see you" ! The pizza is great . The place is always clean and the staff is friendly...  that's all we want - good service, tasty food and a good cold drinks. Thanks again!!

Okay, so I'm primarily giving Lou Malnati's 5 stars because of the pizza.  That is it. 

This isn't necessarily the coolest or most unique place to go. It's big and and clearly fined-tuned to service a lot of people craving some delish deep dish. 

From my 2 experiences, if you go here you are going to need a reservation. If not, be prepared to wait 30 minutes which goes by quick. Espec if you grab a drink at the bar!

Oh yeah, the bar. It sucks. Just because a drink is kind of expensive doesn't mean it's going to be good. This isn't the sort of place you want to try something new....

Getting back to the nuts and bolts of this review, the pizza is the bomb. You can put your order in when you put your name in making your wait-time much shorter. This means you can start nommin' shortly after being seated. The crust is what makes the pizza come full circle...it's buttery and flavorful. Like, I looooove the crust. It's quite addicting. LM goes for more sauce than cheese which is my groove. Some people like the cheesy route but not his CM. 

I need to have my Chicago friends mail me some frozen pizzas. Mmmm I wish I could get this in STL!
Excellent!!! I'm ready for another trip to Chicago. Please check it out if you are in the city.

I have only heard wonderful things about Lou Malnati's... And don't get me wrong it was good, but not as good as I expected for the hype. We ordered the Malnati Chicago Classic and the sausage was good, but weird that it was just a full layer. I would definitely go back because the butter crust was tremendously delicious and I'd love to try a different variety of pizza... But not the5 star review I expected from the hype!

Terribly disappointed. Celebrating my sister's birthday, called to make reservations for 10. Apparently, 10 is too low a number. Was told we could order the pizza before we arrived to be seated quicker--don't think I'll call the other 9 in our party in the middle of the day to ask them what they want to eat at 6p, but, hey, maybe that's just me. So our party of 10, including an 85 year old that walks with difficulty and the use of a cane, along with a toddler, arrived and were then told an hour or more wait. We agreed to wait, and then watched as four other parties within about 15 minutes handed their pagers back and walked out. We ordered our pizzas while standing in the entryway. Had I known we would be ordering standing up, I would've suggested Portillo's down the road. We finally are seated over an hour later. We order appetizers. Imagine my surprise when the arrival of the appetizers are so very quickly followed by the pizza that would be "timed" appropriately...not so much. And best yet, the pizza, normally still steaming when it arrives as on previous occasions, was not hot. Barely luke warm. Spoke to a manager to express my disappointment. Was told, "Well, we have to follow guidelines." I get it. I've been in the service industry for over 25+ years. I make exceptions everyday. I have never felt more rushed trying to enjoy a family get together. We literally waited longer for our table then we sat together and ate. I've been to this location with large parties before, and made reservations, and they've charged me $50 before I even walk in to hold the reservation. Was more than willing to do the same thing this time. Perhaps now we'll choose another establishment.

Lou's is always a favorite with great atmosphere and awsome pizza don't see how it could get any better
I got the traditional added pepperoni awsome!!
25 to 35 minute wait for pizza to cook but we'll worth it
Excellent choice if you want Chicago style pizza.  Oh and the wild cream of rice soup was out of this world delicious!
Really amazing and authentic pizza! Loved the original Lou and Spinach Bread as an app! If visiting from out of town this is the place to check out for sure!

Classic Chicago deep dish deliciousness! 

There's almost always a line but that's ok, look over the menu and order your pizza while waiting and save time! Then go into the bar and grab a drink.

Must try appetizer: spinach stuffed bread, yum!

If you love pizzas...This is probably one of the best places in chicago. Pizzas are fantastic.  Location is great with ample parking that always seem to be full. We wanted to eat in but the wait was so long I decided to do take out. 
Only 3 stars due to long wait and because it is overly crowded.

I love pizza. I love deep dish pizza. I just love everything about pizza. 

We made a reservation at 8pm for a 9pm table with 10 people on a Friday night, and shockingly, we got it! We ordered two cheeses and a veggie, and there were zero complaints on the taste. The crust was delectable, and the cheese, oh don't get me started on that delicious, warm cheese! I could go on and on. 10/10 for pizza. The waitress and two busboys were incredibly nice and always had positive energy, even with the stress of tending to a full house on a Friday night. 

Basically, I had a great experience at Lous. Workers were great and food was great, which made my Friday night exceptionally perfect. Will definitely come again!

Good pizza, a must try when in Chicago and looking to enjoy a Chicago slice.  I prefer their thin crust, but they are not my favorite in the area.  The delivery was fast and fresh however and it was a nice way to enjoy my first night in Schaumburg.  Worth the try, but don't expect life changing pizza.
I have lived in Chicago my entire life and have never been.  My husband took me there last week......OMGOSH the best deep dish pizza ever.  Will be going back very soon.

Malnati's classic Chicago style pizza is the best. We visit Chicago about twice a year for work from Texas and we always make it a must visit. This pizza just melts in your mouth. Lean sausage with cheese and fresh tomatoes make this a wonderful way to add calories to your diet, lol. Thank you for making me fat and happy when I visit!

My family and I were passing through and stopped for the night. Lou Malnati's was recommended to us to experience Chicago style pizza. It was soo good! It does take about 30 minutes for the pizza to cook. The crust was soft, yet crunchy and golden. So very good. However, if you go you MUST order the chocolate chip cookie pizza that comes served with vanilla bean ice cream and whipped cream. No joke, I'd move here just for this cookie. It was seriously amazing and only 5.95. Yes you can share with 2-3 people, like we did. But honestly just get it for you. So darn good.

The crew wanted to eat Deep Dish Pizza and so we ventured upon over here at Lou Malnati's Pizzeria. Once arriving here, we elected the option of outdoor rooftop seating, which is perfect for the sunny day we were enjoying in Chicago. We ended up with a couple of appetizers, and a large Chicago Classic Deep Dish. The Portions here are quite generous - the salad I had myself could've been dinner for two people. It was quite tasty, and from what my co-workers have stated. 

With regards to the pizza itself, it was served by the table in a large metal tin with the waitress freshly cutting the pizza at the table, and serving the slices out. I remember that the pizza itself had a generous amount of the sausage on top of the pizza, and the tomato sauce had chunks of tomatoes in it, which had a nice textural contrast with the rest of the pizza. But those who know me will know that I'm indifferent with deep dish pizza, as I don't care for that much cheese. 

That being said - I did enjoy my slice of pizza here; the service was excellent, and friendly and the venue is obviously popular. While we were leaving, the dinner crowd arrived and the venue started to become a packed house quickly. 

If anyone is interested in Deep Dish Pizza, I would recommend giving Lou Malnati's Pizzeria a try.

Chicago style pizza is allegedly pretty good so based on Yelp reviews we came here for dinner. We are traveling on business from CA.

The crowd was heavy all evening long yet we were seated in no more than 30 minutes.

Customer service was just great.  A waitress took our order promptly and bake time about 25 minutes.

The buttery crust cooked not burned with layers of sausage, cheese topped with anchovies and a mildly spicy sauce was unlike anything in CA.

This may not be the best Chicago but it made the 1500 mile trip worth it!!

Amazing Chicago style pizza place.

I couldnt recommend it more. Careful though, the place fills to capacity very often so just showing up could get you on a waiting list. Also, deep dish pizzas take 35-45 minutes to make so be ready to wait for that too, BUT you could always call your order in ahead of time.
I used to think deep dish was eh bcuz the one I had was salty af but now I lessthan3 deep dish. :)

I came here for pizza for delivery. It was served warm and ready. The delivery man was nice and friendly. I have been to different Lou Malnati's, so I knew it will be good. I ordered two deep dish pizzas (one sausage and one sausage and pepperoni) and one thin crust pizza which was just cheese. The thin crust cheese was okay but not great. The flavor wasn't as good. The deep dish is THE BEST in Chicago pizza I've ever had. The flavor is amazing, and the crust is crunchy and it's great! The sauce, sausage, and pepperoni have great tastes! All in all, great staff and amazing food. I will come back!

I love pizza. Leave me alone with a large pizza and I shall terminate that in one sitting all by myself. I am a champ so I stay away. I hadnt been to Lou's in forever, mainly because I have no self control. My foreign family wanted to try deep dish pizza so I couldn't think of a better place to go. 
We went Saturday night and only waited 20 minutes. Got sat in the back room and our server came right away. He was personable, efficient and kept us informed about the Hawks game throughout the whole dinner. Loved it.
The pizza was great. We ordered 2 medium pizzas, one veggie and one pepperoni. Both were great and the crust was to die for. It was so filling we had to take 70 percent home. My only complaint is that the mushrooms in my black olive and mushroom pizza were canned and not fresh. I dealt with it but I guess I expect more from LM. 
Can't wait to cheat again in my diet and stuff my face at Lou Malnati's. Thumbs up

Had to had have a good Chicago-style deep dish pizza at a recent visit to the area, and this place did not disappoint me. We tried their classic pizza as well as the pizza that is named after Lou. Both were delicious! Nice ambiance and helpful servers. Prices were very reasonable got the quality and quantity.

I couldn't leave the Chicago area without noshing some deep dish pizza, and happily Lou Malnati's gave me the foodie closure that I needed. 

I ordered an individual (6 inch) Malnati Chicago Classic, which comes with lean sausage, some extra cheese and vine-ripened tomato sauce on buttercrust. 

And let me take a second to say how happy I was that they have individual pizzas. The size was probably comparable to one and a half giant pieces of pizza pie that you would get out of a regular deep dish. And the small pizza definitely filled me up and seemed just as deep as a normal deep dish pizza. 

And the taste was "authentic Chicago" as the menu claims.

So why just four stars? I think most people are partial to their first deep dish experience, and for me that's Gino's East. I feel like Gino's deep dish is perhaps more flavorful and cheesy. But I know this is very subjective, and please don't douse me with Hatorade over this. 

Lou Malnati's was delicious and I hope to get to go back and perhaps be swayed to have a new deep dish favorite.

My first experience with REAL Chicago style pizza and I was not disappointed! Super busy place....be prepared to wait for dinner! We were seated sooner then we thought though so at least we didn't wait too too long.They have an OK selection of beer (I'm just spoiled and from San Diego where there's sometimes more beer choices then food choices) but that's not what was important....the pizza! We ordered the Lou's Special which was basically a ton of cheese, sauce, and sausage. The crust was SOOOO good!! We also ordered a thin crust pizza but I was too stuffed from all the sausage and cheese on the first one to try it but for sure will next time. 

I really have nothing to compare this to in terms of Chicago style pizza, but I will for sure be coming back every time we come to visit!

Lou Malnati's is always a great pizza stop.  This location uses a refurbished house setting and is unique for a Lou Malnati's.  We sat in the newer and sunny outer addition area surrounding the main house structure.  We came in for an afternoon snack of spinach stuffed bread and an individual size Chicago classic deep dish - and both hit the spot, just as expected.  The bar area looked a bit plainish though.  The outer dining area can also get quite loud as patrons show up.
Ordered out regret it. But manager was kind and gave me my money back. Says eating in was better
The pizza was great! Our waiter Paul was awesome. He kept our drinks full and even served us our pizza.  It's rare to find such a great combination of great food and great service.  A++
First (but definitely not the last) time having authentic, Chicago style deep dish. Several different friends told me I HAD to go to Lou's if/when I was in Chicago, and I'm glad I did.

This restaurant is in a very convenient location and how busy it gets demonstrates this. I went around 2 pm on a Saturday, and the place was packed. The wait wasn't too long and the wait for the pizza and soup wasn't ridiculous either (30-35 mins or so). The pizza was absolutely exceptional, we got the Extra cheese, and lean sausage (called the Chicago classic Malnati or something of the sort). Overall a good experience

I'm was never a fan of deep dish pizza and I never really order it anywhere else. I tried Lou malnatis once with friends and ordered the deep dish Chicago classic and that changed my mind completely. My fav 3 places are Lou malnatis, Gino's east, then giordanos. But Lou malnatis takes the cake when it comes to deep dish. By far, my fav place so far when it comes to deep dish so far.

I don't go too crazy for pizza, but if I'm ever craving deep dish, this place is at the top of the list.

LOU MALNATI'S is the BEST pizza in and around Chicago!! I LOVE their Personal Deep Dish Deluxe pizzas, which are not on the menu anymore, yet they are available--sausage, mushrooms, onions, and green pepper--DELICIOUS!! 
I prefer the House Salad over the Malnati Salad: Iceberg and Romaine lettuce, red cabbage, carrots, roma tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions and croutons. Medium $5.45  |  Family size $10.25 (A gluten-free option when served without croutons.)
Housemade Salad Dressings: House Red Wine Vinaigrette, Thousand Island, Creamy Lemon Garlic, Gorgonzola, and Reduced-Calorie Ranch. My favorite dressing is the Creamy Lemon Garlic, then the House Red Wine Vinaigrette. I always get two or three dressings when I order this. I live closer to the carry-out/delivery only location on Barrington Road, next to Party City, 
357 South Barrington Road, Schaumburg, IL 60193. At least once a month or so, I order a pizza and salad for pickup or delivery. It lasts for two or three meals! YUM!!

Love, love, love da Lou's! The Chicago style pizza is loaded with a wonderful, chunky, sweet Italian tomato sauce with plenty of cheese and a sausage patty across the whole pizza.  We normally go to the Buffalo Grove restaurant, it we were in Schaumburg and incredibly hungry.  At 4:30, the place was packed.  We were told the wait was 10-15 minutes, in actuality it was 25.  We pre-ordered our pizza.  There was a misunderstanding about a ticket we were supposed to have for the pre-order.  At the Buffalo Grove restaurant, salad dressing is on the side.  At this location it was not.  I don't like using that much dressing.  The seating is tight and increibly noisy!  Will not be returning to this location.

I'm from South Carolina and was lucky enough to visit Chicago (go bears!) and wanted to try Chicago style pizza for the first time! Boy this place did not disappoint! Customer service over the phone was super friendly, food was delivered promptly and the pizza was insanely delicious! Thanks for such an amazing experience at Chicago style pizza!
Their deep dish pizza is always good.
The pizza is excellent. I prefer carryout or delivery because their parking lot is difficult and is sometimes hard to get a table.

I had the pleasure of eating here for lunch yesterday. It's a very nice restaurant with good service and awesome pizza! I had the classic deep dish with pepperoni on top. This is one of the best pizzas I have ever eaten. The deep dish crust is thin and the slices are delicious and filling. Clean environment and very friendly staff. I recommend this place as a must visit if you are in Chicago!
The only deep dish you'll ever need. We love to take visiting guests for the best deep dish in town! Take my advice and get yourself the Lou (add pepperoni) & a Malnati salad, then you're good to go!

Let's talk about clutch Lou updates, shall we?

In addition to the delicious deep dish, here are a few other things you should keep in mind when heading into or ordering from Lou's...

1) Creamy.Garlic.Dressing: Get this delicious dressing on (or on the side of) any salad. Do not breath on anyone for at least 12 hours. 

2) They deliver! Yes indeed. They even deliver a cookie pizza that is king when it comes to desserts. 

3) Lou Special deep dish is the way to go: Spinach, sliced tomatoes, mushrooms (I am anti-fungii, so I typically ask for them to leave these off), and cheddar, romano, and mozzarella cheese. Perfection. 

I got 99 problems, but my Lou ain't one.

YUMO!!!!love this pizza - carry out or eat in - always great

parking not too great

This is an out of the park restaurant. The garlic bread and salad was delicious.  Our pizza was great. Our wait staff was wonderful and attentive. The pizza takes 35 minutes to bake, however it was worth the wait.  The decor was so fantastic.

Everyone lives deep dish pizza and always recommends Lou's. Personally, I didn't think it was anything spectacular. They don't have a variety of options. I'm more of a thin crust person, (gasp!) I know. I suggest checking out peaquods, I think they have better options for deep dish.
The only recommendation I would make is to not eat this pizza. The pizza did not taste fresh, lacked flavor, and overall gave a bad impression.

The best delicious pizza!
Cheese or vegetarian just mouth watering.
Chicago famous for Pizza!

The beef chow fun is excellent that can compare with Chinatown's one, it may be even weight better than over there ! The noodle is not greasy but also the beef is so tender. Besides, Price and portion are decent! Worth to try. I will definitely order it again.

Ordered their Combo Platter for two and Combo Fried Rice tonight. Food was ready in 17 minutes.

The Combo Platter came with 2 egg rolls, Fried Shrimp, Beef Teriyaki sticks, BBQ Pork and Crab Rangoon. All of the item were very good

The Combo Fried Rice came with a lot of shrimp, chicken and pork, a lot more than I normally  see when ordering from other restaurants. It was also very good

I also had a 10% off coupon and got all this for under $20

Went on a Tuesday for the orange chicken special for $4 and also got a smoothie to try

First the smoothie, wow was this horrible, their blender is probably super old and not sharpened, cuase I had some chunks of ice in there that kept getting stuck in the straw. It was a coconut smoothie but the flavor was lacking tasted like water ice and some coconut milk mixed together but mostly water. It was just way too watery to call it a smoothie, sine smoothies are supposed to be a bit thick and creamy, this was watered down juice.

The other thing I got was orange chicken with white rice. The look of it looked good, it was 5 or 6 big pieces of meat with 2 stalks of broccoli. The sauce was nice and had orange flavor to it but it was so thick. The broccoli and rice were fine, but the chicken when you bite into it is crispy, but the meat they use.... Ewww.  On the inside some prices were fine and white others looked like they were sitting out all day for maybe a couple days, all greyed out and black I ended up choosing not to eat those prices and so I only had 3 pieces of chicken.

Overall meh food you can find better around this town
They food was very good and the new management is very nice too. The best dishes was black pepper beef and ice mountain chicken.

My favorite Chinese take-out place in the area closed after more than 20 years. I have been looking for a replacement and decided to give 7 Luck a try last Saturday. 

My wife and I each tried one of our standards -  sweet and sour shrimp for my wife and Mongolian beef for me.  And egg rolls. Plus, a large order of pork fried rice. 

One thing we immediately noticed is that the egg rolls are larger than most places. And, they have a spice that is not common for the dish.  It may have been allspice.  It was an interesting addition and quite good. 

The Mongolian beef was tasty. Again, the recipe is a bit different but very acceptable. I did miss the cellophane noodle topping that most places provide.  But the flavor was quite good and made up for the missing noodles. 

The sweet and sour was pretty standard.  But the sauce wasn't heated enough to be fully liquid and had a jelly like texture. A minute in the microwave solved that.  I'm assuming this was not the normal way the restaurant serves the sauce.   On the plus side, the pineapple in the sauce seemed fresh rather than canned. 

The fried rice also was pretty standard. Maybe it had a few less vegetables than I have seen elsewhere. 

One thing to note is that each entree came with a serving of egg drop soup.  I have never been a big fan of the dish, but I tried it.  It was about the same as every other time I tried it. 

So, summing up,  7 Luck is a decent neighborhood place for take out (they also deliver.)  I will explore the menu further.  But I may try other places too rather than making this my forever Chinese take out.
I must say that I was impressed with the quality and quantity, as well add the speed of delivery, very good in my book! Awesome will definitely get from here again
I tend to go here often, the food is delicious and at a reasonable price as well as friendly people.

Don't be fooled...this is in no way considered "gourmet..." but thay being said, it's still a solid take out joint for cheap, fast Chinese food.  My fav is the Chicken Kow Chow Fun.  It's loaded with chicken, veggies, and soft delicious wide rice noodles.  And let's not forget,  the portions are insanely huge.  I have enough for dinner, lunch tomorrow, and a late afternoon snack.
Excellent food carry out but have small table we ate on I ordered lunch special Beef kow comes with soup or pop crabmeat or egg roll Best Beef kow I ever ate!

This my little spot right here. I'm from Chicago so I'm always looking for a good place to get Chinese food. I like coming here because they have easy access and it's easy to get in order in. There never too busy to take in order. Prices are a few dollars too high, but what can you expect getting this type of food in the suburbs. It's a good spot for what it's worth... no complaints here.

Feature request: please add APPLE PAY support for 5 stars!

I like this place.  They are always nice when ordering.  I haven't had anything I didn't like from them yet.  I think their prices are fair and their service is quick.  This is our go to Chinese place in the area.
ordered yesterday looks like new owners food was disgusting  never again

Okay, I've been going to this place for 10+ years and I'm always going to go here.  The thing that I love most is that this is one of the few places that have combos after lunch.  Their prices are fair and they always let me add additional crab rangoon without ordering a full order (I love them, but I don't need 5).

Compared to some of the other Chinese Food places I've checked out on Yelp recently this place hands down is better than all of them. The flavors and portion sizes are great, and I'm never disappointed.  The only time that I'm ever disappointed is when I realize that EVERYTHING on my plate is fried, but that's my fault not there's.  I should stop ordering crab rangoon, fried rice, and sweet and sour chicken.  

They are always nice when you order and when I'm slammed for time and call 10 minutes before closing they still take my order which is really great!

Anyways I've tried their sweet and sour chicken, shrimp egg foo young, and chicken and broccoli recently.  Oh and yeah their crab rangoon are really good! 

If I try anything else I'll update my review.

We order from here all the time. The food is delicious, the portions huge, and always ready when I get there to pick up our order. We have tried the basics and some new options from 7 Luck and have not been disappointed. 

We highly recommend this restaurant.

Staff was very friendly when I came in for pickup.  The portions were generous as well.  The food itself was average in my opinion and the pricing was average as well.  Overall, I had an above average experience with the staff and an average experience with the food.

My wife and I, at one time, ordered from Seven Luck with some frequency of regularity. It wasn't good, but then again it wasn't bad. With the wide selection of potential places to order in Schaumburg, this was just one of those places that fell into our rotation.

Not anymore. 

We ordered in from them this past Sunday. My wife ordering salt and pepper shrimp and I getting my regular General Tso's Chicken dinner special. All was going well as I started digging in until about the 5th bite into my fried rice, I noticed something odd looking in my food. It definitely didn't belong.

After rolling it over with my fork for a few moments, it clicked in my head that there was the seared remains of an insect in my food. Specifically a beetle that looked like the last moments of it's life had been nestled in rice, green onions and bits of scrambled egg before making it's way to my styrofoam container and into my home. 

Immediately fighting the urge to throw up in my mouth, I had my wife check her food, hoping she could at least finish her meal. Not so. There was half of another insect in her food causing her to collect every last bit of food and throw it in the trash as I called the establishment. 

After explaining the situation, the manager of the place was initially willing to offer me a 15% or 20% discount on our next meal, wrongly assuming there would be a next time. I retorted that I wanted a full refund and was told I'd need to come in. I packed up my bug food and headed over. Upon showing them the contents of my meal, they retorted that it was, "nasty", and proceeded to apologize profusely. Nasty indeed.

They happily refunded the full balance of what we'd paid for the meal, but the damage is still done. Sure, I would love to patronize a place that'd offered run-of-the-mill food and did so relatively well, but mentally, it's always going to be that place where a bug was in my food. For that, I can't condone ordering from them anymore.

Do not order from here!!!!

The food is awful. My husband and I just ordered take out, and we are disgusted. They got my order completely wrong (gave me orange chicken instead of sesame chicken) and my husband's kung pao was literally inedible. All of the food is the same consistency, even the vegetables: mushy, cold, soggy, overcooked, and gross. I called and complained and she was very nice, offered me a free meal, but I will never go back.

Delicious and cheap Chinese food. Love ordering from here. You have to try the pot stickers! They recently changed management, but we didn't notice a difference in the food, service or quality - still outstanding.

I wanted to try this restaurant because I was looking for a better Chinese restaurant. I almost wish I would have stuck to my old place. 

I called in the order for delivery. I gave my credit card number and she kept saying it was declined. I called the cc company and they told me because the expiration date was entered wrong both times. I only had to repeat myself three times! This irritated me but I still proceeded with my order. 

Fast delivery! We were told 40 minutes but within 20 minutes our food arrived. Ordered the Mongolian beef but couldn't eat it because it was sweet to me. My husband had Shrimp with lobster sauce and couldn't eat his dish because it was extremely salty. We both had tummy aches from the crab rangoon/egg rolls. I dunno what it was but I can tell you we will not be eating here again.

My Fianc and I ordered from them. They were relatively quick and I can see why. We were so starving but we were looking for something inexpensive yet tasty. From now on, we will definitely just pay the extra for food that is MEDIOCRE. My Fianc dumped his sesame chicken. I took a few bites out of my egg foo young. The food was so terrible. I immediately ordered from another asian food location that we usually go to. I can't believe I wasted money on such crappy food. The rice was clearly left over for more than a day. I mean, it was bad.

Got take-out. The service was friendly. The food was flavorful, but there were some problems. I ordered the sesame tofu dish for $9. It featured a wonderful savory, sweet and slightly spicy sauce. However, the tofu was spoiled and the broccoli was overcooked. I called them about the spoilage and they were willing to make me a new one, which had good tofu and much greener broccoli, and was totally delicious. If only I didn't have to drive back to get it, argh.

The egg foo young was good, though the gravy was lumpy. Will likely give them another try; hopefully this was just a bad day for them.

Note: If you don't like MSG, remember to ask that they leave it out.

Ordered from this place for the first time via Grubhub. The food was ready reasonably quickly, and I chose to pick it up from within the store. It was ready and waiting when I retrieved it, and the staff was quick to give me the order.

Unfortunately, the food was of poor quality. I had ordered the orange chicken (spicy), crab rangoon, and received a free egg roll because of the coupon they offer via Grubhub. Every item had a rather bad aftertaste, as though the oil in the fryer was bad.

The filling in the crab rangoon actually had large chunks of crab meat in it, which is nice compared to other services in the area that serve their rangoons with 99% cream cheese and little specks of crab meat. Unfortunately, the dough had the bad aftertaste mentioned above, which ruined the rangoon experience overall.

Once again, the egg roll filling was excellent, but the wrapping had the poor aftertaste.

The aftertaste continued with the orange chicken, which was more the neon-red color you'd expect to see on hot wings than your normal orange chicken appearance. Looks were deceiving though, and the chicken was pleasingly spicy, not overly hot, but not overly weak either. In this case though, it could've used a bit more kick to drown out the aftertaste.

Overall, I would probably try this place once more, as their base ingredients seem to be quality, but the finished product's quality seems to be based on if they remembered to clean the fryer or not.
good egg rolls and fried rice... beef  broccoli dish could have had a little more broccoli but overall good food!

If your are looking for very good Chinese food in Schaumburg IL then this is the place to be. New Ownership major improvements. Prices are far with generous portions. Go and try out this place it is well worth it.

Looking for a few Chinese Restaurant since our "usual" has gone out of business.  Came across Seven Luck.  SOOOOO Glad we did!  This place is great.  Food was quick, hot, and extremely fresh.  We will definitely be back for more.  Yummmmmm!
Not impressed, huge portions, quick delivery.Very mediocre Chinese food. Hence the search continues...

Schaumburg...it you haven't tried this place yet....get going!!!  I ordered delivery from Seven Luck and it is some of the best local Chinese I've ever had.  The Egg Rolls were freshly made (these were not frozen).  The General Tso's Chicken was delicious.  It was lacking an adequate quantity of broccoli and the sauce tasted a little store bought, but overall still really good.  Finally...the best part...the excellent fortune cookies!!!  These must have been made within the last few weeks by how crisp they are.  I'm not sure if they just received a new shipment or if this is a regular thing...but really great.  They delivered hot delicious Chinese food in about  1/2 an hour.

excellent! just ordered for the first time! egg rolls were great! had sweet & sour chicken (very good) and mushroom fried rice (also very good)  huge portions! the delivery was quick! they said 1/2 hour, but, I don't think it took that long. will for sure order again!
Excellent service. Will help with special requests. Food is delicious, fresh and MSG free!!!

Clean and well organized. I normally come here at least once a week. 

People are tentative.

do not use their tire and battery center! worst customer service! went in for tire balance took 1 hour and 30 min to get the car in with no other cars being worked on! inexperienced technicians! stripped my wheel lock and tried blaming me for it. do not go here !spend the extra buck and get it done right

This is the worst Sam's Club in the area. I have no idea why. The employees always look miserable, the people working at the customer service desk all seem new because they are completely incompetent and were not able to help me at all (someone working at the Sam's on Randall Rd helped me easily). The tire center has no one at the desk ever, and they also deliberately put our new tires on the back (so they wear down faster) when our car has front wheel drive and they should have gone on the front, but the guy working there said they aways put them on the back. 

Sam's itself is alright, but this particular one is the worst in the area.

I dont know why people area writting bad reviews. Maybe you were having such a crabby day. The people here are great. This sam's is never disorganized. Moreover, its always empty and very easy to shop. They do have a lot more samples now especially on weekends. the pizza is great here too. Many customers just go in for the pizza. Gas is cheap of course that is a mighty perk. The only thing i have to agree on, the parking is not great expect to walk. It is next to a real busy Walmart, but again mostly all Sam's are next to walmart now, so expect to get customers shopping to walmart!!

Recieved a fantastic deal on a "Serta luxury pillow top mattress" over the weekend and could not be happier. Awesome mattress and for over $100 off the competitors. Definitely worth writing a review about. Sams club also had great customer service and made it extremely easy for me to pick up. Will definitely be renewing my membership after this year. Great deals you really cant find anywhere else.
Your typical sams club. Great if you buy items in bulk. Cheaper than department store prices.

There cakes and cupcakes come in frozen and they ice them their. That's not the problem went to p l ace a cake order and employees  could  not be bothered so sad . Employees that do not understand no customers no check

Going to piggy back on what most people are saying (cause it is REALLY oh so true)... this is a nice Sam's club, however, it shares the parking lot with Wal-Mart.

You have been warned.

If you can, enter by the tire section, don't turn by strip mall by Giordano's.  You pull in that way, you are going to be waiting forever to get through the hell that is Wal-Mart.  And don't go searching for a spot either, just park, walking is good for all of us and lets be honest, gas is really expensive.  (Sams Club price is pretty decent though).

Anywho... really nice inside, workers are usually really friendly and during the weekends, samples galore.  They are starting to have more specials on certain products and more boxes around to pack your items in if you don't have bags.  

We are currently obsessed with their fresh stuffed salmon dish and for $13-$15 for 4 filets, you can't go wrong.

This is for their gas prices only. Just average. Always higher than the gas stations in S Elgin though. Like on my most recent visit (July 18th, Fri), I filled up at $3.59. Then on my way home, I passed a BP in S Elgin at $3.41 -__-"
Just your average Sam's Club.  I visited this location while I was visiting a friend for the holidays.  Compared to my local Sam's Club, this one was about the same.  Nothing special.

Typical SAMs club; bulk items, competitive pricing and shoppers who don't know how to drive (or operate a shopping cart). The savings in bulk items is worth it to some. I buy the coffee and Dasani water here. 

Over customer care is great. People are nice.

I really like this Sam's. It's not in the nicest neighborhood, but they keep the store pretty clean, well-organized, and the staff is some of the nicest employees at any Sam's I have ever shopped. They are friendly and knowledgeable. I am also a Costco member and partial to Costco (which typically are in better neighborhoods), but this Sam's is closer than the nearest Costco, and they have some items here that you can not find at Costco.

They have a different variety of Ziploc brand bags, Egg Beaters brand eggs, a wide variety of reasonably priced wine, decent bakery, a nice variety of baking supplies and seasonings and again, I will point out the good employees. 

I won't shop here at night and I'm not crazy about going there alone, but it's fine overall.

Optical dept hell! Everytime you have to work with these people they are annoyed! They tell you 'whenever' when you order your glasses. I've gotten 3 pairs over the years from these guys & I've really had it so I've written this review for others. Like rude service - check out the optical dept!
Bad customer service! Employees with real snippy attitudes like they don't want to be there. Sorry if you hate your job!!! #GetANewJob
i was only looking for 1 specific item that i saw at another sams club & they didnt have it here. i was quite disappointed but its still a nice store like all the other locations.

Store review
Food and supplies in bulk sums up your experience at Sams. Although many people find that Sam's club allows you to save when you buy in bulk, I find that careful review of weekly ads nets you the same product for cheaper. Now you may ask why I even have a Sam's club membership. I ended up getting one before my wedding in order to stock up on certain products in bulk for the wedding party. That being said, the store is great for the one time buy items which can be super cheap like 60 packs of welch gummies for 3 dollars and other items that cannot be found elsewhere (giant breakfast muffins etc). Overall prices are average and you still need to pay for membership. It is a great place if you have a restaurant or store that you need to load up on bulk goods that you can resell for a profit. 

Pros: Bulk goods that are great for selling individual units for profit, one of a kind items that are cheap, wide selection of food products and free sampling of foods. Cheap fast food (hot dog combo, pizza, slurpees!)

Cons: membership fees subtracts from the discount. Long lines on the weekend. No bags to carry your items, but you can use old boxes to store em!

Hidden deals: If you have a home business, you can sign up for 35 dollars instead of 40. Also college students can sign up for cheaper (i forgot the price), but you get a free 15 dollar gift card to offset the cost.

I've been a Sam's Club member for two years. After doing some comparisons between Sam's and Costco, I'm fairly certain that Costco is beating Sam's on price in a number of areas. Even canned goods are cheaper at Ultra Foods next door on sale, and you don't have to buy huge cans. Combined with really long lines (they never have all the registers open) and the membership fee, I'm not going to renew my membership.

Decent Sam's club location. They had one in Rolling meadows a few years ago that closed down for whatever reason, I thought it was slightly better than the one here. Low prices and samples as usual. Only downsides are the checkout lines seem to take a long time, and the parking lot is a pain. The gas station is also always packed as expected.

This Sam's club is really nice...once you get on the inside.

The selection is nice, the prices are comparable, I LOVE their bakery section.  They have great samples everywhere (especially on the weekends), but the parking lot is CRAZY.

There are a ton of shady characters outside ((cough-cough-connected-to-Walmart-cough-cough)) and parking is a JOKE.  Mainly because people from Walmart park in the Sam's lot and leave their carts there so they don't have to walk all the way back, so it's hard to find a parking spot that doesn't have a lot of Walmart carts in it.  

It can be a bit chaotic, but it's great shopping for a party!

I'm a reformed snob, I admit. I used to have a Costco membership, snubbing my nose at Sam's Club despite it being FIVE MINUTES from my house. Nay, I'd rather travel half an hour to go to the hoity toity mecca of free samples that was Costco Warehouse. Long story short, I got over it. All of these places sell the same crap. Costco has a few more upscale items but bottom line is if I want a box of 5000 waffles or eighteen gallons of creamer, it really doesn't matter where I go and if I can drive less, all the better.

The only thing Sam's Club doesn't have over Costco, besides a lot of annoying white people, are coupons. Costco has some really outstanding coupons, Sam's Club doesn't. But aside from that? 

Sam's Club sells TVs, computers, ground beef by the metric ton and industrial sized sacks of rice. You save a bit by buying volume, most of the time. Beware stuff like soda as you'll end up paying more than if you just buy it at the grocery store when it's on sale. Shop smart. Er.
SAMs club is pretty good but parking is pain

Had to switch to this Sams club because the one in Rolling Meadows closed.. So I really like this sams club because of the great selection, low prices and sample food stations. I really HATE this Sams club because half the shoppers there actually bring their entire extended families with them to shop making it difficult to navigate through the store. I wonder how they get to the store?!? And the location of this place is far from good - actually, I wouldn't come here after dark for the fear of some questionable character trying to rob me for my box of cheerios. And last but not least, the parking at this location SUCKS!
I'm on the road quite a bit and one of my favorite places to eat at is stavs food is great place is always clean and prices very reasonable also lots of parking available

Two stars for the hot dog and fries combo.
Another lackluster hot dog and generic, food service fries.  The lowlights:
Limp, skinless Vienna wiener
Non-poppyseed, tasteless bun
Tasteless starch fingers passed off as French fries.

Stick to the Greek specialty items.  The hot dog and fries are very ordinary.

I've only tried the Gyro and greek salad from Stav's. Gyro is hands down - delicious! The pita is so tasty and they are not stingy with their meat portions here! Greek salad was okay - ice berg lettuce, one slice of green pepper, 2 olives, cukes, tomato and feta cheese served with a Greek dressing on the side.
Fries and hot dog? Pass. Go down the street to Portillo's for that. But if you're craving a Gryo - definitely check these guys out!

Ever have a mental struggle with your taste buds?  One half is telling you to eat something 'healthy' while the other half is sayin 'just give in to the gyros??  Happens to me all the time...I have persnickety taste buds *sigh*...

I was driving on my way home and realized I hadn't eaten anything but a protein bar all day (one of those days).  I was getting hungry and thought of making something quick at home, but then realized it wouldn't be as 'quick' as going to a drive-thru.  While I was entertained by the thought of Portillo's grilled tuna sandwich (pretty tasty), Stav's was another choice, both being in my direction.

Suffice to say, I gave in to the gyro since I hadn't had one in a very, very long time.   I've never tried one from Stav's, so I pulled in, placed my order which came with soup or coleslaw (I chose the lemon rice soup) and grabbed a homemade 'spinach pie' also.  NO this is not a whole pie.  It's a small rectangular shaped spanakopita, if you will.  And I love these.  (the owners are Greek, by the way...)

Since everything is cooked to order here & I didn't call in advance, I had to wait approximately 10 minutes for my food to be ready.  Didn't bother me at all...no big deal.  The gyros plate included fries, 1 pita and lots of thinly sliced fresh meat...probably some of the better gyro meat I have tasted at any Greek or fast food joint. And this beats Franky's on Lake hands down!  Meat was not greasy, salty or grossly thick.  Not heavy.  Just really tasty, moist & fresh with my perfectly grilled soft, tender pita and tzatziki....delish!  They even included extra tzatziki (a little 'thin', but tasty). 

 After eating half, I decided to move along to my lemon rice soup.  If you've never had it before it is a thicker Greek soup.  They give you a good serving...almost a small soup bowl's worth.  I've had it here before and this time it was even better.  Lemony, velvety, smooth - almost custard like, with rice.  This was delicious.  Since this soup is made with eggs (hence, 'custard like') it did not taste eggy in the least.  Yumminess without feeling 'heavy or grossly 'thick'.  Perfect consistency.   Had just one bite of my spinach pie and it was OK.  I've had better.  Was filled w/lots of spinach wrapped in phyllo, but needed more feta imo.  Not bad at all though.  

Stav's has an extensive fast food list, and I've tried the kebabs (good), ribs (surprisingly good) and gyros (very good) so far...If your in the mood for fast Greek food, I'd stick to Stav's where you know the Greek owners are doin the cookin!

No offense Stav's, but the next time we meet, it will have to be for a chicken kebab!  No more gyros for me for awhile!! ;)  ps.  they also serve pork souvlaki...wonder what that tastes like?

Came here for lunch/brunch on our recent trip to Chicago area. We tried pretty much all the fish/seafood on the menu and it was terrific. Kids really enjoyed the fish burgers and I really liked the fried shrimp. Wife enjoyed her tilapia as well but thinks it could've used a little more flavor. 

Overall service is fast and everything was fresh. We were the only people in the dining area but did notice a lot of people going through drive-through. Will definetly come back if in Adisson area again
This place was a gem! I had a gyro and o man I got so much meat. My gf had the chicken kabob sandwich and she devoured it. I most definitely recommend this place and we will for sure be coming back.

Been coming here for year! The BEST fast good food around. Chicken is always great, burgers and gyros can't be beat. Have had most of what's on the menu and have never been disappointed. Adult and kid friendly don't have to choose here

This place is very good. I got 1/2 slab barbaque ribs
They are very tasty . Restaurant is very clean maybe need some "updates " but if you near neighberhood give them a chance .
Delicious gyro's and bbq chicken. If you're on lake street and looking for a bite to eat don't hesitate to stop by here. I definitely recommend this place!

My wife and I ate at Stav's after reading good reviews on yelp.  We both got the gyros plate with salad. I read another review, which said that Stav's doesn't skimp on the meat. They were right! We both got a lot of meat. There was so much meat that we could have used an extra pita. The tzatziki sauce was watery and not too flavorful.  We were excited to get the salads because we both really like Greek salads. Unfortunately, the salads were just garden salads.  We wish we knew that so we could have ordered Greek salads.  If you're in the area, Stav's makes a decent gyros, however, I don't feel it is worth a drive.
