The gyros and chicken plate was great.  It was fresh and seasoned just right.  The chicken was tender, the rice was awesome!  The pita was soft and fresh.  The gyro was flavorful and fresh.  Did I mention the food was fresh, lol.  The restaurant was clean and the staff was very friendly.
Great family owned restaurant with a great selection of food. The owners are attentive to their customers. Looking forward to trying everything in their menu.
We love stavs we actually only get gyros when we come here.  The flavor is great and you get a lot of meat for your buck!! The staff is always very friendly!!
Love their greek chicken platter with rice and potatoes. The owners are lovely! Prices are low for the amount of food you get! Love that you can order take out and pick it up at the window.

Was in the mood for a chicken breast plate Greek style.  Usually I go to Billy's on Addison Rd or Yorky's but was on Lake & Rt 53 so I decided to give Stav a try.  Wrong decision on my part.  Maybe they have other items on menu that taste good but my review is strictly on chicken breast plate I ordered.  The chicken was dry and it was thin sliced so I'm surprised that was messed up.  You can tell it's not marinated enough to get any Greek flavor they just douse chicken breast with a bunch of oregano.  Rice was watery and I had water bottom of my to go container to confirm that.  Greek potato's were OK nothing special.  

If your in mood for Chicken Breast Plate don't go he head to Billy's.  They slice little lines across chicken breast to make sure marinated juice soak in it.  Yorky's in Elmhurst is my 2nd choice.

Stav's has pretty good food! I wish I still lived close by! Their gyros are good and If you're trying to eat healthier, their salads are also awesome! You get a lot of food for a great price and it doesn't hurt that they have a drive thru as well!

Excellent alternative to fast food! It's fast food, but fresh fast food. Great for when you're on the go. You could order straight from your phone and pull up to the drive through and get it. Their portions are super generous. Gyros are the way to go. But their chicken sandwich is excellent and so is the Grecian chicken for whoever is watching their weight.

Ordered delivery from Stav's due to my friend having a craving for Greek food.     She ordered the Grilled Tilapia and I had the Shish-Ka-Bob Beef Plate.    As sides I ordered a grape leaf and baklava.   I also had Lemon Rice Soup.

Delivery was pretty timely...about 25 minutes after placing order.

The food from the main dishes were plentiful.   My friend enjoyed the tilapia despite wanting to have it fried which wasn't offered on menu.    My beef plate had plenty of beef and rice along with sliced potato pieces to put on my gyro bread.   It was all very tasty.

The lemon rice soup was okay though I would've preferred the lentil.    When I ordered the soup with beef plate it didn't specify which soup you would get.    Next time I'll specify a different soup.

Neither my friend nor I liked the grape leaf.    I was glad we only ordered the one.    I think it would've tasted better warm as opposed to cold.    The only other place I tried grape leaves was when I dined at Anita's Kitchen in Ferndale, MI.   And they served them nice and warm.

The baklava was definitely another highlight.   It's one of those desserts that will give you quite the sugar high from all the layers of honey.   The bottom layer is pretty much soaked in it completely.    An excellent dessert to have once in a blue moon.

The hits far outweigh the misses with the food...hence the 4 stars.

Look forward to ordering more from this place.

I love this place! We used to go here a lot more often before we moved, but we still come here every so often. We get the gyro combo with grilled onions and extra sauce, and it's always fabulous. Lots of meat, the sauce is delicious, and they've never forgotten to grill my onions for me.
Their baked dark meat chicken special is a steal at $5.75!  The chicken is moist, the skin is crispy, the rice and potatoes are seasoned perfectly, and the salad is fresh.  Definitely going back!

You can call your order ahead and pickup ay the drive through. All their stuff is made to order.

I love that they have healthy options. Whenever I'm on a diet, I make a habit of getting the chicken breast wrap with no vinaigrette with tzatziki sauce (cucumber sauce they use for gyros) on the side. I think I calculated the rough calories before and it's less than a subway sub and a little more hearty. Delicious in my opinion.

I've had some other dishes from there before, the pork souvlaki and the gyro, decent enough. 

Their salads are really big and filling!

I believe they deliver, but it's a bit too expensive a delivery charge in my opinion. I used to order for lunch until they raised the delivery price. While I understand the necessity in the rough economic times...the times are tough on me too and I just couldn't justify paying so much for lunch. PB&J is a poor substitute for Stav's, but you gotta do what you gotta do!
Great food!

I go there every week because not only is their food and service is good, but all the employees are very friendly and will do anything for you. The other people who reviewed them before should give them another chance. You probably went on an off day and we all have those from time to time.

This must be said....The lemon rice soup is really disgusting!  I love soup normally but this was weird and gross and not edible.  I can't believe a restaurant would keep that nastiness as its daily soup staple.  It either needs to be redone (to be tasty) or toss it and get another daily soup.

The rest of the food I get there is ok.  It's not amazing or remarkable in any way.I work about 5 minutes from this place and I stop in once every few months...and feel eh after eating there so I don't go back for months.
We love this place! The chicken kabob dinner is excellent!! Greek salads are great too!
Yummy fast homemade food, love my Greek food and very nice people .I love the fact they have a drive thru if your ever late getting home you can order quality food on the fly!

Stav's Kitchen is a fast food eatery located off of Lake Street in Addison. The outside and overall design of the restaurant remind me of a Wendy's. In visiting Stav's I decided to try the hot dog.

The hot dog I received came on a dry non-poppy seed bun. There were huge chunks of tomato and a large and very thick pickle slice on the sandwich. There was about three hot dogs worth of mustard on this hot dog with strangely chopped slices of onion and very little relish. There was no sign of celery salt on this hot dog and no hot peppers.

It also came with fries, the fries included were salty, crispy out the outside and didn't have a particularly flavorful potato paste on the inside. Overall, I've had much better fries.

Based on my food on this experience I wasn't particularly fond of Stav's Kitchen. While I've certainly had worse food, I wouldn't recommend the hot dog or fries here. Two stars.

Had the Chicken Special, grilled chicken was decent not much in flavor though. Rice pilaf bland as well as the potatoes. Lemon rice soup also jus ok. There's a better place abt a mile away called Billy's on Addison Rd.

Old Wendy's drive thru set up....in the heart of Addison...which Greek Chicken!! I'm happy as a clam. 

Great chicken that falls off the bone and a very nice Lemon Rice soup. Obviously, homemade food with (if i had to guess) a family running the place. I have only been here a few times, but pretty yummy stuff. 

Whenever my boyfriend and I cant not decide where to go, he always throws out Stav's as a suggestion...we'll be back soon!

This place has some very yummy cheese sticks. It takes a while at the drive through, but that's because they actually cook the food while you wait instead of nuking it. You can also call ahead if you're in a real hurry. 

The staff is always very friendly, the food is never disappointing, and it's close to my job so I can fulfill my cheese stick needs without having to travel far.

Why haven't I reviewed Stav's before now?  I am so silly sometimes!

Stav's has a gyros plate that my husband orders with chili (of all things!) that he loves!  I always grab some of the well done gyros meat right off the side of his plate. Usually, I stick with the Greek chicken breast with rice AND potatoes AND a pita bread.  It's a carb fest!  A bite of this with that...I only get through about half the plate. 

Ready for the best part?  It's all homemade, but it's cheap!  You don't have to break the bank to get a good meal here. 

Why not give them five stars then, Jennifer?  Well, it's always cold in the restaurant itself and the tables aren't always wiped down promptly. 

Friendly staff and yummy in my tummy food will bring us back time and again!

Went to here today because billys was closed.  Very disappointed gyro had half the meat, maybe a teaspoon of sauce.the pita was crunchy and the tomatoes were way over ripe.  Still paid a premium price for a sub standard gyro.

Not to shabby! Stav is a fast casual dining vibe and clean. The Chicken Kabob served with rice pilaf, pita bread and soup was plenty for the money. The homemade chicken with rice soup was superb! The staff was friendly and at no means rushed me as I pondered the menu for a bit. I wish Stav's was closer to Downers Grove because believe me I would be "The Duke" in a heart beat....LOL! 

The building sort of reminds me if it could have once been the home of a Wendy's. I like the fact there is a drive-thru for easy pick-up orders.

I love the potatoes here, melt in your mouth goodness. Service is quick but customer service lacking. I was doing my internship in the area and frequently came here for lunch...never once did the manager's son, who waited on my every time, say, "Welcome back!" or "Hello again" or anything. Also, they had a coupon on their website and when I gave it to them, his response was, "Oh, I forgot to take it down, it's expired." Um....good customer service is to accept it anyways. It was 10% off, it would've been $2 off. Really, you can't accept it even though YOU forgot to take it down? Things like that are what I think of when deciding where to go for lunch or dinner when I'm in the area.

Also, don't order the fries. AWFUL.
Best Greek salad I've ever had. I mostly get it for the hot pita it comes with but all the veggies in it are always fresh and the dressing is to die for. I get it at least Once a week.
Only been here once, will go again. Had the hot dog with the works & side of rice. Good portion for the rice- all for $4 something!

LOOOOVE STAV'S!

We've been going to Stav's since moving to Addison two years ago. Why have I not reviewed yet? I have no idea!  Everything I've ever had at Stav's is delicious. They've got a great selection of foods and portions are plentiful.

Then, we tried the "best gyros" around at another restaurant in Wheaton...talk about disappointment!  STAV'S HAS THE BEST GRYOS in the area, hands-down. And, so, this knowledge must be shared with all!
So delicious! Great food and great service. When the staff is all Greek, you know you won't be disappointed.

Everyone has their neighborhood joint. A favorite place that whenever you go, the food is consistent and never disappoints. For a while, I was coming here so often that the gal behind the counter was already writing out my usual order before I even spoke: Greek salad with extra feta, an extra pita and medium diet coke. 

The salad is always fresh (even when I've come in after 8pm at night). The Greek dressing is always served on the side--perfect since I don't like drowning my salads in dressing. I love their feta--soft and crumbly with great flavor. Their pita bread is fresh-baked, fluffy and warmed on the grill. 

My other go-to dish is the lemon rice soup. Great citrus lemon flavor and thick and creamy--perfect when I'm feeling under the weather or just need a pick me up. Bright and yellow, its like a bowl of sunshine. 

The gyros is good--tender tasty meat. I don't care for the tzatziki sauce they serve with it--it might be that they use a different kind of Greek yogurt? Dunno, I like the gyros meat and when we're talking meat, it should be flavorful to stand alone, no? 

Friendly service, good food at very affordable prices.

I'm not a big fast food fan so I like options that are a bit more healthy/homemade/simple.  Stav's has many reasonably healthy options and of course your fast food options when you crave them.

I've tried a few dishes as has my husband.  The only reason I'm giving 4 out of 5 stars is seasoning.  I think they need to amp up the salt (if they use any at all) in their chicken dishes.  Chicken alone can not carry itself so a bit of salt would help.  The ka bobs and the lemon rice soup were both needing some salt in my opinion.  Nothing I can't add myself but there is a difference in taste with grilling a properly salted piece of meat, and then adding it after the fact.

Things I've tired......

Chicken Ka Bob Plate
Grilled chicken with pepper & onion, rice pilaf, oven potatoes, and pita with tzatziki.  All good.  Love the tzatziki and who doesn't love a warm pita.  The rice pilaf is simple.  A heavy meal with all the carbs but at least not horrible for you.  A lot of food.

Chicken-Ka-Bob Sandwich
Much like the plate... chicken, peppers, onions with a side of tzatziki on a pita.  Got it with fries.  I LOVE THEIR FRIES AS DOES MY HUSBAND.  They are awesome.

Gyro Sandwich
My husband got this but of course I tried the meat.  Hard to mess up a gyro really but I do like a good browning of my meat after it's cut and they do that well.  Got it with teh heavenly fries.

Lemon Rice Soup
I only got this once as I was not impressed with it the time I had it.  Not much flavor and a bit watered down.  Could of been a bad batch.  Can't imagine they would not make this well.

Oven Roasted Potatoes
These are good.  My sister doesn't eat meat so got her an order of these and she liked them a lot.  Simple but taste homemade.


Obviously there are a lot more things for me to try, but the things I have tried are good and will bring me back again.
Didn't really care for this place. The food was very bland and the dining room was too cold.
Great local Greek restaurant. My favorite is their gyro salad. The owners are super friendly, and as always, family owned. Support your local small business'!!
Great food!! I had the pork souvlaki sandwich and my son had the ribs. It was delicious. Definitely recommend Stav's!!

This place has pretty decent food, and a great staff.  Me and my girlfriend went here for the first time the other day and were quite pleased.  I ordered the lemon rice soup and a gyro, and my girlfriend had the lemon rice soup and the chicken kabob plate.  The soup was pretty good, nothing to die for but better than a lot of others.  The gyro was good and just the right size.  Now I know it's nice to order a gyro and have enough meat for 2 people or bring some home, but for the price this sandwich was just right.  As for the chicken kabob plate, she seemed to enjoy it and it seemed quite plentiful.  As far as the staff goes, they were very friendly and went out of there way to make it an enjoyable dinner.

Overall I would definitely come back.

Every town has one good independent fast service. I always have
 coupons to this place and enjoy the meals. The soup is great and they are generous  with their servings. This place gets it right and deserves to be more well known in the community. I have tried many of the items on their menu and ii is much superior over similar places. The owners and workers are very courteous and want you to enjoy the meal.

We love Stavs.  They have the most delicious Spinach Pie and Lemon Soup.  My boys crave the gyros.   Fast, friendly service.   Family owned.  Clean.   Always service with a smile.   Stavs supports the community!

Was looking for better gyros around Roselle and happen to read previous reviews for this. Why not try it? Impressed with my gyros sandwich, the meat was juicy and i was hooked! The gal behind the counter said that they've been open 4 yrs. We ate in and there was a steady trickle of people that came in. Will try the chicken next time andq there will be a next time. Cant beat the price too!

Wow! That's one bright order menu in the drive-thru! Fast, friendly and loved that the lady taking my order had a Greek accent! Was definitely a sign of good things to come. Ordered the #1 gyros but will be back for other menu items. Gryos were delish & juicy, so good! Can't wait to return. Greek food with a drive-thru? Hello! Omg get out of that McDonald's drive-thru & come get some real food here!

It is an inevitability that if there's a gyros joint somewhere in my vicinity, I will eat there at least once, however, Stav's has grown on me more and more.

I started just getting gyros sandwiches and gyros plates, then I expanded to their chicken and salads.

Gyros are pretty damn good, and even good reheated when you can't finish all of it in one sitting!  That's a hard thing to accomplish as many times reheated gyros are chewy and basically inedible.  Now their chicken.. holy moly!  The meat falls off the bone.  The Grecian spices or their BBQ flavors are terrific, albeit once in a while the skin is a tidbit on the burnt side.

Now, the trumpets herald the excellent Greek salads they offer.  You can have a small or an ultimate salad... always crispy lettuce, fresh tomatoes and cucumbers, crisp and slightly potent thin slices of onion, green pepper slice, dolmades (rice in a grape leaf), feta cheese, and kalamata olives, all can be covered in their spiced vinaigrette which is in a separate container so you can dose it out at your own convenience.  

Make sure that you phone ahead to place your order if you're going to the drive through window because this place is NOT fast food and you'll end up waiting if you just show up.

The restaurant area is always clean, and has a flat screen television, but I've never dined-in.

This restaurant has delicious food. I love their rice pilaf and potatoes. They make their food fresh to order, so be patient. I recommend getting a dinner so you get a complete meal filled with meat, vegetables, and starch.

I have only dined in the restaurant once. It seems like most people, me included, pick up food to enjoy at home.

I tried them for the first time tonight.  The thing that I liked is that the restaurant was clean and the people were friendly.  I bought my husband the gyro and fries, and the serving sizes and prices were really good.  The food was great and he gave it 5 stars.  

Also having a drive thru is really convenient, we'll definitely be back.

It's a lot of food and it is really tasty. I have eaten the gyro and the half grecian chicken plate. The chicken plate is served with rice, potatos and bread. Delicious and inexpensive. Less than $7 for the chicken plate. It does not get any better than that.

My review is essentially the same as Jay's below..but man is this place great. I too am in love with the chicken leg special. It's unbeatable for 5$ that you can get that much (good) food. The chicken is tender and fall off the bone but they must finish it on the grill because it has some charcoal flavor. 

The greek salad too is amazing....very fresh, awesome dressing. The dolmades are interesting, I don't  think I've ever had them on a greek salad before, but they are very tasty. 

My new go-to place for lunch

It's no surprise that Addison doesn't really have much to offer its residents in terms of great lunch/dinner options. There's Dappers, I guess. There's every fast food place that lines Lake Street between IL-53 and Addison Road. Meh. And then there's Stav's!

Personally, I love the food at Stav's. Everything that I've had there has been good, especially by takeout standards. The kabobs are great. The chicken is great. Fish is great (the salmon is just "ok", but the tilapia is perfectly seasoned/grilled whenever I order it). The sides (soup, rice, potatoes, garlic bread) are always very good too.

I ran the 2010 Chicago Marathon and Stav's was my regular joint for carbo-loading. I'd alternate between the grilled chicken breast plate (two grilled chicken breast fillets, potatoes, a shitload of rice and a slice of pita bread) and the grilled tilapia special (huge piece of grilled tilapia, shitload of rice and a giant piece of garlic bread). Both were in the $7-8 range. And both were perfect options for me to gobble up after a long day of working and training. The last thing I want to do on a weekday night after working 9-10 hours and running 5-10 miles is prepare a meal! Stav's was my answer.

The service is impeccable. It's family-owned and family-run, so you can tell that the people behind the counter (most of them, anyway) care about your food and experience. I regularly call my order in and then pick it up through the drive-thru window. Service with a smile...every single time. 

Gotta love this place. Five stars.

Affordable, they have a drive thru, everything I've ever had here is GOOD! I cannot non-recommend anything which in my mind makes it 5 stars. They have a low carb menu where you can get kabobs and gyro meat and a half chicken and basically everything delicious!

How do you pronounce Gyros? You don't pronounce it, son, you eat it! 

My previous experience with Stav's, I didn't actually go there, but my brother went out and got me a gyros salad, an interesting combination or something delicious with something boring, and the result was something amazing. But that was then. Spending a week in Addison looking after my sister's dog is a time for exploration. Why not check out the place I heard so much about? 

I spent a lot of time here in high school. It hadn't been around that long, you say? Well... I went there when it was Wendy's. And thank goodness Wendy's is gone. I went in and ordered a gyros combo, which comes with fries and a drink. While waiting I watched an inning of horrendous Cubs baseball on one of the television sets and trying to ignore some chick having a loud discussion on her cell phone. Right as one of the Cubs batters was thrown out trying to stretch a single into a double, my eyes met those of the guy working there and there was a feeling of mutual understanding. We both shook our heads, and thus began our discussion of how disappointing baseball has been for us. Nice guy, and it just illustrates the friendliness of the service.

The gyros was great. It was browned on the outside with minimal use of oil, so it didn't have that slippery consistency a lot of gyros sandwiches often have, and it wasn't drowning in tatziki sauce. I always found gyros sandiwches difficult to eat. Overstuffed. Everything falls out and you end up eating it with a fork, defeating the purpose of the pita. This one held together pretty well. I wasn't too crazy about the fries. It seems like almost every grease pit in the area uses the same fries. It gets redundant.

I think my gyros loyalties have changed, at least while I'm in the burbs.

Been to many Gyros joints, this one served up a very good Gryos tonight. The meat was not real greasy, just right. I stopped due to other yelp postings. Very accurate. And I would go back next time in that neighborhood.  Of, the fries vey very good also.

Stav's is a great neighborhood, non-fast food, fast food place....if that makes sense? They mainly specialize in Greek-style food but they do have other options such as hot dogs, beef sandwiches and pastas. 

Dined here on a rainy Friday evening and the place wasn't too busy. They do offer a drive thru so I think most people choose that option. We ordered 2 chicken kabob dinners which both came with a side salad. Everything is cooked made to order so you can guarantee that your food will be fresh and hot. Like typical Greek places, you order, get your salad (or whatever side you choose) and sit down. They will call you when your main dish is ready. You eat on regular plates and use silverware, not plastic. The salad was really fresh but a very heavy hand was used with the oil/vinegar. I didn't mind but it wasn't necessarily healthy when it is drenched in dressing. Our chicken kabobs were really flavorful and came with rice pilaf, pita and potato wedges.

This location used to be a Wendy's years ago but Stav's have made some nice renovations to the inside for a cozier feel. They have a nice TV mounted on the wall which was playing Wheel of Fortune and Shark Tank (my fav). I believe the owners were working when we visited and you can tell they really care about their business. Will be back to try something else.

Me the wife and the little one have been to Stav's 2 times.  We had the gyros, the greek half chicken, fries, Chicken Tenders, Greek Potatoes.  I am not going to say it's a HUB's  but at the same time, for us it gives you that authentic grease pit gyros feeling place.  The gyros passes the test.  I would like the cucumber sauce to be a bit   more thined down.  The portion size was average on the gyros.  I got a large fries and it was enough for a week so no complaints there.  The half chicken and potatoes passed the authentic test and so yes whenever we get the feeling for some fast food this place will be up there.  Oh one last thing.  The lady who works at the front, I think she may be the owner.  She reminds me of my mother... so that makes you feel at home and very happy!

Great gyros, meat is delicious!  They steam the pita, makes a huge difference with keeping the sandwich together.  BBQ ribs are good, a little less expensive than other local places.  Great hot dogs, good price too.  The lemon rice soup they serve with their dinners is salty and delicious!  The owner is super friendly.  They do have a drive through, but unless you're getting hot dogs or something, expect a wait for your food.  They encourage you to call in the order first and then pick up at the window instead.  Never had a bad meal here.

Just the right place to go on a wintry spring day!  As usual everyone was
kind & courteous! I had my steak kabob and baklava.  I also brought home some rice pudding for later.  They make it right there and it is delicious!  
lizzi
Opaaaa!  Lemon soup, gyros, baklava...  A favorite for whenever you are tired of eveyone else's fast food!  Fresh, quick and always spiced just right.

"Just good food" is their slogan, and i gotta agree. It is good food. It doesn't seem to have as many customers at one time as the Taco Bell next door, but Taco Bell is obviously not a  good comparison to Stav's. I believe that in near future, Stav's will be busier. Their hot dog and fries combo is a lot better (tasting and better looking) than Franky's Red Hots everyday special.
I've been here twice so far, and I think I've found a new favorite place to eat!
Love this place. Awesome lemon rice soup. Owners are super friendly. Never disappointed.

I love STAV'S. I have tried the Gyros, Greek Salad, Italian Beef, Chicken Kabobs and Lemon Rice Soup. Everything has tasted so delicious. The gyro meat is juicy and they give you lots of it. It's served with Tzatkiki,tomatos and onions on the side. I was actually very surprised at the Italian beef. I am VERY picky about the Italian beef sandwiches I eat and Stav's really did it right! Plus- the sandwich is huge so I felt like I really got my money's worth. ($6.75 combo meal) This rest is an old Wendy's......but I def recommend this place for people who like Greek owned joints. Owner is very friendly and always greets me with a smile. (p.s. they still use the drive thru) My dad lives near another Stavs near Skokie and he loves it too......
My favorite is the half chicken meal.  Great price, good portions.

Although the woman behind the counter was a sweetheart and the restaurant was clean and comfortable, the food was mediocre at best. The bad, the lemon soup was absolutely disgusting. I usually look forward to it in a greek meal, but this tasted like paste. I had the chicken kebab dinner. The chicken was bland. The vegetables were good. The rice was ok. The potatoes were the best part of the ensemble, but even they were average. My son had some chicken strips. They were actually good. Guess I should have stuck with the greasy items on the menu. Shame on me.

This location WAS a Wendy's so don't get confused by the other websites.  It's been here about a year and seems to be doing well...

I mean, it's sort of a Greek restaurant (spinach pie, baby back ribs, Greek chicken and Greek potatoes and Greek salad) that closes early (9:30 M-Sa, 9 on Su).

But it's sort of a fast food joint (Italian beefs in a Greek place), and...

It's sort of OK. (Try the shish-ka-bobs)

ok, short and to the point.  This is a really good place, but not really a fast food place.  There are lots of things on the menu and each one that I have tried is good.  The chicken special is really good.  You will spend as much at McDonalds and get far less.

Good food, overall.  The prices are resonable.  It's a fast food typical Greek place.  They have good specials.  Don't get anything low carb, because it's a total rip.  Here's an example, they have a low carb chicken leg and thigh meal.  Well, obviously it's low carb, so there's just meat. (they could add some grilled veggies though)  The price is like $2 more than the chicken leg and thigh special they have, which comes with bread, potatoes, and rice.  The lemon rice soup it not the best.  It always tastes and smells like flour.  They don't know how to thicken properly with flour, obviously.  Other than that though, the food is good.  It's not somewhere I wouldn't go to again.
Just ok with me.  Better places in area for this type food.

Black bra, white shirt! WHAAAAAAT???????????????  come on girl. Blue on blue on blue???? eyeliner, shirt, pants? this was how our journey started, first impressions are important. menu is vast (good thing there are seats for viewing) and interesting it was hard to decide so we ran the gamut, a salad, a gyro, a chili dog.  Salad - appealing to the eye, gyro meat was dry, dressing was not mixed???? Gyro - fries were no good, bk like crunchy coating, similar to an arthropod ready to molt, gyro was similar to the cashier , too much meat hanging out. Chili dog - was a chili dog, chili tasted like it was out of a can. The most disturbing part of the meal was the baklava, they pulled a bait and switch with nice big pieces in the case and a sliver on my tray. It was as dry as a scorpion in the desert, nuts tasted burnt, and a slight hint of "anise" according to my lunch mate. The chinsy toy vending machines are killer, for 50 cent I got a light that has a motorcycle image. Stav's Kitchen you have been mexitortured for the sub par food and fashion. BTW you only had five stars the day your restaurant opened after you wrote your own review, take that silly sign down.

I read Yelp reviews that ran the gamut, so I had to find out for myself. DH and I had a fantastic lunch at Thai House on Saturday. 

We ordered 2 small soups and shared: tom yum shrimp (excellent) and tom kha chicken (maybe even better). The crab rangoon was delicious and not greasy or chewy. Husband had chicken rama noodles for his main (reported enjoying). I chose chicken green curry, medium (plenty spicy for me, a spice lover; would be way too spicy for most of my friends). I had leftovers for lunch today--just as delicious!

The service was very friendly. The food was excellent. The prices seemed appropriate. We'll definitely go back!

Worst pad thai ive ever had:
Soggy over cooked noodles.
Tasted like mush.
No distinctive sweet spicy citrus.
No fresh peanuts.
No fresh bean sprout.
Shrimp were so over cooked they were uneditable. 
Shrimp not fresh.

I would bot recommend this place to anyone.  

I wish i could find good pad thai in Illinois.

Went to Thai house with 2 of my friends on a Friday night. 

The place wasn't packed and it was pretty small. You can see the chefs cooking in the back which is pretty entertaining while you wait for your food. 

The service was great. Someone came up to us right when we walked into the restaurant and was seated right away. It's pretty chilly at the restaurant though if they don't turn on the fireplace. Our server kept checking up on us and also came to refill our drinks.

We ordered Chicken potstickers, shrimp tom-yum soup (small), panang curry chicken, chicken red curry, and pad thai with fat noodles instead. The food came out in good timing and didn't have to wait that long. The portions are pretty good for the prices. Shrimp tom-yum was really delicious and I wish I got the bigger bowl instead. The panang was a good portion as well and had great flavor to it. My friends enjoyed their dishes as well. 

I would go back here if I don't want to drive too far for some good thai food.

Had the chicken fried rice and the yellow curry with chicken, as delivery. Food came in a reasonable amount of time. Was quoted by Yelp a 45-60 minute wait but got the food in about 30 minutes. Would have been less time likely but one of the menu items was not available (a Yelp typo I imagine) and I was called to work it out. The food was delicious. My 3 year old really enjoyed it too! I will definitely order from this place again - just not through Yelp next time.

The food is good, and they have a nice variety of options to tickle your taste buds. This place does not lose any stars for taste, but for service. 
My boyfriend and I went here for lunch, and while there were people in there, it wasn't crowded, but you would have thought that by the way the workers were acting. They have two cooks, one server, and one guy who I think might have been the owner. He was the main problem; he was micromanaging every other job. It took them about 15 minutes just to get us water...
Honestly, if they had more people working, and a better system, this place would be a five star place. 

Now on to the food....I had the Pad Thai with shrimp, and it was seasoned well, and not spicy. The shrimp was cooked...I believe, there was one piece that seemed a little cold, but looked cooked. Since we both had lunch specials, we got a cup of their house soup, and a plate of crab rangoon . The soup was delicious and light, and the rangoon was crispy, but still light and not greasy. 
Overall, as I said earlier, if you want to wait three moon cycles to get a sip of water, then this is the place for you. Maybe try delivery or carry out for quicker service.

Pretty Average place with pretty average food. 

The is food is not bad but there are million other Thai places with better food in the vicinity.

So this is a new Thai spot but it is in the old Caribou Coffee, the decor is the same except they put up some Thai decorations. Thai House must have had a different location because the menus are old and beat up. The layout for a restaurant is pretty bad as 50% of the space is kitchen or an eyesore. 

The food is average at best from what I had. The spring rolls had dry and chewy fried tofu inside and a giant dried out green onion on top. The Tom Yum was ok but had zero heat to it, odd as it's supposed to be a spicy soup. The Pad Thai had the slightly wider noodles which I like but it was oversauced and sort of gummy, flavor was ok. Also tried the mixed seafood, a sweet but bland sauce. This was also supposed to be spicy and was not. 

Out of 4 items not one stood out as great, average at best (the Pad Thai). Everything seemed cooked properly but that only gets you so far. Portion size is also less than what I get at other places. I am not sure if I'd go back to try other things (I know I should and probably will) which is too bad as it's the closest Thai spot to home...YMMV

Tum Kai OUTSTANDING! 

Brown rice is excellent. Veggies are fresh and seasoned with a lot of flavor. 

Portions are great. 

Customer service is superb.
Absolutely love this place. We've only done take out, I think the owner takes the order over the phone, seriously one of the most accommodating places I've ordered from. Green curry is delicious!

A new Thai restaurant that offers delicious dishes! I love Thai food as an alternative to Chinese because I believe it is much lighter. Thai House has a nice decor with a beautiful multi-level waterfall just inside the entrance and a fireplace. After an appetizer of spring rolls, I chose the Pa-Nang Curry with Chicken for my entree. I was worried that the curry would be too spicy for me but it was just right and delicious. It was served with white rice. My wife enjoyed her meal as well. It was a bit hard to communicate with the hostess because she didn't have a firm grasp on the english language yet but I won't let that keep me from going back.
I wished I'd known about this place sooner! What a great lunch special with one of the best pad thai dishes I've had the pleasure of eating! The wait staff was great too.

The staff was really nice.  However, the food was not good.  I got the broccoli rice.  That is all it was.  Rice, egg and broccoli.  The broccoli was microwaved as it was not crisp.   It was chewy.  Also, the spring roll I got was not fried.  I missed carrots, peas and bean sprouts.  My first and last time.  Again, the staff was really nice.  I wish the food was as well.

Just tried this restaurant. 
And I must admit I was amazed. I had the shrimp Pad Thai and it was very flavorful.
I ordered an extra peanut sauce because I am a feen for good peanut sauce and again the sauce was great. I will be returning early next week for another round.

The Yelp reviews of this restaurant were so mixed that I felt like I was researching a term paper to figure out if I should order lunch from here. I ordered chicken Pad Thai and crab rangoon, and both were fantastic. I would take a photo, but I already ate it. 

The food is most certainly delicious. It's a cut above the other Thai options in the area. I will definitely be ordering again. I can only vouch for the two menu items I tried, but they were both great. Everything seemed very fresh. The delivery was speedier than expected too. (Thai delivery in Palatine. Who knew?)

Thai food is usually terrible in the suburbs. This place is Chicago-worthy. The food is great.

I came here the other day and wanted to try their lunch special. They don't have a website out since they're new so I had to call. I wanted to place a to go order since that's faster for me. I wanted a lunch special tofu pad Thai easy on the tofu but the girl who was taking my order didn't seem to understand me very well but maybe it's because we were talking on the phone and not in person. I also asked how much it is and its $7.25 plus tax which includes your portion plus an appetizer. No one asked me which appetizer I would prefer so I guess I was hoping they would still put something in.

Upon arrival, the people working here seem to be very nice and the place looks cozy. But they do have an open floor kitchen which isn't the best thing for a casual Thai place but that's just my opinion. I came home and checked out my entree. I know it was a lunch portion but the pad Thai was tiny. Im not expecting too much but this was definitely smaller than I'm used to and it didn't even fill up the container part. They did include two Thai egg rolls which were very tasty so that was at least nice of them. The pad Thai itself was delicious and I would definitely try them again if I'm in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to visit them again. They have nice people, and tasty food but the lunch to go portion was tiny in my opinion. 

I hope they do well and if you live by and maybe if you eat in you will have a better experience.

Delicious food, fast service and friendly staff.
Wide selection of authentic Thai food.
Probably the only place that serves crab fried rice.
This is an impressive Thai restaurant , I've been to several Thai restaurants and this has been by far the best and have met my standards. Service is excellent! Worth the drive.

We saw this place by chance while driving by. It's in a nondescript strip mall and the exterior doesn't exactly make you think delicious food inside. This place however has amazing Thai food. The Khao Soi is the best I've had outside of Chang Mai and everything else was fantastic too.

All of the staff are extremely friendly and smiley. Not something you get much of in restaurants up here.
Could certainly have been worse, but the scallops in the scallop pad Thai did not taste okay.  They weren't horrible, but definitely were a bit off.

This is for what I had for lunch today. Spicy beef salad, papaya salad, sticky rice. Ended with banana sticky rice as dessert. It's not just good; it's AUTHENTICALLY good. Based on earlier experience with basil chicken and pad thai, they tend to make it a little sweet (cater to locals' taste?). But I think you can ask them to just drop the sugar and choose your own spiciness level.

It's a solid Meh from me. It is obvious that they use fresh ingredients, but I was just not impressed. Skip the fried rice, it was bland bland bland. I was really turned off by the tiny portion sizes. It seemed that the more expensive the dish, the smaller portion they gave us. The potstickers we ordered were delivered ice cold. Disappointing to say the least.
I grew up on Thai food and this place is the real deal. I came yesterday and loved it so much that I'm back again! So happy it's less than a mile from my new house!

We have ordered to-go 2x. Delivery is decent. Meals are very fresh and flavorful. My favorite is the green chicken curry. It's very spicy, but oh-so-flavorful. Dishes are on the small side, but that's OK with me since I prefer meals to be healthy rather than over-the-top.

So happy there's now Thai delivery in Palatine!!!

We went for a family dinner on 8/26. It took 15 minutes for the waiter to address our table. Another 30 minutes to serve food. No plates were served with appetizers, resulting us to pick up from the main serving plate and eat. We had to request condiments and the jasmine tea that my son ordered never came although we were billed for it along with a Coke that we never ordered was also billed. The food was nothing great but just OK. We eat at a lot of restaurants and are definitely supportive of our local neighborhood restaurants. I want them to thrive. This attracts people and trade. But I am sorry we had the worse experience of our lives eating at this place. I am not going back.

This is a new place and I have to say although a little on the expensive side it is the best Thai I Have had in the suburbs. The beef was especially good. We picked up but the inside looked pretty nice with a big stone fireplace.

Awesome little place!  Ordered up their Thai Pad with beef and Vietnamese rolls and let just say if I am in the area again I will be back. Actually recommended to the folks in the office I came here to visit, they haven't been yet.
I ordered via the yelp app and the food was ready when I arrived. The proportions were perfect and full of flavor but next time I will order medium and not spicy, they like their heat here. Back home spicy is usually just right.

This restaurant gets 2 stars instead of 1 only because the Tom Yum soup and Yum Von Sen had nice flavor. But don't come here if you have to catch a movie or have somewhere to go, because you WILL miss it or be late.  The waitress took 15 mins to take our order, it took 40 minutes to get the appetizer, and 25 more minutes to get the main dish.  And of course, they forgot my food, so my dinner mate was done and picking his teeth by time I received mine.  Also, don't come here if you're hungry, because you'll leave hungry.  I literally finished my food in 4 minutes. FOUR MINUTES! And I don't eat particularly fast, but I was bloody starving! 

There's definite potential here, and if I have a few more experiences that are better I'll certainly update my review.  But for now, 2/5 is GENEROUS and based on flavor only.

I went in for lunch, hoping to find a hidden gem. What I got, was disappointed.
I ordered the lunch portion of Thai Cashew Chicken, preceeded by a spring roll. I was served a small portion of noodle soup that tasted like canned chicken broth. No flavor at all. The spring roll was also completely void of flavor. Tasteless.  When the entree showed up I was hoping for something with flavor.
What I got was the saltiest chicken dish I've ever eaten in ANY Asian restaurant. It was so over salted it was inedible PLUS the rice was cold.  The waitress told me they could make another, but what I had tasted left me with no appetite. They had the nerve to charge for a terrible, uneaten meal. Thai House will never have my business again, and with food that bad should be gone soon.
Super good for s great price. I had the basil chicken and my dad had the chicken mushroom. They were both delicious. The environment is okay, but for the price well worth it.

Few months back this Thai place opened close to my house- on first I was little iffy on trying it as they have no internet presence but then I tried it; one of the best Thai food in northwest suburb. Amazing food: loved crab rangoons and Penang curry, not big fan of their pad Thai but their curries are very very Gud. I will definitely recommend this to anyone who loves Thai.

Talk about a hole in a wall in not a positive way. The waitresses that work here doesn't give any service.  I keep on waving them down and they still ignored us.  One of them actual told us to go else where if we don't like her service. When you pay $10/Entree you expect a decent amount of food portion. To my surprise ! It was same size as kid size portion. I mean seriously !!! I finally get over the bad service, low food quality and less portion and request my check. We were 3 people and when we checked our bill (I love this part) I found an extra charge of $10 for an entree !!! I kept my calm and request a waitress to remove the charge since, we didn't order 3 entrees. She brought the check back and I noticed another mistake .. For $30 bill they charge $5 Service fee !! Service Fee for what !! bad service, low food quality or less Portion  ???!!  I asked what the service fee is and the waitress have no idea of the service charge.. For God Sake, you Work there !! If you think about, How many times these people charge innocent people with extra service charge fees or extra entree fees !! 

I wouldn't suggest anyone going to this place and get rip off with food and money ! I have attached my receipt copy so, everyone can see what kind of  secret charges they charge to innocent people

My favorite Thai place, hands down. Generous portions, excellent food, super fast take-out. I love these guys!!!!! (I've only really ever had take-out and haven't had the chance to dine in, but I'm looking forward to it!) Only real con I can think of is that it's just a bit pricey, but woah, is it worth it!

Yummy Pad Thai and Vietnamese Rolls! This place is very reasonably priced, under $15 for both appetizer and entre. They have generously sized portions, and for vegetarians/vegans like myself, the tofu is delish. Many different meal options and a nice environment. New favorite.
Good Thai food in northwest suburbs. Ordered take out food, tasted great, whole family enjoyed it. Will order again in the future.

I'm not sure why other people are complaining about this place.  Because I've been about 7 x already.  Thanks to this delicious affordable Thai place near my house-- I make less dinner.  

Price: very affordable.  People who complain probably only eat Fast Food.  Cheaper than Siri.

Diet:
My boyfriend and I are vegan/vegetarian glutenfree.

Food:
Excellent.
Moving to palatine from being spoiled by the many amazing diverse ethnic restaurants in Skokie/Evanston before, has been hard.  The food here has delicious and original and addicting flavors I've never tasted.  I've had Thai food all across the country, and this place is an authentic gem-- that is distinguished.

Vegetarian bonus points:
They make their food from scratch not prepackaged like the other places, and don't lie about fish sauce, like the other Siri Thai places in town.  They're willing and happy to cater to your needs and requests--not many places do the way they do.  Their food is authentic and flavorful--just how it would taste in Thailand.  

Favorites meals:
Panang, Pad Thai, crispy noodles!  I honestly couldn't have pad Thai at other places because of their use of eggs, but these guys make it delicious with a flavor I've never tasted before.  Crispy noodles are just as good as Thai Garden in Schaumburg.

Extremely thoughtful:
They are the only Thai Restaurant that uses special cookware and serve with separate utensils and dishware for vegetarians.  

About the owner:
They're a small business owner family, that's there every single day, with smiles on their faces that greet everyone genuinely.  Ask the owner his story.  And he's open for suggestions on improving.

Patience: 
Have some, they're new and figuring things out and becoming more coordinated each time! They're a little understaffed but awesome.  

Ambiance:
My boyfriend and I love it.  There is a cheery vibe, and the fireplace in the cold is awesome!!!!!
Best Thai food in the burbs.  So glad they opened.  Give them business so they stay around!
Loved it, had shrimp and chicken pad Thai which was very good, and the Tom yum soup was great as well, service was very good as well.  I will defiantly go there again to try the other dishes

Stopped into Thai House for a late lunch and was impressed with the service as well as the food. Not sure why there have been reviews calling this place pricey as I thought the prices were more than reasonable! My dinner-size crazy noodles (delicious and spicy) with chicken was $8.25; Thai iced coffee was $2.75. Both were excellent and were served to me within minutes. Definitely coming here again!
If you love Thai, this is the place folks. The food is awesome and the service is great. Very appealing! The prices are reasonable as well. I definitely recommend this place :-)

Really wanted to love the place.  Been looking for great Thai ever since I Am Siam closed.

The food was mostly bland.  Do not know if it was an off night as others seem to rave about this place.  Panda Express has more flavor - I expect depth and complexity from good Thai food.

Portions were meh - suppose that was a good thing as nothing really demanded to be saved for lunch tomorrow.  For sure not a value buy.  3 pieces of overcooked shrimp in a dish we paid over $12 for - come on.  Spicy beef looked/seemed boiled (looked very pale) - not stir fried and there was ZERO spice to the SPICY beef!

I may try them again - will try the new Thai place over in BG first and see where to go.

Food was good but timing of the service was off. For three people, one entry came first. 10 mins later soup for second person. Then entry for second person 5 mins later. Then soup entry for third person 3 mins after that.

Their food has rich flavor from what I've tried. The curry is so bomb. Highly recommend the curries, crab rangoons, lychee bubble tea, crispy chicken, satay. I do admit that the seating and decor of the actual restaurant is a bit awkward and the portions can be small for the amount that you pay; however, I truly believe that the food makes up for it. So, get your food delivered or place a carry out order :) This is the type of food I would lick stray sauce off a plate when finished. I really want this place to stay and do well.

The tom yum soup was delicious as were the crazy noodles.  It wasn't as spicy as I hoped but great regardless.  The layout is a bit cramped/strange, but the decor is nice.  As this is a new restaurant, the growing pains are a obvious.  They were understaffed and a little slow, but they had help wanted signs displayed prominently.  So this will resolve itself.  

Most importantly, the food and prices were great.  The staff was very polite despite being overwhelmed by Friday night rush.  I think this is a great spot for takeout.

Not sure what people are complaining about, I grew up in Palatine and eating at the local Thai places, Siri Thai is overpriced and tastes the same as The Thai House.  Since i saw it has opened I have ordered from The Thai House and have never been disappointed.  Great food, perfect for carry out, very nice people.
My wife was craving thai food so we tried Thai House. The Ginger Chicken and Pad Thai Chicken are a home run. We will be back
Worst Thai food I have ever tasted. Verry blend. I can just tell that they use bad quality meats.

Placed  order for work, the food was good, but portions are TINY!!! Not worth the money, very little food for the lunch special, all the other Thai places that I have been to, give you a lot more food. Very dissapointing

We've tried numerous Thai places in the palatine/Arlington heights area and this one is by far the best. Yes, the decor isn't great and it's not the most appealing to the eye, but the food is fabulous! I love the tom kha coconut soup with thin sliced chicken. We also always order the panang curry with beef and the basil chicken. Both are so flavorful. We also recently had the spicy glass noodle chicken which was delicious. Overall, we don't go for the ambiance, but we go because it's the best Thai food around!

I ate there for the first time today.  Ordered it to go and only took about 10 minutes to get my food. I thought it was really good! I had the chicken pad thai and they gave me a container of the thai chili sauce so I could make it my own heat level.  I thought the portion was OK for lunch.  But for dinner, it probably could be bigger than it was.  I also ordered the Golden Triangle appetizer.  The filling was tasty from what I could tell, but there was so little of it in the wanton it was hard to really say for sure!  So, food was good, but 4 stars for portions and I felt pretty ripped off by the app, actually.  Plus, there was NO air conditioning - it was absolutely sweltering in there; I don't see how anyone could dine in.

This is new in town right by the Target/Jewel strip mall on Hicks and Dundee. Excellent Thai food! I had it delivered through Grub Hub (wish they delivered on their own) and was very pleased!! Very fast delivery! My only issue is that I paid and tipped ahead of time and   asked to have the food left on my porch because I have two very loud dogs that are difficult to calm down and he not only rang my doorbell, he also went around back to my sliding glass door and knocked on that door before I even had a chance to answer my front door! Excellent shrimp yellow curry and shumai. Generous portion sizes! The yellow curry was one of the best I've ever had, and that is what I ALWAYS order for Thai food so I've had it tons of places. I also had the Rama noodle, but probably wouldn't order it again. It wasn't bad at all, just a bit rich and creamy for my specific taste and I would like to try their other noodle dishes. If you like a creamy and peanuty (not a word lol) sauce, you'd probably love this. I had it with chicken, and it also has big broccoli florets. I thought the prices were very reasonable and on point with other Thai places. Very happy they are open and love having a local Thai place!! Definitely would recommend to anyone! Excited to try other dishes from them and I will definitely be ordering regularly and hope to dine in soon. Yum!

Saw this place as we were driving by discussing lunch and decided to check it out.  Didn't realize how new it was.  The decor needs some work, but the food was just fantastic.  It may be the best Thai food I've had, certainly the best in the suburbs.  My daughter had Pad Thai and I had Panang Curry.  Both had lots of good complex flavor - I never order Pad Thai because it tends to taste sugary - this did not.  The Crab Rangoon and Spring Rolls were also great.  And the prices on the lunch special were perfect :)  I can't wait to go back!

I really enjoy their cheesey garlic beef and homemade mozzarella sticks. If you can't decide then get those. They also have good hotdogs and gyros. In fact most of the food here is good. 
My only issue is that the wait times for food can get a bit lengthy. Probably due to being short staffed. Especially during the week. Thankfully though it doesn't get too busy unless it's the weekend. Weekends can be a bit faster. 

If you are in Bartlett or nearby I recommend this place for anything hotdog, burger or beef related. Yum! Just be prepared to wait a bit.

Best local hot dogs around. I love coming back to this place to try absolutely everything on the menu because it truly is a BETTER VALUE and version of Portillos. Every day they have a different deal going on. 

My boyfriend loves the cheesy beef because the amount of meat in the bread is plentiful and packed with flavor. I am a strong lover of the cheese fries. There is honestly nothing more I crave than a great deal of cheese fries! 

The environment in this place is wholesome and always a great place to hang out with family or friends.

I came in and ordered a chicken gyro and swapped out the honey mustard sauce for the tzatziki sauce. As a side I ordered fries. My boyfriend ordered a hot dog. 

My chicken gyro: It had a generous amount of chicken, it was flavorful and juicy. The tzatiki sauce completed it perfectly. There was lettuce and tomato on it too.

The Fries: were hot and salted, nothing out of the normal. typical wavy fries 

The hotdog: I took a bite out of my boyfriends hotdog. It came chicago style with onions, mustard, tomato and relish. The bun was soft and had poppy seeds on it. Overall it was a good dog, Id order it next time.

I hate to do this. Should be 2 stars but I am trying to be nice.
Just picked up 2 Dogs with everything, These were the two skimpiest hot dogs I have ever purchased from here. On both dogs 1 thin slice of tomato, 1 sport pepper and barely any onion or relish. I know its only a hot dog but if that's what you are selling make the effort.
I'll give them another try and hopefully someone was just having a bad day behind the counter.

Friendly staff took our order quickly and we received it fast! Looks like they have tons of specials and every day seems to have its own special. 99 cent hotdogs on Tuesdays. Everything tasted fine. We enjoyed our first trip here and will probably be returning.

This place is pretty good.  The Hubs, nugget, and I recently stopped here for a quick meal on our way home from Elgin.  The restaurant is on Route 59 in a stripmall near North of the Border restaurant.  The hubs and I had hot dogs, fries, and tots.  The nugget had the cheeseburger.  The food was good.  I can't complain.

It appears as though they are really trying to expand their catering business.  There were lots of signs about it.  They also appear to have some awesome specials like 99 cent hot dogs all day on Tuesday.  What a bargain.

The sausage was good, kids liked the corn dogs, chicago style dogs were good. Tasty fries and tots. Super friendly staff. Cool pictures on the walls, love that era. We will definitely be back! 2 thumbs way up! Go check them out.

I had this place bookmarked for a while. Huge portions, but was not happy with lack of flavor. 

Ordered the garlic cheesy beef. Didn't notice any garlic at all, and beef didn't have any kick to it. 

Onion rings were so-so. 

I'd probably go back for their Vienna hotdog $0.99 special, but not for the beef.

I loooooooove the Dogfather!  Great hotdogs and great fries.  The hubs and I order a large fry and it should probably feed 3 people, but we really like fries.  Don't judge.

Gotta love the 99 cent special on Tuesdays -- the line will be out the door people, so just an fyi :)

Next time I am trying the Gyro and possibly those motz sticks.

This is a great place to get a quick, cheap, but decently good bite to eat.  

My husband and I have lived in Bartlett for four years now and finally decided to stop by for some food. 

He ordered the hot dogs and a tamale, while I got a burger no bun and fries.  I was a little disappointed by the tamale as it was one I could buy at jewel. We were very happy with everything else though. 

The best part, it was a Tuesday, so the hot dogs were one dollar.  Thus, making our bill with tax, 10 dollars.  

Win in my book!

My family and I still frequent here about once a month, and genuinely find their food "pretty good".

- hot dog prices VERY fair (Tuesday's .99 all day. M-F .99 between 2-4 pm), especially compared to Portillo's ($2.85 before tax) and Scooby's ($2.99 before tax. If you want peppers that's .60 extra before tax).  Note:  Hotdogs are almost identical to Scooby's.

- Fries are good and you get a TON.  However, they can be a little salty.  Note to restaurant:  Just add a pinch or two less of salt.

- Italian beefs - potential is there, but like many have said - served on the wrong bun. I even professionally asked the owner this on his fb page, and he replied in a friendly way stating that they chose to use "rolls" instead of Turano bread for their own reasons, most being a freshness factor.  I believe the rolls they use are homemade and made right at the restaurant.  The beef IS GOOD, but I don't like the soft hoagie-type doughy rolls.  I simply think they should be using Gonella or Turano french bread.

We will return.

We were going to go to Scooby's, but the bad reviews and the  ridiculously high prices made me look elsewhere, which led me to the Dogfather. The $.99 hot dogs were really good, the fries were crunchy and salted just right, and like others have said, there were enough in the large bag for three people. We decided to get a hot dog each and split a large garlic cheesy beef. Now, let me just say that Johnnie's beef will always be #1 in my book. Buona is a close second. But the Dogfather's beef is INCREDIBLE! From the first juicy, cheesy, spicy bite, we were instantly hooked! The bread is so fresh and flavorful (it said said that they make it there), the beef is not too dry and the mixture of the spices along with the melted cheese is just right. We will definitely go back there, and we'll be looking forward to it.

So I finally cheated on my beloved Portillos and tried the Dogfather.  I must say, it was no Portillos (I don't know what kind of crack Portillos puts in their food to make it the greatest food EVER but no one can beat it.  NO ONE) but it was a close second.  

We got some hotdogs and a cheesy garlic beef with some fries.  The hotdogs were pretty darn close to a Portillos perfect Chicago Red Hot.  I could go here for hotdogs any day and not actually miss Portillos at all.  The large fries we got were crispy crinkled and delicious and were honestly big enough for 2-3 people to share. (P.S. No one needs that amount of fries.  That said, I ate half the bag myself...for shame.)  The beef was great too with its crispy garlicky spicy yumminess at the top and gooey au jusy goodness at the bottom BUT I definitely prefer the dipped gooey bread and fall apart beef (doused in hot giardiniera) that Portillos offers.  I guess it's a matter of preference really.  If you want your beef to be more like the old Garibaldi's with its crispier baked bread and its tougher but more flavorful beef, come here.  If you want your sandwich to be a drippy gooey fall apart mess that melts in your mouth, go to Portillos.  Honestly, I wish that I could have the best of both worlds and have Portillos make my beef on their garlic bread and call it a day because I do like the garlicky touch that the Dogfather puts on their beef.  

Overall, this place was excellent if you live in Bartlett, like a nice cheap meal, and don't compare it to Portillos.

Great place.  So far have visited multiple times since we moved to Bartlett.  Is your standard selection of food...hot dogs, hamburgers, chicken etc.  Everything that I have had is delicious.  Why am I giving it 4 stars and not 5?  Tater tots.  They have them-and they are awesome...but they only give you a couple.  If you order the fries (which are also good, if a bit salty) you get enough to feed a small army.  The TT you get enough to feed an infant child.  What's the deal between the two?  Fix that you have yourself a 5 star hot dog joint.

The Dogfather is alright in my book.

We popped in for a quick bite and to meet up with a friend. I went with the Garlic Cheezy Beef, which is an Italian beef on garlic bread, and it was pretty good. I wish it wouldn't get wrapped up in foil if you're dining in because the bread became soggy, as did the Tater Tots, while waiting for my friend's order. Still, the sandwich had good flavor and my fianc says their Combo Beef-n-Sausage is better than Portillo's version.

We showed up on a Saturday right when they opened, so it was a bit chilly inside. Hopefully it warms up in the winter as they get things cookin'.

The tables weren't very clean, so I ended up wiping one off with napkins before we sat down. It would have been too tight a squeeze for five in a booth but they have stand alone chairs available and a counter with stools.
Hot dogs were not good and fries were made in very old grease.

Have eaten here twice...honestly, Burger King grilled hot dogs are far superior. Dogfather dogs are nothing better than a store bought package of Oscar Meyer's boiled in water.  I'm not being mean...this is an honest opinion.

Their cheesy beef is amazing! We're also had their gyro and chicken pita which are also very good. Fries and onion rings are a treat. We love stopping in here for a quick lunch on the weekends. Prices are very reasonable. Have to try their hot dogs on our next stop in!
This place is solid, the beefs are huge.  Its your typical hot dog joint.  Only complaint is two times ive ordered for takeout they forget the hot pepper, but charge me for them.

I thought the food was ok, would I waste the gas again. Also PuT THE AIR CONDITIONING ON.. It was 91 degrees outside and it felt like a 100 degrees inside. 
I feel bad for the workers. And the owner pulls up parks his truck upfront like a douche bag... PuT the air on Mr.Hot shot.

This place is the best. Hot Dogs are great, fries are good. Food is exceptional and a great value. The only problem is they have Pepsi products, I like Coke products

My go-to place when I am out and about.

Great comfort food. Nothing healthy here, but if you want a quick lunch consisting of some crunchy fries and a juicy hamburger- this is the place to go. I would call this place a small family fast food joint. Pretty good food for the price.

I was excited to go here because of it being featured on Chicagos best. Food was just average. Fries were undercooked. Garlic cheesy beef was pretty good but super soggy. The one biggest complaint was the place was filthy. Several tables available but they were a mess. I had to clean it up myself to have somewhere to sit. Don't think I will be going back.

Loved this place when it first opened. Then, about a year ago, 3 times in a row went in at dinner time, placed order, no cooks to be seen. Cashier calls them, they still don't come. All 3 are on a break at the same time and not responding. 

Didn't go there for a year. Tonight decided to try again. Walked in, no cooks to be seen. Placed order. Cashier calls the cooks, they don't come. She takes a few more orders, finally they all come out from the back and start cooking. They cook fast, everyone is served, the cooks retire to the back.... A new customer comes in and orders. Then 2 more. Then a phone order. Still no cooks. The cashier yells "Orders"! Still they don't come. Customers waiting for food start to become aware there is no one cooking. Finally they come and cook.

Never again, terrible service.

Love the beef. Well I should say loved I just moved to Texas and compared to all of the food down here in Texas the food up north is amazing. But by far I miss the dog father the most I would usually have the beef twice I week. I NEED IT!! 

Ps. If you are reading this owner I need some beef asap
Great hot dog, chicken sandwich, and maxwell polish.  Owner remembers everyone.  Line goes fast and food is quick and cheap.  Def a must stop in bartlett

Move over Portillo's- I have found my new favorite hotdog joint! I almost feel bad for not trying The Dogfather sooner. I'm giving you 5 stars for not just the quality of your food, but also for the friendly service, the amazing cleanliness of your restaurant, and your incredibly family friendly prices! I was able to feed a family of 6 for under $40!! And we were all FULL and very happy with what we ordered. Things we tried this visit include: cheese burger, garlic cheesy beef, chicken gyro, mozz sticks, hotdogs, french fries, and chicken O's- we have zero complaints. Please, do your stomach and wallet a favor and stop into The Dogfather!

Can't recommend.  I've watched an employee pick up garbage and then walk directly to handling food without washing his hands.  Seen employees throwing pitas which hit the side of food storage bins and then land on the counter before being used.  I walked out immediately.  The Italian beefs are served on the wrong bread.  They use rolls that immediately turn to mush instead of French rolls.  I don't understand this decision.  It renders what could be a good sandwich an inedible mess.  Strange.

I adore The Dog Father, I've been coming here for years. They do an excellent job with all of their food.

4 stars because:
I only ever get one thin slice of tomato on my hot dogs! Otherwise it's perfect.
The girl at the register seemed pretty rude to the line cools in the back.
Don't get me wrong she definitely gets the job done efficiently, a friendly face would have made my experience a 5 date experience.

I walked in on a Tuesday (which if you've read two reviews, you know it's 99 cents hot dog day). The staff was furiously trying to clean tables and counters; I'm guessing  large group had just left. Coming straight from the driving range, I headed into the bathroom and it was moderately clean. The floors were a little wet, there were some towels on the floor. I guess one of them should have checked the bathroom too. 

I stood alone at the counter for a good two minutes before someone stopped cleaning and helped me out. I guess I admire their dedication. Anyway, I ordered two dogs and a drink. I went with lemonade as I never drink Pepsi products. The dogs was of good quality, as it was steamed well and the roll was warm. There was a good ratio of toppings as none of them overpowered any of the others, which sometimes happens. Two complaints: the dogs are steamed and I prefer grilled. Also, there was only one piece of tomato. Maybe that's for budget reasons, but dog gone it, I want my tomato all the way through my hot dog! I would consider returning as it was an ok experience. Not bad, not great. Just good.

This place is Money! Albeit not for the reason you may think! 

Ownership was on their game choosing a location, the only hot dog joint around. Also a brilliant marketing tactic selling .99 cent dogs on Tuesdays and between 2 and 4 weekdays. Sell average food by "Volume" and they will come!

I am a living testimonial, a repeat customer for over 5 years. If I happen to be in the area, it crosses my mind. This is strictly a convenience stop and definitely not a destination. I do not wake up in the morning, jump out of bed, scratch, open the curtains to view a perfectly cloudy morning and proclaim "This is a Dogfather kinda day" Nope.

Now for the details. Granted this is a "Nit-Pic', but one of substance. The Dogfather considers itself an upper echelon Dog Joint. Such a place would be consistent with prep and detail of food and not focus on the Black and White pictures on the wall and the paint color behind them.

Serious Hot Dog Joints know this, thus the focus on detail: Upon ordering a Chicago Style Hot Dog, I may ask "What brand of dog do you serve"? I've received answers that run the gamut. The best is the "deer in headlights" cashier interaction "don't know".

I have been eating Chicago Style Dogs enough to know that hot dog reviews on Yelp are over the top, or just plain boring. This is my best rendition:

"The poppy seed bun is steamed properly however the Vienna Beef or Red Hot Chicago Dog was placed a tad off center in retrospect! Ouch! Quite possibly a result of yellow mustard drenching the northern portion of the bun exclusively.  The vegetable garden presentation raised an eye brow. The sweet onions where chopped small allowing the scant relish population to remain competitive. Such a battle. The two tomato slices were thin and a bit withered. I actually felt some compassion. The thick pickle spear complemented the single over sized sport pepper, an unwanted comparison". Yes, a compelling read.

Lets talk about the Beef Sandwich. Good thing, they offer the option of serving on garlic bread. Bad thing, served on a thick bun tasting like dough. Your first bite of a classic Chicago Beef  should taste "Pure Beef", not bread!

Bottom Line, It's tough to be a little dog.

Sorry these guys were sponsors for my kids football team. Gross food and hotdogs. I feel bad saying this but they need to know. Take some lessons from portillos or beef villa I can make a better hotdog than you at home

I love the owner, prices are alright, location good...but no matter what time of day I walk in, the girl who takes the orders is rude, short with people and literally NEVER smiles, says hello, or thank you.  She is always on her phone and I understand maybe the job isn't thrilling, but cmon!!!!! Get someone in there who is happy to have a job and actually works.  Not someone who makes the customers uncomfortable and feel like a burden.  If I didn't like the owner and know how nice he is, I'd never return just because of her.

Love the name. I went there a few days ago around 1:30. There was no line walked up to counter and the girl was sitting down lookin at her phone. I ordered the days special Italian Beef.  Food came out quick  I went to sit at one of the booths but it was dirty.  Tried another one same thing. So I got a few napkins and clean the table and seats. Beef was ok bread was very good.  Beef didn't have much flavor. 
I would try them again  they might of been busy before I got there.

Been eating Chicago style hotdogs for over 50 years. This place was great when it first opened and was good for many years. Seems they are either afraid to raise prices or are cost cutting as the quality is no longer the same. Toppings are scarce and hot dogs are no better than what I can buy at my local grocery store. Too bad..we need a good hotdog place in the Western suburbs.
Frozen french fries? What a joke. The best hot dog places serve hand cut fries.

Always good. Typical burger and hot dog place but they also have a great fresh grilled chicken pita that is one of my favorites. The hot dogs are well prepared Chicago style complete with sport peppers. Everything is affordable and a very good value. The perfect price to and even better value proposition.

I have wanted to go here since I watched the Best of Chicago-best of 59 review for it. I drove all the way from north Naperville and it was well worth the drive. The Maxwell Street Polish was delicious. I love the way they put knife cuts on one side so that the grill makes it crusty and carmelized. YUM!

Cant' wait to try the hot dogs!

Average and consistent. Sport peppers are unusually large and a bit different than most places - I usually get only one pepper per dog, so I ask for extras. Beefs Gyros and fries are good. Locals seem to think this place is the bomb, probably because it's thinly hot dog place in Bartlett. Nonetheless, I am thankful it's here.

Yummy hot dogs and gyros. 

The gyros have a TON of meat, it's awesome. 

I'm one of the few people that don't like the mozzarella sticks. It's probably because i'm a filthy heathen.
good price good dogs made chicago style. they are clean and helpful and my son enjoyed the burger.

I'm giving the Dogfather 5 stars based on what I go there for, and it's simple. You can't beat 99 cent hot dogs on Tuesdays. Their hot dogs are perfectly reminiscent of chicago dogs, perfectly steamed. And obviously the price can't be beat. I also love their crinkle cut French fries. No need to order a large, even the regular size can be shared!

These hot dogs remind me of what you get in the city. On Tuesday's they are 99 cents which makes the appeal even larger. They have crinkle-cut fries which are some of my favorite. The regular is enough to share, tons of fries included in your order!

The Godfather trilogy is among my all-time favorite movies. I absolutely hate crying and try to avoid it at all costs, but the tears poured when I saw the finale. Oh, Al Pacino.. http://vimeo.com/62591294

So it was fated that I would try this place out just based on its name.

10" garlic cheesy bread ($6.95) - 4.25 stars. 4 stars for taste, 5 for value. Colossus of a beef sandwich. Way better value than Portillo's, free sweet & hot peppers if desired (which I always do haha). Bread that stands up to the weight and breadth of all that meat. The meat wasn't as juicy/tender as I remembered when I tried it last (June 2013).

Chicago-style hotdog ($1.99, or $0.99 on Tuesdays) - 4.5 stars, 5 stars on Tuesdays haha. Very good, but not the best hotdog I've had or among my top favorites. I'm more into dogs with a snap and/or char. Other than that, pretty darn perfect for a Chicago-style hotdog. Soft bun & well-proportioned toppings.

Overall, an affordable neighborhood fast food joint good for if you're in the area.
Awesome food must try their chicken gyros! Excellent service!! Will defined go back again

Came back for round 2 to give them a shot. I was right the first time. I hate when they let you down like that :)

If you're trying to get die soon or need to put on weight quickly (for a movie role or whatever!) disregard my comments and come here often :)
Blargalargalargalargalaahhhh. sorry that was my interpretation of me gorging myself on the cheesie  garlic beef. Good place to pick up a quick meal!
Great food, owner does a lot for the community.  Great joint all the way around!  Chicken sandwiches are awesome!

My boyfriend and I come here almost every Tuesday. They have a friendly staff and the service is impressively fast. I like the fact that they take your name for the order instead of numbers very organized. The food is also nice. 99cent hotdogs every Tuesday is the best. The only thing I would say to improve is more seating availability. Usually whenever we come in there's never any seating available.

Family owned I think so I'll give them credit for that but rude people when I went in I felt rushed to order and hate it when employes and managers TEXT while at work
Keep driving past this place portillos a few miles away on north AV.

This place is deceiving. You think it's just another hot dog joint but when you go in you will see a huge menu to choose from. 

Their food is delicious. You have many items to choose from on their menu. Their staff works fast and is very courteous.

PROs: Inexpensive, Better than Portillos, Quick service

CONs: A bit hot inside

Ordered the Italian beef with a side of fries. The portion of the fries is huge! The fries by itself is a meal of its own and ended up having to pack it home with me. Overall the meal was delicious and would stop by whenever I'm in town.

The Restaurant is clean and the serivce is really good. The Chili cheese dogs are a little in the small side, but really tasty. The Cheese is not some thing resembling Velvita and has a nice flavor.
