I grew up in the area, and there weren't many options back then.  Obviously, much hasn't changed.  Bulldogs is a breath of fresh air in comparison to the still sparse options of chain restaurants and craphole sports bars.

But beware - the mood changes at Bulldogs around 9-10pm.  Earlier in the evening, I was one of the younger people here.  When I left, I was one of the oldest.  The later it got, the pulsating music was cranked louder, as if they were transitioning into a dance club.  But nobody was dancing.  Ugh - identity crisis!

The beer list is respectable; I honestly didn't expect much from Bulldogs, and I'm not sure why.  I went with a Green Line, I'm not sure what my friend was drinking, but there are enough options on draft or in bottles to satisfy even the pickiest beer snob.

I wasn't super hungry, so I thought I'd just order an appetizer.  I had the pretzels with cheese, which turned out to be EIGHT quite large pretzels.  My friend had a burger, which was massive, and ordered a dessert which was big enough to serve 4, at least.  The pretzels were good.

Bulldog is a welcome option in an area that doesn't offer much, but it's not a destination.

Good Bar food.  Great staff.  Nice suburban bar.

Just a great local spot to watch the game, or hang out with friends.  The food is pretty good.  The burgers and chicken wings are probably the better menu items.
Awesome wings,  great waitress Melissa. Very attentive and on top of things. No wonder she training others.  Will return often and asking for her again.

They have a lot of food & if you're looking for some specials on alcohol they have that too.  

The place is very big & even bigger than it looks.  When you walk in they have a large bar area & tables around the bar.  However if you don't want to sit by the bar they have an area to the back with regular tables & booths.  The area around the bar is filled with flat screen tv's.  This place has a huge menu of food & their beer selection almost seems limitless.  

The staff here has always been friendly & the service has always been fast.  My favorite dish that they have here would have to be the shrimp po boy & in second definitely the shrimp macaroni & cheese.  

This place also has a digital jukebox & a few video poker & video slot machines.  Besides the favorites that I listed they also have some delicious appetizer platters.  The potato skins are pretty good & so are the buffalo wings.  They can put a few high top tables together which works very good especially if you have a large group.  

Overall the service is quick & the staff is friendly.  The food is very good & is reasonably priced.  Overall I would definitely come here again if I was in the area.

This place has its really great nights, and then not so much. When I ordered a particular beer (that they don't carry) instead of telling me so I could change my drink the bartender gave me what their version of it was. It wasn't that great, actually it was crap. Service is wishy washy, and it gets outrageously loud. Music and people.
On a better note their specials are awesome and their dollar burgers are delicious!

First time here.  Evidently they've upgraded and added new items to their menu, said the waitress.  It seemed like really good choices. Fancier options than standard bar food.    I chose goat burger with pear and bourbon.  My bf choose the 39 cent boneless wings.  Best meal we've had in a long time.  Excellent drink bulldog martini.  Will return.

I went out with my coworkers to get to know them better. We chose a place nearby so I could easily get to the highway. We find that this place has $2 ale drafts and $.089 chicken tenders. I got blue moon with a shot of orange liquor (not part of the $2 special) in mine which was awesome and delicious. Also, it warmed me up. The chicken tenders were good too. We had ours with Caribbean Jerk. It was subpar compared to Buffalo Wild Wings, but I still liked it. It was a great time and a good deal.

Great change from all the usual chains.  Good food, great specials and awesome service.  I hold pretty high standards for my servers, and Kristy is a mind reader.  Before I could ask for anything, she was already there with it.

Monday nights they have $1 burgers, so I thought it would be great to take the boys here.  Yes, they are 1/4 lb. burgers for a dollar, but fries are $3.50 and onion rings are $7!  So no real deal there.

Our service was kind of spotty.  There was 5 of us and it seemed like our server had a big area to deal with.  Maybe since it was a Monday they cut back on servers, I don't know.  We had a variety of things from the menu, burgers, chicken tenders and I had a portobello mushroom aka "the earth burger".  I was told the tenders were good and my mushroom was good, but just got an "ok" for the burgers.

Once you sign up for the email list from here, they send you coupons, but from what I saw it looks like the coupons just deflate the overblown prices.

The inside is nice and clean and not too noisy, so I had no problem bringing my kids to a bar, but next time I think I'll just go with hubby and toss back a few cold ones!

This place has a good crowd and atmosphere is nice. However, their tvs for a sports bar are all terrible ... Most are blurry or have some discoloration problem. There's never enough room on nights that are more crowded. They just have the set up all wrong as far as tv placement and table set up. (The food is okay... Not amazing but worth coming back to hang out with friends). They just need improvements.
Too much smoking on the patio! People literally standing and sitting next to you at their table smoking cigarettes! Disgusting! Please fix that!

Sad to say, this place is no longer a restaurant. It's a bar.  Bar food, bar service, loud and dark. Poor service from cocky teen age waitresses, who don't know the menu and who'd rather be talking to their friends there.  Place was great for awhile, but poor management has let the food side fail.

My friends and I sat down for 35 minutes with a menu without being helped... The manager came up to the table and asked us if everything was going well. We ordered our food and he said a waitress would assist us shortly. Long story short, the service was TERRIBLE and the waitresses were rude. One waitress even had that audacity to approach us while we were leaving and complained about the 10% tip.... I should have given the tip money to the manager since he helped us more than they did.

My buddy and I go here to watch the Blackhawks games, as it is equal distance for us. The staff is always polite, the food is great, and the beers are cold! We love it. 

There is one downside. The TVs! Guys, you're a sports bar. The TVs need upgrading, and FAST! The two best quality TVs in the place are the smallest ones, right above where he servers pick up drinks from the bar.
Excellent wings. Jamie was very nice and I can't wait to back. The beer is excellent as well.

After being ignored when we walked in, it didn't get any better.  Every beer we asked for they were either out or didn't have it yet, even though it was on their menu and website. The only positive thing that came out of the night was our waitress.  Will definitely not be coming back to this location.

Service can be rude- especially on a busy Wednesday. But you really can't beat $3 you call it's, and some of the bartenders are really friendly and provide excellent service. The food is not very good but I always get the cookie skillet with ice cream which is delicious.

Came here for lunch after moving into the area this last Saturday.

Restaurant appeared to be somewhat steady as I came in with three other people for late lunch. We immediately got sat at a table, but then it took at least a good 5-10 minutes for a waitress to come to our table just to get drink orders. After receiving our drinks and waiting another 5 minutes, we finally ordered our entrees. Once the entrees came (I ordered the shrimp po boy sandwich), they were mediocre at best. The shrimp on my sandwich tasted like it was frozen shrimp that got put in a store bought breading with no spices and then deep-fried. The rest of my group thought their entrees were just okay.

The bar looked nice and they seemed to have a solid beer selection. I wouldn't mind giving this place another try, but only in the sense of going out on the weekend with friends to drink or catch a game.

Awesome bar to check out.  They're open late and have great drink specials.  The manager Dani is great and goes the extra mile for his customers.  All the food I've tried has been top notch.  I will definitely be back soon!

We were here on New Year's Eve, which happened to fall on a Thursday. They have cheap draft beers and chicken tenders on Thursdays. We got the soft pretzel appetizer - SO GOOD. Then we both got chicken tenders, I also got the truffle tots on the side. Both were delicious. We enjoyed the appetizer and beers so much, we had to take home almost our entire meals! Our server was friendly and just the right amount of attention. Loved the vibe, and being able to watch the hockey game right in our booth was nice too. We will be back for sure!

Frequent this Bulldog location. Saturday ordered special build your own burger, indicated allergic to mushrooms.  The kitchen put mushrooms on burger, complained to server, took burger back to kitchen for new one w/o mushrooms.  The kitchen (we think) just scrapped off the mushrooms and sent back the burger.  Hubby allergic so we called manager Josh, and he proceeded to apologize and got us a new burger and took care of bill & gave us gift card for dinner on him.  He was very attentive to our problem and took care of it properly.  We will go back, since we really like Bulldogs.  Just wanted him to know we appreciated all his concern and his help in clearing up this problem...Thanks Josh.

I'm impressed by the amount of people they have working behind the bar yet, all they seem to be doing is moving glasses from one spot to another spot.  Took forever to get a bartender to look in our direction
Super yummy Flir-tinis and their chicken pot pies are delish too! Cool spot! The staff is very nice & friendly.

The food is delicious, but the service is horrible. The one thing everyone says about bulldogs is that they never can get a drink. Customer service is key as well as customer relations - I've seen this business go downhill for the past couple years now.
Here for lunch for the first time. It was as good as dinnet with friendly staff and prompt service. Will keep coming back!

This was my second visit to Bulldog Ale House. I didn't eat anything; I was just along for the ride with my sister, nephew, and mom.

They have a huge menu of different types of bar foods. They have specials everyday, too. I know Mondays are dollar burgers, and Wednesdays, the night I was there, they feature 1/2 price pizza.

My mother ordered 5 boneless bbq wings and a side salad, and my sister ordered the El camino burger (a Mexican themed burger with tortilla Strips, bacon, cheese, sour cream, etc.) with waffle fries. They have plenty of sides options, and like I said, a huge bar menu.

Bulldogs is a cool place. They offer specials every night and the atmosphere is laid back. There is a bar section and a restaurant section, but you can order food and drinks at both, obviously.

There are plenty of tables and the atmosphere is nice. It was dimly lit in the dining room, which is standard of course. The bar probably gets rowdy, as everyone one does, when there's a major sporting event of any type, but there was nothing big on TV that night. I will note there are plenty of TVs in the venue too.

The service was okay; our servers weren't on the same page (one was a trainee) and they kept coming back and asking the same things and actually forgetting simple requests. Oh well, maybe just an off night.

I won't go out of my way to get bulldogs, but it's a nice place to have as an option in Carol Stream. A solid 3 star joint!

Great food and service for an area that doesn't have many other options for a quick bite,  Good barfood and sports-bar type atmosphere, lots of TV's.  My one negative would be the bathrooms aren't kept very well, the mens room always has water on the floor, is slippery and below average when it comes to cleanliness.

Overall though, definitely worth a visit and I often order take out from here as well.  Good service too.
Bar staff is rude and do not move very quick. I ordered a Budweiser and saw them out bud light in the glass multiple times and when I told a manager he told me to "prove it".

Can you say false advertising?  "Would you like to add a side salad for $1.99?"  I say sure.  I asked for ranch as my dressing.  
I didn't ask for any additional.....
Check came....and I was charged $1.99 for salad plus .50 for ranch dressing?
I asked the waitress thinking that was a mistake...nope.  She says we charge extra for salad dressing.  Any salad dressing for your $1.99 salad!  Wth!

The owner should really rethink this.  Upsetting tactics.
Great Specials, Great Grub, Great Staff!  Usually busy so you know they are doing something right.  Enjoy going to Bulldogs!

They have specials every day of the week and that's great for a bar. I love that they have slot machines and a pool table.

Their food is pretty good too and comes out within a decent amount of time. 

What I don't like is their service....I've been here a few times and I've met one person that was friendly, ONE. I think he was a manager, but I've met another manager that was a completely incompetent arrogant prick. The girls there are snotty and seems like they hate their jobs....not to mention one of the bartenders needs way more training....she literally dumped a pint of beer trying to fill one glass....

$2 beers on Thursdays...enough said.

Came here with friends before heading out to music in the park in Carol Stream.  I like this place! I think it would be a fun place to go to on the weekend! $2 for any draft beer?!?! YES PLEASE!  They also had 89 cent chicken tenders...add some hot sauce to them and they are delish! 

Our server was just OKAY, but the manager was very attentive and checked on us and chatted with us a couple times.  I love when the managers do that!

The have a dining area with plenty of seating and a bat area.  They also have an outdoor patio to enjoy!

They have specials through out the week as well.  I fun addition to the western suburbs and I cant wait to go back!

I made a reservation at Bulldog Ale House and they called to confirm it the day of, which I liked. I also requested outdoor seating (which was one of the reasons I chose here) and they said they don't normally hold outside tables but would be happy to help us out! I liked that.

The waitress, Kristina, was very kinda and attentive. The kitchen messed up our appetizer order and she took care of it almost instantly. 

The food was outstanding overall. Huge menu to benefit most people! I also liked that the servings were not abnormally large but a nice meal that didn't leave me feeling gross or food coma-like. 

My Dad had a burger, Mom had the pot roast sandwich and I had the southwest panini. We were all VERY satisfied with our meal. 

Drinks, Food, Service, Ambiance... all great! 

If i had any critique, It was strange to me that people could smoke on the patio without it being 15 ft from the entrance door. Smoke doesn't bother me, really... but if you are extremely bothered by smoking, the outside patio is not for you.

I been here several times and never had bad meal. I've had the buffalo chkn wrap,  buffalo pizza, chkn club salad, and nachos. They have great daily lunch specials but you have to purchase a beverage. I usually drink water but order the special bc it's usually less expensive then ordering at reg price. Service is usually good.

I've been 2 times now, several years apart. Both times I've had great service and food. 

This time around I ordered the Reuben, some Mozzarella sticks, and a "Daisy Cutter" beer. Portion sizes were great with sandwich, as were the prices and wait time for the food to come.

As a traveling trainer, I'd recommend this place for both the pace and food choices. You want good food late at night and fast? This is perfect choice for you.
good food good price! sport bar

Beer, beer, more beer, tables, high tops, TV's, lots of TV's  and a clean facility with very nice employees. I loved this place, specially for a chill night when you want to just watch a game and get a drink or two (or thirty) with friends.

The place is HUGE!! Dining room and bar are separated which is nice. The bathrooms are big, they needed a little up keepin at the time, but I'm sure they're not always like that.  The waitresses could be a bit more attentive though, when a guy brings me a drink faster than you do, guess who's gonna get that tip?! lol j/k 

What did it for me was their beautiful patio area with a fire pit!! Perfect for summer nights. They have darts, pool, and video games. It's lively, large, inexpensive and fun. Can't go wrong. Next time I'll try the food. :)
Pizza tasted like Pizza Hut. Our waitress was so inattentive. I had to literally get up and get service from other waitresses. We were very disappointed and will never ever be back.

I've been here for food a couple times and for drinks a dozen times - great selection of beers on tap. Thursday night is $2 drafts which is something we take advantage of every so often. Food is fine - what kills this place's score for me is the service is horrible. It's notoriously bad - you frequently have to track down your waitress and it can take forever to get a drink. They also added video poker recently which is a huge turnoff for me. I'll keep going back because it's so close but if there were better local options I would avoid.

We went here because I was craving Loaded Fries and Buffalo Wings.

When we got here we ordered Queso Dip and Buffalo Wings instead, because I DO WHAT I WANT, YO. Also, Pregnancy cravings change at a moment's notice, because your body is your enemy.

The queso dip is filled with lies. There is no cheese and salsa mixture, it's cheese and also cheese. I'm thinking next time if I order it ( which is pretty unlikely), I'll just get a cup of the chili and mix it in. There are no rules in outlaw food. 

For the wings we ordered 3 different sauces - Cajun, Sweet Chili, and Inferno Buffalo. 

The cajun sauce didn't really taste like anything at all. The Inferno buffalo had some heat. The majority of the time when a place has 'inferno wings', they're usually pretty tame. These had a good level of heat. The Sweet Chili sauce was awesome. I would definitely get the wings in that sauce again, it was the favorite of both the man and I.

Afterwards I ordered an Ultimate Grilled Cheese, it comes with a couple of different cheeses and some bacon. How could that possibly go wrong, right?

They bring my grilled cheese out, cut in half, and the cheese is very obviously not melted whatsoever. So whomever made it, cut it and looked at it and said ' Yeah, that looks about right!'

Now, i'm not a cooking expert,  there's a lot of stuff I can't make, but a grilled cheese is a relatively easy thing to master. Slap cheese between two slices of bread, heat until melted - BAM! 

A couple reviews had referenced the waitresses walking around in outfits similar to Tilted Kilt, but all of the waitresses I saw were in either normal-sized t-shirts or jerseys, and they all had jean shorts. There was nary an ass cheek in sight. 

I'd go back for wings, I loved the sweet chili sauce. It's what's saving this from being a 2 star review. I'd probably just avoid the rest of the menu besides the appetizers. If you mess up a grilled cheese, i'm not going to feel adventurous enough to try out the rest of the menu.

Went in yesterday & I have to say, the gentleman Corbin who served us was AWESOME! He definitely made up for our previous visits. He acknowledged us prior to bringing us menus, he was attentive & great customer service. The drinks were great, food was good & kudos to Corbin who served us.

A group of 6 of us came here before we went bowling to kill some time. Happy to say this was a good spot to come to. We came for Happy Hour, the food was hot and delicious, and the prices are reasonable and fantastic. Would definitely recommend coming here and I would come back again in the future.

Thursday's. That's all I need to say about this place. 2 dollar drafts and .89 cent tenders. I love the spicy garlic. The only thing that made it give it less than 5 is the service. They are incredibly slow here. Other than that, no complaints. Food is good too.

Service is okay, our waitress just seemed very boring--but prices are great, and it's a good stop to watch a game. The burgers were 3 dollars as a special and the beer list is great. everything from IPA to Goose Island, etc. It's a younger crowd, I saw teenagers here that came in to watch a game. It's in a good location located in a strip. I'm glad I chose this place instead of Fox and Hound or a Chili's to catch a Bulls game. If I was in this part of the suburbs again, I would definitely come. 

They have a separate dining room which is great for families but my fianc and I went to the bar. As the night went on, it became extra crowded.

(DONT PUT MONEY IN THE TOUCHTUNES) 

This place is pretty good. The food is good and the drinks are ok (a bit light handed). The only problem I have is that the Bar manager Donnie loads the TouchTunes player with about $60 and plays only what he wants. If you're looking to eat or drink it should be a fun time just be prepared to drink to the manager's playlist (which isn't good) unless you plan on being around for about 4 hours when your song actually plays.
Came in for the first time today. Absolutely fantastic food, great service, reasonable prices and vast beer selection. I will be making this one of our "go to" places.

Much improvement has been made to the quality of the food and service here.  The waffle fries are awesome, the pasta is definitely a hidden hem, the buffalo pizza is unreal, and the burgers are phenomenal when they're cooked to order.
Service is A ok! Nothing special. However, the food and the specials that they have make up for it. But please stay away from the pizza. Best comparison is Pizza Hut.

The burgers are delicious! I somehow ordered a veggie burger, and didn't even realize there wasn't any meat until my husband pointed it out - it was THAT good! Not sure if I'll order any friend stuff again though, the onion rings are ok but anything fried lacks major flavor. 
Ordered for pick up and it was all ready within 15 minutes which was great!! 
Will be going back to try more of the menu!

They have some decent specials, especially $1 burger and wings for under $0.50 on their respective days. Sometimes service is a little slow, but the food is good. This location has a door that leads to the patio which lets cigarette smoke in if you're sitting too close (gross). Good spot for some specials and a nice time.

A high school reunion topped with terrible service. I mean TERRIBLE service. I'm a server at a bar and I would NEVER treat customers the way these servers and bartenders do. I'm talking extremely rude and slow. Unfortunately I'm forced to go here often since it's practically the only bar in carol stream that for some reason people like to go to. 

Advice for the servers and bartenders. You're probably wondering why you don't make much in tips. Well, read the info above maybe?

I love the beer selection and daily specials.  I end up here alot, because of the specials. I would not say that the food is bad, but it's nothing special either.

Thursdays are my favorite days to go, $2 pints (yes, even the craft beer) and 89 cent chicken tenders. Cheap craft beer and chicken tenders in wing sauce, whats not to like.

The only reason it didn't get 5 stars from me is the food. It's not bad food, but it is not a place I go because of the good food.

I'm going to break it down easy for you here:

Beer:  They've got everything from trash to treasure.  The treasure end doesn't have as many choices, but there's some good ones on there to choose from.  Plus, we came on $3 draft night so it was cheap too.

Food:  Not bad.  I got a burger and it was cooked perfectly and loaded with toppings.  Just the way I like it.  It seems like there are awesome deals in this department as well...although I passed up the 1/2 price pizza.

Service:  We had an awesome server but I can guess it's not always that way in the bar judging from the looks of people around us.  This one's a draw.  I guess you can always sit on the restaurant side if you're really worried about it...though I can't vouch for it.

Atmosphere:  The place looks nice, it's pretty big, and there are two sides to choose from.  If you want sports bar, you've got a side with a bar, tables, pool tables, darts, blah blah blah, and if you want restaurant, they've got a side for that too.  The clientele on the bar side is a little annoying (as is the crappy music they play all night on the jukebox) but if you don't mind screaming over said crappy music at the people around you, then you're alright here.  Obviously, it gets louder and more annoying as the night gets later, but maybe I'm just old and crochety.  Bah humbug.

Went there on a Friday night.  Fish fry was greasy.  They need to bring the oil temp up.  Waitress was fine but tried to hurry us.  Couldn't get a booth because we didn't have enough people...thinking back, 3 of us should have been fine as paying customers.  Not impressed with the flat bread french dip pizza.  Barely any beef but tons of onions. Not going back anytime soon.
The service is just terrible sit at the bar and just forget it you will never get served go else where

I made a reso on open table for this past Thursday and put a special request to sit in the bar. When I got there there was no table reserved for me and the manager approached the host an insisted I did not put that request in when I made the reso.   I went back on open table and tried again to put the reso in adn take the special request to sit in the bar.  I did Notice and told the host that it doesn't work to put a comment in open table.when.making a reso. She said she would tell her manager.  Idk if she did.  Normally the manager is pretty nice but I found it insulting that he was trying to say that I never made that request to sit in the bar when I did.  As if I was lying.   The host was very apologetic however the manager did nothing. Good thing we ended up sitting at the bar and Blaine was our bartender and absolutely hilarious.

I am originally from the the South Side of Chicago"Beverly." Bulldogs pizza, which I was skeptical about ordering, was amazing! It was like a combination of Fox's Pub pizza, with Lou Malnotti's crust! I was going in there to order one of their famous burgers! Yet, I gave in and the bartender reassured me the pizza was very good! All four dishes I have eaten at Bulldogs have been superb, and the service has been wonderful. A "Go to place!," In the west Burbs for sure!

Ok, this bar has me torn. On one hand, they have great specials. How can you beat $2 ANY DRAFT pints on Thursdays? (They have 32 beers on draft) Or $3 U-Call-It's on Wednesdays? 

On the other thand, the service is horrible. I have been there several times since moving back into the area a few months ago, especially after learning about their Thursday night draft special. When I have sat at the bar, I have struggled to be served by the bartenders even when it wasn't very busy. The bartenders would just randomly disappear for 10 minutes. When I have gone to Bulldog with my fiance and had a meal at a table in the bar, we have consistently had to wait for service. We have finished our drinks and wanted another, and had to wait forever for our server to come back. By then we normally pay our bill and go.

Don't get me wrong, I really don't mind the place. If the service was even average this place would have easily earned 4 stars from me. But the service really has proven to be sub-par over many visits. I still go there every other week for a good beer on the cheap. Also, the food is average- I would never go there for a meal by itself but I definitely order food after having a few.

I recommend checking out their website, looking at their specials, and checking it out on a night that suits your tastes.

Uhh ...where do I begin!

Ambiance - negative 1 star
Service - negative 1 star
Food - 0 stars
Beer Selection - 3 stars (just average)
Recommend to: not even my worst enemies.

I really do not get it.  Bulldog Ale House took over Buds, in Roselle, and turned it into a place you want to be. Lively, dare a I say a bit upscale and with a wonderful beer selection.  When it came time to entertain some family from out of town, I suggested this location, as it is a bit closer to my house. 

What was I thinking??

First, good luck trying to find your way in.  There are half a dozen doors, and they are not marked, and tinted.  Some extremely smart people I met up had the same comment, of not being able to find their way in.  Matter of fact, I went to the same door that I came in on, and 3 of us wrestled with it, to get our way out ....ugh.

Second, we all felt guilty taking up our servers time, as she clearly had better things to do, than to provide service.

Third, they must have caught a Denny's-going-out-of-business sale to furnish this dump.

Fourth, the food was drab, they got orders wrong, twice, pizza is laughably overprices for being so mundane (the large and medium are the same size, but priced differently).

Fifth, you will not find the awesome beer selection here, that you might find in Rosellle.  There was only one beer that I found to be drinkable, but nothing else ...yawn.  Ale house?  How about Bud Light house....

Sixth, they went to the slutty Scottish whore store to get the servers uniforms, which seem out of place at a Denny's. (yeah I do not go to Tilted Kilt either)

Seventh, I cannot tell you how embarrassed I was to suggest this place.  How could they have gotten one place so right, then the other so wrong???

Wasted times. This place is bad for the young soul. This is a really depressing bar. 

Service:
I have been here twice and have been disappointed twice. Waitresses here seem to not give a damn about doing a good job. I been here on a moderately busy day and didn't get my order until about an hour and a half later. It was All You Can Eat Wings Day.... My final time, service was still bad and our order took close to an hour to come out. How much time does it take to cook up 10 wings? You shouldn't have to walk up to someone else to get refills on drinks either. Friendliness is lacking from the waitresses as well. You are supposed to be having a good time at a bar! Not getting frustrated over serving yourself.

Food:
Probably the least exciting food I have had in awhile. Fries were lukewarm and not very flavorful even with Ketchup. And the All You Can Eat Wings might as well be All You Can Eat Bland. Every sauce I tried from their limited selection was very lackluster. It always ended up just tasting like the blandness of the chicken meat. At least the food didn't make me sick. I don't want to bother with trying other options considering the service.

Atmosphere: 
Not my sort of crowd. Literally all the creepers and dropouts from my High School go here. As biased as that sounds, I am not even the least bit exaggerating. Place feels devoid of the typical sports fans or young people. You go here if you were part of the awkward social outcasts or you're over 40 in the lonely suburbs. This isn't Bulldogs fault by any means, but be warned. I highly doubt you will find your one true lover or best friend here. Unless you are the type who excessively swears and talks about sticking it to the man as a hobby. 

This place depresses me and felt like it sucked away a bit of my youth. The food, the crowd, and the service all tell me never to return.

Stopped in while nearby on business. Had read mostly good reviews, so decided to give Bulldog a try. Mostly positive; excellent service at the bar; good beer selection. It was "all you can eat" wings night, so I tried both Spicy Garlic (pretty good) and Caribbean Jerk (okay).  Stomach woke me up about 4 am, can't pinpoint the wings, (I didn't have THAT many) but I'll probably skip them if I visit again. Lots of TV's, but not the channel selection of other sports bars. If you want to watch a national channel or a local Chicago team, it's a good spot.

More of a generic "sports bar" than an "ale house" really. The tap list consisted of 31 beers tonight with 11 of them being craft beers. The rest of then were your typical Bud, Miller, Coors fare. That's fine if that's what you are looking for, but a self-proclaimed ale house should hold itself to a higher standard.

I had their wrap and an appetizer which was fine if just typical sports bar food. Service from the wait staff was good, with only one bartender appearing to be a bit annoyed. I don't see why as the place was maybe half capacity.

It's not what I was expecting, and I'd likely not come back.

I tipped generously, knowing it was going to be the last time they would see me.
Good food, terrible service! For this I give 2 stars. Haven't tried the bar yet not much of a drinker but everybody seems happy with it, seems to be popular on Saturday nights

This place was alright. We only went here because we had a coupon. When we entered, we were given the choice of seating which was a plus. 

We started with the mini corndogs which were fresh out of the oven, but nothing special. Ordered the wings and didn't like them much. Got three different flavors, none of which I really liked, and they were not hot coming out of the kitchen. The ribs didn't taste very good and the bbq sauce didn't even cover the whole slab. The popcorn shrimp tasted fine but much better could be found elsewhere. The seasoned fries were cooked well, but lacked seasoning. For dessert, we ordered the apple crumble a la mode. That was actually pretty good even though the ice cream melted too fast. 

Overall, the service was really slow and our waitress didn't smile.  For our first time there, it wasn't really impressive. We probably won't be going back anytime soon unless we get another coupon.

We had family in town and were looking for a place to watch the Blackhawks, have a few beers and get lunch. Turned out we made a bad decision going to Bulldog Ale House. While the beer selection was OK, everything else about our experience was fair to bad. Drink orders were frequently screwed up, the food was bland at best and service was terrible. For example, someone in our group ordered a personal cheese pizza and got a meat lovers pizza instead. They apologized and brought out the correct pizza but it was drastically undercooked and inedible. Despite the plethora of mistakes, the manager was only willing to comp the pizza, saying, "that's all I can do." No, dude, you can do more. You can train your staff better, taste your own crappy food and at least pretend you want repeat business.

I love this place when it's slower. But if you come even when there's a hint of a dinner rush...forget about getting good service. Good drink specials and food is good, but all around the service ruins the experience

Third time is a charm?  This Ale House's predecessors Vangelo's couldn't cut it and Jade did not last long.  It will be interesting to see if Bulldog have what it takes to stick around.  Watch out Flip Flops, there's another bar on the strip.

Grand opening was on Feb 25, which I missed but heard they packed the house.  I came during the week to check out their happy hour menu that they advertised online.  The waitress didn't even offer me their specials and I had to ask for it.  Even then, she didn't really know what they offered for happy hour.  They also offer daily specials, which is included in the menu.  The $1 burgers on Monday sounds like a good deal!

The inside is very nicely decorated, spacious and clean.  They have both a dining area and a bar area.  There were 2 pool tables and some arcade games near the bar area.  The Ale House burger I ordered was tasty and came with a side of my choice, which was crinkled cut fries.

Service was the only downside to this place, but perhaps it'll get better once they get into the swing of things.

Two stars is being generous, and it's only because the food was pretty good and the bar tenders were attentive.  

We called ahead to ask if we could make a reservation for 10 people around 6pm, they said don't worry about it you'll be fine....fast forward 1 hr 15 mins we finally get a seat.  My friend tells the host/manager ? not sure who she was that she should get a free shot since it's her birthday and since we had to wait, the girl says Sure...but how about ALL your friends buy one and then I'll give you a free shot. Um, right. 

So, we order our food and it takes quite a while to come out and once it does 4 out of 5 of the people on my side of the table's orders were messed up- no chili on the fries, no sauce on the wrap, wrong sauce, NO sauce and I got 8 wings and a bonless one when I ordered 10 wings.  YIKES, not sure about how the other half of the table's came out.  One plus is when we pointed out the wing situation the girl we told did bring me a free beer. 

When we were wrapping up, tons of people kept coming to the table trying to get us to leave...but at the same time to buy more stuff.  We had planned to stay the night there, but after all that decided we were done.  I have no plans to frequent this establishment again. Get it together Bulldog!

I was pleasantly surprised with this place. Went with a group of 4 of us, and our baby on a Sunday afternoon. There were a good amount of people there. Our waitress was very attentive and sweet. Two in our party had the boneless wings, and thought they were very good. One had the burger and also gave it high regards. I had a chicken wrap and really enjoyed it. They had a bloody Mary special for $5 on Sunday, which was tasty. My only complaint was that the bloody Mary should have a pickle spear, instead of a pickle slice. Always a spear, people! But, I digress....
Overall, good food, good service, clean and great prices too. We will definitely be back!

Bulldog Ale House is not a bad place to spend some time for lunch or dinner. I spent Mother's Day here (sans mother, but with my brother and my wife) checking the place out.

In a sense, Bulldog is sort of a Tilted Kilt knockoff, but with short shorts or green skirts and less in-your-face cleavage. I got a Bulldog Burger, which has bacon, mushrooms, cheese, and possibly lettuce and tomato. It alleged to come with a bleu cheese sauce and hot sauce, but I don't remember the burger being hot or getting bleu cheese on the side. I did get onion rings, which were nice and crispy.

The burger itself was well cooked, and the bacon was a nice touch. It had a nice hint of charcoal, too. It's not the best burger in town, but I don't regret getting it.

My wife had a ham and pineapple pizza, which was every bit the definition of average. Thick, chewy crust, canned pineapple, ham of unknown origin with unassuming tomato sauce and cheese... it's not terrible, there just isn't anything "signature" about it.

My brother had fish tacos, which I didn't try, but the spiced mayo that went with it was quite good; something I wish I'd gotten with my onion rings.

Overall, I'd probably try this place again. Maybe I'll make a run at the nachos or wings next time, though.

I give it three stars but it has room to improve. Their servers are typical of the style restaurant. Personality is completely missing. I have not gone to drink at the bar yet but on 2 occasions have gone to eat. Each time was pretty much the same. Service was "Meh" food was good. 

I just think that the staff needs to work on their personalities and this place would be much better.

If you want to watch some sports this is a good place to go! They have a lot of TV's all around to watch and the prices don't seem too absurd to me.

So once again, 3 stars, but on their way to a fourth in my opinion.

I've been here a handful of times and every time it has been enjoyable. Read this review based solely on Thursday night specials however, since those are the nights I go to Bulldog Ale House.

Thursdays are awesome because it's $2 pint night! Any beer (or beer combination) is only $2! By beer combination I mean one of my favorite beers, the Black and Blue (half Blue Moon, half Guiness). Their boneless hot wings aren't half bad neither, and their kitchen is open fairly late.

Service here is not too bad, but, as mentioned before, this is based on Thursday nights, which are super busy. If you wish to find seating for your party, I suggest you show up a little early, although there is plenty of seating.

TV's, sports, beer, food, friends, need I say more?

I was in the area looking for some grub and I heard that Bulldog Ale House might have a decent beer selection.

I parked in the lot and thought I had scored a pretty good spot because it was right next to the patio.  Then I realized that the door is on the other side.  The walk didn't kill me, but I was puzzled for a second.

When I entered I was surprised to see that this was another bar with girls wearing short plaid skirts.  I had been to Tilted Kilt and was not particularly impressed.  I did not think my chances for good beer were good.  Girls hired for their looks and willingness to wear short skirts are not typically about the beer.  Don't get me wrong... I like pretty waitresses, but good service is still the most important thing

This place is big.  I was seated in an area just beyond the hostess station, and there were tables in all directions.  I didn't feel overly crowded.  There were far too many TVs, with one on practically every surface.  I guess people like that.  I don't.

There was no beer menu on the table, but I didn't know whether there was supposed to be one or not.  When the waitress stopped by, I asked what they had on tap with a preferance for something besides BMC.  She then realized I had no tap list and retrieved one from another table.  Leaving me to look it over, I noticed that there were indeed a few possibilities.  Rogue Dead Guy caught my eye for one.  There were also listings simply stating "Goose Island"  and "Leinenkugel ".  As soon as I started asking the waitress for some details on these selections, I realized that she knew nothing about beer.  Looking around at the other patrons, I noticed a lot of Bud Light.  What a shame.
So long story short, the Bulldog does have a few good beers on tap at a reasonable price per pint.  I sampled a few and despite being served in a Miller Lite glass, I don't have any real complaints about the beer.

I ordered some food.  It was typical bar food.  Nothing that stood out for me.  It wasn't great, it wasn't bad.

The service was fair.  Our waitress did not really seem to be trying.  She wasn't rude, but just because you are wearing a cute little outfit doesn't mean you can skip the personality.  In fact, I think it may even set the expectation that you are an outgoing person that may even like your job a little.  Sell the fantasy a little or go work at Denny's.  At least there I expect the waitresses to be wishing for death.

So overall, The Bulldog Ale House was big, clean and had some good brews.  The sports bar atmosphere was not quite my style and the pretty girls are a nice gimmick but not enough to make me rave about this place.  I might stop in again if I was in the area, but I wouldn't make this a destination.

This place is SO much better than Wild Bull.  Yes, they have the same menu, but the service here was amazing, and that is really important to me.  Lately, it seems as if service has gone downhill lately, and Bulldog Ale House goes above and beyond.

First of all, it was $1 burger night.  Yes, a $1 for a 1/4 lb burger.  AWESOME!  Mind you, it's not Kobe beef or anything, but it definitely gets the job done!!  We also ordered nachos, salad, fries (crinkle and seasoned) and the brownie bottom pie dessert.

All of the food was good!!  Especially the dessert (they were out of the apple dessert I wanted, though, so that was kind of sad, but the brownie made an acceptable substitute!).  The only strange part was that the nachos came out, and then our salads came out WITH the food.  So you were compelled to eat the salad while the fries got cold.  So that was a little strange.

Our server's name was Jordan, and she was SUCH a sweetheart!  Very attentive and friendly.  And a dirty dish never sat on our table for more than 10 seconds before it was whisked away, even if it was by the manager.  The manager was even very attentive--she was checking up on things, making sure the meal was good, etc.  You could tell she cared about the restaurant!

I will definitely be returning soon!!

Food is very good,  Try their Chicken Pot Pie,  it is to die for. I have never been dissatisfied with their food. My family comes here on different nights and on Saturdays. Service has alway been exceptional and the different managers have always been very attentive to our needs.  All in all,  I would  highly recommend this place to my friends and family.

This place is awesome and you can't beat the nightly specials. The food was fresh, drinks were cold, and the staff was friendly. This is a great location for happy hour, patio time, or a dinner with the family. Really enjoyed the Two Brothers on tap. I will be back soon!

Date of my visit: 21-October-2016
Time of my visit: Lunch

Well, I think, I have reviewed all, but one place in that strip.  I could not decide on what I wanted to have, so I figured I would go for a burger.

Well, I arrived, I was told to sit anywhere and the waitress came by promptly.  I have asked about the special and her recommendations.  She told me the burger were pretty good, especially chicken burger, any other day, I would have opted for that, but I had chicken yesterday and was not in the mood for it.  So ended up ordering Hawaiian Burger (it came with a pineapple on top and a side of BBQ sauce), I was sold.  I took homemade chips instead of fries.

Both my water and food arrived quickly.  Let me breakdown the chips first...  They were pretty good!  There were not stale (which is a case with a lot of place), nor oily (again a case with a lot of place), pretty good!  Now, on to the burger...  Oh boy...  Disappointing...  First, a piece of advise, when you offer pineapple on a burger, ring form is usually better than chopped...  Second, I get it's pricey to keep fresh pineapples in stock, but I can tell a difference between a shitty canned pineapple (which it was) vs. fresh pineapple...  The pineapple took away from the taste of the burger, which was not all that bad.  It was not anything over the top, but about what you'd accept from a bar burger.

The service was a bit inadequate as well, but friendly.  Barkeep was nice and either had a lot on her plate with the bar or was just short staffed, never had my water refilled, until I asked for a refill with my check.  I ended up going up to the bar to pay my check.

Overall a C-, could have been worse, chips and barkeep friendliness kept it from falling further down.

My co-workers and I finally got together and decided to try Flight Flops. the vibe was chill, but what we really liked were the pitchers. they only had two options-miller and Coors. we went through two pitchers before we called it a night. With a basket of cheese curds, each of our bill came out to $16 (including tip).
Stopped in for lunch. Food was pretty good.  No music, no sound on tv's so it was uncomfortably quiet.  Would have stayed for a drink after lunch, but was too weird to sit there in dead silence.

I like the free popcorn, the ladies tend to like this place, because it is more laid back, and serves more flavorful alcoholic beverages.

the chicken fingers are very good.  Pretty good food all around.  Pretty good specials as well.

We had our oldest daughter's first communion party at Flip Flop's.  Wow, what a great place to hold that event.  The staff was more than friendly and accommodating, and the food was great.  Prices were right, and the service was excellent.  They set the area up for our guests, let us bring in our own cake and cookies, and were so helpful.  The guests had a great time and really enjoyed the patio.  They really did a great job, and I would recommend Flop's for an event of that type 100 times over.

I was a big fan of their bottomless soup and salad but I was not a fan of the creepy people sitting at their video poker machines. Typical sports bar inside, with decent prices on decent food. We only went once because it was just okay and because we had a coupon. I would not eat here without a coupon.

Was there on a Tuesday night with a girlfriend. We walked in around 7:30 pm and there was maybe only about 5 people there. We sat at the bar and started looking at the drink menu. We were greeted almost immediately and since we weren't sure what we were having we asked for water. Bartender brings us the first and only waters of the night. Never refilled them, never asked if we wanted more, she just took our waters away after we finished. 
It was nice to see they have a variety of drinks and drink specials. My friend got the $3 Coronas and I had the $4 margarita, frozen. My rita didnt smell nor taste like one. I kept hoping it would get better so I ordered a total of 3. I really think the bartender made them virgin, no alcohol. 
The place was not busy but the bartender ignored us most of the time we were there. After we were done with drinks, rather than ask if we want another, she looked our way and went about her business, eating at the end of the bar! 
Not sure if the poor service was due to the fact that we aren't regulars, everyone else was waited on except us. A group of guys came in later and their beers were still kind of full and she was asking them if they were ready for another. My glass was completely empty, I pushed it away from me, she saw but didnt ask if I wanted another drink until like 10 min later. 
I will give them one more chance in the future and see if the service is better and I will NOT get the margaritas. The bar itself is ok, like that there is outdoor seating and its close to home. I  curious about the fruity drinks on the menu. 
Hopefully we miss last nights bartender who did nothing but stare us down, make weak drinks and stuff her face at the end of the bar.

I went back! still a-miss. 

Was miss charged for the garlic pretzel bites which were advertised as $3.99. Had a double burger for $2 which was well well well done (i guess you get what you pay for). my coworker found a piece of HARD Plastic in his burger! we were trying to have a value lunch yet my individual bill was $12!

There was music playing, but periods of 2-10minuts of silence in between songs.  

case closed, sorry Bob.
Awesome customer service, very friendly. The food and prices were great as well...loved having the TV's on every wall and the place just has a great vibe!

Came here for lunch. Immediately, upon walking in, I felt as though I was at a tiki bar in the tropics! The dcor and atmosphere is really fun! We sat indoors and had a wonderful view of the park across the street! It was not very crowded so you could hear every conversation from guests at the bar. Our waitress was nice but rather slow at greeting us or taking our order; however, she was also the only one working so we can't blame her. We got the pickle chips for an appetizer and they were excellent!! Our dad ordered the BLT wrap, my boyfriend got the burger with waffle fries on it, and I got the jerk chicken. Our food was okay, but nothing spectacular. The service was, again, friendly but extremely slow. I think having someone else step-in to help at the bar or delivering food would be a good idea when it gets busy and there's only one server. We may go back but not on the top of our list of places to go.
Not a big fan, the owner and the youngsters working there spent entirely too much time bullshitting and not serving the tables. Won't be going back.

My fianc and I came here to try it and enjoy the nice day. We sat outside which was nice, but we waited a while for everything. There was only one waitress for the patio so I understand the service may be slower, but the place was pretty dead. The waitress also kept asking us what we had ordered, which made the wait even longer! The food was horrible. We got the special, which was beer battered chicken fingers. They were super greasy and tasted like straight up beer. Not a place that I would go back to for food.....maybe just to hang out on the patio with some drinks.

Fun tiki feeling bar. Always has sports games and they have a big projector. Food is good. Typical bar food. My parents always go for Friday fish fry. The owners always seem to come over to say hi to my parents. The sever always seems to already know what my parents want to drink. They are all very friendly and care about their regulars. 
Much better atmosphere than Bulldogs.

Went in yesterday TERRIBLE SERVICE!! Granted she was a new server but definitely not ready to help tables by herself. After taking order came back to table with random food questions. Also couldn't get a drink order straight. After multiple times getting things mixed up enough was enough already. Either she isn't met for the food service industry or poor training. Then made a comment like wow when I asked her not to remove two appetizers from our table. Over all the service was terrible. Honestly wasn't my first time at Flip Flops but it was my Finances and he agreed we never go back.

Flip Flops is my favorite neighborhood bar & grill with fast, friendly service, good food and a great atmosphere!  I hosted a client appreciation event for my business here and everyone had a fabulous time!

I've been going here since the place opened.  The food is good.  We enjoyed the atmosphere when we went and the owners have always been nice.  The servers have been nice as well.  Two complaints with the place:  one: when you order food it seems to take a long time for your order to arrive and two: when they have music, it is almost always way too loud.  I think they may have fixed problem number one based on my recent experience.  My last order was almost delivered faster than I wanted.  I had an salad before my sandwich and the salad came very quickly and within a few minutes my sandwich was there too.  

Problem number two isn't a Flip Flops problem alone.  I get really tired of going to places to meet with friends and having to shout to make ourselves heard.  It might make some sense if the people in the place were dancing or something but everybody is sitting and trying to talk and these places seem intent on blasting out music.  I don't get that.  I recommend Flip Flops as a place to eat and hang out with friends.  You should try it.

This is a great local bar.  Flip Flops does a great job.  Come here if you're in the mood to watch sports, eat pretty good bar food, & drink beer/mixed drinks.  A jukebox, popcorn, live music, karaoke, in addition....

I really liked it here! 

We had a coupon so even though it was kind of a drive for us we wanted to give it a try. (And we saw they have fried pickles on the menu and we are big fans of fried pickles!) We went on a Wednesday night around 6:15. (It got a lot more crowded at 7:00 and on). 

This is a really cute place with a thatched hut bar and a beach-y wall mural. The bar is big and many people sat at it and ate and drank. They have high tables and low/regular tables. 

We were treated GREAT by Dion. She gave us excellent service and was down to earth and positive. We loved that they bring you free popcorn- that's a fun touch. 

The fried pickles were good- pickle chips- and a generous portion served with a side of ranch.

I ordered the bottomless soup and salad- it's $8.99. The salad came in a huge bowl and was way too much for me but very tasty- iceberg lettuce, carrots, radishes, green olives, hot peppers, and a delicious oil and vinegar dressing. I appreciated that it didn't have cheese on it. You can order any of their soups or chili and I was hoping to try several but the servings were so huge that I only tried two. I LOVED the chicken rice soup- it was creamy and comforting and tasted just as I hoped. I wish I lived or worked closer so I could order it regularly. I also tried the minestrone which Dion said is a favorite- it was also good but I was really too full to eat much of it. I think next time I'll see if the soup could be served in cups rather than bowls- then I could try their chicken noodle soup or chili too. The soups were impressive to me (although probably not what most people think of ordering at a place like this- I encourage you to try them!) 

My husband got a burger and thought it was pretty good but a little dry. The fries were on the thick side but he thought they were good. Next time he wants to try a wrap and the spicy chicken soup. 

They have a funnel cake fry dessert which sounded clever but we didn't try it. 

They seem to have a lot of food and drink specials here and also a lot of events. I bet this is a popular place for locals. I didn't feel like I was eating in a bar- rather a casual restaurant with great food. 

I have to say that I was struck with how clean the bathroom was! Spotless. 

I think there is a jukebox thing on the wall by the bar- I didn't try it but it's a cool addition. 

I was surprised to see that they had "live video gaming" in the restaurant- that kind of bummed me out as we left- seeing the gambling machines. I'm a therapist so sometimes have strong opinions about things that I've seen people struggle with. So I guess that's why I took one star off (and that my husband didn't love his burger). But for my food alone and the cute theme, free popcorn and Dion's great service I would have given Flip Flop's 5 stars.

I've only been to the tiki bar one time for the fish fry but my experience was pretty good as was the food. So I'd recommend the friday fish fry for sure, we had tender cod filets and coleslaw with hushpuppies all you can eat for $8.95. Most importantly it was very good, excellent breading , fish was very tender and not oily. I'll have to update my review once I try more items which I most definitely will

I live pretty close by to this place so it has been one of the first bars that was actually enjoyable to go to.  They have good food AND DRINK specials everyday.  If you sit at the bar you can get a little bit of better service, because you're right in front of the bartender.  Some nights they are so busy that unfortunately it takes awhile for your order to be taken, but the servers at least acknowledge your presence.  

The boyfriend and I go here a lot for the hawks games, and they make the night very enjoyable with ALL the t.vs including the larger projector screen with the game on, and the audio.  

Compared to other close bars I'd definitely pick this bar over them for the atmosphere.

Ok. It was a Saturday night. Not very busy. Service was slow. Food was alright but the drinks are overpriced and watered down! This is coming from a girl who gets buzzed from 1 Mikes Hard lemonade. The drinks were so small too. We ended up going to Applebee's shortly after and got drinks for the same price, were bigger and had more alcohol in them!

Umm...when they say they have a mixed drink bucket special and I imagine a bucket filled with bottled mixed drinks like they have in the picture...I am quite taken aback when the waitress literally brought out a small bucket filled with liquid.  No wonder she gave us a weird look when we said we were going to share...awkward...

The drink itself was pretty good (light and fruity) and surprisingly strong.  The popcorn helps curb my appetite while I waited for dinner.  The music plays too loudly.  The food is okay.  The  Caribbean-themed decor isn't as inviting as I would have thought.

They have outdoor seating during the summer, so that's kinda nice.

I love this bar for 2 reasons 1) the staff. They are always pleasant.  Stacy is an amazing server. The manager is always present and making sure food and drinks are correct and were happy with them. 2) the atmosphere. You dont get the typical 21 year old atmosphere like you get across  the street. Good music, nice people, fun tiki bar theme. They put all the local sports games on the many tvs they have. If you like a local bar with good prices and a great atmosphere...flip flops is your place.

I like Flip Flops a lot in the summer, mostly because I love to sit outside and enjoy a meal and some drinks. The food at Flip Flops has been progressively getting better and more diverse which I love, however I still think that they are overpriced on their drinks. 

The fact they have never had weekend drink specials floors me. I worked at a bar for several years and that is the biggest day for specials, you have more of a draw, especially now with competition from Bulldog Ale House right across the street.

So food I would say 4 stars, Drinks prices 3 stars and the service 3 stars as well.

iVE LIVED IN CAROL STREAM MY WHOLE LIFE YET MOVED ABOUT TWO YEARS AGO. When I do come back to my parents to visit i always try to stop inn this bar, for many reasons. The owners are always the first ones to get off there seat to say hi! The food is amazing here (chicken ceaser wrap) to die for! But most of all the Bar tender Megan who works there always knows you when you walk in always with a smile and makes you feel welcome and wanting to come back. You cant find that alot now adays and its great too see everytime I go home she continues to do so! I will always continue to go here and what a great bar it is!!

I stopped here for lunch on a rainy Thursday. The place was empty, so ample seating was available and service was outstanding. The menu is typical pub fare. Burgers, wraps, sandwiches,  pizza. They have food and drink specials every day. I read through their mixed drink menu and like the variety. One would be able to find something tasty to drink to suit any taste. This is no Hala Kahliki, but a pretty decent drink menu. Portion sizes were pretty good too.  Food was on par for pub food. Nothing amazing, but good.  I would most definitely come back for some tropical drinks after work, or to try their outdoor patio.

The wife and I stopped in for a bite. It wasn't busy yet the service was slow. Also, don't ask me how I want my burger (medium) if you are just going to cook it however you want (well). I never leave fries, but these fries had to be recooked in old oil. Yuck.

I've been here twice.  The first time I went with two friends on a Thursday evening and it was a great time.  Other than us, there were only about 4 or 5 other people there, all sitting up at the bar.  Our service was very quick and the waitress was very friendly and attentive.

After having such a good first experience, I took my girlfriend there.  It was the Friday before St. Patrick's Day, so we were expecting it to be pretty busy, simply because they do sell booze.  When we got there, it was filled with a lot of bigger parties, but we managed to find the last two-top open, near the entrance.  It took about 15 minutes before anyone came up to acknowledge us.  Once our waitress took the drink order, she was very fast at coming back with it, so that was nice.  But then, it was about another 20-30 minutes before anyone else walked past our table.  I had finished my beer in that time, so I actually walked up to the bar to get my second drink from the bartender, who was also busy, but doing a great job of managing all her bar patrons.

A gentleman, who I believe was a manager, came by the table and asked how things were.  He was the first person to come by us since our waitress had brought our drinks nearly a half an hour earlier.  We were able to place our food orders with him and he must have said something to our waitress because she was much more attentive after that.

To be fair to the waitress, from what I saw, there were only two servers, one bartender, one busser, and this manager working the entire front.  Being that the entire place was filled, they didn't do a bad job.  But I would hope that management would better prepare for the future.  Not sure if this was an unusually busy night that caught them off guard, but it's St. Patrick's Day weekend...you should expect to be pretty busy (even though you're not an Irish pub) and bring in extra staff to handle to high capacity.

The beer selection is pretty good.  The food, while creatively described on the menu, is nothing really special.  Not bad, but nothing I am craving the next day.  However, the prices are pretty decent.

Five stars for the bar atmosphere. Probably best in the afternoon, early evening for the laid back mellowness with solid drink prices/specials and a good selection. The staff was friendly and worked hard but...the food was close to awful. I had a burger that literally tasted like soap. My wife wasn't jumping for joy with the chicken sandwich either and the nachos were mediocre agreed to hit this place again after an afternoon of golf at Glendale Lakes but not for the dinner fare. Overall though, I'd tell you to go ahead and give this place a go and decide for yourself!
I've been a local since this place opened, seen 2 bars close across the street as these place strives.  Great owners, bartenders, and overall a pleasure!  Weekends are normally hoppin'!!

A great, local, family owned business. They have an extensive tropical drink menu, awesome food, friendly staff. The set up gives you a vacation feel and has a beautiful patio. Prices are more than reasonable and great drink specials. Also it's SO clean, which is SO important.

The patio is fun in the summer and they usually have cool specials. The food leaves something to be desired, but overall this spot is a good place to meet a small group of friends, just maybe plan to get dinner before hand.

ZZzzzZZzzz..........

This place is an absolute bore. I really would love to know what I am missing about this place..It always seems packed, I just don't get it.

The drinks are horrible, they are ridiculously over priced, the bartenders are rude, the food sucks, it's constantly over crowded because they let too many people in at a time, and it's so loud in there you can't even think straight, let alone order a friggen drink!

So, If you don't get the chance to come here, don't feel bad, your really not missing much, your saving yourself the hassle and headache. There are other bars around the area that are much cheaper and a lot more fun. 

Cheers! :)

How do you spell indigestion?  F-L-I-P  F-L-O-P-S

The drinks,oh darn,  I can't swear right?  ......The drinks are terrible.  If you want alot of sweet taste, without any booze this is the place.

The food is meh.

Outside of that, our waitress was great and the atmosphere is cool.

A girlfriend of mine came here for last week's Hawk's playoff game.  It was an ok place to watch the game.  Fun atmosphere, but the service was subpar.

My friend and I sat down at the only available table left--score!  We picked out what we wanted to start off with to drink right away based on the specials posted above my friends' head.  And then we waited...and waited...and waited some more.  Finally after about 20 minutes of no service, I went to the bar to order....and then I got ignored there for about 5 minutes.  Meanwhile, our waitress finally came over.  We ordered our drinks, and luckily, they came out very quickly.

We got the "Jamaican Me Crazy" rum bucket for $10.50 on special.  It was delicious and the run hit you HARD after that, so it was definitely a generous pour.  They know how to make a good drink here!

The food that we ordered (pretzel and fries) were typical bar food and did their best to soak up the alcohol!

Maybe the service would be better had there not been a game on...but really, in Chicago, when is there NOT a game of some sort on!?

After reading the other Yelp reviews, I was skeptical about going here. It wasn't as terrible as I thought it would be. The drink I got was very sweet as well as very weak. I also tried my mothers Martini and it was also very sweet, tasted like pure sugar, again as if no alcohol was in the drink. 

I got a Buffalo Chicken wrap. It was pretty good. It was your standard wrap though, nothing spectacular. The atmosphere was really cool. The bar was nice, it was a tiki hut. Pretty Cool. Our waitress was pretty nice too.

Grabbed two appetizers to go recently -

Pretzel bread with beer cheese dip - yuck
Jalapeno mozzarella sticks - yum

Popcorn machine with free popcorn
Weekly specials that are okay. nothing spectacular.
nice atmosphere with okay prices.
food is okay too nothing too amazing

I've been here a few times and everytime I go I'm less impressed. The atmosphere is ok. The service is ok. The drinks are weak, too sweet and a little pricey but thats ok, and the food is ok. I don't know if I'll go back there. There just seems to be too many other options that at least do one thing exceptionally or at least a hell of a lot better than Flip Flops does.

I love flip flops!! Okay, so sure the food is not the best, but the overall service beats their competitor across the street. What is it again?  Bullfrogs?? Flip Flops drinks are awesome. And they occasionally run really good specials on them too. The over all ora is nice. Sometimes their bands are too loud. And service has slightly gone down hill since they first opened. But overall I like it here!!

Pretty good place to check out if you live in the area. 

The service is friendly and the food/drink isn't at the price of "Suburban Rip-off" just yet. This is a tiki-type place (bar is a gigantic grass hut) that has island inspired type menu and drinks available. I've had the Friday fish fry and find worth a try. The Blue Moon outta the tap always kinds of tastes funny to me but let me know what you think. I found the pizza to be pretty tasty. 

Place gets a decent crowd in it for the area. Wednesday I believe is karaoke night and was a pretty good time. I saw one live act (I think they have a couple per week) that sang hits of old and new that I really liked. 

I haven't gotten really loaded here even though even its pretty close to my house, but it's on my list of to-do's.
Good burgers.  Cheap beer.
Atmosphere was pleasant until crew of douchebags invaded patio.

OMG hold the attitude please. Went here for the first time last night with my boyfriend. Being our first time we needed to look over the menu but were attacked by mamma meannie our waitress the second we sat down. When we didn't know our drink order her green tentacles were quickly extended and followed by the look of death. When she came back foaming at the mouth we decided we better order quickly or she was going to send us to the chamber of death. I ordered the cheese fries and my boyfriend ordered the jalapeno cheese stix for Appetizers. I must admit the jalapeno cheese stix were quite tasty and almost as hot as the fire that was breath out mamma meannie. The cheese fries were also good and had ample amounts of cheese. For dinner we each had an individual pizza. These pizzas are small. Seriously don't order this alone and expect to be full. My other complaint is getting a refill on a soft drink is harder then winning the marathon on two broken feet. If you have beer they are right on top of refills but if you have a softdrink better step aside. All in all the service here was the biggest let down. The food was ok and probably worth 3 starts but the service is some of the worst I have ever had. Should have checked Yelp before going here!!!

My husband and I went here last night after 8:00.  It was not crowded at all, but what do you expect for a Tuesday night.  Anyway, it should be more crowded.  The atmosphere is very nice and the food was delicious.  It is such a cute place, very festive and makes you want to go to the Caribbean - cute tiki bar inside.  They start you off with some complimentary popcorn, which we found to be a nice change of pace.  We ordered some sort of garlicy bread appetizer which the waitress recommended.  It was really good and the price was reasonable.  Kudos to her for that recommendation.  I ordered the unlimited soup and salad for $8.99.  The salad was huge - I couldn't eat it all.  For the soup I was given a choice of a cup or a bowl.  I chose a cup because I wanted to try several.  I started with the chili - it was quite good.  Unfortunately, after that I was full so I couldn't try the rest.   Also came with some fresh buttered breadsticks!  My husband ordered "flippy's dinner salad"  (name could be wrong) with added popcorn shrimp.  Again, the portion size was huge and he couldn't eat it all either.  They were extremely generous with the popcorn shrimp.  The service was great. This also  would be a nice place to watch a game.  They have quite a few tv's including a big screen.  They also have drink specials for the game and other specials as well, including a really good burger special.  There is an outdoor eating area too, away from the street which would be nice for lunch or dinner.  We often go to bulldogs, but this was a nice change of pace.  I often see coupons for this place - check it out!

Flips Flops is perfect on a hot summer day. Their patio is great if you want to kick back and down a rum bucket (or two). The pizza is okay. Macaroni & cheese bites are good when they actually cook them all the way. $10 for the rum bucket isn't a bad price. The projection screen tv inside would be better if it was actually a dark bar and you could see what was on the screen. They'd be better off getting a flat screen. All in all not a bad little spot to grab some appetizers and a drink or two.

As promised, we made a return visit with another couple.  This time, it was a Friday evening and we ordered entrees.  The food was excellent.  Two of us had chicken sandwiches, the other two enjoyed burgers.  Mine was so delicious that I actually cleared my plate -- a rare event for me.  The chicken was cooked perfectly and had a lot of solid seasoning.  The bun was fresh and the fries were tasty.  

The wait staff was attentive and the bar was pretty busy -- not packed but definitely hopping.  It will be interesting to see how well the clientele holds up in the winter months.

Went there for the 1st time last night around 7:30pm ... For early on a Saturday night the place wasn't too packed but still had a decent sized crowd, with people streaming in all the time.  My GF and I sat ourselves to a table and quickly had someone come over and give us menus and get our drink orders in.  

The food & drink prices weren't expensive, and were inline with what you'd expect from such a place ($8-9 for a sandwich/burger).   I'd have to say the service was really good & friendly(maybe because it wasn't crazy crowded yet?) ... our waitress came over to our table several times to check up on us and see how everything was.  She even offered to reheat our appetizer after we had gotten our meals.  

We got the artichoke/spinach dip appetizer, which came with plenty of chips and a good amount of dip.   I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich - good, but a bit overwhelmed by the spicy sauce and my GF got the burger with pineapple, she liked it and normally she's a bit picky.

Negatives - I could see parking being a problem (but wasn't that night) and I'm not a fan of the whole Jimmy Buffet thing, so music-wise I would put something else on the jukebox.

Will definitely give this place another visit!!

Been here a few times and every single time I have LOVED it. Maybe it is the friendly, down to earth service, the delicious food (my mouth is watering just thinking about it), or the great, affordable drinks. Or maybe it is the fantastic and calming atmosphere. Flip Flops is a great place for a group of friends to come by for a casual night out or during the day for some great food.

I recommend their BBQ Hawaiian Burger! Delicious. Best I have ever had, hands down.

Stopped in for some appetizers on the way home, and sat outside. Decor inside is nice, the outdoor seating area is perfect. I really enjoyed the boneless wings.

Service was good, the food was hot, and the entertainment calendar there was full of events and stuff to do for the entire month - I'll probably come back.

Let me start by saying that I have been looking forward to the opening of this local bar for MONTHS. Their opening was delayed by over two months but no explanation as to why. I hope they didn't miss the mark. 

I went last week on Monday night, hoping to beat the MNF crowd. I went with a large group and a few kids. We did get a table right away, but a roll of the eyes from the waitress when we asked to put two tables together. She did move it and her attitude did improve a little. We ordered a multitude of food, including burgers, kids meals for the little ones, some beer and milk for the kids. I also ordered some wings as appetizers. 

A few minutes later the waitress came back and apologized that they didn't have any milk, but they were running to get some, which was fine. That was one big plus for me. The owner/manager even came over and apologized which was a nice touch. Then it went downhill. The wings never came (I wasn't charged either so they were never ordered to begin with). My medium burger was charred, as was everyone else's. There was no ketchup to be found. They have those little 6 packs on the table to hold utensils and condiments and the three tables nearest didn't have any either. The waitress came back with one that was about 1/8th full. The milk did arrive safe and sound. 

I substituted onion rings for fries which were great. The men ordered the burger with BBQ sauce and "onion rings" on it but were sad to find out there was only one ring per burger. The men also complained that the TVs were too small and not enough of them for a football crowd on the weekends.

Overall, I was not impressed. I know they spent a lot of time working on the painting of the interior and the bar (which look like copies of any Jimmy Buffett bar between here and Key West), but I wish they would have spent more money on their food quality. I think the burgers would have been a lot better had they not been burned. All 4 were charred and not tasty. 

I think if you were purely going into the bar to drink rather than dine and you like the laid back atmosphere of the tropics and don't expect too much out of that type of bar, you won't be upset. However, if you are going to eat, stay away from the burgers until they get them done right. 

I'll go back and try something else next time and hopefully it'll be a better experience.

ETA: We went again, this time on a Sunday afternoon during football. The burger was still horrible. Burned on the outside and raw on the inside. My husband had the pizza and said it was bland and somewhat cold. 

I hope they get a better cook before summer comes. Otherwise, I won't go there to eat again. 

It'll be awhile before I go back there.

I came in here with some friends around 2 pm on a weekday, and it wasn't busy at all. There were a couple of people leaving after the regular lunch hour.
