The decor looks nice but really just your regular jimmy buffett type place. We placed our order and was offered free popcorn, which i thought was weird. For some reason, my friends and i lost track of time and 30 minutes later we realized we didn't even get our food. I guess our waiter's shift changed and he decided to sit at the bar while a new waitress asked if we wanted to order anything. What the hell.. ?! She asked our waiter what was going on and oops, he forgot to place the order. So you think your order would get comp'd right? No. Free drinks is all? I'm going to Cheeseburger in Paradise..

On the recommendation of my BF, who had been there before, we made the trek out to Flip Flops in Bloomingdale last night...mostly because he knew they had a nice patio area and it was a gorgeous night. When we got there around 7:15, the patio was understandably full. However, my wise & observant BF had noticed that there was a table outside that happened to be 2 smaller tables pushed together and only 2 people were seated there. So he made a simple request to the waitress handling the patio area that maybe they could seperate one of the tables. She abruptly brushed us off, could not be bothered with the request and was not interested in accomodating us. We were a little caught off guard by the treatment but  were unwaivering in our perservance. We headed back inside to find a table where we were thoroughly ignored by the waitstaff and after 10 minutes of waiting patiently, stomachs growling, we walked out. Never having been there before they certainly put a bad taste in my mouth. I was really looking forward to trying their drinks & their pretzel bread & cheese dip & their Toucan chicken sandwich...Big disappointment! Anyway's Pub by the mall ended up getting our business last night. They had $4 martinis! Don't know if we'll want to attempt to be served at Flip Flops again...it might take some serious convincing...

This is a cute little resturant/bar. Every time I have been in here the food has been decent and the staff attentitive. Also I should add that most times I am in here are not during peak times and the resturant is usually mostly full. The TV's can be a bit loud and the last time I was in here my friend and I ended up leave as soon as we finished eating to go somewhere else a little more quiet so we could actually chat.

I have gone to Flip Flops several times over the last 3 months and must say this is by far my favorite restaurant/bar!  I have tried almost everything on the menu and have been extremely satisfied with everything. 

They have a very large selection of appetizers. The boneless wings were large, meaty and the sauce was very tasty with just the right amount of spice. The nachos were huge (I could have had them for a meal) with lots of toppings. The jerk chicken is to die for! The bean dip, beer cheese, and onion rings are very good, but my favorite are the Fire Crackers.

The burgers are HUGE (almost too big), 10 ounce Angus beef and have been cooked exactly the way I wanted each time I ordered. The pizza was very good with just the right crust, not too crisp, not too chewy. The chicken sandwich is also very good, a large chicken breast with lettuce, tomato and mayonnaise (I prefer it with the honey mustard sauce).

The servers and bartenders were all very nice, friendly and polite. The food and drinks were all served in a timely manner with a smile!

The atmosphere is what I like best. All of the bar is built with real bamboo and thatch roof. The tables were all hand made with various inlaid carvings. The wall sconces, signs, and  hangings give it a very cozy, laid back feel. The two wall size murals were custom painted and give a Caribbean feel which is nice in the middle of Chicago's cold winter! There are T.V.'s in every corner of the restaraunt/bar, and a large screen on one wall. I was able to get the T.V. station changed to the program i wanted to watch with one simple request. The juke box holds over 30,000 songs, and the place really gets hopping on Friday and Saturday nights. I can't wait for summer to enjoy the beer garden which is just next to and across the street from Carol Stream's parks. The restrooms are very nice, neat and clean.  

The owners are extremely nice. They genuinely seem to care about all their customers and would go out of their way to make sure your visit is a satisfactory one.

The prices are all very reasonable. 

Overall I'd say this by far my best restaurant experience, and I will definitely be coming back again and again!

This is an OK place if you want to stop in midday and have a drink. Food is average at best. Waitress was nice but lost in space... Poor thing kept running trying to give service to everyone but the bottom line is that she is not very organized.

Date of my visit: 17-November-2016
Time of my visit: Lunch

A buddy of mine recommended I try this place.  So today, I figured I would give it a shot today for lunch.

I ordered fried chicken dinner with two sides.  I was not sure which sides I wanted, so they helped me choose.  I ended up getting mashed potatoes and coleslaw, but they also gave me some corn!  I decided to eat inside.

After I paid, I got my food and started eating.  I ate the mashed potatoes and corn first.  A combo was pretty delicious.  Coleslaw was good as well.

I had my chicken last.  I must say, it probably was one of the best fried chicken I have had.  For me, it's all about the skin.  There are so many ways to f* it up.  Usually, the skin is rough, but not this one, the skin was soft and did not feel fried. It was excellent!

Overall A+!  The service was also friendly.  I would highly recommend it.  I'll try to be back for some ribs.

What a joke. There was a couple people waiting in front of me.  Waited 25 minutes to get my food and the amount of people behind me kept piling up. I'm assuming it was the owner, "forgot" to put in the mac and cheese.... That's one way to be passionate about your own business. There was no rush to get together the orders. The workers seemed like they were having a better time talking to each other than doing their job. 

The fried chicken was mediocre, small pieces. Not worth the price i paid for a family meal. Small sides.

I have gone to Priscilla many times.  I have bought food there for my coworkers and myself. My coworkers have raved about the great jerk chicken, I rave about the oxtail. I've also had their catfish which delicious. My favorite is the collard greens. Basically all their food is great.  They are 1 minute away from my house which is convenient, but a problem because I would eat there every day and gain sooooo much weight, lol.

I grew up in the south on the foods offered here. I was so excited to finally find a place to get real food, that we drove all the way from Naperville to get it. It was the worst food I have had maybe ever. Cold catfish that tasted like it was fried the week before, there were two slivers of peaches in the peach cobbler and the saddest of all - they ruined banana pudding which is my absolute favorite and the deciding factor in driving all that way. They charged as much as a nice sit down restaurant to to stand and order and eat of paper plates with plastic utensils.
If you are craving soul food, this is the place to go! My favorites are the turkey, fried chicken, mashed potatoes, and mac and cheese.
The food was delicious. The staff was friendly, cordial and polite. The restaurant was clean. Plenty of parking and good location. Price is reasonable.

We went mid-week. Everyone loves something that they had, most people loved everything they had. Unusual menu items classically Southern classically  soul food. They seem to have a booming carryout business. We dined in. It was fine, clean.. I will definitely return and have told many people about it so far.  A gem in this neck of the woods.

My fried chicken was great and my husbands smothered pork chops were the best pork chops I've ever tasted. We had a bit of a wait while they were making more chicken. I appreciated that it was approaching closing time and I had deliciously fresh chicken at a buffet. The service was great and much appreciated!

Can a person walk in to just buy some food without getting dirty glares ?. Also I would like if your employee's were a bit more friendly to the customers instead of talking to one another and yelling " What !? " when someone tries to get their attention to get serviced. The decor in your establishment seriously needs to be updated very soon.

Well after several tries (4 times ) I have to leave a very negative review. I won't be back .  Visited Saturday night and brought the hubby this time. 
I ordered the fried chicken and again was really disappointed . My pieces were so dry, and wings were so small, practically had no meat on them. The pieces obviously sat for some time.  Corn was just out of a can nothing special. Corn bread again, just ok.  Besides being very pricey. 
The food being so disappointing again was not the reason I don't want to go back though primarily.  
I needed a carry out container and as I stood in line for that a lady brought her plate back up to the counter after having already been seated and her party had started eating. She informed the cashier/ server that she did not get her correct order... She asked for thighs or legs ( not sure ) but had been given wings.  The server apologized and then proceeded to remove wings from lady's plate and put them back in the serving tray... I was appalled !!  Any other restaurant would have thrown the 2 wings out ... And Not used the same tongs to mix them back into the tray that would be used to sell to others. I don't know if the woman ate them or not, seasoned them or not , or touched, spit or sneezed on them ( ok that's extreme and I'm probably sure she didn't ) but still I was just really surprised she recycled them ... 
I really wanted to love this place, but I just can't.

I had the fried chicken dinner with mashed potatoes and collard greens. The food tasted very good but the service was poor. I ordered and paid for 2 extra pieces of chicken but the server did not put them in the bag. I didn't notice till I got home and was too tired to drive all the way back. Let the buyer beware.

Alright this place is amazing. If you want some good ole fashioned stick to your ribs comfort food check this place out. 

The establishment itself is clean and well kept. It's a cafeteria type system when it comes to ordering your food. The line works well though and you aren't in there very long. They are closed Monday's and Tuesdays so keep that in mind. 

Now the food. Good lord the food! This is the definition of soul food and I'm really surprised this place doesn't get the amount of attention it should. I usually go with the mixed fried chicken (white/dark) with two sides and corn bread. The fried chicken is fresh, crispy, and just tastes homemade. The sides are incredible you won't go wrong with whatever you choose. The mac n cheese is incredible. The mashed potatoes are perfect and the gravy has a little kick to it. My mouth is watering just typing this but then again I'm heading there now! 

Check this place out. The five stars are justified here.
Love this place but they have horrible employees. I had a couple of girls given me dirty looks callin my father my sugar daddy each time their boss walked away. Pathetic.

Love Priscilla & her food. Best friend chicken in town. & the sides are wonderful as well. My favorites are yams, Turkey greens and lima beans. The fish is AMAZING too! My boys (14 & 7) favorite place to eat. Any family visiting us in the burbs always request Priscillas. Must try!

This place is awesome !!! 
Seafood gumbo and cat fish were outstanding, the servers were nice and friendly. I will defiantly be going back.

Caution: This is good enough to eat every day but it is definitely not food you should consume daily. 

Here's some additional pre-review advice: Pack a pillow or a huge caffeinated drink for the trip back home. You will be in a food coma if you manage to finish this hearty meal. 

Every now and then I find myself desirous of something you rarely find in most restaurants. Inexpensive, flavorful veggies and something fried just right. At one time, I thought I would have to drive to the south part of the city to eat this good. Lucky for me, I can bask in this type of goodness close to the nest. 

Priscilla's is near and dear because it is seriously akin to a Sunday dinner at my grandparents place. Fried food, items smothered in gravy and lots of starches. That said, I grew up feasting like this regularly and indulging on occasion, reminds me of them and they wonderful conversations during those meals. 

Admittedly, it has taken me a few visits to remember the need to share this great find.  I have tried the mac n cheese, fried chicken, fried fish, smothered chicken, collard greens with turkey, collard greens with pork, green beans, corn, candied yams, cornbread and cabbage (over several visits of course). I seriously enjoyed every single item but if obliged to choose, I would say the fish, collard greens and candied yams are my favorites.  

Each dinner comes with 2 sides and cornbread which means in 2-3 visits you can easily have tried as many things as me. 
Happy Eating!!!!

Stopped in to grab a bite on Valentine's day. My husband and I received a very friendly welcome.

Pros:
- Collard greens were delish
- Smothered pork chops were tasty
- Portions are nice and large
- They try to make things fresh for you when items are out
- Very friendly!!!!!

Cons:
- Can get costly quick
- I am a spaghetti connoisseur & this didnt meet my standards
- They might run out of fresh items if you come to late

Next time Ill come in and try their fried chicken!

I absolutely love this place and I live in Ohio. The food taste like my mother herself cooked it. The staff is friendly. The restaurant is very spacious. Whenever I'm anywhere near Hillside, IL I have to have Priscillas, in fact I was in Milwaukee and drove over to Priscillas to get some. Now that's love. Did I mention that I love this place. If you want real down south touch your soul food then this is the place to go.

The best Southern cooking in town.  Have been several times with the husband and we both loved every meal. Fried chicken is excellent as are ribs. Sides are amazing,  always get the greens, plus sweet potatoes,  Mac and cheese, green beans, or cole slaw, they are all great. Did not love the potato salad as it was more mashed than chunky. Pecan pie is a great dessert to spilt.  We also sometimes split an entree plus a 4 sides plate, or Scilla Size up to an extra side,  drink,  and dessert.  You just can't go wrong here.

One of the worst service I have seen in a very long time! Been here for almost 30 minutes waiting for my to go order. What takes so long the food is ready? The women who work here have a horrible attitude.

This place is great! I love soul food, especially Southern soul food. How anyone could criticize the fried chicken is beyond me. I have not yet tried any of the other entres, but the oxtails on Thursdays are very tempting. The fried chicken is wonderfully spiced, obviously not frozen, and made just like someone would make it down-home. The candied yams are the most incredible I have ever tasted, and you can even taste the molasses in them. They are just exactly how they should be. The corn is corn, and you can't say too much about that. The mac & cheese is obviously not for the box, and it's very tasty. The cornbread is good, but I'm usually too full from everything else to really enjoy it. I always enjoy going to the counter because they've always got something nice to say and really smile at you, which you don't see very often anymore. I would recommend this place to everyone looking for a real southern food experience. Whether you carry out or eat in, you'll be more than satisfied, and I guarantee you'll go back.

Although I have written a fair share of Yelp reviews with a true and ultimate Italian spin, what can I say about Priscilla and her cannot be missed soul express? Oh soul-la-mio, is what I can say!

From its come hither lighting, to its friendly wait-while-we-pack-it service, to the friendliest workers complete with hair nets, what is not to like? It's also super clean. 

It matters not what night of the week you intend to stop in. The food is fresh, plentiful, and offers countless choices to mix and match the soul food sampler of your dreams.

When my niece is in from college, we always get 2 dinners to go. Her fave: the baked chicken with olde time corn bread stuffing, and the 'greens'. Ya gotta try the greens.

For moi: the fried chicken, not greasy and covered with spices, with candied yams, and green beans. 

Each night of the week, the menu entrees and desserts change, based on availability. And speaking of dessert; the coconut cake with light pineapple filling should not be missed; we also swear by the bread pudding.

Whether it is take out or dine in, you will not be disappointed. Priscilla's wonderful take on down home, deep country, good ole comfort food is the ultimate.

I lived in Memphis for two years and enjoyed some southern cooking. This was the first time I had southern-style food since moving north 8 months ago. 

A strange hankering for fried chicken prompted me to get a fried chicken meal (3 pieces with 2 sides and cornbread) to go. I am sorry to say the meal was pretty dismal. The fried chicken (breast, drumstick and a very small piece of thigh) had soggy skin and a few feathers from the bird still remained on the thigh. The skin was salty and the breast meat very very dry. The red beans were salty and the candied yams were sickeningly sweet (which is not unusual for candied yams though). 

Everything was pre-cooked and sitting under heat lamps at dinner time, including the fried chicken. 

I can take a great tasting meal at the expense of my waistline or heart health once in a while but a bad meal ain't worth risking nothing.

Priscilla, sweetheart, you should really pay a visit to Peggy or Alcenia down south.

It should be called Priscilla's soul side's restaurant . The food  is good but the amount of meat you get for the money is pathetic. Somebody call the cops cause when I get my cafeteria plate I feel like I've been robbed !  I've Been here several times because the food is delicious. I've had just about everything on the menu , and it's fabulous! A main course , two sides and a drink -almost 20$ . Short ribs are fabulous, I want the main dish to be the star of the show and the sides to compliment it . I had the smothered chicken ,,, Delicious,, but the baby wing and the miniature thigh wasn't enough for a man , women or child . I want to give her more stars because it's so good , but when l leave the restaurant, I want to be full . Oh yea ,,I really like Priscilla , she's sweet and cooks great food  . Show me the BEEF !!!!!

Let's see....

Convenient location...CHECK!
Tasty SOUL food....CHECK!
Quick service....CHECK!
Friendly staff....CHECK!

Can't ask for anything more.

Great place, Great food! It should be there matto. I had the beef short ribs with mac and cheese, candied yams, and collard greens with turkey- everything was excellent! i am surely going back here. It is yummy for all your soul food needs!
We love this place. The chicken is excellent, the sides are delicious, the people are friendly and it's always spotless.

I had the fried chicken with cornbread, Mac and cheese, and coleslaw. The Mac and cheese and the chicken were extremely dry. The coleslaw was sub par to the kind you can get at a jewel osco store. The worker had extremely long painted nails, in which she did not wear gloves when handling food. (Sanitary hazard) 

It may have been one of those off days for this restaurant but I don't think I'll be coming back again.

This place is over rated they say the fried chicken is the best. But all I saw was dried chicken that looked like it was cooked from lunch and sat there all the way to dinner under a heat lamp.

I asked the cashier what was the best there and all she did was read the menu to me . If I wanted the menu read to me I could read it myself I just wanted to know but she recommended and all she gave me was a blank stare so I ended up ordering the last thing she said which was jerk chicken with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese.
 
The mashed potatoes were good can't screw that up.

The mac and cheese was really hard on the top and that part was uneatable. I ended up eating just the bottom half and throwing away the top. What a waste of money.
 
The Jerk Chicken was not jerked but chicken with jerk sauce on the side. The chicken was moist and delicious and was the only redeeming quality of this visit. The jerk sauce was way too peppery and hot it was mostly peppers and just a little bit of the other stuff to make it jerk sauce and I ended up not eating the jerk sauce and having the grilled chicken alone and if I order the grilled chicken alone it would have saved me a dollar what a waste that's two dollars now I wasted.
 
Overall this place is overrated then I will not be going back again because there are better places right next to it.

Pricilla's was close to home and we were curious about the 'soul food' since I haven't seen a lot of places around here that offered that type of cuisine.  Since it was Friday we picked from the specials which I thought were reasonably priced.  I personally had the seafood gumbo and it was delicious and the perfect amount of food.  Everyone else ordered the fried catfish.  They said it was delicious and they each came home with enough food for another meal.  You go to the counter to order your food and you pick it up like a fast food chain, but the quality of food is much like grandma's home cooking.  I would go there again.  I would like to try other items on the menu and I am glad this gem is so close to home.

This place is incredible!!!!!! Food is always hot fresh, and never greasy!!! Reminds me of home!!!!! The ladies are sweet and friendly!!!!! I will never stop coming to priscillas or priscillas ultimate!!!!! I only wish they were open on Mondays and Tuesdays too but I won't complain ;-)

Went in here today with my lady, and we both got the catfish with 2 sides. My lady got macaroni and cheese for both sides, and I got turkey greens/ macaroni for my 2 sides. The food was out of this world delicious. Exactly how I expected it to taste, being Priscilla's.  The food is a bit pricey, but then again they use quality ingredients to create a quality product. For my lady and my meal plus a drink it was 30$. This is home made food in a convenient setting, not fast food. Do not be surprised to pay a bit for the quality, but you will thank the cook on the way out. Real soul food. Keep it up Priscilla's! Glad yall finally got an express spot open.
Great Soul Food. Short Ribs are marvelous. As are the Collards and Sweet potatoes. Everything's good!

There are two locations. The other one is in Hillside. This location feels like it is newer because both times I have been here it is spotless. Both locations employees are super friendly!!! Hillside location ambiance wise has more character, but this location I think the food is actuallly better. I wish they would adverstise more because this place should have more business. My mother is from the south she can throw down some amazing southern meals. Thank you Priscilla's for your collard grens with pork, chicken wings and breasts, macaroni and cheese, candied yams, and most certainly can not forget the beef short ribs , and corn bread. Authenic southern cuisine at its best. Hands down best place for southern food in Illinois!
Very nice and friendly staff. Food was just ok. Greens weren't that good. A bit overpriced for the meal.
Yuck!  The food is so greasy!  I never see this place busy, makes me wonder how they stay in business!

I LOVE fried chicken.  LOVE it.  So when my girlfriend and I saw that Priscilla's was opening up a spot near my old house, I knew we had to try it.  We've since come back several times, and we're always satisfied with our meal.  

I suppose I should probably start with the fried chicken dinner I always order here.  They offer you a choice of white or dark meat.  It's always dark meat for me, and they usually offer three pieces (sometimes I've gotten four though). The meat is flavorful and you get a good-sized serving of chicken.  It's not the best fried chicken I've had -- it's not crispy -- but it's still very good.  I've also tried Priscilla's smothered chicken and smothered pork chops, and those are also very good.  

Each of their dinners comes with two sides.  I go for the mashed potatoes and macaroni and cheese.  They give you a very generous scoop of each, and thank God they do because those are some damn good sides!  You also get a piece of cornbread with your meal.  Frankly, I've never come across a piece of cornbread I didn't like, and their cornbread was no exception.  

On one visit, we decided to try their peach cobbler.  Sadly, we weren't fans of it even though we really wanted to like it.  Something about it was just a bit "off."  It's OK though because we come here for the chicken (me) and catfish (my girlfriend).  

We'll keep coming back to this place.  The prices are reasonable, the portions are big, and the staff is friendly.

I'm with the majority with this place.   I've been wanting to try this place since it opened because 1) I'm not a soul food expert but have loved it when I've had it and 2) there is always something comforting about fried chicken.  

So finally a situation presented itself to give it a try.   Stopped in on Sunday and got an 8 piece chicken dinner with one large side.   Ordered the mac and cheese which was awesome.  The chicken itself was tasty albeit a touch spicy for my group (kids) and I was disappointed they didn't have any chicken breasts on a Sunday at 6 but also understood it was the end of the run.  They made up for it by adding extra legs into the batch.   Also ordered the candied yams which got a mixed review due to the inclusion of a baking spice (nutmeg perhaps?).   The cornbread muffins were good but as someone mentioned, Boston Market's were better.  Also got red velvet cake which was good but not mindblowing.

The service was great - she helped me through the menus and talked about what she liked there.   Everyone was so darn friendly.

All in all, I will add this to my rotation of local carryout places and looking forward to trying some new dishes as well like the fried catfish.

I have nothing against the food, i really enjoy their food, however... We stopped on a Wednesday evening around 6:30pm (during their hours of operation), only to find them closed with their business hours posted clearly on the door which was 11-8pm on Wednesdays. We were very disappointed and it turns out we were not the only ones. A truck pulled up next to us and the guys said they had drove three hours to get to Priscilla's and they were never coming back after that. I think that is totally unprofessional and unacceptable. Disappointing.

To be honest, I was kind of bitter towards this place because I really liked Boston Market, which was there before Priscilla's opened up. This is probably my 2nd time eating here and I must say, I wish i tried it earlier. 

Not sure how the menu works, but I believe that there's different options for everyday. So obviously I looked at which day it was and just went from there. Had to go with the fried chicken dinner. 3 pieces of chicken, 2 sides, and a bread. Some may think it's a little pricey at 8.99 but I feel like it was pretty good portion. 

Though my personal opinion is just that Boston Market corn bread was better (still a little bitter). But yea, the big factor for me for giving this place 5 stars is just that the staff was very friendly. I came it and took my time while ordering and the lady behind the cash register wasn't impatient or anything. Then when I got my food from another lady, she told me to enjoy. Then before leaving, a third lady told me thanks and to have a nice day. I love good service.

When I used to work in Charlotte, I got spoiled by the plethora of Southern food.  In Chicago, it's hard to find good places.  There are some gems, but few and far between.  So imagine my surprise and happiness when Priscilla's Ultimate Express opened right across the street.  Not right across the street for you stalkers, but close enough.
It's kinda set up like Boston Market, where a lot of the food is already prepared and you choose what you want.  3 of us went, one had the fried chicken, one had the half broasted chicken and I had the beef short ribs.  The short ribs were doused in some sauce.  Pretty yummy but a tad salty.  The chicken dishes were both good. 
The sides.
I think the sides are excellent.  The mac and cheese is delicious.  The candied yams have some nutmeg I think in them.  It gives it a little kick.  But those are saccharinely sweet...
The collard greens are yummy and you can get it with either turkey or pork.  I got the turkey and it had a nice smoky flavor to it.
I'll be back.  The only thing that keeps me from going is the fact I'm trying to cut a few pounds.  But it's definitely worth the treat!

I've had my eye on Priscilla's ever since it opened. Southern food isn't exactly a commodity in the area, and no, Popeye's doesn't really count.

So I stopped in over lunch to see what they had. What really surprised me was... they didn't have a lunch menu. All that was there was dinner prices. Which is fine, but I picked up a baked chicken entre meal. This set me back $10.99, plus tax, without so much as a drink!

The 8 pieces chicken meal (with one large side and possibly some corn bread) was a more reasonable $9. I thought about going with that, but that would be far too much food. As it was, I had leftovers, so $5.50 / meal isn't bad.

So I had the baked chicken, which was wonderfully moist and very well flavored, with candied yams and rice with gravy. Avoid the rice with gravy, as there was nothing particularly special about the parboiled rice or white gravy. But the candied yams tasted nice and sweet; a good example of what I was looking for when I went there.

The whole thing was accompanied by sweet cornbread (I thought you weren't supposed to use sugar in cornbread in the south?), which was buttery and very good.

Take a group here if you're going to go; they give you a ton a food, but there is a bit of a price premium to it, too.
Good ol' Soul Food. I love everthing here. Reminds me of my mom and grandma's cooking! Only complaint, I don't like the mashed potato salad. Potato salad should have chunks of poltatoes.

I am a huge fan of Priscilla's Ultimate Soulfood Cafeteria in Streamwood and was thrilled when I discovered that they were opening an express location close to my home. Please see my review of the Streamwood location for my background  and love of Soulfood.

The basic premise: you get a main meal (options rotate daily), 2 sides, a cornbread muffin, and a drink. The prices are a bit high for me -- hence the 4 stars instead of 5 - but as I said, if you've got a craving....it takes care of it. 

This location is like the cafeteria, except smaller and more compact. I mainly go for the fried chicken and the red velvet cake when I'm not training. 

Around here, your options for fried chicken mainly consist of KFC and Popeye's, neither of which do anything for me. Tonight I tried the baked chicken, and it was just as good as the fried. The sides we all shared tonight were mashed potatoes, corn, candied yams and mac and cheese. My kids ate all the mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. They love it. 

Topped it off with Sweet Tea. Yum.

It's in an odd location, where the Boston Market used to be. I wish they had breakfast and lower prices. But it's worth the trip, and if you are craving fried chicken -- GO. Go right now. Get the chicken. 

Welcome to the area, and please never leave!

Different specials depending on the day of the week.

Amazing Fried Chicken... it does not compare to KFC, Popeyes, etc.. It is homemade goodness. Plenty of seating inside.  I wish the sauces were lableled so I knew which one was ketchup, bbq sauce, hot sauce etc.

Mac and Cheese was delicious and is a MUST SIDE.  Cheesy crust on top.  My 2nd side was the candied yams.  They were good, but I was not a fan.  There was a weird spice in there that I did not care for.  I would guess nutmeg, but I still ate it.

Corn Bread was okkkkay.  A tad bit cold.  If it was hot, it would have be real good.

Overall, very very good.  i wish the food was a bit hotter (tempature wise)  I was there toward closing, so maybe the heating lamps weren't enough at that point.

Can't wait to go back!!!

I was super exited about trying the fried chicken based on all the positive reviews.  Went in to pickup carry out around dinner twice.  The fried chicken was pretty disappointing.  The Chicken was super oily and the batter was very bland.......hate to say this but popeye's flavor blew them away.  I did order some fried Catfish and that was excellent.  I'll prob try them again since I live up the street.

While visiting in Illinois, I always check out Priscilla's. I love the catfish and all the sides  that she serves. Ok, here goes. First of all the fish was extremely salty I mean too salty, the green beans were mushy, the mac and cheese was good and the corn muffins were delish. On my next visit back home I am going to give Priscilla's another try.

Priscilla makes fantastic fried chicken and the best fried catfish I have ever tried!  And her sides are simply amazing.  The fried chicken (all white meat for me, but they offer mixed and all dark too) is tender and juicy on the inside and crunchy on the outside.  The fried catfish is the meatiest filet of catfish I have ever seen and the purest white in color (not grayish like some catfish).  It is also juicy on the inside and perfectly crunchy on the outside.  And I love to add the hot sauce to both for  little extra kick in flavor.  

And my husband has tried almost everything on the menu now  - from ham hocks to smothered pork chops to ribs to baked chicken  - and loves it all!  The one area of the menu that we weren't particularly impressed with were the desserts but that's probably because we've always been so full after eating the hearty entrees.

Priscilla will make a soul food lover out of almost anyone with her delicious food!
The food here is delicious! The only thing that didn't impress me was their cabbage. Their fried fish and chicken are delicious. Greens, candied yams, and macaroni and cheese was super good.

I've been here a few times times since it opened. I used to go to the Boston market in this location so I figured I'd give the new restaurant replacement a try. I was pleasantly surprised. 

The menu is basically classic "soul food" i.e. collard greens, fried chicken, smothered food...etc and just like classic soul food, its great for your taste buds and your "soul" but bad for everything else haha. Lots of sugar, fat and salt in most of the menu items but then again most restaurants are moving in that direction these days (see KFC double down sandwich) so I don't really mind.

The Pros: Great tasting great quality food and side dishes. 

The Cons: Not great for healthy eating or people dieting. 

The Price: Very reasonable, should be under 20 (around 9-15) for a full meal. 

Come here for a great filling meal at a reasonable price!...but not too often if you care about your health.

Harold who?

Yep, the chicken is good like THAT.  I also ate an amazing mountain of turkey greens, macaroni and cheese and a too good for words corn muffin.  

I have a feeling that nothing had to be thawed, microwaved, or "faked".  

The delivery was on time, hot, and friendly.

I actually like Priscilla's food, but now they have gone up on the prices I'm a little hesitant to go. The chicken wings are very very small, so you go up,  but you don't get more food. Also I think they should offer special's on certain days. You have to give your customers a good reason to come back, since the prices are so high.
I've eaten here many times. I've had the catfish and fried chicken many times. Could probably do it once a week. Side dishes usually rock. Greens, mashed potatoes, mac n' cheese - lots more.

We had catfish and beef short ribs, both with mac & cheese and greens as sides. The catfish was crispy and savory with a little kick, but I thought it was kind of cold like it hadn't been fried to order. The beef short ribs were braised in gravy. They were tender, but very greasy and kind of had a gamey liver taste. I'm not a beef, chicken or pork eater, so they weren't my taste. My honey thought they tasted good but again, were greasy. The mac & cheese was delicious! Very cheesy, creamy, and had that oven-baked crust that's makes the sun shine brighter. The greens were good, not great. A little pepper vinegar made them much tastier. The corn bread was the BEST I've ever had. The sweet tea is pure syrup and oh-so-delicious. I did have to water it down a bit. Prices are reasonable. Servers are very sweet and polite.

Yum - everyone talks about it being expensive. It's really not compared to what you get!

My fried chicken dinner:
3 pcs of chicken (dark, white or mixed selection)
1 hunking scoops of dense mashed potatoes and gravy
1 cupful of collard greens
1 medium sized corn bread muffin

all for $8.99

Compare that to a KFC dinner for $6
2 pcs of fried chicken
1 small portion of coleslaw
1 biscuit

I think Priscilla's is a pretty good deal!!

I loved my fried chicken - not oily at all. Very crispy and moist. 
the dense mashed potatoes were soooo good. I loved them! and the collard greens were cooked with ham and turkey so very flavorful and not too salty.

Definitely coming back here soon!
Went here this past Sunday.  Macaroni and Cheese, Collard Greens, Yams.  I could eat the gravy like a soup.

I was very impressed with this place! Read the positive reviews and decided to give it a try and I was not let down! Short ribs were delicious and the smothered chicken was amazing! I truly felt welcome and the food was hearty and not overpriced for the portion size. Highly recommend trying out Priscillas!
Their food and service is fabulous!  Nice to have a soul food restaurant in the suburbs. Haven't had a bad meal yet.
Customer service is horrible waited 45 mins for a plate. If you must eat there I suggest you call in your order first.
Excellent home cooked food! No need to say more. Go there, eat there, bring some home!

I've been to this place 3 times. Every time i ordered the fried chicken. It's ok. I dont like any of the sides. the people that work there are nice though. The chicken is cooked right, but i think the batter is kind of bland.
The fried chicken is excellent! It was crispy and so tasty. The navy beans were good but the mac and cheese is THE best I've ever had. The candied yams were really good too.
Delicious soul food without driving to Chicago.

Catfish was awesome, but a little pricey when you add desert. Fried chicken was equally as good. I'd say the food is a good as the original Priscilla's in Hillside. I like that this ones open more days of the week and closer to my house.
First time customer. Great comfort food especially on a cold day like today. Food was a bit pricey but well worth it.

The chicken here is great just like everyone says...BUT...I think a lot of everything has to do with what time of day you come. The problem is nothing is really served fresh to order. So if it's been a slow day the food just lacks that freshness it can have. All in all a place worth checking out but I recommend coming when there actually is some traffic walking in and out the door.
It's not cheap. It didn't impress me at all. I really wanted to like this place because it is one of my favorite kinds of dining. The fried chicken was OK. I will maybe give it one more chance.

Great fried catfish!  I love their smothered chicken.  Their collards are some of the best I have ever tasted, and I grew up with two grandmothers and a mom from Mississippi.  A little pricey? Sure but you get what you pay for.  Only draw back to this place is their desserts, anything that nutmeg is used, it sees like they like to use the whole bottle, and most of the cakes aren't worth the price.

Ugh, this place is hit or miss. You never know what you're gonna get. One day the dressing is excellent but on 3 other ocassions I got 3 different xperiences. Dog food, sweet corenbread purred for a baby and the last time jnust a clunk of dark brown looking stuff that was really sweet and unrecognizable. Dressing is usually savory, and they don't have it on display probably for that reason. The short ribs sit out so long that they are just burnt to a crisp but they will continue to serve them and be selfish while doing so.  The prices are like 3.00 more than any other soulfood place but you get less. Their so incosistant I don't waste my time going here anymore. The decor is really nice as it should be in a cafeteria

I really enjoy the pizza and service, but today was different. Dont get me wrong the Pizza was amazing as always!!!!
But the girl who took my order over the phone, Angie was very rude. She took my order and before giving me my total she hung up on me. So i called back and again she answered the phone with attitude when i asked her how long it would be for pick up and what the total was. 

She needs to change her attitude with customers. I will still go back because of the great food, but just didnt like the service i received today.

I really love eating pizza, the more dough, cheese and tomato sauce the better!  I'm a fan of Lou Malnati's, Gino's, Uno's and Giordano's pan pizzas and I would put Mug's pan pizza right up there with these big boys.  They also have beef, pasta, thin crust pizza and ribs.  You can eat there (they have two booths, though I've never seen anyone use them for anything other than for sitting while waiting to pickup a carry out order), and they're open late.  So if you have a craving for some great comfort food, give this place a call even after midnight and plan on going into a food coma from over eating.  It's that good.

Duuuuude this place was so sketch on the outside but it cranked out the best Chicago-style deep dish pizza I've ever had! Sure it took a coon's age for them to make but it sure was worth it! I even took a couple slices on the plane back to California! 

I don't even care that they sell ribs and pizza at the same time. Who does that? Who cares!

Look, I visited Chicago a few years ago and tried one of the most popular deep dish pizzas they had to offer but it somehow did not compare to this pizza here. It looked ugly as hell but boy did it stand up good by itself (bruh, double crust! DOUBLE. CRUST.)

We even had a crying baby in the car waiting on this pizza. IT WAS WORTH THE CRYING BABY.

Then again, I'm from California...whatever that means.

I had  to write this review.  I ordered from here for delivery and the customer sevice over the phone was outstanding. This was my 1st time ordering from Mugs and I will be a continuous customer.  I had the fried chicken box with au gratin potatoes and chicken rice soup  and the garlic rolls Let me tell you the food came piping hot.   The chicken was crispy and the homemade potatoes was toooo delectable.  The price was good and affordable . Keep up the good food. Will be trying the pizza soon!
Thank you for my favorite pop and desert which was a suprise

Driving on Kennicott a Muggs delivery car (beat up silver Altima) passed me when I was going 25 on a residential side street near luther village. Last I recall there is no passing and he had to be doing over 40 when he flew by me.  He could have hit a kid or jogger! And to drive like this with the company sign on top his car,  smart move.

This is the second time my ordered got messed up from grub hub and they were very rude while I was on the phone with them saying they messed up my order.  Never getting food from them again.  They arn't even fixing my order.

I have always looked forward to ordering Mug's, especially after midnight. 
They are the only joint in the area to get food at after midnight. (delivered) 

I had just settled into my new apartment and wanted to order some grub from Mug's as I didn't feel like cooking after a long day of unpacking. 

I placed my order right after midnight on 6/26/15. 

I ordered: 

(1) Rib and Chicken Dinner (w/ Fries + Salad w/ House Italian) 
(1) 1/2 Slab Rib Dinner (w/ AuGratin Potatoes + Salad w/ Ranch) 

This totaled $35.91 w/ delivery, tax, and a generous tip. 

My food finally arrives around 1AM and the driver calls my phone to announce his arrival. 
The guy could barely talk he was so intoxicated. The smell of alcohol and MJ were extremely obvious. The entire bag reeked as if he was smoking in his vehicle. 

I shook my head and went upstairs to eat my food. I open the bags and all that is there is a slab of ribs, a half order of fries, and a cup of Italian Dressing. Obviously, not what I ordered. 

I called the store and was immediately placed on hold after the girl answering yells "Pizza Place!". Ten minutes go buy and the manager ERNIE (also franchise manager, more on this later..) answers the phone. I explained that my food was incorrect and I would like redelivery or to refund my money with GrubHub. 

As soon as I mentioned the issues, he decided he could no longer speak english. He also got a nice case of the giggles. He told me in "broken english" he would not redeliver and wouldn't issue me a refund. I asked him his info. His name is Ernie and he is ALSO the franchise manager/director for the entire "chain" of Mug's locations. (Des Plaines, Schaumburg, Arlington Heights..etc) I noted this and informed him I would contact GrubHub. He said he didn't care, and told me what is in the bag is what I get. Regardless, of WHAT I PAID FOR. 

Fed up, upset, and losing my appetite, I called GrubHub customer care and explained the situation. They told me this isn't the first they've heard of this. They called the location and were demeaned, laughed at, and threatened. Needless to say, ten minutes later the rep gets back on and said he finally gave in and credited my money. I did receive my refund from GrubHub. 

Interestingly, GrubHub no longer lists Mug's AH on their list. It may change, but I'm hoping not. 

As a customer who used to order 3-4x a month, I'm truly disappointed. 
I'm shocked at the attitude of the location, as well as the franchise manager Ernie. 

DO NOT order from here, you will receive whatever they decide you will get. 

*Plus, I do not condone or support a business that allows their drivers to drive while under the influence of alcohol or any other illegal substance.* 

Will post proof photos under the main business page for this location.

I've been ordering pizza from Mug's for years; first from their Des Plaines location and later from Arlington Heights. Lately, the food quality really has slipped, at least at the A.H. location.

Their pizza used to be agreeably spicy with a flavorful crust. Now, it's just bland. This may be a combination of altering the original pizza recipe, and not being properly prepared. My last pizza was overcooked (as this location tends to do), not warm and the cheese wasn't sufficiently melted. It also lacked tomato sauce and just wasn't tasty. The nondescript crust also seems to have gotten thinner (not a positive, in my opinion). Some of the chicken wings that I also ordered  tasted like they had been cooked well in advance and left lying around (maybe left over from the last order).

I've stopped ordering from Arlington Heights, but might consider the Des Plaines location in the future (if convenient).

amazing! Amazing amazing! Sooo delish, I've finally found the place! Ribs are out of this world, the sauce is sooo good! Fresh baked garlic rolls, homemade chicken soup, steak fries are perfect, and it's been so long since I've had a baked potato at a restaurant that didn't suck. Buffalo wings were yum, crispy and tender. Open til 3 am, even on Monday's? I've found heaven, seriously!

I've rated mugs 5 stars not because of amazing quality food, but more so because of convenience of service. Their open till 3am which for having a job that gets out late makes for a convenient choice for dinner if you don't feel like preparing anythkng. Their pizzas are OK definitely not the best around, and their pastas arent going to give your mother a run for her money. However their sandwiches are all fairly awesome and a great value. All come fully loaded with great tasting ingredients. Like I said, their not the best place in town, but after midnight they are definitely the bell of the ball.

I order delivery from here a lot. The food is always delivered quickly and hot. The prices are really decent as well.

Pizza, burger's, pasta, and their rib tips are all good.

I've picked up my food a few times and the inside is small and utilitarian. The delivery driver's are always walking in and out.

Decent pizza, but the girl on the phone was so rude - we may never order again. We've had delivered in the past and always takes longer than they say.  Figure it out or you won't be around much longer

Tried Mugs for no other reason than to switch up the Friday night pizza game. We ordered via grub hub and the pie arrived in about 30-45 mins which is quite acceptable for a Friday night. The pizza was a large sausage and pepperoni and the pizza was pretty true to Chicago style thin crust. The cheese was bubbly  and good, the sauce was only the very slightest bit sweet and the sausage was savory while the pepperoni was about average. I'd say this pizza stacks up well with other northwest suburb pizzerias like nino's. Two distinctions are that the 1. prices are a little bit cheaper than most and 2.the crust is a little bit thicker than most Chicago thin. Imo, true Chicago thin crust should have a slight 'crisp' quality to it. This crust was not very crisp and this may be important to Chicago natives so choose wisely your pizza pie....

I can't say enough good things about Mugs....we rediscovered it again after not ordering for at least 3-4yrs and can't figure out why we drifted in the first place...their delivery to our home in Palatine is always surprisingly quick(they say an hour but it's usually about 30mins), the sandwiches are amazing...tonight we tried the onion rings and mozzarella sticks for the first time and they were beyond our best expectations., NOT greasy and as warm as if we were eating in the restaurant...The Italian beef, better than Portillo's or Buona's...the steak fries with cheese are always great...the BLT (my wife's favorite) is AMAZING... We've never ordered the pizza but it's in our near future. 
Again, I can't say enough positive things about Mugs.... I'm not an employee or connected to the business in any way and I rarely take the time to give Yelp reviews but after the rings and cheese sticks showed up tonight soo beyond perfect (like the rest of the order) and our previous orders blowing away our expectations, I felt obligated to give Mugs the credit they deserve for delivering us some of the best Chicago style food we can find. 
GREAT JOB MUGS!!!!
Ordered an XL Sausage, Pepperoni, mushroom pizza, which was delivered ahead of time given.  Great food, service, price and delivery. I will definitely be ordering from Mugs again.

Vince, you should be ashamed of yourself for running such a terrible carry out service. Melissa, the girl who took our order via phone;, you, Melissa, are ill spoken to challenge one of your customers.  The driver who delivers is THE BOMB!  We wonder WHY he drives for MUGS?!?!

Dude

Mugs

Pizza

Has crack in that shit!!

I been ordering mugs for over 5 years now.
Everytime my boys and I get drunk we order mugs.
I order mugs almost every weekend.

Mugs is all I want when I am drunk

Mugs...I love you

Pizza took over an hour to arrive.  May seem normal, but it's actually not as most pizzas today arrive in about 40 minutes.  Driver asked for tip.  (And be aware, by the way, that tipped employees ARE, in fact, required to make minimum wage...   if they make less then this in tips, the employer is required to give them enough to be equivalent to minimum wage.)  
    
This driver asked for this tip in fact right as I was about to notice he looked tired and apologize for not being able to tip due to being homeless and having paid $7 for this over PayPal without which I would not be able to read or carry things due to physical weakness due to lack of food because using PayPal money and these coupon codes in various places is the literally the only possible way for me to get food now, until the food stamp office decides to do it's job. Of course my explanation to him would have been shorter, but I wanted to make an exception and mention it because he looked tired.  When I called the restaurant at 2:50 because they close at 3 and my pizza had not arrived nor a call, and I wanted to make sure they did indeed have the order, they did not even answer the phone.

In addition to this, the pizza was cold. Had a weird, not-even-remotely BBQ-like taste underneath the cheese of the BBQ pizza.  Crust is dry, and neither crispy nor soft.  Chicken tastes like it came from a bag of frozen chicken pieces which have been been refrigerated as leftovers, and then reheated, twice, and is also incredibly dry.  The ONE and only thing this restaurant did right is that there is a lot more cheese...    slightly more then the amount you'd expect to be on every pizza if you'd never had pizza before but knew what pizza was.  (That was not the reason for giving 2 stars; it's still not as bad as Little Ceaser's or something - although Little Ceaser's DOES usually actually do what they are supposed to do, such as having the meat be either meat-like or burned.)  There is also only a very, very, very tiny amount of green herbs visible on the pizza.  (I know not all pizza's herbs are visible, but this one's clearly are and there is a very tiny amount of them.)  

As anyone knows without reading any review if they are looking at the menu to consider ordering, they are also very expensive.

Terrible customer service and a complete waste of time.  I ordered delivery at 1am and after a hour and 45 minutes decided to call back to get an eta on delivery and was told the driver already arrived but all the lights were off so he left.  All my lights were on, including the porch light so it was a flat out lie.  Then the rude lady on the phone began to laugh while she informed me that she called several times, another lie because the phone never rang.  Their excuse of the lights being off so they didn't knock doesn't fit with them saying they called several times, why would you be okay with waking me up with excessive phone calls but be afraid to knock?  I accidentally called the Schaumburg location back to asked for management's info and was told that they constantly receive complaints about the Arlington Heights location.

I'm very disappointed. I used to order their cheese pizza all the time but this time it was thin, instead of fat & glamorous with loads of gooey cheese. The greek salad was missing kalamata olives and maybe a pepperoncini, or two?  

I'm clearly saddened by the pizza. I used GrubHub to order, maybe they have a grudge against them.  :(

I must say that I had high hopes and expectations for this place after reading the positive reviews. 

To begin, the phone girl was extremely rude to me upon placing my order. After being quoted an hour delivery time, I received my order about an hour and a half later, at which point I wasn't even hungry anymore. The delivery guy didn't offer me change, instead leaving my house before I could protest. 

My pizza was cold and ultimately wasn't what I asked for. I called back to voice my concern, and the phone girl was extremely rude to me in return, not once apologizing, but instead attacking me, even going so far as to call me a liar about my pizza being late. 

I've worked in the pizza industry for years, and I've never had such a horrible experience with customer service before. I didn't even bother eating more than one or two bites of my cold, uncooked, wrongly delivered pizza. 

I'm hoping that the GM will resolve my issues tomorrow, but until then, I'll leave my review as is. Please don't waste your money when the staff is so rude to the customers!

 I will never order from here again, which is a disappointment considering it's one of the only late night delivery services in our area. After the attitude I've received after receiving a screwed up order, I'd rather order from a chain restaurant, where customer service is actually valued.

Pizza is amazing. I love the burners pizza and their deep dish. Today my pizza arrived an hour and a half after ordering and my pizza is cold! Very unhappy. Disappointed to say the least. The driver didn't even ask if I wanted change.....

I always order pizza from them since i tried their pizza but yesterday i ordered a vinnis special and instead i receive a onion pizza with little sausage peperoni and mushrooms the flavor of onion killed my pizza  very disappointed this time. Hopefully they hire someone who cares about someone elses food

Great pizza and Ribs!  Don't even bother with other local pizza joints, pizza selection is great and not over priced.  Ribs are fall off the bone good and keeps you coming back for more.  No matter what yo order you will be happy with the order.

My buddy kept talking about this place. After working on a Sunday night getting off after midnight we drove from Oakbrook to the north side of Arlington Heights to get pizza and wings. Let's just say we didn't  have left overs. Lady in front was  awesome she gave us a drink and discount on the food with no coupon. I'm not a regular customer but their number is saved in my phone for mid nite snack. ;)
The stuffed pizza is ridiculous! It weighs like 15 lbs and you'll eat it for a week! Their regular pizza is pretty good too. There's a ton of cheese.

Placed an order at 1:13 and its now 2:16. Called to tell them I placed an order a little over an hour ago and was trying to see where it was at ... And I quote " you placed your order at 1:20 so it should be there in a little bit" well how about u cancel my order cus I have no " hunger" for your crap, nor tolerance! Grrr!

I absolutely love this place. We order all the time. The pizza is great. We have had the pepperoni,bacon and cheese pizzas. We have also ordered the fries. I am not a fan of steak fries but the must use crack oil because the are addictive. The wings are awesome and I just tried the bacon sandwich for the first time the other day and wow. I look forward to try the rest of the items on there expansive menu.

Ok this has become my go to late night delivery place, and I love it. Consistently speedy and tasty, plus a lot of bang for the buck. Even when I have leftovers in the fridge, I have to fight the urge to order Mugs!

New to the Palatine area.....the best pizza around

The Muggs Monster is da best!!!!!!

The steak fries are da best too!!!!

Must try the ribs soon!!!

Keep up the great work!!!!!

I ordered pizza for delivery last night.  My pizza was delivered on time and tasted delicious!  They are very generous with the toppings here!  The crust was nice and crisp with lots of cheese!  I will definitely order from here again.

I'm from California and rather picky .  I love thick crust.  Yet Mugg's is the only place where the crust and the pizza itself is thin yet I can DEVOUR it.   Some places just sprinkle the toppings on but Mugg's COVER the pizza and are fresh.   
My large 3 topping pizza with a $1.50 off coupon is about $20.  But it's so filling because of the toppings that I stay full longer after I've eaten.
This is TMI, but because the pizza isn't greasy I don't get an upset stomach after eating.  I don't know why but store bought, frozen, Ninos, Ginos, and other major pizza restaurants upset my stomach...  Mugg's is the only place that doesn't.   
I've sent 5 people here and they've all been very impressed considering from the outside looks run down...  and did I mention that they deliver all the way to Milwaukee Blvd?  
I haven't had anything else from here, but you should definitely try this place, they ROCK!!!

Working in the industry myself I know how detrimental false and over exaggerated reviews  can be to one's business. However unfortunately all the reviews I read on this place are true in one way or another. I cannot comment on the food being that I had to cancel my order before it even arrived. when my boyfriend and I tried to order from a new place The female I spoke to was very short, cutting me off when trying to place my order. Before I could get another word in wanting to make sure she got an apartment number she said have your card ready followed by a click. While waiting for the food to be delivered which I placed the order at 10:45 PM I was working away on one of my many projects. Not realizing how much time had gone by since I placed the order until my boyfriend interrupted me saying where are they at? I looked at my phone to see what time it was and it was now 12:00 AM and had been an hour and 15 minutes and mind you it was only a Thursday night. So I called there and it took about a minute for somebody to answer the phone. The rude girl that I had spoke to previously was the one who answered the phone again and I said that I had ordered at 10:45 and I was kind of wondering where the food was at. No response from her yet just she just put me on hold. She then pick up the phone said the delivery drivers five minutes away and hung up on me not even giving me the chance to say one thing. So we bared with it because I know working in the industry stuff happens. 12:30 AM rolls around and we had both had had enough we had given  them plenty of opportunity to deliver this food given that we are no more than 10 minutes down the road and An hour and 45 minutes had gone by. So again I called back having the same girl answer the phone this time I only had to wait about 30 seconds for someone to pick up and I had said I want to cancel my order because I ordered at 10:45 it's been almost 2 hours now you told me the delivery driver was five minutes away which clearly wasn't true. And her response was OK and hung up on me. I was Very disgusted by the customer service and definitely would never recommend them nor order from there ever again. I had mentioned my experience to someone and they had said why didn't you call there and talk to manager. I laughed and said well given the yelp reviews I've read that doesn't get you very far. Also for a place to allow continuous bad yelp reviews to appear on the same issues with the same  individuals it's clear to me they don't care. Being a manager of a restaurant myself having to deal with issues like this on a day-to-day basis it's sad to see a place being one that doesn't care about their customers and value their feedback being good or bad.

First time ordering from Mugs. My Daughter picked up a "Vinnie's" tonight.  We all enjoyed the crunchy crust, the meats were abundant. And loaded with cheese. I see all these negative posts, I don't understand. This pizza was awesome. And we will be back for more.

The quality of the pizza and the service has tanked. I will not order again. Other places in the area are much better. Why spend good money from a joint that does not care. The owner needs to get back to caring.

Ordered the margarita pizza and was disappointed. It even seemed cold when I got it. Took them like 65 mins to deliver and I am like 1 mi away. Took longer than LouMalnati's. I willing to give them another try since they are close and open late but was one of the most bland pizzas I have had in a long time.

ok pizza place if you tell them to cook it well done and make it thin. Otherwise the crust is too thick and they cook it to the point where cheese just melts. its an ok joint. Better than most in the burbs

I ordered a pizza for delivery, and was told by the less than friendly girl on the phone that it would arrive within the hour. An hour and a half later, it still hadn't arrived. I'm thinking, maybe the delivery person got lost so I called. I was put on hold before I could ask where my food was, and when my call was finally answered the girl said "it's on it's way, should be there any second." And then she hung up on me. 15 min later my pizza arrived, cold.

Was in town visiting my mom and needed some food. I read reviews but am never sure how authentic they were. I ordered the ribs and they were fantastic. Meat falls off the bone and the delivery was right on time. Will definitely order from them again!!!

Whether it's pizza, ribs or a chicken parm sandwich, Mug's is pretty reliable. You know it's gonna be good. Fair prices too. 

I keep forgetting that they're open until 3am every single day. You won't find a better late night option in this area. If it's 1am and you're starving, fuck Taco Bell, give Mug's a call!

You will NEVER GO WRONG AT MUGGS Des Plaines.

Total customer courtesy, Great Pizza and the RIBS are to die for.

Don't waste your money going to Little Villa.

You will dream of Muggs , you will spread the word how delicious their food is.

Good food...really good cole slaw. Vinnies special pizza is good, awesome steak fries...just plain good eats. My only negative is delivery can be slow...typically an hour...but I order here a fair amount anyways.

Not only is this place worthy of every bit as much the praise as it's sister spot in Des Plaines but they also get the Team Spirit award.

They have expanded their already generous delivery area to include a big part of the neighborhoods covered by the Des Plaines store as it recovers from a kitchen fire.

The pizza: XL, thin, Vinnie's Special, well-done, and un-cut. It was perfect. Delivered piping hot by a courteous driver within an hour- during the Bears game, no less.

It was election night and the time had escaped me - where to get food at 11PM on a Tuesday night? Then I recalled that Mug's had opened on Rand and had the 3AM close, so I thought it was time to give them a try. 

Ordered an 18" sausage pizza and it was excellent. Good amount of sausage and sauce - lots of cheese. With tax, about $18.50 - a little over a dollar an inch. I opted to pick it up, so I did not experience any delivery woes as noted in other review(s). 

I'll give this place a try again in the future, though Tortorice's will still get the majority of my thin crust pizza business. Tastewise, it's a wash, but the people at Tortorice's are always friendly and pleasant. The staff here was fine, but not nearly as outgoing as their competitor.
The pasta is really good, but I ordered some bread sticks and they tasted like rocks. I don't know what I expected ordering food at  2 AM though.

Great Chicago style pizza. They can't drive but they can make great pizza. I recommend you have them but multiple ingredients on your pizza. Lots of cheese is normal so don't be scared. Whenever I'm in the neighborhood we order.

I've ordered delivery from Mugs in the past and had good experiences, but I'm going to bed on an empty stomach tonight.  I placed my order with Mug's Pizza & Ribs in Arlington Heights, IL on 7/27/14 at 6:30pm. Being a Sunday around dinner time I assumed delivery would take longer than it normally does. At 8:30pm my order had not arrived. I called the restaurant and was told my order had just left and would be arriving shortly. The person on the phone read my address to me, so I thought, Great! Food should be here any minute. At 9:30pm when my order had still not arrived I called the restaurant again and was told that the order was never received and they had been having issues receiving Grub Hub orders. How disappointing. I'm giving 3 stars for the good experiences I've had in the past, but because of tonight I probably won't be ordering from Mugs anymore. Thank you Grub Hub for immediately emailing me back with a refund.

Best stuffed pizza ever!! The cheese oozed & filled in the spot where we removed a slice. (cheesegasm!) Aaaand they're open til 3 a.m. everyday! You seriously cannot go wrong. They have really good au gratin cheesy potatoes. Everything is priced decently. I used to live in the condos right next to the place & they delivered to us a few times without charging a delivery fee; so nice. I think they only have a table or two, so this is more of a take out and delivery place. The staff has always been very pleasant. I haven't ordered from them since I moved, but every time I drive by, my mouth waters. I cannot wait to order from Mug's again.

1 star is generous and based on the LAST last time I had food from here. My hubby picked up that time.

The last time, well ... I didn't get to eat & here's why. I called them yesterday (Friday), ordered ribs & pizza for delivery. Girl on the phone put me on hold a few times, took my order - rushed me through it by asking "is that all" each time I said something. She said, ok... it'll be an hour. Gave me a total. I ordered at 6:20. Waited, waited and waited some more. At 7:50 I call them saying I ordered for delivery over an hour ago, where is it? 

Stupid girl said "The caller (who was me) said it was a pick up." Uh NO! I said delivery. She insisted "the caller" said pick up. So I asked her... Pick up takes AN HOUR because you told me it was an hour??? I think her stupid brain kicked in at the moment and she thought... crap! 

They offered to deliver my food, the cold (it's not cold, it's been on a warmer) nasty food to me within 30 minutes or so (the OR SO is probably like an hour or so). 

Then they offered to remake me new food and redelivery it within the 30 minutes or so. Gave me a new total of $39 something! 

Seriously... you people screw up, offer to delivery me cold food and then reoffer to deliver me food after 3 hours and NO SORRY, NO DISCOUNT, NO FREE DELIVERY!

Guess what... NO MORE! 

Beware ordering from here. Read the reviews... Food may be good, but don't get delivery!

Definitely a decent dinner destination.  The chicken was super tasty and was still crispy when I got home.  The ribs were meaty and finger lickin good.  The dinner roll was frickin awesome and I wish I had more of that instead of the somewhat soggy steak fries, but fries don't usually hold up well unless theyre separated.  

The highlight of the experience was while I was waiting for my order (I didn't call ahead, just showed up so I expected to wait) I ran my battery down and the darn thing died on me.  A Mugs delivery guy was kind enough to give me a jump and I was on my way home to rip into some tasty food.  extra star for excellent service!

get some mugs.

I am seriously disappointed that I did not know about Mug's until now. I grew up in the area and I had never even heard of them until a friend just recently recommended them to me. I am not going to lie.... when my husband and I found out that they were open til the wee hours of the morning, we figured it must taste like crap and must be a pizza that you eat when you are drunk. :) To our amazement, the pizza was delicious! We have only had the thin crust, so I can not comment on the deep dish. We have had it several times now- pepperoni, sausage, green pepper and cheese. I would say it is a cross between a Barnaby's and Rosati's. ( A good rosati's, because as you may know, not all rosati's are the same.) The cheese is very fresh! love it!
Good pizza for good price! Very cheesy pizza!
Pizza was cooked perfectly - both crust and chesse!  The sausage was flavorful.  Not too greasy.

Really good pizza.  Their sauce has a bit of a kick to it and its very tasty.  I picked up the pizza based upon the bad Yelp delivery reviews and was pleased with my order.  We also got an order of Ribs which were really good.  I will definitely order from here again because the spicy sauce is different from the other pizza places in the area.

Let me start this off by saying that if you have two hours to wait, mugs is decent in the food category.  The service at this place is horrible and delivery is by far the slowest in the area.  We ordered tonight at 3:15pm,  I called at 4:20pm to find out where the order was and was put on hold for another five minutes while it was discovered that not only had my order not gone out but that it would be "the next" (after another order" sent out.  No thank you.  Asked to talk to the owner and was told they couldn't get back to me until Tuesday or Wednesday.  Ribs are good and au gratin potatoes are decent as well but without good customer service and timely delivery - there are too many other options out there for me to consider.

Mug's has the best thin crust pizza in the area.
Crust is great, perfect amounts of cheese, sauce, seasonings and toppings, and they know how to cook the pizza all the way through.
The only drawback is that it always takes an hour for delivery, but it's worth the wait.

I had a craving for take out spaghetti for quite some time...dunno why, but I did.  Convince my wife to order from here one night...

I ordered spaghetti and Meatballs, she orders Eggplant Parm.  Portions were big but the food was bland...even for take out.  Prices are the same as a sit down restaurant.  So as I get to my last meatball, I'm already thinking I'll order take out from a restaurant before coming back here...then I get to my last meatball...

My wife wants to have a bite.  She's like "How do you eat these?"  I said "Just bite it" Confusion ensues because I'm having a hard time figuring out why she doesn't know how to eat a meatball.  Then I try...

YOU COULD NOT CUT THE MEATBALL IT WAS SO HARD!!!!!!!

I've tried to think through why that meatball was so hard and all I can think of is either the food is microwaved or the meatball was sitting in a pot for days.  Either way, I don't think I want to ever eat at this place again!!!!!!!

What a difference 10 miles makes!  I have been going to the Des Plaines Location for years and they do a great job and have an excellent pizza. My Experience with the Rand Rd location was completely different. When I called to order I was put on hold for close to 10 mins. Then when they did pick up they wanted to put be back on hold.  When I arrived I expected the place to be mobbed ( Assumed all the hold time was because they were very busy). The place however, was dead.  Our Pizza still wasn't ready and as we waited, no one else arrived.  
The pizza is spicier then Des Plaines, but other than that pretty similar.

Quite nice little "dive bar" to hit for lunch. It is usually pretty quiet in the middle of the week. The service is a bit iffy if you take one of the high-tops but if you sit at the bar the bartender will take good care of you. The food is amazing everything I have had from the burgers to the fish has been excellent.

My coworker and I were feeling a bit hangry since neither of us brought a lunch to work and we decided to order from this place. The first let down was the difficult time we had just placing the order. First we were told delivery wasn't an option because they didn't have a driver. We were then told about 30 minutes later that they now had a driver and we could place an order for delivery. I ordered the chicken gyros and I feel like I got ripped off. The fries were cold, the lettuce they gave me was brown, the tomato they gave me was sour (gross), and they gave me a mountain of gyro meat with only one small pita. Honestly, I should have saved my $10 and ordered from literally anywhere else. My favorite part of the whole experience is that they provided me with a wet nap because not a lot of places do that. Honestly, I was more pleased with the provided wet nap than my food.
This place has great nachos and wings and a great atmosphere! Saturday night karaoke is the best!

Nice little restaurant/bar with a "Cheers" atmosphere
and lots of regulars who know each other. Enjoyed a very
flavorful Cheeseburger and delicious Cajun Chicken Wrap.

Also enjoyed Karaoke on Saturday night where everyone
really seemed to enjoy themselves. And the outdoor beer
garden looked like a comfortable area to enjoy food and drinks.

The pizza and ribs also looked good...will try that next time.
And $4 (24oz) drafts during Bears games with Complimentary
Halftime Buffet...what more can a sports fan want?
Nice little sports bar close to the hotel friendly staff good prices nice place to catch the game and hang out much better than usually whats near a hotel

If you want to go to a place where everyone is cool and you can enjoy yourself then this is the place. Drinks are good,service is great and food is great.  Overall this is a great place first time here and i will be back with friends....   Thanks for a great night.

Pros: Had my birthday party there.  Scheduled it a month in advance, and owners followed through confirming party and number of guests.  Easily accommodated the 30+ people I brought in on a Saturday night with reserved tables and a dedicated waitress.  Waitress and bartender noted my drink of choice, which made it easier for friends wanting to buy me a drink.  Karaoke girl was efficient and friendly, and I (and my friends) were all able to sing.  Great beer garden for friends looking to escape the drunken singing. Friendly staff and owners

Con: The pizza was a little oily for my taste

Back in 2002, my buddy and I went to PAPS for the 1st time. We ended up singing Karaoke for the 1st time as it was Karaoke night. We had a good time and the following week, we told our co-workers to join us. This was the start of a weekly get together in which the United Airline employees would pack the place thus making them A LOT of money. To this day, United employees pack the place. Their food is really good and they have a decent selection of beer. They have daily specials as well. Jimmy, one of the owners, is very friendly and customer oriented. (END OF YELP OR PAPS EDIT) 

***seems as though someone went in and edited my review for this establishment! How did that happen Yelp??

Let's try this again....with the business my buddy and I brought to the place, they treated me like a POS when my cousin from Colombia forgot his passport (ID) at my place. Upon leaving to get his passport, George proceeded to talk badly about us. Not a good way to treat long time customers. The only reason I found out was because the same people I introduced PAPS to let me know when we got back 15 min later. I guess it's his way of saying thanks to all the business I helped bring to his establishment.

I wish I could leave zero stars  I decided to venture out of the box and try paps as I have driven by it a lot but never actually tried it. What an extreme disappointment. I went on a weekday at 1:30 in the afternoon and there were very few customers in there. After being told to sit anywhere I waited and waited and waited for a server. Nobody ever came after 20 minutes. I got up and left and noticed all the employees just standing at the bar. Great way to do business. No wonder there was nobody in there. Don't waste your time.

Sat at the bar, which had one bartender working during a very busy time. We asked her what the beer specials were, she told us $2 domestics, and WALKED AWAY.
