As if we were going to need a while to decide what we wanted to drink. 10 minutes later, after she made her way back to us, she finally remembered that she hadn't served us yet. She was nice, but even worse, for "Ultimate Bar", their beer selection is pretty pathetic. Would definitely of liked to see some more craft beers available.

Got the $1.50 chicken tacos, they were great.
The atmosphere was pretty good, and the people were nice.

Monday nights half off wings! Daily specials everyday of the week and karaoke nights every Thursday and Saturday! What more can you ask for from a sports bar? More than 5 TVs and two large screen projectors? Got them!

A nice bar building on a bust intersection that offers other choice of food choice outside Asian food. This bar looks old but is a great place to catch an American meal and watch some sporting event in company of others. The drinks are reasonably priced and service very good. There is a small dining area in the front and a bigger sports bar section in the back room with some huge screens for viewing Chicago sports. Plenty of parking is also available.
Nachos are delicious. Good drink prices on a Saturday night, decent karaoke going on. Small bar with what seems like many locals but fun and friendly crowd.

The husband and I stopped here while my car was getting fixed, and after a night of fun and drinking, the grilled ham and cheese was the perfect meal. The bread was buttery and crisp, while the inside was gooey and salty all at once. And I don't know if it's just my pickle obsession talking, but their pickles are some of the best I've ever had! Thankfully my husband hates them so I could indulge on his helping. Plus they easily accepted my 10% off Yelp check in discount. We'll definitely be back, the food was awesome!
Tuesday nights 700pm trivia night is a fun night for friends

Delivery was fast but the food was absolutely terrible. The ribs seemed old and mushy and they just covered them with a ton of sauce. The fries were under cooked. The pizza was the thinnest I have ever seen with about a tablespoon of sauce on the entire thing. The wings were dried out and seemed like they have been sitting under a heat lamp all day. I will never order from this place again.

Nice towny bar. 
Haven't had their food.
Drinks and drink service = great. Friendly bar staff and well made drinks for great prices. 
It's always a friendly and fun atmosphere. 
Karaoke on Saturday - Line up seems fair, good selection, and the man running it is friendly.

i have had the best sandwiches and wraps here and the fries are awesome. Since i have just chicken and seafood i have not tasted other meats, the look very delicious though. I order almost once a month from this place even my 4 yr old likes the taste.

Honestly the owner really needs to watch his mouth.  "I'll get the girl for you?" Really?  Then I ordered tuna and received turkey.  The waitress was working the bar and the dining area.  We were the ONLY people in the dining area.  The bar looked dark and a bunch of locals that had to get their DRINK on were there. The food was ok but nothing special.  The daily specials seemed a reason to go here.  The waitress recommended the Friday pizza deal and to bring my kid there.  I'll pass.

We used to stop by here after work for the occasional beer, but only just recently for lunch. I opted for the chicken gyros which were decent. I've definitely had worse and don't really see them on the menu too often. My coworker had the philly which he said was really good too. 

The tables were a bit small, but the service was pretty good. I'm sure we'll stop in again after work for a few drinks. Lunch wasn't bad at all, but nothing spectacular.

We went here on a late Wednesday night. We had a gift certificate from Restaurants.com and we figured we'd give it a try.

We walked in and saw several really decent specials for drinks and food (1/2 price burgers every day). The place is no frills and hasn't been updated probably in the past 20 years and it seems to be a local joint. We were welcomed though and I didn't feel like a stranger. 

We needed to order $35 worth of food to use our gift certificate and let me tell you, that's hard to do with 2 people in this place. So we ordered 10 wings and then full entrees. The wings were good, not great, but better than average. The entrees were the same, the portions were huge and we left with plenty of food to eat the next day. 

We probably will be back for the burgers and beer specials.

If you're looking for some place to go out cheap, this is your place!

We went there on a Wednesday night and it was not very crowded.  The place is divided into two halves - a side that is more like a bar and side that is more like a restaurant with TVs.  Having this two-sided setup was nice - if you want the bar atmosphere, then you can choose this side or if you are there with your family, like me, then you can choose the more restaurant-like side.  The 1/2 price Angus burger special had really good flavor.  Their wings were also very good - very crispy outside and I loved their BBQ sauce - great combination of sweet, lightly sour and lightly spicy.  The prices are very reasonable - especially if you get a daily special and the flavor and food quality was very good for a bar and grill.  We will definitely be back - I want to try their pizza and friday fish fry and get some more wings.

Good burgers, friendly bartenders and a nice selection of beer. I'm there often.

WARNING: If the owner is there, he'll have the volume on the TVs so loud your ears will bleed and your teeth will vibrate.

We've been going there for years and never thought of writing a review.  

Aside from going there for drinks, it's our favorite place to go for Italian Beef sandwiches.  We went there tonight and I had one of the best Philly Cheese Steak sandwiches I've had in a long time.  My friend had the steak sandwich and said it was delicious and cooked to perfection (he likes it rare.)

They have great specials every day--both for drinks and for food.  Like I said, we've been there many times and will continue to go there.  It's a nice neighborhood bar with friendly people and great food.

Tried this place for the first time for the Friday Fish Fry!
Great food for an even better price!
The fish fry was $5 and was delicious..., my daughter got the 12 in pizza for $5 as well!  What a deal!!
Will def come back.
Great food and good service for a Hotel Restaurant. Plenty of TV'S to watch. I recommend the Caprese Salad and the Grilled Salmon Tacos. They Are Both excellent!

Easy going, good selection on the menu. TVs to watch from all angles.

I ordered the filet mignon ($32) with a side of asparagus. I also had a house pinot noir and ice cream for dessert. I do not recommend the ice cream, it wasn't worth it. It tasted like fake vanilla, it is not vanilla bean.
Great food and great service. They can be a little pricey but otherwise it's a great place!

This restaurant is located inside the Continental Tower 3 on Golf Rd. I haven't been coming here for too long. One day I ordered a burger. The burger was not done at all. I had to come all the way back for them to finish cooking the burger. Since then, I've been skeptical about buying anything else. Their personal pizza is good. Their breakfast is good as well. The rest of the food (burger, fries, soup, sandwiches) is a definite hit and miss. $2.35 for a simple order of fries, and some of them are inedible. Their prices are a bit on the high side as well. It is easy to spend $10 and up for a meal for one. You have to be careful what you order if you're on a budget. I'll go again, but I will be a lot more picky about what I choose.

Luv the split pea soup here! The homemade croutons really separate the soup. 

Every other week they have it. Last time I ate a quart for lunch! $5 for a quart of soup?!?! That's a price you can't beat anywhere.

This is the local retirement community hangout. Recently under new ownership, the staff seems friendly, but still trying to figure out the waitress/table assignment. I like the relaxed atmosphere as the patrons seem to all know each other and greet each other pleasantly. I visited with some senior friends to celebrate a birthday and the experience was very nice. The place was very clean and well kept. I have to take a couple stars off because the food seemed to be worn-out and mushy looking and tasting as if it was originally prepared a week ago and frozen and reheated a number of times. I had the meat lasagna. This was on special for around $10.50, but was only worth around $6.50 or so. Some entrees include soup, which mine was good, but I would suggest that they give a smaller portion of soup with an entree. I filled up on soup (and so did my friends) before the entree showed up. I think they have to bring down the prices and improve the freshness of the food to succeed. The owner introduced himself to us at the end of our meal. That was nice. I hope he listens to all of these reviews, as I would like to see this place survive and have better quality food in the future. NOTE: They do serve alcohol, but don't seem to stock much of each type of beer.

Don't bother trying to bring your Restaurant.com certificate here; they won't honor it.  That is DEFINITELY the fastest way to lose good customers.  What cheapskates........ not to honor a $10 off coupon that I had to pay for the day before I tried to use it!  I don't care if your system has been "hacked," Dunton House.  Honor your coupon.  You just lost me as a customer.... and I'm sure other people like me who are on SSI, SSDI, or social security will take their checks elsewhere; to restaurant owners who actually care about their customers and don't think a $10 savings for a good customer is going to shake the planet.  Shame on you.

Just like every "breakfast all day" Greek place youve ever been. And that's a good thing. Prompt service and food, cheap prices, and plenty of sodium. Kids menu, plenty of dessert options and free refills.

I was greeted the moment I walked in the door. My food came in a timely manner and it was as good as the waitress said it would be. Which might I add, she was wonderful. She was an older Polish or Russian woman, very kind. Overall, a great experience!
This place is all-around terrible.  Mediocre service and terrible food.  Even the coffee was bad.

I'm been coming to the DH for a few months. 7 days a week. The coffee is really good and gets my day started every morning. Coffee is self served which is real convenient which jumping on the train or running to work and at 1.25 beats McDonald's in size and taste. Food is delicious. Home town feel is perfect for any local or transient like myself. Try the soup. Will not disappoint.

First thing I see says "World Famous Salad Bar"...in who's world? Rabbit life world? I felt sorry for the new waitress....she's gonna quit from making no money....ambiance of a small Florida retirement town...ice water was good and cold!

I was looking forward to going here, as I have passed it many times.  I decided to take my kids there this morning.  Not impressed whatsoever!! It was cold in there and I we all wore our jackets.  My daughter had a hair in her pancake and her water and I had hairs in my omelette.  Also, the server had an obvious cold.  The food was average.  I'll never come back unless they invest in some hair nets.

I went there last Friday, the typical Greek style That probably has not been renovated in about 30 years. That would be alright if the food was any good. I had the all you can eat Fish Fry $10.95 ... and out came these rectangles of breaded/fried fish clearly NOT fresh but something processed and out of a factory. It would have been better to have gone to the supermarket and gotten the frozen fish out of the freezer. Had some green beans too, mushy and clearly from the can. Also had the Red Clam Chowder .... ummm vegetable soup with tiny bits of clam does not count as clam chowder.  I'm not sure where these great reviews are coming from but I will not be going back.

The quality, for both food and service has been variable. I had one very bad experience where the meal served appeared to be leftovers-stale bread and a cold main course that seemed to have been prepared hours earlier.  I recently had a ham off the bone omelette with cheddar cheese and broccoli. It was quite good, ample in size, fresh tasting and well cooked (perhaps a bit too salty). The hash browns were slightly undercooked but still tasty.

Subsequently, I had a patty melt, fries, onion rings and cream of mushroom soup. The word that best describes this meal is BLAND. It seems they serve the cheapest and least flavorful frozen french fries on the market. Same with their onion rings. At times it appeared there was some kind of actual string under the batter and not onions. The soup and sandwich were decent, but again bland tasting. I don't go to a restaurant for this kind of food no matter what the price.

This might be a decent place for breakfast, but with all the alternatives I won't be back.

I'm a regular at the DH and am always treated with courtesy and a good attitude. Owners Nancy and Bill treat everyone as friends. The food is excellent and the servers and kitchen are eager to accommodate special requests. The Dunton House is my favorite place to take friends, family and colleagues.

Basic food, nice atmosphere. There's nothing pretentious here. Nothing to whine about. The coffee is standard stuff, made to fuel conversations. The food will full you.

Think that coffee shop on Seinfeld. You go there to enjoy being in the company of friends, not to be seen.

The prices are affordable. The location, across from the Metra station, is excellent. 

Sit back, relax. Stretch out in a booth with the wifi. You don't need to overpay for that meal. You don't need to have that bitter coffee from the barista/ artist.

Leave the attitude home.
One of the best local family owned restaurants in the northwest suburbs. The quality of food and the amount of is excellent by my standards and the service is great also.

One of those places I really go more for convenience than for the dining experience. The prices are a bit pricey for the portion size and the cooking is solid but not gourmet. If I didn't pass by downtown Arlington Heights after 3 pm sometimes, I wouldn't make a special stop here.

It does offer a full menu of items and has spacious seating but the food is only good enough for those looking for a diner style experience. Otherwise, Panera nearby is probably a better choice.

I order lunch or dinner about 4 times a week from the Dunton House. Have been for years. Food is delicious and owners & staff always great. Wide variety menu with excellent soups. A real family restaurant. Eat there or pick it up for home! Donna D.
Skip it. Outdated decor, menu. Overpriced. Much better places in the area to eat for this price range.

My partner and I went here before a matinee performance at Metropolis theatre with really high hopes.  We tend to favor "greasy spoon" family restaurants opposed to expensive chains. We thought that the establishment would be decent since it is located in downtown Arlington Heights--it looked very quaint from the outside. Unfortunately, our dining experience was very disappointing. 

For starters, upon entering the establishment, we had to wait a long time to get seated. There was no sign of a host or hostess, and a waitress was too busy making senseless conversation with other elderly guests. She made eye contact with us several times, yet she never paused to greet/seat us.  After a few minutes of waiting patiently and mumbling profanities under our breaths, we were finally seated.

The decor and ambiance was very confusing. On the walls were amateur oil paintings that could be purchased for ridiculously high prices.  Perhaps they were attempting to support the arts in the area? The color blue was everywhere and created a drab mood and made us feel as though we were dining in a hospital cafeteria or nursing home during the 1980s. Our conclusions about the decor were confirmed when we scanned the dining room; other clientele included local elderly patrons that appeared to be regulars. In fact, my partner and I were the youngest ones there!

Our waitress was somewhat rude and intrusive. She did not offer us a lunch menu, but offered it to other tables.  We waited a long time before she came to take our order.  In fact, she walked up to our table, asked us if we knew what we wanted, we replied with a yes, and she yelled "GOOD!" and walked away to help other guests.  My partner and I were shocked.  I'm not sure if she was trying to be cute by acting all snarky, but that just doesn't work in the service industry.  Sorry.  Also, she gave us a hard time about sampling the hollandaise sauce. She claimed that their Eggs Benedict was the best and assumed we would take her word for it. The hollandiase sauce was average at best. When the food arrived, it was abundantly clear that the cooks had no idea how to poach an egg; in fact, the eggs were hard boiled. Interesting. Overall, the food was edible, but not of the greatest quality. 

We will not be dining at this establishment again.

Come for breakfast  - Dunton House is a fav, we've driven miles before - just to enjoy the down home tasty skillets or Irish Benedicts.  Now we live in town we can walk there - even better.The owners are caring locals and the waitresses have good mix of snarky wit and extra helpfulness. It's what you want in a local hometown diner.  Pass on lunch or dinner - it's not their thing.

One day we were caught in the rain from the train and decided to grab a bite here.

To sum it up, my wife and I were disappointed with the food. It wasn't horrible but slightly below average. It was bland and not really seasoned well. Service was, again, not horrible but below average. It was strange since there weren't that many people in the place at the time.

Did not leave thinking I would try here again. There are much better options in the area.

We have been going here for breakfast for over 25 years. Great food and service. Just had their pumpkin pancake special and it was delicious. This is a great place for families to get a good breakfast at reasonable prices. Oh, Best waffle in Chicago.

Love this place.  It is family owned and always has the best service! I love their ham off the bone and cheese omelette, and you can get breakfast anytime which is great! Very close to the metra also, and they have great and convenient coffee set up in the morning for us commuters.  Overall would definitely recommend to a friend!

My favorite go-to breakfast restaurant in Arlington Heights. Always great, attentive service with fast turnaround time for meal delivery. Great prices- cheaper than Egg Harbor and the new Circa 57 place (and better quality food, in my opinion)

My favorite item on the menu is the feta and spinach omelet, and I usually get a side of grilled tomatoes instead of potatoes!  Yum!
They also have a great salad bar and Friday fish fry! I also like that I can order breakfast at any point in the day, and not just at breakfast time :)

The staff is extremely personable and give you a really homey diner experience. 

Will def return and recommend you coming here!

I grew up in Arlington Heights and moved away and still crave the homemade soups. You cannot beat the tomato rosmarina or creamy tomato basil soups. Really, they are all excellent! The breakfast skillets are creative and satisfying. A perfect place to get lunch, in-house roasted turkey, thinly sliced roast beef... And their sides are all good. Sometimes I get the Greek potatoes and mashed potatoes! My favorite special is the tacos- I think on Tuesdays. But it's the service that really makes the Dunton House stand out. The owners know everyone's names and orders and even have been know to call and check on regulars when they are missing for a few days. It's a real family environment. Every time I go home and make it a priority to stop in!

not sure what compelled me to come here. i get breakfast in this area a lot but had never been here. i really wanted corned beef hash and i know none of the places around there were good for it, so i decided to try this place that was new to me. as soon as i walked in, i knew i didn't really belong. everyone there was at least fifty years older than me. nothing wrong with that, but you know when you don't belong.

i sat down and noticed a smell i didn't like. not sure what it was - maybe the food at the table behind me? anyway, i ordered the corned beef hash as planned and it was the mushed and then fried kind. not too salty though, which was good. but it was terribly greasy. i mean even more than necessary. also, i ordered my eggs poached and they came over medium. not sure if that's normal for them.

people here were nice though. my waitress was sweet and the cashier was too. i just don't think i could be back on account of the food. if i were a regular here and knew others, like everyone else seemed to, i'm sure i'd be a good place to hang out.
This place is great. The Chicken Breast Plate is delicious as well as their soups they change on a daily basis.

Except for the stale cooking oil that ruined the hash browns, everything was perfect here.  Perfect 1970's dentist reception area decor.  And, oh yes, incredible cheese omelette and pancakes!  The wait staff was, shall I say, crusty? And perfect.  I can hardly wait to return.

This is about as average a diner as one could imagine.  I can see how if this was down the street from your home you might feel an emotional attachment to this place but it really isn't anything special.
Terrible. Just absolutely terrible. I went here with my wife and daughter, and the food was horrible. Not to mention the service. It was OK. Not what I expected it to be. Won't be coming here again!

Came here for breakfast, GREAT service, food was good-what you would expect from a diner. Older crowd but no complaints here! Ordered the omelette with fruit and toast-large portion, not too greasy, not dry, not too much cheese, will be coming back soon

I've been here 4 or 5 times recently, and have been pleased each and every time.  I think I've eaten here several years ago, and it was very good then too.  Great in-town, local restaurant.  Not a chain.  Food is good, service is good, prices are fair.  On street parking (I'm not sure if there are any lots close by), I've always been able to park very close on the street (Davis).  Lot's of other businesses close by.  Right by the Arlington Hts, Metra Station (Commuter Train).  Will be back again.

I have been coming here for years!  Everything in Arlington Heights gets all stuck up and we get all of these people who forget that AH used to be a small town and Dunton House was where it was at! Same amazing food every time! I will loose a part of my childhood/life if this place ever leaves!

Great diner, everyone is so friendly!  I sat at the bar and every employee that walked by offered me coffee. My waitress called me "little one"...felt like I was at someone's house :). The food was great diner breakfast food. A hidden Heights gem!

My husband & I have been eating here several times a week for years. The food is good, the service is very friendly and the atmosphere is welcoming.  Some people mentioned that many customers are older.  Well, some are, but we regularly see people with children.  We often bring our kids &  grandchildren in too! The menu is just what you would expect for a neighborhood restaurant.  Parking has never been a problem for us either.

I really was disappointed by my stop here.  I went based on positive reviews on yelp. When my bf and I arrived, we were literally the youngest people by generations. No disrespect for people over 85, but there is a certain food quality served to cater to these clients and I didn't pay attention to that important detail. The coffee mug was dirty and my bf didn't bother asking for a new one- his issue. I asked for a skillet with hash browns and when it came it was completely obvious it was microwaved. The skillet wasn't hot and the hash browns were mushy, not even soggy as it can get from sitting too long but mushy that can only be achived from a reheat. If you are young and enjoy flavorful food, I'm afraid to suggest this place. Nice staff but very poor food.

I happened to stop here one afternoon while waiting for my train.  The atmosphere was down to easrth and relaxing, the food fantastic, and service outstanding.  There's plenty of menu options.  I recommend that you enjoy a meal there!

One of the "classier" IHOPs in my opinion. I remember my highschool days, where I'd go to a IHOP after watching late night movies, and getting into riftrafting and troublemaking.

In any case, this IHOP is right next to a hotel in good ol' South Barrington, and not so far from the AMC 30, so I would think its a pretty prime location. On the Monday evening, this place was deserted, to no surprised. Upon entering, we saw boes of Kraft Mac N Cheese on the counter -- cool that IHOP uses the same Mac N Cheese that I make for the kids, weird that they don't homemake their Mac N Cheese, although I guess we are talking about IHOP after all.  

I ordered the steak tips and eggs, that came with pancakes. IHOP boasts several flavors of syrup, and my fave is the strawberry. Super good and tasty. The steak was made to what you want it (medium for me!) and it was cooked just right. Pancakes were nice and fluffy, like I like my pillow (actually no, I like my pillow rather firm) and service was on-point

BATHROOM REVIEW: I had low expectations of the bathroom, given past IHOP bathroom experiences and Golden Nugget. But this bathroom was super clean and maintained! Sit or squat? Sit!

First time I ordered chicken and waffles here. Yummy! Our server was Edgar. He was super nice and patient. He even offered to take our credit card to close our tab... Even though I was waiting for my hubby to come back from the bathroom, so I could remind him that at IHOP we pay up front.

Been going here for a long time when we were still living here.  Not much has changed, pretty much the same as any other IHOP with similar decorations.  Its in a nice location next to a hotel and a chilis.  The staff is always nice and comes by often to ask if we need anything.  No complaints with the food but they did have the biscuits and gravy combo which not all IHOPs carry nowadays so it was a plus.  The wife had no complaints as they did have the strawberry banana french toast she wanted.  Food tasted good and came out pretty fast considering we came late night and less staff was around.  So if we have time next time we are in the hoffman estates area, definitely would stop by here again.

Ordered country omelet with a side of sausage , they brought my Olmert and the waiter realized there was no sausage or toast , well they decided to cut up some sausage and reheat my omelet to melt the sausage into it , it also took 24 minutes have the food served , this was 10:32 am  I love ihop but don't like a mess up of food

I wish I could give this IHOP a more higher rating, but it failed to impress me. Positives would be that Or waitress Brandy was excellent! She was extremely professional, pleasant, warm, and charismatic. She took pleasure in our requests and did above and beyond what a waitress should do. The hosts looked like they hated their job and didn't greet customers with a smile. I got chicken and waffles, and although my waffles weren't warm, everything else was decently good. It was the standard IHOP meal you would get at any other IHOP. The atmosphere could of been more welcoming, so that's the true downfall to this place. Finally, when the host cashed us out, she looked in a hurry, gave us no eye contact, and no smile. I probably won't come back again, but I wish the best for this place.

Every time I go there I order the sauted tilapia. Who would have thought IHOP for tilapia? Always very good. 

I am a fan.

I think if you stick with pancakes or breakfast here, you'll be happier.  I've tried a couple other things and not gotten too excited.  Most recently it was the bacon / blue cheese burger with onion rings.

No electing 'doneness' here, they cook til it's dead.  The "blue cheese" was a salad dressing, no chunks, tasted a little "off."   Onion rings were worth the stop, tho.

They have a senior BOGO daily at this location, 3-6PM, and always have a discounted senior menu with smaller portions.

Service is always great.  They have some longevity with the wait staff.

Haven't been to iHop in ages. After a night at the recording studio, there's nothing better than finding a 24 hour food pit stop. There was no one to seat us, so we sat ourselves, a little worried we might get crappy service. But, the place was slammed with families - like ours at 11pm! This was the happenin' place to be! Our server was fantastic! She put our order in right away, and we waited only a short while before our food came.

Kid silver dollar pancake meal a steal at $6 with a drink. My Colorado omelet with bacon, sausage, ham, green pepper, and cheddar was ginormous. I now have a second breakfast waiting for me with the amount I brought back home. 

The bathrooms sucked, so my rating went down. I mean totally sucked with non working toilets, some chick throwing up in the only working stall. So bad I chose to hold it. Man do I have to pee...
Food choices are great no doubt everytime we go here we always enjoy every food we try. Cousy and nice place to sit, talk and eat. but very slow service even if it's not crowded.

The place is clean, the food is decent for the price and it makes my grand daughter giggle with delight to go there for dinner. I will comment that the servers are very kind, friendly and work very hard for a few dollars in tips! Nice job servers! Hats off to you!

The service at this IHOP restaurant was extremely poor. Joshua  (IHOP employee) did not offer our family glasses of water and accentuated that our family member had been inebriated because she told him that water should be offered regardless if it's requested.  We waited over an hour for our food and no one explained the wait time or apologized for the inconvenience.  People came well after our family arrived and they were able to eat.  Never again will we  frequent this establishment!

I can honestly say this was the worst food I have ever had.  My mom and I both ordered a Colorado Omelette. They were both dried up especially the "shredded beef" on top which was basically pot roast that was a bit on the crunchy side. We asked for a side of fruit and it came off color, I figured it was just over ripe but it actually had started to ferment! You would think the waitress would have picked up on the fact that most of the food was still on the plates and we didn't even want to take it home that it might not be a good experience. So when the manager asked how it was we told him.  He took the charges off for the meals and we paid for the tea we ordered.  Now I am looking at my credit card statement and he added on the another $10.00 after the fact. Not good business at all!  If I could give this place no stars I would!
Our server was Edgar. he was extremely nice and really helped us throughout everything! will definitely be requesting him from now on!!

Well.. This was one of the most often visit IHOP for me. It's pretty good place. Service is pretty good. But the bad thing is - probably one of the more busier IHOP and hence GROUPON doesn't work here. SIgh.! Usually have an omelette with a side of flavored pancakes :)
Having a GREAT meal here with our FAVORITE waitress Christine! Always takes care of us with a smile!
It's your standard IHOP fare. Doughy pancakes and eggs at a bargain price. Service at this one was a little slow, even though it wasn't crowded

Open 24 hours with great service and food! No complaints here! The food didn't take long after ordering and it tasted good! You can't beat the food for the price here! I received my refills whenever I finished my ice tea. Nice clean bathroom and the manager was very attentive asking us how the food was and if we needed anything. This is a great place after watching a late movie showing next to AMC 30 or the bar.

Service has always been pretty decent here, given that I am usually on premises at after 1-2am. 

Its an entertaining place at this time - random suspicious characters or odd pairings make staying awake easier while having breakfast food and what should be decaf coffee... 

Yay 24 hour IHOP... thanks for the free, after hours comedy shows.

Overall ok breakfast food. My kids always get the rooty jr. I try to switch it up to taste other things but not have found a wow dish. Very bad service, waiter didnt bring soup and salad until after our meal which was kind of disappointing. The front ladies taking down the name to be seated should watch their language because when the manager came in to start seating people they didnt like it and said bad things in spanish about her.

Yes, it's an IHOP.  But when you have a server like Abraham, it's a 4 star experience! :)

We came here on a Saturday morning for the all you can eat pancakes promotion.  We had 8 people in our group and we were seated right away.  Everyone in our party ordered the pancakes, except my dad and I.  I ordered the veggie omelet (which is coincidentally the only thing keeping this from being a five star rating--it wasn't very good...) and my dad got the french toast, which he said was great.

But the pancakes--YUM!!  My four year old ate about five of them by herself, and our amazing server kept them coming!!  He really did a great job :)

The waitress kept forgetting my water, I asked for toast for my meal that she forgot to bring then when she brought it 10 minutes later my eggs were cold so I had them remake them so I can have warm eggs.  They brought me the eggs another 5 min later and they were runny not fully cooked.  The silverware was dirty and the waitress asked if I wanted something else I said forget it I'm just gonna go.  Very bad experience with very sub par food

One day, you will end up stranded in the middle of nowhere at a hotel that was chosen for the convenience and distance to a wedding.  You will take a dozen steps outside and look up passed the five lane street with no sidewalks and find not one interesting looking building let alone food place.  In the cold, in the dark, and staring at your smart phone Yelp app, knowing that you won't be able to get to all the cool Yelp places that you bookmarked, you will give in to a chain.

If you decide on iHop, you will drink gingerbread hot chocolate and enjoy delicious pumpkin pancakes with a massive dollop of whipped cream on everything.  Everything will cost about $5~$8 since you ought to be ordering breakfast.  It's flipping iHop.

You will wish that you chose a hotel closer to downtown, but you will get fat and happy.

Open 24 hours a day.

I hate giving bad reviews.  I really do.  I'm a pretty laid-back person who can look past the occasional bad experience, but...

There was a hair next to my omelet. Right there on the plate in plain, obvious sight. Just hanging out.  Like Garnish. I have a picture.  I won't post it, but the picture exists as evidence.

The hair clearly did not come from anyone's head.  To quote my cousin who was dining with me on this day, "look on the bright side, it could be from someone's armpit and not necessarily from 'down there.'"

Okay, so the hair was there.  What next?  I flagged down our server and pointed to my plate.  Her eyes opened wide, then she muttered something, whisked the plate away, and disappeared for a while (probably 15 minutes or so).  So, we sat there and waited, a little dumbfounded. 

My cousin debated eating her food.  She only took a couple bites before she realized it bothered her too.  I didn't let my kids eat their food (though they sneaked a few nibbles at the pancakes).  I know that it was just my plate that was affected, but still...I was thoroughly grossed out.

So we waited.  And waited.  Our server came back to tell me the manager would be out in a minute.  The manager appeared after another 5 minutes or so.  Said that my meal was on the house.  I should hope so...since you just took my plate away and I haven't eaten anything!!!!  But, I was still charged for the rest of the meals.  The meals that we didn't eat.  That's fine.  I paid it.  Then I went home and emailed IHOP corporate and provided them a picture of the offensive omelet hair.

They responded within a few days.  Gave me three complimentary meals at the same IHOP.  I wasn't really expecting anything, really.  Most especially, though, I wasn't expecting that I'd actually RETURN to this IHOP!  But again, I wasn't expecting anything.  A refund of the other meals would have been nice and ideal, but mainly, I wanted to make a point.  I had no desire whatsoever to eat here again.  A shame since my kids love IHOP and it's usually a great, quick, kid-friendly, wallet-friendly place for us to eat.

I caved.  We still eat at IHOP occasionally...just not this one.  I wasn't planning to ever use this comp, but we ended up back here this weekend cuz we were in the area and the kids were really hungry and they saw the IHOP sign and insisted on it. 

Second experience was a total 180 from the above experience.  Meals were hair-free, good, and service was extremely friendly.  The on-duty manager had to register my comp when it came time to pay and once she read the reason for comp, she made sure to ask about our experience this time.  I told her it was great cuz it was.  

But still.  1 star for the first experience.

The only thing IHOP, especially 24 hr IHOPs, is for drunken munchies. I refuse to eat here at any other time because IHOP food is just nasty while sober.

I gave this location 3 stars but I really should be giving them 2 because late night service really, really sucks. This, of course, is expected but c'mon.... increase your staff on weekend graveyard shifts by even 1 person.  I gave 'em 3 because many a drunken 4:30 am morning I've gazed upon the blue sign with glassy eyed gratitude.  They get the job done when I need to coat my alcohol abused stomach lining with grease.

You'll see nothing but drunk, obnoxious young adults on late weekend nights and it's fun watching the poor wait staff have to deal with them.

Oh yeah, the food is standard for an IHOP just in case you were wondering.

This is my favorite Breakfast restaurant chain.  I've been to a couple of IHOP restaurants in the city and the suburbs, and the food and service is pretty consistent.  They always serve the best Breakfast combos, and the food always comes out nice and hot.  Their pancakes are always so fluffy and warm and always a great compliment to my main meal.  

When I find myself at any of the IHOP locations, I always get the Breakfast Combo (2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 pork sausages, 2 pieces of ham, hash browns, and 2 fluffy buttermilk pancakes).  I get to sample all these items and still have my pancakes too.  Another recommendation is their  "Pick-A-Pancake Combo"  (2 eggs hash browns, and choice of 2 bacons strips or two pork sausage links, and your choice of their famous pancake (Chocolate chip, New York Cheesecake, Double Blueberry).   Their Double Blueberry pancake is to die for....ooozing with so much Blueberry goodness.  

IHOP is the best place to meet friend for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner.  Some locations are even open 24 hours.  The place is always clean, the wait staff is always friendly (at least on my experience), and the food is always great; not to mention, your not breaking your wallet.  Just be forewarned this place is a madhouse on Saturday and specially Sunday mornings, expect to be in line for a while, but still is worth the wait.

IHOP...what do you expect....want cheap food with bland taste in a mediocre stuffy place...this is your spot. The food wasn't great and the waiter did have some attitude. It reminded me why I don't go to the chain places. If I can rate this 0 stars I sure would

Hungry after a movie at AMC? Do not eat here. My orange juice was luke warm. Food was mediocre at best. Friend's pancakes were greasy. The place was cold to probably suppress the clorox cleaner smell permeating through the restaurant. Do yourself a favor and drive the extra 2 minutes to a McDonalds to grab a bite to eat.

What can I say? It's IHOP. 

However, you've never had a server like Lisa. She's the only reason my buddies and I keep coming back to this one restaurant. I request for her section every time. She's extremely attentive, makes sure everything's done the way you want it (ok, i can be a tad bit picky sometimes) and is never without her sweet smile. This establishment is very lucky to have a gem like her.
I like this IHOP. Staff is friendly, food is served hot and the restaurant is kept clean. Only ding is Hoffman Estate's high food tax-not the restaurant's fault.

Nice IHOP.  Always been a decent place to eat, even late night.  
We had an enjoyable visit here except for three drunken d-bags who kept dropping the F-bomb every other sentence.  A few death-glances in their direction managed to get them to lower their voices. 

A few minor issues were quickly resolved by our server, Jose. Iced tea was weak, and I got bacon instead of the sausage I ordered.  A plus for having Cholula sauce.

I was CRAVING breakfast food so I came here for my lunch period. I haven't been in an IHOP in about 3 years. All I can say that I don't recommend eating here... I had country fried steak and the gravy on top was cold, they forgot my toast, and my grapefruit juice was watered down. Not to mention I had to wait about 30+ minutes for my food and even longer for my check. Now I remember why I haven't gone to IHOP in years.

My boyfriend and I are regulars at this location and prefer this one over the one in Elgin because they always give you an extra biscuit with the skillets (it really is the little things that count!) Although most of their food is mediocre (you can get decent breakfast food anywhere), it's the amazing pancakes that keep us coming back time and time again. Even pancakes at "trendier" breakfast places like WIldberry can't compare to the fluffy buttermilk pancakes at IHOP.

Terrible service, gross food, and completely sad. I go to this IHOP after going to the movies near by all the time, not anymore. My waiter took forever to take our order, then still screwed up my drink, didnt even bother to deliver our food another server did that. I got the crepe combo and my eggs tasted like burnt plastic, I couldnt eat them. Server never bothered to checked on us or bring us the check. After waiting 25 minutes after finishing no one came to give us the check or check on us in general after the food was delivered. My waiter with a bunch of others were too busy hanging out in front talking to each other. We had to go up there and tell them to give us the check so we can pay and leave. It's the first time I went here and had to ever deal with this, What happened, why the hell is the manager not managing?? Worst experience I've ever had going there for years and years. And to whatever waiter kept singing in the back, I'd say don't quit your day job but you aren't good at that either so good luck. I give this place a year, if service doesn't go back to the way it use to they will be gone.

CAVEAT LECTOR:  this IHOP review is *primarily* for my fellow Biscuits and Gravy fanatics.

So it had been ages since last eating at an IHOP (fam vacation days some 20 yrs ago??) but the wife and I were coming back to Chicago after a heavy night of pre-memorial day drinking in the burbs and this seemed as good a place as any to nurse a bang on headache and coat the tummy w some greasy goodness.

French Toast, bacon and scrambled eggs with a side of B & G's.  It was delightful and just what the doctor ordered.  The Biscuits & Gravy, while not even close to best ever (which would be my mom's homemade version) were some of the better ones i've experienced in Chicagoland...this over my 10 year quest for a respectable version of these elusive Southern delights.

The Chicago B & G search continues but have to give a mention to IHOP'S version as i'd rate them a 3.5/5; will do in a  pinch if the craving comes upon you.

Way better than Denny's, and this is the IHOP I prefer in all the surrounding suburbs I've been!  The service was always great, with one waiter in particular, of Hispanic descent, whom introduced me to Cholula hot sauce for my hash browns!  It's not super hot, and has this authentic flavor I've never had before..........anyway, he brought out a few kinds, and I ended up loving that one (and his service)----I'm sorry I forgot his name!  LOL
But yeah, good food and service!  :0)

I know it's stupid to review an IHOP, we all have probably been to one at least once...so i'm not going to bore you...
but if given the choice of this IHOP or the other IHOPs within reasonable driving distance of my house, i choose this one.  the food is quick, the service is ok. it's as good as can be expected

I love this place! I dont know whats with all the negative reviews.
My gf and I always go here every Saturday morning after our work out. 
I love the smell of this place and the bagels are always fresh. I always stick to their breakfast bagel sandwiches and never had 1 complaint. 
Make sure to get here pretty early though because their Jalapeno Cheddar bagel seems to run out quick but besides that everything is good to g.

I was asked to provide breakfast for an early morning (7am) meeting of about 30 people. I visited this place on a Friday afternoon the week before the event to scope it out and see if they would be a good option.  The bagels were good, and they had a good variety. They told me that an early morning meeting wouldn't be a problem as they open at 6am, and have 2 dozen of each kind of bagel made for each day. They also said that they would be able to have coffee travelers made for large parties. This satisfied me. 

Come Tuesday morning, I went to the place at 6:30am. The place was locked, lights off, nobody even inside making bagels. Come 7am, there still wasn't anyone at the bagel shop. It says right ON THE DOOR, hours are 6am-3pm. No bagels, no coffee, locked door.

Luckily, bagels weren't the only thing I had on my menu, and I got by with everything else I had bought. But, I had to run to Starbucks on Golf Rd. to get coffee in a pinch. They didn't disappoint. 

I'm terribly disappointed in this shop. They are incredibly unprofessional. To assure a customer that everything will be ready, and then not even be available to unlock the door by an hour past opening time is unforgivable.

Each time that we have come in here, the products of choice have always exceeded expectations. There is a considerable lack of enthusiasm. This particular visit, we had bacon cross contaminated into our strawberry bagel. Which leads one to wonder about proper practices being applied. All considered, I like the place

Was very impressed for my first time here. Very friendly server. My Lox and cream cheese bagel was delicious. I bought bagel bones for my dogs and they devoured them. Looking to come here often as I am moving to Rolling Meadows.

Went this morning to give this location a second chance before posting.  The first time I went at 6:15 am. and today at 6:40 a.m. They open at 6:00 a.m.  Both times an older Asian man and woman were there and they had NO BAGELS.  They are both incredibly rude & acted like they didn't understand English.  When I mentioned it to my co-workers I was told this is normal.  I will not be back to give them another try.
Italian panini and chicken rice soup for lunch. Served fast, hot and delicious as always. Crowded on Fridays at lunch, but still fast service!

Great bagels - but do not buy the over-priced "homemade" cream cheese.  My wonderful hubby went over there about a  week ago in the morning to get bagels for a treat for us. Bagels were great.  He also purchased 2 different types of cream cheese.  One plain and one with scallions.  I was leaving for work, so I took a bagel with me & packed up some of the plain cream cheese.  I got to work about 10 min later, put my cream cheese in the fridge.  Got it out about an hour later - it was spoiled.  When I got home from work a couple hours later, I took that cream cheese back to the store.  Told the young man behind the counter - said hubby bought that morning, came home, put it in our fridge, blah, blah, blah whole story.  He says ok - gives me a refund.  What freaked me out completely was when he said that people return the cream cheese all the time because it's spoiled.  How is it then that they are still selling it?.
Got a panini. I usally dont make bad reviews but when you see you're sandwich go into a microwave and see all the goodness get zapped rite out you loose appetite. Under staffed, expensive

I used to make weekend trips to the Great American Bagel in Palatine, IL.  Unfortunately they closed down about a year ago.  Since then I have been searching for another one close to where I live & have had to settle for a few other places with terrible bagels & sandwiches.  

Then one day I remembered about this location.  I really enjoy their lox & bagel sandwich.  Each sandwich has an abundance of salmon & it is thinly sliced just the way I like it.  I also get the everything bagel & it is pretty good as well.  

They have a pretty large variety of cream cheeses & bagels here.  I really like the Jalapeno bagel & the salsa cream cheese.  These two selections go very well if you like spicy sandwiches.  

The only reason I am not giving this establishment five stars is because sometimes when they are making my lox & bagel sandwich I notice that the jar they get the salmon from has discolored salmon in it.  They have never put any of the discolored salmon on my sandwich but I wonder why it is in the jar to begin with.  

Other than that this place is big & have plenty of tables to sit at.  The staff here is pretty nice & the service is pretty quick.  I have been h ere multiple times & I plan on eating here again.
I love this location! Since the palatine one closed, this is my go to for bagels. Nothing beats a toasted cheddar bacon bagel.

Always a go-to spot for bagels when you're in the suburbs of Chicago. Everything is made fresh!

I've been coming to this location since I was a little kid and enjoyed watching them make the bagels through the glass into the kitchen. Big thrill for me!

My normal order is a turkey club bagel sandwich on cheddar herb with swiss cheese added. It never disappoints!

Definitely recommended if you're near the burbs and have a bagel craving. I always miss it now that I've moved!

OmNomNom.

Back in my earlier high school days (c 1997), believe it or not, we would take regular trips to GAB in P.E. class. (Pretty satisfying way to get a workout in!) 

I stopped in for a healthier lunch option at 2:45, 15 minutes before closing time. I was the only patron and the dude behind the counter seemed a bit frazzled. (I'm sure having a last-minute customer doesn't help things much.) Still, he had my toasted turkey + bacon sandwich ready to go in record time! I was in and out in a few minutes.  Needless to say, my tummy is quite satisfied, and I'm left wondering why I let 16 years lapse between visits! I'll be sure to make more stops when I'm in the old 'hood.

Bagel sandwich I just are kinda sucked. It was a hummus and veggie, and it was pretty much a gob of Athenos hummus 
, wet lettuce , gardinera,  tomato. All of this made the bagel soggy. Sad. I got the "super" bagel too , so it was almost 8 bucks . Feeling ripped off is a sucky feeling. Never again

The bagels are always warm and I like the cream cheeses. Also, it's around the same cost as Dunkin' Doughnuts.

Edit: I spent about $10 buying 6 bagels and a small tub of cream cheese for the office. The general consensus was that the bagels kicked ass.

I was so excited when I saw that there was an A Great American bagel shop near my home and it opened at 6 am. So I thought I would try it this morning and when I walked in there were no bagels in their cases and no one came to the front of the store. I waited 5 min and left.  I saw them walk into the store as I pulled up but wonder if they were just starting to make bagels at 6?
So I went out of my way to another location that actually where fully stocked and ready to serve the public. If you're an early riser don't go to this location.

This place is nasty. I haven't been there in years and I certainly won't be going back again after today. The owners are very cheap and the place is understaffed.  These people have no idea what customer services. And don't look up at the ceiling cuz you'll probably find it. Many of the ceiling tiles are brown because of water damage. The people behind the counter do not know what they're doing and they are very cheap and unfriendly.  It's just this one location that is a problem. I have been to at least four or five other locations and my experience was much better.

These bagels are the best.  I go at least once a week!  They taste fresh and are always satisfying.  I brought a box of bagels with boxes of coffee to my staff, and they absolutely loved it.  There occasionally is a small line, but it goes quickly.  Satisfied!

My kids and I visit this bagel store every once in awhile for lunch.  We enjoy sitting behind the window to watch the bagels being made.  I believe the bagel sandwiches are made fresh every morning so they are well worth the price.

The freshest bagels around. I don't know what bagel stores bake their bagels fresh every day. The bagels here are BAKED FRESH EVERY MORNING with SO many selections, even seasonal varieties. I don't know what Lee W. is writing about. He/She doesn't know what he's talking about. Everything, everything, EVERYTHING is fresh here, right down to the vegetables that are used in the sandwiches. The owners are very generous in all of their toppings. They have a great drink selection too. Check out the refrigerator case or try the Java iced coffee. Fresh bagels served with a smile. Don't miss out!

It's been a while since I came in, and it seems the new management knows what they are doing, especially since the last time I was in. For some reason it says closed on yelp but I was their on 9-20-16
Starters:
Pakora and Medu Vada-perfectly crispy and crunchy
Main course
sizziling Tandoori Chicken and the super tasty bed of onions under it hit the spot with some nice fluffy yet crumbly naan and some butter chicken which  put me over the edge in a heavenly food coma. 

Dessert-mango lassi to wash it all down and i  headed home to  sleep as if I just had my last meal for a deep hibernation

My wife really liked the food at this restaurant.  Then we went in shortly after the new management took over.  We were blown away that they no longer offered papadum complimentary appetizer.  It was the very first and only restaurant that charged for what is considered complimentary to all other restaurants.   When I asked to speak to an owner or manager about this, I was pretty much told there is nothing that anyone could do and the manager wouldn't talk to me.  

Then we went a second time, just to give the new management a chance.  Again, I was completely thrown another wild curve ball when I they tried to sneak tilapia in a fish curry which was supposed to contain mahi mahi.  Considering this dish is only made with mahi mahi, it is clear the cook knew what he was doing.  When I shared my disappointment to the waitress, she gave me a blank look, said nothing, and looked powerless over this manipulative switcharoo.  I could tell she wanted to say something, but wouldn't.  

Consider this a warning to all, make sure you get what you ordered.  Otherwise, you may very well get a primary ingredient switched on your for a cheaper and less tasty substitute.  

This is type of treatment you would expect at a cheap cut-rate restaurant.  I am so disappointed, because the food is usually really good.

India Bhawan has the best butter chicken that I've ever encountered. The sauce is smooth, rich and intricately layered with flavor from coriander to ginger and cinnamon. I order the butter chicken with the garlic naan every time. The naan is crisp and flaky on one side but nicely buttered and garlicky on the top side. Their standard jasmine rice is al dente and perfectly cooked.

I've tried the goat chettinad which was flavorful but crept up on your tastebuds which heat and formidable presence. If you can handle the heat and spice, go for it. India Bhawan takes up a sizable portion of the strip mall but it is beautiful on the inside with nicely appointed adornments. 

Their bathrooms are glitzy to say the least but impeccably clean. I haven't ventured to the bar area but their house wines are pretty tasty for the money. Be prepared to split dishes because their portions are large. Yelp has a free appetizer (vegetable pakora) if you do their checkin.

My parents have raved about this place so I had to check it out.  I have been here twice now but the food just hasn't met my expectations.  I would like to give it 2.5 stars.  The service was okay but the food did not taste right overall.  Some items were okay, others weren't.  For example, one time I went and asked for a spicy Malai Kofta dish, it came out mild and sweet tasting.  And after it was sent back, it came back out with more cumin taste then red chili powder taste.  I am generally not a picky eater and don't criticize about my food unless it stands out (in a bad way).  I did like their Indian style specialty pizza.  They are not bad.  Some of their apps like Chicken 65, Chili Paneer, and Andhra Cut Mirchi are good.

Am not sure if I'll return here anytime soon.  A part of me says to give it a one more time.  Maybe a third will be a charm.  Who knows?

We went for dinner tonight. The food wasn't that great at all. Most of the dishes were either to hot or too sweet. We had butter chicken which is a pretty standard Indian dish. The dust was extremely sweet and the sauce was not fresh at all. Sorry we are not going back. I heard they had a change in management. Whatever it is if the don't change the chef I doubt if they came er become profitable or can stay in budiness

Took my mom here for the buffet.  Both of us love Indian food.  The appearance of this place is excellent.  The buffet was good, especially the fried appetizers but some of the main dishes are sweet when they shouldn't be.  I've never had butter chicken that was sweet before.  It was strange.   I've only been here once but it is close to my office so I will give it another try and revise review.

First time visit-stopped in on the way home from work, spoke to the manager. Took a menu home and the family said "Let's try it out." We are all very glad we did.
We ate fish, chicken and lamb curries, different styles. Really, really tasty, a nice bite to the curry but after completing our meals, there was no lingering burn which we often found at other places.
Service very courteous.
We'll definitely go back. It's so close to home!

I LOVE chicken tikka masala. It's one of the only things a picky eater like myself likes at an Indian Restaurant. I had a favorite place. It closed. I finally found another favorite place, and then it too closed. I found this place through Yelp a while ago and was finally able to try it a couple days ago! SO happy i did. 

We ordered for carryout. My son went to go pick it up, he said the interior of the restaurant was really nice. I was a little worried, because the reviews are like either 1-star or 5-stars, seems like people either love it or hate it. 

Chicken Tikka Masala: was a little bit more yellow than i like, so i was nervous when i opened the container. But i have to say it was DEEEE-LICIOUS!! My son and i both really, really enjoyed it. It was creamy and buttery and fabulous! Lots of flavor, just a smidge of spice. Based on this first experience, It's right up there in my top three ever. I was a little disappointed in the size of the serving, when you're paying $15 for some chicken i guess i kinda expected a little larger container. Ultimately with the extra rice and sides i purchased, it ended up feeding two of us. If we had not gotten sides though, there's no way it would be enough for two people. 

The Garlic Naan was BEAUTIFUL! Is that weird to say about bread?! lol. See picture. It was truly the most beautiful presentation of naan i've ever had. It tasted really nice, as well. Very pleased with the naan. 

Samosa: wasn't my favorite. I still have one left, i'm going to heat it up and try again, but it just had a little different taste than i'm used to. I usually love samosas. I need to try and put my finger on what I don't like about this one, and then will update. 

Overall, i think it's a tad expensive. However from a quality perspective - it was really good food! I am definitely excited to try it again! Looking forward to it.

Tip: per their website, looks like they do deliver! Never seen an Indian delivery place - i think it's great! Unfortunately, i'm sure we're too far away so we'll have to pick it up. But that's fine. 

Definitely worth the try!!

Visited on a recent Saturday evening. People at my table ordered different types of dosa, vada, and paneer tikka.  Pleasantly surprised by the overall quality and portion sizes. Dosas were crispy and paneer was creamy. Sambhar recipe may need to be tweaked.... It seems mild, and needs more spice and tangy flavors. Service was responsive but key staff seemed extremely busy. 
There was a private party that evening in the main dining area. This created a huge noise factor for diners (family members singing with microphones). We requested staff to shut the doors between the party venue and the dining area but they did not.  If I go back to this restaurant I will call in advance and check if the restaurant is hosting a party that evening.

I went here last night with two other ladies and we were thoroughly underwhelmed. I am sad to write them a bad review since it seems like so many people love this place and also because I love the other location Clay Oven Tandoor in Long Grove. I was not a fan of this location because the service was inattentive and slow. Also, the food was not very impressive and a tad bit on the pricy side for what you get.

Let's start with the service. We sat around and waited for a while before we got water, then sat a while again before we were able to place our order. It also took 40 minutes for our food to come out. One of the dishes wasn't even warm when it came out.  My water glass sat empty for a while and I had to ask multiple times for it to be filled, but they kept forgetting. I love Indian food and I was not a fan of my dish. We were all disappointed in our meal. 

I might go back and try the lunch buffet, but I'm not sure if it is worth it.

Ordered delivery twice from this restaurant.. Both times food was delivered 1.5 hours late and they do charge a delivery fee!  When I called the delivery is always 10 minutes out. Also one of the delivery was missing rice for the two curries.... Decent food, really bad service.

DONT have business hours up for Monday if your aren't open on Monday. Hours for Monday are posted on both Yelp and Grubhub. Ordered food on Grubhub - the order went through with an estimated delivery time. Two hours later and still no food. Called the restaurant with no answer. Had to call Grubhub and after 10 minutes on the phone with them they find out they're closed on Mondays. I was looking forward to trying this place. Disappointed with their poor communication skills and attention to detail.

Despite the numerous Indian restaurants in the area, this place is in a category by itself. Don't be deceived by the stop mall location, the inside of the restaurant is gorgeous with modern decorations, high ceilings and huge amount of space. 

Next the service: in one word Excellent! We were fortunate to have Rocky as our waiter and he was the best!  He was attentive, informative, and just the right amount of interactive. He made great food recommendations and really knew the menu well. 

The food....an upscale unique interpretation of Indian food.....simply said AWESOME.  The cut mirchi was such so uniquely made I was blown away. The quantity of paneer tikka appetizer was enormous and soooo freaking tasty. A little spicy but it was perfect for me. The bullet naan was soft and had a nice hint of spice. 

Overall a very classy upscale Indian restaurant with excellent food and even better service. The prices are a little higher than the average Indian restaurant, but you are getting TWICE the quantity, so keep that in mind when ordering. We can't wait to go back again.

Horrible food . We went for buffet and they used stale meat my daughter got sick with food poisning . Gives reason for empty restaurant . Staff was yelling at owner for non payment of there paycheck . Will never go back

New Indian pace in Palatine. Just two words!!! Mind Blowing!!! The food and service is top notch. We tried tandoori chicken and chicken tikka masala,both were perfectly spiced and yummy.
The restaurant is beautiful and huge. Service is attentive and courteaus. Will definately be back soon.

Went to this place over a weekday lunch buffet and thought it was decent enough to return. They didn't have the dish we wanted in buffet selection so decided to do takeout instead. Mind you their entire buffet is $11.99 which includes a bunch of items, bread etc at the table, and 2 people could eat heartily in less than $30 with tip.

We decided to do 2 dishes in takeout and paid just over $30 for these, no bread/naan..just the dishes, and all we got was a lousy leftover container with the food. This is the same amount of food I usually get after I've already eaten as leftover at other places like Gaylord or India House. For the amount of money charged for each dish, the quantity is not even enough for a single person. Sorry quantity, mediocre taste, decent ambience... would never do this place for a-la-carte, if at all.

Having said that, buffet is decent in terms of spread, so anyone going there stick to that.

I was at the restaurant yesterday for buffet and was thoroughly impressed with the amazing food. New management is just awesome. Chana masala, paneer, pakoras and Naan - all were just brilliant. Highly recommend. Best food after long time.

I'm so confused with what do I start with for this great place I visited during my recent Chicago trip.  
I knew Amit from his Tamarind court days, while I was staying in Niles, so thought of trying this new project of his.
We went on a Wednesday night, as I desperately wanted to try their South Indian buffet. I had some friends from the southern part of India. 
Impeccable service and awesome food would be too little to describe our experience.
My friends said the food tasted like home though miles away, & guess what they serves unlimited dosas complimentary along with the buffet.
We tried Goat chettinad, & was just speechless. So was the idli & vada's.
Our server Patricia was guided well through our dinner.    
Great job India bhavan, & kudos Amit , looking forward for the next visit already.

New Indian place in town - we are sure gonna be there. And so it was for dinner yesterday.

Like many others have pointed out it is a new restaurant and one section of the restaurant was still undergoing reno as we were dining. This was a tad annoying at times with the drilling sound.

We ordered the Medhu Vada, Onion Pakora, Chicken 65, Paper Masala Dosa, Onion Rava Dosa and Chicken Chettinad with Naan. 

What we thoroughly enjoyed :::: were the Medhu Vada, Onion Rava dosa and Naans. The vada was fluffy & crunchy! The Onion Rava Dosa was superb in texture and taste.

The rest of the food items were good but nothing extraordinary. The Chicken 65 tasted like a simple chicken fry tossed with curry leaves. The Paper Masala Dosa was over done on one side. This biggest disappointment was the Chicken Chettinad which was loaded with pepper and other Indian spices. Those flavors were very dominant and did not allow us to enjoy the dish. This was such a shame since the chicken itself was juicy and very nicely cooked.

Food service was a tad slow as well.

An OK experience overall. Am hoping to try the restaurant once they are well set up and hopefully have another favorite in India Bhawan.
Worst experience I ever had today...atleast not one of item is fresh ... Biryani smells bad.I left that without eating.

First visit will not be the last. Excellent quality food. Good service. A bit spicy for some, but perfect to me. Lots of veg options. Lots if no wheat options. Interesting choices too like goat - but regulars like chicken tandoori. Very nice spot for dinner. Easy parking too.  Eat here!!

Trusting the reviews I went to this restaurant, the food is so mediocre, the naan are pre cooked and heated, the Vada is made from spoilt batter, the deserts are bad...

On top of this they charge a tip for the buffet, on your bill for 5 or more pax.

When asked the owner says he does not pay his servers and they are paid only by tips.

Who charges you tips for a buffet.

It's a rip off


I understand Amit., but my concern is, If it's called a tip or gratuity it must be negotiable. 

My objection was on two levels. First, the mandatory nature of a fee for service that's generally expected out of a buffet restaurant. Second, I usually tip 10-15%. I could be persuaded to tip by a suggested tipping. But when it comes to mandatory tipping it's more of a service charge and not a tip which is usually at my discretion.

Have gone for Buffet several times now and have not been disappointed. The buffet is very large with a wide variety of Indian favorites. Nice balance of Veg and Non-Veg items. The head chef is- in a word--Amazing! Spice level is generally on the high side which I appreciate. Tandoori Chicken brought sizzling to the table and Dosa available for asking. Rarely do I encounter Northern and Southern cuisine on the same buffet so expertly prepared. The atmosphere of the restaurant is clubby and cool...Very nice. Large space. Comfortable and friendly. Highly recommended!
The food was so  delicious and it's worth money of quantity I would highly  recommend server name was patty she was very friendly also

This restaurant is beautiful because of the ambience and lights. It has beautiful chandeliers and colored lighting that changes throughout our meal. Definitely a good idea for a date night! The food was great and came in large portions with 3 choices of naan bread, garlic, butter and herb, but you have to pay extra for it, it doesnt come with your meal. 
The wait staff was very attentive, but we waited longer then I expected to get our food and the resaurant wasnt crowded at all. Also the wait to get our check was longer then expected as well. I like that they have two different menus because they also have a bar section of the restaurant with a bar menu. 
If you choose you can have bar food, like burgers, salads and appetizers. Or if you'd like indian food you can choose that menu in the restaurant. I am going back and this place can easily become one if my favorites.

We ate buffet here. Starters were pretty decent and they served us hot dosas which was very impressive unlike other restaurants where they just make it beforehand and put it out there. Moving on to main course, I'd say they have very good options for vegetarians. I loved malai kofta, one of the best I've eaten so far in US. Everything was flavorful. However, we reached at around 2:30 so couldn't really enjoy the food as much as we wanted to but it was good. Thumbs up.

I went back yesterday, and was much more pleased with my experience! There was butter chicken that day, so I was in luck! The servers were better at refilling everything. The tandoori chicken was fresher. I still wasn't asked if I wanted a drink, though. The servers could be a little more prompt at emptying the table. There were still a few dishes that left something to be desired, the one that stuck out from my yesterday was the hard rasgulla and watery korma. My two lunch buffets experience there demonstrate the buffet items range from amazing to just okay.  Keep up the amazing things, and take out the not so great things! Therefore, I'd like to take my 3 stars to 4!

Indian Bhawan has great food. We first went on a Saturday night. Although it was eerily empty, the decor was modern and the staff made us feel quite welcome. We ordered masala dosa for an appetizer and it was sooo good. It was a huge portion and presented with hot Sambhar and coconut chutney. Yum! Then we ordered paneer tikka masala and bhindi amchur. While the paneer was tasty, the okra was amazing. Probably the best we ever had. We had plenty to take home for leftovers. After our meal, we decided that we had to come and try the lunch buffet. So we went on a Saturday afternoon. The options were plentiful and some things were spicier than I could handle but still, the food was great. Hot, fresh naan and tandoori chicken were brought to our table too. We left with happy tummies. 

All and all, the food is a tad expensive but is really, really tasty and we recommend it.

Visited India Bhavan today for their Lunch buffet with a group of 6. The ambience is great and spacious. Well that's the only good part of it. Although we were a group of 6 we were crammed up into two tables which could barely fit all our plates and glasses. There was no place for the breads, dosas and tandoori chicken which came in later. We just had to juggle everything between the little space we were left with. When we asked the server if he could add another table so that we could ease out he bluntly replied that it's Friday and we have lot of folks coming in. Well the place had quite a lot of tables vacant and they remained the same till we had left.

Now coming to the food, there was a lot of variety and almost equal options for both veg and non veg food items. But unfortunately just having lot of options is not good, it also needs to have some taste. The goat curry, chicken curry and tandoori chicken were very low on salt and not very tasty. Tandoori chicken had almost gone dry, probably was sitting on the sizzler for a long time. Other items were ok, didn't find anything that caught our attention.I have had better Indian food in the vicinity. Most of the folks on our table were visiting for the first time and were not too impressed with the experience. I think the place is still new and has a good scope to improve.

Forget about all of your other Indian restaurants in all of Chicago. This place is absolutely the best. There is not a dish on the buffet that was not amazing. Even if it's not your kind of thing, even if you think you would never like it, try it, because you will either like it, or you still won't like it because it's not your thing, but you will try to like it because you want to because it's so damn good.

I would have taken photos of the food, which I like to do, but I ate it too fast and I couldn't stop myself, so no pictures. Just go eat it. Don't even take a picture of it. Just eat it. Today. Do it. Go.

Spouse and I have lived in many places where Indian food is ample and wonderful. This is the best Indian food we've had in nearly 20 years. Why are you still reading this review? Push the button for directions and go.

The restaurant seems pretty unassuming from the outside - located in a small strip mall, in a space that was initially going to be an italian restaurant. When you walk in, though, it has a large spacious, beautiful interior - with a large bar area to the right, an even larger dining area to the left, and a small party room in the back. The decor is what I loved most about this place! It's sparkly, a modern touch, just beautiful - very different from what you would expect from an indian restaurant - word is, they kept the decor from the italian restaurant that was going to open there prior to them - LOVE it!

We went for the lunch buffet to try as much as we could. There were plenty of items to choose from - Chaat, fruit, salad, samosas, pakoras, gobi manchurian, rice, idli, sambar, chutneys, raita, 5 veg entrees, 5 meat entrees, gulab jamun, ras malai, and fruit custard. They bring fresh masala dosas, naan, and tandoori chicken to the table if you want any of them. The food was decent, not the best I've had but definitely not the worst. The samosas were small and delicious! Chaat was pretty good. I really enjoyed the gobi manchurian so I looked past the extreme oiliness. Idli, sambar, and chutney were fine - nothing to write home about. The dosa was a decent size, yet contained maybe half a cup of the masala, which itself was pretty tasteless to begin with. Wednesdays are dosa night, and judging from these dosas - I wouldn't want to go out of my way for that. The veg entrees were palak paneer, dal makhani, mushroom muttar, potato fry, and navratan korma. I absolutely loved the navratan korma: Extremely flavorful! The mushroom mutter was pretty good. The palak paneer is usually my favorite, but didn't have much flavor other than the spinach and paneer, the dal makhani was extremely tasteless, and the potato fry was nearly inedible due to how extremely spicy they made it. Another table heard me talk about the spice after downing a glass of water and they agreed that they couldn't even finish one bite. The fresh naan was great. Dessert was pretty good.

Overall, food was decent - not the best, but there were definitely items I enjoyed. I have never heard of sit down indian restaurants serving pizzas, but they do - and I'm intrigued - I will probably come back to try those at some point when visiting my parents again in the suburbs!

If the owner reads this - seriously, do you know where all that decor is from?? LOVE! :)

By far the best Indian food in the area. I frequent a lot of Indian restaurants so I know what's really good. The selection on the buffet was very good and fresh. The staff is exceptionally professional and will stop to answer any questions. I just spoke with a cook and I think an owner who each came over to ask how I enjoyed my meal. 

Please give this place a try. We.want to keep them around. The decor is very nice too. You won't be disappointed.

I love Indian food and have been to many if not all in the area. After reading the reviews I was hopeful that India Bhawan would not disappoint, but sad to say I was terribly disappointed.  

From the beginning we waited in the entrance for longer than one would expect for a restaurant that was pretty slow for that time of night on a Friday.  When we were seated the waiter (didn't have a name tag) kind of tossed the menus in a pile at us and walked away.  We ordered as soon as he appeared, which took so long the hostess came to our table to see if anyone had taken our order.  The chickpea bread with the sauces was very good, but when it was 30 minutes and we STILL hadn't seen any food we grabbed a server and asked for more and also asked that our water glasses be refilled.  That took 10 minutes and STILL no food.
