Took about an hour for our food to arrive and I can't speak for the rest of my party (though they probably would have eaten the tablecloth they were so hungry) but my Aloo Gohbi (cauliflower and potatoes in a creamy spicy sauce) was probably some of the worst I have ever experienced.  The sauce was hot but the cauliflower and potatoes were warm at best.  The cauliflower was noticeably scant in this dish that had an over abundance of UNDER COOKED potatoes.  I thought the price $13 for a mostly potato dish was over the top.  Again waiter MIA so I asked the hostess if we could get our bill and a takeout box (thought I would take my potatoes home and cook them).  After a few minutes our waiter appeared from the bathroom reeking of smoke and offered to box my leftovers, I declined, paid the bill and left.

My wife and I came here last month and absolutely enjoyed our meal. Our server, Rocky was courteous and attentive. The food was better than anything we ever had on Devon in the city, sorry to all those who love Mysore Woodlands, Tiffin Kitchen, and Shera Punjab, but this place was wayyyyyy better!  

We ordered the Baingan Bhartha, Appetizer Sampler, Mango Lassi and Okra Stir Fry, plus Onion Paratha. Everything was AMAZING!!!

The owner, Amit came over to greet us and ask how everything was which was a great touch.  Our server, Rocky made our experience fun and memorable. This place will do extremely well and I wish Amit, and his wonderful staff much success!  We will definitely return!!!
Beautiful establishment.  We had takeout and it was delicious!  Friendly staff.  Will come back for dine in.

We hosted a party at India Bhawan for 80 people and it turned out to be a memorable event with good food and music and very well coordinated by Amit Thanks to Amit and Staff 

Looking forward for  Holi party :)

Their lunch buffet is delicious.  Great selection of different vegetarian options along with curries, chicken, goat.  I like how they bring the naan and tandoori chicken to your table too. We've been going back on a regular basis because the food is delicious.

Amazing Great tasting food. Nice interior. Owner was even nice. However I am not taking any stars away but as other Indian Restaurent they lack in their service. Hopefully they will take this opportunity from this comment to make it even better. But we did got ok service. Nothing bad. Definitely recommend this Restaurent. We will be back for sure for their dosa and pizzas too.
Excellent food ! Loved the service and the options. The tandoori chicken was better than some of the places in india. Highly recommended.!!
Very good new restaurant. . I like food and ambience.. specially service they're offering.. one of the best restaurant I visited.

The tandoori style meats are all I order from this establishment and it's the best in the area.  The prices are a little high but you do get quite a lot of food for the money per dish. The ambience is great as well.  Great bar section with many televisions to watch sports!

We love this place so much! Great tasting food! we ordered out from this place 3 weeks in a row! Food quality is fantastic, portion size is amazing and the staff is extremely polite & courteous. The bar tender, Kourtney took great care of us ( I hear she is no longer there) and made special drinks for us even though it wasn't in the menu! The owners themselves are out there running their business and mingling with their staff and customers. Very hands on! There is a separate section on the other side of the bar that serves american finger foods , so this place suits to a wide variety of customers with unique taste palette. Huge place witha separate section downstairs for group events etc.Great ambiance, great service. I highly recommend this to everyone! I would done in or do take out from them every day if I could!
Food great. Service, not that great. Atmosphere classy. Price HIGH!
I just spoke with Nick, the owner.  A new manager, Boney, has been hired and they have reopened as of 20 September.  Welcome back India Bhawan and bring on the buffet lunches again!!

Great food! Very few resturaunts will make authentic dhum biryani the proper way, homemade style and this resturaunt hands down has the best biryani and mango lassi (they use rose water essense) we found this resturaunt on a whim and it surpassed all expectations, decor food quality taste and service. A must try!
Overall Good. Great Buffet. Great ambience. Most dishes are tasteful. This location has been our preferred place to eat. Would definitely recommend. Worth a try

Love the India bhawan food.Had Chicken Hari mirch and Chicken Briyani.It was so yummy. I would highly recommend the server name is  Roque Britto.. He made great food recommendation and really knew the menu well.Highly recommend!!
Chaya

This is for a Sunday lunch buffet. We reached here when they were about to close. Wide spread of food than any other Indian restaurants. Chicken 65 was very delicious. They serve naan bread, masala dosa and tandoori chicken to the table. Very attentive staff. Will definitely go back for the buffet. They catered food for VKK event in lemont, delicious authentic South Indian food. Overall 5 stars this time.

Definitely my favorite Indian restaurant in the area...and it seems to be the only place to serve garlic naan in Palatine! The decor and dining room are surprisingly grand and spacious. It is not what you would expect to find in a strip mall....nor is it a carry-out kind of place. The colored lighting is slightly odd and would be better suited in a night club...but it's also kinda fun. Be prepared for a doggy bag because the dinner portions are large. The Chicken Tika Masala is my go to dish and is always spot on. My only complaint is that you have to pay an extra fee if you want/need another serving of rice.

The food is great and the staff is extremely friendly. Also a great atmosphere. Ask for Rocky as your server. He makes sure you are happy and does everything he can to make sure you have the best service

Went there for the Sunday lunch buffet. Pretty large spread of options and they bring fresh tandoori chicken,nan and even dosas to your table. I've definitely had better tasting dishes but overall we were pretty happy and probably will be coming here again.

I have been a customer of india bhawan from day one and make it a point to eat here at least once in now twice a week. 
The restaurant is a new one and all my visits have been just great when it comes to food and service. I have had their executive lunch buffet about 7 to 8 times and all the times I've just been impressed with the quality and the spread. Also, I have dined in 5 or 6 times including their dosa  night on Wednesdays and have nothing but great things to talk about this place from the ambiance to food to service. 
Lately, I have seen some reviews which are not that great but then we can't be rating a place on just one visit. It took me few times to realize that they have been getting better and better day by day as they are getting busier too.  We all have our days and so does a new place. Give them some time and if they are consistent in what they are doing they will do well.
I wish you guys at India Bhawan all the very best and much success, we needed a good restaurant in this area and there you are.
Get some more specials like your dosa night and try harder.
Cheers..

I would have to agree with some of the other reviews that the service is subpar.  The food was ok but not always fresh.  I ordered lentil soup which was reheated. The few other times I went the food was ok but service needs to be improved.

Went with some co-workers here for their lunch buffet.. What a surprise! Beautifully decorated, incredibly friendly staff, and a wide open room with plenty of seating. It's hard to tell from the outside, but this place is definitely legit - great ambiance despite being in a strip mall.

The buffet was out of this world, not only in terms of taste, but in variety of dishes. Somehow, they managed to keep everything high quality and fresh, despite having a gigantic table full of different curries. I went back for seconds, thirds, and fourths, until I couldn't fit anything else into my stomach. 

I definitely recommending coming and trying this place out. I'll definitely be back soon.

I came for a banquet and found the food to be good. Only concern is that they had no one at the front to guide regular buffet guests to another room. Instead I watched the person who was paying for the banquet have to tell people where to go.
India Bhawan has great tasting food Lamb Rogan Josh is a great plate!!!, staff very professional, and the decor is beautiful! Highly recommend!!

Love the food with so many great choices. Indian pizza is amazing!  Had the chicken tandoori pizza which was delish and can't wait to try to the vegetable kadai pizza next.  Tandoori chicken entre is awesome and loved tandoori veggies too but they can come very spicy so you may need to ask to tone them down.  Patty is an awesome server and took great care of us.  Have a decent wine selection too!

My wife and I went to the Sunday buffet brunch today, and really enjoyed the experience. Food was very good, and at $13.99 per person, we thought it was an outstanding deal. We've also had the takeout, and the food was also very good, but not nearly as good a bargain as the buffet. I'd recommend either.

We went for a father's day brunch. The service is horrible. Had to wait 20 minutes for Naan. The place is decorated nicely but they are just understaffed and poorly managed. Tandoori chicken was not included in the buffet which I have never seen and i have eaten a lot of buffets:) The buffett 16.99 which is expensive. This is my second experience and both have been poor.

It was OK. Came with family here for first time, the only curry that was acceptable flavor for us was basic dal. Vada and dosa was averagae, desert was OK, I was expecting more taste for the price. I don't plan to come to this place ever again. I would give 11 out of 10 for cleanliness, service and ambience tho. I would give 2 out of 10 for taste.
Great new Indian food option that does not serve food in a polypropylene tray and in an atmosphere full of Indian spices, but still fresh!  Friendly service, roomy and nice decor!
Easily the best Indian I've had in the suburbs.

Just moved out from the city and went to Devon Ave a lot. This place is great!!! I had veggie samosas, chicken vindaloo with rice and naan. 
A+, will repeat! Great service and relaxed atmosphere and good tea too!

Very decent buffet options. I loved the breakfast items like idli and dosa. I generally thing if the buffet is pretty good, the dine would be much better even, which I am yet to try. They even have a trendy lounge area/sports bar. I loved the authentic Indian aura in the restaurant. The place was bigger than a usual indian restaurant.

Weekday lunch buffet is a pretty good deal for $15 (tax included). Should be cautious about Dosa takeouts as the Sambhar seems to have been made in the morning and not stored well. Found it very pungent , and quite different from how it is served during the buffet.

That's the only downside I've seen so far. No other complaints.

From the tasty mango lassi to the perfectly fried vegetarian appetizer platter to the delicious aloo tikki masala and paneer, this restaurant is a suburban gem and deserves a try!!! Ask for rocky, one of the kindest servers we've had the pleasure of meeting!!

Service is good,but there are very few options available in the menu. The taste is very average when it comes to buffet. Dosas are good, but not the  best. Only limited number of choices available when it comes to buffet and even dosa. Not really my best choice, I would give 2.5/5
Delicious lunch buffet. Clean place, good service and most of all great tasting food :) Welcome addition to the neighborhood

Mediocre food but great ambience! Went these late in the evening with friends and family. The service is terribly slow and the chicken starters tasted chewy and not cooked. The biryani was ok but the gravy dishes were very ordinary. The bar is one of the biggest I have seen for an Indian restaurant in the suburbs.

Overall very good. Nice quality people providing great service. Rice crepes were yummy. Food is definitely unusual so if you're not adventurous it may not be for you. If you are it's definitely worth trying as its quite good. I do wish that they would provide some description of what it actually is besides just the name of the dish. Overall good experience.
Best place to eat authentic Indian food...it has amazing sports bar and fine dining. I have waited long time to have good restaurant in and around this area...

Went there for the first time to watch a cricket match. The staff, manager and owner were all very friendly and courteous. The bar section of the restaurant was pretty good.  There were about 20+ TVs  around the bar and gives a good viewing experience from any place in the bar.  The restaurant was big compared to other Indian restaurants in the area.  There was ample space between the tables and did not feel cramped.  The ambiance was great and the restaurant looked a little upscale.  We went for a buffet lunch and the spread was generous.  The food overall was good in general but I particularly liked chicken 65 and rasgulla a lot. If you like Indian food you should definitely try this restaurant once.
Dosa night didn't have chutney at all. No white rice too.. Tomato chutney and chicken gravy was raw. Not cooked properly.. Disappointed!!!
Looks Fancy from inside and out. Food was horrible and the service was super horrible. Will never go to this place ever again.

This is really yummy. Reasonably priced. Extremely good service. I felt terrible when after sampling the Wednesday night buffet, I didn't care for it. I was told it was no problem and they were glad I tried it. They then made me a perfect paneer makhani. Beautiful decor too!

Loved all the food.. There was plenty to choose from. They even bring out fresh sizzling chicken.. Really liked this place. The service is great too. The place was pretty packed on a early Saturday afternoon.

Got carry out last night and everything was terrific. Food was ready and waiting for me, and it was hot and delicious. Can't wait to come back and try the lunch buffet. We have been disappointed with other Indian places in the area and are so relieved to have found this place.
Tried this place for  a Sunday lunch buffet.  The food was excellent, the service knowledge.  The variety is one of the best I've ever seen, particularly in the desert
Great food! Absolutely delicious! Ordered for delivery- food arrived on time, portions are big enough to feed more than one person.

Food was excellent, service was very good. Nice atmosphere. 
I will be coming back soon.

I had dinner with my family in this beautiful restraunt last weekend and we loved everything about it from ambience to service and the best part was food. 
This place is huge and very beautifully done, high ceilings, well lit, classy interior and the washrooms were just wow.. I got a chance to peak inside the kitchen and just to tell you all, unlike other Indian places their kitchen is spotless clean and again huge. I was surprised to learn that they are a Indian restaurant but their amazingly beautiful bar had a totally American menu and we tried some stuff from the bar too and gosh!!! One of the best burgers I've ever had. Fresh and juicy with lots of sides. 
Now coming to the Indian food which I found one of the best in the U.S. Their portions are huge like the restaurant, kid you not. Every Indian place I've been to give you 16 oz bowls or copper handis, this place each entree is 24 oz and you get basmati rice on every table. Chicken tikka masala and Kadai chicken were to die for, chilli paneer and mix grill top notch, dal panchratni was flavorful and one of the best soft naans. Prices are comparable to other upscale Indian places with double the quantity of food. Overall 5 stars and the servers were so friendly and knowledgeable that added a cherry to the icing. A must visit if you want to enjoy some hard core Indian food with classy setup.

Stopped by for lunch here while I visited Chicago for work. I noticed that restaurant was new from the Yelp page, as well as the clean and elegant interior space. Service was friendly and prompt. The main reason I stopped by was because of the lunch buffet, which I am glad to say is worth it. I stopped in around 1:30, and all the buffet stations were filled with steaming hot food. The food itself was filling and flavorful. I especially enjoyed the chicken makhani, with it's nice thick gravy. Naan was hot, soft, and moist. 

Definitely will stop again once I'm back in the area.

My wife and I took my son here on Sat. He said the same thing I did the first time coming here. He said per word... The spice level was perfect and the flavors were perfect. He loved it. And as usual my wife and I loved it as usual. This is our home for great. Indian food. A matter of fact, while we were in the restaurant he was texting his wife to be and was telling her, how he can't wait to bring her to the restaurant. He loved it. And of course I will be back for father's day, if not sooner.

I just discovered this place, and I love it! Extensive menu with many delicious vegan options. Tastes very authentic. Will be ordering from here frequently from now on!specially the chicken 65 is delicious.

The place has a great ambience and a wide selection for lunch buffet.  The staff is courteous and prompt.  The gulab jamuns and carrot halwa were amazing!   A little pricey than other Indian restaurants.

Went for lunch buffet today, they were just packed. Being so busy the servers were attentive and super fast. After a long time I really enjoyed authentic punjabi food. Each curry had a different color and taste. They also serve masala dosa with the lunch buffet which was a treat. Will be back soon for a la carte.

Looking at the reviews wanted to give this new place a try and as luck would have it, it was Dosa night tonight at India Bhawan.  After years I had authentic south indian food in the US. One of the very best. The restaurant has beautiful interiors and is clean. Service is top notch and all the servers are courteous and polite. This place is unlike a typical Indian place from a standpoint of interiors,  service and is very classy with terrific authentic food.  They do a lot of other things like concerts and bands on Saturdays, they also have a huge classy bar where they have Karaoke nights on Fridays.  Have to check it out this Friday as they are open late till 3 in the am. At least some Indian place is thinking outside the box rather than the typical lunch and dinner. I wish them all the luck and success and hope they do well as we needed a good Indian place in Chicago. Highly recommend and if you don't give this place a try.... Your loss.

Just had a horrible experience with this restaurant. I placed a online order for delivery. I was told that it would arrive in one hour. After close to 1.5 hours I called to find out where my order was. They told me it would be there in 10 minutes. It took them 2.5 hours to deliver our order. I refuse the order because they acted like they did nothing wrong.  They really shouldn't offer delivery because they suck at it.

The only good thing about this place is the overall ambiance. But that doesn't really matter as the food tasted below average. Want some details? Chicken 65...over-fried. Chicked tikka masala...really? Being a punjabi, let me tell you that it was an insult to call whatever you guys prepared as chicken tikka masala. And yes, it's not cheap if you compare the price with other Indian restaurants, $13.99 for lunch buffet. To the owner - instead of putting more stress to the interior of the restaurant, you should have focused on finding a good chef. Thumbs down.

Absolutely the best Indian food that I have had in decades. We have lived in cities with large Indian communities in the past. The food was amazing. This is better. The Tandoori Chicken was especially smoky and delectable. Go.
Excellent! Owner was attentive. Made our anniversary dinner extra special. Food and service was top notch. Butter chicken and garlic nan were delicious. Check it out!

I would have given this place 4 stars but because of lack of service, I will keep it to 3. The food was very good but the waiters and servers had no clue what was going on. I am not blaming them for the poor service instead the blame should be given to the management. We saw the manager stand behind his counter and not to anything while wait staff was running with no clue on what was going on and what to do.

A wonderful new addition to the ethnic flavors in north Palatine!  I've been anxiously awaiting their opening  - so I was happy to be able to try their lunch buffet today.  It was delicious!  There were many choices:  fresh fruit and salads, two soups, three appetizers, idli & rice, vegetarian & meat curries and three desserts.  Tandoori chicken and naan were brought to the table - piping hot.  My favorites among the entrees were the goat curry and the navratan korma, a delicious mix of vegetables in a wonderful sauce.   Every dish I tried was well spiced with a lot of flavor and not excessive heat (for this white girl!).  The kheer was a perfect balance of rice and milk.  Since I live less than 2 miles from India Bhawan, I will be back often!
Awesome spread on the buffet! The food is yumm.. Nothing comes close to this around this area for Indian.. The dosas, medu vada, sambhar are the best I have had in a long time, they are a must try!

Went there at the grand opening day.  All the dishes were delicious. I would give it a five star for food. Being a south indian myself I usually have less expectations when it comes to south indian food at restaurants. However, their idli, sambar... were pretty impressive too. Service could have been a tad bit better. Overall a nice place to eat with good food and great ambience though. Would certainly visit again soon.

PERFECT PLACE!
Place: Nice, clean, big, different areas and atmospheres...
Food: really tasty. Caesar salad, meat, soup, desert... Cheese cake not so good.
Waitress: they are kind, help in the decision, they modify options in order to make your visit perfect.
No so expensive.
They have balcony.

Extremely poor customer service, menu offerings and accuracy.  

I had this misfortune of ordering from this particular Jimmys on 2 occasions. The first time we experienced Jimmys, our order was horribly incorrect.  Due to the fact that we ordered Carry-Out, we didnt realize the order was incorrect until we started ooening the containers.  We ordered a Family meal with 2 quartered chickens, fettucini alfredo and mash potatoes and gravy.   Upon opening we discovered our chickens weren't quartered, no big deal just an annoyance.  We then opened something i would call mostaccoli alfredo.  No fettucini? Lastly, we did not receive any gravy for our orders of mashed potatoes.  At this point, it wasn't feasible for us to go back, so instead we called and spoke with the manager Tom.  He was very empathetic and offered us very generous gift cards and he delivered them personally to us.  I felt extremely satisfied and vowed to give them another chance.  I was told they had only recently moved a bit further up Devon, so i chalked the experience up to "the move."   Mistakes happen.

Well, we waited a while to allow them the opportunity to get situated and such before ordering again.  A few weeks went by and we decided to order from them again (yesterday.)  We placed our order with a lady named Helen.  We asked Helen to repeat our order to confirm everything was correct.  She repeated the order perfectly and, given our past experience, we figured all would be in order this time around. We picked up the order and proceeded back.  We were celebrating a co-workers retirement so we wanted everything to be nice and smooth.  You can't imagine how incredulous we were to find some of the same glaring errors as before!  No fettucini,  only "mostaccoli alfredo." No gravy for the 4 or 5 orders of mashed potatoes.  The chickens were quartered this time, thankfully.  We made the best of a bad situation and improvised the best we could.  Of course we were chagrined when we heard repeated requests for gravy.  We also had to field a lot of questions regarding, "whats that mostaccoli dish called?"  Not a fine dining experience whatsoever.

We called amd spoke with the same lady that took our order originally.  Frankly, it seemed she couldn't care any less.  She stated, "We dont have fettucini alfredo..., ...our mashed potatoes don't come with gravy (cereal no milk?).. you can come pick up some gravy."  Absolutely unacceptable. Highly incompetent and unempathetic staff. She seemed unconcerned and even bothered by our complaint.  Mind you, we maintained absolute professionalism and courtesy while interacting with her.  Her responses weren't a result of an unreasonable or beligerent customer. She seemed to want to say "is that all u called for? i got work to do." We pointed out that we spoke to her originally and that she repeated our order to us twice.  Why didnt she say anything about gravy not being included with mash potatoes (what respectable restaurant does that?) Why didnt she advise they dont offer any fettucini alfredo?  The reason she didnt do this is because she simply didnt care and lacks professionalism. 

We did not bother escalating any further to Tom, although perhaps we should have, but no matter the conversation or offers, we will never visit this place again, nor will we allow our family and friends to support this place.  Had they delivered quality and accurate service, they would have earned increased business and promotion from our work group. 

For REAL Jimmys Charhouse i suggest visiting the one in Elgin.  The one in Elk Grove is the one to avoid.

I was attending a conference in Elk Grove and part of the experience was the organizers arranged for a networking dinner at this restaurant.  I was more in it for the networking than the dining, but that soon changed. 
Our shuttle bus dropped us off and I was surprised to find that at 8 pm on a Saturday night they weren't too busy.  The staff there is very friendly as everyone who walked past greeted us.  Their menu has something for everyone and I chose the filet medallions trio, excellent pick.  The pieces were very tender and flavorful.  I don't drink but others on my table said the wine list was impressive and the waiter really seemed to know his pairings.  I would eat here again when I'm back in the area.

A hidden gem in Elk Grove !! The staff is awesome .. Food is great especially the kabobs! The owners Tom and Jimmy make everyone feel like they are at home !! A must try for all locals. Modern with a flare of old school hospitality.

Pretty good food here, and you get a good amount for the price. I would avoid the desserts as they are very generic and don't taste homemade at all. The salad was great, I love their balsamic dressing. Mashed potatoes and steak fries both rock. Steak itself was just ok. At least I could cut through it easily! And their side veggies are always yummy! It makes for a decent work lunch, but I wouldn't go back for any other occasion.

I typically like to give good reviews but our first visit to Jimmy's Charhouse was on Mother's day.  Menu choices were very limited, service and food were bland. Menu could use a lot of work. Nothing stood out that would prompt our group of 16 to return. Charhouse should indicate a great choice of grilled meat cuts, but the menu is more like a typical Greek or Denny's dinner menu. More salads, sandwiches and chicken breast meals.
Lots of potential for this restaurant since location is par.

Had dinner with two friends last evening. Two of us ordered shrimp. The other ordered chicken.  The shrimp were hard as rocks both outside and inside. Awful. The mashed potatoes were cold and heavily salted. The vegetables were over cooked and mushy.  Awful experience.

This place has new owners and they run it now and  they CARE.    everything is so much better.   Top notch, quality and service and friendly.   

If you haven't been here or had a sub part time in past , get you butt over there and try again.   

These guys can do big parties too....  they have a lot of banquet experience as well.   

Keep up the good work!

We came for an early dinner on the weekend. This is a nicely decorated place and definitely looks like a charhouse. We sat near the kitchen but it wasn't too loud and it was interesting to see the cooks work. The drink menu is ok, not great. The food menu is much better. They have the typical apps, salads, chicken, fish, beef, pastas. We started with the potato skins. The portion size is insane! they gave us like 3 whole potatoes! And they were well made. I ordered the chicken piccatta special and my table also ordered a steak and the pork chops. All the meats were cooked very well, and the potatoes and beans that came with each plate were nicely done as well. The bill was very reasonable considering alcohol, appetizer and the portion sizes of the entrees. It's a good place to hit if you are in the area.

Party of (2) Sept. 17, 2016 - Dinner
Ordered Beef Barley Soup (excellent); Blackened Salmon (possibly frozen) was below average when it was always much better in the past--lacked flavor and seasoning (price increased by the way), Mashed Potatoes, Veggie was Green Beans.  Spouse ordered Chopped Steak which was excellent, Mashed Potatoes, Veggie was Green Beans and Beef Barley Soup.  The Mashed Potatoes were terrible and they were not whipped and fluffy and also tasted full of margarine instead of butter.  There was definitely a change with the potatoes.  Also, there was no live music this evening either so we don't know what happened.  Service was good tonight although they were not very busy. Would recommend ordering a Baked Potato over Mashed and the Rice is just average but everyone has different tastes.

Wanted to try and compare this place to our usual streak place. Had 6 oz filet,  was very good.  But just a smidgin less tasty/tender as Long..@ng dinner Comes with salad  potato and veggie.  Not real crazy about the beans, a little overcooked.  Onion soup a little too salty, but still good.   Also served with bread, fresh and warm!  Service was great  the decor a little too "upscale" for my taste.   Would like to go back to check out live music tho

I won a gift certificate at a raffle a few years ago for Black Steer Steak House at the same location. I came from the far south side of Chicago  (50 miles), so when I pulled in and saw a different name, I was worried.  
The folks at the front desk said they would honor it. Cool.
The decor is classic upscale steakhouse,  not old looking or anything,  but just nice. A little darkly lit for lunch time,  though. 
My server was polite and had good timing (there when you need him, not obtrusive when you're eating).
I ordered a 22 oz. Rib eye bone-in, mashed potatoes,  a chowder soup and wedge salad. 
The soup was terrific, flavorful and had enough seafood taste without being overbearing. 
The wedge salad was BIG! Bacon bits, Bleu cheese crumbled on it, a hard boiled egg  and Bleu cheese dressing. 
Garlic croutons would have elevated either soup or salad, but the were both great tasting dishes.
The main course came and it looked and smelled wonderful. The classic char smell, beautiful look on the plate. The steak tasted every bit as fantastic as it looked. Potatoes and sauted green beans... just great. 
It was a long drive but we'll worth it.

The steak was way below average but I must say it was a good size. The baked potato was between cold and warm and not fully cooked. If fact it could not melt the butter. As others mentioned it is an older crowd and I think this may have contributed to our slow service. Only good thing was 10% discount because we stayed next door at the walkable Country Inn & Suites eunuch does get an above average score.

Bad!  They don't know how to grill a steak.  Ordered NY Strip.  Tasted like beef jerky; dry and hard to chew!
Avoid this place at all cost!
Wow.... Words can't even explain how great tasting their food is! I will definitely come back again! One of the best tasting steaks I've ever had. I definitely recommend this place.
The Prime Rib cooked just perfect, Beef Stew soup fantastic and service was outstanding. Next time will try their Surf and Turf.

SO very disappointed in the recent changes. Bar menu - GONE!! Prices  - INCREASED! Entree portion sizes - DECREASED! This was one of our favorite places to stop in for drinks and bar snacks, average once a week. Owners - $12 for a saganaki, really?? Bring back the bar menu!

Nice place overall.
However not somewhere id go back to. 
Not a fan of their limited cocktail and drink menu.
Definitely not a place to go if your looking for a good drink.
It's a family friendly environment.. Not for the younger crowd. Very family oriented. Food was unimpressive. 
I could have prepared the same meals in my own kitchen. 
Very basic. 
Will not return.
I like eating here my husband not so much, service is good and food quality is like most sit down restaurants. Not very memorable but not a bad place to go when you need to fill your belly.
NEW OWNERSHIP. Great place, beautiful interior and excellent food. The owner stopped by our table to check on us. Hoghly recommend the sakanaki cheese...OPA!
New owners!  Things looking up.  Much improved!  I'm Leary but going o give them another few tries!  Hopeful.
WOW New owners have really made this place welcoming. Food was amazing. Great portions too. Had dinner at the bar with 2 of the most friendly tenders I've met. Great experience   We will be back
It can be great ,if you get a good waiter. All depends, which Greek waiter you get that day. Soups are awesome, steaks and chops are good. Nice bar and live music.

Wow - what a great place!  Started in the bar, very relaxing area.  Dinner was amazing.  Waiter was charming, quick, and attentive.  Throughly enjoyed everything from the artichoke dip, all the way through to the flan.  Would to back to this place over and over and over.  Truly great place to dine.
Great service, great food. I work out that way and its a real nice place for a quality lunch. The bar is pretty awesome to. For after work. Thumbs way up

Some of the best food in the area, with some of the best service. The bartender Nina and the owner Tom went above and beyond to make sure my experience was the best possible. With all that said for a fine dining steakhouse the drink and food prices are extremely affordable; I will be coming back on a regular basis!

Second time here and the food is really high quality. The Greek lamb chops last time were amazing and the roast chicken with BBQ sauce was so tender and moist tonight. Just great. The lobster was very good but the filet was out of this world. Reasonable prices for what you get. Our only issue was that we were somewhat ignored our first time when we got here even though we had a reservation. The owner seemed kind of snotty to us but we talked to him a little and he was much friendlier this time. Definitely worth a try.
Just had our daughter's bridal shower at Jimmy's Charhouse.  The food was excellent and the portions were large.  Everyone was so accommodating.  Highly recommend this restaurant

I walked into Jimmy's at 9:56PM, normally their kitchen closes at 10PM...I insisted that I didn't need to order food because of such late arrival and the host insisted I still order. So I ended up ordering the chicken fettuccini Alfredo with a side salad. I ordered to go, and sat down for a beer while I waited for my food....15 minutes later my food was ready to go and I tried to even up with the bartender. She proceeded to tell me that I was fine, my dinner had already been payed for. I replied with "Are you sure?" She said yes...I took the bag in hand and started toward the front where the host had greeted me looking to pay him, no where to be found I started towards the door and a gentleman that had greeted from a seat at the bar when I walked in, motioned towards me to have a good night! This was the owner of Jimmy's and he payed for my entire meal just on a whim. I cannot describe the gratitude and how much I truly appreciate this act of kindness. Not only did I walk in less then 5 minutes before the kitchen closed, not only was my food was absolutely phenomenal. It was paid for in full. I will be back and I will tell any friends I have visiting to pay this place is visit. Awesome service and great people, above and beyond!

Very disappointed with this place.  Don't go here if you're a vegetarian.  I ordered the rigatoni with fresh vegetables in a pesto sauce (from the "vegetarian menu" which had 3 items on it) and the pasta came plain - no vegetables whatsoever.  I mentioned it to the waitress and she went to the kitchen and eventually brought out a plate of stir fried vegetables that had an asian flavor.  Not good.

On the up side they did have a band in the bar that was pretty good so at least we enjoyed the music.

We had a blast.  Went on a Friday evening for dinner and to hear the Johnny Burnett band.  We sat in the bar area and the music level was perfect.  Our server Nina was the best.  She was happy and sweet and took good care of us.  We both had the clubhouse sandwich and upgraded to the sweet potato fries.  Took some home as the sandwiches were huge.  Hubby had Blue Moon and i had red wine.  Didn't care for the Copper Ridge merlot but the Dark Horse cab was really good.

The music was so fun.  Johnny's fingers flew across the keyboard and they played so many of our favorites from the 60s and 70s.  The band engaged the audience and that made it even more fun.  People danced (me too) and we sang along with the songs you just had to.  Can't wait for the next time.

Food wasn't bad, steak was really good. However, had an extremely bad experience with a very snarky waiter. Wasn't given bread, when ordering waiter was rude with harsh comments, never checked on once during meal, asked for butter and was served hollandaise sauce.  Told waiter the butter tasted funny, was told that's what it comes with. Felt as if we were a major  inconvenience.

I've been here when it was Charlie's I've been here when it was black steer. This place still has tasty steaks. Cooked perfectly! Out waitress was super slow and needed some prodding from the manager! 
Will we be here again? Definitely! I'm not sure how long they've been jimmys... I moved out of the area. I'm sure the wait staff just needs to grow some:) but it made for an awesome date night !
We were really pleased with our meal and ate there 2 nights in a row. The price is very reasonable for he food and experince, Steak, crab cakes very good. Hidde pn gem in Elk grove Village.

We celebrated my mother's 90th birthday at Jimmy's in August. The staff could not have done more to make it wonderful. We were helped arranging photos and were given a screen for our "photo booth". The accomodations were perfect for the size of our group. The table was beautifully set. Our guests ordered off the menu and all were pleased. The Guest of Honor was truly honored at Jimmy's. 
Great job, guys.

I've been here quite a few times; it's close to home and has a bar that the wife and I love to go to on our nights out.

The Food:
I've been here on weekends and weeknights. I've been here for Valentines day. I've had private parties here.  The food is just....eh.  It's basically a classed up standard greek diner.  The steaks are not Prime and I would question even Choice.  They're not bad, but they can be dry (especially on the outside) and lacking flavor. Not nearly enough salt on them prior to cooking which makes for a dry crust.

Other food is a little better than your average Greek run family style restaurant.  It's not a bad place, but you're paying Wildfire prices for about two steps down in quality and maybe three or four down in flavor.  It seems like they're stuck on Greek inspired family recipes and don't really have any POW on the plate.

But it's not bad and I don't feel like I'm getting ripped off.  For us, we go there when we can't get reservations elsewhere.

the Bar:

Love the bar.  Good drinks and a fun crowd, although on the older end of the spectrum.  Great people watching for middle agers like us, but I think a younger crowd would feel like they're seeing Grandma dancing at the bar.  Very fun time for us though, we always end up having fun conversations with random people and the live entertainment is a blast.

So, in short...

It's not a BAD place for a date night dinner, but I wouldn't take your girlfriend there to propose nor would I say it's your "once in a life time" date night. It's not bad for your kids first communion party or a nice meal out with the kids.  I don't think patrons would be offended by children and it's spacious enough where you can request a secluded area if you're planning for the worst with them.
Food was good. Not great. Staff was pleasant. Walleye special was very good.  Kabobs ok

We went on Christmas Day and it was terrible. It was almost 10 minutes before anyone came to ask us for drinks.  We ordered the fried calamari for an appetizer and there were no tenticles...very disappointing because that's the best part. I ordered the lamb chops and everything was less than room temperature. Nothing was hot. I think the mashed potatoes were from a box...very loose. A couple of pieces of broccoli and some carrot chunks. The salad looked old. My husband ordered the prime rib that came with a baked potato to go. The meat was raw and cold too. I asked for the Bernaise sauce on the side and that was fine. Took the carrot cake to go and ate that later. That was very moist! Great.
Awesome waitress personality wise but the food was very disappointing. Jimmys charhouse has been in business for many years so I thought it would be a perfect place to go. How can u go wrong with lamb chops at a Greek restaurant but I guess u can. Very disappointed. Can I get a refund please?!

Ordered their Swiss burger Friday night 5/20, just before the kitchen closed. It was absolutely outstanding! When I inquired, the owner Tom explained that they grind their own meat. Cooked to the temperature I asked. Nothing to add. It was great!

I've been to the other location many a time and felt confident the result would be the same. Sadly the experience was not good from the service food and atmosphere. The bar area had a horrible musician playing on a piano...loud and obnoxious, dining room empty and bright during dinner rush and only three tables were sat. Drive to the Randall location is my suggestion or a different place entirely.

I was in about a week or two ago and had Julie as my server. she was a total mess. she kept bringing over the wrong items. then when I asked for a refill of soda it took her over 15 minutes to refill my drink! worst of all, when I left that night I took the alley behind the building as a short cut. and what did I see? Julie smoking from a pipe! no wonder she was slow and a horrible server! if you couldn't already guess, I will not be back!

Unbelievably terrific!  I had the Chicken Artichoke for lunch yesterday, it was sinfully delicious.  Succulent moist, hot chicken breast, with 4 artichoke hearts on top, light sauce, side of rice and fresh green beans.  I ate every bit on my plate, it was that scrumptious.  Rice was hot, fresh, not clumpy.  Green beans were cooked perfectly.  Business lunch on a Monday, fairly crowded, darker, intimate interior.  A bit loud, in there, acoustics aren't the best, we had 5 at our round table, sometimes couldn't hear others speaking, but who cares?  The food was magnificent.  Our waiter was the best but can't remember his name :-( very professional and knew his stuff on what to recommend we order.  Others I ate with ordered the wood roasted chicken, they raved about that.  The waiter told me the place is known for its chicken, um YES INDEED.  Definitely returning.  Vundabar!
great atmosphere, bar, dining area, music, etc... all good!  great quality on the menu here... will definitely try and frequent more often.  Nicely done guys!

The new owners Tom and Jim have taken this place to a new level. The food quality is even better than before and the level of service is outstanding. Both owners stopped by the table to check on us, and I can tell you that they are not only two of the nicest guys I have ever met, but they are truly obsessed with making their restaurant top notch. Live music on Friday and Saturday night that starts at a reasonable hour [usually 7:30 pm]  and good food at reasonable prices make Jimmy's Charhouse one of my favorite restaurants in the area.

I really have mixed thoughts on this place. I was looking forward to going here for Valentin's day when it was Black Steer charhouse. I found out about the change about 3 days before Valentin's day and could not change it. Everyplace else was booked. We got there about 10 min prior to our reservation. They were very busy. We were seated about 15 after our reservation. The service was a little slow but I expected that being Valentin's day. The food was C+ to B -. Same quality as the Elgin location. Being a steak eater, I was not impressed. I'm not upset we went there but won't be rushing back.

I recently had my bridal shower here in the back banquet room, and it was fantastic. Jimmy was so helpful, and the servers Jessica and Jorge were so attentive and generally awesome. :) We had a brunch buffet with a delicious variety of food--all of it was so good! The mimosas were flowing, too. Nothing but good things to say about this place and their service. Thanks again!

I went there for my 2 year anniversary with my girlfriend. She was so upset after dinner she ordered the chicken parmesan and the chicken was so hard you could have thrown it against the wall and it would have left a hole in the wall. We felt like we were getting rushed out of our seats. Our meal was 100 dollars and it was expensive and terrible. I read a lot of reviews how good this place was and I have to say it really disappointed me

saganaki was good!  nice atmosphere!  SLOW service.    the ceasar salad had mozzarella cheese, all stems of the Romanesque and soupy.  Greek salad was okay.  Steak was over done, not seasoned and dry.

Used to LOVE this place when it was Charlies Char House. It's switched hands twice since then. Every time it does, the food gets a bit worse. Went on Saturday night for a good steak. Place was dead. Used to have to wait a good 45 minutes to get in, that should have told me something.  Waiter was attentive, soup and salad were fine. Bread was good. I had the prime rib. Worst prime rib I've ever had. Tough and chewy, no flavor. My husband had the $26 New York Strip, also not very good. Honestly, a few weeks ago I went to LongHorn and the steak was to die for and it was half the price! Skip this place, you can get better steak elsewhere. Sadly, this place is just not what it used to be.
Was not really happy with the service. The waiter never came to check on us after food was served. The food was ok but could have been better, not what I expected.

I wrote a review back when they were the "Black Steer Charhouse".  Now that they are Jimmy's Charhouse, they are still good.  I've gone there twice recently.  They provide a very tasty meal, and have great dinner choices.  The steak was fantastic, and the sides were very good.  They are a little on the pricy side, but not too badly.  Service was also good.  A good place to go for a nice meal.

I used to go to this place when it was Charlies Charhouse and then Blacksteer Charhouse.  Food and service was always great then. Well I went last night with work people and friends to a retirement party.  The service was not good. You walk in the door and their is just a bunch of people standing at the hostess station.  No hi no anything.  Food horrible. Me and another co worker got the Ruben.... All fat no kraut regular 1000 island dressing out of a bottle.  My husband and a co worker of mine got the cheeseburger. I've seen Portillos plated better on a cheeseburger.  The other people got steaks.  None of which were cooked to what they were asked to be cooked at. Then when server brought food out, he brought no condiments. So everytime someone needed something, that should have been brought out in the first place, they would have to ask. Lets see alcoholic beverages.............no consistency what so ever.  It is a shame that this place turned into this from Charlies.  Real disappointment.  I will never go here again and feel sorry for the people that do and spend the money and food and service are horrible;

My wife and I have been here when it was Black Steer char house and always enjoyed it NOT ANY MORE this had to be the worst experience we ever had we came here for Valentine's Day what a mistake we asked if we could make reservations in the bar and they told us NO so we made reservations for the dinning room , we had a couple of drinks in the bar which were not very good and booth opened in the bar so we took it ..the service was so bad we thought about leaving but every thing was booked everywhere else so we stayed WRONG the waitress had a  problem very unfriendly to us took for ever to flag her down asked her about the menu and she stated we can't change any thing the menu is the menu we won't make any changes , well if the service got any slower we would have aged could not even get a drink order right. When we finally got serviced there was a table behind us and the waitress to a couple I was holding this table for you (we were told they don't hold tables in the bar) This will be the last time I will ever go here and we live two miles from here and we will avoid it and we will tell every one we know not to go best thing for this place now is close and lock the doors and walk away (the manger did nothing) This is a bad start for them ..LIKE I SAID NEVER AGAIN !!!

This location used to be a Caribou Coffee, but had been empty for a while.  I recently saw a new sign and decided to stop in.  

The front half of Shelby's has the vibe of a nice, inviting lounge similar to that of a Caribou, Starbucks, etc.  but that's where the similarities end.  They have a menu of appetizers, sandwiches, breakfast type foods, and in addition to standard soda/coffee selections, serve wine and beer as well.

I had a chance to sample a grilled cheese on sour dough bread as a snack as I was passing through and was pleased.

Where the biggest twist is... The back half of Shelby's actually hosts about 6 slot machines/video poker machines.  The machines appear to be penny slots and are multifunction machines, where you can switch between a variety of slot and video poker games on the touch screens, which is nice, so you can play a variety of different games to spice things up.

The service was great, as Robyn was pleasant and sociable from the get go and explained how everything worked.  Sodas are comped while you are playing slots which is a nice little perk. 

From what I hear, more of these types of establishments are going to be popping up in the Chicagoland area.  When you think of slot machines, one often conjures up seedy images of smoked filled rooms.  But, this environment was clean, warm and inviting which was a nice surprise.  It's not a casino by any means, but you can have a quick bite/drink and entertain yourself with some slots and get your small dopamine rush in a friendly place at the same time.

I'm not sure if it's due to regulations, it'd be nice to see a few more machines maybe.  But, I give the extra star due to the very welcoming and excellent service from Robyn for my first visit.  

Will stop by again.  And maybe win back my $20 next time...haha
Only wanted to buy coffee they just didn't let us in because my wife didn't have an ID. I had mine and she could've easily recommended that I get one coffee with my ID. Pretty weird and pathetic.
We work right by here at the sport clips and we love this place! Super good food, always consistent and a beyond friendly staff! Haven't ordered even one thing off the menu that I didn't like!

Not a fan really.  I'll give 2 stars for the fast and nice service.  This is a hot dog place.  I've got hot dogs from here as well as another meal option or two.  I liked their fries, and I think I got their ribs were were pretty good.  The sad part is their hot dogs.  Tiny cheap dogs.  Chicago dogs should be tasty and a bit higher quality.  These dogs seem worse than the lowest cost ones you can make at home.  I'd rather get a hot dog from Steak & Shake next door.  Or if I feel like driving a couple miles, of course Portillo's.  Probably won't get food from here often.  Sad because they are very close to my home and it would have been nice to have a good hot dog spot.  They have good deals, but, I am usually disappointed with my meal.

Whoa! Whoa! Gyro!  Oh how magically delicious it is!  This place is great.  I have eaten here a few times and each time I have loved it a bit more.  The time before last the guy asked me my name, when I went the last time.. he remembered it!  Talk about impressed!  The food was ready fast and it was so good.. did i say it was good!  It was!... Did I said that I loved the fries too! Because I do!

I will definitely return... They have so many options...

This place literally has the worst rendition of a Chicago Style hot dog.  Plain bun, low quality dog, regular relish, and a long slice of pickle.  Everything about it was wrong...the toppings weren't even spread properly, just clumped together in the center.   And morale seems to suck, too.  The guy at the counter was on his cell phone the entire time,  and the cook just looked like he was miserable.  You can't be a hot dog joint in Chicagoland and serve this food and experience...makes me feel like I've lost a little faith in humanity.
Love Sammy's! Grilled chicken on a pita is my favorite. I've had Sammy's plenty of times and have never been disappointed with the food.

The hot dogs are very small.

They look nothing like the pics posted thru out the restaurant. The bun had no seed and the actually hot dog was about half the size of a Vienna you purchase at the grocery store. 

The topping were sparse and poor quality. 

For $7 I expected better quality and bigger portions. The fries were a very small portion and the drink is also a small cup.

I think I will take a pass next time. 

The workers appear over worked and unhappy.

Just walked in, looked around, there was garbage and food all over the floor and noone was cleaning.  I asked the guy for a menu and he just points behind me at the wall

I didn't have such an issue with that lack-there-of with communication, as I have never and let me repeat NEVER walked out of a fast food place for cleanliness.  I was so turned off by the site of garbage all over the floor that I walked out.  I starred at the outrageously priced menu for a hotdog for a few mins and walked out without saying a word. Just went to taco bell instead.

Called the owner to give him feedback on how i was just in his establishmet and was so disgusted by the food all over the floor and the way his front counter guy handled the situation and all he said was thankyou.  No, "im sorry, please come back in and let me buy you lunch, i will get someone to clean it up right now, nothing.  Bad for business.
Guy at register is very rude. Accidently ordered wrong item and he told me he already made it so i have to pay for it anyways

Food was great not to mention the great prices they have on their lunch special. I had a gyro and my hubby had the hot dog lunch special and they were good. Place is very clean and food came out fast. I will definitely try this place again. Guy at the register was very nice and friendly.

Just moved in area and this place has the best hot dogs in area.  Even better is that they have a 2 hot dog, fries, &drink special everyday for $5.50.  Food is made fresh to order so expect to wait 5+ minutes for your food to be ready especially during peak lunch and dinner time.

Yesterday my cousin went there and ordered 2 chicken sandwiches and requested grilled onions with some tarter tots.  Chicken sandwiches tasted fresh and flavorful.  Next time I'll remember to ask for BBQ sauce.  

If your in area give this place a try and don't expect expect extremely fast food if your in a rush call in your order.

One of my favorite hot dog joints! for several reasons:
~wide variety of foods, not just your typical hot dog & hamburger options
~clean & spacious place
~fair prices
~clean washroom
~open fairly late
~large menu on the wall
~a lot of photos of the food covering different walls (I once regretted studying all the photos before ordering because I realized there was so much I didn't know about that I wanted after I placed my order)

One thing they have that I have never seen at another hot dog place is their "cheese logs." They are basically mozzarella cheese wrapped in a shell that is similar to an enchilada. They seemed to be fried and crunchy with a melted cheese filling. 

They also have plenty of side likes mac-n-cheese nuggets (mac-n-cheese fried into pieces), sweet potato fries and tater tots, not what every hot dog joint has. 

I always get cheese dogs with grilled onions. The dogs are beef and possibly Vienna brand; really good. 

Only thing I was totally happy about was the charge for a cup to get ice water and one of the guys at the cash register seemed to be having a bad night or maybe wasn't friendly. The second time I went in and he was on the register, he was in a much better mood and more friendly, but I had to wait a half a minute until he got off the phone to place my order. It seemed to be a personal call, but I could have been wrong. 

I have yet to see Big Sammy himself, but he looks like the kind of guy you want to order with; really happy-go-lucky and funny. 

I will definitely return because I don't know of any other places in the area to get a hot dog at a somewhat late hour and I am in this area a lot. Oh, and for the mac-n-cheese bites and sweet potato fries. And for the cheese logs, too. 

Sometimes when I drive by, I get cravings for the food! Wish this place was closer to my house.

Big Sammy's is great. I love the charbroiled burgers. The gyros are always a good choice. Hot dogs and Polish sausages are good too. They have a large menu that I have barley touched so far. Plenty of fried sides to choose from.
What gives with the big guy behind the cash register handling money and also handling food? Hello health department.

Not sure if it's a one time event. Haven't ordered an Italian beef for a while. Phoned 2 in and picked them up. Last time I ordered them, each had twice the beef. It's definitely changed. Big Sammy's used to give good portions. That's what Big Sammy's was known for. Used to have more than Portillos. Now the Big Sammy beef sandwich is less. Noticeably less.

Everytime we come here, the place is very clean. Friendly service and reasonable prices. Hotdog Special is what we normally get, and comes with all the toppings. We NEVER had an issue with customer service. Its always the same guy at the register EVERYTIME we go, and he is always plesant.

This place is awesome. The gyros, cheeseburgers, sausages, italian beefs, bbq, and hot dogs keep me going back. I have not had the pastas and was unimpressed with the breaded chicken patty they use on some of their sandwiches. Get it grilled or get something else, in my opinion. I don't mind waiting a few extra minutes for hot off the grill food. Cheeseburger is always on point. The gyros are popular. Recently I got hooked on bbq chicken with onion and pickles. If you can get it on the French roll, even better. I will make sure to ask them to dip my Italian beef next time. I am a Chicagoan afterall. There is something for everyone on their menu and it doesn't cost an arm and a leg.

Every time I order a beef wet and I get it home it's dry as a bone. What am I supposed to do, open the beef in front of them before I leave?  This has happened at least 3 times. I'll wait in line at Portillos

My first venture into Chicago hot dogs.  It's convenient to my office, so a group of us went.

2 hot dogs, fries and a drink for $5.50.  I don't know many places if at all that can beat that for the value.  A few small tables, and bar/window seating.  no nonsense, to the point, short and sweet. I like that.  The guys are friendly and quite jovial, which always makes an experience better.

The fries are crisp and delcious, not too salty at all, the cheese they give is on the side, and ample for the fries you order.  My hot dog (with everything) had onions, tomato slices halved, relish, and a big slice of pickle.  It doesn't need anything added on..  

I'll be back again Big Sammy, I'll be back Sir.  italian sausage meal is next!!

Fat gyros, thick potato fries, and that awfully addictive and plentiful cheese dip you get at carnivals. My problem is that when you put a number four combo with cheese in front of me I'm not going to even think about saving any of it. I'm eating all of it now, and be totally comatosically full for the next seven hours.

I don't understand the bad reviews. Every time I go to Sammys I have a nice conversation with the counter guy, the place is clean, and the food is good. For $5.50 plus tax you get two Chicago dogs with all the fixings, fries, and a soda. That's one of the best deals in town! The beef is awesome too. Tender meat, good bread, and double the size of what you get at portillos. Maybe I spend more time in the city than the other reviewers who are complaining about Sammys so I see it differently. But in my opinion, Sammys is one of the best Chicago dog places in the suburbs.

I've had food from two of their locations. The food at their meacham rd location is much better over all. I've had the beef and gyro sandwiches and they don't compare to their meacham rd location. Their biesterfield location is soso.

I got the 2 hot dogs, fries and a drink for $5.75 deal. The hot dog was nothing special. It was decent but nothing I couldn't get at a million other hot dog shops. The bun was just a plain standard bun that is sold in the packs at any grocery store. The fries were also just okay. What I did like about them is that they were not overly salty which is a problem with many hot dog places' fries. Drinks are refillable which is a plus.

They don't pack any napkins or ketchup with your to-go order, so be sure to squeeze your own ketchup into a little tub. 

The service was good here and it's a nice, clean place to have a meal. They have a big TV which is good for people dining in and eating.

I wouldn't go out of my way to venture back here. However if I was passing by, it's not a bad place to stop for a bite to eat.

The best word to describe Big Sammy's is 'consistent'. I have been to two of Big Sammy's locations. One on Meacham and one on Biesterfield. Service has always been good. The locations, inside, are not very big so if you go during lunch hour - be prepared to maybe have to take your food and run.

It's a basic Chicago food joint so there really isn't much out of the ordinary.

The gyros here are very good. They are also very large. Be prepared to be stuffed for the rest of the day if you eat an entire one. 

All that said, here's the best food there:

1) Gyro
2) Burgers
3) Tater tots
4) Wings
5) Hot Dogs
6) Sweet potato fries
7) Pulled Pork Sandwich

What I didn't care for: The chili dog. The chili was mediocre. Bland. 

So if you just need a chicago food fix, this is a good place to try.

My dad took me here because he is in love with the burgers they have. When I first walked, the room was a fair size. I wouldn't say it's a restaurant, but they have enough tables for you to sit in. They have one GIANT main board menu full of food options and combos. My dad usually orders their double cheeseburgers with fries. From what I remembered, I ordered a pizza burger (burger with mozzarella cheese and marinara sauce), onion rings, chicken gyro, and fried mushrooms (not in one day. Haha).
Their burgers are actually good and cheap. The only complaint I have for them is that the burgers are too greasy for me, and that all the grease ended up making my buns a little more wet... but not extremely soggy. A pizza burger was something unique to me, remembering that burger king had one too. But this place has a really GOOD, different pizza burger! Their onion rings and fries were great sides! I fell in LOVE with their gyros! The sauce is my favorite. What's great about this place is that they cook FRESH in front of you. I like places that prove to me that they cook fresh once you've ordered.
What I hated though were their fried mushrooms. The appearance looked appealing, but the inside had the worst batter. The batter made the mushrooms so wet (no, not grease) that it gave the mushrooms such a gross texture and taste. Will never order that again! 
Otherwise, I see why my dad loves going here.

Went here with my mom and her boyfriend. I got my soda, a Dr. Pepper and the flavor was totally off. So I went back up to the self service machine and got myself a Pepsi instead. It was a little better, but still the flavor wasn't quite right. My mom's boyfriend was like "you don't come here for a soda! you come here for a hot dog!". I have to say, I disagree. While it wasn't the end of the world...it's still part of the experience. Plus, I don't drink soda, so I was looking forward to it! The little things in life...

Enough of that though. I split a gyro and two hot dogs (which came with fries) with my mom. The gyro was pretty good...your typical gyro. I got an extra side of tiziki sauce because I can never have enough (for 40 cents, whatever...no biggie). I kinda wish their hot dog buns had poppy seeds but other than that typical hot dog joint.

Service was horrible here.  

I am the type of person who never cares about service as long as the food is good.  The food was very plain here, I do not understand the good reviews because there are other fantastic local businesses in which you can get better quality food.  All of the food is general Chicago food, just done in a very plain way.  There is nothing separating it from the rest of the pack.  As for the prices, these are general prices that you can find at most places.  

As for the service I mentioned in the beginning?  I was ignored for around 5 minutes as the guys behind the counter were talking to each other, and I was clearly in view.  I probably should have left, but like I said, if the food is good, I'm willing to put service aside.  This was not the case.  I would have given this place 1 star, but I did finish the food, probably because I was hungry and don't like to waste things.

A little expensive ( hence the 4/5 stars), but the serving sizes are good and I've never had a bad order here. They toast the buns for their burgers on the grill, same for the gyro bread. They even crisp up the gyro meat on a flat top before serving it. Fries are perfect. Crispy but soft inside and not greasy. Contrary to other reviews I've always enjoyed their hot dogs, but then again, when I order a hot dog that's all I expect. Not sure what everyone else expects out of ordering a hot dog.

So, good quality food and a solid serving size.

The staff here is always good to me as well. The guys are polite, have never messed up an order, and the place is always clean. In this type of establishment that is HUGE to me. I hate coming out of a place with mystery sticky food residue stuck to me, or the feeling that a table or ketchup bottle is dirty.... and it never is here. The place is kept spotless.

Solid food for a reasonable price.  The only reason I did not give it a five star review is because the layout is kind of tight.  When waiting for food, everyone is crammed into the front area.  Other than that, food is fantastic and service is great!

I don't like the place.  Overrated.  Food is fair at best.  Prices are ridiculous and portion sizes are small.  Nothing special about this place.  I met Big Sammy himself one day at the Elgin location.  Did not like the guy - no personality - I told him it was my first time there - he had no comment and walked away.  If that happened to me I would welcome the customer and show him the restaurant and the menu and make sure he gets a good meal.  He could care less.

I got the 2 hot dog special last night for my daughter because she insisted on hot dogs and fries and Big Sammy's was the closest place and I didn't feel like driving any further.  I got the bag of food (2 dogs with everything and fries) and it weighed like a half pound.  Most other places when you order the same thing the bag weighs at least a pound.  Their hot dogs are small, their fries are small, and their prices are high.

Go somewhere else.

Haven't tried anything other than the ribs here so don't know about the hot dogs. They have a deal where you can get full slab, fries, and drink for around $15. It's alright for the price. Fries were excellent and well seasoned. Service was pretty fast and ready to pickup in the time they told me.

Although the price is right for the 2 hot dogs, fries and drink special ($5 before tax), the dog is nothing special.  The plain buns are like fluffy pillows.  The small wieners are skinless and overcooked but the condiments are applied properly.  The fries are standard food service industry which means they are just OK.  As the two star rating indicates, "Meh. I've had better."

I've been trying to eat healthy lately, but decided to stop here after running some errands at lunch.  I ordered the daily special, which was crispy chicken fingers with fries and a drink.  I was going to order a hot dog, but saw their sign boasting how crunchy and juicy their chicken strips were.  I'm a total sucker for advertisements.

The chicken strips were seasoned well, crunchy, and very moist.  They have a few dipping sauce choices and went with some hot sauce & honey mustard.  The honey mustard was really good, with a creamy mayo-based consistency.  The fries weren't anything special.

The service was quick, interior was clean, and they have cheap daily deals.  I'll be back for sure whenever I feel like some chicken strips and maybe try some of their bbq.

For a standard, fairly-priced hot dog joint in the burbs, Big Sammy's fits the bill. The dogs are good, fries tasty. The food isn't going to blow you away, but it's a hot dog place. The specials are good to snag 2 dogs, fries and a drink for $5. I saw a review about their soda machine and will agree. I had root beer and the ratio must be off.

I'd opt to make my wieners at home, but if you're in the area and hankering to boost your sodium intake for the week, pop in. The staff has always been friendly.

Stopped here for the first time ever.  Never paid much attention to it despite having past it a hundred times.  Last night we were hungry on the way home from mom's in Roselle.  Guy behind the counter was nice, and bragged about their food.  Sorry I can't say I agree.

I had a steak sand that sarted off OK, but the last part of the steak was inedible - hard.  Not even chewy - couldn't bite it.  I don't think a dog could have chewed it.  Guy @ the counter suggested my wife order the veggie burger, said it was "great, not like the other places" (or soemthing like that).  It was NOT GOOD.  Just out of a freezer, nothing special.  BLAH.  We should have toosed our food and gone some place we know to be good.

Overall a complete disappointment.  They get an extra star for being nice.  Their food is terrible.

A clue that we should have walked out was all the ads on the walls for products supplied them by various purveyors.  Chili, soup, sides, etc.  Pretty much everything is bought frozen from Sysco or some place, then tossed on the grill or in the fryer.   Nothing is fresh.  I guess I just expect more from the little places.

I won't return.

Not one of my choices to eat at. My brother stopped here and I had no choice so I decided to five it another try.  I had the battered cod meal on the advice of my sister-in-law. It came with fries, cole slaw, tarter sauce and a drink for just over $9.  What a rip off!  If I had been paying attention on the way driving to this dump, I would have noticed there is a Steak and Shake close by.  I could have walked here and had their chili for less mula and a much better meal.
Good food and friendly staff. Our kids love the corn dogs and their 2 hot dog special is the best deal in town. You should never leave this place hungry.
I had a good vibe walking into this place. I had a chicken gyros which was very good. My 8 year old hot dog and fries. Fries were nice and big. Place was very clean.  Good for a quick bite.
The hotdogs are good, trust a Chicagoan. Their food is good overall except their cheeseburgers are not worth your time. Fries are good too. They have a good deal for hot dogs.

Two locations in our area and our most recent visit was the Meacham location.

No complaints whatsoever.  Good food and good service....the guy who took our order was friendly.  We had hot dogs, pork chop sandwiches, onion rings, and fries.  The kids don't usually like onion rings, but they loved the ones here.  Would come back here just to order those.  Perfectly crispy, not too greasy, and you get the whole onion.  Always liked the pork sandwich here and this time was no exception.  Tasty and tender.  Hot dogs are consistently good...typical dogs.

We carried out, but waited for our food inside.  Seating area is kind of small, but it's clean and they have a TV to keep you entertained.  We didn't have to wait long, even though there were 2 people ahead of us in line.  We waited less than 10 minutes for all our food.

We'll continue to come here.

I've been to this place a few times and I always forget why I don't come here more often, because its not very good.  The hotdogs are below average and the guy behind the counter seems continually pissed off at something. Don't waist your time.

Overall its low quality, poor service and expensive.

Stopped by the shop in Elgin since i work down the street. Food was good but the one thing that really turned me off was the prep cook was on the slicer cutting tomatoes and NOT USING GLOVES! Being a food service professional I would NEVER let that happen. Invest in some gloves for your workers. You are lucky I'm not the health department.

Moments ago after ordering and paying for my lunch I made the mistake of taking the smallest sized Styrofoam cup Big Sammy's had and I began dispensing water into it, the manager walked over to me and said "excuse me", at first I was not sure why and then I realized that he had not given me the cup which was actually closer to me than him. I stopped pouring the water and handed him my cup, at that point he tried to give me the cup back. Making someone feel bad about taking a cup worth a cent or two made me feel like I was not welcome there, and I got the hint.

Convenient location been there a couple of times and no to impressed.  Service was average took a long time to get food. Beef is average nothing out of the ordinary (little dry). Gyro had very good flavor, but was over cooked. Went around lunch time and not enough hel0 to handle lunch time crowd! Make the french frie order larger! I think this place has a great of potential if they worked with their staff on customer service skills, lowered prices a little, and make it a unique experience. Ooo... and bring in Chicago style dogs..relish, boilded dog, mustard, celery salt and a pepper. The server couldnt make it that way !

Strictly go there for hot dogs only. EVERYTHING ELSE comes out of bag and the proof is on its walls. The pictures of the food they have also have the name of the company that manufactures the food. There prices on everything but the hot dogs is way to high for food that comes out of a factory. They need to fix their pricing ASAP.

This place isn't bad - simple dogs and burgers. is it out of this world? no it is not but it does hit the spot if you want simple decent food at a reasonable price. I like their meal deals and the food is pretty good quality.

Only complaint is they need more seating room.
Place is great, big Sammy is always super friendly! We only go to the one in Elgin.  Great value very clean place!

Gyro combo was HUGE - I put myself into a food coma trying to finish it. The food was fresh and made to order, greasy and tasty gyros, crispy fries and their soda fountain choices are plentiful. They have a pretty good menu selection and 8 different combo meals.
This is my go-to place for good dogs when I'm driving through the suburbs. Its one of the few places around that doesn't skimp on fries. The manager and employees are always friendly. Great place.

More or less the same as the location on Biesterfield only smaller.  Identical menu.  Decent prices.  Just your typical run of the mill hot dog/burger/gyro place.  

Pretty good portion.  Decent burgers.  Clean.  Quick service.  

I wish they had Greek Chicken ....

I stopped here for lunch because I had a card for a free hotdog when you purchase a fry or drink. I got here a little before noon and it wasn't too crowded at the time. As I waited for my food though, it was a different story as there were a ton of people lined up.

The hotdog was average which confuses me. The sign states "Big Sammy's Hot Dogs" so I would think that their hotdogs would be above average, if not superior to other hot dog joints. Dog had your typical tomato, mustard, onion and I think relish. The weird thing was it had one of those flat stacker pickles, not a regular spear like most hotdogs. I love pickles so I still ate it! Oh, and no sesame seed bun, just a plain ol bun that you can buy at Jewel. And, no celery salt which a lot of "Chicago Style" hotdogs have.

The fries were pretty good. I noticed that they weren't too greasy which was a plus. My order was to go and they did give me ketchup packets (another yelper mentioned that you had to pump your own ketchup). 

I also ordered the beer battered mushrooms. I love breaded/fried mushrooms...these, not so much. I am not a fan of beer (shocking, I know) and these tasted very strongly of beer. You are probably thinking, "then why did you order beer battered mushrooms, stupid"...I'm thinking the same thing. I've had many "beer battered" items before and you can never really taste beer but these shrooms must have had an overnight beer bath because they were kicking. They do charge extra for ranch sauce.

I may try Sammy's again for lunch but I definitely won't get a hotdog as it wasn't anything special.

good chicago food place.  being from the city and working in the burbs.  This place is pretty good.  and with the $5 two hot dogs fries and a drink?????  what an awesome deal.  Probably will become a weekly spot for me.

I've been going here for years. The hot dogs are pretty good, but as with other reviews, they're nothing to write home about. Their hot dogs are not advertised as "Chicago Style" so you have no reason to be disappointed if you get one with everything and it's not the Chicago Style dog you're used to.
