I will say though that their Cheesey Combo is very large and one of the best to be had in the northern suburbs. Their facilities are clean and the service has always been good.
I love this place! They are the best "grill" place out there!!! Clean, very reasonable prices and the people are SO nice! Im so glad you guys are around!!!

I 1st went here because I had a card for free 2 hot dogs, fries and a drink. Hot dogs average nothing to brag about the fries were good and salty. 2nd time around I came for the Rib deal, I think it was like $15 for full slab fries and drink. Ribs were decent not the best but for the $ they weren't bad. Now for my most recent visit I got the chicken fingers and my boyfriend go the gyro (which was huge). My chicken fingers were crispy, meaty and little dry... but still tasted good. Overall the place has average food, not outstanding. I rather go to Portillos.

I'm from the city so finding a place in the suburbs with pretty good gyros are few and far between. So my girlfriend took me here down the street from her house and boy was I surprised. Big Sammys opened up not too long ago so was a new place to try and convince me the suburbs had a decent gyro spot. It did not disappoint. First they give you a large portion that is worth the price of the meal. That's rare with smaller food chains but the actually give you the bang for your buck. Second most gyro spots in the burbs try to imitate the city but not here. Its  there own kind of gyro that makes it unique from all the other spots out in the suburbs. Big Sammys is really a pleasant surprise.

This review is for one event/two restaurants and will be posted on both restaurants yelps!! 

This past weekend my husband & I hosted an all out "Tropical Pool Party" in our home where we catered/served an array of Caribbean food to our attending 50+ guests. Prior to the party we had diligently searched around  for local restaurants to cater our main dishes - we were trying to avoid ordering from the inner city usual locations and wanted to support local suburban businesses. And I must say we are so glad we did. 

We ordered Jamaican & Puerto Rican cuisines from two separate restaurants and I must say they both delivered Exceptional Dishes. 

1) Montego Bay Restaurant & Grill - Bellwood, IL 
We ordered a medium tray of Jerk Chicken & a medium tray of Jamaican Rice & Beans. I had initially called in to place an order for just the rice & beans, then personally visited that same evening and ended up ordering the jerk chicken as well. 
Mr. Curtis was extremely nice and very attentive & helpful  to us while deciding on the portion sizes for the amount of guest were were expecting. During this time there were 2 other younger gentlemen behind the counter attending customers and I could not help but notice how respectful, polite and courteous they were (oddly we don't see that very often from the younger generation working in restaurants) Much respect for that!! 

O.M.G.!!!! The portions in these trays were so much more than expected - I can only imagine how much food comes in a large tray. The food was absolutely delicious, the rice & beans was amazing, cooked just right with  lots of flavor & seasoning - I could not stop eating the rice, it is so good that you can eat it alone. The BBQ'd Jerk Chicken was cooked to perfection, full with aromatic & smoky flavors, extremely juicy with an awesome Jamaican kick to it - the taste just filled your mouth with delight. We were also provided with extra jerk sauce to add to the chicken - that sauce was "Fire in a bottle" and although it was spicy it had you wanting more. Our guest were completed delighted with the Jamaican food as many had never had it before. Mr Curtis - Thank you so much for catering your delicious food for our Tropical party. We will definitely be back for more. 

2) Santiago's Puerto Rican Restaurant Sabores Latinos Inc. - Des  Plaines, IL
We ordered a large tray of Pernil (roasted pork), Medium tray of Maduros (fried plantains) & a tray of Pastelillos (fried meat pies). First off, my husband (who picked up the food) said the Pernil smelled so good in the car on the way home that he was tempted to pull over to eat some. 

Again, the portions were much more than expected which is a big Plus when catering for an event. The pernil was extremely juicy and flowing with flavor, the seasoning was perfect, the pernil was cut up into nice sized portions  - just what you expect for a great tasting pernil. We were provided in a separate tray with the cuero (pork skin) which was crisped to perfection  (that we saved for our enjoyment the next day...LOL).  I am guessing and totally speculating that the pastelillos (fried meat pies) were absolutely delicious because they went so fast I didn't get a chance to have one but the guest sure made it a point to tell me how delicious they were as they were savoring the taste. The maduros (fried plantains) were a big hit as well, after all who doesn't like fried plantains to compliment a nice piece of pernil/ Right?!?!! 
Santiago's I must  say you provided some Absolutely Delicious Food!! 

In addition your attention to detail & customer service is exceptional, the fact that Mr. Santiago called me the following day after our event to see how everything went and if the food meet our expectations is by far going above and beyond for your customers satisfaction. That was completely priceless!!!

Thank you once again Mr. Curtis from Montego Bay Restaurant & Grill and Mr. Santiago & his beautiful wife Marisol from Santiago's Puerto Rican Restaurant for providing our guests with an ultimately delightful cuisine experience that I am certain will be 
talked about for a long time to come. 

I wish both of these restaurants much success & prosperity!! Many Blessings!!!

I REALLY wanted to love this place, I really did. It's disheartening to have to write this review but I feel it is necessary so that people who have families and have busy lives do not waste their time.

Firstly, the food is good. No complaints in that department. What I don't like is that my family and I have wasted time driving to Santiago's (during business hours) and they're closed. Very poor business practice and rather unprofessional. We let it slide and never even brought it up on one too many occasions but tonight, we just had enough.

Since we've made multiple visits in the past (6-8 roughly) where they should be open but for whatever reason they're 'closed', we decided today to call hours ahead to make sure they weren't closing early or closed in general. We call 3 hours ahead of time and ask the owner what time they close. She stated "8pm". Wonderful! I, being weary because we've had so many issues regarding driving there to find out they're 'closed', decided to call in my order at 7:35pm. No one picks up and we called atleast 6 times.... At this point, we really don't care about how good the food is or how nice the staff is, this is inconsiderate to customers ESPECIALLY when we called 3 hours ahead of time to make sure we'd make it before they close. And you close earlier anyway. They have caller ID. At the very least, CALL the customer who you told you'd be open til 8pm and let them know you're closing earlier, again. I get you have a family but so do the rest of your customers. We'd like to manage our time just as efficiently as you do yours so when you tell us you'd be open til 8pm and that's what we planned for our family dinner yet you close earlier, it just shows me that you have no regard or consideration for your customers. And as good as your food is, it's not worth all the hassle of trying to plan around your wavering 'business hours'. 

Consistency is key and this establishment is lacking. We shouldn't have to call EVERY SINGLE TIME we want to dine in or order out. Business hours are there for a reason. I honestly don't even know why you have business hours to begin with when you hardly ever adhere to them.

I've ranted and raved to family and friends about your food and recommended it to everyone. Can't say I'd do that anymore. Last visit we had there you closed early and when we left, a gentleman walked up to your restaurant and disappointingly shook his head. He told us he was from out of town and that someone recommended this place to him. That night was his 2nd attempt but left in disappointment because he also has wasted 2 visits since you closed earlier than what your business hours state.

This review is not intended to bash Santiago's. It is more of a duty I feel is necessary to make to the public so that they are aware that although they're craving that Jibarito or what have you, that they may just be wasting their time just as we have TOO many times. Gas isn't cheap and time is valuable. Please take that into consideration when you decide to close earlier than what your business hours indicate.

Please either change your hours completely or don't have them at all. It's very frustrating. And I'm sure if this consistently happened to you and your family while trying to plan a family dinner, you'd be just as disappointed. Please be more considerate of your customers and their time. We are just as busy with our own lives as you are with yours and this is nothing short of a HUGE inconvenience and disappointment.

Sincerely,
A Once Loyal Customer

Santiagos is located on Oakton in Des Plaines.  I found it where else on Yelp.  As I was coming back towards Sweet Home Chicago I was hungry (so what else is new). I looked on Yelp for something on my return path what should I see, but Santiago's a 4 1/2 star Puerto Rican Restaurant.  

I was in a rush as I had another meeting scheduled so I grabbed some food on the fly.  The shredded pork carnitas  looked delicious.  I ordered this with Puerto Rican rice and red beans.  They gave me a very generous portion.  Ummm ummmm excellent choice.  I scarfed down about half of the serving and figured tomorrow is another day.  

If I'm ever in the area again I plan on going back and trying some of the other dishes and dining in a more leisurely way.  The one dish I had was very good

Outstanding Puerto Rican food. All Puerto Ricans should be proud of Santiagos and their staff. This is a establishment that deserves all the praise and press available. Restaurant is clean, service is sweet and the food is out of this world. If you are in the area, STOP BY. You will not be disappointed. You will thank us fellow yelpers. Thank you yelp for uncovering this gem. Thank you Santiagos for serving such delicious Puerto Rican food. I will be back! Great Value too.

Really nice food here and very friendly staff.  Be prepared to wait a long time for your freshly made food (like 40 minutes), or better yet, call well in advance if you already know what you want.  The interior is not big, but nicely decorated and there is some seating available.  It seems like a lot of the proprietors' friends and family members like to hang out here, which frankly I think is nice.  That's how a real family-owned business should be.  

We chose to bring our food back home with us since the six of us felt too cramped in the restaurant and the music, while peppy and thematic, was a bit too loud.

I had the steak jibarito.  I had never had a jibarito before, and now that I can check it off my bucket list, I don't think I would order that again.  It was just TOO much for me, with the fried plantains, plus the steak, plus the tomato, onions, and especially the MELTED CHEESE.  I split this dish with my sister (and it was certainly big enough to do so), and she hates mayo so we didn't get that, hence some calories were saved.  If you are a fan of messy, over-the-top, calorific foods, you will probably like this.  My brother-in-law devoured his jibarito and practically licked up the crumbs, so surely they are doing this dish right.  And if you already know you like jibaritos, they have a variety of different types available so I'm sure this will be a worthwhile stop for you.

My mom got the beef stew, which was awesome.  We also got the rice, which was equally good; they use some kind of tasty spice to season it and that really made it outstanding.

We got tostones (fried plantain) as a side.  This was similar to what was already on my jibarito.  Next time I'd probably go for the maduros (sweet plantain).

The highlight of this outing was probably the pasteles (Puerto Rican tamale).  My mom LOVES pasteles, and used to get them homemade all the time from a former co-worker.  My mom has since been on the hunt for a good one, and with the first bite of Santiago's pasteles she proclaimed how dangerous it was to have this place so close to home, because now she will have access to great pasteles all the time!  The only glitch was that Santiago's forgot to give us our pasteles in our to-go bag, so we had to drive back after we were done eating our main course to pick them up.  Luckily it was all worth it!

The food here is really good and the family seems very nice, so I am hopeful that the efficiency of the restaurant will increase over time.  Either way I strongly recommend a visit, and I am sure that my family will become repeat customers.

The food is delicious!!  A little bit of a wait, but definately worth it!  The staff is very friendly as well.  I live about 45mins from Des Plaines but my husband works out there so we order from there from time to time.  My last visit I ordered the Lechon dinner & when I got home I noticed they had forgotten the lechon!  I only had the arroz con gandules.  When I called to notify them of their mistake, the owner was very, very apologetic.  I explained to her that I lived far & wasn't able to return right away but would be heading back out that way to pick up my husband from work at 11pm. She went above & beyond to make sure I received a new dinner, with some soda too, even though they would be closed at that time.  Then she called me the next day to make sure I received my dinner & that I was satisfied.  I thought that was very thoughtful of her!  That is great customer service & is greatly appreciated!  I highly recommend them, not only for the food, but for the service.  Wells done Santiago's!!

The first week they opened I went and the food was delicious.  I recently went back and ordered the same dish which was the lechon dinner.  I was very disappointed, the meat was dry and over cooked  with meat juice over it.  I asked for some skin and OMG I could not believe what she gave me.  It was a black, burnt piece of skin that was so bitter.  I kid you not, I threw it in the garbage.  It was nasty.  I could never serve anyone something like that.  I was pissed because the food is not cheap.  I will not be coming back.  You might have a different experience though.  Try the place out for yourself.

We were around the neighborhood and had a taste for something and then we yelped Puerto Rican food. When we arrived it's a divey place in the corner of a mini strip mall. 
There were a few tables in the place and in the background was Latin music. As you approach the front you can actually see the different types of dishes they serve in warming trays behind a glass pane. Their menu board is handwritten. At the time we were there they ran out of there to go menus. Basically you place your order upfront and seat yourself and they will serve your meal. They serve fountain drinks and we ended up getting Horchata. It was refreshing and really sweet you can definitely taste the cinnamon. We both ordered the beef steak and onions with Puerto Rican rice which has bits of pork in it and we ordered a side of sweet fried plantains. The plantains was enough for us to share. Crispy on the outside and nice soft and sweet on the inside. Serving portions were pretty good the beefsteak was not at all tough and chewy but perfect that I was able to separate it with my butter knife and fork. There was a little sauce that I soaked my rice with really tasty I would get this dish again. The one thing that we didn't like was that we found a couple of pork bones in the rice. I'm sure that made it flavorful but you have to be careful not to chip a tooth.
The staff was friendly and they also asked us how was our meal.
Overall a nice experience I will definitely come back again because we don't have a good Puerto Rican restaurant around us unless we go into the city.

Amazing! A must have!
The food was a piece of heaven. I will definitely be stopping through every time I visit Chicago!
My family and I love this place! Wonderful authentic Puerto Rican food! The family that runs this place are always so kind and genuine! Thank you for your hospitality!

Soo happy to have a place that serves Puerto Rican food close to home 
It was soooo good definitely going back
Just like if you went over someone's house to eat lol thumbs up to the chef 
Gonna be sure and tell everyone about this place
Great food, my first time getting food from here and the Jivarito was delicious. The arroz con gandules was delicious as well and I highly recommend this place.

So my first experience, headed home this morning and decided that I would check out this place for food.  I'm a big fan of Caf Central in the city and have never found anything close to it.  My favorite meal is arroz blanco con habichuela y bistec encebollado (white rice and beans (kindey) and steak with onion).  This is a meal that my grandmother and mother have made and for me, is a staple of growing up Puerto Rican.  

First, they weren't open on time, but they explained what happened and so I didn't let that discourage me.  I was willing to wait for food while another customer came in to get a jibarito.  The other customer really got me excited since they had food there already and they were a big fan.  

So I got my plate, took it home to not let customer service or friendliness or anything impact my meal.  Let's just say that no pictures could be produced because the minute I smelled and tasted it, I couldn't stop from digging in.  Once I started, I could not stop.  The food took me back to growing up....I'm extremely happy this is in DP!

As for customer service, the cook in the back and the lady at the counter (assuming husband and wife combo) were awesomely friendly.  It isn't a walk in order your food and go, people here are willing to have a conversation with you.  Love the vibe of the place, the service, the food...would love to go and take my wife for some good PR food.  Would love if they did some catering!

I was so excited that I found a Puerto Rican restaurant nearby. I had a Jibarito De Lechon and thought it was very flavorful. The pork was soft and juicy. I didnt wait long at all. The owner was especially nice and welcoming.

I'm so excited! A Puerto Rican restaurant in the burbs! You mean, I don't have to drive to Humboldt Park through the Kennedy traffic??? This place is so cute with the Puerto Rican paintings on the wall, the domino table set up, and the lively salsa music playing in the background. I was a little apprehensive about this place because the previous restaurants in this space did not do so well. However, the food was delicious! I loved the jibarito de bistec and the relleno de papa. The steak was juicy on crisp garlicky plantains and the potato mash ball was soft and filled with a delicious meat mixture. I especially loved the pique on the tables. The flavor brought me back to my visits to Puerto Rico. The mofongo was so flavorful, one of the best flavored mofongos I've had, but the temperature could have been warmer. The alcapurias was delish and the pastelillo was just okay. The ground beef in the pastelillo was a bit overcooked, but I would definitely try it again to see if that was just a one time thing. I can't wait to go back and try the morcilla and the pasteles. Yes! They have pasteles! If you never had Puerto Rican food, you should definitely try this place out!

The food was incredible. I had a steak jibarito and rice. Thr plantain was nice and crispy on the outside. The meat was well cooked and flavorful. All the other parts of the meal blended together PERFECTLY and came together for a wonderfully delicious explosion of flavor. The rice was also incredible. Rich, full of flavor and a soft creamy texture. The service was also very good and the people working here were more than friendly. They were willing to answer any questions and FULL of smiles.  Cannot wait to come back again!

This is not a true PR restaurant by any means. Went there yesterday with a good friend that's PR and I'm Cuban. We've both lived in our respective islands, been spoiled by great food made by our moms and replicated by the numerous quality Latino restaurants in Chicago. Having said that, this place is not good. 

The place is small, a little musty, service was mediocre at best, and the food was sub par. We ordered the arroz con gandules, pernil and a side of maduros. Thank God my buddy caught the server trying to dump the juice from the pernil on the rice. Wtf??? Who does that to rice? The actual meat had no flavor, seemed undercooked and smelled foul. I ate the maduros and the rice, but threw away the meat. 

For the people that live in the area this is probably a good restaurant, but make no mistake about it, this place is NOT authentic PR food.
If you are in the neighborhood even if not I suggest giving them a try small place but offering real authentic food.

Did my daughters birthday party catering  from here got arroz con gandules  pollo guisado and the Lechon everything was Amazing!!!!! And they even opened the restaurant  on Sunday just for me because my daughters bday was on Sunday !!! Best price around and best quality food ... they made a customer for life thank you sooooo much !!!! Ustedes son los mejores !!!!

Finally got around to trying this place out. Super impressed with the food. I ordered the lechon with Arroz con gandules. It was delicious. The lechon was moist and flavorful. I ordered take out but got a chance to hang out in the restaurant for a bit. It was very cozy and had a home comfort feel to it. What's even awesome is, the dominoes table they have set up for guests. Made me feel part of the family with all the decor and music. I will definitely come back maybe to often then I should since it's down the street from me.

Very great food and service feels like home and everything was tasty from the entrees to the desserts and there pacha juice was amazing come check them out the prices are very reasonable and the food is well worth it 2 big thumbs up

I hope this place thrives because their pork (lechon) was great. Very moist and abundant in serving portion sitting in its own juices. Every bite was delicious. The pernil dinner came with a side of Arroz con gandules which was tasty but it was a bit dry. It was probably because we went 10 minutes before closing. My wife had a steak sandwich which was also moist and delicious. The horchata wasn't the same as I had at Mexican  restaurants but it still satisfied.

Definitely will come back.

I absolutely love that this lil gem is in DP! HANDS DOWN on the lechon hibarito!  Such explosive flavors!  I highly recommend this place. You won't be disappointed.  People that work there are so super friendly!

I was recommended by coworkers to come here. I was glad they finally opened a puerto rican restaurant close to work. As a Trained chef and foodie, I also, work part time in the food industry i didnt care for their alcapurrias -fried dumplings or thier relleno de papa-stuff potatoes with meat., it was over seasoned and burnt.  My other coworkers didn't care for their meal either. The horchata was,horrible, and the pastry had too much filo dough and not enough filing  While you provide good customer service !
Your establishment needs structure, like answer phones that is what is advertised on your menu for take out.  People stationed  where the need to be in order to have everything run smoothly.  
I wish you great success!

Love small businesses. You can tell these guys have their heart in it. I look forward to see where they take this venture and will revisit in a few months. Great idea to bring Puerto Rican food to the NW side.

Love this place.  They just recently opened a few weeks ago and you can tell their customers will definitely keep coming back. The owner is very friendly and came out to see if the food was good.  This is an authentic family owned restaurant. The owner/chef runs the kitchen and his wife and kids helps out and takes the orders.  Super friendly staff. 
My husband ordered the Lechon and rice and it was delicious. My 3 years daughter who is usually picky at dinner times devoured the bistec steak sandwich and rice. If you ever go you must try the flan.

Updating my review. I finally got a hold of someone and was able to finally try the food! It was delicious! The wait was a bit long, but the food was great. I had the jibarito and Puerto Rican rice. Some of the best I've ever had!!

I grew up eating the best PR food from my Abuela and all my Tia's and of course my mom. Grew up in Humboldt park and then moved to northern suburbs a few years ago. The move was the hardest because all my favorite places to eat at in the city are now an hour away. Enter Santiagos! I now have a DELICIOUS PR restaurant a short drive away from my house. I went on a Friday night and they were very busy. Always a good sign. Ordered pastele, alcapuria, jibarito de bistec and lechon dinner with a side of kidney beans. The flavors were all SPOT on from my childhood. The food was hot, and fresh! The service was amazing. Truly a family joint that welcomes you into their Puerto Rican Household. And after the doors closed and we were still eating, the workers all made themselves a plate of food, and all sat down together and are together enjoying each other's company. Another person (assuming family member not in uniform) came in after closing and made a plate and joined everyone else. This is a hidden gem, and furthermore it's this small family business that I love to support!! I enjoyed their pastele so much I bought a dozen frozen! I will be back soon and slowly try every thing on the menu. Mofongo and bacalatos and new stew next time

Thank God for this hidden jewel of Puerto Rican cuisine in the heart of Des Plaines...love this Puerto Rican resto for its homey, comfy ambience... the owner Marisol and staff are so hospitable and gracious....Her hubby, Chef Santiago never cease to amaze the palate ...hats off to the steak and lechon jibarito , the patitas, mofongo, and Puerto Rican tamales, so delish and oh to die for!

I was super pumped to find a Puerto Rican restaurant on this side of town! I got sick and tired of driving the city to places that were slowly declining. This place is fresh, delicious and the people that work there are also super nice! Customer service is everything. It's a cute little hole in the wall, but their crunchy and juicy Jibarito has me wanting to come back daily! If I didn't want to have a beach bod, I'd probably be here daily. Ha! Deff worth the try! Steak Jibarito no caramelized onions. White rice and beans(because I don't eat pork) or else I would've gotten the arroz con gondulez
Super friendly staff, clean and food is authentic. Price are reasonable and they have all the traditional PR food.

I always knew something was missing in my life until I tried their cuban sandwich. No need for marriage when I now feel like a complete person after eating a cuban sandwich. When im having a bad day or feeling sad, their cuban sandwich makes me happy. I am planning to try more menu items but I have a strong hunger relationship with the cuban sandwich.

First time last night. I ordered a large order of rice. The staff here are amazing and friendly and give the best welcome feeling. I was only picking up rice but the amazing smell in there and the staff made me want to sit down and have dinner. I cant wait to be back to sit down for a full meal. I will be back here for sure!!!

The food is great! The wait was long! About a good 30 mins for 3 jibarito sandwiches and rice. At first I was not happy at all due to the wait, but when we got the food it was fresh, hot and tasted great! The place is still brand new and opened up Feb 1st. Seems like a nice family running the place. I really think once they are open longer things will run smoother. All I can say is to be patient the food is worth the wait.

I had the accappuria and relleno de papa; really good. The arroz con gandules was not flavorful. It was really busy I went on Thursday during my lunch break around 12. The only thing I didn't like was when I asked the man serving me if they accept credit cards he said he didn't know and that he works in the back cooking and shouldn't even be in the front that he was just helping. I felt be it work in the back as cook, busser boy, etc good customer service should be all around and he should have asked one of his coworkers my concern. None the less they accept credit cards; which is great! The woman that rung me up was very sweet which due to the food and her great customer service I will be back. If it wasn't for her, the gentleman that was serving me would have lost a customer regardless of how I liked the food. I'm a big customer service person.

My husband and I drove by a few weeks before it opened and then stopped in as soon as we saw the open sign.  The restaurant had a welcoming, family atmosphere and tasty food. We ordered jibaritos, arroz con gandules and pinto beans.  The food came quickly and tasted great.  Would definitely recommend to friends.  No more trips to the city for us!
Decided to try a new restaurant and very glad we did! The staff is so friendly and welcoming! The jibarito and cubano sandwiches were delicious and worth the wait! We will be back again :)
I was there the second day they opened. Ordered a jibarito and to my surprise, a bunch of hair between the lettuce and the cheese. I left it right on the table and walked out. Will never go back.
Food is delicious, great service. Serve fresh to order. Finally Puerto Rican food near us! Love coming here

I've wanted to come here after reading the reviews on Yelp and also on a local foodie web site.Today was that day.I tried the El Jibarito on Plantains with the yellow Puerto Rican rice.First the steak;large,cut in two with fresh plantains holding it together.The meat was moist,juicy,and an enjoyable sandwich to devour.On to the Puerto Rican rice.A large portion which was quite tasty and complimented the El Jibarito.My friend chose the beef stew with potatoes and carrots with yellow rice and he was quite impressed and he's a hard one to please.We walked out of Santiago's Stuffed and Happy like one would after eating at a family feast.And this is a Family restaurant run by a family who makes you feel welcome and part of their family.This is a hidden treasure in Des Plaines.Lots of items to choose from.This is a go to place.Try it.
Delicious el jibarito! Definitely going back and highly recommended.

Got a recommendation from a friend to come here. Now being the second time eating here,the great recommendations prove them well! It's quaint appeal, leaves something to be desired. I loved the warm welcoming customer service from the mom and daughters when you walk through the door!  The food...Well worth the wait! So fresh and yummy! I have a feeling they will need a bigger spot soon!!! I'm sure they will thrive beyond belief!

I have been to this restaurant several times already and must say its a definite favorite in the area. All their food is prepared fresh and full of flavor. I have tried many things on the menu and have to say all taste great. Would recommend to anyone wish they stayed open a little later but that's ok. Great Puerto Rican food at a great price. To many more visits here!

Just went here last week with my sister, and let me just say amazing!!! When u walk in smells so great. The food was delicious and if u have trouble picking the lovely ladies will help u. Can't wait to go back.

I just saw someone post on FB that they ate here and it is near my house and Joe Caputo where i buy groceries. The only food I know that is Puerto Rican is Jibarito.  So i ordered that and was surprised that they also have lechon which is the same food back home. The place looks new and clean. The people are friendly. For the dinner it already pre-made and it is on the see through counter. The sandwiches are made to order. The service was fast enough. They just need to organize on how to take orders and pay and get food. The food smells delicious. My jibarito is awesomrly yummy. The plantain outside is crispy, thr steak is thinly sliced and tender. Everything that is inthere is tasty and i love te taste of garlicwhich is just the right amount. The lechon is good too. They serve it with rice and beans but you can order it as appetizer for $6/lb. definitely will be back

So I gave this review a lot of thought and I even asked for my girlfriends opinion before I posted this. Her and I went to Santiago's for the first time together and found our experience a little different from everyone else's. 

I'm used to the Puerto Rican restaurants in Chicago and was recommended to visit Santiago's by a friend. Our friend found their lunch menu to be perfect as she expected. 

We went to visit for dinner and was greeted by who seems to be the owner/manager. We looked at the menu and knew exactly what to order. Unfortunately it took us almost 10 minutes to even place an order because of the people coming in after us that we're getting served before us.. Not sure how that happened. We made eye contact with the girl leaning against the wall by the register to take our order but she walked away.. Eventually after standing in front of the register we were greeted by the owner/manager again who asked the same girl who walked away from us to place our order. She walked away again and another girl took our order. After we placed our order we were instructed to have a seat and to wait for our food. My girlfriend and I were a little confused because of how different the ordering process was for us compared to how we're used to in the city. The same girl who took our order dropped off our food and checked up on us throughout our visit. At the end we grabbed our plates and since we paid in advance we left. Don't get me wrong the food was awesome and the restaurant was as I expected. Had a great Puerto Rican atmosphere. I understand every restaurant is different and I plan to visit this restaurant again. 

Pro: The food was rich in flavor and was really good. The restaurant was clean and the manager was very attentive. Food time and portion was good. 

Con: Seems there were a lot of employees but not enough service. I felt the person who I approached at the register could have taken my order without walking away. I was also asked to grab my own food when the tables next to us were served by someone.

I was told about this place from my daughter who raved about it.  So I decided to try it out. I heard it gets really busy during lunch time so We went around 1:30pm. It's a nice small, friendly place. The young girl who took our order was very friendly and polite. I ordered the arroz with gandules and an alcapurria , I have tried better but this is still good puerto rican food. I will definitely come back . I need to try the jibarito. The only thing I would recommend is that they have a better system when people order , because I witnessed them trying to figure out who ordered what,  because it started getting a little busy.
Love love their rello de papas and morcilla. I'm glad a pr restaurant opened up close by.
Excellent food and customer service! Must try the mofongo and the pork! The restaurant also offers plenty of puertorrican beverages including Malta India, passion fruit juice, and Coco Rico.

Was looking forward to trying a new place and came back disappointed. Really wanted to try the jibarito but was told that the wait would be about 45 minutes (I couldn't wait as I was there on my lunch break). The waitress recommended the lechon dinner said it's a popular item also I wouldn't have to wait since it was already prepared. I went for it and also ordered a relleno de papa and alcapurria along with a pastelillo de guava for dessert. After waiting over 35 minutes I finally received my order. The relleno de papa had a weird taste, the alcapurria was dry, the lechon was too salty also the pastelillo didn't have enough guava. The one good thing I have to say is the staff was friendly even though they were very disorganized and they kept getting friends name wrong! If I do go back I will try the jibarito as a fellow coworker said it was good.
Outstanding Puerto Rican food, You will not be disappointed! I can eat here everyday.

Just went for dinner...Soo delicious ! Great food and huge portions. Had Cubano sandwich- first time trying it and WOW :) Awesome service! Everyone so friendly! They make you feel like you're a guest in their home. Will definitely be back.

This place is all about the food. It's a small place which is a huge downside and it was kinda dirty, but the food...amazing! We ordered the Lechon dinner with arroz con gandules and it was so delicious! Also, we ordered a jibarrito which is a steak sandwich with plantains as the pieces of bread. That was so good and we ordered the tostones and Maduros. Tostones were okay with not enough flavor but the Maduros were nice and sweet so that was nice. The people are extremely friendly and make you feel like part of the family. Will defenitly be going here again!

Very excited for local Puerto Rican food!!! Great food and extremely friendly service! Had the jibarito, bistec sandwiches, both white rice & beans, and arroz con gandules, pasteles, morcilla, and lechon- all was delicious, and I can't wait to go back for more. Would recommend calling ahead if during lunch, but be sure to do so with at least a 45 minute window- definitely worth the wait!

I really enjoy Puerto Rican food, but I hate the drive into the city to get it. So you can imagine how pleasantly surprised I was to find this new Restaurant. This place is legit, there food is authentic and super delicious.  I recommend El Jibarito, it's a steak sandwich made of plantains. During my last visit I met the owners, who were super nice. So if you have a hankering for some great food check this place out.

Absolutely a great place! Been 3 times because I live down the street and it's somewhere I look forward to frequenting. Food is home style and made with love. I have a culinary background and am an extreme foodie. This is a great spot!!

The service is not good, the wait is long, jibaritos do not take long to make. If the place opens at 10 some frituras should already be ready. Jibaritos should not be made with American Cheese. The food needs a lot more flavor. I live in the city and the food does not compare I think this place needs help in every way they can. I know many people that were excited when it first opened and very disappointed afterwards. Lots of customers lost. Very unorganized. I work right by this place and will never go back again.

My fault for coming in one hr before closing...the staff was courteous and so incredibly awesome. Food was great! Definitely excited that there is a P.R. So close to home and beats going to the city! Woot woot!

So I have given this place many chances for the sake that I love Puertican food. First time I went just so happen to be good Friday. They were closed, I was bummed because it's not an official holiday for business's but whatever. Went  a second time, ordered a jibarito & side of rice. They explained they ran out of rice! Who runs out of rice? That just tells me, that no one is truely paying attention to the establishment & it's needs. I waited 30min for my jibarito's, with no rice to be done within that time. I was never given my drinks I paid for. I had to ask for them. The girl giggled with a "OMG I forgot!" Look on her face. They had prob like 4-5 young employees in the business shirts & hats but not working what's so ever. They were lounging around, just talking. Maybe they were on break. Not sure but All Tables were dirty, full of empty plates just sitting as they all talked. Mind me, it was only me & 1 other couple in the whole joint. Finally got my Sandwhich, which was decent but it wasn't the same with no rice. I insisted to my boyfriend he must try the food with the full experience of the Puerto Rican rice! I convinced him to go again. We walked in a lil after 7:00, it was an hour before close (so the door states) and I order the same thing. So they inform me the kitchen is closed! I can only order whatever was already cooked. Are you kidding me? My boyfriend said he's done with this place! So today, 04/29/2016. I said ok! I'm giving them another chance! I'm going to phone in my order & just pick up to bring to him! I call, no one answers. I keep getting busy signals. I try again & I finally hit a voicemail saying that they are closed due to going to Minnesota for their daughters volleyball competition. What kind of inconsistent business is this? You can clearly tell that this is a first time experience running a business cuz they are doing a horrible job! It's a little hole in the wall business with a not so clean looking inside. The one sandwhich I tried was good. I never got to try anything else due to all these obstacles. I've never written a Yelp review & for this I felt I def had to! Maybe I just have bad luck but I have given this place one too many tries. No longer waisting my time! I'll just drive to humbolt park for good Puerto Rican food, I'm sure I wouldn't ever deal with situations like these over there!

You won't get service with a smile, but the service is good for an Indian restaurant  (you know what I mean).

The food is great and the spread is one of the best for lunch.  Sorry Gaylords, we're coming here from now on

I've been to Thumka many times over the course of the past few years, but was just never motivated to write a review...until today. 

4 adults and 3 little kiddos were on our way to Santa's Village on a Sunday afternoon and decided to fill up on some real food instead of the junk at the amusement park.  Having a hankering for Indian food, we settled on Thumka for the variety and speed factor.

The restaurant has absolutely zero wow factor, but the glorious buffet is what one comes for anyway.  Today's lunch buffet was full of EVERYTHING that was uber-delicious!  I can't personally say much for the vegetarian dishes, but from what I  could see, a couple in our party were enjoying theirs.  But my oh my, the meat options were ah-friggin-mazing!  There was the always-present tandoori chicken, hot and flavorful.  But let's move to the curries: lamb, butter chicken, achari chicken, and a catfish curry...I just couldn't get enough!  Hats off to the chef, because everything listed above, plus the raita and the desserts were off the hook! 

I'm looking for my next diet cheat day, and the navigation arrow is headed straight to Thumka.

It's waste of giving stars for this shit restuarent , me and my friends went for a buffet today there was no proper food in this restuarent and  all those food which they have kept in the buffet I think all have prepared a week ago and when we are eating house fly's are falling on our food no proper maintainance and no proper food is available in this restuarent and water millon is the only fresh food when I went, I think that is not called as a food but I payed 10$ for 3 pieces of water millon, going to this restuarent is waste of time and also waste of money....! I hope these people got my point .......!
Thank you for your food and I never visit again....!

I'm no Indian conoisseur, but I have tried a few places by now. I feel as though this Indian spot will appear more to the ethnic palate. Don't expect your Americanized, diluted down versions here.  The spices are spicier and packs a stronger punch than from other Indian places I've dined at. And that's not in a bad way!  In that sense, i feel that dishes here lean more authentic, and for the Indian-food-familiar crowd.

Ordered to go.  Chicken tikka masala/butter chicken. Sauce was flavorful. Thicker than what I'm used to (chunkier, not creamier), and darker, rather than the creamy-sweet I'm used to having. It was pretty flavorful, and the chunks of chicken were hearty. (In a Thai food analogy, more red curry than panang).

My friend ordered the chicken vindaloo. Also really delicious, and definitely deserved to be ordered on the spicy side. 

We opted out of the plain basmati rice. I had the basmati with mushrooms, since I'm a mushroom fanatic. These slices were hearty. She had the basmati rice with cumin, although I didn't try it.

We also added in an order of buttered naan bread. I'm used to garlic naan, which is pretty flavorful.  However, this naan's flavoring leans more on the mild side, and can be lost when eaten with the flavor-infused entrees. by itsself i notice its faint essence more, but... overall, it can be easily forgettable. Also on the thinner, burnt side. May not order the naan again, and instead try roti on a different go.

Worst Indian restaurant.. Food were stale, food flies were seen on buffet.. Buffet price was too high.. I have visited this restaurant 1.5 years back, this time I thought they might have improved but this time too I was disappointed. And too my surprise they increased the price. Will never visit again !

I was at this place on this past Thursday night. The buffet was terrible. Palak Paneer was cold. I told him that something was wrong. He politely understood the problem but did nothing to fix it. For a $15 buffet, this place was terrible both in quality and options for the food. Only reason for two stars is that both people working there, the manager and the server were very courteous and pleasant. 

I wish they can fix the food problem.

Thumka is in an alcove just north of the Garibaldi's. On entering, it is impressive. Very modern, clean, with linens, and wall treatment that reflects the Indian motif. A video of Indian pop music plays quietly on the TV.

The service was very slow. We came in just after opening for the evening, and there was only one other occupied table. It took over 30 minutes for our food order to arrive. I'm not sure if there was a delay putting it in, or some problems with the kitchen. We did come in upon opening, so maybe they were not set up yet. And there was a mix up on one of the dishes, which came blazing hot-spicy. The waiter spoke very softly and we often had trouble understanding him. We did go over the spiciness of the 3 dishes when the order was taken, but this dish was very hot instead of mild. They no-costed the $8 beer and apologized. 

Our chicken biryani was OK, very mild flavored. We have had tastier. Our spice-loving diner will try to dilute the high-heat spinach saagwala when using up the take home. The goat curry was good, and moderately spiced. We expected it would be the hottest thing on the table. Servings are very large: the biryani in particular was immense. The take-homes would not fit in 3 boxes.

They serve Indian beers (incl Hayward 5000), which are in a league of their own. I recommend them. The menu offers a long list of dishes, and nearly all are offered vegan or egg, and for added cost, chicken, goat, lamb or shrimp, and at various spiciness.

We may have hit an off time for Thumka, but our original high impressions were not representative of our overall experience.
Lunch Buffet is a rip off. $15 for lunch buffet is too much considering the fact that the food was very average. No wonder why the place is empty during lunch time.I will not go back.

Food was preety good.
Noodles are too delicious. Its a tradional good meal. Should taste the food.

2 words: Unlimited dosas! We went on a Wednesday night and the buffet had a vast variety of food, but the star was the unlimited dosas made fresh and in front us on a grill. The chef was very accommodating as we had a restriction of food without onion and garlic.  The food was great and the staff was attentive.

You won't find many suburban Indian places that run past 10 o'clock at night but one of the hidden gems that you WILL find tucked away in the outskirts of Schaumburg is Thumka. Anil was extremely courteous and professional and not only did he provide us with top-notch service, he also brought fresh naan and a fresh batch of paneer. DELICIOUS!!! The ambience is a very tranquil, dimly-lit setting with cozy booths and clean tables. 
*Anil re-filled our water at least 6 times
*Brought me extra desert
*Anil also taught me not to swallow the fennel seeds since they are to refreshed the mouth and help with digestion. High-five Anil!

Located behind Garibaldi Pizza.
Great gol gappa, great bhel.
Dinner buffet is $14.95, lots of veg options, good garlic naan.
Sour yogurt, wouldn't order the mango lassi.
Get the groupon if you can. Read the terms carefully. Groupon does not apply to the buffet.
Note that there is a 15% mandatory gratuity on groups of six or more - even on the buffet!!!
Service is attentive.
Restaurant says it is open but is closed from 2:30 to 6 pm be careful they will trick you
Its been a pretty good experience. Food is really good . Only downpart of going there was the servers tries to force you for buffet. Ordering from the menu is really worth it.
Can't beat the lunch buffet, mix of north and South Indian.  All you can eat dosa on Wednesday nights.  Atmosphere is nice also, good location off the highway.

Ordered for a party from thumka!! The delivery was on time.Good quantity. Food was good especially dum aloo, chicken tikka and dal makhani.butter chicken was ok. Had assorted breads platter out of which parathas were delicious.Gulab jamuns were very soft and perfectly cooked. Always loved their food n this time too they were great!! If u don't wanna compromise on quality as well as taste, this is the place to try!!

Great buffet!  Probably the best tandoori chicken I've had in a very long time.  There was a good variety of dishes.  The garlic naan was out of this world.  If you like Indian cuisine, this would be a good place to try.

I'm not an expert on Indian food, but my sister and I did enjoy our recent buffet visit to this restaurant. The food was good as far as we were concerned and the gentleman who catered to our needs, water, etc., was very friendly and personable. Also, it was a quiet place with some cozy booths available, which I always like...:)
My only comment would be that they might consider dropping the price a bit for the buffet as we did find it a bit higher than we would have liked for what was offered.
But again, we really liked the food and service! We would definitely recommend this restaurant!!
Great food! Even better service. They custom made food for my parents at a special request! No hesitation no complaints. Can't beat that service!

We really have enjoyed our meals here... my kids love the naan and my hubby and I like the wide variety of food.

However, in the past 3 months, we have tried to dine here on three different Saturday's only to find out the restaurant is closed for a private party. We don't live in the area, and drive past many great restaurants to get to Thumka and we are always super disappointed to see it closed. 

We are now searching for a new Indian restaurant to dine at that either has a private room for parties so their restaurant won't be closed to the public, or perhaps an Indian restaurant that has an updated webpage so the customer (me) knows it will be closed before driving all the way out there.

I went their around 3pm today. Me and my friend get a chance to eat. He welcomed us even it was around closing time. We are so happy about it. The presence was good. I like the service and this is the first time here for me. I would like to try buffet here only because of the reviews. I didn't encourage this place to anyone in terms of taste. I actually try all dishes to taste. I feel good with gulab jamun and mango shake. That's it with this place. Please don't even try to eat it here. One star for gulab jamun lol and one star for presence and service

An awesome find. I've lived right near it for awhile now, but just ended up going in the other day. When you go for the dinner buffet, you can order you choice of bread (naan, roti, etc.). I got the garlic naan and it was awesome. The selection at the buffet is pretty great for whatever indian food you might prefer. Definitely worth the money. I see that a lot of people five it less stars because they are catering in the restaurant so they're essentially closed, so I would call ahead just to make sure they're open to everyone. If so, prepare for some amazing food!
Thumka definitely has the largest buffet section in chicago land. All the food items were pretty average; nothing exceptional about anything. Loved the ambience though.

I like a small restaurant where they have a actinic flavors and it's not crowded we had a good experience in this restaurant and we enjoy some of the good food where we ordered  four different plates ,my bill was  approximately 55 dollars which is not bad for 4 people's I would go there again and again

If you've ever been to India, Thumka will remind you of a nice little restaurant that you might have eaten at away from your hotel. That is meant as a high compliment. 

Comfortable, friendly, no frills tables and booths with non-descript Bollywood playing on T.V.

Pakora's and chats are nice..Samosas, onion and potato pakoras, make your own bhel puri and pani puri.

Very nice and varied selection of main dishes -goat curry, chicken curry, butter chicken, 3 types of rice and biryani, channa masala and mixed lentil dal all had nice flavors and did not lack for spice (heat). 

Tandoori chicken was good quality and tasted good but suffered from being covered up and steamed so it lacked that nice dry outer texture that comes from the tandoori oven-like a dry barbecue. 

Desserts were good..Kheer was especially nice. 

Choose your own Naan is a nice touch. I chose plain-a little dry but still very good. Could have used a brush of ghee. 

Overall a nice experience and very good value.
Its back to nasty again. Its definitely not consistent. I think we r done now for sure.

Nice location.  A lot of selections on the buffet.  If you are into north Indian dishes you're likely to love this place. The lunch buffet wasn't crowded unlike other Indian restaurants on a Sunday afternoon.

Really bad experience with their buffet ... im giving 3 stars just because the owner is really nice person ... i had butter chicken or chicken tikka masala (taste was similar to both dishes) chicken was quite smelly that after 3 bites i quit .. the other dishes i had tasted below average . . Please do something about it .

Just one word - Awesome.... The food over here will remind you the awesome food from India.. I went for buffet... I was just shocked seeing the extensive menu for buffet. That too very cheap... I will recommend this place to everyone....

I met up with my boyfriend here for a quick lunch.  When I arrived I realized everyone does the buffet.  I wasn't feeling that hungry, but for about 8 or 9 dollars, who can complain.  The service was pretty good about filling our water and clearing our plates.  We found out that the buffet does not include naan, so we added two pieces of naan.. because Indian food is not the same without it!

The buffet was just okay.  There were quite a few options, but the food just wasn't; that great.  It tasted powdery like everything came from a mix.  I did not have much of an appetite after the first round of food.

I do not think I will return with all the other great Indian restaurants in the area,

Coming from a Desi who has searched high and low for good Indian food, Thumka is as good as it gets in Chicago. The food tastes really good and authentic although a little on the spicier side. But hey.. That's what good Indian food is supposed to be. The buffet has the most options that I have seen in Chicagoland area. And their bread menu is huge!! Both vegetarian and non vegetarian options are really good. I don't know how this place makes a profit with so many options at 10.99 for lunch and 11.99 for dinner but I hope they keep it up.

Somewhere between 2 and a half to 3 stars. 

Nothing too great, but not revoltingly bad either. We generally avoid buffets like the plague. Usually the buffets have stuff sitting out there for long time, rice is dry and in general the quality of food is sub par. We landed here on a Saturday night, we didn't have a choice but to take the buffet. It was ok... there was a variety of dishes, vegetarian and non vegetarian. I stuck to vegetarian mostly - the dal was tasty. The other dishes were ok. The best part about the buffet is their choice of bread. Usually, restaurants serve regular naan on the table. But Thumka gives you a whole menu of breads, that you can choose from, and it is made fresh to order. That, I thought was a nice touch. The service is nothing great, we had glasses empty on our table multiple times.

I have been here 3 times in total. The first 2 times I was so impressed by their food, quality and service.
I went there in 2013 Feb and came out licking my fingers.  That time lunch buffet used to be $6.99 which has hiked now.
Oh my today I was utterly disgusted by the quality of food.
Quantity of appetizers has reduced. 
Yogurt was sour, felt like weeks old.
Kadhi was sour as well. Gulab jamun were made out of bad milk I think. Daal makhni tasted way too sweet. Only good things were paani of golgappa, the service and the naans. 
Its not worth it at all now.
Clearly those $13 of dinner buffet went to waste.

Good thing gone downhill. So disappointed.

This is by far the absolute worst indian restaurant in the schaumburg barrington area. I don't understand how indian reviewers can possibly give this a good rating. We went on a Sunday afternoon for lunch. The buffet of course. The goat and lamb curries were like water. Not even salt in the samber. The rice dry. The buffet in general was dirty and if tandoori chicken doesn't get served on a sizzler plate...it's a fail. Desserts were just terrible ...gajjar ka halwa made with oil. Never going there again. Sticky floor. I felt gross afterward. Blaring news on the tv. Only good thing is the parking. It would make a great episode of kitchen nightmares.

We went here tonight for dinner - we've driven past multiple times but tonight we decided to come in.

Signs on the windows are all about the buffet, but we have a 10 year old who likes the flavors of Indian food, just not the heat.  We asked if they have menu service and the waiter told us no, just buffet, which was a bummer, but we decided to see if we could locate something that would fit our daughter's heat-phobic palate.

I went up with her and picked out items that she usually likes at other restaurants (Chicken Makhani, Paneer Pasanda, and Tandoori Chicken).  Unfortunately all three had a high spice level- they were even spicy to me and, as such, were completely inedible to her.  My wife and I kept eating and promised her we'd stop and make it up to her on the way home.

At this point, the manager came by and asked how everything was.  We told him about the spice level being so high and he said we could order off the menu and ask for particular spice levels.  We were both shocked and told him that the waiter said they didn't have menu service, he apologized for the confusion, brought us a menu and the waiter came by to take our daughter's order.  (Chicken Makhani, mild.)  When it came out, the manager apologized again and said he hoped she would like it.  She did - she said it was some of the best she has had and really liked the smoky flavor to the chicken and that the sauce was really creamy.

All the dishes on the buffet that I had were really good, but also really spicy, ot the point that, after a while, all I could taste was heat and the individual flavors of the dishes were lost in the flames.

Before we found out about the fact that they do have menu service, we vowed we wouldn't be back...but after finding out that they DO have menu service, we will be back and give them another try.

Attention all Indian restaurants: we know when you water down your curries.  We came here as a group.  We had the lunch buffet on a Sunday afternoon.  Some of our family members liked Thumka, some hated it. I'm kind of in-between.  Good variety of food.  Good variety of naans, paratha, etc.  Salad was fresh.  Chutnies, both sweet and savory, were also good.  Tandoori chicken is always better if it comes to your table sizzling which it did not.
  Here are the "no no's"; Undercooked rice that actually crunched when bitten.  Bland sambhar, I think they forgot the salt.  And, as stated earlier, no one likes skimming through watered-down shorva and bones, desperately in search of a boti that ends up being bland.  There were dishes that deserved a thumbs up.  I wonder if ordering ala carte is a better experience.

Definitely recommend this place, you should go in for the buffet sometime. Priced at $11 and $12 for lunch and dinner resp, they always have a bread special meaning you can order any kind of naan/paratha, the bigger your group the more varieties of bread you can probably taste. I think the BEST place for chat items for sure and they do have a big array of choices.

Chat Items: 1. Samosa & pakora.
2. Pani Puri -- This has to be made. For all the non-indians out here, who probably have not had this, you guys should make this. Its very simple to make. You have these small puri (small crunch oval shaped -- next to samosa/pakora), take some of those, make a small hole, with say like your thumb only on top of the puri, fill it with the POTATO (this is in the salad bar), then put the mint water in it [this is different from both the chutney - mint and tamarind, this is on the left of those two] and gobble the entire thing. You can probably google it if you want to see how they look. 
             Innovative items to make: 1. Having gone there a couple of times, I did get the idea that, we could also make SAMOSA CHANNA. So take the samosa (and pakora if you like those), crush them (if you want Indian style - just use your hand), put lot of channa masala , to cover the rest of bowl, then add both the red and green chutneys to it, you can add onion, tomato and small corriander leaves as garnish. It is by far the best thing that can be SELF-MADE on the menu.

Starters: Things that were good -- Chilli Chicken, Fish Pakora and the Chilli Babycorn (if you consider that as a starter)

Entrees: As far as they were concerned, I think everything was just ok.  The dal was good, paneer butter masala was good. butter chicken was just ok (it was good the first time I went, not the second time). 

Naan: Guess you could try something different always - Lachcha paratha was pretty good. 

Rice is also there, but I didnt take it.

Dessert: I think Gajjar halwa (Carrot halwa) and Payasam (Rice Pudding) were both good. But for my taste - Gajjar halwa would have been so much better if it was as sweet as Payasam. The gulab jamun was a let down both times. 

[ P.S. Anyone from restaurant seeing this, I would recommend the following : 
1. Please make the gajjar halwa a little more sweet
2. Gulab jamun more soft - which can be done by not letting it cook for as long as you have
3. Have instructions to make Pani Puri 
4. Tandoori Chicken has to be improved.
5. Please make butter chicken masala better, paneer masala and butter chicken masala should not be tasting the same way.
6. In my opinion, you can remove one of the main entrees, there are too many things and maybe put something similar to idli (I know you have this) - another solid item to eat is what I meant. ]

Ask for what drinks come with Buffet. Friendly service.  They have coat hangers. BEST BEST PLACE FOR INDIAN MUSIC. Bollywood tracks.
Loved the biryani in this place.. Hot,spicy and tasty just as hyderabadi asli biryani..

Went for a dinner buffet on a weekday.

Stale food. Food quality is sub-par. Too much oil in chicken biryani and that too of cheap quality.

Probably they are serving left over food from lunch buffet.

We are never going to visit this restaurant again nor we are going to recommend this outlet to anyone.
food is good. not so great. Hidden inside a deep shopping mall but nice customer service and coupons groupon always makes it cheap and affordable. the manager is a nice person.

If you like Naan, they have variety of flavors and it's good.  The rest of the food was mediocre. I didn't know they served sashimi there oh opps I guess that was the undercooked fish that was deep fried to attempt to mask the poor quality of fish any cat would refuse. Beware eat at your own risk!

I work nearby Thumka and I go over for the lunch buffet frequently.  There have been some nice improvements to the shopping center as well as the restaurant.  They always have a nice selection of Indian dishes to choose from and the soups are awesome!!  Great place to fill yourself up on with some well prepared Indian food.  Especially considering the price!

I tried the naan, samosas and lamb vindaloo. Everything was good and spicy. The only complaint is that one of the naan pieces was undercooked.  My order included a big bag of onions and carrots. The waiter was very nice with my to go order.

Ok.... $6.99 for lunch buffet.... not bad at all right? Well it all depends on the food.

right out of the gate I got a giant samosa. I mean, baseball sized. That was awesome. 

There were several other very tasty entrees, mostly vegetarian. Oh except the butter chicken, which was very good. I'm a big fan of the HOT food... none of this was but the flavors were great so I didn't mind. 

In the middle of all this, they brought out some naan and a sizzling cast iron plate of chicken with fresh white onion and lemon slices from somewhere in the back. Yum. Free refills on that awesome sizzling chicken too. Very cool.

The place was not that crowded, maybe four or five other tables of people on their lunch break....I hope they have enough business to stay open for a while. Staff was very nice and attentive at the right times.

I got a diet coke that tasted flat/strange and cost me $2. That was probably the only thing I could really complain about.

Came here thanks to yelp, wasn't disappointed,  have been coming ever since for the last year, I didn't give it the full set of stars because I don't think it beats when it's cooked fresh, otherwise delicious food great price, gotta love the naan menu. Service is good, and if it's a holiday the food will have an extra kick.

Update: As you can read below, we used to love this place.This place now has new management that's not serving the same kind of food. They try and not let you know the same so they can keep the original clientele but to me that was very deceiving. The food is way different than what original Thumka owners served. I don't think I am ever going back.


I usually don't review places we eat at, but this place made me sign up with Yelp!
May I start by saying, that there is no one form of Indian food but several depending on the regions it comes from/how it is cooked. Thumka serves north Indian food, and is very close to what you would find at various restaurants back in India. 
Few things on why we love Thumka:
1. The main course dishes,(like dal makhani and paneer) always taste the same, every time we go. 
2. The number of dishes on his buffet is good for the price charged compared to other Indian restaurants in nearby area.
3. Not just the main course, but his appetizers(samosas, chaat, pakodas) always taste fresh and are really good. Oh, did I mention the pani puri (gol gappe) is AHMAZING!?!
4. My MIL  loves the desserts here, especially Gajar Halwa.
5. I really like how many different types of Naan's are offered.

My husband is a vegetarian but just by looking at the meat items I can tell they are good too.

 Things that can be improved:
1. Idli and sambhar? They just don't taste good here.
2. Service? It's a little on the slower side

Nothing else to complain. It takes a lot for a restaurant to bring me and my husband back, but Thumka serves the Best dal makhani and paneer in Schaumburg area, amongst all the places we have tried. We come here a lot often, for these two items, oh and Gol Gappe!

Must try!!
The only good thing about this place is the service. This is a place the health department should check out.

I went there with my husband after a very long day of running errands. We noticed a buffet for dinner and were skeptical- we usually order off the menu because most Indian Buffets are a disappointment , considering the food is not fresh. 
We were both taken by surprise- it is by far the best Indian food we have had anywhere in America. The best part being that each dish had its own unique flavor- (usually a lot of indian restaurants will end up using the same gravy for more than one dish)
We loved everything we ate there and also made sure we told the owner (a very pleasant man ) that the food was great! I will definitely recommend this restaurant for its food. 
I can't wait to go back again.

I dont think the food is really authentic but for me, a non indian, it works out just fine. The dinner buffet is somewhat expensive for $11.99 but when i saw "lamb" and "mutton" on the menu, i told myself $11.99 is fair enough. 
Unfortunately, they never really filled up the lamb and mutton dishes. They loaded the chicken, rice, and other vegetarian dishes but not mutton and lamb so it will only worth it if you buy the groupon. I will come back with a groupon.

Considering the area is under construction in from the the restaurant and it is hidden in the middle of a business complex it was good.  My Husband and I had the dinner buffet. We enjoyed it. My husband ordered a fruit nan and liked it. They have many many nan to choice from. The youngest waiter was a little high strung and was a little odd but I recommend this place.

I went there with my Indian friends for dinner buffet . Ambience was good, we went on weekend so it was almost full , but luckily we didn't need to wait for table . Buffet had lots  of good variety for veg and non veg both. Definitely worth trying this place :
We order food from there and are never disappointed in the portion size and the food is awesome!

The food that I had here was good if compared to other restaurants. I had Peshawari Naan and Chicken Chettinad which was good in taste and also chicken biryani which was kind of OK. All in all it was good food.

A nice variety of dishes for their lunch buffet.  Was impressed on the different choices of naans you can order.  Location and decor needs a bit work, but overall the taste of food was good enough to come back for more!  Will return again and it's recommended to all to give it a try!!

I regularly visit this place. The dinner buffet they have is worth the money you spend.
They have a wide variety of Naan.

Nothing extraordinary, but decent food at a very decent price.

Been here a couple times now... once on a Sunday and recently on a Friday night.... only checked it out because of a Restaurant.com coupon and local mailer.

LOCATION
Tucked in the Barrington Square Mall, a little deeper in past the old Garibaldi's Pizza location... 

VIBE
I would agree that the initial ambiance is not particularly impressive... tables amd chairs are hokey, and all the taped up signs are not helping. Menu has blatant typos. Am I a pedantic spelling sheriff for getting annoyed? *SHRUGS*

SERVICE
Accomodating if not the most smooth or professional, the initial waiter on Friday was non-Desi and had NO clue about the menu. Lame! After like 5 "Let me ask..." responses, we eventually got an informed one... and I told him the tip was for him alone.

FOOD
The food IS pretty good... even the initial basket of chips were extra spicy. 

Recommend ordering from the 'Appitizer' section, as those are pretty substantial and come with naan or rice... for the same price range of the Entrees... which illogically, comes al a carte.

Thumka Sampler... Veg & Non-Veg Tandoori is good... except that the fish portions included, were LITERALLY the size of a pair of dice. I asked what the dealio was, and the response was a sheepish grin and shrug.

C'mon... seven.... ;-)

Generally I don't do review, the place was too bad Thad I had to do it. As part of dinner buffet I order paratha which did not arrive until my repeated request for 25 min by the time I was done with dinner.  The check and Paratha came together .

The food quality is not worth, not much selection in not veg or veg, will never go back. Food quality is not bad it's very bad

Eat at your risk
OMG!  This place is awesome.  The buffet did not disappoint and the price was reasonable.  There were many foods to choose from.   I cannot wait to go back.

Not a good food...we went there for dinner buffet on friday night.. though they had many items none of those we re fresh...if u r Indian then u can make out how does fresh indian curry would taste..
I m sorry but even naan was v bad..not sure if they served different types on that day..
Will never go again even if they offer free food...

This is by far the best Indian restaurant I have been to in the US. I've been here for a la carte dinner as well as their buffet. (But i hear that they've also started dinner buffets for $8). I feel like they have just the prefect balance of "spice" and "flavor". 

Their buffet food doesn't have that mass-produced taste that many of the other restaurants do. Also, a LOT more variety than any other indian restaurant I've ever been to in the US. Something for everybody. Be it idlis, dosas, tandoori chicken, samosas, chana, daal, pulav, etc.

The staff is also friendly and competent. Which is very rare for indian restaurants.

In terms of decor/ambiance, its not like a fancy steakhouse but its definitely decent and well kept.

I don't do reviews but this one warrants one,I went to thumka with my wife for dinner buffet, and it is the worst Indian food I ever had in Chicagoland area, only item that was fresh was the naan. Too salty mutton,bunch of butter overloaded other sides, Rasam tasted like tomato sauce, I wouldn't call their bitter concoction sambar, and there was no idli. Dirty restrooms ,Never going back there again even if they give free food

Its been a pleasure finding this place in the Burbs. My husband and I have been looking for a good Indian spot for a while now and its pretty safe to say we can stop looking. The Naan is wonderful and the buffet is always a winner. We do order from the menu from time to time but no matter what is on the plate, its delicious. My personal favorite is the Goat but I also ador the spiced cauliflower. Every single time we have been there is a steady crowd.

A previous review spoke about the wait staff in a negative manner. I have to say they have always been friendly and very attentive. One even let us take some Naan home (which is considered part of the buffett so the usual answer is no)

I dont know about the "Bar" portion but who cares. Quality Indian fare at a very reasonable price. GO.

Wish YELP had negative stars, I would so go give it to THUMKA RESTAURANT. Let me start of saying, I got trapped into buying Groupon deal (should have read the reviews before buying it). Anyways, bought the groupon, went to Thumka with 6 people for dinner. One of the worse place to eat food. Service was terrible, lady/manager/server (only 1 person doing everything) didn't bring bread/naan on time, by the time I got my plate @ the table, I had to wait over 20 mins to get Naan. And when she brought the Naan, they weren't cooked well, it was very doughy, told her try one and she walked away. Their RICE was not cooked @ all, it tasted like it had been sitting in the same pan for days. Their desert was the worse, I believe it was rice pudding/kheer but had the taste of burned milk in it. The server only came once to our table to fill up the glass (water). @ the end, when I asked for the check, ofc it came with over $16 something included on the bill as a TIP for her. Called groupon and complained about it but they told me that I should have read reviews about it before buying the groupon deal.

We went for dinner with a few friends. 
It was a wednesday night and as we parked our car and started walking towards the restaurant in the strip mall, we began to regret our decision for choosing Thumka.
The restaurant is almost not visible from the front of the mall strip, just the name shows and is cornered to the side next to a hair saloon.
We entered and ......."crickets"......IT WAS EMPTY!!
They had a dinner buffet set up and we cringed..
For some reason our lazy behinds decided to give it a shot (It was freezing cold outside and no one wanted to take the effort to research another place).
I did not fancy the decor and ambiance. Open dining hall with tables spread out with some wall decor or paintings, not worth mentioning.

We summoned up all our courage and decided to go for it.

No Buffet for us....A la Carte

Spoke to the server to recommend a good indian beer. (While at an Indian restaurant ,why not try Indian alcohol). He suggested a light indian beer : Royal Challenge and a strong ale : Old Monk.
For appetizers we went with
Tandoori Sampler
Jhinga Lasooni

First off both the beers were different, can't compare to any american beer...but we freakin loved both of them. The old monk beer was either quite strong or we all were weaklings, gave all of us a slight kick.
The Royal Challenge beer was refreshing.
The tandoori sampler.....so well marinated and flavorful. Loved all of it. The fish and the meat.
The Jhinga Lasooni (Shrimp), this one had a nasty spice kick to it. All of us had a teary eyes and running noses...BUT....WE JUST COULD NOT STOP EATING IT.!! :) YUMMY SPICY....not for the weak stomach.

Second round of drinks...more beer!!

For the main course
Entrees
Sharabi Kababi Tikka Masala: This is supposed to be similar to the Indian Butter chicken but with a twist of brandy. I could not taste the brandy..not sure if they flambed it. Not anything like butter chicken. I'd say this was good.
Konkan Prawn Masala: I expected a more coconut based dish as it is a "Konkan" prawn masala. I could not get those spices. Regardless very good.
Yellow Dal: Simple lentils with some tempering, not spicy just cooked right.

Breads
Nan, Roti, Laccha Parantha, Reshmi Parantha
Always loved these Indian breads baked in a clay oven. My pick was the Laccha Parantha with the layers.

The food we ordered was good enough for about 5 people, we were 4 so had a few left overs.
No desserts, were too stuffed.
Spoke to the server, who happened to be the owners brother, and commended the food. They happen to hail from Himachal Pradesh - Northern Part of India.

Give it a 3.5 stars....
Stellar food.....buck up your ambiance !! Service was good....but we were the only table that night :)

I am from Delhi and when I saw Delhi Chat on the menu when surfing the menu online, I knew I had to try it.

We went for the dinner, dang they have a buffet, well we could order from the menu, but I have never seen this to work out well as in ordering from menu when they are serving buffet, so we went for the buffet.
