Delicious Samosas, stunning Gajar Halwa (Carrot desert) took me back to Delhi, wow that you can get a real and fresh Paratha rather than a soggy Naan, The best Fish Pakora I have had outside of Amritsar, awesome Aloo Bhindi, Nice Indo Chinese Dish.  But Meat dishes looked stale and just bad.

Service:  Warm service, good location.  Owner personally stopped by and asked around people for their opinion, he cared.

My critique:  Place lacks ambiance.  Chairs are covered in some sort of a cloth, table cloth is a weird colored, water glasses are humungous, different size glasses on same table, water tasted bad, small things like this add up.  This is all very Delhi styled things I know, I grew up there but when going for a decent dinner, these things matter to me.

I will definitely go back and order from the menu next time.

We had a groupon here. My wife loves Indian food, I like it occasionally. The food was quite good, my wife considered a few of the dishes better that the last local restaurant we went to (Gaylord out by woodfield) Good selection of food on the buffet, and more types of naan than I knew existed. We'll definitely go back.

Had been here with a few friends some time back on a saturday night. Its very difficult to find this place because its located quite in the interior. The place looks small and its very easy to overlook. 

So, here we were to eat indian food. The staff was friendly and nice. We were in the mood of some nice bhajias (pakoras) so went ahead and ordered pakoras and our friends were extremely excited to have it because there aren't much indian restaurants in the place where they live. We were disappointed. The pakoras were very oily and they tasted okay. The veggies had too much batter coating. Next was the shami kabab which was good and tasty. This made my hubby & me happy.

For the main course, our friends ordered paneer pasanda (they are vegetarians) and we ordered chicken saagwala. While our dish was okay, paneer pasanda seemed more like a dessert than an entree. While the description on the menu suggested it had mango gravy, we had expected it to be a little sweet. But, this was 100 times overly sweet and could be served as a dessert. Our friends were totally disgusted with their dish. They literally had to forcibly put it down their throats unwillingly because we didn't want to waste our money on this. 

For the dessert dish, the rasmalai was good. 

Our friends will definitely not come back here for sure. If you do visit this place, please stick strictly to the non-veg menu.

Went here for lunch during the work day a few months back, it was dead other than our big group.  Lunch buffet is good, provides a good variety of foods at a reasonable price of under $8!

Tired to go again for lunch today and found out by the sign on the window that they are closed Mondays. :( Wish we knew that ahead of time.

Had their $12.99 dinner buffet this evening. The garlic naan was delicious as were all the items I tried. Thumka had a well stocked bar and the wait staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. All in all a very clean and pleasing atmosphere for a place that offers a buffet. When I'm near I will definitely enjoy this place again.

Son recommended this last night; we arrived shortly after opening and were warmly greeted and quickly seated.  Waiter explained bread options and off we went to buffet.  Large array of selections but selections did not seem in order of dining experience, suggest the line up be looked at.  Soups were watery and very salty, very.  Salad selection was good with outstanding dressing/condiments. A bit disappointed in meat in sauce selections as the meat was minimal. Wanted to try the lamb but there honestly wasn't any piece of lamb to be located. Tandoori chicken was good. 

All that said, for this non-Indian diner, the service was great, atmosphere good and food OK.  We did use a groupon but would probably go back hoping that more protein was in the sauce!

Excellent for lunch as everything will be hot and fresh. I liked this place more than any other indian restaurant. 

For dinner, you better order something on menu and stay off the buffet if you want everything fresh.

Good for non-veg and Norht indian food. Not for south indian food. If you are looking for Dosa n idly look else where  

Good bar and family place

We had gone therefor a buffet lunch. Most of the items are very salty or very sweet. In the buffet, there are so many variety of Naan breads, but they are of poor quality. For example when we ordered coriander Naan, they just gave a plain Naan with coriander sprinkled on it. it gives a poor and cheated feeling. Same goes for Chilli Naan. It would be great if they concentrate on just plain Naan and make it good. The buffet is not arranged in order. So, people not familiar with Indian food would not know the order. Overall food is just average. Only worth if you have a coupon.  
The restaurant has a very friendly staff and good ambience though. We found chat items to be good.  Nice place to hang out with friends.

This place is overpriced and nothing special.  They advertise a Indo/Chinese menu on the website and when you get there, they say they don't cook that type of food on a regular basis.  If you want that, call ahead to let the chef know to prepare it.  That is nowhere on the site.

My in-laws came to town wanting South Indian Cuisine,  when we got there, we were told they were out of dosa mix.  How do you run out of one of your major dishes.  

We had a Restaurant.com coupon and they would not honor it stating its only good from Mon- Thurs, even though its not specified anywhere on the coupon.

While through all this, our waiter just laughed and apologized.  No concessions on the bill or anything.

Many better options in the area, pick anything else.

The Grill: There is no grill
The Bar: A tiny bar. Not much choice
The Service: OMG

My wife and I went one night just before closing time. There was buffet and we wanted to carry out 2 orders since he (owner) was wrapping up for the day. He gave us 2 boxes. We served 2 curries, bread, appetizer and rice into the box. There were gulaab jamoons (dessert) which we wanted to pack separately; we asked for a smaller box, but this guy refused to  give us one. He said if he gave another box, he would consider it as 3 orders! Very surprised by his rude response, I asked him how would I carry out gulaab jamoons if I did not want to pay for the 3rd box (full price of carry out order just to pack a dessert).
He bluntly replied to make partition 'using' the rice and pour the jamoon and sugar syrup in the middle (use rice as a water well). 
We walked out in a haste never to return to this restaurant again!!!

The owner was really rude. We were at a buffet dinner, and he kept telling us that he could not give us more bread until we finished the bread on the table.  He  kept reminding us, that he was losing money on the groupon, and if we could please use cash, because when a credit card is used , he will have to eat the cost on each transaction....that was really rude, and we were trying to celebrate my mom's Birthday.....They open at 6p for dinner, most Indian restaurants open back up at 5p, we are from Chicago, we had to kill three hours just to enjoy the owner ruining our dinning experience. Lastly, we had to wait a very long time to get our  check.    My advice is don't use a groupon, pay with cash, and eat all the bread you choose, even if you decide you don't like it. They need a course on good customer service.  It was totally not worth waiting the three hours for the restaurant to re-open, and the long drive we had to endure to reach the restaurant.  Ambiance and customer experience is the other half of a good dining experience.  I hope they improve, as they get their feet wet in the business, I know I will not recommend this place, to the many people I know, and I will never return myself.  If you want great Indian food and and over the top service, go to Curry House, Curry Hut, or Nepal House, all  owned my good friend Bala G. He knows how to treat people with class.

The best Indian food I have eaten in the US. Fantastic food and very affordable. There was no crowd which I felt was very weird given the kind of awesome food I had here. I was already full before I went there. I thought Ill just share some starters but their dinner buffet was mind blowing. This place is actually worth the travel from downtown. Just scared that they might not be doing so well financially since there was no crowd. I can't go there often because I live in downtown Chicago so hope its still there when I go there again. If you are in Hoffman this is a must go. If you live in downtown or somewhere far away this is the place you should go to eat Indian food whenever you find yourself in Hoffman Estates.

Tried their buffet today. The food won't knock your socks off but for the price, it's pretty decent. Service was prompt but not obnoxiously attentive. Chicken biryani, vindaloo curry, idli and samosas were good. Tandoori chicken and other deserts could've been better. Naan however tasted fresh and soft. All in all a decent restaurant and you get what you pay for.

The sequel is even better !

I had a chance to go to the buffet a couple more times. I honestly have to say they have maintained their quality consistently throughout. 

I did go one of their 'special/grand' buffet which I think was only a dollar extra (from $8.99 to $9.99) but did noticeably have a lot more dishes. The day I went,  in addition to their traditional fare (of an already expansive menu) they did have mini uthappam , masala dosa, bhel poori (you have to make  your own with the chutneys, bhel etc). 

If you are in the mood for trying something new I would recommend their salt lassi. It has got its unique blend of mint,ginger and other spices. Perhaps more suited  to be enjoyed after a long summer day but a refreshing fare nevertheless.

I have been back numerous times since my review. I have eaten there over 15 times. This is a great restaurant. Probably the best lunch buffet in the area. I have eaten at almost all of the local restaurants in Hoffman Estates and Schaumburg for lunch buffet and Thumka wins!

The restaurant atmosphere and bathrooms were nice and clean, the service was good. The food itself was not good. I have had way better Indian food at many different restaurants and this food was not up to par. I love Indian food and I'm sad to say I was highly disappointed. They had very few options and it was more than the website said for the buffet.
Excellent buffet at lunch and dinner,  can't beat the value.

I was very pleased to see a new Indian restaurant open up in the Hoffman Estates area.  Not only was the food incredibly authentic with awesome curries, the setting was chic and very clean. The host and waiter were incredibly patient with a couple of white folks sifting through the menu.  The food can be spiced down for your liking as well.  The fried appetizers were great as well as the samosas.  My husband and I both had curry dishes, mine was their cottage cheese in a mango almond curry, while my husband had a smokey curry that was great with Thumka's colorful rice.  Don't miss out on the garlic naan either!  We will be returning!!! Great service! We want to go back for the lunch buffet and try a little of everything!

Been there a couple of times, always dead, not sure how they survive ...
Shame though cause the food is good, I like their lunch Buffett, lot of variety.  Service is good, people who work their are very friendly and always smiling :)

My wife and I went the day after Christmas not knowing what to expect.  And came out of the restaurant saying "this was the best indian food we ever had".  The waiter was very nice, prompt and on top of everything.  We had the SHARABI KABABI TIKKA MASALA and Chicken Curry which were magnificent.  They were both soooo good.  Also we had 2 orders of there Nan bread which was excellent also.  My wife and I will definitely be going to this place at least once a week.

My husband and I discovered this restaurant last fall and it quickly became one of our favorite restaurants. We eat here as often as possible, usually at least once a week if not more!  The food is outstanding and the service is great! Everyone is really nice, humble and eager to serve you. We normally go to the lunch buffet which has an amazing variety of great food for under $10! The Grand weekend buffet is wonderful too! It is only $1 more than the weekday buffet, but includes more dishes and deserts. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting good high quality Indian food at a great price!

Their buffet had great selection of both veg and non veg items. And everything tasted fantastic.  My wife and I come here regularly during the weekends. Menu items were also fantastic. Service is always great too.  Highly recommended.

We went here for mothers day.  It was buffet only.  Which was fine, however my husband did want to order off the menu.  Oh well next time.  lol  I love Indian food and am always on the look out.  I thought the food was good.  I would definitely go back.  

The only drawback to that meal was it got very croweded and they were understaffed, so we had to wait a good bit of time before they refilled our water and brought our lassys out.  Other than that I would go back, just not on Mother's day.  lol

Food was not fresh and looked and tasted left over dried up. Vegetarian menu was 3 star but some items were not fresh enough some of the people I went with got stomach issues later. Meat menu was really bad. Chicken tikka had 1/2 inch cubes of meat and they were chewy and hard. Tandoori chicken was also not fresh very blend.  Lamb was also very boring. Also Biriyani boring. All the meat items needs some new touch. I did loved the fresh Dosa they made and naan.

Great food and the people are friendly. Great buffet. Great Service. I went there with my 5 year old sone and they made a seprate dish for him because he did not wat to try the buffet selection. i will keep coming back.... FYI the Rasam soup is awesome!!!!

Excellent food!! Do not let the tables, chairs, & booths fool you! The food can go toe to toe with some of the best Indian restaurants in Chicagoland. Its a fairly new restuarant so they can get away with the tables & chairs..definitely better than India House!!

I have no idea why this place has gotten positive reviews. I've been to many indian restaurants in the chicago suburbs area and this was by far the worst. From start to finish, the service was extremely poor. Food was okay, but the service left us feeling very disappointed with the place. Definitely not coming back.

So there was a groupon now for $4 for $15 worth of food at this place.  With tip I invested $6 on this lunch, a rather low risk gamble.  Well I kind of got what I paid for.  I went for the buffet, and like most buffets it was rather junkie.  They did make you fresh these two small portions of a whole chicken piece and a kabob type chicken.  Both of those were decent, but all in all,  this wasn't good.  These people were nice, I'm not in the mood to massacre them too bad, but I know a 2 star place when I see it.  Maybe I should of just ordered a menu dish, but if they are serving up this buffet, then they are fair game to be judged on it.  I'll say something nice now, the naan bread was made fresh and very good.  They also have what looked like a full bar.  I saw about 8 Johnny Walker bottles sitting there ready to go.  So if you want to really blast off and drink some whiskey with naan bread, then I say go here.
This is one of best Indian cuisines I;ve had in IL, their tandoori naan, palak paneer, Punjabi kadhi were simply delicious their buffet had a decent selection of food. loved the ambiance as well.
Excellent Indian food!

I think I would give this 2.5 stars.  We were there on Friday night.  -The service was attentive and good.  The food was just OK.  There are much better Indian buffets to be had in the Chicagoland area.  The buffet was a mixture of Indian food and Chinese food.  I was more interested in the Indian food.  The samosas were mini samosas and bit rubbery.  The butter chicken was good, but probably more sauce than chicken.  They didn't have a lot of vegetarian Indian choices.  They had a califlower dish which was OK.  No Saag Paneer.  The Galub Juman dessert had smaller mini balls (like the samosas) but were a bit crusty and not very tasty.  They also had a carrot dessert (which I've had before at other places) which wasn't very tasty.  There wasn't any mango kulfi or rice pudding.  No Rogan Gosh either or Tandori chicken (the guy from Gaylord India tells me it isn't a buffet unless there's Tandori chicken.)  There weren't a lot of people, but a lot of buffet choices.  I always think that's a bad sign.  A good buffet keeps the food moving.  The more the food has to be replenished, the fresher it is.  Fewer options and more people usually results in a better buffet.  If food sits out under the sterno for too long, it affects the quality of the food.  I might be inclined to try this place for lunch or brunch if it were convenient (I don't work around there).  Friday night might not be the best time to visit this place.  For a better buffet, try Cuisine of India (Mt. Prospect / Naperville) or India House (Buffalo Grove / Downtown).

Prices are to high and it is not the best mexican food, even in the website says a torta is $4.99 and they charged me $7 for it 
Also my friend ask for 4 gorditas and he pay $16 , for that price i have getting better mexican food elsewhere  also i rate this five stars so people can read it
Thanks

food not good and the price is high never again the place is empty now I know why.... 

pinche comida no vale la pena $10 por un pinche burrito sin sabor y una soda
The food is good, it's not as good a Chipotle, but lightyears ahead of Qdoba. It's a decent alternative to Chipotle with generally much shorter lines and better service.

Pancho's rates a solid 3.5 stars in my book, actually. Honestly the place is pretty damn good, it just has the unfortunate circumstance of being located less than a mile from a Mexican place that is absolutely superb in Cantarittos and it just does not measure up by comparison. That said, this place is a solid stop in for "authentic" Mexican food without question, and it's always nice to mix things up. 

While we are on the subject of the whole "authentic" thing, I am not sure if there is any actual measuring stick for what constitutes this trait, but it is a descriptor I see thrown around a lot. To illustrate this point, at Pancho's virtually every time I have shown up there I am about the only white guy in the joint. The guy behind the counter speaks almost no English and my Spanish skills do not extend much farther than being able to order beers and lap dances in Tijuana. Ordering is sort of a case study in non-verbal communication. I have stopped in a couple of times on the weekends to get carry out and they have non-stop Karaoke in the attached bar. It's is wall to wall Mexican dudes in cowboy hats and boots. Yup, I would say it qualifies as a authentic then. 

The menu here is quite long, and it has options to suit about anyone's taste buds. It's also handy to swing by if I am on the go with client meetings and need carry and eat food. Both the Burritos themselves as well as the Tortas are tightly compacted and can easily be polished off while blasting down the highway. I have tried most of the accompanying meats they have here at one point or another though I recommend you stick with either the Carne Asada or the Pastor as they are both excellent. Fresh tortilla's are also kicked out nice and hot from their press. I have tried the Tacos and Gorditas here as well but I always gravitate back to the burritos. They are always a safe bet. The really disappointing aspect here is the sauce and salsa they have. It is pretty weak. I admit I like really spicy food but this stuff is to the point my Mom could eat it. It needs to pack at least some punch. 

There is no table service here. You just go up to the counter to place your order and they throw it up in the window for you when it is ready. No shortage of places to sit as the inside is huge and is recently remodeled, though this was mostly done to accommodate the aforementioned Karaoke/bar crowd. 

Overall this is a solid option for Mexican grub and food comes out quick which is handy when I am pressed for time.

This place is decent! It is cheap, and the food is tasty.  I would probably give it 3.5 stars, but cannot choose that, so it gets three.  It's a no-frills kind of pit stop place.  When I go there, I get the tacos and absolutely love it!! I would consider it authentic compared to other Americanized Mexican places.  It's not expensive, so it's worth a stop in if you are curious.

The regular burritos here are the size of an infant - the ground beef-filled offering was a solid half pound of spicy seasoned ground beef, tucked into a large tortilla with wilted lettuce, a spoonful of tomatoes and a squirt of creama. My Combo #3 was a tender pork-filled tamale, a greasy enchilada topped with sliced cheese and a gooey, cheese-filled quesadilla. There was a nice little nest of bagged tortilla chips, a dollop of spicy guacamole, a nice smear of cheese-topped refried beans and cold, dry rice - all for less than $9.00.  Sadly, my chili relleno was ready and plated far earlier than the rest of the freshly-prepared meal, and the guy at the grill opted to reheat my perfectly fried pepper on the flat-top, pressing it down so flat it was almost unrecognizable. A three-star vote for authenticity and price,  but the whole meal felt a bit greasy.

Delish Mexican place for a quick lunch! We had the burritos YuM aNd the chimichangas & both were equally very tasty & good. My only issue is, they have a hard time understanding you when you place an order. I do suggest this place if looking for good Mexican no the Schaumburg area.

Stopped in for lunch. Had the guacamole which was average.  Ordered the camarones with tomato onion and jalapeo.   My plate was filled with water which soaked into the rice and beans. In my opinion, the worse thing you can do when serving shrimp is leave the dirt vein in!   I couldn't bring myself to eat it. Very unappetizing.  Won't return.

Stopped here for the first time tonight for take-out! Ordered a chile relleno burrito and thought it was pretty good. A little less greasy than I would've preferred (I know - I'm weird), but very tasty with their spicy green salsa. I've never seen this type of burrito on a menu so thought it would be yummy to try. Their rice was also good. I wanted beans but there was a 15 min wait on them... Didn't get them because of this. My husband ordered a steak burrito with a side of fries. The fries were very dry - tasted like they were basic frozen fries that ended up sitting a while after they were cooked. The prices are a bit higher than I'm used to paying for mexican takeout - $7.50 for my burrito and $3 for a side of rice. They do offer a burrito combo with a side and a drink for cheaper, but only certain fillings were included (and not chile relleno)! All in all, it was good. I'd go back.
Food is okay! The portions are big though. I didn't quite like the enchilada and I felt like there was way too much sour cream in the taco. My husband ordered a chimichanga which was fantastic.

Best Mexican food in the burbs. Been coming here forever. You won't be disappointed. The guacamole is flame. Grilled peppers by request. Get enormous amount of goodness for the money. Service is excellent. Everyone is super polite. Check it out if your missing the ol school spots of Little Village. Definitely comparable if not better.

This is an awesome place for authentic Mexican food!! They also cater greatly to vegetarians! So many options! The vegetarian tacos are my favorite! Every time I've eaten here, the food has been consistently delicious. There's a choice of corn or flour tortillas, which I thought was awesome. They also have great combo meals at an affordable price. Everything here gives you a great bang for your buck, the don't skimp you out on the meats or condiments. Always friendly staff, very clean, and their jukebox is really fun! I definitely recommend their horchata, it's so delicious. The place to go if you want a filling, authentic, and affordable meal.

Consistent and fresh food.  There isn't that many options for fast Mexican food in the area.  The staff seems indifferent most of the time. Kind of blah. They are very stingy on the hot sauce to go.  Super Burrito is the way to go.

Horrible food, terrible, patheticly unfriendly owners that need to stop eating the profits!!! Purchased a fountain drink, went up for a refill and wanted to charge me full price !! NO ONE DOES THAT ! Then , the non smiling, charge for everything owner, offered to refill half my cup for a $1 !! Steak is dry, the dish bin is never empty , again , laziness , rice sucks, beans suck !! EVERYTHING SUCKS ! I recommend SABROSSA BURRITTO ON HIGGINS AND PLUM GROVE !! Clean , foods delicious and the owner is polite !!! ADIOS PANCHOS , I've eaten my last meal there, can't see you keeping the doors open much longer !!

americanized tacos. tomatos and lettuce? i need cilantros and onions, brah.
the meat is not as flavorful - i think the neighborhood abuela can make it better.

Consistently good food. Very tasty and accurate when taking multiple orders. I've never dined in, but the customer service on take out has always been great. Decent portion sizes and appropriately priced.

I would give a kidney to the owner if he needed it. 

Three words...
Fucking.
Amazing.
Burritos.

What a nice surprise!

I had a taste for tacos--not the taco-like food at Taco Bell, but authentic tacos--, and decided to do some digging for another place after a not-so-awesome visit from a certain card-ripping entity.  And I found that Pancho's Burritos is not far from where I live, so off I went.

As soon as I went in, I noticed the very extensive menu.  I decided to try Combo #1...3 tacos (I got chicken), chips and guac, refried beans, rice, and a fountain beverage.  I waited about 5 minutes for my order.

The guacamole is delicious and fresh, with nice chunks of avocado.  The beans and rice were pretty good.  The tacos didn't skimp on the meat, and tasted great, but needed a little extra flavor.  Each table has a bottle of red sauce and a bottle of green sauce, so I decided to try each of them.  The red sauce has a nice kick to the food.  The green sauce...watch your mouth.  It is so spicy that my eyes and sinuses were cleared (not a pretty thought, I know).

It was about halfway through my meal that I noticed that they have Mexican Coca-Cola for sale.  I was thirsty, seeing as I swallowed the juice of Hell on my tacos.  I go to ask the cashier if there are refills on the fountain beverages, she says no.  So I decide to order a Mexican Coke.  She charges me $2, and offers to open it for me, which is very nice of her.  I hand her my credit card (which I used previously to pay for my lunch) and she says, "Even for $2, you don't have any bills?"  No, not even for $2.  If I had the bills, I would have given them to her.  So, instead, I use my credit card, which, last time I checked, is allowed.  I simply say, "No, I don't."  So she replies, "Well, I'm going to have to charge a tax then."  A tax?  Otherwise known as a fee for using a card?  I say, "That's fine."  She then hands me my receipt without acknowledgement.

Aside from the rude handling of the Coke transaction, this place wasn't bad.  I know that it costs businesses money to accept credit cards, and I am happy to pay a small fee to use my card for good food and service.  I'm happy to come back for a burrito someday.
Okay flavor, okay salsa. They don't charge for their chiles toreados which is cool, but the crew their always seems annoyed when they get busy...

Fist and last time I come to this place. Their service is terrible and not to mention the food. Ordered steak tacos and their cheese was not even melted which looked like they just dumped the ingredients together and gave them to us. The Carne asada and el pastor tacos were terrible. Not happy with their food. I will go else where for Mexican food.

In my attempt to discover a new taco joint, we stopped into Pachos after a long day of errands. This place is close to our home and friends have recommended it. I ordered the chicken and steak taco and just found it to be lacking flavor.
I was starving and I was in my way to another taco restaurant and pass this place. The food was so good I was screaming with goodness.

Had a al pastor burrito.  It was tasty and genuine and reasonably inexpensive. However the flavored were not very strong, even with a bunch of their red and green sauce squirted on. I would definitely eat there again and try to figure out what is yummiest.

Quick place to grab lunch. Tacos were good and brought to table quickly.  There is a huge variety of food and decent selection of lunch items. 

Next time in the area would def give it a try. Good for kids because it's cheap and filling.

Very authentic, very good, very fast, very cheap. 

steak burrito was good, but the corn tortilla gorditas with beef were amazing, some of the best refried beans I've ever had...........would go 4 stars, but overall place could use a good cleaning..................

Excellent, family run Mexican restaurant. My favorite in the NW suburbs. Been going here for years. Good prices. Food comes out fast. The owners (Baez family) are usually there working and very friendly. 

I'm a huge fan and would recommend you check it out.

I tried this place 3 years ago and wasn't a fan but my friend says its the best, so I thought I would try it out again. 

I ordered the Enchilada dinner. The cheese enchiladas had no sauce on them and instead of having shredded cheese melted on top and slices of cheese melted on top. The tortilla was rubbery. The rice was decent. The beans were way too thick, taste was fine bu too dense. Everything was super super greasy. I only ate half my dinner and left hungry.

My fiance has the steak quesadilla and it was tiny. The chicken tacos he has were "fine" as he said. 

I think 2 chances are enough. Maybe I am ordering the wrong things, but I won't be back to try again.

Great FAMILY owned and operated place!!
Always GREAT FOOD 
If ur looking for "real" MEXICAN food this is the joint.... Ole!!!!
We try every mexican food place we find and this is our favorite.  BBQ Pork chimichanga and tortas was excellent and great steak tacos! Friendly and fast service. The nachos are my favorite.

What a great surprise!

My son and I were looking for a night of cheap eats.  After reading a few of the reviews of Pancho's, which is only a couple of miles from our home, we decided to give it a try.

First of all, the place does not look like much from the outside.  And, when you walk in, I have to admit we had a thought or two about staying.  That is, until we realized that more than half of the place was shut off for a private party.  It was someone's 70th birthday party - lots of people and a pretty good Beatles cover band.

I'm not sure if this is the way it always works there, but we ordered at the counter.  The menu is on the wall next to the register and it is VERY extensive.  The menu covers the more traditional meats and veggies to the more exotic (for Gringos like me) such as Lingua.  Since it was the first time I was there, I went with a Chicken Burrito to be safe.  My son ordered a Pork Burrito.  Neither of us had beans or rice, which was fine since the Burritos were so large.  You are given both green and red salsas in condiment squeeze bottles. After tasting both (which were really good), I used the red which was pretty spicy.

For $15 we had two large, fresh, home-made burritos and two cokes with live music.  I'm not so sure we'll expect a band the next time we're there, but we will be regulars here.

Ugh! If you're a vegetarian,  skip this place. They have vegetarian options on their menu, but what do you think they consider 'veggies'??Answer- lettuce and tomatoes. Really!?? No peppers, onions, squash, etc etc. They don't even have those veggies in the restaurant! Their Enchiladas have no sauce on the top and are literally impossible to cut through with the plastic knives they have. One of our friends spent nearly 2 mins to cut a piece with the plastic cutlery. He finally gave up and ate the enchilada with his hands! That hard. UGH!

As for the music, they play mexican/ salsa music. And if this isn't your thing, you might seriously want to try somewhere else.

The two stars is for the server who was friendly.

Not fancy, but very good food at reasonable prices. Staff is friendly.  If you like roasted hot peppers, they will provide them upon request. I usually get the dinner options, because I like the beans and rice. I have been here dozens of times, and never been disappointed.

Great find!  Drove by here every other day to and from work.  

Highlights:

Tacos- very good, not skimpy on steak (other meat options available)  
Salsa- Wife really enjoyed the salsa de verde (green)
Tortas- Bread was super soft.  Lots of meat, whole slices of avacado w/ lettuce, etc.

This may very well be a regular spot for me on the way home from work!

Can't wait to try other menu items as the menu has tons of variety.
Burritos are great!!!! They have tons of meat and don't fill them up with rice fillers

Been on the hunt for the best tacos in the area.  We are fans of cheap and authentic mexican food. We ordered tacos, gordita and burrito. The food was okay but not  memorable. Big open restaurant with lots of seating. Horchata was tasty, another key factor in our search! Would probably come back, but only if our regular go to place is closed.

Car stalled out across the street , luckily at a jiffy lube.  Went across for a few chicken tacos . They make them right in front of you .  They were a bit greasy in my opinion , but they were very tasty. Due to it's location. , not sure I'll be back. However , if you are in the area and want Mexican, I would say go for it.

My, my the Steak Burrito! It is very important when you make a steak burrito that the steak isn't chewy or it absolutely destroys the entree. The tortilla is nice and soft, warm to the touch as should be. The rice and beans taste fresh. You can tell it's a family run business and I love supporting nothing more than family restaurants. Everyone is really kind, I can't wait to go back!
Definitely the best burrito place in the area... I highly recommend anything with chicken.
I always get burritos from here. They're good. They've expanded inside to include a bar. So it's good for take out and dining in
PB is amazing! Their tortas are heaven. I get the veggie torta without the meat and it is so yummy! They also have other Mexican food that can be sub for meat. Try this place because it's awesome!
DIS PLACE IS DA SHIT! i eat dey tamales like errday. Dey tv is like broke or something doh. it all like talkin in mexican n shit. other den dat. good shit 3/5
They got a good fucking burrito.........and a bar.

Torta Milanesa, how do I miss thee?  Yes, this is by far the best one I have ever had and since I moved down to Miami,  I go to Hoffman on a regular basis when in Chicago to have some of the good food that I enjoyed when I lived there.  

The Torta has a nice slice of avocado which I absolutely adore - this really is the closest thing to eating in Mexico that I have had anywhere.  YUM!

Too good, and so authentic!  Service is good, they are super nice.  No frills just cool people and good food plus the prices reasonable - you can't go wrong getting a Mexican fix here!
Awesome restaurant that expanded into a bar with the next-door store front. Food is old school Mex with a huge menu, great flavors, and ample portions at a reasonable price.

LOVE PANCHOS!!
Excellent food!
Great prices!!
Nice owners/workers!!
Love the new addition/remodel too!!

I had eaten here multiple times and the tacos and burritos were always decent, the staff could have been a little friendlier and more helpful, but I could overlook that if the food was good. My last visit there I ordered a steak burrito and took it home and after taking one bite I knew I would never be back. What ever was in there for meat was not STEAK. If I was to guess, I would say brains or dog food. I couldn't eat Mexican for a month.

This place is solid for a local Mexican spot. Great for lunch or carry out. The tacos, tortas and burritos are all good. They also have grilled jalapenos on the counter that you can grab with your meal which are really good and spicy. They have a red and green squeeze bottle of salsa on the tables for your food. The salsas are very good. Overall, this is a great choice for local Mexican.
I have only had their steak tacos. Very good! I will be back for more steak tacos. Mmmm, I'm hungry!

There seems to be a lack of 'authentic' style faster mexican joints in the area, so I gave Pancho's a try, as I had a craving. 
Pancho's is fairly solid.  I tried the taco combo.  Pork taco, 2 steak tacos, rice, beans, and a little guac.  Call me a gringo, but steak tacos are my standard for judgement.  Pancho's steak tacos are pretty basic.  Coulda used a little more seasoning, even though I do like my steak tacos not overly seasoned.  
Rice, beans, & guac were also pretty basic.  
No real standouts, but nothing subpar.  For the area that seems to be lacking in the cuisine, Pancho's will certainly suffice.  I'm not a regular to the area, so not sure I'd make the effort to get back.  I'm one that likes to try new places more often than not (gotta get places to get my yelp on, ya know).
Pancho's does appear to be prepared to throw a killer party.  They have a stage with speakers, ready for a band.  Party lighting and all...

I've been to Pancho's twice so far and it's been a good experience. The only thing i've ordered so far is the combo #1, which includes 3 tacos with your choice of meat, beans and rice, guacamole, and a drink. The pricing isn't too expensive either. 

I made the mistake of not trying the chicken because I prefer steak, but MAN the chicken is flavored very nicely. I'd say I like it better than the steak. 

So go here if you're craving some good authentic mexican food at a decent price.

Best (ex)hole-in-the-wall burrito joint around.  I love this place and go here quite frequently.  The staff has always been very friendly and their food has been above par.  I typically get their super steak burrito and a couple of their green and red sauces.  I find that if you put a little of both sauces on, you get the best of flavor and spice.  Their horchata is pretty good too.  They seem to be doing pretty well as they have now expanded.  I hope they are around for a long time and continue to put out a good product!

Monster BURRITOS!
yes

Mixed results on two visits here.  The place is small and decorated nicely.  Very basic inside, but what do you really need at a quick mexican food place?  There is a TV that plays Mexican TV programming all day in the dining area, so that's good if you want to watch TV.
Service is quick and efficient.  The place is open until 9 PM Mon-Sat...not sure about Sunday. 
On to the food...  
The Torta Milanesa was alright, but needed more flavor...maybe a little more salt & pepper on the meat and breading would help.  
The steak torta and steak burrito are not good.  The meat that they use is vile.  It's gritty, fatty, and unappealing.  I do not suggest anything with their steak.  
Horchata was really good.  
Would possibly try something else from there, but was turned off from my last visit.

I used to go to Pancho's at least every few days. The food was always great. The last time I went I asked for Cilantro on the taco. It came with none. When my friend took it back and asked for Cilantro the cook gave him a dirty look but put Cilantro on it. The Cilantro was all browm and yucchy! When my friend took it back to the cook, the cook said, "Well, you wanted Cilantro!" My friend explained that it was bad, the cook said, "It's all bad". I am sorry - but get a dollar from the register and go next door to the grocery store and buy some fresh Cilantro! That was the last time I was there. I refuse to eat (or shop) where the staff has an indifferent attitude towards the customer. I understand a bad day - but this staff was always kind of like that. I see they now also have a bar, I wish them all the success in the world because the older gentleman and his wife (presumably the owners) seem very nice. I think they let their kid manage too often - and he doesn't do anything but sit and play on his PC and ring the register when a customerr comes in. 

They do have a TV - but I quickly figured out it is for the staff - not the customers. The tables don't get cleaned very often and the place was never real clean - wasn't dirty - but wasn't clean - if you know what I mean. I kept going there becasue the food was pretty good and fast. But I will have to be pretty depserate for food before I go there again!

Since our last visit was good - we decided to call in & pick up 2 steak burritos to go - to my disappointment once we arrived at home and started eating we realized the meat was WAY over salted. Someone got quite happy with the salt! Thus I'm updating my review to a 2 star simply because of the lack of consistency.

Pancho's is great. We enjoy torta milanesa with avocado, pork tacos Mexican style (cilantro and onions), and the steak burrito with avocado. The service is fast and the food is inexpensive. There is a large selection of Mexican food nearby and Pancho's wins every time.

My go to mexican place. Affordable pricing. Pretty good tacos. Burritos are just ok. Wish they had better combo options (ie: they don't have a burrito combo!). Love their chorizo tacos + cuban tortas. They also have grilled salty jalapeos (free, just ask!)

I go to Pancho's for lunch from time to time.  I call my order in from work and it's ready to go by the time I get there.  I've had the super burritos ($5.99) as well as combo 3 (Quesadilla, enchilada, tamal, rice, beans, guacamole, chips, large drink for $7.75).  They also have grilled jalepeno's for $.25 if you want one.  They aren't grilled heavily so they are still HOT.  I took my combo 3 back to work to eat it, along with one of the jalapenos.  The Jalapeno was HOTTER than I expected!  I was sweating like a pig while eating lunch.  Fortunately no one stopped by my office until I was able to cool off a bit.  

Everything was good and I will go there again.  The prices are fantastic for what you get!

I LOVE Pancho's! Small, homey family establishment I've been visiting for about a year now. They are currently expanding into the spot next door. 

The Great: 

- The cheese fries amaze (yes, you heard me right). Who would think at a Mexican place? Try it to believe it. 
- Charred jalapenos. They are lightly salted and grilled to perfection, but not for the weak-hearted. Super spicy, but I find myself addictedly chomping away tiny bite-after-bite in hopes I don't fall over...
- Super steak burrito - great value and bountiful ingredients.
- Chicken tostadas are yum. Seasoned well. 
- Their homemade green and red hot sauces
- Horchata 

Room for improvement: 

- It would be nice if they offered free chips & salsa like many Mex establishments for dine-in customers
- The chorizo taco is very yummy but wish they would drain the oil a bit more because it gets soggy after a while. 


Overall value is decent, food is good/consistent, and it is pretty clean compared to some of the other like-joints I've been to.

Yummy, Yummy, Yummmy..... 

Driving home from work and I had a taste for Mexican food. Since I'm new to the area, I really wasn't sure where and how, I was going to satisfy my craving, and there you were! LOL 

Not the fanciest place in the world, but WOW.... Yummy! Yummy! The food was awesome and very authentic! I will be returning!

They serve the best burritos I have found anywhere.  A great portion without any fillers like rice.  If they would get their liquor license and started serving margaritas or Mexican beers they would have themselves a goldmine!

I've been to Poncho's Burritos a few times now. The food is good. My only complaint is that the last two times I ordered tacos I asked for cheese, which cost extra (no biggie) but they forgot to put the cheese on my tacos. So I paid extra for cheese that I didn't get. So frustrating!!! It's enough to keep me from going back.
Recently, I went to  this restaurant.  While the had cute mexican decor, the tacos were very bland and tasteless! I will not revisit!

bad services, the lady that toked the order look like we were a bother to her more than people spending $$ for a service....... OK food, nothing special
, but they should ask how the tacos should be , they assume? lettuce and tomato? tacos are always serve w cilantro and onion, specially AL pastor tacos.... torta looked like it was trow together all at ones,the avocado was in a single piece in one end. flavor was good,, Don't think going back.

The other reviews are interesting, because many of them are crapping on the good ole fashion steak burrito, and my experiences thus far in 5 or 6 visits is that it's rather decent here.  Have tried the chicken taco and a bite of chicken burrito and that wasn't too bad.  The pastor taco was mediocre at best for me.  I'd possibly go to 3.5 stars if I could and maybe 4 on the steak burrito itself, but the place is what it is and really does not warrent more than a flat 3 star rating.  There often seems to be disorganization between making the order, delivering the order to the grill, then wrapping up the order.  They've never messed up my order because when I see this going on in a place I hawk them and make sure I get what I ordered.  However, I've seen other people's orders in pretty much complete chaos.  I live about 2-3 miles from this place, and this misplaced south sider hasn't found a better local burrito yet.  In the south burbs this would be all around not as good as most places, but I'm glad I have it here. It also should be mentioned the prices, especially for the large burrito, are fair.  If you're on Golf Road and have a hankerin for a burrito, then stop at Pancho's, other wise keep driving.

Hard to find anything close to great Mexican food like I did in southern cal. Panchos came pretty close. The burittos were packed and extremly tasty. They had just enough grease for taste but not a lot to kill the flavors. The tacos were good but the burritos were the selling point. I  asked for avocado on my burrito and it was fresh unlike some places I find in the midwest. Whenever I come to the Schaumburg area I will definately seek out Panchos during my stay.
This is one of the best mexican fast food places in the Schaumburg area. Most of the other ones just suck. It's an ok price for a decent quick lunch.

Not the fanciest of Mexican Restaurants, so I wouldn't plan a romantic date here, but the food is amazing.  I've been there a few times, and it tops any other Mexican food in the area.  I recommend the steak burrito, Pork Tamale, guacamole, Tostadas, tacos.  Everything is delish!

Tried it for the first time today on a friend's recommendation; had the super steak burrito.  I enjoyed the chairs; Riveraesque motifs carved into the wood backs an brightly painted.  Did not enjoy the big-screen TV on the wall tuned to "Dr. Oz'" railing about cholesterol.  The burrito was okay - generous portion of meat, but not as well-seasoned as I like.  The staff seemed irked that I was there bothering them for food.  I'll probably go back at some point to try the chicken burrito, but I won't be in a hurry.
Not sure why everyone is complaining about this Subway...it's not Mortons's, it's a five dollar sandwich...

I go here at lunch, the set up of this restaurant is really stupid. You are on top of everyone just trying to get in line.  Then today the "owner" she says ( name starts with an N) came out after a delivery came in, grabbed a knife off the sandwich making station, opened a bunch of boxes with it, then put it back and came to make my sandwich!  Horrified I asked if she could use a different knife, you know one that didn't have shipment germs all over it, where she looked at me funny, wiped it on her apron and said it was clean.  Um, no. Im in healthcare. It's NOT clean. Needless to say I made her rip the bread. Id rather have a messed up sandwich than a dirty one!!! Omg!

I decided to come here for lunch one day, thinking that it would be less hectic and quicker than going to McDonald's.  Well, I thought wrong.

I arrived to find a line 6 people deep, with only one unenthusiastic employee assembling sandwiches and ringing up orders.  I waited about 15 minutes for my turn to order when another employee came up front and served me without the slightest hint of a smile or eye contact.  I wasn't looking to have my ego stroked, but I could have chosen to go anywhere for lunch.  They should be appreciative that they have a long line of customers that are interested in giving them business.

The food was exactly as I expected: unremarkable.  It is Subway, after all.  It certainly wasn't worth the wait, though.  I'm just grateful that I have a job with flexible schedules, or I'd be pretty damn pissed about a ruined lunch hour waiting for one sandwich.  Without so much as a "thank you" or a smile.

Get it together, Subway, and next time I'll look forward to spending lunch with you.

As far as Subways go: 

- Clean
- Skimpy on the ingredients
- Good service
- Ingredients and bread do not seem as fresh as the other subways in the area.
Delicious beef fried rice. Love the chicken wings. Fast delivery, reasonable priced, and large portions. Highly recommended. Best Chinese restaurant in the rolling meadow area.

Ordered lunch for 3 people in my office. Was told it would arrive between 12:10 and 12:20.  At 12:40 we hadn't heard anything, so we called. 

While the person was repeating back our order to confirm who we were, we realized they had a portion of the order wrong. We had ordered through Grub Hub and since you simply select what you want, there shouldn't have been any errors. They said it would take another hour to get the order corrected. 

We asked them to take the incorrect item off and send the rest. Supposedly the guy was already on his way. These guys are 2 miles from us. 40 minutes later, still no guy. We called again.  They started to say the guy wasn't coming, then changed it to that he should be here soon. By this time we we're starving. 

We contacted Grub Hub who refunded the entire order. (We only asked for the incorrect portion to be refunded, but they really wanted us to be happy)

I wish I could give them less than one star - maybe have a negative rating system installed huh, Yelp?
Absolutely love this place! Cheap and BIG portions! Egg rolls are good and that is a plus, it's hard to find good egg rolls.

Just coming from the grocery store, I was too exhausted to cook and I had a taste for Chinese. I was riding down Algonquin and decided to stop in. Based on the number of reviews and being somewhat high, I decided to give it a go.

First impression- place was in a run down strip center and inside was not very appealing. Floors and tables had food particles but ironically the place smelled like bleach. Large menu with standard choices. Nothing out of the ordinary.

I ordered chicken lo mein. As I ordered the clerk said it would be a 10 minute wait. As I began to wait, I decided to actually review the pictures from the Yelp reviews. To my surprise(not really) I noticed that one mentioned of cockroaches. As I starred around me, I was not surprised yet for some reason decided to continue. 

I came back into the store , I stood watching the clerks unload boxes. The lady was wearing latex gloves, purple to be exact, and as she was opening a box that appeared to be for soy sauce packets, she shrieked ew and jumped back. The gentleman beside her, seemed non bothered and looked inside the box and moved it to the floor. After seeing the reviews and what I witnessed, I decided that I couldn't do it. I kindly accepted the food, only for the sake of this review. 

Food- From the looks, it's standard. Not greasy as you may find at other places. Lacked chicken. Large vegetables with a light sauce. Sorry I did not taste it.

My recommendation would be to proceed with caution, unless you want to risk extra protein in your food. I would hate to taint a restaurant reputation, but when there are red flags, I do not proceed.

Maybe someone else had a different and better experience. Good luck

Good luck!

Good food, fast delivery, never make mistakes on your order, will accommodate special requests. Never skimp on portions. 

Best Chinese joint in the area. Going here is a no brainier.
Do not buy the orange chicken. It is all soggy breading. It is horrible. AVOID.
the location is kind of shady, the store is run down and old. The food though was good.

I forgot my lunch and did not want to go out so I checked out grubhub and liked the recommendations I saw for China 1 so I thought I would try it out. I was not disappointed.

The food arrives hot! Portions are a good size and the food is tasty. You get a lot of food for your money and the food is so good. 

There was a little mishap the first time I ordered but they have more than made up for the error and I have not has any issues since.
I just started a job in the area so was asking co workers about good Chinese food.. They all recommended China 1. Not only was it good.. It was quick and nice and hot.. Will be going again.

Delivery was quick. Food delish. Was easy to order via phone, not having to repeat myself several times as with other Chinese restaurants.  Ordered beef w/broccoli with fr. wings as appetizers.  All good. Definitely  would  use them again and recommend.

I would give this a 5 star but the only reason why I'm not is because we ordered two xl large and large sesame chicken and was given only 3 sweet sour packets otherwise this place is amazing the food was amazing and when they said xl large they ment it!! If we lived closer we would come back all the time!!!!

Lunch specials for $5.70 are huge! China 1 is the definition of a hole in the wall. Shady lookimg characters hanging outside in their cards and crazy drivers in the parking lot.

I've tried the Sesame Chicken (surprisingly spicy), Orange Chicken (very spicy!) General Tso's Chicken (full of veggies, my fav of the bunch, spicy) and their eggrolls. All three flavors tasted markedly similar even though they were all what I would consider vastly different items. Each lunch special was marked as spicy so I can't say they didn't warn me on that! Their eggrolls are not as big as some other Chinese places but their lunch specials are HUGE in size. 

The girls working inside were very nice, the price isn't bad, portions are large and the food is pretty good. I'll be back to China 1 fo' sho'!

Egg foo young is amazing! I hope they don't change that.
My only complaint is in the beef and broccoli or chicken and broccoli dishes they don't have just that. Last time I ordered it they put in onion and peppers etc. When I asked for just the meat and broccoli (how the dish is supposed to be) there was a small charge for that since its considered "extra". 
Otherwise I highly recommend this place. I love their deal after $20 you get free egg rolls and after $30 is free crab rangoons. Everyone is friendly as well. Food is made quickly and delivered quickly.

From the outside, this place looks kinda shady. I've never been inside, but we have ordered in for delivery a few times. Their lunch specials are super cheap, and the portions are HUGE. I happen to love their crab rangoons - they are ginormous and taste pretty dang good. Sometimes the food is a little on the luke warm side when it is delivered. They don't have anything that is out of the ordinary here. It is your typical Americanized Chinese restaurant that is good if you want a fast, cheap, not-so-good for you meal.  Not bad, not amazing.

Decent food, reasonable price, fast delivery. If you need a quick meal for a good price you will love this. You get a large portion for the money, and you get it quickly. The orange chicken is good, but I am not in love with the shrimp fried rice which comes with the meals.
Great egg foo yung....lots of meat and shrimp, give a hardy portion too, rice is average
poor service delivery slow 2 hours 20 minutes food arrived cold and call the restaurant and they said only 2 minutes and 2 minutes  are there not recommend

Food is 3 out if 5, but value and speed of delivery was 5 out of 5!

Got food within a half hour and was very fresh.

In MN we call this fast food chinese cause there are like 40 chinese restaurants that serve the same exact chinese recipes with exact ingredients that hade exact same "cheap chinese" flavor made it seem very mcdonalds-like. But man does it taste it great when you get in that  greasy, generic, amazingly overly flavorful chinese food mood.

Food is pretty good and reasonably priced.  The dumplings are solid.  The Mongolian Beef was actually spicy, which was nice for a change.  The Kung Pao Chicken was equally good.  I would definitely recommend China 1 to anyone looking for some decent Chinese food for a reasonable price.  Delivery was spot on also.

After reading a review where diners found a cockroach in their food (there's a photo posted of it!) and others commenting on the dirtiness of the restaurant, I regret not reading the reviews prior to ordering delivery.  Now, for our personal experience.  The delivery driver was friendly.  The restaurant forgot to deliver the wonton soup.  No hoisin sauce for the Mu Shu Pork.  They delivered the fried chicken pieces, but no sweet and sour sauce for the sweet and sour chicken.  Fried foods very greasy, obviously not drained before packaging.  The crab Rangoon was just cream cheese in fried wonton, no seasoning, no crab, no spring onions, nothing.  Everything was very bland.  The beef almond ding and combination rice was OK.  It's very overpriced for the low quality food.  Overall, unimpressed.  There are way too many good (and clean) Chinese restaurants to ever revisit this one.
Been going here since I moved to meadows 14 yrs ago great place great price and the food is great...

No flavor, No taste, no spice! Disappointed for sure! But I guess you get what you pay for. Cheap prices for nasty tasting food! I ordered the magnolian beef extra spicy, tasted so plain all I rated were the big chunks of onion and green bell pepper, I order the pot stickers nothing but dough and tasted raw, and the filling again needed something cuz it didn't taste like anything good. I also got the Singapore noodles ( only comes in one size super extra) YUCK! I've had them before at other places and this place is gross! Oh and there egg drop soup yuck yuck!!! You get two free egg rolls if you order more than $20, they could've kept them and gave them to some one else, soggy and smelly! And honestly these people are so rude when they take order that should've been a sign to not order shizzzzz!
good food reasonable price, just alot of oil they use in the rice and they charge for every little thing including hot sause!

This place was yet another restaurant tucked into a nondescript strip mall. The interior was a little sketchy and snug but served its purpose. It had a broad menu and when asked about their favorites they pointed us towards the Sesame Chicken, Moo Shu Pork, General Tso's and Seafood Delight. 

It was a sad and tragic moment for me. After spending a year in China I was hoping for the Mandarin host to point me to dishes that could be found in the mainland. Instead we were instantaneously shown Americanized-Chinese dishes -- those that are filled to the brim with proteins coated in deep fried dough and slathered with gravy, and lest we forget the 6 slivers of carrots, the 1" by 1" square of green pepper, and 2 dying sprigs of broccoli that we fought over. 

We ended up ordering a Large order of General Tso's for approximately $10.45 Post tax. When in Rome. 

The description above does the dish justice. The staff was very nice, and our food was ready in less than 10 minutes. Overall it was pretty good, yet not great. The spice level was like a slap in the face which was delightful after our tragic jaunt into The Indian Bistro later that night (see other review). Andy states that "it is the spiciest General Tso's that [I have] ever eaten". Especially since those little "spicy chili peppers" that they place next to food dishes are typically misnomers.

We will not be returning, especially when The Wonton Gourmet is a stones throw away. We gives this place a 2.5/5 because honestly, when you think of Chinese take-out this is the place you should envision. And if you're intrigued, their Lunch and Dinner specials sound like fantastic deals.

Once again, this restaurant has exceeded my fried rice and rangoon expectations. I LOVE their chicken fried rice and crab rangoons!! JEEZ!

Just had something new last nite with my usuals listed above: my quasi BF person ordered their shrimp with lobster sauce. Wasn't really feeling the thought of it initially but one bite of the juicy flavorful shrimp and my mind was transformed. That was enough for me though - I dont think I'd order it again on my own. Not sure what that means for the restaurant but cant I just be happy with my usual fare??
Lunch special is so good! Egg foo young is something I never tried from other Chinese restaurant, it is very special and good. People in that place is very nice and patient.

China 1 is across the street from my office.  Everyone in my office probably gets them for lunch around once a week.  It's a good, solid, "middle of a strip mall" chinese place.

The lunch specials are cheap ($6) and come w/ a huge portion of your entree, as well as shrimp fried rice (w/ a ton of shrimp) and an egg roll.

My favorite there is the sesame chicken (made extra spicy by request)
For the amount of food you get for the cost, I think it's a good deal. They seemed to change their chicken from before.

Good food, we enjoy ordering from here.  We have not had any issues yet with our orders.  It isn't the best food around, but does taste good, and they are always nice.  I would surely recommend them to others.
Hole in the wall but I love this place!  This is the best Chinese place in the area!

I went to this place for mothers day, carryout. Their food was great! Portions were good for price. The potstickers were very good. Comes with some sauce, tasty with the potstickers. Their kung pao chicken was good. Their combination fried rice is the best i had. Good price, great food :)

Just got lunch from here. The quantity was surprisingly large. I got the general tso's chicken and quite enjoyed it. It is more of a take out place since they have very limited seating. Since it is very close to my place, I will probably be going here often.

I eat here somewhat regularly, and the food is decent, but not great. The biggest issue is it is a dump, and completely filthy. Not a great neighborhood, but for sure no place I would  take my family. For a quick in and to go meal, it's fine, but please, how  about  just a little soap and water in the place?? It is  gross, and in my opinion they do nothing to help their cause. Oh yea, lastly, try asking for extra soy sauce; you'd think your asking for a fifty dollar bill. You get one packet as the norm, when you ask for one more, they roll their eyes, huff, and just not happy about  having to part with their precious soy sauce.

Fun outdoor venue in summer - the espresso was quite good! An odd mix of high-end Italian food and artistic pizzas on the menu. Staff has always been friendly and helpful. I'd recommend Artistic Cuisine for a unique experience.

Fun fact: I was initially irritated to see folks referring to Argentinian or Argentenean food on the menu, thinking that it was called Argentine food. I've met several Argentines and they always refer to themselves as Argentines so I just figured that was the adjective. Turns out after a quick Google search, all are appropriate - good vibes all around! 

Uh, maybe that's only a fun fact if you're a big dork. If so, then we are birds of a feather.

I wanted to catch up with a friend in the area after work and she suggested this place. After reading some of the reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect...but I found this place to be quite charming. The pinot noir I had was exactly what I needed and the papardelle was A-MAZING! Seriously, yum. I can't wait to come back here with the fiance! 

There's some off-putting reviews about the service here - they're always around for you to flag over, but they're not hovering. IMO they're trying to let you chat and enjoy - not ignoring you.

Delicious food; a wide variety of selections. With outdoor seating, there are plenty of tables in the nice weather, but the restaurant itself is small so if you are going on a weekend in cold weather, do yourself a favor and call for a reservation. Definitely check this place out. It is unique and an enjoyable experience.

If you are looking for good Argentinean food this is the place in the suburbs with out driving to the city. 
Great service and the price is reasonable as well !

Just like having dinner in the hart of Buenos Aires!
We enjoyed empanadas, milanesa a la napolitana and gnocchi (de potato and spinach). Delicious!
Great food and good service. We'll be back!

Small intimate restaurant with a menu focused on Argentinian food-especially beef including steaks and pot roast. 

We stopped in memorial weekend for early dinner (6 pm). Service was super friendly and helpful in working through the many choices on the menu.  We started with a couple of the house made empanadas made with a crisp buttery crust and served with a marinara sauce.  One is big enough for two people. They were crispy and really good.

For dinner I tried the Diablo chicken which was a half chicken cooked flat and smothered with a thick red somewhat spicy sauce. The waiter warned me that it was spicy but I felt it wasn't too bad-it was similar to a Mexican Mole sauce. My wife had roasted salmon that she enjoyed and we also tried the gnocchi (apparently a lot of Italians immigrated to Argentina back in the day) that was light and creamy. They bring nice bread sticks to start the meal.

The restaurant is pretty small and there is not much room between the tables so it feels pretty cozy inside.  All in all I felt this was a nice place, nothing remarkable, but decent for a neighborhood spot in the suburbs.

Finally I get to try this place, been wanting to have Argentinean food for quite a while now. It's a small place with seating outdoors as well. There are about 4 tables outside and about 30 people capacity inside. So, it's a pretty small place. They were really busy on Sunday night, we were on the waiting list when we got there. The service is pretty good and staff is pretty friendly. The decor in the restaurant is pretty nice but there isn't too much space between the tables, so no privacy and you can pretty much hear other tables talking. My two buddies who came with me, were complaining about the noise level, it was quite a lot.

We started things off with each of us getting an Empanada - I got the chicken and other two got the caprese (veg). There are 4 other choices of the filling - spianch, green onion, ground sirloin and ham & cheese. Total 6 choices - 3 veg and 3 meat. The pastry was hot and crisp with cheese and whatever choice of filling you ask for. It was really good. I really liked my chicken empanada. 

For our entrees, my friends got the lamb ravioli and the authentic grilled steak. I tried the lamb ravioli it was pretty good and the steak I heard was good too. I got the Pescado En salsa dealmendras (tilapia with almonds in a white wine sauce along with veggies and mashed potatoes), that was really really good. Oh wow, fish was cooked well - really soft and sauce was not over-powering, almonds topping it with a crunch and texture. The mashed potatoes and grilled veggies just there to neutralize the rich taste of the dish. I highly recommend this dish.

We then finished it off with a flan de leches which was pretty good. Overall food was really good, dining experience besides the wait and slightly high price was good. We paid almost $35-40 a person just for an appetizer + entree + one dessert to share.

P.S.  They have a section for seasonal appetizers/entrees and the regular appetizers/entrees. They also have a huge section of wines. In the regular appetizers - there were a couple of bread options which were non-meat based. (veg). The entrees had italian dishes which were veg but no authentic food which was Veg. Probably for meat eaters - this is a place to TRY :)

Here's to trying something different. If you are willing to go out on a ledge and explore your taste buds this will be a spot you'll want to try. 
I stumbled across this place because of its decor..... Very festive! The music however did not flow with the season and it's really really small maybe 14 tables max. The servers were very pleasant however the Diablo chicken I ordered was not that great. It was heavily smothered in sauce that over powered the flavor of the meat. The chicken was uncooked and fatty in some spots, and the veggies were over cooked....
Wish I had a better review to write.

Food and drinks were good. The sangria is a must.  We had a pollo Diablo and a pancetta pizza. The food was worthy of 5 stars but the service was lacking. 

They took over 20 mins to take our order.  About 40 mins later one dish came and they forgot the pizza.  So we had to wait another 15 mins. 

It took over an hour and a half for everyone to get food. I though that was pretty bad.  

FYI this isn't a very kid friendly place.  They make accommodations but the space is really tight and menu not kid friendly.  Not a negative but something to keep in mind.

Today was my first dinner at this place, and I certainly will be back. There's a boutique atmosphere inside.  The tables outside are on the sidewalk of Bothwell st, cozy under the pine trees. The servers are quite attentive, and kitchen was rather quick.
My main course was the pot roast and it exceeded my expectations. It was super tender, served with a blend of grilled peppers, asparagus and zucchini, mashed potatoes as well. I tried two empanadas - caprese and beef and these were super soft and delicious.
I hope my photo helps, too:)

I went for dinner and everything was great. Junior was our server, and he was attentive while still giving us space. We never felt rushed. There were four of us and zero complaints. Is the restaurant small? Yes, but not nearly as small as other reviews have made it out to be. You aren't crammed in at all. I would definitely recommend this place for dates and family dining. There was a nice mix of people.

We were excited to try this place, and when the empanadas arrived it seemed like we hit the jackpot. The empanadas were delicious! Full of meat inside, perfectly seasoned. Unfortunately, everything else we tried after this was either bland or unseasoned. The crispy calamari appetizer is big enough for 2, and so was the entree featuring different meats, all of which lacking in flavor. We expected bold flavors...we grill at home quite often, and achieve better results in flavor. Not worth coming back as much as we wanted to like it.

Lovely for lunch and reasonably-priced. Portion sizes are just right. Soup, salad and empanada for just $8!

I had a work lunch here today, and though it's pretty far from where I live, if I was in the area again I'd come back for sure. I ordered their special that comes with a cup of soup (tomato-basil) a light side salad, and an empanada of my choice (spinach and cheese). The soup was loaded with flavor. A burst of tomato with ground up chunks of basil to give it a bit of texture. What I loved about my salad was the fact it was simple with light dressing. I typically only have olive oil on my salads, so I really appreciated that the dressing was barely noticeable and not too strong. The spinach and cheese empanada was packed with cooked spinach. Take note, it was super rich and fried (I think) and reminded me of biting into a slice of veggie quiche. So, if you like crust like I do, you'll really enjoy these.

It was crowded and loud in there, which is why I only gave my review 4 out of 5 stars.  I honestly couldn't hear a word my dining partner was saying across the table - only a few words here and there. Additionally, I'm on crutches right now, so maneuvering between the close tables was a bit tricky. 

The service was excellent, though it seemed like we waited a bit for it to come out (maybe because I was super hungry). Dishes were cleared from the table right away, and my iced tea was filled up 3-4 times without having to ask. That's a major win on a nice summery day. 

A delightful experience overall.

Affordable and pretty darn good food. I think their hidden secret is the pizza! Not the most advertised thing they make- but it should be! I'd argue that the veggie pizza is in my top 5 favorite pizzas!

My wife and I were driving through Palatine looking for a new place to try when we noticed this gem tucked-in a small strip center and decided to give it a try. 

I knew we had made the right choice as soon as I got out of the car. The aroma of the food hung in the air made me instantly hungrier.

This place is tiny. Like a hole in the wall might be an overstatement. They squeeze tables in there, and there isn't a lot of space to spread out. Don't let that deter you though. Once you start imbibing and snacking on some breadsticks and empanadas, you will be in your own world. 

The food is Argentinian which coincidentally is all the best stuff from Spain and Italy based on my knowledge of global cuisine (almost none). The empanadas were amazing. My wife and I split 3 of them to try different flavors (chicken, sirloin, and caprese). All 3 were great, and I may even order more next time. 

For my entree, I had Vacio A La Parilla. A delicious steak with plenty of flavor served with roasted potatoes (ok), and grilled vegetables (excellent). 

My wife had Pollo Al Mattone. A half chicken cooked in a brick oven with the same potatoes and grilled veggies. The chicken excellent. Juicy, tender, and flavorful.

The portions were also huge. My wife and I each took home leftovers. 

This is a great place, and I am reluctant at letting anyone else in on the secret. I don't want this place to get so busy that I can't get a table anymore.

This place is like no other.  Small, authentic, excellent service and some of the dishes cannot be found anywhere else.  The appetizers are awesome especially the grilled calamari. Their steaks and sandwiches are always almost perfect and the service, cost and wines just make this place a gem -
I have been coming here for lunch for several years and love it! The food is great, and we have never had an issue with service. It gets busy for lunch on Fridays especially, so plan accordingly.
Hidden gem in Palatine! The food is amazing, the service is equally as great. The only problem is that it's a tiny place, so odds are you'll wait for a table. Definitely worth it though.

I think I'm going to need to find more reasons to stop for lunch in Palatine...as Artistic Cuisine is pretty delicious. 

It's been months since I've been, but I still recall the creative menu, cozy interior and awesome tomato basil soup I pummeled through. As mentioned, the menu is super diverse, so AC is a great spot for those with varying tastes. I was much appreciative of the Chef's trio in which you can choose three varied menu items for an affordable price tag. I went with the rag tag options of chicken parm sandwich, salad and the aforementioned tomato basil soup. Each was tasty but the standout was the soup - very flavorful, creamy and tomato-y perfection. 

The location is cute but tight on space so make sure you mind your elbows and be ready to sit pretty close to others!
Excellent restaurant and pizza. Staff is great and very attentive. Restaurant itself is very cozy and a neat atmosphere.
I usually don't write Yelp reviews, but this is a must. This place is fantastic! The baked penne is to die for. Also, it's irrelevant, but they have really good bread.

Great food and great service.  I just wish they had a bigger property.  It can feel a little tight at times.

Great salads, tasty pizza and refined entrees.

An awesome "hole in the wall" style restaurant. Best restaurant heading in the downtown area is a must to go to. Their menu features amazing Argentinian items and classic Italian and Hispanic fare. 

The empanadas were made from an amazing dough, but the fillings were ok. 

The gazpacho was well made and fresh as it should be.

The Salmon seasonal entree was delicious but the salmon was slightly overcooked

The homemade lamb ravioli was outstanding and the sauce made it even better. 

The panna cotta dessert was extremely light and delicious, but the chocolate chip cookies that accompanied it did not go well with the panna cotta and ruined its flavor. 

The service was slow, but the server was very interactive when he came to the table and we enjoyed it. 

I would come back.
Excellent service with top quality food.  We ordered the seafood for 2!  Quite a value for $63.  Salmon, mussels, shrimp, calamari and scallops serviced with a cornucopia of roasted veggies.

We've dined in at Artistic Cuisine twice now. At first we weren't sure about Argentinian food or the name of the resturaunt, but got over the odd name pretty quick. The food is perfect! They serve freshly baked bread sticks before your meal (tastes like they're made from the pizza dough, and I love it). Favorite apps are baked goat cheese dip and the empanadas. The beef empanadas were delicious. My boyfriend got the lamb ravioli the first time we went, and we went back because they were so good he was craving them for weeks after. I tried a more traditional chicken diablo dish the first time. A little too spicy for me personally, but very good and very flavorful. Second time I had a pasta dish... you can tell all pastas are home made, and it was very good.

This was definetley a great find in downtown Palatine where food options are limited to mostly bar food. Be prepared for slow, but very professional, knowledgeful and friendly service. They have a very small dinning room, which can feel a little crowded at times, and typically only one server and a busser. But just be patient and enjoy the dinning experience. You shouldn't be disappointed.

I've been eyeing the pizzas when we go, because they look and smell delicious. And the to go menu as well, which is different than the dinning menu and offers sandwhiches. We'll be back soon!

We ordered the lunch trio (soup, salad, and half of a sandwich) and everything was amazing. My mom had butternut squash soup and a spinach empanada, and I ordered tomato basil soup and a sirloin steak sandwich. We both cleaned our plates and would come back here in an instant. Great service and ambiance. Cute flowers at every table! Also the prices are very reasonable.
