I like trying new things and exploring new places. I have worked really hard on keeping an open mind about different foods. For those that have been reading my reviews,  you can vouch for me. I even eat spicy food now. That's a sentence I thought I would never say (write to be accurate for the sake of this review). 
So I came here on a Wednesday night and brought my two very foreign friends. One from Bulgaria and one from Georgia. Three funny little countries combined and it's a recipe for disaster. A bit of a vague background information. Most people from the eastern European realm (even Georgia) tend not to get out of thier comfort zone. We eat our stews with feta cheese,  lots of bread and tomatoes and we rarely eat anything else unless it resembles our culture. We usually tend to suggest that all other countries should do the same. Thank god my mother does not speak English. Either way I didn't care I was determined to try this place out and take it off my yelp bucket list. Well needless to say we all loved it and can't wait to return. 
So we sat down and they were very skeptical about the menu but the server was very helpful with everything from wine suggestions to the food. We had the steak the tilapia and I had the salmon and the baked goat cheese for appetizer. Well I tried everything and they were all great. I am in love. I wanna take the chef/cook home. 
Cant wait to go there again. I might dream about that goat cheese dish today.
Outstanding food (salmon and chefs vegetables). Service was very attentive and knowledgeable.  Definite recommend

The sirloin with pesto is delicious!! I have been there twice, Once for dinner and lunch.. The goat cheese appetizer is yummy. The meat sampler plate is a great way to share and try the different meat cuts. The flan with Carmel is perfect!! Reservations are recommended since it is a very small/ cozy Establishment.
Restaurant is very quaint and the staff is super nice. Food and wine is amazing. We will be coming back and this could become a regular place.

Che Guevara Approved! 

I've had this quaint Argentinian eatery bookmarked for two damn years and I'm rather embarrassed to say that I only just recently popped in. It's really a shame because I'll bet I would've been a much more pleasant person if I'd spent some of that time entertaining my diet with Artistic Cuisine's immaculate empanadas instead of some of the other crap I eat. 

The place is pretty darn cozy in terms of size, but they do have a nice little outdoor patio and the front vestibule where they do pick-up and catering orders is largely out of site once you enter the dining room. 

I'd never had Argentine food before, so I did a little research beforehand and based on what I read, it's apparently very reminiscent of Italian food, and while the AC menu did carry a variety of unique things, the overall Italian-vibe was present and I did hear other tables ask about the similarities as well, but I'm sure if you lived somewhere where Argentinian food was more common than Italian, you might say that Italian food seems a lot like Argentinean food. None of that really mattered to me either way. Good food is good food and I'm always down for some delicious eats. 

We started with a couple of empanadas, which were much bigger than I was expecting and came in a variety of flavors like sirloin, spinach, chicken, ham & cheese, caprese, cheese & green onions and more! They came with a red sauce that was like a marinara, but we preffered our spinach and caprese empanadas straight, no chaser and they were divine. Next time I'll probably just get a million of those bad boys. 

I wasn't super hungry so I got thier grilled octopus appetizer. The octopus was in a really rich, delicious broth and was served with crunchy bread, but I did feel like the octopus was tad rubbery. I don't know that I'd order this dish again with so many other stars on the menu. 

My partner got the veggie sandwich, which sounds super boring, but that was hardly the case. It was definitely a family-size sandwich and you practically needed a third hand to lift the entire half-loaf of in-house, freshly baked bread that it's served on (pita style). It was made with beautiful and colorful fresh veggies, marinated perfectly and priced rather nominally for how large and well-done it was. 

I left really happen to now be in the know about Argentinian food, sad that I wasted so much time not eating here in the past and excited to come back (like, every week) for their special lunch and dinner menus.
My family regularly gets the lunch combo of empanadas, salad & butternut squash soup. Exceptional. The staff couldn't be friendlier. I've ALWAYS enjoyed this restaurant.

Really fantastic little gem. We've eaten here multiple times and have never been disappointed. The soups are fantastic, salad is really fresh. Just good fresh food. Try the trio of your there for lunch.

We live in the immediate area and have been wanting to try Artistic Cuisine for quite some time, and let me tell you, this place is out of this world good. The previous review is right, the aroma spills out the door and draws you right in. 

The actual restaurant is very small, and they squeeze as many tables as they can in there. This did not bother me, and don't let it bother you. The food is that good. In fact it added to the ambiance of the place. Everyone seemed to be really enjoying themselves and even joined in conversations from table to table. 

I had the Estofado De Carne (an Argentinian style Pot Roast) and my husband had the Pappardelle Caseros Con Frutos De Mar A La Plancha (seafood w/a pasta in a spicy tomato sauce). 

Both were the best dishes we have had in a long time. My husband raved about his, stating it was fresh and had a good kick to it!  The Pot Roast was super tender, flavorful and beyond perfect. Everything tasted super fresh and was served nice and hot. So many restaurants I go to have served dishes lukewarm, not here! 

Palatine is often passed over for it's larger neighbor Arlington Heights, but I am telling you, you must add Artistic Cuisine to your short list. You won't be sorry. It's a true gem.

I had never had Argentinian food to my knowledge, so this place sparked my interest! 

My friend and I came here for dinner on a weeknight. It is a small, intimate restaurant with about 15 tables (this fills up FAST - get here as early as you can!). There really isn't a waiting area either, so if you can't get in right away, I can't imagine it would be fun to wait here. It also gets a little loud after the room fills up. We were seated right away. There are murals painted on the wall and pictures of people dancing scattered around. It is dimly lit with flickering candles lit on every table.

The menu was surprisingly similar to many other places I had eaten, and to many cuisines I have had before. There is pasta, soups, salads, and meat/fish entrees. Nothing crazy or out of the ordinary. I ordered the Vacio A La Parrilla and sangria. The sangria was awesome - and you get a full glass. They also bring out small bread sticks to munch on while you wait. The steak was cooked perfectly, not over seasoned, and the mashed potatoes and vegetables were tasty as well. The meal took a while to come out, but if it ends up tasting good and the quality is there, I don't care. From what I noticed, they really play with the natural flavors of the food and don't try to cover it up with salt and other seasonings. I appreciate that.

The only downfall was that the service was a little slow. We didn't see our waiter much (although he was very nice), and we only got a refill on our water and drinks once. It took a while for them to come to our table too, before it was even busy. However, the atmosphere and the food made up for the lack of attention.

Food was excellent! We ordered the salmon special, pot roast, and classica flank steak. Very good! Unfortunately we were initially charged for three bottles of wine, which was taken care of after called attention to. Also it is not appropriate to call your customers buddy. The ambiance, food and authenticity of this place was great!

Artistic Cuisine has a very small dining area that gets packed at lunch time and the service was a bit slow- so don't expect a quick bite to eat.  I came here for the $8 soup and salad lunch special (picture posted).  It was super crowded.  The food was pretty good, but portions are small.  I think I need to come back for dinner to be a better judge of what AC has to offer!

First time here with friends who have been here before. A small place so allow time to sit. Very quaint and a little noisy. You will find yourself talking over people to be heard.

We started off with a bottle of Catena Male 2012. Little pricy for a bottle but very nice and recommended for a medium bodied, smooth red. We ordered appetizers Corian Con Salsa Criolla, Viera Glaseadas, and a steak and chicken Empinata. The apps were good. First Empinata I have had. Very light and fluffy. The best app was the scallops wrapped in bacon. But everything is better with bacon. I would eat my toe if it was wrapped in bacon. 

For the entrees, we had the steak and potatoes, pot roast and vegetable, and the seafood pasta. I had the pot roast and must say it was good and I would have it again. However I must say I am the type of person looking for the extra. I can't say anything bad about the dish, but it tasted the same as other pot roasts. No extra spices or kick. The comments on the steak was again very good. Good taste, prepared well. The seafood past from what was left was again enjoyed.

I would say for people trying Argentinian food for the first time is not to worry. The food is excellent and you will enjoy. Everything seems to be prepared well and seasoned on the conservative side. ENJOY.

I've been to Artistic Cuisine twice for lunch and the only word I can really think of to describe the experience is "awesome".

Artistic Cuisine may not have the fanciest menu but they use good ingredients such as Revolution brand for their hot tea and fresh greens instead of lettuce in their salad. The use of good ingredients and fresh preparation is evident in their dishes through superior flavor and aroma.

I can say that I am pleased with every item I tried, but several items really stood out.

Soups -- Tomato basil and roasted red pepper were my favorites. Creamy, thick, and robust flavors make these truly a joy to consume (the bread is home made and excellently compliments the soup).

Empanadas - These are kind of like large fried pot stickers filled with excellent fillings. I especially liked the chicken offering.

Gourmet pizza - Thin crispy crust, slightly sweet tomato sauce, and just the right amount of cheese. This is my favorite thin crust pizza of any local restaurant. Perfect if you're a Lou Malnati's or Giordano's fan but don't feel like eating deep dish that day.

Vacio sandwich - Few people can make top sirloin as tasty and tender as ribeye, but AC does it. Full of flavor and a great deal.

The Chef's lunch trio is a steal at $8 (soup, salad, and either a half sandwich, slice of pizza, or empanada). 

This has replaced all my trips to Giannis and Biaggis and is a serious contender to Toscana.

Tried today for the first time. Recommended by co-workers who rave about the food. And I concur, excellent lunch, sat down, ordered, ate and done in an hour. Food freshly prepared, great quality with excellent service. Portion was enough for two meals (eating moderately). I had a skirt steak with grilled vegetables, extra portion of veggies and skipped the mashed that came as a side. The steak was perfectly prepared, juicy, tender and absolutely delicious. Definitely a new lunch fave! Although I'd certainly enjoy dinner there as well. Pleasantly atmosphere and clean environment.

This place is amazing! You would never guess that by looking at the outside or even when you walk inside by how small it is but don't let that fool you.  

The service is great and the food is out of this world I had an empanada for an appetizer in their steak for my entree. 

I can't wait to return.

Diablo chicken!  

I was amazed by this dish! I will definitely return at some point just for this.  Huge portion, extremely flavorful without being overbearing.  Im curious about the other dishes.  My wife's empanadas didn't really look all that great but she said it was good so I'll take her word for it.  

If you are in palatine, it's worth your while.

Haven't been here in a while and thought we'd go for a celebratory dinner and I was sorely disappointed. If you were blindfolded and had a plate of their spinach gnocchi and a plate of Chef Boyardee you wouldn't be able to tell the difference. Literally tastes the same. Brought me right back to my childhood memories of spaghettios. Service is good and friendly but BOY is the food blah and for the prices; I expect way more. Goat cheese appetizer is a bowl of Chef Boyardee tomatoes sauce with a plop of goat cheese in the middle. Underwhelming at best.
Fantastic food!  Fantastic drinks!  Fantastic service!  Little cramped on space inside but that's the only thing I can think of about Artistic Cuisine that isn't.........well, fantastic!!

This place is fantastic! Hubby and I were out on a date night and wanted to try something new. So glad we found this place. Jimmy our server was really attentive and asked great questions to help us decide what to eat. He also gave great wine suggestions and was right on. The food was beyond delicious . I had the skirt steak that melted like butter when I ate it. Amazing flavors complimented by a great glass of wine and amazing service.

Outstanding little gem of a place. I ordered the meat Parilla for two and everything was cooked to perfection. My wife likes her steak well done, and I'm a medium rare kinda guy...and we were not disappointed. Looking forward to our next visit.

Its a real shame that the service here has gone down.  Chef Zee  was the key to this place,  since his departure the service and atmosphere has gone down.  There is no doubt that the food is good, but if you want to request any change to your order be prepared for them to tell you it is a $2.00 fee.  I asked if they would substitute a Bowl of soup instead of a salad and cup of soup in the lunch trio (cup of soup, salad and half sandwich or Empanada) and they wanted to charge $2.00 extra.  My order total for a Bowl of soup and 1 Empanada (had they made the change) would already have been $10.50 (which I feel is expensive). I would hate to see what they would charge to accommodate a person with food allergies.  It is a shame.  Thankfully there are a lot of local restaurants in downtown Palatine and I would suggest supporting one of the restaurants that want your business.  I hate to be nickel and dimed when I can go to across the street and get a bowl of soup for $3.65.  Maybe I should have given 1 star...

Great little place tucked away in downtown Palatine.  Only problem is that if you have certain dietary restrictions, you should ask what is in your plate before ordering it.  Some of the descriptions do not tell you of every meat or veggie in your meal.  The service was great and the food tasted good.  Our server treated us as if we were regular customers, and it was our first time there. The goat cheese appetizer is also a must I would recommend this place to anyone looking to try something new and I look forward to going again!

Excellent Argentinian place in the suburbs. The place is small but very cozy and with a romantic atmosphere. They have a good selection of wines. Order the choripan and the churrasco and you will not be disappointed.

Great food, I've been all over the world, I give this restaurant a 8.5. The only reason I gave 4 stars not 5, is the size of the restaurant. Was a bit loud, but otherwise was great. We'll definitely B back.

Our completely clueless waiter set a cup of nearly boiling tomato soup on the edge of our table and as I leaned forward it flipped off covering my clothes and literally torching my bare fore arm...I'm talking like I have skin peeking off, just a little, but still the waiters neglect led to an insane burn on my arm and ruined clothes. 

Guy literally just watched and did nothing to help until we asked, did not apologize, and did not comp any food...unreal

Food might be good but I was too salty to eat. HOW DO YOU GIVE ZERO SRARS?
We ordered the White Pizza, this is our favorite, it was wonderful. The service and ambiance was very nice as well. Just wish there was a little more elbow room.

YUM!

Menu: Varied and delicious. Empanadas with soft yet crispy outside, warm gooey inside, and no grease to be seen. Meat cooked peeeerfectly. 

Ambiance:  Inside, it's close quarters but bustling. Makes the place feel alive. Lots of regulars. 

Staff:  They take care of the customers like family. Sitting outside? The staff will bring a citronella style candle to put on the ground and ward off uninvited dinner guest. Jimmy, one of the servers, is friendly, funny and on top of his game. Keep it up!
This is one of my favorite restaurants, lunch or dinner this place is great. take your wife's, girlfriend's or your work husbands. the Chef trio is a good choice for a lite lunch.

I was meeting a friend for dinner in the Palatine area and looked on Yelp to get a suggestion. I'm so glad I did! This place is fantastic. Great ambience, service, food -- and reasonable prices. Frankly, I think I will become a regular here!

Our waiter needs a lesson in hospitality. We asked what he liked, then agreed to order it. When our meal came out there was a misunderstanding and a different dish arrived at the table. He was not apologetic but in the end removed the dish from the tab. Still a disappointing experience. Food was ok but not amazing.

I had a $10 Restaurant.com gift certificate to use and I had been wanting to try this restaurant for a while now. I should have redeemed my certificate somewhere else. The food was unimpressive and pricey (I spent over $40 for dinner even after using my gift certificate) and I left with half a dozen mosquito bites from dining outside on the patio.

I have to admit that I had no idea what "typical" Argentinian food was. I assumed it was just meat dishes but was surprised to learn that it includes pasta as well. The boyfriend and I ordered both types of dishes so we could get a fair sampling of the menu: the most popular steak dish (Vacio a la Parrilla) as well as the seafood pasta special. We also tried the empanadas as an appetizer.

The meal started with some complimentary breadsticks that were cold and a little stale. The empanadas had a good crust but the fillings were bad. The spinach & cheese had way too much flavorless cheese and the beef tasted like sloppy Joe meat. The Vacio a la Parilla was disappointing as well. First off, the waiter didn't even ask how I wanted the steak cooked. That's a bad sign at any restaurant that serves steak. Even Denny's asks if you order steak & eggs.  I would have preferred the steak to be a little more rare. Our dish had no flavor and was too chewy. The pasta was also a little too "al dente" for my taste and the sauce was really overpowering. We didn't even bother ordering dessert. Instead we went to Spunky Dunker to cheer ourselves up with some donuts.

Have been meaning to try the pizza here for almost a year now. In short, it was AMAZING! $8 lunch special for a personal pizza with 3 toppings. Light thin crust with flavorful sauce. We also ordered the $8 soup, salad and empanada special. Soup was a delicious tomato bisque and empanada was ground sirloin. Only room for improvement is the limited seating which leads to long wait times for everyone in the know about this gem restaurant.

Oh, Artistic Cuisine, how I had higher hopes for you!  It seems as if you are torn between being a great pizza place & a great higher-end dining location.  In the end, however, your service needs to greatly improve in order to pull anything off beyond a pizza take-out place.

We don't normally dine out for Valentine's Day but after being cooped up for a while with an illness I really needed to get out of the house.  We made reservations for Friday night & the place was jam packed with plenty of people waiting.  We were 15 min early for our rez & were told it would be a slight wait.  Okay, fine. Though there was a table for 4 open the entire time while we, and others, waited...I guess they were hoping a group of 4 would wander in.  After 10 minutes they went ahead and sat us at that open table.  By the way, they have no actual waiting area so we were all crammed in the small area in front of their to-go pickup counter which also doubles as the area where they keep the wine & some shelves & the vacuum, etc.  Ugh.  I had a clear view of the kitchen and saw the servers regularly bring back breadstick baskets (from the tables where the diners had left), dump the uneaten breadsticks in the trash, but didn't' bother switching out the parchment paper lining the baskets.  I don't know, maybe that's a normal thing but I thought it was kinda gross since I know other people had touched the paper.  I also overheard someone picking up pizza say to one of the staff, "Oh, you added more tables!" to which they replied, yes, they put in 5 additional tables.  That's all fine and good IF you have the staff (both servers & in the kitchen) to accommodate this extra activity...which they did NOT.

We were seated and sat for about 10 minutes before our server came over to take our drink order.  He brought our drinks back and we ordered a couple of Empanadas to share (cheese & green onion and the ground sirloin) to start.  Placing our order was the last time our server even stopped at our table until he finally dropped of the check....no stopping by to make sure everything was good or to see if we wanted more to drink (we did).  The Empanadas were both delicious!  About 15 minutes later our entrees came out.  By this time I had one tiny sip of wine left & The Hubs was done with his beer but no one noticed & our server never came back so we drank water the rest of the evening.  My meal, the lamb ravioli, was very good (though for 5 average-sized raviolis I'd say it was overpriced at $20).  The Hubs ordered one of their specials of the night, which was Sweet Potato Encrusted Salmon w/grilled veggies.  The veggies were fine, but the salmon was bland and had no seasoning and the sweet potato was not cooked enough so it was partially cooked shredded sweet potato around the salmon and whoever "encrusted" it had a hard time getting it to stick.  The salmon wasn't bad, really, and it was a huge piece, but it certainly was lackluster.

We were done eating and sat there waiting for our server to come by with no luck.  We sat there for 15 minutes when a someone came by to refill our water & we asked him to bring us a boxes.  We sat there another 15 minutes with no one stopping by.  Every time anyone walked by our table they were always looking the other way and it was so noisy in the crowded place even giving a loud, 'EXCUSE ME!" didn't help until we pretty much had to yell & literally grab someone.  It was one of the owners, I believe, or at least a manager, and we asked her if we could please have our check as we'd been done eating for a half-hour and our server hadn't once come back.  No apology, just a nod.  Our server comes back a few minutes later (FINALLY), no comment at all, no apology, and just drops the check on the table.  WTH?  The manager lady comes back a few minutes later and takes the check for us.

In the end we were there OVER 2 hours.  We had intended to have dessert & coffee there as well but by then we just wanted to get the hell out of there.  We stopped at Mariano's instead on the way home & picked out desserts & enjoyed that at home.

They may be better any other day of the year but how they handled Valentine's Day was a big FAIL in my opinion and we will not be back...and based on their attitude I really don't think they care.

What put me over from a 3 to a 4 is that I can get a decent steak for $19 walking distance from my house.  It's not even a la carte.  Their marinade is flavorful in a good way.  Nice wait staff.  Being in Palatine, there are many challenges when dealing with the clientele, so the waiters are busy, but friendly, knowledgable and flexible.

Argentine food owes a lot to Italian, as the great majority of Argentinians are of Italian descent.  

These were the first real, authentic empanadas (chicken and spinach/cheese) I've had since I moved out of Palo Alto twenty five years ago--they had an empanada joint there that was awesome.  The fillings were mildly flavored but the crust was fantastic.  That pretty much sums this place up.  Really nice dishes, but nothing really wowed us.  We will return and see if we just missed their best offerings.  

We had a mixed seafood platter for two that was straightforward and fine.  The appetizer scallops were, again, mild.  We enjoyed the butternut squash soup--delicate.  Service was very good.  Next time, the Diablo Chicken calls.   Something with some "pop".
Beef medallions were perfectly seared, lots of fresh veggies. Vegetarian risotto was delicious!  Pollo Diablo has a wonderful kick.

We were in the area and looking for a place for lunch. Looked at nearby restaurants on my Yelp app and saw Artistic Cuisine with great reviews, so we decided to try it. It was a bit later on a Saturday afternoon, so the place wasn't crowded. We both had the $8 lunch special: I had the cheese and green onion empanada with the tomato bisque soup and salad and my husband had the shrimp wrap, clam chowder soup and salad. What can I say except that all the food was fantastic. Fresh and very flavorful. I appreciated that the salad was actually beautiful mixed greens and not just a pile of iceburg lettuce and that the dressing was a light balsamic vinaigrette. The waiters were very polite and attentive. Even though we live in a different town, we will definitely be back to taste more of this restaurant's food.

My husband and I found this restaurant on a whim and we were so happy that we stopped in. Delicious food! We loved the empanadas and Amish chicken. Slightly slow service and too crowded. Lighting was dark, as well.

First time to the restaurant for lunch. Although the food was tasty, the acoustics were terrible!  Having to shout to be heard is no way to have a meal, especially since everyone was shouting all around the small dining space. Service was very slow - 40 minutes and the waiter refused to give separate checks. Don't plan to return.

Ridiculously delicious!!! We had the empanadas for an appetizer, which were amazing. I ordered the "Pappardelle Caseros Con Frutos De Mar A La Plancha" as my entree, which roughly translates to "pasta with alllll of the seafood". They were out of mussels the day I went, which was disappointing, but they doubled up on the other seafood items in the pasta and it was OUT OF THIS WORLD delicious! My friend ordered the petite filet, which was also really good. I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu!!

Love it! We had the calamari with tomato appetizer that was soooo good I even dipped my bread in it until it was gone....I rarely eat bread!
I had Argentinian marinated steak with vegies that I would definitely have again. My sweetie had pork tenderloin with mushroom gravy that was so good he ate it all with his potato wedges......he does not like potatoes!
My Sangria was delish! It was laden with fresh strawberries and mint!
Highly recommended! I will be taking friends from out of town here for sure.

I've driven past there but never went it. I finally decided to go in there and check it out. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I decided to order the meat lovers obsession pizza. Wow the pizza was orgasmic. I would never expected the pizza to be that awesome. I want to try the other pizzas and food now since I'm sure all the rest is delicious.

If it would be just about the food i would give 5 stars. The food was outstanding! I had the petite salmon with avocado salad and it was just delicious. My husband had the steak which was cooked to the point. 
It was a friday evening, that's why we made a reservation. The place was packed. Nobody really told us, how long we gonna have to wait for our table. We waited almost 30 Min., which is too long in my eyes if you have a reservation. They should organize this way better. The problem is also, that they don't have a bar, so you are standing in the entrance while you are waiting, which is very unpleasant. 
The service was very friendly and quick. 
The restaurant itself is nice, but very small. Therefor the  noise level is pretty high. 
All in all, we will probably be back, because the food convinced us...

Empanadas! These empanadas are incredible! I had the chicken, and the filling was super moist and flavorful, with the crust perfectly crispy. I've been to Argentina, and these are the most authentic empanadas I've had in the US. I'm tearing up a little as I remember how good these empanadas are! I can't wait to go back and try the other flavors of empanadas!
The food here is awesome!!! If you ever get to the northwest suburbs and your in Palatine you have to come to Artistic Cuisine!!!

Came to Artistic Cuisine again for another birthday celebration. I feel like it's a really good choice for a birthday dinner in the suburbs because it is intimate but serves big restaurant quality food. 

Our table ordered the sea bass, filet mignon, seafood pasta, gnocchi, pizza and much more. All were very nicely done. I myself had the sea bass, and it was one of the best I've had in a long time.

Good and unique thin crust pizza. You  can tell that they use the freshest ingredients and quality cheese. Although it's really only at its best went you dine in and get it really hot right out of the oven. Takeout gives it just enough time to steam in the box which causes the crust to loose some of its molecular structure.  Also I think the sauce they use is olive oil based and sometimes to oily.

I've only had pizza here so my review is based solely on that. Intend to try some entres in the future and will update this review when I do.
Incredible food, wonderful service. Everything I have ordered I have absolutely loved? Try their chopped salad, amazing!
Great service on dine in and carry out. Every meal I've had from there is excellent and the empanadas are to die for!

Some of the best thin crust pizza I have had in the Chicagoland area.  We got 5 of their pizzas to sample at Restaurant.com and Artistic Cuisine sure did deliver.  All the flavors were there, their sauce was some of the best I've had and the ingredients were as fresh as the one's I pick from my garden.  Without a doubt I will get this pizza again.  Its worth the drive for me!

I am absolutely obsessed with this restaurant! Best restaurant in the northwest suburbs easily! Go here once a week! The take outs great and sitting in the restaurant is even better! Ask for junior to be your sever  you will not regret it, he goes above and beyond to give you the best service!

I really love AC. It can be a little hit or miss, but it is never bad. They make my favorite pizza in Palatine. On the rare occasion my husband and I order pizza we always argue about whether to get it from here or Pizza Bella. Pizza Bella is good, but AC's pizza is better, fresher, more creative, and more flavorful to me. I love the Napolitano pizza with fresh oregano, garlic, fresh tomato, mozzarella, and parmesan! The garlic on here is heavy, but I love it. Just don't go planning on kissing anybody unless they've had a slice too!

I've also tried their empandas and gnocchi, and both were pretty yummy.  And the good news is they deliver everything, not just pizza. So if you're feeling like relaxing at home but eating good food definitely call AC.

First time here with my spouse.  Was looking for a nice restaurant.  Now, I probably could have avoided some of my issues, but asking before arriving...

First, the main course was very good.  We had the steaks and vegis.  Very tasty.

But, we are not wine drinkers and were both disappointed that they didn't have a full bar.  The restaurant is small and we were in the center aisle.  So, about every minute, a waiter or guest was walking on either side of us (not large aisles). 

But, probably the most disappointing was this... We arrived early for a Saturday so we weren't rushed..  We had a very friendly waiter who promptly took our order.  Our appetizers arrived quickly.  And, when we were about half way completed with the appetizers, our main course arrive and they took away my wife's unfinished plate.  

When we finished with our meal, they brought the check and never asked if we wanted coffee or dessert.  Seemed they had more bookings and wanted to turn the table (55 minutes form start to finish).

We left for another restaurant for dessert.

Again, very good food and very friendly... but just not for us.

This is a small and intimate Argentine restaurant. The food dishes are large and beautifully presented. The menu is not large but it has some great dishes like the pasta and seafood plates. The servers are friendly and informed. The eating area itself can get cramped when fully empty but it is a small area. In the warmer months, one can eat outside.Ther eis ample parking.

Food was incredible. We all (8 of us) had something different and all loved our meals.  Only 3 didn't finish. The Saffron appetizer was amazing. The muscles were solid, we finished the sauce with our bread sticks. Service was attentive and personable. We were too full for dessert but want to come back and try it again.

We love this local gem. The food is plentiful and always tasty. They have a great list of wines from Argentina. The service can be slow but it's worth the wait. If the slow service bothers you don't go on a weekend. Try the spinach salad one of the best around.

We went here for dinner the other night and were overall very pleased. They give you breadstick twists with herbs to start off, probably could have skipped the appetizer because I ate a ton of the breadsticks and was full before my meal came. Started off with choripan con salsa criolla which was pretty good. The bread didn't seem very toasty though. He had the lamb raviolis (ravioles caseros de corderos) which was very rich but he thought had excellent flavor. I had the tenderloin medallions (lomo con champignones) which were absolutely delicious. The potatoes and veggies were so good, grilled to perfection. From the outside it doesn't look like much but inside the atmosphere is very charming. My only complaint is our server was a little rude in the beginning and not helpful with menu selections. Otherwise the food was quite delicious and we will definitely be back.

My fiance & I made a last minute reservation for V-day after hearing great things from a friend--luckily, they were able to squeeze us in at 8pm & didn't rush us out even though they were technically supposed to close at 9pm.

The dining room is small and intimate which I loved especially for a romantic dinner. The server (Jimmy: brother-in-law of the owner) was very attentive & knowledgeable. He recommended all the right things and we were very happy with everything we ordered.

We had a bottle of Los Vascos Cab which was perfect. We shared the goat cheese appetizer which was fine (nothing spectacular). He ordered salmon off the seasonal menu which was cooked to perfection w/a nice potato crust. I ordered the sirloin which was juicy and flavorful. If I had one complaint, I would say it's a bit misleading to claim the entree comes with "grilled asparagus" and only one shows up on the plate.

I was really looking forward to the dulce de leche cheesecake that I saw on the website BUT that dessert menu was outdated--we went with flan instead which was a great alternative.

All-in-all a great first-time experience. I definitely plan on going back to try their pizza and a couple of their other Argentinian dishes.

Outstandingly exceptionally well run restaurant with "to die for" food. Staff are like musicians in an orchestra, the owner is a doll and they except Reservations I take advantage of this especially for dinner and absolutely on weekends. Only problem I have is the place is to small.

This place is a bit of an oddball. Crummy strip mall location, cramped/uncomfortable waiting area, so-so room... but who cares. The food & service are simply excellent. Way above 'burbs average, AC's menu is interesting and the food is not saturated in faux flavors & salt. It's like,... real cooking. This restaurant would do well anywhere.

Last time around: Roasted Red Pepper Soup, Grilled Octopus App, and Beef Bourguignon. Each one 5-stars.

Great pizza!! More like 4 1/2 stars! The cheese on the pizza was amazing!! It tasted so gooy and flavorful and what all cheese on pizza should taste like. Very surprising to have pizza like this come from an Argentinian restaurant. I will come back for more and maybe some empanadas too!

We stopped in to Artistic Cuisine for lunch today.  It was our first time for lunch at a place that has become a staple of ours for dinner.

I was surprised at their lunch menu.
They have a great selection of unique salads, sandwiches, pizza and more substantial fare.

We sat outside on a beautiful day and started with two excellent soups; the butternut squash and the roasted red pepper.
Both really hit the spot.  The roasted red pepper was particularly good.  And the chunk of bread served with each was delicious.

We had the Patagonia Salad and a Prosciutto and Arugula pizza.
The salad was a great combination of citrus and shrimp on a bed of baby greens.
The pizza was not your standard Italian pizza.  The sauce was more of a fresh tomato puree than a classic Italian pizza sauce.  It was light on spice but full on flavor.  It was different, but I really enjoyed it.

Pizzas range from $8 for a personal size (plenty for one or two) to $17 for an XL.  Pastas are $9 -$10 and sandwiches, hot and cold, run between $7.50 and $9.00.
The entree dishes are in the $12 - $15 range.

This place is great for dinner and now I'm glad we tried it for lunch. I suspect it will become our new favorite lunch joint as well.

This place is a true gem! I keep coming back for more and more of their delectable food! Everything from appetizers to deserts is perfect. Meat is always cooked to your satisfaction, fish entrees are moist and delicious. I have to say that sauces they create deserve a separate 5 star review of their own. Ambiance is intimate and cozy and service is always great! Hats off to the chef!!!
Not only is the food so great but the service is phenomenal! Thank you Artistic Cuisine for such a great repeated experience.

Got takeout lunch from this place last Friday and boy, are their good reviews deserved. We got the baked goat cheese and spinach and sirloin empanadas for appetizers. The goat cheese swimming in some kind of tomato sauce was excellent with the crostini it came with and their soft bread. We didn't even use the sauce that came with the empanadas, they were so good by themselves! I had the Argentinian pot roast and my husband had the Pappardelle Caseros Con Frutos De Mar A La Plancha which was a spicy tomato sauced pasta with lots of seafood in it. Both of our portions were huge and ended up being our dinners, as well. I even love the grilled zucchini that came with my pot roast and I'm normally not a fan of zucchini. The only minuses were that they forgot my tiramisu, luckily I checked, and we didn't see lobster in my husband's pasta, but there was a ton of seafood in it, overall, which is why I still have to give them 5 stars. The flavors were that good and such a great change of pace from standard restaurant fare!

They have the best lunch trio ! The grilled veggie sandwich and butternut squash soup are my picks  ! My favorite though is the veggie pizza which I order without cheese and it's delicious ! I highly recommend eating here. The atmosphere is very cute although its on the smaller size so don't come right in the middle of dinner rush. Don't miss out.

This is a mom and pop shop that gets it right. Service is always excellent. Food is generally well done (although some dishes are better than others). Its small and a little loud so take that into account.  Argentinian cuisine so steaks and seafood are good bets. Favorites are the seasonal soups, the Mista salad (large salad with nuts and cheese) and the pot roast (melt in your mouth with a great sauce).  I would not say its destination dining but rather a great local place.

Artistic is now a mainstay dine in or take out place in palatine. Great food, killer pizza, and nice service (Especially Julieta).  Chef Zee is the man. Recipes are delicious and very homemade. Empanadas rock too. Enjoy and salud!!!

This is our local joint and we hope it's here forever. Here's why:

Really good food - You might think it's basic boring Italian but there are little hints of something different. Empanadas. Argentinian specialties. 
Lively atmosphere - In the summer we sit outside. In the winter, we jam into the little dining room. It's lively - maybe even noisy at times - but you get that sense of a neighborhood gathering place.
Stable, AWESOME staff - They've had the same basic small wait staff for years - Jimmy, Junior, Carlos and the fantastic Salvador. They aren't anonymous people who just work here for a few months and bail - they are here for the long haul. They're personal. Super friendly. They even do my favorite lunch dish for me even though it's not on the menu anymore. 

So if you want same same same standardized fare, go to Schaumburg and jump in a chain. Leave this gem to us. It's our joint and long may it continue.

Very good prepared hot food! The staff is very nice and will explain any item that you would like to know about. They are always busy which is always a good sign. They also have a big selection Milka bars which are not like American candy bars. The chocolate is much better and different flavors.

Let's see.... Ive been to several KD Market Stores and this one omg! Upon entry your eyes are filled with the racks of fresh fruit & vegetables, keep on walking and you see the bakery where you tongue sticks out lol because everything there looks so good and smells amazing, then you have the deli with all the polish sausages and goodies, meat department had just about everything I needed, fresh meat, they also have prepared food if you are looking for a quick prepared lunch on the go, a vegetable salad & fruit bar and not to forget a sushi area where you order and they make the rolls right in front of you, this store was above and beyond compared to the other KD's I've been to, plush not to mention how clean the store was, this store is huge and the lay out is nice. I like shopping here.

On a couple of occasions we bought food and the next day it had to be tossed in the trash. Recently we bought strawberries, raspberries, blueberries, and grapes and let me tell you that the strawberries and raspberries had so much mold growing on them the next day that I couldn't even take them apart. there was no way of even saving one strawberry there goes money down the drain and food to the trash that I was going to feed to my son I think it's time for us to change our store. Deli4You maybe?

Krystyna's Deli :) or now re-branded to KD's grocery...? Regardless, yuuuummy Paczki! We tried almost every flavor...sooooo delectable :) Raspberry, Blueberry, Apricot,  NUTELLA (Our my favorite, hands down) ...Totally should have grabbed more treats at $1.25/Paczki!

I am a KD market costumer for the past 4 years and
It was so disappointing to hear from the store manager that selling girl scout cookies in front of the store is illegal and will get them in trouble. Also he said that selling cookies will only take their profit away and they don"t like competition. You don't have to be afraid of little girls selling cookies! 
VERY DISAPPOINTED with the treatment that they gave me and pretty soon we will have another store only a block away so there will be a competition for your store in the near future!

This is where the Pollacks gather;-)
Krystyna's Deli (KD) is a Polish deli/grocery store that my family and I have been going to probably every few days for over 20 years. In the past few years they have completely renovated the place and expanded it to twice its original size. They have added a sushi bar, increased and diversified the staff to include people other than those only from the mother land and have included more American products. Back in the day, I would do half my grocery shopping here (meats, bread) and half of it across the street at Jewel (produce, snacks). Now I can get ALL my groceries here. Love that! 

When you enter, you'll find: 

-decent fruit and veggie produce section
-large fresh deli section
-great raw meat section
-fresh made breads and if you get your timing right....WARM rolls
-small but good sweets bakery
-sushi area where they make sushi on the spot and often have free samples
-hot lunch/dinner bar;  $5.99/meal  for 3 HUGE items. It was so much food, I shared it with 2 other people. 
-full salad bar with two different kinds of hot soups
-aisles of usual 'grocery' crap you may need such as shampoo, creams, soda  (I love the spice section since it is so different from most US grocers)
- small but enough international beer and liquor selection

I'm really happy with KD now, I do hope they stop Americanizing (is that even a word?, ha!) it because currently it has the perfect combo of European, a splash of Asian, and just enough American in it to make me a very happy girl and like a good grocer should....meets all my daily food needs.

This place does not deserve one star!!! I was a shoping at this location last Saturday and their credit card system was down. I had no idea that the system was not working but they knew. The cashier asked me to swipe my cc  and we were waiting for like 3-4 min for the transaction to go trough. Well a receipt came out saying transaction not completed, but my money was taking out of the account. So one of their employees asked me to pay at another register and he charged my CC again!! So my account got charge twice $ 185.60.....
Since then I have been trying to talk to them to provide a refund or credit. I called to speack to a mgr and they said the banck has to refund not them!!! 
I am very upset and I don't know if I want to shop there again!! There are other Polish stores ! Better then KD!! 
They don't deserve my money!!!

I went to this store plenty of times with some Polish friends since this store used to have a huge selection of Polish items. This is a local Chicago area chain. Unfortunately, the store recently changed its name and became more internationally focused.

Fortunately, the store still offers a very large selection of Polish foods, and their other offerings are pretty interesting as well. The deli is very large with many types of European based meat product and other cheeses. I definitely appreciate their kielbasa and kabanos very much.

The bad thing about this store are its prices, which tend to be pretty high, for items that you could find for cheaper prices in other stores, even smaller ones. Also, there are a lot of expired products in the aisles so be on the lookout for the expiration date before you purchase anything!

The staff has always been friendly to me and everyone in there speaks both Polish as well as English.

Overall, my experience with KD Market is neutral and I would recommend that you visit it at least once. Feel free to message me for any additional details that you may need!

The food is awesome here, but the shopping experience is incredibly AWFUL, especially if you are not the only customer in the store.

Every time I come here, the checkout process takes 20 minutes for just 2-3 items I may be buying; it's caused me to visit Jewel [across the street] a lot more often now.

Krystyna's management, please note the following:
1) You need an Express Lane... "10 Items or Less"
2) Your cashiers need to tell people who have been waiting in line for 15 minutes that THEY are next, not the person who just joined the single open lane with a full cart. This is one of the worst things about your store and the patrons are never ethical in allowing those who have waited the longest to go first. It sucks!
3) Get rid of the sushi section. This is a deli and nobody buys this stuff here.
4) Add more employees to the Hot Food Bar. This area takes forever if I'm willing to wait and waste my time.

My favorite Polish store in the burbs. If you want the good stuff unfortunately you have to go into the city either of Belmont to Genes sausage or somewhere off of Milwaukee they have one on each corner. At least when I was a kid. This is the closest place to those! I even buy produce from here! The need to open one in the mchenry area!!

This happened today. Went in to buy a half a pound of prosciutto and other deli meats, the lady at the deli counter said that they have brand new sealed prosciutto, but would not open it for me!  She said that I could buy something else and pulled out some deli meat I did not want. Unbelievable!!!

My mom has been telling me about this store for a while now. I have driven past this place hundreds of times and always wanted to go in, but never have. My mom brought me some prepared chicken soup from this store. My husband and I shared it before dinner one night recently. As we were eating it, we both looked at each other and said how much we loved the soup. It was so flavorful and had beautiful pieces of chicken!

When you first walk in, you will be happily surprised to find what's behind that automatic sliding door! Its a whole grocery store. I had no idea. Where has this place been?? Or better question, why have I not found this store until now?

There is a complete produce area, it's not the size of Tony's, Caputo's or Valli, but it's a decent size and has everything you need! Fresh chives, grapes, potatoes, apples, oranges, peppers, onions, ginger, you name it! The pricing was excellent on their sale items. Gala apples, for example, were $.79 per pound and a 3 lb. bag of Yukon potatoes was $1.50. 

They do not have a meat section with packaged meat like you find at your regular grocery store, all their meat is at the meat counter and you purchase as much or little as you need. They have the basics in the poultry area...chicken breasts $2.99 per lb., whole chickens, leg quarters $.99 per lb., ground chicken $2.49 per lb. and that's about it with the poultry. The beef and pork was also pretty limited, but they have the basics. Pork, Beef and Veal meat for stew cubed up. Ground veal, pork and beef. The ground beef was $3.49 per lb., while the ground pork was $1.79 per lb. They also have a full deli with a lot of Polish items but also some American basics like Munster cheese and ham. I sampled Krystyna's Baked Ham which they sell for $6.99 per lb. and it was FANTASTIC!!! 

If you are looking to grab lunch or dinner, their prepared foods area is next to the deli and you can select one main dish such as cabbage rolls or breaded pork loin and one side like potato pancakes or cabbage. A meal is $5.99 for one main dish and one side. Not bad for a complete dinner.

I briefly walked the aisles and found that a lot of items are European but most items have a label on the back side explaining what the item is and it's nutritional information. If I know anything, a lot of European items are better than some of our American products. For example, they have a chocolate cake mix that looks like it would be delicious!  I might have to pick that up next time I visit.

Speaking of cake, they have a small bakery near the back of the store across from their prepared foods area that sells Pczki's, sweet rolls, small cakes and cookies. Nothing looked particularly appealing to me they day I was there, but they had plenty of options. 

I also found an entire section of Milka bars...I'm a big fan of Milka bars and there are a zillion kinds, and you rarely find more than a few flavors in a candy aisle but Krystyna's has almost every kind Milka makes!! I was impressed. I'm still on the hunt for a Milka bar I found in the Amsterdam airport that had milk, white and dark chocolate all in one bar and have yet to find it in America. I searched here and sadly, they did not have this one here but they had plenty of other options!

You are not going to come here and get everything on your grocery list, but you can certainly check a majority of items off and trust that they are fresh from a store like this. I look forward to getting back to Krystyna's soon!!!

I love this place! We are regionally from Germany and miss a lot of our usuals like "Brtchen" (bread buns) and actual bread and chocolates and some other stuff that we have been unable to find but were able to find here. Their pastry is amazingly and dangerously out of this world, great variety of things and the staff is very nice and helpful as well. Love love LOVE their half off sushi after 7pm- still tastes very good and fresh. 
Definitely a must stop on am the way home from a long day- not-feeling-like-cooking-day. But hurry barely any left after about 8pm.

Krystyna's which is the real name of this place, is a totally awesome polish grocery/deli.
It's a local (Chicago area) chain and the deli is huge with every kind of European based meat product you could possibly be interested in, at fair prices. The sausage is the best available anywhere. The Keilbasa is perfect,the bock and wiesswurst as excellent the chicken/pork is very fresh and the blutwurst is ...........well, it's blutwurst, not much you can do with that. Every bit as good as it can be. 
The grocery side is a fully stocked store with everything you remember from the old country. The bread comes both from outside bakers and is baked fresh (daily, and on busy days every four hours) in store. 
While the meat counter has a limited selection of fish, they have a good selection of both dried and pickled fish on the shelves. There is an entire row dedicated to pickled vegetables-mainly cucumbers but also cabbage, radishes, mushrooms etc.
There are two wooden drums with self serve sauerkraut and herring in the produce area. WOOT!
The attached wine section in addition to a small but high quality stock also has extremely high quality vodkas and spirits, however the beer is all polish with a few domestic options. 
Assuming you are not interested in cooking the deli has a full range of items ready to go ranging from soups (borscht) veg and meat dishes. 
Just about everyone speaks polish, but everyone also speaks English as well. The only tricky part is when a line is present for the deli meats and the numbers are called out in polish. Usually they figured out that my blank look indicated that I'm not a polish speaker and compensated accordingly. 
Be advised that the grandmothers and grandfathers in line will dispense advice freely on your deli selections. It comes across as charming as opposed to annoying. 
This is a seriously wonderful European grocery.

Oh. Em. Gee. How did I not know this was here this whole time?! So...I'm not Polish. Let's just get that out of the way. However, a few of my close friends are, so I kind of feel like I am. 

Anyways, at first I thought this place was just a deli. Um, no guys. It's a grocery store, deli, bakery, and wonderful heaven of a place. You can literally get all of your grocery shopping done here. I don't know what my favorite part was. The mass amounts of meats, or the bakery with all of the freshly baked bread (that smelled amazing!!). They have all different kinds of Polish goods - from candy to kolaczkis to pierogis. You name it, they have it. And everything is really decently priced! And of course there is the barrel of, what we like to call, dirty pickles. 

We came, we saw, we bought, and we ate. I know we will be back!

I have been here a few times and I love this place! A big must for a large Polish Immigrant community in the the Schaumburg community. My girlfriend is Mexican and she says she lives this place as well because when she cooks, she needs vegetables and spices and they are cheap and very fresh there. Plus they are a block from my apartment. My whole family is from Poland, so I grew up with Polish beer, kielbasa, and Pierogies. Good selection and the alcohol section is unique. The alcohol has wine from countries you never heard of. Have u ever had Wine from Moldovia? Of course they do have popular wine brands as well. Zywiec.....of course they have it. No matter what your nationality is....this place is good to go too if u need fresh produce, inexpensive food, and good alcohol. Boom!

Very large Polish Market with fruit, produce a bakery and large deli and meat department. They also have a large hot prepared foods section with tables so you can sit and eat your selections immediately. Lots and lots of imports from Poland make this a unique shopping experience. They also have a decent selection of Polish liquor's.

Great Staff, great selections, and great store! I consistently have a very nice shopping experience every time here. I was also there on that Saturday when the credit card machines went down. They handled it very well by apologizing repeatedly, and by providing another option. They are always very accommodating. I will not shop anywhere else.

The reason I gave two stars is the huge selection of cosmetics, chocolate, canned and pre packaged goods from Poland. Nevertheless you really have to watch expiration dates, freshness of food and most of all watch the cashiers at the check out. I went there yesterday and was ripped off of seven bucks. Having the whole conveyer belt loaded with items and paying $  200 worth of groceries it was hard to keep track of what the cashier ( Karolina ) was doing. I had a bag of apples ( which didn't have code number and name stickers on - another cheat ) which happened to be Honey Crisp according to the cashier. The price was around $ 7 for the whole bag. I told her I picked Gala ( at least that's what the store's price and info sheet stated underneath them ) she changed the name of apples and the price came to $ 7.18. I said I did not want the apples then. She put them aside without subtracting the price off of my bill obviously. I've learned it at home upon checking the receipt and would've returned to KD if I didn't live an hour away. Another issue I had yesterday was with their meat counter. I've purchased pork fat that happened to be a pork skin you cut out and throw away anyways ( there was literally a quarter inch fat on it ). They have it rolled up in the cooler so you can't see. 
So there's NO $ 100-200  trips to KD Market in Schaumburg for me anymore. I've warned my family and friends as well.

This ain't your standard hole-in-the-wall Polish deli.  It's a full sized supermarket WITH a liquor section.

While combing the locale for a decent source of kielbasa, I came across Krystyna's and instantly fell in love.  

The deli section is always crowded and if the tag system is inop, get ready for mayhem. Somehow everyone stays in order, unlike the death pit at Valli's deli.  Service is friendly and served with a smile from the ladies who aren't hard to look at.

Check out the aisles for some unique Polish groceries.  I tried an Apple Mint drink that was strangely refreshing.

The liquor section is small but has a decent selection, including 90%+ alcohol spyrytus. Extensive Polish beer selection is available as well.  

They have prepared food and a bakery as well but I haven't had the chance to try either.  The food on display looks good though.

Check it out and grab some kielbasa for the grill.

First, the five star ratings seem way over the top for this place, perhaps they were paid for.  While they are trying to be a cross between Jean's in the city and Valli in Hoffman; it seems they are neither Polish nor American.  The hispanic staff is nice if they speak english, but the polish staff always have an edge in their attitude like they are ready to snap at any moment.  I've always tried to be overly friendly to them in an effort to get a smile.  Never got one. They worn me down.

Best polish store in the suburbs! Especially after their big remodel you can now get all your groceries done in one place! Huge selection of fresh local produce. Great variety of warm prepared foods for those days when you don't feel like cooking dinner! They have a large alcohol aisle as well as Polish cosmetics and medicines. As for prices I would say they are fairly priced.

Stopped in here for the first time after yoga down a few doors to buy some scallions.  Very Clean and fresh produce at great prices.  The place smelled amazing from their hot dinner bar $5.99.  Tons of freshly baked goods.  Lots of bread options.  I took one star off for their relatively small meat/fish section, but I understand they're working with a limited space.

Being half polish and visiting my grandparents there when I was young this is by far some of the best kialbasa and polish delicacies I have had around Chicago. I travel here once a week with my mother just to get polish sausage. The deli counter has everything and they carry a wide range of every polish grocery item! Beware though the deli counter is usually crowded.
Ever since I have discovered this place I do my weekly grocery shopping there. Meet and cheeses are very fresh, and prices are are lower when compared to jewel.

Pretty good selection of Polish items. Although I am Polish, I don't speak the language. Lots of the workers (and customers) speak Polish so don't be surprised if a worker asks you something in Polish instead of English. I love their bakery items!
Everything here is amazing. Homemade chicken noodle soup that is out of this world, homemade tomato noodle soup, pierogis ... All so good!! We go here weekly!

Everywhere I went in this store they tried to speak to me in Polish.  I told them what I wanted on my sandwich, they responded in Polish.  I gave them the money to check out, they responded in Polish.  I don't speak a word of Polish, but it didn't matter because our sandwiches were awesome.  That is some high quality ham, Krystyna's Deli.

Dobra szynka! (?)
Great selection of very affordable produce! They also have nice organic dairy options too. We will definitely be returning here for regular grocery shopping.

I'm in heaven!

A Polish deli & supermarket where they assume you speak Polish! My grandmother would be proud.

The first source of kielbasa I've ever shopped at that has 3-4 distinct types of kielbasa available not just a single generic "kielbasa," or sometimes kielbasa-like options.

Picked up some of their house brand frozen pierogi too. Couldn't find a potato/onion pierogi like Grandma used to make, but I'm sure the potato and cheese is just as good.

I love it. I'm totally going back, even if it is a 20 minute drive and completely out of my way.

My mother bought $50 dollars worth of various cookies and desserts, partially for a cookout. We tasted one bite of the eclair and one bite of a tart, the cream tasted like Jello sugar-free pudding. We tasted the marble pound cake and it was bland and didn't have much flavor. Maybe the meats are good, haven't tried, but I wouldn't buy desserts again. My mother put three packages of various cookies out at the picnic and only two cookies out of all were taken. Go figure.

I love this Polish Deli & groceries store. My husbands family Love's traditional polish foods for the holidays and I can always count on getting what I need from Krystyna's. 

LOVE that they assume I speak Polish! My kids get a kick out of it as well. I've learned a bit of it while shopping there. They are always kind to the American speaking patrons which is a bonus as it can be a little intimidating otherwise.

Looking forward to my Holiday shopping at Krystyna's. :)

I want to warn the costumers of Kristina's Deli in Schaumburg and to describe what happened to me in this store. I liked this store and I was valuable costumer because I spent a lot of money in this place but I won't be the customer any more. When I was shopping last time the manager stopped me after I paid and told that he knows I am a good costumer and spent a lot but  that I not always pay for my groceries. Then I said that I don't  understand what he is talking about. Then he said I steal some staff and I put it to my pockets. I was shocked, humiliating and I asked him for some evidences. He said that he has videotape with me but he can't show me it.  Then I showed him my pockets and my purse to proof I didn't steal anything. I asked him to call police but he refused. He even didn't  want  tell me his name and name of owner of this store. He tread me like a shit ! I was crying and shaking, and then I called Police. When the Police officer came the manager  refused to show him the videotape and said  if I will come to this store again they will arrest me.  I am a woman in middle age and I am exceptionally honest person, I have never been arrested, I have never stolen nothing in my life and I survived trauma. I am sick because of this , they hurt my civil rights, and I don't know why, they should show me some evidences and I am sure that I could to proof that it was not me on this videotape. They don't know what means false accusation to so honest person like me. Fortunately there are other stores where every costumer is treat with respect and friendly.
Krystyna's always has good produce prices as well as excellent meats, prepared foods, and bakery selections. There are plenty of other polish staples, cookies etc as well.

My first 5 star. Simply great. I'm so glad I found this place. They have a large produce area, meat, deli, bakery, fresh bread, and more. Go ahead and sit down for some good old fashioned cooked foods. Nice to see them use wax paper for deli products. Easy access to run in and out if need to. Prices fit like a glove.
I love this store, you cannot beat this prices and the food is delicious!!!

I love the grigliata at this restaurant and it keeps me coming back.

The restaurant itself is very well hidden, in a strip mall and it's on the small size. I hear that it gets very busy at peak times and that there can be a wait. I came for dinner during the week so it was not too busy. 

I ordered the grigilata, which has calamari, octopus, and shrimp broiled with balsamic vinegar. It is served with eggplant and zucchini.  It tastes like it comes right off of the barbecue. It is so delicious and I highly recommend it.  It is my favorite dish on the menu. The portion is also very generous. I usually share it with friends as an appetizer.  My friend had the brilliant idea of ordering it with pasta next time so I will have to do that.

This time, it didn't have the smokey flavor that it usually does so I was a little disappointed about that.  It was still very good.  

I also ordered the spaghetti noodles with bolognese.  I like my pasta al dente and kind of chewy and this pasta was cooked just perfectly.  I also enjoyed the bolognese, which was sweet.  My friend who tried it was not as big of a fan.  I think because she does not like sweet spaghetti.  

Also, the owner stopped by our table to say hi, which I appreciated.  Our waitress was also very friendly.

Great Italian food. Highly recommend.

First time here! Had the baked clams and the lobster ravioli. Also tried my friend's salmon Vesuvio. Everything was excellent. I probably over ate because it was so good. I was stuffed but the vodka sauce on the ravioli was the best I ever had and I had to just keep eating it. I love the atmosphere too. It's truly a family owned place full of regulars. Everyone but me were speaking Italian but that's why I loved it. It felt so authentic! The owner/chef cones out of the kitchen to say hello sometimes too. I'll definitely be back! A lot!

The words to describe how mad I am can not be described. Sat at 745 and check given at 945. We got one appetizer , the mushrooms that were the only thing about this meal that meant anything, and still 2 hours to get our meal and check no thank you.

Service ; terrible. We literally saw our waitress three times. No water no service no anything. To say we felt like an afterthought means they at least thought of us and they did not. 

Her meal with chicken with asparagus and forget the fact that it was served in hour late The chicken looks like any of the process chicken that you get at McDonald's and asparagus was overcooked.

I get the risotto with the basically it was just a seafood Medley and it was equally awful. Pretty sure that was just rice and not risotto the clams and mussels her over cook the shrimp was tough. I was thinking this is what I see a white based milk in it was tomato-based which is fine it doesn't post to be but it also taste like rague.

After waiting an hour before we get our meal and you cannot tell me that they sat there for 2030 minutes and we're just microwaved. The fact that one have to play the sauce look like it was cold and then when you cut into the chicken in it was steaming hi kinda tells you it was microwaved.

I've been here for take out a few times in and out in 20 minutes in the food was good. Take some way here in a day for a sitdown meal in the service is terrible and the food is all over cooked. And I like to eat. Not happy

They give you complementary powdered cakes that taste like carnival snacks and even those felt old.

All in all, it took 2 hours to get one appetizer and two entrees. Unacceptable at any venue. Much less here.

Bravo to Pasquale, owner of this class act 20 table Italian Restaurant! I dined here last night for the second time ever & was most definitely pleased! My initial reservation was for 5:30 but my date & I showed up early & we were seated immediately. I personally ordered the Lasagna which was cooked perfectly & tasted phenomenal! My date ordered the Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. The Fettuccine pasta was cooked perfectly & served with a thinner than average sauce complimented by a citrusy lemon taste. While my date would have preferred a thicker sauce consistency, it really made no difference because my Lasagna was so good we simply ended up sharing my Lasagna! Upon requesting the bill, our waiter suprised us with a complimentary Tiramisu which blew us both away. We intially only took a bite to try it since we were so full, but at that point we couldn't stop! In ragards to the service quality, our waitress was extremely kind & sincere. Not only did we interact with her but the whole staff seemed more than willing to ask us if we needed anything. The owner Pasquale also came by our table at the end of our meal & thanked us for dining with him which in my opinion is the real meaning of dining at an amazing restaurant. Thanks & I hope you're ready for me next time I come back!

Unbelievable!  From the moment we sat down to the final fork of our tiramisu it was an amazing pleasure. The calamari was perfectly grilled. the homemade blue cheese dressing was fantastic.. The staff was very personable and made you feel very comfortable and "at home".  Top the whole meal with coffee and  a tiramisu that was so good I almost ordered a second piece.

If you have not been here you are missing something special.

Awful experience, I highly do not recommend this place.  Margie, one of the owners was incredibly rude, the food was not fresh and salty, and the restaurant lacked any type of ambiance.  In addition,  the service was so slow, we had to ask another server to have our waitress bring us our check.  Arlington Heights has so many other great restaurants to choose from.  Do yourself a favor and go anywhere but here.

My husband and I had heard about this place and were anxious to give it a try.  We finally made it there for his 65th birthday.  It was fantastic!  From the portibello mushroom appetizer to the pistachio gelato, it was a wonderful experience.  I had the lobster ravioli - really good!  And, I loved the atmosphere - small and unpretentious and the owner came by our table several times.  Now on our list of regular stops.

We went here last night (4-9-16) and had some of the worst service we have ever had. The staff were all on their phones. The manager did try and get the staff to help but,  not effective. I got a dish I did not order. No one ever came by to see how things were going. The manager was busy counting money at the table next to us. Rough experience.

I have mixed feelings about this restaurant. My first experience was great, my second time was not.  

The first time I came at around 5:45pm for dinner on a Tuesday with a friend who recommended it.  Everything from the service to the food was excellent. The waitress was super friendly and we were seated right away. We ordered the grilled seafood appetizer (grigliata) and I ordered the fra diavolo with minestrone soup on the side. 

The bread that comes with the meal was roasty toasty, crisp on the outside, soft on the inside. The minestrone soup was flavor and the vegetables were nice and mushy.  The grilled seafood appetizer was superb. If I had to order one dish at this restaurant, this would be it.  The pasta actually had a bite and was spicy, which I was surprised by because I have a high tolerance for spicy food.  The only complaint I had about the food was that the shrimp was overcooked and tough. The restaurant is also a bit pricey. 

During our visit, Italian families started piling in so I thought it must have been authentic Italian food.

The second time I came back for lunch with friends. I could smell the grilled seafood from the parking lot. It was actually pretty busy. The waitress let us choose our seats. We ordered the grigliata, the gnocchi with marinara, the eggplant parm, and the lobster ravioli. Lunch was slightly less expensive than dinner.

Again the grilled seafood was wonderful. It was seasoned well, the portions were generous, and it tasted like it had come straight off the barbecue. Everything else was just meh. With my side salad, I ordered garlic dressing. It was overdressed and kind of sour.  I wasn't a fan. 

I've made eggplant parm before so I know how time consuming and labor intensive it is. The one at the restaurant was just ok. A little on the mushy side and not flavorful. The lobster ravioli was very sweet and the filling kind of reminded me of a crab rangoon. The gnocchi was bland.

I noticed the owner making rounds at all the tables but he did not stop by our table. I don't know if it was because he knew the people at the other tables or if it was because we were not Italian. This kind of upset me. I know he saw us. He just didn't take the time to say hi.

The bathroom was not wheelchair accessible.  A wheelchair cannot fit in it. It's also a bit hard to maneuver around because the restaurant is small and the tables are close together. Luckily we sat at a table right by the door.

I would definitely go back for grigliata but I'm not so sure about the other dishes.

My girlfriend went here last week on a recommendation.  We were not disappointed.  The moment we walked in the hostess (owner) greeted us warmly and seated us immediately.  Initially the service was so-so but it was crowded and we were in no hurry.  The food made up for the so-so service.The bread was excellent and the olive oil was fresh. The food came out piping hot. The chicken marsala was excellent and I highly recommend it.  The owner came around and was very friendly.  The portions were a good size so as to not overwhelm you, but not to leave you hungry either.  My girlfriend and I really enjoyed our meals and will certainly be back.  Authentic Sicilian style Italian food!!!!  I only wish they could serve hard liquor. They serve beer and wine.
Best restaurant by far...... Sicilian style food and great service with the best chef him self Pasquale

This is by far the friendliest Italian restaurant I've ever been to! The food is delicious as well.

My mom and I went for lunch. We started with a bottle of wine, of course, along with the portabello mushroom appetizer which was very flavorful and to die for!

We ordered 2 entrees and decided to split them both so we could both have different tastes. We got the lobster ravioli which gaff a delicious shrimp sauce with little pieces of shrimp in it, and the chicken ortalano which included artichokes and asparagus with a light lemon cream sauce. Delicious. I highly recommend both entrees.

Aside from the great food was the great owner who kept checking on us and even sang and danced as he delivered us fresh watermelon for dessert. He sat with us and talked with us for awhile. He was very friendly and professional!

Ill definitely be back!

Great little restaurant, full of local regulars who love fresh Italian food made with love. We had amazing pasta, perfectly al dented and tasted freshly made, amazing lobster ravioli, and fantastic cannolis. The wait staff was attentive and friendly, the owner came out and chatted with us, then went back to cooking. Decor is plain, tables close together, but this just helps focus on the amazing food and neighborly atmosphere.

Since moving out to SW Connecticut 3 years ago, I have yet to find an Italian restaurant where you know each dish is freshly prepared and authentic.  Coming back for a short visit to Chicago, I made sure my first stop,straight from O' Hare airport, was Joe Guiseppe for a late lunch.  I needed my J & G fix.  Was not disappointed and in fact Pasquale treated us with freshly made cannoli for desert!   Never been disappointed!  Thank you!

Absolutely fabulous Italian restaurant with REAL authentic Italian cuisine. We went in on a Saturday night and it was starting to get full due to the fabulous food and atmosphere. (So I would recommend calling and making reservations, especially if wanting to go on a Friday or Saturday night).  They have tables for larger parties and also tables for 2, so they accommodate all party sizes appropriately. Definitely worth the drive if you are coming from a distance and definitely a place to be a regular at. Perfect for families, couples and everything in between! Will absolutely be coming back!

I love their lasagna, taste fresh and not burned on the sides as usually done in other restaurants. . We have tried other dishes and taste great too but my fav is lasagna.  The staff is very friendly feels like a family there. The owner comes out to small talk with the customers, very friendly.  The line gets long at times the place is small but so worth it. Mmmmmm

This was the worst food of any type that I have had in the Northwest suburbs in 20 years.  The octopus was "not fresh" and had to be sent back because it smelled "wrong".  Our friend, who likes the restaurant for some reason and took us there, was the victim. She declined an offer of something else.  Smart move. The lasagna was warm, at best, with a runny, orange sauce. The service was abrupt and impatient.  The patrons were loud and rough.  The minestrone  used a canned stock--no freshly made soup here.  Appropriately, the restaurant is located in an industrial area--where it belongs.

I wouldn't be surprised if I see this place on Restaurant Impossible at some point in time. Wouldn't know what the food tastes like, because we walked out of the place when we saw that the prices were up to $7 more on the dine-in menu, than the menu on the website.
