Somehow, she skipped us and seated a party of four that came in about 30 minutes after us. When my wife asked, she acknowledged the error and gave a hurried apology, but made no concessions for us. As others have noted, this place is small, with counter space for individuals, but only a few tables that seat larger groups. So we had to wait our turn. This would have been enough to turn me off from coming again, but the quality of the food did a lot to make up for it.

Another issue is the parking: they don't have enough and many of the spots are reserved for the other stores in the small strip mall. I think the key is to come here during off-peak hours if you want a chance at getting a spot and getting seated in a reasonable amount of time.

Some folks think the ramen here is too salty, but I tend to prefer my ramen on the salty side, so no complaints here. My wife and daughter were in the "too salty" camp. If you want a less salty broth, order the Kyoto-style shiro miso. You can also request extra broth to make it slightly thinner and less salty.

I'll definitely be coming back here... hopefully when it's less crowded.

My first ramen experience got off to a slow start, but turned out to be amazing.

My one piece of advice: do not come here if you are starving, like I was. We waited a long, long time in the small waiting room before we were called into the dining room. I was really hungry when we walked in the door, which was a huge mistake. I was told there is always a wait here, and usually quite a long one. We arrived around 11:30 on a Saturday and waited a good 45 minutes or so, to give you an idea.

Aside from the long wait (which is the sole reason that I knocked off a star), the food was just fantastic. We went on an especially cold day and the ramen warmed me to my core. It was the perfect blend of salty, spicy, and savory. I couldn't eat the whole bowl, but I wanted to. I know I don't have any other basis of comparison for ramen, but I just can't imagine eating better ramen that I had that day. Not possible.

I hate long waits, but I know that I would gladly head back to Ramen Misoya and wait just as long or longer for more of this ramen. It's just that good.

Interesting.  Ramen Misoya specializes in three types of miso-based broths with various toppings.  The Nagoya is medium brown in color and opaque.  I wouldn't say it's salty but maybe has a hint of sweetness?  The flavor was definitely different than I'm used to.  I also didn't enjoy their grilled pork as much.  It's leaner and although pretty tender, I much prefer fattier pork belly cuts that melt in your mouth.  Also, the ramen noodles were on the thicker side, kind of soft, and curly, like they came fried in a package, and then dunked in the broth to rehydrate.  I'm suspicious of whether their noodles are good quality.  They have some "seasonal" ramens like curry and tonkotsu (pork based broth).  My fave kind of ramen remains the tonkotsu broths at Santouka/Mitsuwa and Wasabi and the chicken paitan at Ramen Takeya.

Their appetizers were all good, though.  Takoyaki (6 octopus/potato balls), 3 grilled whole squids, and chicken karaage (fried chicken pieces).

Surprisingly, the wait at 1:30 PM on a Saturday was an hour, so we didn't get seated until 2:30, and by the time we finished our meal at 3:30, there was still a line of people waiting to eat!  Also, there are only 4-ish tables that can seat 4-5 people.  The rest of the seating is along the counter, so don't come with an entourage or wait for a very off-time (weekday?) to go.

Lastly, the parking lot kind of sucks.  Certain spots are "reserved" (via hand written poster board signs) for the dry cleaner and convenience store.

I've seen Ramen Misoya mentioned on multiple Ramen-worthy lists as well as heard my friends talk about them, so I was hankering to give them a try. I finally did last week, and it was worth the drive. I got something like a tan-tan chasu ramen (?? I can't remember the name), for $9.90 and it was pretty good! Broth was savory and noodles are on the thicker/cheweir side (as other reviews had mentioned), but I didn't mind it. I generally like thinner noodles, but these were like excessively thick.

Service was super nice. The venue is small, maybe like 15 tables plus bar-like seating at the open kitchen area. There is a waiting area right outside.

I would recommend! And I would come back.

This was so yummy! I've been to other delicious  ramen places before but this definitely beats them. I got the Hokkaido style cha-shu ramen. I added the miso egg into it. I've never had corn in my ramen before and it was awesome, it added a little sweetness to the ramen. The waitress told us what the styles meant. She said Hokkaido style is salty, Kyoto style was less salty, and the Nagoya style was bitter. The Hokkaido was salty but not overpowering. The meat was thick and not like a melt in your mouth meat but it was great. I love the char flavor it added to the soup. This was so delicious and I will definitely be coming back.
Best suburban ramen I have had to date. It's a small place so I should say it is terrible to keep the crowds down but I just can't in good conscience.

Tasty Ramen options, great vegetarian options and great fast service. The food presentation is well done..  Looking into the big bowls of Ramen with chunks of tofu,noodles, bread and butter is like looking at a work of art. No BYOB though...

First time here and would definitely go back! The ramen is flavorful and the service was excellent. You might have to wait awhile for a table but it's SO worth the wait! 

P.s. Definitely add the miso egg to your ramen! So good!

Not bad, but I don't know if it is worth waiting for 30 minutes to an hour, and more for driving. As a person who came from Asia, I think I've had better. I had Hokkaido style chashu ramen with extra egg. There is some American twist in ramens, but I didn't want fried potato and corns in my Ramen. They don't go together with ramen.
I am glad that I didn't order an appetizer because the toppings and noodles made me really full, I couldn't even finish it. 
The price is a little higher than I expected from the service I was getting. The dining area is very small, and there weren't enough parking spots for everyone. The staff was friendly, though.

Got the takoyaki, and the Tokyo miso tonkatsu with a miso flavored egg and cha-shu. Both of them were fabulous. The broth has the perfect balance of flavor, not too watery and not too bold. The takoyaki was exactly how I remembered when I was living in Japan.

As someone who loves ramen, I like to try different ramen places. This was my second time back and my boyfriend's first time. 

Misoya is a cozy little place with very nice staff. 

As for the ramen, my boyfriend loved it. He said it was flavorful, not too rich, and the spiciness wasn't over the top. But the reason why this is a 3 is because although it's good, their ramen just didn't wow me. I couldn't finish my bowl because there wasn't enough balance in the flavor for me. 

Bias comment: As someone who is hypersensitive to salty food, I did find my food too salty. That was prolly what threw off my taste buds. 

I've tried better places in Chicago and this definitely wasn't worth the drive to Mount Prospect.

Get in here... NOW!  This place has some outstanding Ramen.  Pick your style and you get a hot delicious bowl of Ramen.  The service is fast and efficient.  The place can get crowded at lunch time and in the summer, when it's crowded it can be hot inside.. but that is part of the charm.  enjoy it!

Fuck yeah this is what I needed! Way better than any of ramen place in San Francisco, and is up to the quality in Japan I'd say. 
This is the real ramen
I've had ramen from other places but theirs is always delicious and authentic.  And great costumer service.

So i live 0.2 miles away from this place and I attempted to go so many times already. There always is a crazy line that finished in the parking lot. Unwilling to wait I left. So many attempts later i am bound to think this place is amazing right? Well, i wasnt impressed. I really was excited due the plethora of stars. Sometimes i wonder if i should trust them. 

This weekend i decided to go early. After freezing to death at the cubs game, misoya just sounded like heaven but I thought it was ok. The broth was good but a bit salty, the pork was just tasteless and the service of the place was just awful. So the soup warmed me up but not so much to write a 5 star review.

I went to this restaurant on recommendation from friends who had been here once before. Actually they accompanied me, which is good, because I found the menu little confusing. 

I ordered the Spicy Ramen, with vegetarian broth and chicken pieces instead of pork. Next time I'm going to go all vegetarian. I would have preferred the chicken pieces to be smaller. The four stars is for the flavor and the spicy dish. Loved it. 
We also ordered spicy potatoes in appetizer which was a disappointment. They were just simple potato wedges served with ketchup. We expected "spicy". 

There are couple of reasons that I took off one star: parking is an issue, eating Ramen made me tired...all the swallowing of noodles!  You just have to bend over the dish, in order to avoid the liquid splattering on your dress.

I read other Yelp reviews and figured I would be able to substitute veggie broth for the beef or pork broth but was really (pleasantly) surprised that they have a full vegetarian menu. 

The bowl was made quickly and was very generous in size. I can't wait to come back!

I have to say I'm not such a big fan of ramen but misoya is definitely my top choice if we were to do ramen for dinner. Their staff is friendly and their service is pretty good. Sometimes the line is long and there's a bit of a wait but they get people in and out pretty quickly.

It's hard to say something that hasn't already been said by others, but I will try.

First thing we noticed was that even though there is a fairly large parking lot in front of Ramen Misoya, nearly half of the spaces are reserved for other businesses in the strip mall, it made parking a bit of a challenge for us, and we didn't see much in the way of other parking options nearby.

I feel that the menu could be intimidating for first-timers; it is in three sections- 1st you pick your style of ramen noodle (kome, mame or shiro), then go to the page for that noodle and pick a preparation, then pick any add-ons (listed in the back of the menu). There are also pages in the menu for appetizers and beverages; I was disappointed that they only had canned green tea, and I didn't see an option for hot tea (but I could have missed it). Our server took the time to help us understand the menu even though they were busy- we appreciated that. I tried to find the menu on-line ahead of time to get familiar with it but wasn't able to find it.

Although "vegetarian menu available" is printed on the menu, it simply means that they can prepare the miso without pork on request. Ask your server about this if you're interested.

If you are seated at the bar/counter, you can entertain yourself by reading about the health benefits of miso. I believe that there is a photo of the health benefits of miso card that someone else posted here on Yelp.

Other reviews mentioned that their miso broth was overly salty- I seldom add salt to my meals and I thought it was not too salty for my taste. I did order the vegetarian broth so that might be the difference?

I tried the hachi seasoning (Japanese pepper) on a small part of my meal and really didn't feel that it changed the flavor a lot. Probably was due to my "round eye" taste buds?

The portions are quite large but the servers are more than happy to package any leftovers for you to take home.

When a customer is leaving, the cooks in the kitchen seem to say something to the people that are leaving in Japanese- I never did figure out what this was all about or what they were saying. (Added note: an Asian former co-worker told me that they were likely saying "Thank you and Good Bye")

We had a great experience and look forward to visiting again.

Place is great! Long wait, so be ready. The ramen broth is a bit salty, but overall delicious. I love adding the egg and nori to my dish, it really adds to the flavor. The karaage (fried chicken) is also really good. Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside.
So so so yummy, much needed after a long day of frisbee tournaments and we didn't wait long for seats at all. Great variety, perfect miso-based broth.

Small spot, ended up almost missing it, but I'm glad I didn't. Catching a cold, I was recommended on getting a soup from here. I entered in and getting immediately greeted, I was sat down. I was given a water and a menu. At first I had no idea what I was reading... but I asked the kind lady to give me a soup that she would recommend and ended up getting a spicy Shiro bowl with an egg. I also got fried squid. I received my squid and it was lightly breaded and not too salty, I actually had to squeeze lemon on it. I got my bowl of ramen, and was astonished by the size! This bowl is huge and hot! It was so flavorful and delightful. I ended up getting full around half the bowl, a little less, which is a surprise because I am a pretty big guy. So to summarize, I would definitely recommend this to anyone, and I would definitely come again! For the price and for the portions, I'll be one of the first to say that this place is one to try out!
A dive for Ramen. Heck yes please go here! All the choices are amazing! Portions are enough for a second meal! The restaurant is small and it's best to go on off hours. Worth it. Thank you Misoya!

SALT. SALT. AND MORE SALT. I ordered what was recommended to me by the server AND a friend. I ordered the Hokkaido style if i remember correctly. The other person I ordered with.. we don't remember. It just wasn't memorable. but MINE, was as if a drank the ocean. it was SO SALTY I couldn't taste whatever taste it was supposed to have. The service was okay, but there was an extremely long wait. When it came down to it, it wasn't worth it for either of us to wait so long and then have to pay quite a sum on some noodle soup that didn't taste good.
I don't know what happened with all these wonderful reviews, but maybe someone spilled a can of salt in my soup. Not sure I want to return since I kind of don't want to spend the money to see.
I'll stick with Mitsuwa.

Small hole in the wall place - where I grew up.  Why wasn't this place when I was a kid??

Anyway, #1 haikkido style was very good.  Pork was especially delicious - a bit salty but the broth was pretty good.

Went on Friday right before noon and got sat immediately.  Overall, another good ramen place.

Great place, great tasting Ramen, and authentic Japanese Ramen. Love their food. It has been delicious everytime I have visited it. Their noodles and broth preparations are exquisite. No soggy noodles. Broth has has the right savory taste. With all the trimmings and toppings, the noodles and the broth come together to give you an amazing taste of Ramen. They have got a good variety on their menu. Prices are reasonable and service is good. Expect to wait as the place is small and busy. A must visit restaurant if you like Ramen.

Mmmm, YES!! Probably the best ramen I've had in the states - last time I had ramen this good was in Japan!!

Eating in is just a little cramped (but pretty authentic - really reminded me of my fav place overseas) and isn't the kind of place you can really sit and chill for undetermined amounts of time after your meal (I could feel the staff getting pretty antsy, but the place wasn't particularly busy from what I could tell). The quality of the food definitely makes up for it, though!!

I liked the food and would have given a higher rating if not for our bad dining experience. This was a Zagat-rated place so was expecting an experience deserving of a Zagat rating. I called before coming to inquire about group reservation. I was told they don't take reservations but assured me that they could accommodate our large group (12 people) if we come within the next 15-20 minutes. We arrived within 15 minutes and introduced myself as the one who called earlier about our large group. The person who greeted us, who was our eventual server replied with a condescending attitude saying, "you're call doesn't mean anything!" That gave a sour start to our dinner. We were seated shortly and our orders taken. We didn't know anything about the kinds of soup served so we asked. Our server hastily answered and kept pointing us to the menu like we should have read the menu descriptions in the first place. She got our orders and we waited and waited and waited - for a long time - for our food to come. Many customers came in after us and table after table, their orders came before us and we were still left wanting and waiting. We finally asked our server what took so long for our food to come. To our dismay, the server immediately threw the cooks under the bus, saying she has nothing to do with the delay and that all she does is put the orders in, while making faces as if it's our fault for being impatient to wait. Customers who came after us left way long before us. This is utterly unacceptable! We contemplated of not leaving a tip but we still did only because the food was good. The service sucked and maybe it was because of that one girl! This establishment should train their personnel better. I would have given a 1 for poor service but I don't want to speak badly about this place just because of that one server.  In fairness, I enjoyed the food.

Great small ramen shop that fills up during lunch. I went with a coworker after craving ramen all week. I had the tonkustu special with egg and a big slice of the pork. It was a lot to eat in less than 1 hour. 

The broth was flavorful and the service quick. Next time I could do without the pork and add another egg. Great little places and I look forward to trying the other broth

Best ramen in Chicagoland, period. Best broth, best miso taste, solid noodles, and literally the best pork (pork is better than even in Japan). Eat here. I always get the Hokkaido ramen and my wifey always gets the spicy Kyoto... By far the best, excellent service and I am so thankful they are opening one downtown...I have even had ramen in Japan many times and this is definitely a contender and holds their own...staff is so nice and service is outstanding. Pork so good I get a double order...

I wish this restaurant was closer to where I live. It is quite a drive to get there but well worth it if authentic Japanese is a must have. This place has the real deal. Several types of ramen from various regions of Japan. The staff are Japanese, genuine! Sometimes the soup broth is a tad salty, but it's not easy communicating that to the staff. The place is clean and tastefully decorated- truly as if you were in a little ramen shop in a Tokyo suburb. Location is not great, though, and there's very little parking space. Hope they move someday... Closer to me!

Absolutely great food and a fun place.  I have not had ramen in Japan, but I have had it in Beijing and this place (Ramen Misoya) beats any place I have been hands down.  Very nice people working here.  It is a hole in the wall type of place, but the food is so good there is a line out the door at lunch and you will wait.  Parking sucks.

Some interesting things about their ramen.  The big fried potato wedges - very western - very good.  The large slices of meat also seem to be a nod to western appetites.  Their stock is awesome and thick, a really hearty base.  I will be back to try again.

If you like ramen, you have to go here. If you think you don't like ramen, you need to go here and then decide if you REALLY don't like it. 

I'm in desperate need for another trip to Misoya. A couple of friends and I have joined together to create a group called "the dinner club." In said group, we try out places we haven't been or we go out to eat something we're all craving - luckily, Misoya was both. We made the trip out to Mt. Prospect because we heard Misoya was some top quality ramen.

When we entered, we were seated right away. It wasn't super busy; there must've been three other people there other than us. We were given menus right away and asked if we wanted anything to drink. I just had a soda. I like salt ramen, and the lady was very kind in answering some of my questions. She directed me to hokkaido style ramen which was spot on for my taste. I ordered the cha-shu ramen, (kome) hokkaido style w/ egg. The broth was full bodied, but not too salty. It had corn and potatoes, but the pork is what I want to talk about. The pork in the ramen was delicious! I even saved a piece of pork for last because it was so flavorful. It's nice and tender but not too chewy. 

The only thing is that this ramen is a little bit pricier than what I'm used to. It is a generous bowl of ramen, but still, $13 is a little much for one bowl. Although I won't be a frequent goer, I do recommend this place! GET THE PORK!

Hands down the best ramen in the burbs but also among the top 3-4 in all of Chicago.

How often can you make such a statement when ranking a restaurant in the burbs? Almost never. Ramen Misoya doesn't offer much besides it's ramen, which limits it from surpassing places like Wasabi and Oiistar, but to be honest they don't need it. Rather than add a redundant review of their ramen offerings I'd prefer giving context to greatness by saying this ramen spot isn't highly rated by suburban standards, it really is this good.

4.5 stars only because I couldn't tell if I got extra noodles and a fully side dish menu would make perfection. More room as opposed to being in a small unit within a tiny strip mall would be nice but at least it isn't in a hipster village or buried in downtown.

Was there one time. Ramen too salty and noodle is like instant noodle. So-called Tempura is American styled friend shrimp instead of light covered Japanese tempura. The only good one is the chashao pork. I don't understand why people think this place is one of the best in Chicago.

Ramen Misoya - you've stepped up to the plate and hit a home run again! Still a fan, I am. My last visit prompted a few updates though, so here goes...

Busy busy busy at 12:00 on a weekday! Okay, so a busy lunch at the noon hour is pretty much a given anywhere, but there are a couple things to note. 

Parking = not good at all. There are literally only like 5 or so spots designated to Ramen Misoya and no street parking near by - good luck! If you're feeling risky like my lunch date, there are other parking lots available nearby. I just wouldn't stick around too long or you might snag a ticket. Regardless, this ramen is worth the hunt for a spot - just wanted to forewarn you.

There will be a wait. At least there was the Friday at 12 pm when I was there last. Nicole W and I waited about 15 minutes before we were seated. The service was quick though and our food came out fast so that helped.

This time around I ordered the spicy ramen. When I asked just HOW spicy it was, the waitress said it's not too bad. She said she doesn't ever get any complaints from people sayings it's super spicy. Sounded legit to me, so onward I ordered.

She was right! HOWEVER, I maybe should have gotten further instructions to be sure to mix my bowl so avoid overheating in a single bite. Not sure what ingredient was the "spicy", but at one point I put a whole spoonful of it in my mouth and almost choked on the heat. Am I a wuss? Maybe. Did I keep eating it? Well of course. But in all seriousness, it wasn't that spicy and super delicious! I would just suggest mixing up your ramen a bit. 

Luckily I ordered their iced green tea to wash down my yummy spicy ramen. The tea was super refreshing (green tea has kinda been my jam lately).

Anywho - still a 5 start joint in my eyes. Can't wait to come back :)

Short and sweet: this is the BEST ramen in Chicago. No competition. Even the location on Ohio has nothing on Mt. Prospect. You will have to wait to be seated no matter which you choose, but it will end up being one of the smartest decisions you've ever made. I recommend the hokkaido but they're all incredible.

Finally made our way to Ramen Misoya since we were going to O'Hare and I am so glad we went! As part of my #ramentrail2015 quest, it definitely is a contender for first place.

We tried the chicken karaage with the lemony mayo sauce first and that was perfectly fried and tender. For our ramens we tried the Kyoto style and the popular Hokkaido. 

Kyoto Style with Cha Shu Pork:
I was going to get the Hokkaido but the server said this was lighter and slightly sweeter than the Hokkaido. She was RIGHT, and I absolutely loved this ramen. It was still creamy and rich and not as smokey as the Hokkaido. The noodles were also the perfect al dente texture. I only wished it came with corn and I wasn't a huge fan of the fried tofu since it got soggy. This is a perfect bowl of ramen folks. 

The grilled pork belly in the ramens:
I wish I could marry it. 

PRO TIP: 
If you have extra soup left, get a side order of noodles for $1.25 and package that baby home for another meal 

Parking situation:
Really stupid, you just have to be patient (I was not) and wait until someone leaves in the world's tiniest parking lot. But put your name on the waiting list by the door first! 

Overall, Ramen Misoya delivers an extremely solid, well rounded bowl of of ramen. I'm sad it isn't close to the city, but will definitely make the trek again!

Yummy!!! My go to place for Ramen in the burbs. My hunny was craving some ramen & we decided to drive the 30 minutes here. I ordered the Kyoto style chasu ramen & he order the Hokkaido style chasu ramen. We both added the miso eggs with ours, which are the bomb.com! Our bowls were big & had an assortment of fixings already added to it! The bowls are quite pricey but the ramen is delicious. 

We also order takoyaki as an appetizer it was okay, quite fishy tasting, which makes sense because of the pile of bonito flakes & the chunk of octopus pieces inside. I wasn't too keen on it but I'm sure other people would like it more than me. Although, I thought it was unusual to receive our appetizer half way through our meal but I get the takoyaki needs time to cook. 

But come here for quality service & food! Just a heads up, the restaurant is quite small & does get packed at times! Parking lot is small too!

Cute little ramen place. Really enjoyed the spicy Tokoyo tonkatsu ramen. I also tried the cha shu ramen  and I think the tonkatsu ramen was significantly better. Also had the takoyaki appetizer which was delicious.  Just be careful because it comes really hot!

Awesome ramen.  I had the Hokkaido style Chasu ramen.  It was very good and I would have it again.  The different in my opinion from some of the other versions I have tried is more vegetables and 3 huge pieces of grill marked chasu.

I came during Saturday post lunch hours and was able to easily find parking in the lot.  I can see given the small lot though and how busy they are with limited parking that this could be an inconvenience.

My wife and I went here for lunch on Saturday. It was both of our first time having "real" ramen and we were not disappointed.

We both got the Hokkaido style Cha-Shu ramen. The broth was tasty in it's own right but all other components of the dish made it outstanding. 

The service was fantastic and we will be back again soon.
Loving this ramen place. Very authentic with generous portions. My kids love it......

I have never eaten herebut husband who loves ramen said this is by far one of the best ramen restaurant in the area. No doubt it is rank as one of the best ramen house in Chicagoland area.  I will also try and have one when i get the chance, will then update this review base on my findings!
Way too salty for my taste. they use the cheapest kind of  noodle. I also don't like how they put french fries and corns in ramen..ut just makes it cheap. but, it's still kind of good, so 3 stars.

Great ramen , tonkotsu plus miso base dashi. Small shop with quick table flipping rate. I ordered karage and the white miso ramen. If you are looking for thick tonkotsu, this is not the place. But if u are looking forward to have a ramen with great balance of broth and miso dashi, here u go. One thing , they serve potato wedges , which still puzzles me these days....

Reliable, cheap, and quick -- Dengeos for years has provided huge portions at extremely reasonable prices, with cooking that's a little better than other similar nearby restaurants. But what makes it really stand out now is the remodeling which gives it a feel more like the trendy fast-casual restaurants but with fast food prices. This will probably become the norm in the next few years as consumers look for great values that they can bring friends and family too -- especially since more expensive sit-down full-service restaurants don't cook burgers, fries, or gyros better than fast food specialists do.

What makes Dengeos really stand out for me is how they salt their food less than restaurants that serve similar food do and don't seem to use as much oil. This is not to say that their food is flavorless, but they don't overseason items and the textures of their food are good (fried foods are crispy, vegetables are juicy, meat is not overcooked, etc.). My favorites are the gyros and skirt steak sandwich if you're looking for something simple and delicious.

So when I come to Buffalo Grove my go to dinner is the Gyro Plate and a side order of hummus.

I spend one night A week in Buffalo Grove and this is always my headlight. The hummus is fresh and the perfect blend of spices  and chickpeas.  Served with fresh warm pita game over. Well the hummus by it self alone I could have like this for dinner!

I've had a few things for dinner here from my hamburger, chicken Greco style, and of course the famous gyro plate. The dinner plate you could really get two meals out of there is that much meat with it. Always fresh always and full or flavor it's like eating a fine steak at a portion of the price. A tomato and a huge portion of onions. The tiZieke sauce is great and always ask for extra and they never charge you. If anything the fact they  don't charge me for the extra to Zieke sauce is just shows great customer service.

The value and the amount that you get do not compare anywhere else.

Stopped in for lunch at this spot. Their dining area is decent sized and everything appeared clean.
The menu here is quite expansive. You place your order, get a number and when it is ready, they call out for you. Drinks are self service.
We ordered an Italian Beef sandwich, Tilappia sandwich, and a Greek salad.
We staked out a booth and waited for our number to be called.
Upon getting our food and digging in, we agreed that none of it was very special. The Italian Beef was kind of blah. I also did not like that they cut the sandwich in half and was sparse on the giardinera.
Tilappia fish sandwich was also kind of bland. The Greek salad was just that, however the dressing that accompanied it was not the best. 
The flavor of everything seemed under seasoned. It was not terrible or anything, just flat.
Lunch was also not cheap for this kind of restaurant. I can only give it about 2.5 stars but I always like to round it up. Others may like it more than me

Cheers to all

You must come here for a gyro plate!!! 5 stars because it's one of the best I've had. They give you a TON of meat and you hud it yourself so you will walk away full. It's cooked well and so yummy. The amount of food it fantastic and its well process. They have great desserts and you can get them to go which is even better. They do get busy but there is ample seating. If you are coming for lunch, I recommend coming here early (11:30) to avoid the rush. You order your food and then seat yourself (similar to portillos)

If gyros are not your thing, they have many other options from Italian beef to grilled cheese. They have salad and other Greek food. Everyone in your party could find something to eat.
The gyro plate is the best. Greasy, filling, and calorie dense with almost zero nutrient density - a true Chicago meal (:
I live right across the street from this location and I love it. All of their food is delicious and it's so convenient to call in an order and pick it up within 10 minutes. Staff is always friendly!

Food is decent. We usually order salads and pitas but I consistently find the staff to be rude. Especially over the phone when they take pick up orders. If this keeps up, I will see no reason to return.

Being pregnant I am now craving different kinds of food weekly. One evening I was craving a chicken gyros and since I live directly across the street the place is easy access for me to get to.

When I placed my order there wasn't a long wait and I requested Tzatiki sauce a few of them at that. I wasn't charged extra for the sauce and I was given a few. I also love the fact that they keep lemons out in their beverage area. I love putting lots of lemon on my chicken gyros and pita so instead of driving the people who work there crazy with requesting that as well I'm able to take as many lemon wedges as I'd like. AWESOME!

I ordered my food to go and when I arrived home everything was warm, flavorful and fresh! I also added a side order of their delicious Greek potatoes where I squeezed additional lemon juice on. This lemon addict feels you can never have enough lemon especially in yummy delicious Greek food like this! I've been dining at Dengeo's for many years so this review was long overdue! I'll be back again soon for my chicken gyros and Greek potatoes fix!

Great place to go for gryos. They put a really good amount of meat in the pita which is soft. They also put the right amount of onions and tomato with it and the cucumber sauces is great. There are plenty of tables in the dining room so it's nice to come here for lunch even at noon when it can get crowded. It's similar to Portillo's where you order food at the counter, pick up your food when your number is called, and then someone comes around and picks up your tray at your table when you're done. This helps keep the dining area clean and comfortable to enjoy your lunch.

I can't comment on anything else because I haven't tried anything else here but based on their gryo and other reviewers, I would like to try something else next time.

When I got out of my car and walked up to the door it was blocked up by a line of lunch time customers all eager to get out of the cold. No problem the three cashiers that were on lunch duty moved them with remarkable speed. They have efficiently nailed down! Can't say anymore about the food that hasn't been said before. It's all good! Gyros are one of the best, but I do have a couple of favorites I like better. Greek chicken and salads are highlights for me. Service, value, great food served hot, plenty of seating. Done!

Dengeo's is consistently a great place for great food!  Been going to Dengeo's for 18 years, started out at Skokie and now Buffalo Grove as well.  They're very generous with the food portions & the food is made fresh & delicious daily.  They have incredible Chocolate Cake as good as Portillo's!  They also deliver which is a huge plus!

Great Gyros. Lots of meat. Cooked well. Good amount of sauce. I'm not local but I'll be back next time I'm in the area. 

Staff could be friendlier.
A little higher in price but good quality and variety. So much to choose from. Never have had a problem, bad service, wrong order, or anything bad from this place as well so way to go

Great lunch spot! My favorite item is the cream of chicken soup. I always ask for lemons in the side and make sure to sneeze in at least three. The grilled chicken green salad is another favorite. The gyros, Greek potatoes, and milk shakes are a couple items to try!!
Awesome bbq chicken, gyros.  Family atmosphere.  Very clean.  Very consistent food. The staff here go out of their way to help customers.

Can't miss with the G-C-R line up or Gyros, Chicken, and Ribs. I get them all and take home the leftovers for a great midnight snack. The Greek roasted chicken is done perfectly and what all other joints should aspire to.  

Love their dining room, free help yourself refills, and generous parking lot.

This place is a miracle.  Whether its just a gyro or a strip steak its always great. They catered a party we had recently. We had italian beefs, pasta, salaf etc..everyone loved it. Dengeos is awesome!

YUM. I think if there is one way to describe this place is a Greek-style version of Portillos. I went here for the first time with my husband and we asked their recommendation about the food. The two girls went back and forth about their favorite dishes and how fun it is to work here. NOTHING gets my vote more than enthusiastic people at the job their are at. 

We settled on the meatball sandwich and the gyros plate with greek potatoes. It was all very good. Everything tasted fresh, was delicious, and was plenty of food. We had fun sitting out on the patio and loved people watching. It was fun to see all the families coming to the restaurant after baseball, soccer, and dance practice. This is a great place for families and I'd highly recommend it. 

Small complaint: gyros plate only came with 1 pita, which wasn't enough. If you order it, make sure to get more than one pita.

This place is great for a quick meal. Its like portillos but offers greek food.

Service is always is quick and friendly.

You get a ton of food for your meal so its a good value. I've had the BBQ chicken and ribs. I really like the sauce. Chicken and nice and juicy with charred skin. Ribs are nice and tender. If you order a meal it comes with a side and garlic bread. 

I've also had the chicken gyro. You get a lot meat and all the toppings. I always have leftovers to take home.

There is a lot of variety on the menu so you can always find something that you will like.

I always order a Greek salad or the gyro when I come here. The staff is so wonderful and you can really tell they love their jobs and are there for the customer. It is owned by a Greek family. Once you order you wait up at the front until your number is called. They always move pretty fast. The last time I went I was offered some free tasty desserts. They are not expensive at all. I would highly recommend it for anyone that loves Greek food or wants to try it. There is always parking.

We get take-out from here often, and Dengeo's never disappoints. My favorite is the chicken gyro, my husband likes the kebabs and the BBQ chicken, and my son likes the bacon cheeseburger. The Greek potatoes are delicious. My only complaint is that the packaging for take-out is about as un-eco-friendly as you can get. I wish Dengeo's would transition away from styrofoam and plastic.
Good food and great prices. We were sent there by our friends ,so we went to try it. you order your food from their counter and you pick it up when called. This was actually ok. You will like it too.

The food is amazing. I've tried many things on the menu so far. Gyros, ribs, sandwiches, Grecian chicken.....all delicious. One of my top choices for those evenings I don't feel like cooking. If you haven't tried them yet you need to check this place out.

Love this place!! Great options, delicious food! I will go there with my whole family and enjoy the green style char and the atmosphere! They are friendly and patient! The price is reasonable because the quality meets the price! Gets the any of the chicken dishes! The burger and gyro meat is really tasty! I love the toppings and it's a nice kid friendly place! It is a high quality fast food restaurant/diner! Yummy place!! The only this is that sometime the tables are left dirty by other patrons and not wiped down for new patrons and it's unclear "do we throw our garbage away or do they take it here"

Stop there some days ago. Ordered Italian beef, ask what can I have for the side dish, he offered some, I ask what is Greek stile potato, he sed it's wedges of potato baked in the oven. For me it's sounds good, in front of my eyes something like in KFC. And for drink I ordered  small soda. So after some minutes he called my number and I took my tray. I was disappointed. About beef sandwich it's ok, size is ok, taste is ok for Greek restaurant, but potato, my my , so or they lie or they don't know what they talking about. I had in front of me boiled potatoes in some liquid ( I think it's just lemon juice with something) no taste at all, and the they put it in oven for 2 min so u can see some born on top. I worked I Italian restaurant before, and baked them avery day. Baked potato crispy on avery side , spatially on the bottom, because of an oil, or marks from the racks . no nothing. So i had for $2.25 boiled middle size potato in some lemon juice and baked for 2 min. 
Plus I ordered small soda , in receipt I checked it's middle soda for $1.99.
If u don't have small soda  just say it , maybe I will take some think ales, a don't want to  pay $1.99 for small soda( because I will not drink much) plus they bring ice from ice machine and put to soda machine. 
Three stars.

Nice fast casual place w comfortable,  nicely decorated interior and some outdoor patio seating. 

Great menu features favorites like  ribs, kabobs, deli sandwiches,  and some Italian specialties. Nice baklava and cake or milkshakes. 

Food is made fresh on the spot so there is a bit of a wait.
The food is great. I usually get the bbq chicken. Been coming here for years and this is one of my few go to places

After living near Dengeos since it opened, I actually went in for the first time yesterday.  I believe I've had take-out from them in the past, but to be honest, couldn't remember.  After having dinner last night, I think I know why.  It's just not memorable.

I ordered carry-out because my man is sick and we were just stopping in on the way to pick up his prescription.  I ordered:

Dengeos steak sandwich (comes with grilled onions and bbq sauce) also comes with fries.
Gyros plate, which comes with fries, and all the fixins.

I did order the fries well done, as I know any fries tend to get soggy when being transported.  They did a great job with that.

The gyros was just kinda, there.  Kostas at Dundee and Hicks is much more flavorful, and not as soft... the meat has more of a bite, which I like.  The tzatziki was very acidic but not extremely flavorful.  The tomatoes the are currently serving were a bit pale... but the only thing they can really do to avoid that is to say that they're not serving tomatoes at all, which I doubt would fly.

The thing that really pissed me off was that I was waiting in line behind two high-school aged girls, to order.  There are three registers to order at.  If you're not familiar with Dengeos, you order at the counter, and then your number is called when your food is ready.  So, i was waiting in line behind these two girls.  It was OBVIOUS we were in line.  Then, these two older people walk in the door, bypass right past us, straight up to the counter and order (the register they went to had JUST become available.)  I mentioned it to the girl at the counter when I got up there, and she just shrugged.  Sure, if they were THAT hungry that they needed to go ahead of me, fine, but that's not good customer service, Dengeos.

Overall, I wasn't too impressed and will probably continue to go to Kosta's for my Gyros fix instead.

Great family-style restaurant. My family eats here almost on a weekly basis. They have so many options, and all of them are good quality. My favorite is the BBQ chicken dinner, and the Dengeos chicken salad. I can make 2 meals out of both of these entrees, which is a plus. Most importantly, their cheese fries are AMAZING. I have also had them cater a few parties, and the food is always a big hit! I love Dengeos!!!
Decent food.  Having a hard time using them for delivery, they always forget items or take longer then they say.  Prices are decent but would rather go to Kostas for gyros more food for the price.

Decent greek-american fast food place. The decor is nice and its always clean we I come. The staff is always friendly and greet me whenever I come in. They handle crowds well at this location. The chicken pita sandwich is usually my go to but pretty basic/plain tasting. The fries are good and the cream of chicken rice soup is my favorite but the chicken does taste a little strange so I don't eat that part  I loved the outdoor seating options as well.

I live close to Dengeos and drive by often.  On a whim happened to see this place in a coupon book so what the hey, let's try em out eh.

Ordered the Shrimp and Gyro Dinner plate.  Was very good.  The Gyro dinner plate in particular came with big portions.

Definitely would go there again and completely understand the high number of "above average" scores given to this establishment by fellow Yelp customers.
Dengeos is wonderfully close to home for me, it is the go-to place for lunch or dinner for this old man. Varied menu, eager employees and tasty meals that can't be beat. Always a pleasant experience.
Service was friendly and fast. It is a cute place, food prices are very reasonable, chicken pita was on the bland side.

Dont order chicken fingers..

I want to give this place a better review because food that is actually prepared looks great.

 That was not my experience, I ordered the chicken fingers plate with fries and what I got was frankly insulting. 

The entire meal was what your lowest expectations would be from a dorm cafeteria. It's almost as if the fries and chicken was microwaved. 

I have had better food from a microwave kids cuisine dinner.

Meh.....I don't really understand why they are so busy.  Probably just the convenience.  I've been here a few times (LOL - because it's convenient), always hoping it will be better this time.  Food is just alright.  Service is terrible.  Rude people every time I've been.

They do have a large selection of food, but nothing to write home about.

I love this place for lunch.  They have some really good sandwiches and salads.  I have really enjoyed their patty melt, even though the beef patties aren't the best.  I also have gotten their Dengeo salad, which is excellent and very large!  Also, one thing to definitely get if you aren't sure, is their chicken kebab dinner.  The chicken is cooked and seasoned perfectly.

I came here recently with two of my girlfriends for a quick lunch since we haven't been in forever or at least since they've remodeled and I was really craving some good old gyros (pronounced the correct way). Upon coming in, it looked nice and spacious and clean, which is always a plus. You order what you want up front and then they give you a receipt with a number and then you go and pick a table and wait for your number to be called. 

It literally took about five minutes and all our orders were ready. I wasn't super hungry to get a whole gyro plate so I decided to get the gyro sandwich with extra tziki sauce and it came to about $6.50 and even for the pita sandwich you get a LOT of meat so the portions for the prices are definitely fair. Okay, so the gyros were very yummy but they weren't the best I've ever had and since this isn't just a fast food joint, even though it does carry lots of fast food items I was hoping that the emphasis on delicious gyros would prevail. They were okay, not the best I've ever had but certainly not the worst. Now, the tziki sauce which makes the gyros was a little thicker than I prefer as I like it to be more of a dressing instead of a white gob. You get veggies with it like tomatoes and onions which I get on the side. The pita was also good but not the best I've had. I usually want to go get a second pita, but not here.

Overall, we had a nice time. The place is spacious, there's plenty of booths and regular tables, the food consensus amongst all of us is that everything tasted okay but nothing special, however, I don't think I would go out of my way to come here just for the gyros even though the place is Greek and known for them.

WOW! I was super impressed by my meal at Dengeos! We didn't know what to expect from the outside, it looked very nice so I expected a sit-down restaurant. It was actually very similar to Kosta's on Dundee and Hicks, except a little nicer and definitely more crowded! Their menu is large and covers all the traditional Greek bases, with some American classics. 

I ordered the chicken kabob plate with Greek potatoes and pita bread. My boyfriend ordered the salmon dinner (comes with rice and vegetables) and pita bread. Since it was so busy, I expected our food to take a long time, but they called our number in about ten minutes. The servings are very large, so you are getting your money's worth! My chicken was perfectly seasoned and the potatoes were incredible. Their tzatziki was really good! Very different from most other places, it was a little thicker and slightly more savory. The pita was cut into quarters, and I usually like a whole pita with my chicken, so I will have to ask for a whole one next time. But obviously, that did not detract from the food! My boyfriend really liked his salmon and rice (no veggies for him!), and I thought the salmon was great as well! I was pleasantly surprised by the food at this restaurant and I hope to go back soon! I can't wait to try their gyros!

Have been coming here for years.  Overall, great food and decent prices.  As this is the only true fast casual Greek place in the immediate area, this is the place to go if you are in the mood for good Greek food.

PROS:
*gyro meat was not greasy
*cheap prices
*extensive menu
*friendly service
*outdoor patio seating
*quick service

CONS:
*gyro meat had no flavor
*meatball sandwich had more cheese than meat
*boring french fries

I expected more from the food at Dengoes considering how busy it was for dinner. I'll probably give them another chance and order something different next time.
Not bad, typical Greek establishment. Ordered Gyros plate, daughter had a burger and fries. Will return.

I've been here a couple of times awhile back, and though I pass by it all the time, I kind of forget this place existed. The Super Bowl party that I attended this year had catering from Dengeos and it was super delicious!! They had gyros, chicken, a couple of salads and excellent rice. It was so good that my fianc and I decided to come back here again and grab some food on a weekend evening. I had the Greek Salad with gyro meat and it was amazing especial with the warm pita bread. My guy had the 1/2 Grecian Chicken with Greek potatoes and he also enjoyed his meal very much. 

I am honestly surprised with all the negative reviews. Dengeos is constantly busy... the restaurant is always packed and the parking lot looks even worse. We walked in on a busy night and ordered for carryout, and we only waited 10 minutes or so. If you are in a hurry, I do recommend calling your food in ahead of time, otherwise, it's really not that bad of a wait. 

Dengeos is a good place to go to when craving Greek food... fairly cheap, tasty food, and quick service!

OMG! Drive there now and get the Greek potatoes. They are so simple and so tasty awesome.
Gyros are perfect and Tzaziki sauce is so original. Burgers - yum. Staff - very friendly.
Parking is packed but that is because a lot of people are there eating great food - Duh!
Great casual food and very family friendly. Chicken gyros is a go-to favorite, although many items are good here. Kids menu could be improved.

Heaven on Earth! Tasty chicken, good salads, excellent burgers and outstanding gyros. This place is the best. It doesn't do justice to Dengeo's to call this a burger or hot dog joint. I'll take Dengeo's over Portillo's any day. I pass Portillo's on my way here. Everyone should eat here.
Worst spinach pie ever!  Over cooked, bland.  Had no feta cheese on it.  Served with bland iceberg lettuce salad with tomato and onion low budget red wine vinaigrette dressing.
Great family Greek eat anythjng type of place.  Good for takeout on nights when running around, love the grilled chicken, ok pasta, good skirt steak.

This was my first trip to Dengeo's West though I know Dengeo's East very well. First, you walk in and see a clean restaurant, with an easy to read menu and great prices. To have a fair comparison I ordered my usual consisting of Mostaccioli and Meatballs and Chicken Kebob. The food arrived and it looked like the same high quality and fresh food I get at Dengeo's East - and it tasted just as good. I will definitely be back.

I had never heard of (or noticed) this place until a friend suggested we meet here for an early dinner a couple days ago. It's a gyro/hot dog/burger joint that is very similar to Portillo's and other locally-owned Greek/hot dog joints. Although I don't eat these things anymore, I still love going to the restaurants.

Dengeos doesn't really have vegan options (aside from a salad and some sides) so I asked for a pita with grilled vegetables in it. The only vegetables they have are onions and peppers, so I said that was OK. I also requested some tomatoes and lettuce on top of it. I explained to the cashier that I don't eat meat, blah blah blah. After I placed my order, I realized the price was a bit high. I checked the receipt and noticed the girl charged me for a chicken pita. Baffled, I asked the guy behind the counter why I was paying so much for a simple pita with some vegetables in it ("Why should I pay for the price of the chicken if I'm not getting chicken in it?").

Apparently the girl thought I wanted a chicken pita and had asked for extra vegetables on top of it. And this is after I explained that I don't eat meat and made a big deal about wanting on vegetables. Really?! How can you mess that up? (And why do places keep messing up my order these days? Is it my fault?) Fortunately, the guy was willing to refund me for the extra cost and switched my order around. Yay!

The pita with vegetables? Delicious! They stuffed it with a good amount of vegetables and the crinkle french fries I got on the side were as good as any other place. The only thing I didn't like was that my vegetables were not cooked at all, as I had requested, but I was tired of being picky so I ate it anyway. I felt satisfied.

My friend and I ended up staying there nearly two hours, just catching up on life. When we arrived, there was barely anyone dining, but by the time we left (6pm on a Monday night), the place was getting busy. That's a good sign that this is a good place to go.
Excellent, great food, they deliver in the area, bbq chicken perfect, salads yummy, always friendly too.

First, let me say that this is a good place and I will return. The three stars are because of just some minor issues.

I ordered the Italian Beef and a baked potato with BUTTER and a side of au jus for pick up. I got to the restaurant and went to the counter. The gentleman asked for my name, and gave me my total, and I asked if I could add a slice of chocolate cake. He said no problem. I paid, and he brought my order up to the counter. I asked him if the BUTTER was inside. He searched through the bag and said, yes.

I got everything home, and it's still hot (I live about five/ten minutes away). I opened everything up and the sandwich is huge and stuffed to the brim with beef. Very tasty, but the au jus is way too oily/greasy. It really should be more of the beef drippings, not the fat and oil, so half a star off for that. The potato is good, but very small for the price they charge. I would expect a bigger potato. Not huge, mind, but more a medium sized, and what they give you is a small, so another half star off for that.

Now, to the BUTTER. Notice that every time I write the word, BUTTER, I capitalize all letters. This is because I asked for BUTTER, not MARGERINE!!! So, I am not happy that when I asked for BUTTER, and even checked at the counter to ensure the BUTTER is in the bag, and I get home and see MARGERINE, I am not happy! If I'd wanted MARGERINE, I'd have specifically asked for that, but I asked for BUTTER. Country Crock is NOT BUTTER. There is no substitute for BUTTER!!!!!!!!! So, one full star off for that.

Still, as I said, Dengeos is otherwise a good place, and I'll go back for another Italian Beef, and to try other items on the menu.

And I know some people will read this and get to the butter part, and laugh, and I get it, but sorry, it's not funny to me. Also, I can't say anything about the cake yet, because I'm still eating the dinner part. I'm going to assume it's good. It certainly looks good, and while a small piece, it cost less than $3 while at other places for the same sized piece, they'd charge $4 or $5, I'm not complaining about that.

What happened to Dengeos ? It used to be a good casual option . Did not enjoy my chicken pita . The pita bread was cold and the chicken had absolutely no flavor . My husband ordered the half chicken and was looking for the meat ...quality and flavor not the same as in the past .. Could of been a off night .

Amazing prices for a wide variety of quality, fresh food.  I love the gyros!!! As a Greek owned restaurant they definitely know how to make it tasty.  You can also get a hot dog, salad, and even tilapia.  The tilapia here is amazing for a "fast food" place.  With the large selection here and great food you can't go wrong.

I usually go to the Skokie location but thought I would go here since I was in the neighborhood. It was rather crowded and I prefer a booth and found one near the bathrooms/west side doors. Big mistake. The powerful smell of the deodorizer from the bathrooms was making me sick. Every time the doors opened the smell poured out, plus you could hear the toilets flushing. It was just gross!! The food was good, but the meal was ruined because of the bathrooms. There was a wall between me and the bathrooms, but it didn't stop the smell. My tuna salad was good, but they forgot the dressing and the butter for the bread. My husbands burger was way overcooked and dry. My first experience here was bad enough to not want to return. They need a better barrier between dining room and bathrooms.

I have written a pretty extensive review on the original location in Skokie on Main and McCormick.  
Same applies here: excellent food and great variety of options to choose from on the menu.

These guys do it right!
Love this place! The food is always consistent, fresh and super yummy!! I get dinner from here multiple times a week and I appreciate their great, quick service! Highly recommended.

The food is pretty standard, the Greek dishes are always good. The reason why they didn't get more stars is this; I was in yesterday and was charged different prices than those listed on the menu. When I asked about this, the cashier simply said, " we changed our prices but haven't gotten the new sign yet.". I understand that prices will change, but don't change them until signage reflects this.

My family and I have been coming here for years. The food is consistently good and the place is always kept very clean. The menu has enough something for everyone to choose from. The entire staff is friendly. Defiantly try the chicken gyros pita sandwich. It's one of my favorite things on the entire menu. You can also get your order to go if you want.
Had some really good Gyros!!! Clean and modern decor.  Fun atmosphere and good customer service!  Will go back!

I was not very impressed with this place and I do not think I would go back.  Overall, the food here seemed pretty bland and tasteless.  The service was slow.  you seat yourself in the dining area once you order and pick up your food.  They were a bit slow here actually cleaning off the tables.

Great food, and really good service.  I enjoyed the dish that I ordered, my family has enjoyed the food they ordered as well. They make, XCELLNT soups,salads,burgers,Pretty Much EVERYTHING Is XCELLNT. .. try it

Good place for a decent gyro. The pita was thick and tasty, the meat seasoned just right. Also tried the homemade chili it reminded me of the way Hormel chili tasted when I was a kid. Mean this as a compliment, its meaty with just a few beans. This isn't a sit down type of restaurant, you order at the counter and pick it up there as well. Similar to how Portillo's does it. The inside is clean and there's plenty of tables and booths. The only knock is no beer or wine. But hey, the prices here are cheap, less than $10 a person so worth a visit.

The place was bustling and had a lot of turnover at lunch and at dinner.  They get the food out hot and fast.  Seat yourself after ordering at the counter.  Great food at great prices.  Even their simle chicken sald sandwich was delicious.

Free private parking lot.  Clean bathrooms, friendly.  We keep going back to try new items and they are all SO good.

Im a restaurant operator with a Pizzeria that does good volume.  As an expert, i can tell you that if i were teaching a class on how to operate a restaurant successfully, and wanted the class to observe the most well run Greek owned fast food operation, here is where id bring them.  Whether it be in Evanston or here, Dengeos is super clean, bright, modern.  The food is fresh, tastes great.  Food comes out fast, staff is well trained, minimum mistakes are made. These guys would make money anywhere.  Great operators. Period.

I tend to forget about this place because there's a Portillo's closer to me and if I want a hot dog or Italian beef or sausage, I go there. I also try to avoid gyros, as they're really not too good for you. But there aren't too many gyros places up in this area, so when I do want one, I typically go to Dengeos.

All in all, their food is pretty good. They recently remodeled and it's nicer inside than before, plus I love the TV's around so you can watch some sports if you choose to eat in. I have found the staff there to be really nice - especially for a fast food joint - kudos to them. Prices are reasonable too. A cut above most of their competitors.
Boy do I miss this place having moved to LA.  Can't get fries like those out here I guess.  Terrific gyros, club sand, and fast service.  They would do so well in LA....

I'm giving this a terrible review because it's so fucking hard to access your menu, why the fuck should I constantly click a bunch of shit, you guys should put a fucking menu button on the front page. Seriously I clicked so many times and have not seen a goddamn menu.

I've eaten here twice... I'm a fan! 

I've had a chicken pita, Grecian chicken, and Greek potatoes. Everything has been perfect!! 

The restaurant itself is super clean. The workers are friendly. The prices are very reasonable. They give kids balloons (which I think is super cute!).

If I'm in the Burbs' there's no doubt that I'll be eating at Dengeos again.

This is one of my husband's favorite fast food restaurants. He enjoys the gyro plate, 8 bucks can get you gyro and fries. The meat is juicy and tender and their tzatziki sauce is fabulous. His other favorite is the half bbq chicken, 8 bucks can get you the chicken, a potato of your choice, coleslaw, and garlic bread. Everything that we have had here is delicious and we have not had any complaints about their food. 

The place is very clean, the service is great (they take away your trays if you're done and still chatting away), and there is plenty of seating. But even with the seating, this place gets jam packed on a Friday/Saturday night and sometimes you can't find seating very easily.

I don't understand why Dengeos is sitting at 3 stars.  This is one of the places I would go out of my way a little for when we lived in Palatine.  I almost went with 5 stars just to offset the 3 star reviews.  The Philly Chicken is freaking awesome and all of the food we've had here is really good.  Cheeseburger - Good, Chicken Cesear Salad - Solid, Skirt Steak Sandwich - Delicious.  They give you some warm pita or garlic bread with your salads and I am always greeted with a friendly welcome when we come in.  The cashiers are always ready to take our order and we never have to wait that long for our food.  

As a place that brings us Vienna beef, Kronos gyros and Gonnella bread I can't imagine why they aren't getting more love.  Maybe it's because we are all so used to the hole-in-the-walls around town, but they really are offering up the same exact food in a nicer overall location.  It is always busy at rush times and we're always treated nicely.  Great place for a family dinner.  You can stay for 15 minutes or stay for a couple hours, never hassled and always a nice time when we're there.  I can highly recommend Dengeos to anyone because they have FREAKING EVERYTHING!!!  Enjoy the deliciousness that my family and I so often do.
I work next door and always stop in for there chicken breast salad. Great food, nice people!!
I got violently ill after eating the gyro plate dinner from here.  I haven't been the same since.  I will never go back to this place or eat another gyro again.

This is a quick-service place that has decent food.  I actually haven't been there for a while, but used to go there for a change of pace.  I remember they had a great Caesar salad that comes with awesome garlic bread.

I don't think I can put my finger on it, but I always got a funny feeling when I went there that everyone was looking at us... or something.  It's like they didn't know who we were and so we didn't belong?  I don't know... Still went whenever we felt like it, though.

Most of their food is really just decent. 

It's all about that double bacon cheeseburger. I would advise against going with their meal that comes with fries and coleslaw.

Their coleslaw sucks, there's no sugar coating it. Every time I've gotten it it's room temperature. Cabbage is limp. Juuuust shy of flavorless, and the bit of flavor that you do get is like a watery Miracle Whip. Not for me, I guess, and I love me some coleslaw.

I've also substituted the fries that come with the meal for Greek potatoes twice in the past. Eh, I prefer the fries.

The potatoes are okay, I feel like if they toned down the butter a tad(kindouv a lot), and threw some more lemon flavor in there they'd be fantastic. Until then I'll leave them with a solid "Meh".

Onto the burger, ohhh man. Any burger you get, get it with bacon. The bacon is thick cut and always crispy. Flavorful as hell. "Everything" is lettuce, dill pickles, tomatoes, onions, ketchup, mustard, and mayo. Good portion, really gotta open the mouth to get a solid bite. Have napkins handy, it's a messy beast.

Been eating here 2-3 times a month for the past two years or so, and as it's so close to work I have no intentions of stopping.
I've been here several dozen times and tried a number of things on the menu.  Overall, very good food, large menu, good prices and very good service.

Pretty good food!  Both the spaghetti and the chicken gyro are very tasty. I have come to expect blah or boring, from a fast casual food that is not a hamburger or hotdog, Dengeos packs in the flavor. I also recommend the Greek potatoes; they have a lemon flavor and good seasoning. The rice is also pretty tasty. There patio is perfect for a quick work lunch outside on a nice day.

After reading all of the great reviews my friends and I went here because I was in the mood for a delicious greek salad.  I ordered the greek salad and the HUGE disappointment was finding a long black hair in my food.  Thank goodness I didn't eat any of it yet as the long black hair was right on top of the feta cheese.  I took it back immediately and the cashier was apologetic and it seemed it was the manager that demanded I be given a new one.  I thoroughly inspected the new one and enjoyed it. While I appreciated their promptness regarding getting me a new salad -- we won't be back.  Perhaps the girl at the counter whose job it is to double check the food before it goes out could spend less time on her iphone and more time doing her job.  What a shame that I must restart my search for a delicious greek salad.

Dengeos is our go-to place for carry-out or delivery when we can't figure out what we want to eat, but we want to eat fast, but not "fast-food".  They have fabulous gyros, cheese fries, and philly cheesesteak.  You really can't go wrong with anything they serve.
We ate here three times in three days. This place is amazing. Food is outstanding. Portions are huge. Prices are low. It is a favorite among all favorites.

This is hands down my first choice for an easy meal on the week days. They make it easy to call and order on the fly. The food is ready really fast and it is great food! I always order the gyro. It is the best gyro in the area. It's cheep and fast. I will always come back here!
food is so good!! yummmmyy gyrosss!!! get some

I've been here twice and both times I had their gyro platter. Easily one of the best gyros I've ever had. My favorite part was probably the pita bread. I've also sampled their ribs, which were good as well.

Both the restaurant and service are nice and the prices are good for what you get. I definitely will come again and perhaps try something new.

Great gyros and excellent prices - one continual disappointment:   PLEASE make more Greek potatoes!     My friends and neighbors have been disappointed along with myself for the "we're out of potatoes" comment.      I was recently told that "we ran out at 7:00 P.M." - well heck, it's Saturday night!    Can you make more at 7:00?   And I had been sitting and waiting for a while before this was announced.   Next time they are out, I'm  leaving.    Simple fix I think, huh Dengeos?   I'll try once more.

We order take out from here about once a month.  My husband loves the gyros, my son gets the spaghetti (although he doesn't like the meatballs but he's picky) and my daughter loves the skirt steak sandwich.  I always got the barbecued chicken, made with sauce similar to Open Pit, but last time I tried the Pork Skewers and Oh My I have a new favorite! You get 2 skewers loaded with tasty chunks of pork, a nice serving of rice pilaf and a green salad. Also a choice of bread, a serving of coleslaw, and some yogurt sauce -All for 8 bucks! The only thing I didn't like was all the onions they put on the salad but I picked them off and it was fine. Loved the vinaigrette dressing. I now have a new favorite dish and I will be going back for it.  Oh yes.

Tasty Greek food. Friendly service, good vegan options.The ambience and friendly service cannot be beat. It is very family oriented, noisy( not in a bad way). The best way to describe it is  - Cozy, warm, clean. You see lots of kids with satisified smiles due to the food I am guessing!  The Gyros are very good as are the salads. I have seen a lot of people order some sort of a grilled chicken with a wedge of Lemon, I keep telling myself I am going to order it the next time I am here, but the gyros always win!

The food here is pretty good, I love their fries. A little pricey IMO. Atmosphere is clean and inviting. Decor is cool. I've had the Gyros, burger and chicken sandwich and they were all really good. The burgers and chicken sandwich were juicy and not dried out.
Yummy!

What a fast food place should be.  
Good Gyros, chicken on pita, service.
Family friendly.  Fast casual, nice decor.

My buddy Neil was a regular at the Skokie location back in the day. When Dengeo's opened up a few years ago closer to the office, we became semi-regulars here. Their menu is pretty big. Big salads, good gyros and patty melts too. It's a great place to get a pizza puff if you want a fix. My personal favorite is the pork kabob sandwich, served skewered on a pita. Very lean cuts with a slice of lemon, plenty of raw onions, tomato, a kosher pickle and yogurt sauce. The Greek family that runs the joint has been doing so for a very long time (since they bought the business from Dennis and George) and they are very involved with the community. Always good eats here.

I like their food.  Good value for your money.  

Especially fond of the BBQ Chicken dinner!

Gyros is really good too.  Very generous potions!

5 stars for the outstanding pizza puff.
Pizza puffs are more of a nostalgic food for me and this place does it right.
Pastry is super flaky.

Always satisfying.
incredibly cheap but the gyros and chicken had absolutely no flavor.
Good food, good prices and friendly staff! This place is always busy. So glad it's close by!

I've ordered takeout from Dengeos twice and while I was impressed with the freshness of their food the first time, it wasn't as good the second time. I have tried the grilled chicken sandwich, the chicken kebob sandwich, and the tilapia sandwich and all were decent. But I'd have to say that I still prefer the taste of the food better at Portillo's and Teddy Fabz.

Probably won't go back. The food isn't that great. The gyro sandwiches are average and the club sandwiches are just bland and boring. The staff is always very friendly, but it's all about the food. Sorry guys.

Disappointing start....

Grand opening day and this is the best quality they could offer. Flat buns, contents slipping out, overall messy. Why give out a smashed burger? At least their service was decent. Can't believe I paid $7.38 for a small size meal.
tough to order sometimes language bearer. But I love there food.

Did not like the eggrolls at all (the wife did).
Potstickers were very doughy and came with a redish colored sauce that had a bit of kick to it - I enjoyed both (the wife did not).
Combination fried rice was OK - a bit overcooked.

They have no website or menu posted anywhere on the internet. I took a picture of the menu and will post it.

I ordered Takeout, Chicken Fried Rice and Chicken Sticks. I was told 30 minutes and the food came in about 22 minutes. This is slower than most Chinese takeout restaurant, but they seemed to be busy since the phone was ringing a lot. I think they just have one cook and the front desk person.

The Chicken Fried Rice was delicious. It came with a lot of chicken and scrambled eggs cut up. The Chicken Sticks were also very good and were cooked in Sesame Oil, which gave it a great flavor.

I came here because I saw the high rating on Yelp.  I like to judge Chinese restaurants based on my two go to orders: Kung pao beef and orange chicken. So, that's what I ordered. The cook didn't take much risk with the flavor. It was very bland, watery, and certainly not spicy. I was, however, impressed by their fast service and affordable prices. It was confusing as to why people rated this restaurant so high.

Best Chinese food ever! Only place I will order Chinese from in the burbs. I live in Elgin and always make the 30 min drive. I'm very picky about my fried rice and Wu's is the only place I trust. Serving sizes are pretty large, they stuff the rice to where the box can barely close.

Food is very good and reasonably priced.  Service is quick, I jsut wish they delivered!!   Their egg rolls are outstanding!  One downfall; their chicken and broccoli is made with a clear sauce rather than a dark sauce, other than that I love their veggie fried rice, and their beef and broccoli is delicious.

Don't order the crab Rangoon, there's no filling in them.  We called to inform them of this and they responded with "we're under new management and that's how they come now."  Everything else was good, just don't appreciate them ripping me off.

I enjoyed Wu's Garden, the food was good and a very good portion for the price. We ordered moo-shoo pork and vegetable fried rice. The pork was my favorite, very good and comes with huge pancakes so no need to get extra. The rice was a little under-flavored but it was still really good. Just needed a little soy sauce. Overall, really good.
I have never had a bad meal yet. My usual is pot stickers, combo fried rice, and moo shu pork or beef and broccoli.  Service is always quick and good pricing.

Food is good, fairly priced and service is quick. It'd be even better if they delivered...but it's close to home so the drive isn't too bad. Their egg rolls are to die for, I could eat just egg rolls and be fine. Overall this is my second go-to Chinese place, only because their chicken and broccoli is made with a clear sauce rather than a dark sauce...so it's decent but not my favorite. I love their veggie fried rice however, and their beef and broccoli is delicious.

Good food, reasonably priced.

We ordered 2 types of egg rolls (regular & vegetarian), both were crispy with tasty filling.  My wife had the egg drop soup, which she said was very good, and the chicken fried rice was excellent.  I really enjoyed the yu-shan chicken.  The portions are good sized, too.

Docked a star for no delivery service.

Restaurant Review
Chinese carry out galore! You can't go wrong with Wu's garden. This has been a staple restaurant for chinese food since I liver here in Bartlett for the past 15 years. The food is always cooked to order and piping hot. The prices are good and the portions are ample. Even the left overs (which there always is) heats up nicely the following day. Staff is friendly. The best would have to the egg rolls with sweet and sour sauce. 

Pro- best egg rolls, quick service, cook to order, big portions, good prices

Con- none

Hidden deal- none

Wu's is the definition of a hidden gem. Most people will rave about the egg rolls, and rightfully so. However, people forget to mention how amazing the food is. They make fantastic, TRADITIONAL Chinese food. That means you need to forget about the orange chicken and pseudo chinerican nonsense. If you want flavorless garbage, head over to Panda's.

I personally love the hunan beef and chicken. This spicy and garlicy concoction is making me salivate right now. Fried rice is delicious, and their spicy pork is always a hit. Let's not forget about the portion sizes. 

All in all, you need to check this place out if you are in the area. Also note, there are other great places in the same strip mall.

I've tried almost everything on the menu at least twice. I can't find anything I don't like. The food is always consistent and delightful. I just wish they would deliver! Give them a shot it's well worth it.

Breading/batter ratio to protein not good. Like 75:25. Batter is too thick and hard to bite into. Bland and thin sauce for orange chicken. Vegetable delight is nothing special. Not my choice for chinese food even it's very close to our house. The staff are nice though.

I kept seeing this place on the top restaurants in my area list. After reading all the positive reviews I finally decided to give it a shot. Usually I'm not one for Chinese takeout but this place was literally 5 minutes from my house so why not. I ordered:

The egg rolls: Just about every review raved about these things and I can see why. They are like a quarter pound to half a pound per egg roll and are stuffed with Chinese barbequed pork and vegetables. I would say 3 is enough for a full lunch for me. (1.50 each)

The Beef Chow Fun: At around 10 dollars, this seemed a little pricey for Chinese takeout but I admit I was wrong...wanna know why?

 CUS THEY GAVE ME 5 POUNDS OF FOOD!!!!

I'm not joking, the dish weighed literally 4-5 pounds. After 2 giant egg rolls l could only finish like 1/6 of this massive pile of beef, noodles and veges. The flavor was good but nothing special.  The quantity of food is just absurd.
