So to sum things up, this place makes great egg rolls and giant dishes of food. If you want to get your money's worth, give this place a shot, I'm sure your belly will hate you after you stretch it like a water balloon with tasty Chinese takeout.
The food is pretty good, I've been coming here for years! One of my families go to places if nobody feels like cooking dinner.
Great local Chinese food have been going here for years of cravings. Decent prices most orders take 15 minutes to prepare. You can't go wrong with the combination fried rice.

Had Wu's for the first time tonight,  and I loved it!   We had General Tsao's Chicken,  Beef w/ broccoli,  Chicken fried rice, and Crab Rangoon. Everything was awesome!!  Found my new favorite Chinese Restaurant!

I love the food at Wu's Garden.  It is a nice family owed Chinese takeout.  It is not very expensive but the food is delicious and plentiful.  I love the face you can just order the "Chicken Nuggets" you would normally get with sweet and sour chicken.

We've gotten Wu's a few times.  We always order too much food!  If you order a full order of anything, expect to share it, including the fried rice.  The food is good, not great, but fast.  It's pick-up only, but at a very convenient location and rarely seems to be busy.  The prices are VERY reasonable.  

The Beef and Broccoli is great, but their Sweet'n Sour sauce could use some work.  It's way too sweet and loaded with pineapples.  The fried rice is full of bean sprouts, which I like, but you may not.  You have been warned.   

We got it last night and didn't even make a dent.  Holy cow, we'll be eating Chinese for a week!  But it reheats well, so I can't say that's a bad thing...

After driving by this place for a few years I decided to give this place a try. Decent Chinese food and just OK egg rolls. I have had much better tasting egg rolls and larger in size than Wu's. The pork fried rice was a huge portion and was ok. Order was ready in 10/15min. Take out only.

I've ordered food here many times. The eggrolls are very good, but I've i had a few overcooked ones. My favorite thing is the beef and tomato, The beef gravy here is good. Not too thick, not too thin. The general Tso's chicken is good, but they put too many vegetables (mostly green and red peppers). I dont like the plastic containers that chinese places are using now. I say keep using the cardboard boxes. Good fried rice too, (not awesome), but good. Good pot stickers too.

I do not typically give a fast food restaurant 5 Stars, however the customer service @ this location is amazing.  
      My food order has never been wrong.
It does not matter if you use the drive thru or dine in it is a great fast food choice. 
     I work in the area so I have eaten here many times. The service is great all day. There are also a few televisions set up for your comfort and viewing pleasure.

I usually don't have a problem with any Taco Bell location, especially this one since I frequent it quite often. But when I order a chapula and a soft taco, I'm obviously not going to be happy when I find out that I was given a burrito and a hard taco instead. Honestly, I don't care about the taco shell. Either way, I ate it. But I am mad about the burrito because that's definitely not what I ordered and not what I wanted.

Moral of the story: Check what's in your bag before you drive away.

If your visiting this store you may want to download Taco Bells new phone App. If you don't, you may die of hunger! I waited in line (which include only me, myself, and I) five minutes waiting for someone to help me, I know five minutes isn't long but for fast food service it's an eternity! There was a total of TWO people working the store for lunch on Sunday.
 After I was finally served and I sat down to eat and rest my weary feet, the food was up to par Taco Bell. I had the new big box meal, it's priced right for what you'd receive from a fast food restaurant. I will not visit this store again because of the service.
 I did dock this store 1 star for hurting my feet from standing so long waiting to give my order.

I'm not a big fan of Taco Bell but this location is within walking distance from my job so my lunch crew wants to come here every once in awhile. It's not a fancy location nor is the staff very friendly, but it gets the Taco Bell job done. 

Food here is normal Taco Bell fare and I've actually never had an issue with them forgetting items from my offer. They have added flat screen TVs (and done no other updating) but these TVs play Forever Stamps commercials like 20 times an hour...it's insane!

All in all, a decent Taco Bell location.

After walking around the streets of woodfield, I had a hankering for some burrito lovin'. It helps that The Bell, as I affectionately refer to it, always comes out with new products for me to ingest. I went with a light snack of the new burritos to tide me over until dinner. 

The drive-thru was fast and efficient. The burrito, deliciously satisfying.
I love Taco Bell, but will admit a lot of the locations vary and some are better/worse than others. This one is definitely worth going to. Always gets my order right, & the food is always consistent.
My friend Colette blacked out from the frosted lemonade it was so good. She really wants to try the frosted coffee because of the positive review, but I'm afraid it might put her into a coma.

I am a huge fan of Chick-fil-A, but this one needs some help!!

3 visits 

1: I ordered for my family and bought a kids meal. When I came home I noticed no chocolate milk with the kids meal.  

2: I ordered a few meals and a bag of cookies.  My mistake, when I get home no cookies. I talked to the manager about it and he tells me he'll send me coupons to make up for this.  Cookie bags are about $7.  Weeks go by and no coupons.  

3: I ordered today a meal with a shake in the drive through.  I specifically ask can I get a straw, which the reply is it's in the bag. Total lie. I pulled over and drove back to get one

Very disappointing and I'll write to corporate about quality control for this chick fil a.

New location just opened on Dec 4, 2014.

5 stars for being seconds from my house! 

5 stars because I Loooooove the #4: spicy chicken deluxe. Add a delicious lemonade and chik-fil-A sauce and I'm in heaven. 

Now I have a CFA by home and work. :)

Great place to take the kids. They have a nice indoor play area for the kids. Always clean, always friendly, always good food. I like they are very consistent. They are closed on Sunday, which is fine, but I forget sometimes.
Free February! Everyday they feature a free item for the month of February.  Come and get spicy chicken sandwich. It's the best, juiciest, and meatiest!
Drive thru service is really unprofessional. I heard someone say words that made think twice of coming back to this place.

Wonderful staff, great food.

The staff are so nice and the place is very clean.  I came by here for lunch one day and got a Spicy Deluxe and Small Fries, I went back to work which is about 10 minutes away and my food sat on my desk for another 30 minutes before consuming it and it was still excellent tasting. The fries were still fairly crispy, though not as much as when I had one in the car haha. 

Remember to ask for Chick-fil-A sauce.

Great place to eat I also love that they r closed on Sunday's so people can be with their family. People r really nice don't feel like ur at a fast food place. Love to read the history of how they started. Keep up the good work

The staff at this location was extremely nice.  Very well managed teen working the drive thru.  Love the spicy chicken sandwich and waffle fries.  Also I love the sauces they have too. I always get the Polynesian sauce. Yum.  Sweet and tangy.

Ask yourself a simple question: Do I like chicken breast?

If the answer is an enthusiastic yes then this place is for you. From what I have seen, this place basically runs and thrives on its many many variations of the breast of chicken. 

Examples:

Chicken Sandwich: fried chicken breast patty. 

Chicken Nugget: clearly cut pieces of chicken breast fried the same as the patty. 

Chicken breast soup: Its in the name.

Grilled Chicken Nuggets: same as fried nuggets but grilled. 

Chicken strips: Made from chicken breasts. 

Tortilla soup: probably made with chicken breast too. 

I'm sure there are more stuff that include the chicken breast on the menu. 

Some of the other stuff on their menu include waffle fries and a unique lemonade. The waffle fries I really have no opinion on, they aren't amazing nor bad. The lemonade is quite good and tastes fresh if super sugary drinks are your thing. The diet lemonade isn't as good  because one must imagine how much artificial sweetener they need to dump in to match the sweetness. 

What really stood out about this place are the service and the sauces. The service was really good for a fast food chain. They had a lady going around asking if you want your drinks refilled and the speed they crank orders out is phenomenal. 

The two sauces I tried both surprised me:

The Chick-fil-a sauce: Very similar to honey mustard with more spice added and kinda of reminds me a little bit of horseradish. 

The Polynesian sauce: I imagined it would be generic sweet and sour sauce but again, like the chick fil a sauce, has an added spice kick to it. 

These 2 condiments really stood out for me. Too bad I don't really like chicken breast that much.  

So again, if you like chicken breast, let this be your new fast food destination. I tried to be objective but personally, breast just ain't my thing. 

An above average fast food chain.
Over rated!! Its a fried chicken sandwich just like Wendy's.  Every time my sandwich was not warm.

Don't see the hype over this place.  It's almost creepy how "friendly" they try to be.  Yes their waffle fries are good, but it doesn't make up for fast food that is almost $10 a shot.  I can find better food for less - Culvers comes to mind.

Love this place! Good service and good food. Real Chix pieces, not mashed up ground Chix. Lots of healthier options for adults and even for kids meals. Grilled nuggets are an option too. Just wish portion sizes were bigger

As a Chick-Fil-A fan for years now, I have always wanted a location closer to where I live. I guess my wish has been granted!

This place just opened up a few weeks ago and the whole place is spankin' new. Staff were polite and wonderful as always. However, the place is a lot smaller than the east Schaumburg location near Woodfield. The whole interior felt cramped and crowded. It made me think of this place as sort of a "Chick-Fil-A express" place rather than the full featured location such as the one near Woodfield or down south in Elmhurst. However, all of this doesn't matter because the food here is pretty good.

Not a fan at all.  This was my first experience here and I had heard so much about this place and how they had respectable values so I decided to come here with a guy I met on Grinder.  We went through the drive through, and there was no one behind us but they were awfully pushy to get my order, I got the number 2, crispy chicken with American Cheese, and a root beer. (Never heard of american cheese on chicken it intrigued me) We could hear a bunch of woman talking to each other through the head set which made it hard to order.  We then pulled up to the window where the window woman was laughing and laughing and I'm not sure if it was at me or not but I felt like that was very unchristian of her.  I gave my money and left.  When we got home and started watching Golden Girls and opened the food and this crispy chicken was soggy as hell.  My only question is who the hell puts American Cheese on a chicken breast on general it was gross.  The fries were not that great, and my root beer didn't taste very carbonated.  I was not at all pleased with my food. Not to mention both me and my date got the runs from the food all afternoon.  I literally was making spin art all afternoon in the bathroom. And he went home and had to stop off twice to flush the demons out of him.  This was not at all good. I'm sorry you didn't live up to the hype. I was truly hoping for a great meal for the price to bring back to my AA group  but instead I found a new way to cleanse my insides.  I don't think I'll ever be back.  I hope no one else has an experience like this and it was a one time thing, although you'll keep the toilet paper industry booming!
Food is excellent everytime.  I dined in once and the employees are friendly.  Always quick service.

I decided to write a review for this place because of the cleanliness and friendliness I experienced here.  Our waitress was so smiley and friendly she made me happy just having her as a waitress! Also this restaurant is extremely clean and nicely decorated with fresh flowers on every table being a nice touch.

The food was good I had chicken pad Thai and my bf had the garlic curry duck (I think that's what it was) he wasn't too impressed with that after all of the good things he's heard about it but we both really enjoyed my chicken pad Thai.  Only complaint was we both asked for spicy and there was really no kick at all.

All in all, I would go back here when I'm in the area.

I came in for lunch today. To be honest, the place didn't look like much from the outside. It is located in a strip mall on the same side as the Coffee Haus.

I do have to give my server some props for the friendliest service in town. She brought some water while I was deciding on lunch. I ordered some Thai iced coffee which she brought over to the table fairly quickly. I ordered the spicy beef meal which is a part of their lunch special menu. Mine came with 1 eggroll (you can opt for a vegetarian eggroll), a small cup of vegetarian tom yum soup, and some veggie fried rice (or plain steamed if you wish). The tom yum soup was good and had enough veggies as well as flavors, however, I have to say that the eggroll lacked any sort of flavor. The spicy beef had a good flavor to it but it was fairly tamed when it comes to the spiciness.

The place is clean and well-decorated.  The booths are sizable so if you have 2 people sitting on each side you won't feel like you're too close to each other. The restaurant from the inside definitely does not reflect what greets you from the outside. The staff were polite and they provide efficient service. For example, my waitress brought over my bill after she delivered my main dish which I appreciate because I hate having to wait for my bill for a long time after finishing my food.

Overall, I feel like I've been to a more authentic Thai place than this. It sort of reminds me of a fusion restaurant. Maybe I just didn't try the right menu items but as it stands, I think it's a 3-star at best mostly because of the fantastic service.
Nice people and decent food.  The lunch special is good.   I have had better food and willing to pay a dollar or two more to try another restaurant.   If it is close by, give it a try.

Yummy food and delightful service. Very attentive and the food is excellent. We had Garlic Scallops and Sweet and Sour Pork, Pork potstickers and spring rolls. They serve beer, wine and cocktails! A definite plus!

This is one of my favorite Thai places because their panang curry is SO good! My only complaint is that the carryout portions are much smaller than when you dine in and you're getting charged the same price.

We visited here on a late Friday night and was so glad they opened late until 11pm because my Thai cravings were kicking in and not too many places open for dinner past 10pm. Luckily, this one was and it was nearby. 

For appetizers, we ordered the Egg Rolls $4.25 was not bad, the pieces were cut in halves. I liked the glass noodles inside and they had this nice savory, sweet dipping sauce which we cleaned out. The Tom Yum soup was $4.95 but the bowl was a bit small for the price. They did have the option to go with a larger size for more money so perhaps that will have to do next time. Also, I asked for mild spice but I should have gone with Hot because it was a bit too mild. Normally, at other places I haven't been given a choice for the level of spicy-ness for the soup so I didn't know what to chose. I chose Chicken as the meat but it's probably better to go with Shrimp next time just to complete the taste. They have many pieces of Chicken but it doesn't quite beat the Shrimp. 

As for entrees, the hubby and ordered the Pad See Ew $10.45 which was delicious and we finished it all. The Panang Chicken $10.95, came with a rice bowl and was good as well and tasted mild. I could use a little more spice so may try for a Red Curry dish next time. We bagged up the curry because we were so full. For a dinner for 2, our total came out to be $34 before tip so not a bad dinner date. Overall service was polite and courteous and the bathrooms were clean. We will definitely be back again for more Thai eats.
Pad Thai was flavorless and the chicken in the Basil Chicken and Chicken Pad Thai was rubbery. Won't be returning here.

Thai garden claims to serve authentic thai food which I really doubt! I won't ever go here again. I have never had this bad Pad thai noodles ever. Their curries are not as bad as the noodles but still, they need to work on the quantity. I believe the food here is not worth the amount you spend. The beer we ordered had already passed its expiry date!
I'd stick to Dan Thai for thai food in this vicinity.
Delicious food, nice people, clean and cozy place. Will definitely come back.

Very nice atmosphere,  lots of plants and interesting pictures and wall decor. Chicken mango special tonight. Eggs rolls come as three,  weird. Why not two or four? Service is very attentive. Mango dish was superb. I asked for medium and it was Midwest medium high spiced, good for me. Egg rolls ok, smaller variety in size, quick to cook, easier to eat.

Thai food! yum! So this place was alright, iv come here a few times. But this time I was really disappointed with the portion size. I usually come here and can never finish my plate and look forward to left overs! I came with a group of friends this time and they all got the same dish but different meats, and I think they might of given me the last bit of the noodles or something bc all of their plates were still pretty full after mine was already half done and my plate looked pretty empty compared to there's too before eating.... I didn't say anything bc it wasn't worth it but I don't think il be coming back here again after this experience. I left feeling ripped off, still hungry, and very unsatisfied.

I can't get enough of this place.  I love their tom kha soup, pineapple fried rice, and fried tofu.  This time we also got my son the kid's noodles and my husband the panang curry.  My son and I both thought the noodles were awesome.  My husband loved the curry.  It was good, but a little too spicy for me.  So to summarize, I have never gotten anything from here I did not like.  They have also averaged 10-15 mins for take out, even when they have a counter full of take out orders.  We always get take out, but the people with have that short interaction with are super nice too.

We used to love going here but today just changed that. Dining in after so long was definitely not the same and I wish we had just ordered to pick up. In addition to that the owner decided to say she remembered us and claimed we were "the restless group." This was completely insulting and started the evening off on a bad note. Then the server did a poor job as well. The peanut sauce was not even a sauce, it took forever for the food, checking in to make sure everything was great was nonexistent, and when we needed something it took forever to get the server to come to the table. After today's experience the chance of us going back is very slim.
Went there with our friends. Great ambience. Delicious food. Loved every bit of it. Definitely recommended for Thai food lovers.
Kids fried rice was horrible taste with stinking oil smell.. staff was rude and I would never go again

Trying Thai food for the first time and must say was impressed by the cuisine and the restaurant. 

The ambiance was neat and simple and the food option were plenty. Staff was courteous and service was quick. Tried the sampling platter, Veg pot sticks, basil seafood, Salmon ho mog, fried rice. All the dishes were flavorful and quantity was generous. 

They even served Indian Beer. :).

Would recommend this place for a quite and dinner/lunch which would leave you thoroughly satisfied
Great environment, great food, been to many Thai restaurants, this was one of the bests!!! No exaggeration.

I was skeptical about trying Thai food in a pizza town and being from CA I just assumed we had the best Asian joints. I was so wrong, this is the best Thai food I've had in years. 

Not fancy gourmet style, doesn't look so beautiful, but it's "shovel into your mouth repeatedly CRAVABLE".

Just like pizza, if you can snack on it cold out of the fridge the next day then it's good quality.
Broccoli Tofu was delicious!  Had the mild spicy level and was still pretty spicy but not overly so.  Egg rolls were also tasty.

Either this place has gone downhill, or my experiences at Dan Thai have spoiled me. I've been here numerous times before I had discovered Dan. Each time was a charm. Perhaps I didn't notice, or perhaps the times are tough in the garden. Everything we ordered tasted watered down.  It was as if they were trying to cut corners in every aspect of their business. The tom yum tasted of dandelions instead of Lemon grass. Loaded with cheap veggies which were difficult to eat and not cooked. The broth was basically water. No flavor. The two main entrees we ordered (1 tofu something and 1 spicy pork) had more nasty fillers than an Oscar Meyer wiener. What I mean by that is they loaded the plate up with a watered down sauce and enough cheap veggies to make a green smoothie. Honestly, I maybe had a handful of pork in my plate. Unacceptable! If I wanted veggies, I'd go to subway. Perhaps that's all is growing in the Thai Garden lately. Freaking onions and green peppers. No thanks. Never again. See you all at dan Thai.  

P.S. "Spicy" here is equivalent to Taco Bell verde sauce. Not even the mild.
The food is inexpensive and it has a light taste, the seafood is also very cheap.

I eat a fair amount of Thai food at a lot of different restaurants. Each restaurant brings a little something different to the table. In this case, I really like the Thai style spicy fried rice at Thai garden. Many of the other entrees on the menu are excellent as well however I generally go to Thai garden for my Thai style fried rice fix. It's excellent and I usually get it with shrimp. They don't skimp on the shrimp and they are well cooked. Their sauce is a little sweet a little spicy and just perfect for me. My wife generally gets the pad si yu which is excellent as well. Tom yum soup is delicious. Lunch specials are a great value and service is quick and courteous. The ambiance is actually quite nice for dinner as well.

This place was really great! We'll be back! My friend and I go to a lot of Thai restaurants in the NW SUBURBS. we always order crab rangoons as an appetizer. Theirs had the best "crust" ever! Light, not oily, very crisp and beautifully shaped.

My entree, basil chicken was delicious. Ground chicken, basil, onions, peppers and straw mushrooms. It could have been a tad spicier - next time I'll say hot not medium hot. 

We rarely get dessert but we got "baby bananas with chocolate sauce" - SO good. Kind of like a banana cannoli! Really delicious.

The server was attentive. The atmosphere was pleasant though not exceptional. 

We split the Bill - it was $23 each (we each had tea as well).  

Most excellent!
My wife and I luv this place. large selection for vegetarian/vegan food - vegetable delight with tofu or garlic tofu. We also like their dessert - sticky rice with mango. :)

all i can say is yummy!!! My favorite restaurant in the Schaumburg area!
I recommend the Pad  Thai ,Penang Curry and the  delicious soups!

Went for Sunday night dinner a few weeks ago. I have had Pad Thai at several other Thai places and never had a "red" sauce on it. Was okay, but have had better. Spring Rolls were good and service was with a smile. Won't be going back though...Will stick to the ones I know...

we asked for veg curry and they gave us with chicken.
they were arrogant on their mistake. Will skip them.

Went here with a few friends a couple days ago. I didn't know what to expect since I haven't eaten here in years. Ok, I knew what to expect, but was hoping it changed?

I waited forever for a seat, even though there were plenty of empty spots. The host told me he'd get me a table & then disappeared for a long while. Not sure where he went. I was waiting for people anyway, so I guess it didn't matter that much.

Our server was nice & friendly. Other than that, the service was super slow. Super slow to the point we all noticed. 

We ordered spicy beef, tofu panang, & combination pad thai. It wasn't good, it wasn't bad. I got the combination pad thai (chicken & shrimp) & there were like 4 pieces of shrimp. For the extra charge, I thought there would be more. I ordered the pad thai spicy, but it came out only really sweet. Not sure if that was a mistake on my part for asking it to be spicy? 

Their food was mediocre. There are def better Thai places to go to. Plus, they're pricey for the portions, but I think most Thai places are like that anyway. 

Whenever I get the urge to eat Thai Garden, I always order tom yum seafood & sometimes the squid salad carry out. The tom yum soup is probably the best thing on their menu. I can't find any other Thai place that does tom yum soup like they do! I always order it extra extra spicy with extra cilantro. Yes, it burns, but I love it.

A great family dinner, especially or Father's Day this year!! And SO GLAD we did!! Busy as usual but waiting for only a few minutes to be cleared and seated. 

Big family with grandparents totaled 8 of us and still very nicely seated with enough room and a big table for all the great food! 

Tom Kha Soup with chicken was such a great call- the chicken and vegetables were AMAZING and FRESH! Honestly the freshest chicken I've tasted in any Thai restaurant. The spring rolls were very fresh too as well as the beef satay that finished the apps. 

Pad Thai is a must, along with Massuman curry and Panang noodles. But the Basil Mussels caught my eye this time around. Great choice! Good amount of veggies and sauce. Spicy beef along with a seafood dish accompanied the carbs very, very well. Everybody got a huge portion of everything and were already stuffed- before dessert! 

Sticky rice was great!!! And you can have any kind of ice cream flavor on top! So many choices! (that's rare for Thai places!) we tried green tea and jackfruit and mango.... Along with the Thai custard was delicious. And don't forget the Thai herbal hot tea to finish off. 

After this whole dinner, the part that really was the cherry on top was talking to the owner Tom. What a great guy. A nice family business with genuine owners that spend their life at work. Nice to see the quality control and very good customer service. He stopped by the table to see how the food was and ended up talking about everything!! Great time last night, can't wait to go again!

Thai Garden and I have a strong emotional connection. Many enjoyable family gatherings, quiet dinners, and take-out meals have bonded us for life.

Veggie egg rolls, tom kha soup, fried rice (pineapple or plain old, both are delightful). All my favorites. We used to live within waking distance, and this was our go-to meal. In the weeks after my son was born, it was all I wanted to eat. 

We have since moved out of the area, and we can't find a replacement for our dear Thai Garden. Waaa. So we go whenever we're around.

The biggest ding I can think of is that they don't accept AmEx. Their bubble tea is also nothing to write home about. But neither of these factors dim the shining star that is Thai Garden.

The lunch deal is pretty good as of today its $7.95 for soup, spring roll and one entree. We had the Tom Yum soup, which was a tad spicy, right amount of tanginess and vegetables and it definitely hit the spot. The spring roll was a little over done but not too bad for a strip mall Thai food. 

I had the Penang Chicken with fried rice which was actually one of the better ones I have had. it was right amount of coconut in the curry but there was something missing that didn't develop into its full flavor, probably lack of salt or some seasoning.

We also had the Spicy chicken which was also pretty good just not as spicy as i thought as well as the gravy was on the sweeter side. 

Overall this is a pretty good place if you want a quick thai lunch for a decent price. The ambiance is good, and is tastefully decorated also area is clean and is more upscale looking than its outer simple appearance. However, the service seems rushed and and might need a little  more work on customer service.

Ive been going to this restaurant since i was born. My family has been going to this restaurant ever since. It family owned and the owners are wonderful and joyful people! The employees/waiters....can get annoying bc they don't come to the table much and we would always have to call them if we needed something. Its easily the best Thai food in Chicago. For starters, I recommend the spring rolls and tom yum vegetable soup!

Food was nothing to write home about. Or not, I'd say to not go here as the food is either bland or too salty.

Nothing really stood out in a good way. My garlic beef was tender but too salty (and i love my food salty) my thai iced coffee was way too sweet and too much milk was put in that it tasted iced condensed milk with a hint of coffee. Tofu soup was nothing special, just boiled water with veggie flavor and salt and pepper. Egg rolls? Ugh skip it. 

The only thing that was good with our dining experience was the veggie rice and ice cream.
This place is an okay restaurant to have dinner at. But the service here is too slow and they carter to the White people too much. I'm Thai myself. Like where is my Service??? Hello? ....

Nice, friendly, neighborhood Thai restaurant.

Came here for dinner, ordered the vegetable wantons for appetizer.  Contents were quite good and the crispy wanton shell contrasted nicely with the texture of the filling.  The accompanying sauce was also quite fitting, although a little on the sweet side.  

For meals we tried the staple pad thai in both chicken and tofu varieties.  The chicken and tofu were well cooked, however the noodles for both dishes were slightly overdone.  The sauce was applied a little too liberally and the sweetness of the dish was slightly overpowering.  

I also prefer a more traditional style of separating the ingredients for the pad thai, but here the bean sprouts and peanuts were pre mixed.  The dish was accompanied with fresh lime which was a nice touch, however the limes were nearly dry.

Ambiance was clean and pleasantly a bit on the formal side, with interesting art adorning the walls.  Service was very friendly, almost overly respectful, unfortunately it was not attentive.  We never had water refills and after finishing it took about 10 minutes for the server to notice, despite the fact that the restaurant was nearly empty.

All in all, not bad.  The food was decent and the staff was nice, but with a plethora of Thai food in the area, this one doesn't start at the top, but probably warrants another try to see if their more traditional Thai food fits the bill a little better.
This place is always my go to. They have very yummy food and reasonable pricing. The staff is very nice! Definitely recommend!
really good place to have lunch! They got a lunch special and the food is very good considering where the store is located! Don't let the store outlook foul you guys!

Just had lunch at Thai Garden and can't help but rave about this place. First of all the service is incredibly fast and the service is outstanding. 

We ordered the Panang tofu lunch, spicy tofu lunch, and pad Thai lunch. The lunch specials are $7.75 each and they come with rice, egg roll, and soup..... An AMAZING bargain. They huge a huge quantity of food leaving you thoroughly satisfied at the conclusion of your meal. 

As far as taste..... I was blown away by the spicy tofu lunch special. It was spicy, light, and had a wonderful combination of vegs and flavor. The tofu was well marinated and sauted perfectly. The Panang curry had a light coconut cream sauce that was also wonderful. 

Overall the service and food were excellent. They constantly checked on us keeping drinks topped off and kept the table clear. On top of that....the food was awesome. Definitely will be back again.

For all the Thai restaurants around the suburban area, this is our favorite place to go.  I can't believe I haven't given my review for this establishment, maybe subconsciously I don't want the whole world to know about how good the food taste here, LOL!
Thai Garden is located within a strip mall so there's plenty of parking.  I've been going here for years and when we try out new Thai places, we compare our dishes with this place.
When you go into the restaurant, it's a pretty good size.  There are some sections of the place that are divided with half walls.  It's pretty cozy with booths and tables, even for a big group they are so accommodating and they have a very nice staff.  One time I had my GNO (Girls Night Out) here and they put us chatty gals in the back of the room so it felt like we had our own private room, so nice of them.
The dishes are served like family style, enough to share and have leftovers.  Unless you brought a BIG appetite  It does get busy during the lunch rush hours and weekends, so I usually come here for dinner during the week.  
So here are the dishes we usually order again and again...
We start off with a tall glass of Thai iced coffee or Thai iced tea which both is sweet and creamy.
For appetizers, we order their fresh Spring Rolls which is steamed soft rice paper rolled with rice noodles, fresh cucumbers, basils, cilantro, and bean sprouts. You get 3 pcs with hoisin sauce on the side which includes crush peanuts.  
Sometimes I order a small Tom Yum Chicken soup which is a traditional Thai lemon grass soup (spicy and sour) with chicken, straw mushrooms, and tomatoes. It's a good alternative of the old fashion Chicken Soup if you're under the weather.  I highly recommend if you make this as your main meal, ask for a large with noodles (thin noodles like pad Thai) which makes this a spicy chicken noodle soup, good stuff sniff, sniff!  
For our main meals, we order Curry Fried Rice combinations with chicken and shrimp.  It's one of their chef's special fried rice with yellow curry sauce, coconut milk, eggs, onions and carrots so good. 

For a noodle dish, I'd order Beef or Chicken/Shrimp Pad Thai.  It's a platter of delicious thin rice noodles stirred in their homemade sweet and tangy Pad Thai sauce, with eggs, ground peanut, fresh bean sprouts, and green onions.  If I wanted a little bit of heat, I would ask the server to get me some Thai chili sauce which comes in a little container that you can see the red sauce and pepper seeds with a little spoon making my Pad Thai sweet and spicy

My husband's favorite dish which he can't find it made like this anywhere!  It's a traditional Thai yellow curry blended with coconut milk, potatoes and onions with chicken or a combo chicken/shrimp.  It comes with a side of white rice.

Another dish my friend introduced me (I'd order this when I'm in the mood to eat with my hands) is called Larb Kai.  It's a made with ground chicken breast seasoned with lime juice, onions, Thai herbs and spices.  It's so good to eat this with an order of Sticky Rice.  With cleaned hands, I would take some sticky rice and roll it into a size of a golf ball and eat some of the Larb Kai the then the sticky rice ball I created, and then repeat.  Of course you can use a spoon and fork but it's more fun using what God gave you, natural utensils...your hands and fingers, lol!

Overall, if you want good authentic Thai food come here, you won't be disappointed at this place!
being a vegetarian I always left with 2-3 choices in almost all good restaurants but Thai Garden server almost all dishes in vegetarian too. Must try their soup and Hot Panag Curry

Lunch special comes with small bowl of vegetable Tom yum soup, an egg roll and your meal. I ended up getting the spicy beef. Tastes great. Mildly spicy yet sweet. Soup was awesome but the egg roll was ok.

Stumbled upon this place when my boyfriend and I took our car for service at the dealer we go to. It's right across the street where the Zeigler car dealer is at. I love Thai food and was also craving it so I decided to give this place a try. We both ordered lunch specials and it comes with soup of your choice and also an eggroll. The Tom Yum soup is good but thought it wasn't spicy enough in my opinion. Thai ice tea was a little too sweet..The place itself is quite big and clean.Overall great service . Lunch for two around $22. The portion is big as well , I couldn't even finish my pad Thai and I had to get a box !

Just moved to the area and wanted to try out this restaurant. Overall, it was pretty good. The food quality was about a three/five, which is decent, but I gave it a fourth star for the nice staff and atmosphere. I had the Tom yum soup and pad se eiw, both had good flavor and were served hot. It wasn't the best Thai food ever but it hit the spot. The restaurant is decorated with many lovely paintings and other ornaments. The staff here was also very nice and attentive.

We've pretty much always had a pleasant experience here. 

My favorite dish is the Popeye Tofu. It's a pretty simple concept--tofu, spinach, and peanut sauce--but their version is AMAZING. The tofu is crispy and flavorful. It's like it has its own flavor. The spinach is fresh. The peanut sauce, orgasmic. And they give you a LOT of it. In fact, I think this is the only time I ever get enough peanut sauce at a Thai restaurant :). Have to give 'em five stars based on this dish alone.

Sometimes I get the Tom Kha soup and the Tofu Pad Thai. Tragically, I can't recommend the Pad Thai, it just doesn't measure up--especially compared to the flavor bomb that is the Popeye. It's a bit tart, a bit savory, a hint of other flavors, but in the end, bland.

The place has a nice quiet ambiance and good service. One time though, they misheard me and initially served me the Pepper Tofu instead of Popeye. So make sure you enunciate :P. I've never had the smoothies because Coffee Haus, the place with the best smoothies, is just a few doors down.

Thai Garden looks unassuming in the strip mall, but that just means it's a hidden gem. The decor is typical of most Thai restaurants I've been; we felt comfortable here. The menu is extensive, covering any type of meat or flavor you would want in Thai food. I had such a hard time deciding, nearly choosing to blindly land my finger on any choice. Luckily, I thought it through and ordered the Basil Tofu. I wish I had gotten broccoli to replace the onions and peppers, and I hoped for more sauce to dredge my rice in. However! This was a great dish with fantastic basil-y flavor. I was perfectly pleased to scarf this down. My sister got one of the house specials with salmon (forgot the name), which was really great as well. I would definitely go back here next time I find myself out at Woodfield Mall. I think there's curry in my future.

My only negative, which is more of a comment than a complaint, is that the portions are smaller than I'm used to at a Thai restaurant, though the prices are the same. This may be because it's near Chicago and is competitive to the area? Or I'm a spoiled fatty who loves too much food? Doesn't matter, I'm still heading back here. Flavor over price in this case.

Thai Garden standards are falling... Green Curry Tofu is usually mind-blowing and they have maintained consistent quality for years. The last 2 times I got it from them, it's been watery and diluted. Please don't cut corners and ruin your brand. Increase your price but never decrease quality. I will probably complain to the owners on my next visit.

Red Curry is still good and Garden Fried Rice is awesome.

Had lunch there and the place was clean and the service was great. I ordered a lunch special that came with soup and egg roll. I chose the Tom-Yum soup and could not eat it because it was so oily the grease was sticking to the side of the cup. The egg roll was your standard out of the box, drop in hot oil and serve. Nothing special about the egg roll.

My entree was Tiger shrimp in a ginger sauce. It was to come with onions, mushrooms and red peppers. I cannot eat peppers and was about to ask if they could substitute a different veggie but I realized before I asked that the menu said no substitutions. I understand the policy and just requested it without the red peppers. Well, I admit I like stir fried onions but not when it becomes the most dominant feature on the plate. Perhaps they were trying to compensate for me requesting no peppers but to load me up with a plateful of onions was not the way to do it. Perhaps maybe a few pieces of broccoli or carrot would have been nice. The garlic sauce, shrimp and rice were good so perhaps I will give this another try in the future.

Went in on a weekday. There was only one server taking care of all of the tables so needless to say, service was a little bit turtle time but she was nice enough and had good attitude. 

Ordered the salmon ma hog house special. I asked to have it mild but she said it's pre made and that it was just little bit spicy so I went with it but it was too spicy for me!!! Plus the salmon was very dry and flaky. I've had this dish much better at other Thai places.

Tom yum soup was delicious and generous on the jumbo shrimpies!

Beef salad had waaaaay too much onions. It was 90% raw yellow onions and 10%bf and qcumber n tomato. Otherwise tasted pretty good.

Spring rolls- below average.

Pad thai wasn't what I expected it to be. Loaded in too much red sauce and not traditional . Appetizers and sampler were good but they did burn shrimp roll. Would use this as an emergency spot but not come again

fun place to sit down and eat with some friends. it was a weekend evening and not too filled. we ordered a variety of foods from the restaurants different meat/vegetarian options. The food was wonderful, authentic, and fresh. The Thai Ice Tea is famous among our friend group! we are very pleased and would come again.
Food is good and pretty consistent. The fried rice and noodles are delicious. It is a good alternate to Dan thai.
The food is OK but not great. Portion is very small. I had to stop by McDonalds after. Over priced. Not enough staff, we had too wait a long time to get our meal. Plenty of parking.

I went here for lunch the other day.  I saw they had okay ratings, so I wasn't expecting too much.  I still left disappointed.  The table had a plastic cover on it that was sticky.  If anything screams "not clean here!" that would be it.  But I was meeting someone for lunch, so I decided to deal with it.  It also took a while to get any service.  Everyone was just standing around.  We had to ask to order.  It was also sticky hot in here... and I am the type of person who is always cold!

We both got the lunch special which comes with tom yum soup and an egg roll.  The soup was like spicy water with some cabbage thrown in.  Not the Tom yum I love.  The egg roll was a tiny probably from the freezer version.

My dish was pretty good.  I got the Curry chicken with fried rice.  The fried rice was a pretty lame excuse for fried rice if I have ever seen one.  My dining partner did not really enjoy his spicy beef.

When we were leaving, we ordered two Bubble Teas to go.  I started drinking my Honey Dew Bubble Tea in the car and it tasted off.  First of all, they did a crappy job blending it.  It did not taste like Honey Dew.  Then I got to the tapioca balls and they tasted metallic.  I was afraid of getting food poisoning, so I chucked it.

I will not be returning here ever!

Never order from this restaurant --- ESPECIALLY THROUGH "Takeout Runners".

We ordered for a birthday event and it took TWO HOURS for them to get our food delivered. When we called to complain and asked for our money back, they apparently couldn't muster more than a $20 refund (this order was over $100). 

We tried to call several times to complain, but the phones were non-responsive -- This is AFTER the lunch rush.

After already stating they weren't charging us a delivery fee, they reinstated it after the $20 refund. 

It's now 2pm. We STILL don't have our food. We will NEVER order from this place again. WORST RESPONSE to upset customers I have ever seen. 

***EDIT***: Our food finally came and it was cold and stale.

Awesome lunch specials for under $10 including tax!  I came with a coworker around 11:40am and we were seated right away.  Service was quick and the food was tasty.  I ordered the panang beef entree and all lunch specials come with either fried rice or steamed rice, tom yum soup (spicy or mild), AND a decent sized spring roll.  The panang was perfectly flavored and the level of spicyness  was just right.  It had a nice kick but not burn- your- mouth-for -10 minutes hot.  Portions are good sized but I ate all of mine since I'm greedy! I can't wait to come back for more.
This was not good good at all. I had the pad Thai and it was horrible it was it was too many peanuts and the chicken taste like it was out of the can. Only get the Thai tea and walk away.
Panang curry and pad see ew are my favorites. It's my go to Thai spot in NW suburban area.

I've lived in Schaumburg my whole life (not sure if that's something to be proud of or embarrassed by...) and this is without a doubt my family's favorite Thai restaurant in the area. The staff always recognize us when we come in.

I will admit, the service can sometimes be unpredictable here, it has fluctuated through the years. Sometimes it takes a little too long for the food to come out. But in my opinion, I'm able to overlook that from time to time because the food is SO delicious.

Our favorites at Thai Garden include the Tom Kha soup (with or without chicken), Panang Curry, Garlic Chicken, Garlic Tofu, Chicken Satays, Popeye Tofu, Pineapple Fried Rice, and /of course/, the Pad Thai. My mom swears by their Pad Thai, and has never found the dish anywhere else that could compare.

Thai Garden is also great for lunch. Their lunch specials are really reasonable, and come with a lot of food. You get soup and an eggroll in addition to the dish of your choice served with fried or white rice. A very good deal.

I will agree with other reviews that say the service is "meh" at times, but the food is so delicious and reasonably priced, it's worth it.

I have come here and on and off and I used to think everything was pretty decent til I stopped coming last October.  The food is at most OK....nothing all that impressive.  However, the food was not really the reason I stopped coming. 

Last fall I was at the restaurant when, ate my food and paid my bill.  I left a decent tip but the waitress did NOT do much at all.  However, at the end of my dinner she comes up to me in front of my friends and she asks me if she did anything wrong that warranted her a small tip.  That was not only unnecessary but also very embarrassing.  I got so angry that I wanted to talk to a manager, but decided instead of doing I'm just gonna walk away, never show up and warn other people who decide to go there and get embarrassed by the waitresses who may do to you what happened to me.

NO single place will allow their waitresses to do what she did to me that night.  I paid a very fair amount for the work she did and she had the nerve to call me out in front of all my guests.  That is very non-business like and extremely rude.

So just be careful about the people who provide you service there.
Love this place. They are very nice, the restaurant is very clean, and their Pad Thai is sooooo yummy.

I stopped in here about a year ago, after a haircut. 

I had my standard Tom Kha Kai and it was excellent.  

The waitstaff was swift and nice, the prices were reasonable and the food was good. 

'Nuff said!

It's been a long time (five years?!?) since I reviewed this restaurant, so time to put in an update.

We've been coming here for a long time and the service and food quality is always great!  They do all levels of spice on their dishes - but you need to make sure to explain how hot you want it, because at times they tend to 'under-spice' a dish.  

I asked for something 'medium-spicy' on this visit and it came out without any heat at all.  They fixed it when I pointed it our, though.

Still great five years later!
Food was good.  Has the spicy fried rice and some curry.  Service was lacking.  Not to attentive.

I am so glad my husband had a craving for Thai food! Yum!

The service was fast, the drinks were delightful, and the food was wonderful. My husband ordered a curry dish, I had the sweet and sour pork. The meat was tender and well-seasoned, the veggies were not too soft or squishy, and we both left comfortably full with some leftovers.

Only complaint? It was a tad pricey. For the two of us, it ended up being about $50, for an appetizer, two meals, and two drinks (non-alcoholic). More than I expected for Thai food, honestly. We'll come back, but not as soon, because of that.

My butt. My butt. My butt is on fire. I don't need no water let that motherf*cker burn. 

Seriously spicy. Like, they're not f*cking around and you need to have your god damn game face on. As a practically professional heat-seeker, I always opt for the highest spice level at restaurants and then on top of that I ask for it extra, extra whatever that spice number is. Today, I met my motherf*cking match. 

I frequent the Korean CoffeeHaus just a few doors down from Thai Garden (Duchess status, yo!) but had yet to make it in to Thai Garden because my usual CoffeeHaus date has some sort of inexplicable beef with them. So for the past year I just drooled as I looked across the parking at Thai Garden and thought about all that spicy basil tofu going uneaten by me. Today, I decided to take the necessary steps to go forth with my personal goal to get some Thai Garden in my gubby, despite the (IMO unwarranted) badmouthing by my coffee mate. 

I dined alone, which has become the norm for me since my boo hates going out to eat (weird, right?) and I usually eat at off hours so when I say that I dine alone, I mean I'm almost always the only one in the restaurant who isn't employed by said establishment. I don't mind eating alone and for the most part, I enjoy doing most things in life by myself just because I know it won't involve any sort of compromise on my part. Seeing movies, going shopping, exercising, etc-- Lone wolf status is how I like to play it, but today, well... today I wished I'd gone in with some sort of buddy system after getting a taste of Thai Garden's spice level. I could have used a friend to coach me through my nose running into my mouth and my lips burning and swelling from the heat but because of my hermit habits, I was left sitting in an empty restaurant with my face on fire, envisioning how badly my butt was going to pay later for what my mouth was feeling now, but I still tried to play it off like a man while mentally chanting a monk-style mantra to get me through the pain. 

***
Don't ask for milk. 
Don't ask for water. 
Don't ask for anything.
Don't be a p*ssy.
Work through the pain. 
You don't need a second napkin.
Just hold the rice in your mouth. 
Breath.
Cornucopia of calm.
Feed the spicy stuff to the back of your throat. 
Don't show the waitress your weakness. 
Stay golden, PonyBoy.
Power through. 
***

I made it about a third of the way through my absolutely GIANT extra, extra spicy basil w/tofu dish before I asked for a box. I think I did pretty well considering I'd started with a bowl of Tom Yum soup with tofu as well. The soup was delicious and as a person who is pretty much addicted to lemongrass, I would say the flavor of Thai Garden's tom yum was one of my favorites, though I do wish the portion was a bit bigger. And again, that spicier-than-a-motherf*cker basil w/ tofu was a giant-ass dish. Defo enough for 2.5 meals. My one critique for the spicy basil would be that the tofu was cut in long strips about 1-inch by 2.5-inches and was awkward to eat and wouldn't cut well with just a fork like at most places, also, I love to be able to pour or scoop some of the juice from the dish onto the rice, but the way theirs was plated made it very difficult, at time making the dish taste a bit drier than I like. 

Overall I'd say that both my dishes were good, though beyond the spice level of the basil dish, there wasn't anything that I'm ready totally gush about. But again, I got to give it up to them for having the balls to spice a dish up like that for an unfamiliar to them gringo. Normally when I ask for the crazy spices restaurants take one look at this pale white girl and give me some sissy sh*t, so I LOVED that Thai Garden stepped it up and set my ass on fire.

This Thanksgiving, I'm thankful that I get to work from home on the day after eating at Thai Garden. The 'Ocupado' sign on my bathroom door will be working overtime tomorrow while my butt plays the crying game.

Not great, not terrible. Just so so. 

I guess I've never had curry before. It always looked and smelled delicious, so I thought I would give it a try. Perhaps it wasn't this restaurant's fault, but I was just not impressed. It wasn't anything spectacular and it just seemed like I was spooning a somewhat-spicy soup over rice. And for the price, it just didn't seem like a valuable meal. I had a lot left over, but I didn't even think it worth taking home for leftovers.

My date had some sort of shrimp plate over vegetables, and I think if he had been any hungrier than he was, it would have been severely disappointing considering the price and the tiny size of the entree.

Yum!  

My husband and I have been on an adventure lately to try new foods.  We decided on this place after seeing it when we left coffee haus. 

First off, I ordered a green tea bubble tea.  For 3.75 I would rather have it here than next store.  It was delicious. 

I ordered the popeye chicken for dinner. It was not what I expected, but still really good. It said it was spicy next to the description, but was actually very sweet.  I'll try something else next time. 

My husband got the spicy noodle dish and asked for it extra spicy. It had a little kick to it, but it was nothing to drink a gallon of milk over.  


We will definitely return to try some more dishes!

I thought my local Thai place was pretty good, but when I friend suggested we meet for dinner at Thai Garden, I figured it would be good to compare.  My friend had Chicken Pad Thai which she liked, but frankly from looking at it, I think CK Pad Thai in Carol Stream might do that particular dish a bit better.   But the Tofu Green Curry here  was outstanding-- the best I've ever had!
The reviews were more favorable than the actual food. Pad Thai was okay. Cashew Chicken had very little flavor.
Good service.  Nice location and atmosphere. Food was not the best.  It could be what I ordered too: veggie curry and spicy tofu noodle. Worth a try.

Tom yum soup - 5 stars
Pad Si-ew - 5 stars
Lad Na.. Yuk yuk yuk!!!!! 0 star
The service was just okay...just like any other typical Asian restaurant.  Lad Na was the new dish that we tried this time, and we got really disappointed by how nasty it was.  I would only go back for Tom Yum soup and Pad Si-ew.  Scared to try new dish from there now...
My best neighborhood Thai place. They cater to special needs of vegetarians. The currys are awesome.

Went with a few friends. Our server wasn't friendly at all! She had no smile, and kept interrupting our conversation asking ''have you guys decided yet? now? now?'' Very annoying! 
The food was ok. My advice to you guys- Don't order the appetizers. The ones that are supposed to be deep fried felt like they've been re-friend 2-3 time. It was filled with oil and disguising! The main courses was ok. Like any other Thai place. The noodles in my Panang noodle were all stuck together and felt like I was eating a large piece of horribly thick noodles. Eww..

I am vegetarian and this place please my senses.  I ordered spring rolls which are fresh with a good taste after dipped in the sauce.   The red curry is delicious.  It is a good place to eat healthy and tasty.

Incredibly flavorful food. I work in the same  plaza and among all the restaurants within it, Thai Garden is hands down our sole go-to when stranded at without food. 
We've all developed a dangerous taste for the spicy fried rice  I can't even remember what else on the menu I've had at this point, which isn't much. 
My only complaint might have to be the pricing/portion. While I will agree with the saying, "you get what you pay for" I'm sometimes left feeling I didn't. Though the flavor is outstanding, I'm sometimes left feeling like i want more because the dishes tend to be heavy on rice and minimal on the substance. At a few dollars more than most Asian restaurant lunch specials, you also get more than just a few bites less. Though I struggle to give this place the 4, I'm a sucker for great flavor. Plus, I've never dined in, so, benefit of the doubt.

This just may be the best Thai I have ever had.  Like, ever.

I was in the mood for Thai, and since it's so close to my home, I decided to take the S.O. here for dinner.  SO is not an adventurous eater; he likes burgers, pizza, fried chicken, Taco Bell, Doritos, and other assorted boyfood.  It's not common that he lets me take him out of his comfort zone by coming to an ethnic restaurant, so I was hoping that he would enjoy himself.

The atmosphere was a little dim, but also cozy.  Our server couldn't have been nicer or more attentive; I never had to ask for refills of my iced tea or flag her down for the check.  I ordered the Tom Yum veggie soup and the shrimp/chicken Pad Thai (medium spicy, because I'm a wimp), and he ordered the beef Pad Thai (mild).  All of our food came very quickly, in less than 10 minutes.  The Tom Yum soup was pretty good, with just enough spiciness to tickle my throat.  I would definitely order it again, especially if I had a cold.  The Pad Thai....wow! :-)  It was a nice blend of spices, veggies, tender sliced chicken, huge shrimp, and just a smattering of peanuts.  I've been to other restaurants, even Thai restaurants, in which the Pad Thai was covered in peanuts like a sundae.  I'm not much for peanuts and can only tolerate them in small doses.  So I really appreciate that Thai Garden focuses on the meats and spices and not so much on the peanuts (thank you!)

And the servings are huge!  So huge that I could only eat half of my order.  But at least I have the other half for lunch tomorrow!  (Yayee!)

My SO enjoyed his beef Pad Thai, and cleaned his plate.  He still has his preferences, but he enjoyed the food, atmosphere, and service enough to want to return again.

As for me, I will most definitely come back.  Especially for the lunch specials!  Bravo, Thai Garden!

Order Green Papaya Salad, Pad Thai or Curry Dish, and Thai Iced Coffee.

Food is spicy, authentic, and approachable.

Best Thai Food in the burbs that I've had so far.
The food is 1 star. Yeck. But the place is nice, so that bumps it a star up.

Had pretty good curry dishes here many times. Decided to try something new and ordered basil duck from the chef's specialty list. Disappointed on the first look, too much onion on the plate, sauce was watery. I love onion and don't mind eating a little more of it. But the proportion was just too much. Duck, not that good either. Tough and chewy. Only 1 or 2 pieces were okay. Basil flavor wasn't really there. The other dishes we ordered were way too sweet. Maybe just one of those chef's bad days. I will come back but maybe just for the curry dishes. Panang chicken is one of my favorites here.

Went back to try something else, I had the:

Tom Yum Vegetable Soup: still great, still fun to look at (See picture). Sweet, tangy, sour, salty, and light. 

Lad Na Seafood: if you like Chinese Ho Fun this is basically the same thing. Wide rice noodles cooked with squid, shrimp, broccoli, and scallops and covered in this thick gravy. (see picture) It tasted pretty darn good and wasn't short on tasty bits of seafood.  

Overall I'd up  this place from my last review of 3 stars to 3 and a half for consistency in good food. If your into Thai food, definitely give this place a go!

It was like an oasis in a frozen tundra landscape...one of my favorite memories of this restaurant was when we came here after driving 40 miles from Midway after picking up my sister-in-law with my wife, and ended up ordering almost half the menu.  This place may not be tops as far as making the best pad thai, or spicy basil chicken , but I think they do a good enough job at everything to earn themselves 3 stars.

Today we got the usual - Shrimp roll app, extra spicy pad thai chicken for me, extra spicy basil chicken(sliced not ground) for Mel, and ordered the spicy chicken fried rice as an extra, just because.  When I got home, the first thing I saw was the clear top of the container of fried rice, which had ground chicken on top of it.  Almost flipped my lid, because I thought they put ground chicken into my wifes dish.(I hate that more than she does).  But I called and asked them to describe the fried rice's appearance, and that was what they gave me, apparently.  Turned out to be pretty good, it just didn't look like was I expected

One thing my wife noticed when I got home from ordering out was that on the receipt my name was spelled Keigh.  That was one of the funnier spellings of Keith we've seen, and we've seen a lot. 

Just like Yelp says, A-OK.

My party had 2 apps, fried rice, panang noodles, and pad Thai. All were absolutely delicious and served on  time by a very skilled, friendly waitress. I would definitely recommend Thai Garden to anyone. I actually just regret it took me so long to get around to trying it. Will definitely return.

Me and my husband tried shrimp satay what was just ok . Panang chicken was good , spice level was perfect for us. We also ordered Spicy chicken which was horrible , didn't able to finish it even . Will try some other place next time.

I've been eating here, and from here, since they opened at this location. My kids have grown up eating this Thai food. I was so disappointed at the level of cooking and service on our recent visit. The food was bland, preparation shortcuts were taken, the service level was lackluster and not of traditional Thai good humor and smiles. I am so sad that I need to go find another Thai restaurant to make my home away from home.

Two people recommended this restaurant for the best Thai food in the area. We were beyond disappointed. I asked the waitress for recommendations and she suggested the fried red snapper and any of the fried rice. She said pad Thai also popular. 
My tiny potion of fish was swimming in a red sugar syrup. Really. I have never had such a sweet entree. I ate a lot of plain rice to dilute the sugary taste left in my mouth 
My husband tried the pineapple fried rice. The rice was undercooked and the whole dish had absolutely no flavor. It was as if they were cooking for picky children. We returned pineapple rice and requested the pad Thai. Hubby took one bite and was done. Had zero flavor and was mushy. 
We threw down some money and made a beeline for Wendy's for a quick bite. 
I don't know what happened. Maybe the regular chef was not there. But it was so terrible that we won't give it another try.

Amongst the sea of Thai restaurants located all over the Chicagoland area, I appreciate that Thai Garden created their own dishes using Thai flavors that are unique. One dish, Popeye Chicken, uses the peanut satay sauce and chicken and is served over spinach and rice. It's a great combination for those who like Thai peanut sauce. The other dish is one in particular that I highly recommend is their Spicy Fried Rice. The name will be misleading because you won't think anything of it but it's definitely distinctive. They took traditional Thai fried rice and topped it with ground chicken which has been stir fried with a chili sauce. It's a sweet and spicy combination that's really good. Both of these dishes cannot be found anywhere else. 

Save room for dessert because there is one dessert at Thai Garden that you won't see often at a Thai restaurant, Coconut Ice Cream with Sticky Rice. The combination sounds crazy but you have to try it. It's ice cream made from young coconut served alongside Thai sticky rice which has been cooked with coconut milk and sugar. It's the perfect complement to finish the meal since it isn't too sweet. 

Thai Garden does a good job of offering good customer service and a Thai inspired atmosphere that keeps customers coming back for more. The interior is decorated with a lot of traditional Thai art pieces. Their weekday lunch specials are a great option for lunch meetings if you work around the area.

Love coming here! Always good and always consistent. We typically get the chicken pad Thai one hot and the garlic beef one hot. They are sooooo good!!! The potstickers are good, so is the crab Rangoon and the egg rolls are amazing! Their hot sauce is so good too! We just love coming here
Starter soup was bland egg roll was good. The cashew chicken was a bit bland for me. I loved the rock and roll playing at lunch.

This is one of the only restaurants we have been ordering from for years!  The quality of food is top notch.  We usually take out now (due to young children) and orders are ready quickly.  So far, have never sent anything back and have never had any complaints.  Keep up the terrific work, Thai Garden!  We need you!

We go there every week. Every dish we've tried, we really enjoyed. Because we go there as often as we do, the owners have come to know us well. The female owner is so wonderfully friendly and always makes sure we are well taken care of. 

We love their pad thai, chicken egg rolls, lad na, panang curry, garlic chicken, tom yum soup, and pineapple fried rice!

I've been going to Thai Garden for lunch since they opened in 1997 and am completely hooked on the Chicken Pad Thai special.  A huge plate of yummy noodles mixed with tender chicken, chopped green onion, crunchy bean sprouts, ground peanut and egg.  I've tried to recreate it at home but there's something unique in their sauce!  The lunch special includes mild wonton or spicy soup and a regular crispy pork or vegetable egg roll.  So delicious, I could eat here every day.

Excellent service, simple decor and large menu selection keeps me coming back for more.  I wish they would open a location in the southwest suburbs!

This is our family's go-to Thai place.  Fantastic food, friendly service, and reasonable prices.  All their ingredients are fresh, and we've never had anything from them that hasn't been delicious.  They make a terrific Tom Yum soup, and their Red Curry is great.  Our wallets are just not big enough otherwise we'd order triple what we normally order.

Good food, reasonable prices and good service. I always get the Tom yum soup here. Like others mentioned, it is in a strip mall and one might easily pass on but it is definitely worth a visit.  This place is also convenient because it is open late. Last month my roommate and I were here for a to go order and they had just closed the kitchen. The chef noticed us as he was leaving and he went back into the kitchen and got us our food before closing! That definitely felt great. Eat in or take out, this place has never let me down.

I really enjoyed everything about this place.  I was visiting the Chicago area with a group and everyone was in the mood for Thai.  The staff was very friendly and attentive. The food was glorious.  If you ordered it not-to-spicy, it was not-too-spicy, and if you ordered it spicy, it was spicy. This is actually very important to me.  I hate ordering something spicy and having it be either so hot I can't even breathe or so mild that I feel cheated.  I wish this restaurant were near where I live....

Thai Garden is our favorite thai food place hands down. Our favorite dishes are chicken pad thai and Roast Duck Curry. They have the best pad thai I've ever had- perfect combination of sweet and sour flavors. Service is super nice as well- they have a little real flower on every table ;)

If you want "Mexican" for cheap, this is where you go. I will admit that their seasoned ground beef for the tacos is quite tasty, and I like the fact that you can use as many sauce packets as you like. For those with dairy intolerance you can substitute the cheese from Pico De gallo on some of the offerings. Value meals are usually no more than $6.

Only thing I would improve is the speed of the service. Sometimes it takes as long as 25 minutes to get an order out. Other than that, recommended place for inexpensive dining.

Sitting here for over 30 minutes and still haven't had a chance to even order. If I wasn't stuck in the drivethru, I'd be gone already. I could literally have made my own tacos in this time. Again, it'll be at least 45 minutes before I even ORDER because four people are still ahead of me. This pace is pathetic. Step it up, Taco Bell. This has been far too much of an annoyance for far too long.

WOW!! They I got home and realized they forgot two things in my order! The manager, Leslie, was extremely rude and hung up on me when I called and asked for them to do something to correct their mistake.

WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!! I have never hoped a business would go under so that a new owner would take over, but yeah... I do here, lol.

Their not even worth that one star, went inside at 9:50pm they close at 10 for dine in and no one acknowledged us. Then went to drive thru and asked for a sprite and Baja blast and they gave us a Sierra Mist and fruit punch!!!! Like what the freak and on top of that asked for some hot sauce and they gave us freaking 1 packet for like 6 items. Very disappointed, Taco Bell needs to do better

I come here all the time. I'm sad to say that this past visit here was very unpleasant. The customer service sucked so bad!! I asked Jesus M. for extra sauce because I had more than one taco and  he gave me the biggest attitude and was very nasty towards me. I don't even feel safe to eat the food i bought just because his attitude towards me.

Every time I come here I sit for about 20-30 minutes. Management really needs to figure out what's going on here. It's been like this for over a year. I keep my fingers crossed that today will be different and it never is. The next one is about 15 minutes from here. Making a complaint on the website whenever I get the hell out of this drive-thru!

COMPLETELY INCOMPETENT WORKERS MANAGER INCLUDED. Even after taking 40 minutes in the drive thru with only 3 cars ahead of me, they over charged me, gave me the completely wrong food, and when i called , they said next time they wouldnt mess up my order... Wont be returning here ever. It doesnt take 40 minutes to make tacos, in that case i could have cooked at home .

I haven't even eaten my food yet bc I've been in the drive through for 20 MINUTES!!! No apology. Nothing. Still waiting for food now that I am finally at the window. The line was only 4 cars deep when I pulled up. Terrible. Just pulled away and still no apology for the wait.

What can I say TB?!? Your chicken quesadillas do not disappoint... The rest of the menu??? Ay caramba! 

2 stars for chicken quesadilla and sausage crunch wrap country style. 

Great location on Golf rd, nearby other restaurants, and other shops. However, I'm definitely not a fan of fast food restaurants except Portillos. So sorry for the low ratings. I just wish that fast food joints used better quality foods. 

Can't go wrong with TB late night though so I can't hate =)

WORST Taco Bell I've ever been to. Terrible customer service employees are rude. An employee was starting his shift and he cut a customer to make an order before his shift started. Don't waste your time here....

If I can give them 0 star, I would! Their drive tru sucks! I'm still in my car waiting to get my order in and it has been more than 30mins. There was 3 cars ahead of me. Wtf is taking so long? And you know what sucks? You are stuck in the drive tru coz there's no way out! I'm telling you, if there's even one car ahead of you, don't stop by!!! If you value your time. Not worth it!
This is the worst food I've ever had in the northwest suburbs.. The food is very salty and they always mess up my order!!! But I will never eat here again.

(note: Laura is my half-sister who went to the drive-thru with her boyfriend Pedro to pick up my food.  She will write about her experience, and then I'm gonna tell you about my thoughts. Cannot believe this!! I am so upset yo)

Laura: Around 12:40pm today, we went to the drive-thru.  The cashier, Dominick, was very friendly and took our order accurately.  The food took a little long to prepare, but our order contained many items (a #3 combo for Ash as usual, as well as a Mexican Pizza and 2 tacos for me and Pedro). We went home, and I gave Ash his food.  He asked if I checked the bag to see if his combo was "supreme". I said "No, I didn't check".

Right away, he fumbled frantically through the wrappers and yelled "GOD DAMN IT, What the hell is this shit!?! Again. Again. AGAIN?! You gotta me kidding me, dog!". 

 I gave him the receipt, and he looked at it and saw that it was indeed the supreme combo I ordered.  He just said "We gotta tell Yelp about this cuz they keep doing this to me".  Anyway, Pedro and I enjoyed our food just fine.

--


Ash:  Disrespected by Taco Bell AGAIN.  Look, at #3 combo is Supreme (has tomatoes and sour cream on them). The #8 is the one without tomatoes and sour cream.  Why do they keep doing this to me? This ain't the cashier's fault, but why can't the kitchen do it right?  I yelled at my half-sister and I regret that.  It ain't her job to have to check the accuracy of my order.

I am hurt and angry.   Thank God they included my side of avocado ranch, or I woulda confronted this situation directly.

Good riddance.  I'm about to start paying more for Chipoltle, a place where I feel respected and treated right as a customer.

Service is still a little slow, but at least it's always friendly. The food, well...it's Taco Bell. Even when I know that I'll have to contend with an unpleasant stomachache and a vacation on my toilet after having a meal here, I just can't help the occasional craving. Especially the prices: hello, $5 box!

they totally messed up our order...yet again! my daughter ordered a family meal, consisting of ten tacos, and a plethora of other items! but they only managed to get one order (out of six) correct! they only put two out of ten tacos in the bag! everything else in that huge bag was not even close to what she ordered! :( who has the time to open each individual wrapper to make sure it's correct?! then the phone number on the website is wrong! so who's there to complain to? this is the third time there and the third time the drive through had it so wrong it hurt! unbelievable! who's in charge? can someone be held accountable for the extremely horrible and rude service? because not only are idiots working the window, but they're also rude as can be! please avoid this location! go there at your own peril!!! only if y'all have the time to check every single item or drive back! otherwise, avoid this particular location like the black plague!!!! just sayin!  *btw, had to give a star rating or this would not be posted! :( i would like the zero or no star at all options! yes! it's that bad there!!!! you've been warned! lol!

I have gone to this place more than  10 times only drive through.
The foods are pretty decent I would say. And I like their cheap value meal.
I can not remember the name of the meals but they are cheap and tasty.
I like to go sometimes.^^

Stay away from this location.  EVERY TIME I HAVE ORDERED THERE I COME HOME AND THERE IS AT LEASE 1 THING MISSING OR WRONG.  VERY FRUSTRATING.  I speak VERY clearly and I'm lead to believe they understand what I say but NOOOOO......  just go somewhere else.  You pay extra for something and you don't get it.

I drive by ther all d time n get a quick midnight snack. Today I thru d drive thru like usual, get to d window 2 pay & of all days, today i forget to bring my wallet. The bill was only $3. So, I start looking for change in the car.  The employee Karla to the rescue! I was so surprised that she gave me my food for free. Even tho it was only $3 my stomach was jumping for joy. From the bottom of my stomach, THANK YOU KARLA. I hope u get a raise.
You were open when I needed you.  You got my order right.  Your mediocre food of questionable authenticity was still hot when I got it back to the hotel room.  Te quiero Taco Bell.

So I've basically grown up eating here; my dad's auto repair shop is just up the street. 

They consistently fill quick, accurate orders.  And most of the workers I've encountered there are friendly and polite. 

Bonus: they know how to hook a girl up.  I do not eat meat, so when I order items sans beef, they make up the difference with extra lettuce, beans, tomatoes, etc.  

And that makes me happy.
Normal Taco Bell.

I cannot tell you how many times I've eaten at this taco bell while completely trashed out of my mind.  I love it.  Memories flood my brain when I get drunk as I crave grilled stuft burritos like a madman.  I'm still full from lunch and I'm craving one right now!

There is a place in hell for me.

After 3 years living in the burbs we found this pizza place. We have had it 3 times in 2 weeks ;). Try ordering the pizza well done. It's so good. I wish they expanded delivery to Roselle road between Euclid and Palatine road. Maybe they will consider expanding radius a few more blocks.

For a long time we didn't get pizza from Wayne's because for some reason I thought of it as being greasy.  But our neighbors get it regularly so about a month ago we tried it instead of our usual Mugg's. The pizza was good. Then tonight, when pizza sounded like a good dinner choice I picked up another pizza from them. It was as good as last time.  It was tasty, fresh, and consistently good.  So I guess I need to get with the program and readjust my thinking!

TIP: It's not much of an eat-in kinda place. They have two tables.  It's really more for carry out.  Either way you can't  park near the entrance on Northwest Highway, so drive around the back.  Then walk around to the front or if you're picking up a pizza, you'll see the sign for carry out in the back.  It's right next to the True Salon.

My favorite thin-crust pizza delivery spot in the burbs. They're thin crust is hands-down the best of the best. No questions asked.

Wayne's is a small takeout/delivery spot that has been a favorite in Arlington Heights and surrounding suburbs for MANY years.
