We usually order Wayne's when the craving hits, or if we're too lazy to cook. Usually, the craving hits. :)  

Their thin crust pizza is thin and crispy with a slight chew to it which makes it simply irresistible. The sauce is flavorful, yet light so it's not overbearing. Their cheese blend is ooey-gooey goodness. At Wayne's they're not afraid to pile on the toppings. We usually order a Medium Thin Crust with extra cheese, pepperoni, black olive, and spinach. The ingredients are fresh and plentiful. 

Whenever I call for delivery, they know exactly where to deliver without needing to provide any info. That's great service in my book! Delivery is crazy fast and the pizza is always piping hot. They're delivery is super fast, to the point of being a little bit of an inconvenience. ;) (I was finishing my shower and they were at the door)

If you're looking for the best thin-crust pizza in the suburbs, look no further. Wayne's is what you want...what you crave!

Just ok....

I had an Uber driver tell me this was the best pizza in Arlington Heights so was excited to try it.

It was all right but I think he oversold it.  The ingredients were good but just average overall.

I'll try it again though.

It's been years since I had a Wayne's Pizza but I always really enjoyed it.  My wife and I don't live in the immediate area anymore and there are loads of terrific pizza places near us, but I wouldn't hesitate to revisit if in the area.  I think my first visit was around 1981 and there's a reason why these long ago established restaurants remain in business.

I left my first review a few weeks ago after trying their thin crust a few weeks ago. I enjoyed everything about the pizza with the exception of the bread. I was messaged by the owner and he suggested that the double crust might be more up my alley as their thin crust is just that, very thin. 

  We ordered the exact same pizza, with the exception of the crust. Boy was Tony, the owner, right with his suggestion. The double crust is exactly what I was looking for. It was spectacular. Wayne's Pizza has stolen us as customers from Rosatis!

I would love this pizza so much except I do not like when there is chedder cheeze on a cheeze pizza. All i want is mozzeralla. Maybe next time I order they can do that and hopefully i will love it.   One more problem, they don't deliver in Prospect Heights. I live right across the street from Arlington heights and Mt Prospect, but they still said no. SO, that stinks  .   Thanks

Wayne's features old school pizza with lots of options to make it "your way".

Wayne's web ordering system is one of the easiest and most user friendly that I have encountered. Payment can be cash or major credit card- no checks accepted.

With each order you get a "Ticket", save 4 and get a dollar off, save 8 and get two dollars off. On Wayne's website there is a print out coupon for $2 off any order over $10; be sure to bring the coupon with you if you do a pick up.

They have only a couple of booths if you want to "eat in", otherwise take-out rules.

Tip: Wayne's entrance is in the rear of the building.

Best pizza in Chicagoland. Been a customer for 39 years and keep coming back. I drive 8 miles to get a pizza and usually cannot wait to get home to eat it, so I end up eating in th car.
Check their website for a $2 coupon too!

First time trying Wayne's.  We have a favorite pizza place in Palatine, and have only occasionally felt the need to venture elsewhere.
Since our favorite is currently closed for remodeling, we've been trying a lot of other places lately.

Of the 4 places we've tried, the consensus is that Wayne's is the best.
They do a great job.
Crunchy crust that's a baked correctly, nice, well balanced sauce and their toppings, including the cheese, where fresh and full of flavor.


I'm seriously disappointed that we didn't make the run to Wayne's sooner.

We'll be back, without a doubt

We ordered pizza and ribs for two of us (yes we were hungry).

Delivery was nice and on time (40 mins)
Pizza was above average, but not great. I did not like the crust but the flavor was good.
Fries were good
Neither of us liked the ribs. The meat was a little dry and the BBQ sauce was terrible.

Anyway, recommend for the pizza, not the ribs.

This was our go to pizza when we were kids, and it is still my favorite Za when I am in town.  

Thin crust sausage is 5 stars, delicious and a perfect pie. The Italian beef pizza is very good also.   That is all we typically order but tonight we are tying the meat monster.  

Small dining room, nice staff, clean restaurant and locally owned, what more do you need?
Super flavorful thin crust pizza! The spinach-garlic is a win. It's a small joint and friendly staff. Great local option in Arlington Heights!

So I love local small establishments.  I want them to succeed.  This pizza is okay.  It's not as good as you'll get at some other places near here, but it's good enough that you'll eat your fill.  The cheese they use is a bit too orange and waxy and their sauce is thin and not very flavorful.  These are easy enough fixes, however the major drawback here is the price.  $22 for a large thin crust one-topping w/o delivery.  I just can't understand it.  There are better pizzas within a mile of here that are about half that price.
Not great pizza. Our search will continue!
Great take out pizza.   Place has been here forever, and it's always good, and correct to what I ordered.  Kind of reminds me of my days back as a teenage boy,  enjoying a local good pizza. Safe bet!
Delicious as usual! Thin crust sausage pizza is perfect.  The onion and green pepper pizza had wonderful flavor. Wayne's never disappoints.

Only lived in Chicagoland for 5 months but this was the best pan pizza we had and we went back many times....no sense in continuing to find the best when it's this amazing!  The pizza weighs a ton and we had multiple meals from it.

We also tried the Chicago style pizza and we didn't like it near as much and it seemed like the dough was only partially cooked.

Wayne's has been my favorite pizza place for as long as I can remember!! Their pizza is second to none! They keep it old school, you won't see any conveyor belt ovens in this open view kitchen! Their Italian beef and Italian sausage could also be considered world class

This pizza is slightly worse than just ok.  Customer service on the phone was alright,  but it took over 45 minutes to deliver on a Wednesday ordered at 9pm. Charged 21.00 plus tip for a 16 inch thin crust pepperoni. The cheese was waxy and orange.  The driver was nice enough but wasn't in a great mood either.

They got it.

Skills, that is.

No frills. All pie.

Worth picking up to go, fo sho. 

I'll edit this after I finish eating.

Ok and here we go...

The crust (ordered well-down) is almost a pretzel. So twisted, crispy, and not over powering. It was dense and firm so it held the juicy toppings of onion, green peppers, sausage, and spinach effortlessly. 

The fresh tomatoes on the top were so sweet and herbed. They melted like sauce. Sweet, sweet sauce. 

The toasted, gooey cheeses were so delicious. Not too much but definitely enough.

The veggies were fresh and tasty. I LOVE THIS PIZZA!!!

Even though they don't deliver to me, 3.3 miles away, I'll definitely be ordering more frequently. I'm sorry, now, that I've waited so long to order from these masters of pizzaology. 

My pie was ready in 30 minutes, or so they say, for pickup. I got it fresh out of the oven and uncut so all the juices stayed in the pie and not all over the box.

On the passenger seat next to me it sat all the way home, still piping hot as I rolled my cutting wheel through the caramelized cheeses and crust.

Five fuhhhh king stars. Word.
My favorite thin crust pizza. the more simple the better. I recommend the cheese and sausage, well done. if your looking for a go to pizza place. it's waynes.

I've been ordering pizza at Wayne's for years but tonight may be my last night.  Worst off day ever. I ordered 3 large of their specialty and all 3 were either burnt or burnt on one side and under cooked on the other side.  If this is a trend, I don't see myself ordering there again.  Tonight, I think I would have been better off ordering at Dominos. I would have taken back if we weren't so hungry. I may still call to tell them they failed tonight. Halloween night.
Great local pizza place!  Delivery is fast, orders accurate and staff and delivery drivers are above friendly.  Wings and pizza are all solid.  Double crust pizza is by far the way to go - delish!

Ordered it last night with friends  and ordering it tonight. A family tradition on Saturday's since I was little! My dad went there in high school when it had just opened. Now that I'm older I still think it's the best pizza I've ever had!

Deeeeep Diiishhhhh. Whoever wrote the Best Pizza in Chicago is Wayne's and Lou Malnatis ....you are darn right!!!!!
Truly amazing !!! THeir wings were great too!

I have grown up in Arlington Heights and NO pizza place compares to Wayne's! Even the delivery guy knows me cause I order from Wayne's so much. They might as well get half of my paycheck. :-D It is by far the best pizza around and their bbq sauce is amazing!! Keep up the good work guys! You have a forever loyal Wayne's Pizza customer here!
Good Pizza deliery, not super fast, but they are close to me and the pizza is always hot! I think that if you want fast pizza, this might not be the place. but for good hot pizza, give them a call!

This is one of the best places in the country to get pizza in my opinion. They have it all, super thin crust, thick crust, double decker (yes a real double decker pizza), and deep dish pizza. 
They really make a solid pizza with all fresh and some homemade ingredients. 
My favorite is an 18 inch with green peppers, pepperoni, and garlic. 
I've eaten a lot of pizza and not many can compete with Wayne's on their thin crust pizza.

We've recently tried this place a couple of times. I really like the supreme/special thin crust. The sausage is great and the other ingredients seem nice and fresh. My only complaint is that even with a well-done pizza, the center of the crust on the underside always seems to end up pretty soggy, which I haven't really experienced with other places. Great pizza though!

Pizza always delicious. The wings I'm very picky and they get them right all the time. Wings with bone medium sauce easy sauce well done with ranch. But what stuck out the most was I called at 10:50pm on a Sunday and asked if it was to late for a delivery. They wanted to say NO. but they took my order and delivered.  I was very happy and grateful!!!  6 month pregnant wife was hungry and I had been working in nursery all day. I would never do this again but they helped me out by not having to go out that night and searching for food.  Shout out to Jeremy S. driver who made it happen.

First time visit last night.  I live in Algonquin but work in Arlington Heights.  Ordered pizza half cooked.  Four minutes under broiler was done.  I have no idea why anyone would think the sauce was bland.  It was GREAT!  Sausage was good & did not go easy on ingredients even the peperoni!  Parking is in the back but so is the carryout door.  Pizza is thinner then most but not too crispy, thank God!  The only down side was because the 16 inch was so thin it did not fill the two of us enough for am second dinner.  Will have to try the double decker with the crust so thin it should be great.
Pizza is great & they get the orders right here. Been going here for years and tasty pizza it is. Not greasy .

Awesome pizza! 

Been going here for a long time. Just getting into this yelp thing with my new ipad. The crust is amazing and my cheese,sausage, mushroom, and onion never fails me. To many more years of good za. Keep it up. They also deliver.

I recently had Wayne's pizza because some friends told me it was the best around Arlington heights.  However I was not so impressed with the sauce, I thought it was bland with no flavor. The crust was nice and crispy but overall there are certainly much better pizza around the area.

I have two favorite pizza places. Lou Malnati's and Wayne's.
They have the BEST pizza. LOVE IT

I have eat and made every style of pizza under the sun from Chicago Deep dish to Detroit style, New York floppy crust, Neapolitan and everything in between. I've used brick ovens, gas ovens, wood burning ovens, the list goes on. I've worked at 4 pizzerias in my life (Including Wayne's) and I can tell you without a doubt Wayne's is the best pizza I have had, in taste, consistency and price. There's a reason this establishment has been operating for 50 years, because they never skip a beat. This is mom and pop quality, get in, get out "We're all about the quality of food."

What to order:

Appetizer:
Good ol' French Fries
Mozzarella sticks
Chili Pepper and cheese bites

Main Dish:
1. Thin crust sausage - Keep it simple if you're a first timer to this place, their known for their thin crust sausage. Don't attack the pizza with salt and pepper, red flakes or Parmesan until you've tasted it and THINK that it MAY need it.

OR

2. Deep Dish Pan Pizza - Wayne's is known for their thin crust but employees and fans will tell you that their Deep Dish is just as amazing. I order Sausage Bacon or Sausage Giardinera.

For the adventurous:
Try a BBQ chicken pizza with onion, and some cheddar cheese. ;)

If you want extra sauce, well done, crispy, or burnt the staff will happily oblige you.

I've ordered here a number of times over the years mainly because the location is convenient.

Their thin crust and double dough pizzas are only fair. The cheese is rather hard tasting and they are not generous with toppings except for the less expensive items. There is very little tomato/spicy taste.

Some of their side orders can be good (onion rings, breaded cauliflower, seasoned fries, and chicken wings when they are hot and fresh tasting. They do not travel very well however and this is a pickup or delivery restaurant only. If you order these items for delivery watch out.

Their delivery service is reliable though the food doesn't always taste freshly prepared (including the pizza). However if you pick up when they're crowded you can be ignored which can cause delays in getting your already prepared food.

This place is substantially overrated.

We've eaten here since the early '80's. We love their pizzas both thin and pan. The sandwiches are good too. Love everything they make ! I still prefer over the bigger pizza businesses. These seem to be made with love.

Delicious! We ordered pick up and I should have told him to wait to cook it because we were coming from Cary.  Even cold it was terrific.  We tried the thin sausage and onion and it was not greasy. The onions were sliced thin and well placed on the pizza, sausage was generous. We ordered a meatball sub too.  They stuff four meatballs onto the roll. They were tender and tasty.  We can't wait to come back and try the thick crust.
I used to really like their pizza. Now it arrives cold. The crust is like cardboard. No longer a fan.

This is my number one pick for the best beef sandwich in the northwest suburbs.  Whenever I get a chance this is a place to go unfortunately they don't open till like 4 p.m.  If they had lunch hours I would go here more often.

Great Pizza!  Friendly Service!  Good Prices!

Favorites: Thin Crust, Double Crust, Double-Decker (Yes, a pizza on top of a pizza!).

We haven't tried the deep dish yet, but I'm sure its just as good as the rest.

Don't forget to bring in your competitor coupons for $2 off each pizza.

Just moved to the area and I'm trying different places out.

I ordered a small thin crust and some boneless wings. It's a very true to the 'thin' name too, but I mean that in the best way posible. All the toppings tasted great and the crust was the perfect amount of crunchy.

The wings were actually really good for take-out pizza wings. Hot and juicy with nice breading and the sauce tasted good.

I can't wait to try the double decker and other things there next time. This is most likely my main pizza place now.

One of the best small non chain chicago Za joints. One of my food snob to the extreme friends recommended it so I had to try and man are we glad we did. It's a staple place now though I've never tried anything but the thin crust. The sausage is perfectly spiced.

I've been ordering from Wayne's for about 15 years now.always yummy love the double decker pizza, the beef sandwiches are fantastic and my new fav is the chicken bruschetta sandwich love the coupon on the website too

Great local pizza place we always go for the double decker pizza it's literally two pizzas on top of each other, just something different ... Always good & fresh! A little pricey but still a great pizza! Carry out only by the way...

This place is one of the best places to get really good pizza!  We have been coming here for at least 17 years.  I love their Double Decker Pizzas!  My husband and I usually get a large because we love eating the leftovers again the next day!  Everything we ever get, thin crust pizza, sandwiches or appetizers has always been great!  They use fresh ingredients and they don't skimp on the toppings!  
I love that when I call to place an order they recognize my number and already know what kind of pizza we usually get.  Plus they keep to their word of how much time it takes to get the food ready for pick up or even delivery.

I LOVE WAYNE'S. The deep dish is delish, and while they usually get everything perfect, once our pizza wasn't what we ordered (or maybe expected?) and they brought us another one post-haste. Friendly, local, and with a huge variety of crusts (which I appreciate!). Try the double crust or the deep dish!

Their double-decker pizza is amazing! But I made the mistake of trying the chicken fingers and was very disappointed. They were just tiny frozen ones made out of that "fake"-tasting chicken. I'd love to see them upgrade the quality of the other food on the menu besides the pizza, which needs no improvement!

Wayne's Pizza is a good go-to pizza joint for tasty carry out. More often than not the pizza is cooked well and is delicious. There are times (I think, perhaps, when they are busiest) when we get an undercooked, hastily made 'zza (ingredients strewn unevenly across the pie, soggy crust), but 7 out of 10 times we get a great pizza at a good price. There are some that do it better, but Wayne's is our first call because it's close, the guys are friendly, we get what we order, and they've been here forever and we want to seem them stick around. A solid "B" in our book.
The pan pizza is so good! Probably one of our favorite pizza places around and the workers are all so friendly!

Great carryout pizza. I ordered pizza for a blackhawks game party I had and the pizza was ready on time and the order was 100% correct. I am not a pan pizza fan but theirs is very good. We also ordered their thin crust, I wasn't as thrilled about that but it was fine. The toppings were adequate and the cheese and sauce were good quality.  It is definitely a good carryout pizza choice.

Started going here about 12 years ago when my brother lived in Arlington Hts. He introduced me to the double decker pizza - a definite pizza HOF'er!

Well, he's quite a ways from this place nowadays, but fortunately I now live close enough to enjoy the goodness of a Wayne's double decker. 

I'm awarding Wayne's four stars because they made a single decker (normal) pizza for me once and it was just OK. Pickup or delivery only.

Been around forever for good reason. A perfect pan-pizza crust, super-reliable and friendly service, and prices that seem a smidge lower than the other local shops. We hit Wayne's about once a week. A neighbor treasure.

Since I'm fairly new to the Arlington Heights area, I was excited to try out a nearby pizza place - and one that specializes in thin crust?! Heck, yes! My guy and I ordered a medium thin crust pepperoni, and we eagerly anticipated crunching into that crispy crust.

Except...the crust wasn't crunchy. It wasn't crispy. It was actually kind of floppy, soggy, and greasy. Talk about a letdown! I mean, this pizza wasn't AWFUL, but it wasn't remarkable in any way. I suppose I would give the Chicago-style pizza a whirl sometime, but not for awhile.

My favorite pizza place of all time because it's absolutely delicious and has been our family pizza place forever.  One time we went in for pickup and two other people from our family had ordered that same night.  And it's not a family party without pizza from Wayne's.

Down a star, but why?
Wayne's put on a pretty good run of stellar pizzas but lately the pizzas have been soggy in the middle. 
I don't mind a soft pizza but soggy...almost wet on a pepperoni pizza isn't a tasty meal. 
Will I stop eating here? Probably not but be on the lookout for a wet a pizza pie.

This is hands down the best pizza in the NW Burbs for your money. Thin crust is great and there is no skimping on cheese like the other pizza joynts do. Also, on website you can print $2 off coupons and walk out with a 12-inch pizza with 2 ingredients for $10 and some change. See if you can get this quality and price elsewhere, I doubt it. Do yourself a favor and try Wayne's, really you can't go wrong!!

I grew up loving deep dish/pan pizza, but my entire family prefers thin crust. Wayne's thin crust won me over! It is not that thin, squishy NY-style that you fold to eat...yuck! Wayne's thin crust is crispy, almost has a snap to it and is very tasty! With their crispy crust you really appreciate the quality of the ingredients. Their sausage is excellent. They have a few "outside of the box" options, too, like penne pasta on your pizza, which is great with spinach, too! Wayne's has been around for decades and with their quick, pleasant service and delicious pizzas, it's no wonder they've been so successful.

Let me start by saying I am not a big fan of Pizza. That being said, I enjoyed Wayne's thin crust pizza. I used their online ordering system and it was perfect. They also have a mobile app. I downloaded it! I will be back!! If ordering online and you use their website coupon you have to print out the coupon and bring it in or give it to your delivery driver. I did not know this and I find this to be a bit wasteful.
Delicious pizza!  We always order the thin-crust sausage.  It's a great value.  Hot, fresh, and delicious.  Highly recommended!

I don't understand Chicago pizza. It's either deep dish (and pretty good) or this other poor excuse for a pizza that the majority of places, like Wayne's serves. I'm from Michigan originally where we have delicious Detroit style pizza or normal pizza. I don't understand why normal pizza isn't an option in Chicago, it's either deep dish or thin-crust cardboard pizza with no flavor.

The crust is like cardboard, the sauce is ok, the cheese is bland (is it unsalted?). We got a veggie pizza (spinach and mushroom) and there was pretty much no flavor. I've never wanted to put salt on a pizza before but I did on this one. The meat pizzas are better since they actually seem to have a little sodium in them. The yelp ratings of this place baffle me.

Unfortunately, this is the closest pizza place to our house and anything within a few miles isn't any better so we're stuck getting it for poker night but I feel awful serving this to my guests.
Their thin crust pizza is very good. We always order their pizza, and never get disappointed.

One of the few places that truly knows what a crispy thin pizza should result in texture and taste. Also one of the few that offers giardiniera as a topping as well - try it you won't be disappointed!

Sorry Wayne's!! I'm moving next month 30 miles away ;(

Good Pizza! 
Ordered a Thin crust sausage. 
Hot, crispy and cheesy!  
Carry out or Delivery only. 
I don't think they ever have any specials or coupons...

I love thin crust pizza and tried this place out with a friend.
It's definitely a more carry-out store. The cheese is delicious! but the sauce was not the greatest. 
The workers were friendly and there were 2 tables for people who wanted to dine-in.

Amazing.  The best thin crust pizza I've ever had.  I've ate pizza in Vegas, LA, DC, NY, and obviously Chicago and this is hands down the best.
Right now I'm eating their deep dish which is also excellent.

The place is located right off of Northwest Highway by Arlington Park.  
Take-out and they do deliver.  
Pizzas, that's all I have to say.  You can tell the ingredients are fresh and made to order.  When you walk in to pick up your order you can even see them making the pizzas like a well oiled machine.
The thin crust is so good, it's crisp, but not too hard.  It's chewy, but doesn't get soggy.  
The deep dish is great to.  Not like normal Chicago deep dish where you're full after 1 piece.  This, you can eat 2 or 3 pieces.  Which I love cause I love eating.

If you're in the Palatine, Arlington Heights, Rolling Meadows area, definitely go there for pizza.  
I'll update the review after I have one of their sandwiches which also look great.

The best Northwestern IL suburbs pizza hands down. I've been away and coming back to Arlington for 15 years and always make it a point to grab a thin crust sausage when I'm here. The best Jerry, the best!

So it's a Friday night and I'm chatting on the phone with a dear friend who happens to live in Florida.  As I finish venting about our Chicago weather, I say that I wish I lived in Florida.  Then  I mention that I am going to order pizza for dinner.  My friend says he wishes he were here, so he could order pizza- from Waynes!  So I thought: Hmmm...never tried that place.  Why not?

All I can say is AWESOME!!

We went her based on a recommendation from a friend and he was right, this is the best thin crust around. Super thin, crunchy crust, big hunks of sausage, fresh onions and juicy mushrooms! 
In fact, I knew his pizza was good just by smelling it in the box. There is a certain smell that great pizza gives off and Wayne's makes it!
If you like thin crust,this is for you.
And that girl from Michigan who wants" normal" pizza, should go back to  her home state and that rat-ass Domino's!
Best pizza in Chicago.
The deep dish is almost as good as Giordano's in the city. We even prefer it over Lou Malnatis. Very fast for delivery or pick-up. Pizza reheats well, too!

Have ordered from here a few times while in Arlington Heights visiting a friend ...and I absolutely love their thin crust pizza! Always delivered nice& hot by a friendly dude, sausage has great flavor, veggies always taste super fresh, and the cheese is fantastically gooey :) Although i would love to see ricotta on the ingredients menu...this girl LOVES cheese... STILL AWESOME PIZZA!

Wayne's has been my go to pizza for the past 8 years.  Great crust and sauce make for one of better thin crust pizzas I've had.  Pepperoni, mushroom and onion are the way to go.  The onion is sliced thin, not diced in big chunks, and slightly charred.  Gives them a sweet taste you can't beat.  Garlic bread is also very good.  You have to try the Dyna-Bites!
Our favorite pizza place, hands-down.  The double crust is fantastic.

Had the pizza twice. First time pizza was very bland and had very little sauce. After coworkers bragged about it I tried again. Same as first experience. Way too little sauce and pretty tasteless. Wouldn't recommend

pretty much everything i want in a pizza: 

incredibly salty, cheesy, greasy.
I live down the street, so it's quicker and better than frozen pizza. I've gotten a pizza that was a bit too crispy (burnt), but most have been great.

i fell for the yelp good review and decided to try them out.. though the pizza was cheaper and the service was good... i really didnt like the pizza taste.. it tasted like eating rubber pieces with no flavour in it.

Wayne's has the best pizza in Arlington. I cannot give them 5 stars because the quality is not always consistent. Their off-nights pizza is still vey good, but when they are on the pizzas are fantastic. They seemed to have cut back on the sauce and so to compensate I order extra sauce on the thin crust which is fantastic. However, I feel let down that I have to order the pizza to get them to make it the way they used to. Their thick crust pizzas are great too. The thick pizza uses a different sauce. Excellent sausage and their pastas are very good too.

I have been a fan of Wayne's pizza for a long, long time.  I have never been disappointed.  I only ever order the thin crust, which is crispy on the outside and gooey on the inside, and the sauce has a great flavor to it.  My pizza is always ready when they say, and the price isn't bad.  My favorite PIzza in the area.

It's a take-out / delivery place.. there's one or two booths in the front, but i've never seen anyone in them.  The owners/operators are nice.

I have ordered from Wayne's for the last six months and I have not been disappointed.  If you pick up your order, go to their website to get the $2 off coupon.  Their thin crust pizza is awesome.  Their pan is good.  The service is good and they always have your pizza ready when they say, if not earlier.  Looking for a good pizza, look no further.

Wayne's Pizza is an institution in my family, if you want the Best Pizza in Arlington Heights look no further.  Its take out only and parking is in the rear, you might even miss it if it weren't for the Orange lights in the strip off NW Highway.  I recommend checking out their website before you order, they usually have a coupon available to download and print out.

My new fave!!! 
Picked up a kale & quinoa salad. It's delicious!!!!
Staff was extremely friendly. Ingredients are fresh. You also get a chocolate covered strawberry & bread roll. 
They also have awesome soups, sandwiches,
Cream brle  & brownies. Definitely going back again to try something else....tomorrow

Some chain restaurants pleasantly surprise me (hello, pie five!) This place was a disappointment on an epic level. I have a five year old boy so we visit our fair share of these quick serve type places. It looks very modern and bright and they are going for a New York loft look with a West Coast vibe. They have salads, soups, and sandwiches/ paninis. I ordered the pick two combo with a panini and salad (similar to panera's you pick two deal). The sandwich was underwhelming and not crispy enough for a panini, and tasted underwhelming. The salad..... oh Lordy that's a whole other story. You can opt to order one of the salads from the menu or a make your own, which I opted for. They pre dressed the lettuce to the point where the entire heap of lettuce was sliding around the bowl in an unappetizing pile of gloppy soaked greens. Also, they must have been told to be very exact about the portions, but there's something so bothersome about watching them literally count out 5 cherry tomatoes and three minuscule pieces of chicken. I watched them actually pick a cherry tomato OFF my salad because it was one too many, and that was very unappetizing. I also really love olives and asked for a few extra and they absolutely refused. This REALLY irked me. A few extra olives isn't going to make or break your M.O. When I go to NafNaf or Chipotle and ask for a few extra veggies on my salad, it's never an issue, and why I continue bringing my business there. Also, I was supposed to get one protein and 5 toppings, but they insisted that the chicken was part of the five and I wasn't about to argue.  They had to remake it because of too much dressing and I never send food back. 
Lastly, the guy came by to take our trays and when he asked how everything was, I told him- kindly but honestly. I was shocked when no manager came out to speak with us. 
For my first time trying this chain restaurant, I'll never, ever go back. Stick to your old fast casuals and save a trip.

Last time I had this was in Az so I was super excited today when I got a coupon in the mail saying they were now open!  We headed over the same night, so expectations are running high!

Super friendly people that were very helpful and super fresh high quality food.

If you do a single item (sandwich, soup, salad) it is very filling. Doing the 2 combo item is having a FULL sandwich with half soup or salad, it's a lot of food and you get bread with the soup and everything comes with a Chocolate covered Strawberry. 

Roasted Pepper and Lobster soup - it's a bit of a kick with nice little pieces of lobster. I truly enjoyed dipping my soft bread into the soup and eating it. It was soooo good, very creamy, slightly salty, a little bit of spicy, and some nice lobster taste even without eating the lobster pieces.

Pesto Chicken sandwich - I used the artisan whole wheat bread, it was nice, crusty, and had some good pops of wheat grains in there for texture.  Nice strips of chicken and good pesto. I enjoyed it but it was overshadowed by the soup, which is odd because I am not generally a soup guy. I totally could have just had the soup by itself.

Chocolate Hazelnut Creme Brulee - so apparently these things are 50% off after 8. It tasted like nutella creme brulee, it was soo yummy. The chocolate on the top was the best, rich thick and creamy and just the right amount of sweet to remind you that it's dessert time!

Drinks: I tried all 4 of the drinks, a cucumber green tea, coconut something, orange and berry something and lemonade. I enjoyed a mix of 2/3 lemonade with 1/3 orange and berry. I will probably pass in the future since they are lightly sweetened with raw honey (very good for your health) and I didn't want to add more sugar to it. So I'll stick with nice healthy water.

The decor and bathrooms are all so relaxing and very nicely detailed. I am very pleased.

I'll be back for sure!

My fianc and I went to Cafe Zupas for lunch last weekend. The menu is expansive and super fresh. So many delicious salads, sandwiches and soups - you also have the option to customize just about everything. I got the Strawberry Harvest Salad and a cup of the Lobster Bisque soup with croutons. Both ridiculously yummy and created right in front of me. The salad wasn't overdressed and the soup was nice and hot and the portion was huge. We will definitely be back. 

Update: 11.12.16
Not so impressed this time around. Got the "crab and avocado melt" sandwich comes with artificial "krab" meat salad and unfortunately mine arrived without avocado. Super disappointing. Then I ordered the Wisconsin cauliflower cheddar soup, tasted wonderful but was served lukewarm. I know that they were busy thanks to just opening and sending out coupons. But I was absolutely bummed. I would have said something but due to the busy hour and fast casual atmosphere I wasn't even able to attempt to speak to anyone. Maybe I'll give them a chance again, but avoiding that faux crab sandwich like the plague.

This place just opened today.  It is right down the street from my work and we are always interested in new lunch options, so we went to check it out.  Cafe Zupas made a great first impression.  The space was clean, bright, and modern-looking.  Plenty of fresh ingredients and custom fruit juices were immediately on display.  The whole thing kind of had a "Whole Foods" vibe to it, but for the Woodfield area the prices were actually fairly reasonable.

The staff was very friendly and perky for the grand opening.  There was even a staff person in line to help new customers with the menu and provide recommendations.  I myself did the Pick 2 Combo for about $9, along with a drink.  I usually don't order that much for lunch, but I wanted to get the full experience.  I got the Honey Cilantro Carnitas sandwich, which was very tasty.  It wasn't exactly a warm sandwich, so you know, but it was flavorful and the meat was very tender.  They gave me the option of ancient grain bread, but I went with the standard bread this time.  Even the regular bread was rather good.

For my soup I got the Roasted Red Pepper & Lobster.  It was very flavorful, but did not have large chunks of lobster - just some ground up bits.  Overall it was pretty good, if not amazing, but for a cup of soup from a sandwich shop, it did the job.

The Pick 2 Combo came with a small chocolate-covered strawberry, which was a nice touch.  It also came with a plain roll, in case you need more carbs in your life.  And finally, a tempting assortment of desserts was on display near the cash register, in case that little strawberry is not enough to sate your sweet tooth..

I mixed a few of the fruit juices from the juice bar and found it refreshing and not overly sweet.  It seemed that most (all?) of the juices were sweetened with honey, so there is a distinct honey flavor.

All things considered Cafe Zupas shows great promise.  I really enjoyed my sandwich, the customer service was great, and the menu has an intriguing variety of options to try next time.  We are sure to be back here again.

Cafe Zupas has carved out a nice niche in the fast casual space in good ole Schaumburg. 

Yes, there are a many fast casual places in the 'burg, but Cafe Zupas appeals to sole eaters and family alike, healthy and "splurging" eaters, and keeps the prices super affordable for all. 

Let's talk about the good:
-The tomato basil soup was deeeelicious. A bit salty but really flavorful! 
-Kid's grilled cheese was on point, albeit basic 
-As mentioned, very affordable combos at $8.99 per adult (includes a full sandwich and a soup or salad) and $4.19 per child
-Local and regional ingredients aplenty
-Chocolate strawberry included in all combos 
-Staff was very, very friendly and welcoming
-Interior is modern and ridiculously shiny clean

The few mehs:
-Ordering for multiple people (at once) can be complicated as you first order sandwiches, then salads, then soups, then dessert. So if you have four meals to order (for one family) you have to remember the matrices of each meal as you roll along. 
-My salad was over dressed (but I'm a bit sensitive to soggy lettuce), so next time, dressing on the side 

I'll definitely be back...can you imagine if they did curbside pickup? Cafe Zupas, can you help a mama out?

I love eating at new places. This one popped up on my fb and I had to check it out.

It has a very clean vibe and the prices are all reasonable. Once people find out about this place, it's gonna blow up. It's like a mix between whole foods and panera.

So we ordered literally everything on the menu. Honey cilantro carnitas, turkey bacon avocado, both sandwiches with the ancient grains bread, garden chicken cobb, asian citrus chicken, wisconsin cauliflower soup, new England clam chowder, creme brulee cheesecake, salted caramel creme brulee, rockslide bar, and 2 of the raw honey infused drinks.

Yeah, a little of everything. The half salad and whole sandwiches were $8.99. For the quality, I think that's a bargain!

And everything was so good. The soups they let you sample before you get so you know you're gonna like it. 

The raw honey drinks are AMAZING. Plus raw honey has awesome health benefits, with aiding in digestion being one of them so get it!! You can taste the honey in there but not overwhelming. So good! I recommend the orange berry infusion. Yum!

The sandwiches were good. The honey carnitas one was the better one of the two. My salad was amazing. I'd come back just for the salad and drinks,  for a light lunch :)

Each meal comes with a roll and a freshly dipped strawberry. The strawberry is sweet and a really great touch. 

Omg the creme brulee is so good. I'm a huge creme brulee fan and they have so many options (salted caramel, berry, and chocolate hazelnut). It makes me so happy.

The cheesecake is really good too. I've been craving cheesecake so I had to get that too. 

The rockslide is very chocolaty and has tons of caramel on top. It's good if you like chocolate!

Everyone there is friendly and courteous. They want to help you. 

I think I ordered too much and I ended up being way too full for lunchtime but I had a lot of to go boxes.

I'm pretty sure I'll be coming back many more times and bringing people here.... as long as they never change :p

Excellent concept and delicious food!  The lobster bisque tastes like anything you'd find in Maine (minus the chunks of lobster meat).  The chicken pesto panini oozes goodness.  The salads looked intriguing, I will be back tomorrow to try one.  Brownies are heaven.  

They even give you a chocolate covered strawberry!  Woohoo!  

Everyone provided top notch customer service with friendly attitudes.

Now that Sweet Tomatoes is gone, this is certainly a nice alternative (a step up in my opinion!).

The only disappointment for me was the lack of a chicken noodle soup option.  But, I guess that will just keep the flu-ridden and contaminated customers away, so that is good.  They can go infect Panera people instead!

Check this place out.  It's pretty cool.
Got the pesto chicken panini and lobster bisque soup. Everything was fantastic! I will be returning.

I was looking forward to eating at this place. Umpteen number of soups, salads and sandwiches. Decor is very nice and bright. I got the sandwich and soup combo. The cauliflower soup was yummy but the vegetable sandwich was all bread and nothing much else in the middle which was a buzz kill.

The food was good! I got the pick two combo with a strawberry fields salad and a chicken pesto sandwich. I love how you get a chocolate covered strawberry with your meal! The guy at the line was very helpful and friendly. I'm only giving it 3 stars because of the cashier. My boyfriend ordered a soup and was asked if he wanted cheese. Without knowing that it would cost 69 cents extra, he added parmesan. When we got to the register, goat cheese was also added and charged on the ticket. Before he paid he explained that he didn't ask for the goat cheese and the cashier was just like "sorry about that" but still charged us for it. I know that it's only 69 cents extra but it's the fact that it should have been taken off and he should have only been charged for the cheese he asked for. After that, we spoke to another person in the store about it and still, nothing was done.

It's like Panera, but better. The staff was very helpful as it was my first time there. The line moved quickly and the food was excellent. I liked that it was fresh. They have a better selection of salads than Panera in my opinion. I'll be back but not on a Sunday, because they're closed all day.

Welcome to the neighborhood! I could live on the 3 S's soup, salad and sandwiches and that's what these guys do well! The food and ingredients are fresh and made in front of you. Since they are new they give you samples of everything! The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. The location is bright and clean. They offer organic honey sweetened drinks and the ability to add Italian flavors to your drink. This place puts Panera to shame. I had the Cobb salad and the lobster bisque. Both excellent with great flavor. Can't wait to come back and try more menu items. Keep up the great work!

We had our wedding reception at Chandlers and it was beyond perfect. Kathy was wonderful to work with and made us feel so at ease. They set up the room beautifully including our centerpieces which we had done ourselves. The food was so delicious and we received so many compliments on it! It was a wonderful experience.

Came here for Thanksgiving dinner. Service was outstanding from Megan and Jenna. Food was very good. We had a party of 15 and they did a good job of getting the food out quickly. Friendly and made for an enjoyable holiday.

I really can't say a lot about this place except it's great, I'm so grateful I found it. Every single thing I've tried surprise me how good it was, They don't use a lot of salt just great tasting food you have to experience for yourself

We have been to Chandler's several times and enjoy sitting outside on their very nice and scenic patio.  However, the poor service and B grade food cause us not to frequent Chandler's as often as we would prefer, despite the reasonable prices.

We have been forgotten about while outside on the patio more than once. During our last visit, after the waitress never came to pick up the check, I actually had to take it to the bar to pay for our meal.

While the ribs are very good, most of the food is B - grade.

However, the food and drinks are reasonably priced and the patio experience can be a very pleasant setting.

My wife's and mine go to spot .  Steak and bake  12 bucks on Tuesday is great . The best is Sunday chicken dinner , 3 giant pieces of broasted  chicken , soup or salad, mashed potatoes with gravy, corn on the cob .  9.95 !!   It barely fits on a plate. Great service and the staff is very accommodating.  Filet sliders are great.  I gave Chandlers 5 stars for value, food quantity, food quality, and service .  Try Chandlers  you won't be disappointed.

What a pleasant surprise after a sub par round of golf yesterday. Stopped at the lounge for a beer after my round of golf for a quick beverage and ended up having dinner there. I'm so glad I did as this place is really great and reasonably priced. I ordered one of the daily specials which was a 12 oz. choice strip steak or a prime 12 oz. sirloin and I opted for the the strip steak. What great value as it was served with a fresh warm loaf of bread, soup or salad and the steak and a perfectly cooked baked potato. Can't wait to go back and sample something else off the menu. Highly recommend this establishment. For $12.99 you can't go wrong here and I understand this is one of their Tuesday specials.

Can't say enough good about this place! Me and my wife come here every year for our anniversary and it's always a great time and so reasonable. 4 drinks, steak appetizer, 2 6 oz lobster tails, 1.5 lbs of crab legs for less than $100. Our waitress Pam was super welcoming and prompt. Plus, they gave us a free dessert for our special day. Can't ask for more!

I had to write a review after my meal last night. I've been going to chandlers off and on for years (because it's not very close to me), and it is always a wonderful experience!! Consistent- fresh- reasonably priced- great atmosphere and great service!!!   Love the warm bread!!! Their salad rocks!! And I recommend the petite filet dinner, so so good!!!

Took my mom and her friend here for lunch. First time any of us had been here. Really really good food. Beef Filet sliders were just FANTASTIC! BLT with a side of tater tots and French onion soup was excellent. Fast friendly service in a very nice atmosphere. Check this place out and you won't be disappointed. We will be back for sure:)

Can't say that I was all that pleased at Chandler's. It is located on the golf course, so of course we saw many golfers (most of which seemed intoxicated). We decided to sit outside, which ended up being an alright choice. It was a very nice day out, and later when I went inside I wasn't impressed with the atmosphere. It is very dark and has an old school lounge feeling...but not in a good way. The bathrooms were disgusting...I'm not sure when they cleaned them last.

Our server was very nice, but they didn't have enough staff that night, so we barely saw her. Or anyone for that matter. She was gracious that we were patient, so we did get a few drinks off of our bill. However, the management either needs to hire more people or make sure that they have enough people on staff. 

When I looked at the menu, I was surprised at how reasonably priced everything was. I decided to get the steak/potato special, which also came with a salad and bread. The bread was very good, but the salad was pretty plain. They brought the wrong dressing, and had to go back. Then my steak was very well done...I ordered it medium. The presentation wasn't anything to brag about either.

The one good thing - they make strong drinks. Kudos to you bartender. Needless to say, I wouldn't recommend it and I probably won't be returning.

We had our wedding at Chandlers last weekend. The whole process of working with chandlers was a complete nightmare.  Kim was our "planner" and she was terrible in every way. Her communication skills are the worst I've ever seen and she acts as if she's never planned a wedding before.

During our rehearsal dinner, which she was suppose to be in charge of, she just kept leaving with no warning and was gone for 20 minutes at a time.  We ran the rehearsal ourselves. 

Our outdoor ceremony site was a complete mess. It was under construction and extremely unsafe. Chandlers offered 0 support to get that fixed. We had to spend all night getting our florist up to date with fixing it and had to pay her more money. Chandlers refused to split the bill with us. 

So we sent the florist out early to set everything up and chandlers ripped them all up and threw everything in a corner. Because they had a booked a party til 430 when our wedding started at 5. So we couldn't take our pictures because the place was packed with a bunch of over served people who were wasted.  

Luckily our vendors that we choose were amazing and we all worked together to get this going, no help from Chandlers.  The wedding started and Kim was suppose to be there all day setting everything up and getting people in the right spots. She did nothing of the sort. She set up nothing, I was scrambling around at 515 looking for programs and the bouquets and everything else she was suppose to do. 

During the reception Kim was supposed to be there all night. I never saw her after 6pm, she is awful. We had requested stations but instead we're given a buffet.  The floor plan showed one thing and we got something completely different. There were people that we didn't invite and didn't know hanging out in our lounge area and dancing in our lounge area.  

The night was a big hit due to the DJ and the way we designed everything. But absolutely everything Chandlers had to do with they failed completely.  They didn't follow through on anything they said they would do. Kim is impossible to work with and she is very bad at her job. Bob Whitehead is the manager and he is a complete jerk and needs to be fired. He not only refused to help us, but was a complete jerk about it. 

I would never recommend this place to anyone and if you're getting married there be prepared to do everything.

I had my wedding ceremony & reception at Chandler's in 2014. 
Kim was my wedding planner and minister ;-) 
I have no complaints and had a great experience during my wedding planning. The ceremony area is beautiful!!! They have a nice fountain and flowers along the isle. 
Kim was very helpful and accommodating to my needs. Any linen color you want, Chandlers has it.  They throw in a lot of extra stuff too.  I didn't have to bring any decorations.  Kim had all the center pieces for me already.  There are a few different options for food.  We went with the buffet stations.  Everyone favorite was the sirloin steak.  The mashed potato bar served in martini glasses was a huge hit.  Everyone raved about the food and went for seconds and even thirds. The prices are affordable and you get the venue, food & entertainment all in one lump sum.  Everyone had a great time and I would definitely recommend Chandlers to others. 

I like Chandlers during summer the most.  They have a nice patio overlooking the golf course. Clean and a very friendly staff.  I had the chicken strips with tater tots.  The chicken was very moist.  My husband had the Filet sliders and said they were excellent.  My son had the burger and tater tots.  The burger was huge and very filling.

Filet sliders were delicious. Thought they would come with more than bread but the flavor of the steaks held its own. Tator tots are heaven. This place is priced well and service was friendly. I ate here mid week on lunch.

Based only on attending a large group lunch event here several times, I'd say that this place serves good food and good service at a fair price.  The cash bar seems a bit pricey, though.  The staff is very efficient and pleasant and the surroundings are easy to take.  If you come here at noon during golf season, prepare to walk a fair distance from where you can park.

Had lunch this past Friday. I must say it was the worst meal we had ever had at Chandler's een coming here for years. Our wait staff told us he was all by himself the rest of the staff was at a meeting. He did a fine job trying to be the waiter,the bartender, the chef. The food was presented nicely but had no taste. I must say for 63.00 I should be reimbursed. The calamari was flat. The filet sliders had no taste they were dry.  The chief cook and bottle washer just can't do it all. All the food was just bad tasting. We didn't want to complain because he was trying. We realize that this is a slow time of the year but that is no excuse for not being fully staffed.

Great food, slow staff, but friendly

Sunday Broasted Fried Chicken special is very good

At Chandlers today for lunch :) 
Another great meal. I love the food here. I had the chicken tenders. So moist and yummy. My fianc had the steak sliders which I had to steal one from him :) because they looked so good. The meat was very tender and juicy. Cooked perfectly!! My son had the burger with sauted onions. This boy can eat but after he finished his burger and FF he said he was so full and that it was delicious. It was my sons 1st time here so he asks to come back again :) Our waitress was Sasha. Super nice and funny girl. I loved her personality. I love when restaurants hire ppl with awesome personalities. They make the atmosphere even better.   On and the patio was pretty awesome. Not to many place in Schaumburg have a nice out door/patio. 
Will be coming here again :) 
Thanks to all the wonderful staff at Chandlers!!!

Restaurant Review
Eh this is rather a average restaurant located in a golf course. My father always had raving reviews from his monthly chapter meetings here and we decided to give it a try during rib-eye Saturday. 14.99 for 10 oz ribeye, veggie, potato, and soup or salad. I was excited that this would be similar to Omega another diner type experience. I believe that the restaurant can do better with the hostess... the greeting did not feel at all welcoming or friendly. We were quickly seated and the ordering process was painless. Clearly there were a bunch of regulars here as well having dinner. The bread was top notch, fresh from the oven and our waitress even brought seconds. My main meal was less than eventful with a very thin cut ribeye which made a medium rare taste well done. The sides were your run of the mill potato options (fries, etc.). I will have to think about if I will return in the future with so so service and food that could be improved upon.

Pro- daily dinner specials. low prices compared to other restaurants

Con- unfriendly service, very thin cut ribeye (it would be better if the 10 oz was with a thicker cut steak)

Hidden deal- Daily dinner specials

The food here is pretty good but it doesn't really matter because the service is some of the worst I've seen.  The staff are all very pleasant, but it can be 20-30 minutes before you even see a drink.  Also, if you would like your plates cleaned up within oh, say, 30 minutes after you have finished eating, forget about it.  You will just be staring at your dirty dishes forever.  I have been here several times and it is the same story.  I wouldn't go back if it were up to me but my family insists on returning all the time.  I heard the manager go around to several tables last weekend and apologize to them for the poor service.  Having said that, the guy made no attempt to actually get someone their drink or help out the waitstaff at all.  Lame.

1 Star for food.
Your dry run, after remodel, was the worst ever.
Only allowing 4 people per table and splitting up our family and not even allowing us to sit in the same section or near each other.
Giving me a OBVIOUSLY filthy glass. FILTHY !!!! 
Have a new waitress who is clearly NOT ready to do it alone. My mother order a Araretto stone sour and she said we don't have a blender to make that. WHAT??!!! Really. 
Waiting an hour and 1/2 for our food, watching several people who came after us eat. We had them bag it as at that point we weren't hungry anymore.

It was one of the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. 
The manager wouldn't know this as they were NO where to be found.
Kind of strange as this was a dry run to re opening, you'd think they'd be visiting tables.

Have been here for weddings, showers, & golf outings before and really had no complaints. Food was very mediocre though. Came on a Wednesday night for burger night, had a wonderful waitress, but again the food was super average, nothing to rave about. We went there tonight for my fiancs birthday and we had to wait to be seated even though there were 20+ tables open. We waited at the bar and I had a glass of wine, I was very unimpressed with the wine selection. My fianc had the strip steak & enjoyed it. I had the twin filets and ordered them rare and stressed that I prefer my meat extremely rare if possible. When I got it, it was medium. I told our waitress, who by the way was very friendly but flustered because she was so busy because they were clearly under staffed, and she apologized & took it back. When I got my new steaks they were medium rare :( I didn't send it back though because we had already been there for a while. We really wanted to come in on a Sunday because we heard the chicken special was really good, but I'm scared I'll just be disappointed again:/

Good food, friendly server, drink special...very nice setting on the course.  Hadn't been here for a long time and it's nicely remodeled and everything that came to the table was delicious.  Salads crisp, onion soup good, sampler starter platter thingy DT (Darn Tasty).  Dinners were very good not five star but solid 3+ to four.  I'll go back which is a good thing to say considering the dozens of choices in the general "Woodfield" vicinity.

The food is really great.  1/2 slab of ribs & chicken fingers were great!  Also they have great weekly specials.  We went on a Tuesday and they had $4 svedka vodka martinis - this was cheap and delish!  Service was good and there are nice views and plenty of parking.  The seating could use a little updating and this is more of an older crowd.  A good place to bring the family, grandpa and grandma too.

Also have been here for the banquets, and the food is always a hit.

I've been to Chandler's on a few occasions, all for showers of some variety- baby or wedding. I was here this time for a wedding shower for a dear friend. The space was decorated beautifully, the servers were wonderful. My only complaint is that they kept mixing up the diet and regular pop on the table at the front of the room (they did it several times) which frustrated a few people. Overall though, the experience was great. My friend was treated like a princess, and they held the meal for awhile as several guests were running late without complaining. The food was served family style, and I enjoyed all of it- especially the mashed potatoes. They also allowed the family to bring in an outside cake for the shower which I thought was very nice. Someday I'm sure I'll visit here for something other than a special event- but they do a great job with special events. I would definitely recommend this location for a bridal shower.

I live in the vicinity for years and never thought to stopy by to eat at their restaurant. I assumed it was only for the golfers. I'm glad I stopped by.

I usually dont order a strip steak due to it's chewiness and less quality flavor as compared to filets and ribeyes. However, the bartender suggested their Tuesday night special, "steak and bake" for an incredible price of $12.99. I was truly amazed by this juicy, tender, amazingly tasty, and surprisingly thick strip steak. No A1 steak sauce was required. This had just enough fat to melt in your mouth without getting chewy. It had such a juicy flavor that I recommended it to the couple sitting across from me. They ordered it as well and loved it too!

I will definitely stop by on another Tuesday hoping to get the same tender juicy steak over and over again...

My daughter selected Chandler's for her wedding reception and we were very impressed with not only the place itself but the level of service we received. They really take care of the guests and quickly attend to any concerns. 

The food was excellent. The bartenders were great. One of the better wedding venues I've seen. Lots of places both inside and out for photo ops.

Loving the newly remodeled Chandler's... We go there fairly regularly and have found the food very good and the service, friendly.  Clearly the menu prices have increased which was expected in keeping with the renovations.  Spoke recently with a friend and neighbor who asked if we had been to Chandler's recently as it had been a while for her and she had taken a gentleman friend who hadn't ever been there. She was wowed by the renovation and especially liked the changes to the bar area and restaurant area with three sided windows to the golf course.  They enjoyed their visit and also plan on returning.

Save yourself time, emotion and money and do NOT host your wedding here.  We had the most horrible experience  with their customer service and they are very unprofessional.  Leading up to the wedding, we had signs that they were disorganized and dropped the ball, but once you book the venue you can't really change your date/venue.  During our walk through three days before the wedding, I took extra caution in being OVERLY descriptive and step-by-step in a list of all the items for them to set up, along with labeled boxes of everything (and even pictures of how it should be set up).  The day of the wedding was a extremely disorganized - there were so many things that went wrong.  Nobody took control even though they promised that they would 'own' the timeline for the night.  
* We were told there was another outdoor wedding at 4:30 pm which would not interfere with our cocktail hour on the terrace at 6 pm.  Upon my wedding party arriving at 6:15 pm, all my guests were crammed in the lobby while the other wedding had just started at 5:30 pm (we were told this would not be a problem/conflict).  My friend arrived at Chandler's early to take control of everything, since she got married at Chandler's and was cautious about making sure nothing went wrong.  She was guiding guests from the other wedding to go upstairs to their reception, since Chandler's staff was not taking control.
* The cocktail terrace was not ready until 6:30 pm, and my friend had to demand that the guests from the other wedding leave the terrace. Meanwhile, their guests wandered into my ballroom, confused and thinking that was where their reception was. This set back the entire timeline on our wedding, causing our guests not to eat dinner until 9 pm (with many complaints from the guests).  There was no manager or direction from anyone at Chandler's to tell guests to go inside to the ballroom when dinner started.  I was assured that Chandler's would coordinate with the band to make an announcement and take control of the timeline.  We did not know who was in charge throughout the night. 
* One of the boxes with all of my decorations was not set up. The candy buffet was also not set up, and Chandler's outlined in the contract that they would set up the candy buffet. Again, my friend set out all the jars and filled them with candy and refilled throughout the night.  
* Per the contract, my florist was providing a cake topper of flowers. Chandler's could not find the cake topper and was scrambling. Again, my friend found the cake topper in the fridge.  It was outlined in the contract that the florist was providing a floral cake topper.
* We paid $250 extra for the video montage slideshow. Before the reception, my friend made sure the DVD was set out and reminded the staff. After the dinner and toasts, Chandler's staff forgot to play it. I had to remind them, and they played it over the dinner music with both the slideshow and dinner music blasting over each other (dinner music was not shut off). 
* The staff took my mother's plate away while she was visiting guests at tables and she wasn't done eating.  When she asked for her salmon, they said they only had beef left. As the mother of the bride, this was upsetting that she could not eat.
* Finally, there was confusion on my cylinder vases post-wedding. My parents picked up all of my belongings after the wedding, and Chandler's had demanded that we call our florist to come pick up the vases, otherwise they would toss them. It was written in the contract for both the florist and Chandler's that I had provided 54 vases, yet Chandler's did not pay attention and the vases were lost (over $200 worth of glassware).  After much runaround after my honeymoon, my husband and I showed up at Chandler's to look for the vases ourselves.  Sure enough, they were locked in a closet by the bathroom.  
We met with Chandler's in person to explain our dissatisfaction and demand answers. They took accountability for nothing and NO apologies.  They gave us a run around for about another 6 weeks with excuses on why they couldn't meet with us again with an explanation.  First they had to pull the Park District tapes to understand the timeline. Second, Bob had fallen and was in the hospital. Then they lost electricity. Finally they got back to us and said there was no problem with the timeline, and the reason they got behind was because of our band. They BLAMED our band. Our band came up to us after toasts and explained that we were way behind on timeline and needed to move things quickly, otherwise they wouldn't get a chance to play. They certainly were in tune to the timeline.  Chandler's is awful, and the way they handled all of our mistakes was by complete denial and no accountability. They are not wedding professionals and I would never recommend a wedding here.  We had a big wedding of 250 guests, and all of them noticed the disorganization and know that they also would never use Chandler's.

WEDDING REVIEW

Chandlers- where can I begin.... only with a warning to NOT host your wedding at this venue if you are potentially considering it.  

My brother's wedding ceremony and reception was held there on 5/17/2014.  What a mess.  From the beginning when we walked in there was no assistance provided by Chandler's coordinator Kathy-- she popped in  to the bridal suite for about 5 minutes at the start to tell my sister in law she "looked great!" and then was nowhere to be seen for the rest of the evening.  

There was no communication as to what was to take place, and everyone was left on their own.  For the bride and groom's "first look" there was a Chandler's employee showing someone around on the gazebo area and NOT MOVING even after I said, "hey! they are going to do the first look now!" (something that should have been Kathy's job)  Clearly they care about trying to rope in new business, but did not give a crap about existing customers.  

Grounds were terrible-- bright orange tape running all over the greens--No flowers, tons of construction, nothing being done to hide the work during an OUTDOOR CEREMONY.  Also there was no direction on where we COULD take pictures, (again, Kathy was not present) but plenty of notice from Bob, the manager at Chandler's, about where we could not stand.  Any location we walked to, we were quickly told by Bob in a rude tone that it was a "danger zone" and to get out, but not given any alternatives on where we could stand for photos.  Adding a joke about the bride being hit by flying golf balls does not make your rude comments to move  funny, or OK.  Not even close.  You would expect a lot more from a manager, but not Bob!  Total nightmare!! The coordinator was nowhere to be seen.  Thanks Bob and Kathy for ruining the photographs and the mood of the bride right before the wedding ceremony! Super Job!  

On to the dinner- food was good, but the kitchen ran out of prime rib for some of the guests.  Not acceptable when you are running out of the higher priced dish that has already been paid for.

Highlight of the evening, the DJ Marty-- he was excellent!

WARNING to all brides-- DO NOT HOST YOUR WEDDING AT CHANDLERS.  Will be posting this review to as many review boards as possible so that future weddings will not have to  deal with the mess my brother and sister in law did.  

Brides:  Do yourself a favor: DO NOT HOST YOUR WEDDING AT CHANDLERS

Love this place. Amazing ribs, and the half slab of ribs with chicken fingers is a tasty combo. Anything fried here is superb: chucken, fries, kalamari, onion rings, zucchini, etc. always a golden brown. 

My favorite is the crab legs. My wife knows its going to be a long meal when I order them on account of how much you actually get. Verrry good all around. 

I haven't been there for burger or steak night but have heard rave reviews. 

They have a set menu but alternate between specials and seasonal things. It keeps my favorite restaurant fresh (and even after I try something new and delicious, we've got to go back soon bc the crab is amazing!!)
Decent food, I ordered the Saturday rib eye special and my wife ordered the NY strip. Service was okay, clientele was not your usual Yelp crowd, mostly locals

Went there tonight with my hubby. The back half of the remodeled area was PACKED.Let me add that it was 7pm. Past the typical dinner hour. The inside had 2 tables with people. The man seating us (we thought he was there playing golf they way he was dressed) sat us in the furthest corner under a cold vent at a teeny tiny table. We then sat almost 15 min before someone came. I was on call for work so we told our waitress that we may have to leave quick. She asked us for our drink order and we gave her our entire order. It took 9 min for her to bring our drinks and our salads. She showed up 2 minutes later with the bread. When our entrees came (I ordered well done and if I can figure out how to get the pictures here I'll show you what they think well done is.) there was no where on the table to put our dishes. I had to give up my salad before finishing it. My plate sat 1/3 off the table. The waitress asked twice if we wanted her to remove something from our table for more room to let her know. I don't know what she could have taken away to make more room. The food was decent. The salad was also on a tiny plate, no way to move the lettuce around without it falling on the table. This is where my husband and I got married in '05 and every once in awhile we go back. We also had my sister in laws baby shower here. Seriously debating if we will ever go back with the way it is now.

Stopped here last week with a few co-workers for lunch.  Great food.  Great staff.  Amazing customer service.  I will be back!

-Ryan

Surprising.  This is a solid choice for dinner, provided you have a lot of time and don't mind looking at a few respirators.

Good:
- Prices were the most reasonable I've seen in Schaumburg.  $17.99 for a good steak, $12.99 for pastas, $7.99-$9.99 for sandwiches with lots of daily specials
- Most entrees included a salad and a choice of side
- The rustic pasta was delicious, and generously sized
- Ample space, nice views of the golf course

Bad:
- Service was horrific until more tables got seated near us, and then the server had to come around to us
- Definitely more of an older crowd
- Don't get the rosemary chicken

This is the first time we went. We went for the fish fry (Lake Perch) since we enjoyed it so much at Snuggery. Very disappointed however. The fish was  overcooked and dry and had WAY to much batter on it. The service was terrible. Took 20 minutes just to get our check. Managers were standing around BS ing at the bar instead of taking care of business and their customers. Not sure if we will be back.
Pathetic service, 35 minutes just to take our order.  Decent food.  Good but expensive fish fry.

Worst service ever. We arrived tonight for dinner fairly early...we were the only one's in the restaurant and the waitress acted like she was waiting on about 10 other tables.  We had to eventually flag her down near the bar so she could take our order, as we have a two year old son, who is not going to sit at the dinner table for hours on end.  
When the waitress finally came to take our order, we asked if we could get some bread and crackers....she replied, yes that will come with the soup or salad. Very rude in the way she answered.
We also never received the crackers, when we asked for him the waitress informed us that she would have to go in the basement to get them.....ummm, ok, what kind of reply is that?  What place that serves soup with your meal, does not have crackers on hand??!!??  So we ask again,can you get them? and she replies, well they are in the basement!!  Anyways, she comes back 10 mins later with one pack of crackers and doesn't say anything to us.
I could go on and on, worst service ever AND the waitress with the long blonde hair should be fired immediately!!

My wife and I were there along with our 9 month old granddaughter on April 1st (no April fool joke here...). We had a reservation and were promptly seated. Overall, the service was fast and friendly even though it was getting busy for a Friday in Lent.  We went for the fish fry 2 yrs ago and really liked it.  This time all was very good except for the fish itself. Last ime it was moist and tender, this time kinda dry. Service was great, price was good, and by the way...

If you like a good garlic salad dressing - THIS ONE ROCKS!

So... Everything was good about this experience except for the fish.  I'm willing to give it one more try sometime, but kinda disappointed in this trip.

My friend and I were looking for a place to have a Lenten supper last Friday night.  I immediately thought of Chandlers for the fish fry.  I'd had their fish fry in the past, and told my friend that it was very good.  
We made a reservation for 7:00 pm and off we went.  We both ordered the fish fry dinner, and it was not what I expected or remembered.  The plates came out and the cod was served in skinny strips which resembled calamari.  I thought they'd brought us the wrong food until I tasted it, and it and found that it was indeed cod.  It wasn't very good, and we didn't finish our fish let alone ask for the second helping that comes with the dinner.
The waitress was borderline rude.  When she asked for our drink order, I asked her what was on draft.  She replied that nothing was on draft.  I then asked for a beer list, and she said they didn't have one and proceeded to rattle off a list of bottled beers.  It was surprising that nothing was on draft since they had a full bar.  Where were the taps?
After a mediocre dinner, and mediocre service, we decided to go elsewhere for dessert.  I'm glad we did.  I was embarrassed to have recommended Chandlers for the fish fry.

I've been to this place a few times just for appetizers with my friends and always left satisfied. So I decided to go there for dinner on a Tues night. The service there was great our waitress was friendly and more then willing to help us on what to pick for our dinners. We started out with the fillet Mignon  skewers which were awesome! Then I got the Rosemary chicken and my friend got a pasta with braised meat and mushrooms both were delicious but I'm not gonna lie his was amazing! She did recommend that we come back on a Thursday to get the ribs which she said was one of their specialties. All in all it was a fantastic experience and I can't wait to go back.

Here is the deal...

Play alot of golf at Schaumburg Golf Course. Chandler's is connected to the golf course so I figured I would check things out after a recent round.

Great Value! Steak Sandwich is to die for. Alot of old poeple but who cares....The steak sandwhich is bad ass.......I will def go back again. Loved it!

I wish that there was a way to give this place more stars.  I went here Saturday night and the place was pretty busy.  It is very casual and not at all formal, so there is no need to dress to impress as most people were in jeans.  There are tv's, a bar, and a fireplace in this clubhouse type restaurant.  My gf and I both got the Butt Steak (actually is part of the shoulder, not the ass) and that came with soup or salad and two sides.  We each got the minestrone which was Gluten Free or not depending on if you wanted noodles (awesome), my gf also got the salad for 1.99 extra (just typical salad, but good value), then we each got steamed broccoli and garlic mashed potatoes with our steaks.  OH MY GOD.  The steak was divine and so were the sides...there was actually a good taste to the broccoli which is shocking because sometimes it is bland.  The cost of the meal? $35.  Yes, $35 + tip.  I will be back here as often as possible! I loved this place and so did my gf.

went here Friday night with my fiancee 2 10 year old boys and my brother. It was quite busy. Our service was a bit slow....but it WAS busy....and the food came quickly. Overall....our meal was very good. I had the little mini tenderloin sandwiches...and they were just great. Cooked perfectly. My fiancee had the ribs which he said were very good....and as a rib snob that's saying a lot! My sons chicken fingers were delicious.as.well. my brother wasn't thrilled with the all you can eat Friday night fish fry...it was just so-so.....plus our waitress never came back to offer more.
Forth most part...everything was tasty and well prepared. Our only complaint.....and its not really even a complaint because we should have known? At 37 my fiancee was the youngest guy in the room. It was senior citizen central!! So as a "fun" place for kids or to hang out with friends or to take a romantic date? Not the place. Just to get some good food in you? Sure thing!!

No better fish fry than Fri nite at Chandler's.  All the lake perch you can eat for $9.99.  Steaks are great here too.  Very good quality meat for a very reasonable price.  $4 buck burgers on Wednesday are excellent.  I also like the broasted chicken dinners on Sun nite.  Heard the ribs are very tasty.  Drink prices are reasonable, especially the specials.  Ask for Holly.  She's the most attentive waitress.  One of my favorite places to eat.
Everyone was talking about how good the food was at my wedding. very yummy

We eat here regularly.  The food and service is always consistantly good.  The atmosphere is warm and comfortable.  They have interesting specials which we have always enjoyed.  The portions are good and the prices are reasonable.  They have wine and drink specials on the weekends, I think $2.50 for a glass of house wine and $3.00 for a cocktail made with Absolute vodka.

If you sign up on their website, they will send coupons and specials.

Food is good, not great, but very good.  But heavens, they do not know how to train their wait staff.  Last summer, after a round of golf, we sat down and I asked the waitress what brands of scotch are available; specifically, do they have McClelland 12?  She had no clue.  After a wait, she came back and said they did so I ordered one, neat.  After another even longer wait, she came back and told me the bartender wanted me to know the drink would cost $12.  Un-friggen-believable.  After another even longer wait, I actually got my drink.  Fast forward to this past Wednesday night.
