I told a different waitress I wanted a McClelland 12 and please let the bartender know that I know how much it cost.  She came back and told me they are out of McClelland 12.  Oh well.  Almost an hour later the restaurant was emptying and we still had no food.  When asked, the waitress said the kitchen was "slammed."  I got up and asked to speak to the manager.  The waitress had lied.  She had forgotten to turn in our order.  Like I said, the food is good.
Great Food, Service and Cant Miss Daily Dinner Specials

Chandler's is more like a bar than a restaurant.  It's located at the clubhouse of the Schaumburg Golf Course on Roselle Rd.  We first ordered drinks, but they really didn't have much of anything on tap.  Even the waitress said there was nothing good and she recommended the bottled beers.  I had a Beck's Dark which was good and my gf had the house wine (only $2.75/glass) and it was decent.  We ordered the sliders as our appetizers and they were tasty so we were looking forward to dinner.  I ordered the London Broil, which was really an 8 oz filet sliced up w/ a mushroom sauce on top.  I ordered it medium, but it was much closer to well done.  It was really nothing special.  For a "Chop House" I expected much better.  My gf ordered the mixed grill which included 1 dry piece of "rosemary" chicken (came with a sprig of rosemary, but no flavor of rosemary on the chicken), a 4oz filet which looked and tasted like something you would get from Ponderosa or Old Country Buffet, and some decent sized butterflied shrimp, which was cooked well and fairly good.  We both ordered the mashed sweet potatoes as our side since it is one of our favorite things to eat when we go out.  This was the first time I didn't even want to finish eating my sweet potato.  It had your usual spices likes cinnamon, sugar, along with some marshmallows, but there was something else that just really didn't go well with it.  Despite the food, the waitress was very friendly and seemed to be pretty attentive.  I would only go back for appetizers and maybe a burger.

Wow!, I wish I had one of these around my house.

This is just another one of those places that I happened to stumble upon when we were on our way to go to cascade outdoor movie theater. 
  You are not going to see billboards, flashy lights, etc. in order for you to find this place. Just a yelp review : )
  When my wife and I were in the area, she happened to suggest checking out yelp to see if there was any places located around us to eat.
 That is how I had located Zenwich. So thank you fellow yelpers. 
 When we entered their location. Again nothing flashy just a order menu with some pretty interesting sandwiches. 
 I ordered the Korean cheese steak. When I took a bite into that sandwich, I noticed my mouth like one of those cheesy commercials you see on tv, going crazy with excitement. 
 This sandwich is #$*@ Good!. It was so good I had to order another. And then also one to go. Don't judge me ; ) 
 What can I say.  When you find something you like, you seem to buy more : ) 
 So if you are in the area, I can only advise to stop here and try one of their sandwiches. I am quite positive that you will not be disappointed. I know that we were not. 

Thanks Yelpers!

WOW! Where has this place been all my life!? Seriously AMAZING. I LOVE bahn mi sandwiches but have had a hard time finding a good / fresh bahn mi in the suburbs (and the city too sometimes). This place is perfect when I get a craving for bahn mi, even though it's a bit more asian fusion. But don't let that discourage you! The outside is very unassuming (it's in a strip mall) but these sandwiches are some of the best bahn mi style sandwiches I have ever had. I tried the shrimp one and my mom tried the chicken satay one. We were both blown away. The sandwiches were warm, bread was so fluffy and soft, and tons of fresh veggies. The shrimp looked fresh too. 

I almost forgot: they have these homemade "chips" with an amazing seasoning on them! YUM!

The flavors will knock your socks off! Prices are not bad either - about $8 bucks for a sandwich. Think outside the box and try this version of bahn mi. You won't be disappointed!

Gosh,
I'm so sad to report but, Zenwich is NOT all that... :(

Yes, they have a wide variety of Vegetarian and Vegan options which is a total plus and made me want to eat there but...The meal was mediocre at best. 

Kinda felt like the excitement was gone from the space and whoever was cooking, was just "going through the motions." :(

Sandwich, was barely warm and the fries we're not freshly cut, seemed like diner fries and we're 100% soggy. :(

Hoping it was just an "off" day for the place and the cooks.

Exactly as I hoped it would be with all these great reviews! I got the spicy shrimp and it was amazing. I couldn't get enough of that sauce. And the shrimp were a perfect size. I really enjoyed the homemade chips as well. Got a bottle of root beer. I'm glad I did cause damn that was spicy! I can't wait to go back for the crab cake and tofu sandwiches. It's pricy but I worth it because I was full after just one half.

I was very impressed with this place!  

When I heard about the spicy garlic sandwich it sounded like an Asian style po boy and I knew I had to try it.  Everything about it was great.  Lightly battered, plump shrimp smothered with their sauce in some incredibly soft ciabatta bread.  I also had half of the mu ping sandwich and while it was also amazing, the shrimp did have the slight edge.  I ALMOST went back for dinner and got another shrimp sammy but decided against it.  The chips and ginger cole slaw were pretty decent but weren't anything that really stole my taste buds away from the sandwich.  The chips were plain for me and the slaw was a little too sweet and saucy.  It would be cool if they could do sweet potato fries.  Regardless, the sandwiches are definitely worth everyone trying and are my new food obsession!

Decided to give Zenwich a try since I was picking up a cake in the area. From the outside, Zenwich is very unassuming. I would say the inside as well. It is quite small--would probably fit 20 people max. When I looked at the menu, I knew this place had to be great! Zenwich offers Asian fusion in the form of sandwiches. They range from Thai, to Chinese, to Japanese, or even Korean! 

We came on a Saturday afternoon and it was moderately busy. I chose the Spicy Garlic Shrimp while my boyfriend had the Spicy Basil Chicken that was a special that day. I subbed the chips for cucumber salad, while he subbed his chips for wasabi coleslaw. To sub, it is 50 extra! The total for two sandwiches was around $20. Our sandwiches came out within 5 minutes and everyone is so friendly there!

Overall, we really enjoyed our visit and would definitely come back. I like that every sandwich comes with a side and a pickle (: My boyfriend and I both agreed that our sandwiches lacked some sort of crunch or sourness--I guess that's what our sides are for! My Spicy Garlic Shrimp was delicious, especially with its arugula; however, I would have really enjoyed if they seasoned the batter for their shrimp. The sandwich was chock full of yummy shrimp with spicy aioli, but the shrimp itself was in desperate need of seasoning.
Crab sandwich in a lettuce wrap. Thai iced tea. I want to order more!  but I'm hooked. One day I'll venture out.

Always skeptical when you try to merge Asian and western concepts. I'm a purists??  Naw. But this one worked.  Had the beef curry.  Won't become a staple but maybe u can grow into it.  Nice distinct Asian flavors. And clever interpretation of both styles. ;)

Ps, A food critic's instinct is to be a skeptic????  No, not here.  You have my 5-stars for the curry pork sandwich.

Asian flavors with Italian bread!

Well not exactly Italian bread, but it's probably how I would describe it to anyone that hasn't been here yet. I tend to like places more when no one knows anything about it vs. places that have 200+ reviews simple because I'm usually disappointed as it seems more overrated. 

As of this moment only tried the Crab Cake Sandwich, Pork Katsu Sandwich, and Spicy Garlic Shrimp Sandwich. Would order all three again. $8.50ish sandwich that now comes with chips. (use to be $7.50ish with no chips) I came on Saturday afternoon possible around 2 and although not standing out the door. Had to walk out as there was no place to stand without being in front/behind someone that was already eating.

Will be coming back here VERY often.

Four star food, one star service tonight.

I got a delicious tofu-katsu sandwich. No problem there. The issue was my wife ordered first and had to repeat her order three times to the woman at the register. My daughter then ordered her sandwich with unseasoned fries. I then ordered my sandwich, also with unseasoned fries. The woman stared blankly at me after I gave her my order and said "sorry I just totally spaced out. What did you want?" So I repeated it.  Five minutes later our orders are brought to the table. Both my daughter and I get our sandwiches with seasoned chips, not unseasoned fries. Shouldn't be a big deal, right?

We let the server know and she took away our sandwiches with the chips and the woman behind the counter asked what was wrong and we both said we ordered unseasoned fries. She was confused. We reminded her we had to repeat our orders multiple times and she just must have made a mistake to which she replied "fries will be $2 extra." Okay. So I get out my wallet and she says it'll be $5.50 or some amount close to that. I was now confused and asked "but you said the fries are $2 extra. She replied that it's $2 extra per order IF we get the fries with the sandwich but if we order them after, they're $2.50 each. Huh? We did order them with our sandwiches we said. "Well that order is closed now, so I have to put it in as a new order." She saw nothing wrong with this crazy logic.

I gave up and said, please just give us some chips, at this point our sandwiches are getting cold. 

I noticed as we left that there was a Help Wanted sign in the window. I hope the management gets some better help or at least can do some very basic training for the help they already have. The sandwich was good but the service was laughable. And we were the only customers there, so it's not like they were busy.
Always enjoy coming here a true hole in the wall kinda of joint for sandwiches .... love their chips

This is a tiny sandwich shop in a non-descript strip mall in Elmhurst.  It's so much better than what you would expect by looking at the exterior.  You know what the say, don't judge a book by it's cover!

I went with my friend Courtney C., who's been here a few times and said everything was delicious.  I ordered the Pork Katsu, a fried pork cutlet with coleslaw, watercress, a tangy sauce and mustard, served on a toasty bun.  This sandwich was so flavorful for...a sandwich!  I don't know if the bread is homemade, but the bread is yummy and the ideal size for containing all of the sandwich ingredients.  I like the Asian-inspired spin on the food here.

Sandwiches are served with chips & pickle, but watch out - those chips are spicy!  I like spicy food, but these were a bit much for me.  

You can eat here, but there is a limited amount of tables.  It was super busy when we were here, on a Monday, at 2-3pm!  I'm not sure what this looks like during the lunch rush, probably a lot of to-go orders.  Food comes out fast, but not super fast, since they cook your food as you order it.

Lunch here was very affordable, my sandwich and a drink came out to about $11 and it's far superior to all of the chain sandwich shops nearby.

The outside and even inside is a bit questionable... Lol BUT THE FOOD IS DELICIOUS!! So many awesome vegan and vegetarian options! I had the ping tofu sandwich I believe! and mmmmm it made me so happy. Fresh veggies... Crunchy fried tofu.. And Delicious sauce. I also had the seaweed salad and it was yummy as well. 

I was going to take some pictures of my food but I vacuumed that zenwhich in my tummy before any of that could happen lol. The people working were really chill too. Awesome. Super satisfied

A decent choice for gluten-free and vegetarian options.

Suggestions:
1) Don't charge $1 to convert a sandwich to a lettuce wrap or rice paper wrap.
2) Wash the produce.  I saw an unwashed head of romaine being cut up for my wrap.
3) Wear gloves or wash your hands before making a sandwich.

Literally the only decent place to get lunch in Elmhurst (sorry). Fills up QUICK at lunchtime, so plan accordingly. Your best bet is to call ahead and order, and then take your awesome sandwich and bomb chips to go (sometimes hard to find a table). 
Crab cake sandwich is my go-to. All the sides are good, but the chips are my favorite. Also, if they have the homemade toffee up front, don't think twice, just eat it.

I've tried the Mu Ping and the Korean Cheese Steak and both were very delicious. I usually don't like sandwiches but this is one of the only places I actually go out of my way to get some. The interior is a what you expect from a typical small business in a plaza (small and plain) but what goes in your stomach is the most important. If you are near Elmhurst and are craving sandwiches or want something to-go, get Zenwich!

Soo excited to finally try it!!! And OMG it was amazing!!!! My ping was fantastic I had it in rice paper for a healthy choice. It was loaded with veggies and flavor. My boss had garic shrimp was also very good. I can't wait to come back. What a great choices of different sandwiches. Love this place!!!

Small place.
Great grilled pork sandwich.
KBBQ sandwich was a bit sweet.
Menu is limited in terms of offerings.
Quick and friendly service.

Seriously the best place! This is a diamond in the rough. People don't know enough about this place! I love the variety of food and I'm vegetarian. Not just one option... they have a vegetarian menu and a regular menu. Food has great flavors and I've rendered my whole family here

Man, I really like this place. It's a little too trendy for me, but I still love it. I usually order the crab cake sandwich, I imagine that's not the exact name for it, but that's what is on it and it's delicious. I plan on getting it again, possibly today... just writing about it reminds me about how much I love it. 
The place is small, and you should probably order ahead. But, I've never had anything I didn't like, and I find it reasonably priced for the lunch you'll get. Yeah, you're spending more than McDonlads...but you're getting good real food... so, it's probably worth it.

Nice concept and good sandwich that is fairly reminiscent to Bahn Mi but instead of a French baguette it's served sorta panini style.

The Chicken Satay Zenwich was delicious and fuses all that is good about satay and puts it into a tasty sandwich...it's topped w daikon, carrot, cucumber, red onion, jalapeno and drizzled with a light peanut sauce.

The Zen salad was a little less revolutionary and a bit disappointing.  Simple spinach and arugula with a few diced pears and almonds thrown in the center. Terrible prep and presentation to be honest but going 4 star simply bc of the place's namesake is done so well.

Want simple and delicious sandwich but tired of the same old sandwich places? This is it! I stumble upon this place with my friend. They have a small menu but it hits the spot. They have tofu options, kids menu, and salads as well. I got chicken satay without jalapenos. Yummy yummy in my tummy!
This place is a hidden jam. Highly recommended by my tummy.

Best sandwich I have ever had! 
Crabcake sandwich.. drool. :)
Chips are homemade & taste like spicy BBQ.
So bomb!
You need to stop by.. Dont let be fooled by the outside look.. Grab and go.. You will taste heaven.. Next try is shrimp one..
OMG so good! Everything. Maybe a little expensive, but food was filling, fresh and extremely tasty. Not a lot of seating, so not great for big groups, but you can order pickup too! 100% recommend!

Ordered the spicy shrimp sandwich it was amazing!!! I made it spicier by adding siracha ! My side was the ginger coleslaw it was sooooo good! I felt like my sandwich needed an extra crunch so it tossed it in my sandwich . It came with a pickle which I normally love. But with Asian sandwiches I thought it was weird and couldn't dare eat it. Thanks will be back again to try the crab cake and veggie options!!!! Love love love love this place !!!!!!!

Shrimp Po Boy - I have not ordered anything but this but OMG its delicious. Other coworkers have ordered some curried sandwich, which they stated was absolutely divine and I would love it but I have not yet tried it.

It's a small footprint so get there before noon or  you may not have a place to sit.

The food I have had and my friends have had is amazing and I would recommend anyone in the area stop in and check it out!

Ambiance: cozy, at times cramped
Food: BOMB-ASS SAMMYS
Value: Totally worth it!
Popped by for the first time and enjoyed the MuPing sandwich and homemade chips. Good stuff. Food is definitely original and fresh tasting.

Oh hell yes! Zenwich  = 10 wich

I ordered the third most popular item on the menu (didn't know that at the time)

I read a review about the Satay Sandwich and and have been jonesing for it ever since... I was sure that it couldn't live up to my expectations. I've been talking about going there and that sandwich for so long that my wife Lisa was just as stoked.

Approached with trepidation...

Exceeded expectations... That was one of my (and Lisa's) favorite sandwiches of all time. Awesome , The owner came over and talked to us for a while, his newplace in downtown Chicago is doing well.. a really nice guy.

So my sandwich came with some spiced potato chips (sure I'd love fries, but the chips were really good) and a regular pickle.

Even though it's only the third most popular.. I can't see myself getting anything else I loved it so much.

For those that would like to know the even more popular sandwiches.. The Garlic Shrimp and the Crab Cake Sandwiches are the ultimate big sellers..  but I'm feeling pretty good about my third place explosion of flavor.

It's a small, casual place.. not super comfortable... iridescent green walls.. but, in my opinion .. just about perfect!

Savory, refreshing, refined yet chill,
1.  Gps locate this place - it is in a small strip mall and can be missed
2.  Be prepared to chill.  This place isn't about fancy interior - it is about a well prepared sandwich you will remember ... Pretense needs to be left at home or in your tesla
3.  Staff-  I have no idea who owns this place but they recruit well.  I was greeted, time was taken to talk to me about what was great about what I was ordering.  So personable and inviting.
4.  Food -  this isn't your average sandwich shop but it also isn't extreme.  Anyone can order food here - it isn't complicated but it also isn't subway.  Talk to the staff, read through the well described menu- I have to return because there are several sandwiches I'm interested in. 
Basically- go to this place.  If you are local to Elmhurst you have no excuse ... If you are not  -it is right off the expressway.  Easy peasy

LOVE!!!  I would rarely try a restaurant in a strip mall.  My boyfriend brought me here for lunch and the location had me feeling skeptical.  I was wrong.  

The food at Zenwich is creative and delicious.  The Mu Ping sandwich is my favorite, along with a side of seaweed salad.  You won't regret any meal here.

Outstanding food!!! My wife and I ordered two sandwiches (Korean Cheese Steak and Chicken Satay) and the Peanut Salad, and moaned obnoxiously with every single bite. Tried not to, but couldn't control ourselves. It was that divine.

This place needs to go national -- or at least expand to Minneapolis, where we live. :)

The food is great and you really get your money's worth! It's nice to find vegan and gluten free options in town. I usually order the tofu satay sandwich or the peanut salad with fried tofu. My hubby loves their veggie tempura sandwich!

TL;DR Pricey, hit or miss, when they hit they're phenomenal, worth at least one trip

After seeing this place pop up on yelp searches over and over again, we decided it was time to take the plunge. We went on a Sunday and there was ample parking and minimal waiting. We stepped up to the counter and had a few ideas about what we wanted. We ordered a Chicken Satay sandwich and a Garlic Shrimp sandwich. Both came with homemade chips. Prices were $8-$10 per sandwich. 

Garlic Shrimp: This little pocket of heaven was delicious, very garlicky, very generous amount of perfectly seasoned shrimp 9/10 

Chicken Satay: This sandwich fell WAY short of the garlic shrimp offering, the flavors were bland, there was no pop to this bad boy at all. It needed more curry and some sort of cilantro aioli. 4/10 

Homemade chips: the chips were nice and crunchy but the seasoning salt was very unevenly distributed, some of the chips were salt licks and others had very little flavor. 

At the end of the day I probably won't be back to Zenwich, but if I do find myself back there I would try different offerings for sure.

Delicious food -- one of those "hole in the wall" places that survives because the food they make is darn good.  The facility leaves a lot to be desired, but that is easy to look over because the quality is so good. 

Unique flavors and tasty sides make this a destination place where ever you live in the burbs.

Always look forward to when my job takes me to Elmhurst so I can stop at Zenwich! Everything looks sooo good but the spicy garlic shrimp sandwich in the rice paper (like a spring roll wrapper) is so delicious I can never seem to order anything else. The menu is great for gluten-free folks and vegetarians, too. Chips have a great spice blend on them that you won't find anywhere else. This is not going to be drive-through speed and it's not supposed to be, so keep that in mind if you're heading there during a busy lunch hour. I love this place!

Creative and delicious! Love this place. Of course it is located in a tiny hole of a restaurant in a strip mall. Enter, order at counter, get number, be seated. I got the pork sandwich, which was basically a take on a bahn mi. It was excellent. Husband got the curry beef sandwich. It had great flavor but was very messy. The shrimp seems to be a really popular option, will probably try that next time. Seating is self-serve and very limited. During peak times the tables are all filled, but they seem to turn over quickly. Will definitely be back!

I happened to be in the area and decided to check out Zenwich after seeing its solid reviews. Usually I'm not a big sandwich fan because they typically don't fill me up and I'd rather get something meatier for the price. However, Zenwich did have an interesting menu with an Asian fusion approach to their sandwiches. 

Just like other suburban gems, Zenwich is in the middle of a random strip mall. The space isn't that big, with maybe 3 or 4 tables and then a small counter space against the wall with around 4 more stools. It seemed like most of the people were taking their orders to go. You order at the counter and they warn you that every sandwich is made to order, so it could take 5-10 minutes to prepare. The guy who rang me up seemed to the be the owner and he was pretty cool. He was giving suggestions about the menu and was just generally making some small talk. He hand delivered all the sandwiches to the tables and I noticed him checking up on everyone to make sure they enjoyed the food. 

I ended up getting the spicy garlic shrimp zenwich. Seeing the words spicy and garlic next to each other on a menu is usually a sure-fire sign of a solid choice. Although I didn't think it was really that spicy or even had a strong garlic flavor, I still thought it was pretty tasty. The first thing that jumps out at you is the sauce that came in the sandwich. It was kinda like a mild Asian styled ranch sauce, and it was super creamy with just the slightest kick of spice. The shrimp was lightly breaded and fried, and surprisingly there was a decent amount of it in the sandwich. Even though there was a ton of aioli in there, the shrimp flavor still came through. The ciabatta bread was soft in the middle with a crisp crust, while the arugula and cilantro added a nice freshness to the sandwich. Together it kind of had that salad sandwich vibe going on. It also came with homemade chips, which were a nice surprise. Whenever I have a choice between fries and chips, I always go with the fries. These chips though were crispy and had a unique spice seasoning on it (with just the slightest hint of sweetness), which I really liked. 

Overall, it was a pretty solid sandwich. I was slightly disappointed that it was a little weak in the garlic department, but maybe I'm the oddball that wants garlic so strong your breath stank. The total came out to be around $10, so it's up there in terms of price for a medium sized sandwich, but they do have quality ingredients and original flavors to make it worth it.

I guess I just don't get the hype. Or maybe it's because, living in Chicagoland, we are spoiled with having so many great sandwich shops on top of all the other amazing dining options...that I guess I just wasn't amazed. 

What was good? The cheesesteak sandwich was very good. They make a coconut milk based salsa for the sandwich that they mix right there when you ask for it. So the sandwich did have a very fresh taste to it, and it was moderately filling. Good stuff. My wife had the chicken teriyaki sandwich which was good. It was mostly cucumber and other vegetables, but it was a good, light, sandwich. 

What wasn't so good? The fried calamari appetizer. It isn't fresh calamari. Take it or leave it. Also...the price. I'm not a cheapskate when it comes to dining out. I have no problem dropping serious coin on a seriously good meal. Two sandwiches, an appetizer, a bottled water (yes...you have to purchase water here) and a root beer was $30. Again...don't get me wrong...$15/pp isn't a bad price for dinner. That's not the problem. But again...in Chicagoland where we are spoiled with amazing delis that will get you a great sandwich & soft drink for $5...it's just hard to pay triple that and not come away feeling like, "meh". 

If I'm in the area and hungry I would go back. There is a beef curry sandwich that sounds good. Nice people run this business...and that's a plus. I like giving my business to nice business owners.

I have literally been dreaming of my lunch from Zenwich for a week now since the last time I was there. Ohh how I must go back...

I had heard of Zenwich before, but really did not understand the hype until I walked in there for lunch - the line was out the door! Now, it's not a very big place to begin with (a lot of people seemed to be placing orders to go), but luckily my group snagged a seat in the midst of the hustle and bustle.

Their menu includes a load of delicious options so choosing one was definitely hard. But hey, more reason to go back and dive into the rest of the menu, am I right?

I ended up going with the ROI (Chicken Teriyaki) sandwich (or shall I say ZENwich) and it was AMAZE-balls. The delicious-ness between those two pieces of bread included grilled chicken, lettuce, grilled onion and mushroom with wasabi infused teriyaki sauce and honey mustard. Need I say more?

They have a few different sides to choose from to accompany your sandwich. I went with the cucumber salad which was excellent - fresh and delicious to say the least. I of course also welcomed a pickle spear on the side (for good measure of course). 

If you're looking for a whole new foodie adventure, these asian inspired sandwiches are the way to go!
Great food love the peanut salad, the homemade peanut sauce is delicious with a hint of spice! Great sandwiches, great homemade chips! You won't be disappointed!

I've been thinking about my Zenwich for four days now. It is just SO good. So fresh. So simple, yet a perfect, filling lunch set between soft yet crunchy bread. 

First of all, if you haven't figured it out from other reviews, this place is teeny tiny. Yet don't be dissuaded if you can't grab a seat at one of the five tables. Just snag your sandwich and get the hell out. Second, I don't think you can go wrong with whatever you order. I personally went with the Chicken Satay Zenwich with my side of choice being the cucumber salad. To say it was delicious is putting it mildly. Twas just the right mix of flavorful chicken, shredded carrots, tons o' veggies and thin (housemade) peanut sauce. 

You can grab a bottled beverage while you wait for your surely awesome Zenwich. Nom-namaste for everyone (h/t to Danny W).

It's 9:30am and I could already go for a Zenwich sandwich.  Yeah, that's how good this place is.  

Driving past, you really wouldn't think to maybe stop here.  The sign is faded, it's located in a little strip mall and seating in limited.  But don't let that stop you from tasting this hidden gem. Asian inspired ingredients paired perfectly with fresh bread will always have your taste buds going for a ride.  Highly recommend the Famous Remus, Bryanism and the Crab Cake Sandwich.  My friend who is vegetarian, tried the Tofu Ping and said the tofu was prepared perfectly. Their Wasbai coleslaw or seasoned chips gives you the perfect crunch and heat that your sandwich needs for a sidekick.  I'm actually okay with the fact that they don't offer a lot of options on their menu - it's just enough to showcase their undeniable craft and passion.  

Highly recommended.

I would eat Zenwich every single day if I could. I am also considering a wedding cake made out of Zenwiches. 

Their sandwiches are the most satisfying lunch you could ask for. HIGHLY recommend the Spicy Garlic Shrimp, Pork Katsu, and the Mu Ping. And the Korean BBQ beef!! I absolutely adore their home made chips, as well as the wasabi cole slaw. I could go on for days. I usually have to save half of my sandwich for later in the afternoon - which always gives me something to look forward to around 3pm. They also have Thai Iced Tea in cans - just as delicious as the real thing :)

I used to love this place so much... until they opened their downtown location. It's so sad because this place used to be so amazing; dare I even say life changing. I'm going to send an email to let them know, but things have definitely changed in the quality of the food. They upped their prices - which I could care less about since their sandwiches are pretty gourmet and extremely filling. However, their quality went down as they upped their prices. That don't make no sense to me.

I have no problem paying $9 for one of their sandwiches - I'm just so saddened by the deteriorating quality they're currently putting out.

I always get either the crab cake sandwich or the spicy shrimp. Before the shrimp used to be so fresh and CRISPY. Now it's just soggy breading around cold shrimp. I've ordered twice since I felt like the quality went down and each time it's been poor. 

I can't leave a one star review because I truly do love this place. I'm just really sad to see - from what is seems - that the owners have abandoned their Elmhurst location. Please don't let that happen Zenwich!

EDIT:
They gave me a free meal. It was still kinda cold, but I love zenwich so much that I can't just leave them a mediocre review. They really are a one of a kind asian infusion sandwich shop - AND I'M ASIAN.
OMG so so good. Meal was superb. You won't be disappointed with anything here on the menu. Best bread soft not to hard. Perfect. Ate in could be a little nicer for dining in. Location in strip mall.
Yuk! Hype is all about the great menu and NOT about the execution. Food was gross and boring. Bathroom filthy. Big YELP let down!

Fresh and delicious samis will call to you in your dreams. I really have never been disappointed with anything I have eaten here be it Soup, salad or sandwich. While difficult to choose my favorite has to be the MuPing with its caramelized pork and crisp veggies... nom i'm drooling.

Ever since my +1 suggested it, I was STOKED to try Zenwich!  First glance at the menu - and the lovely Candice's review - confirmed the presence of many veggie options!  Score!

The location is in a strip mall and has a smallish interior.  It seems most folks took take out orders, but a few - like us - stayed and enjoyed our dinner.  The owner was very nice - he not only explained the menu to us, but showed us sizes that helped us decide what to order/what we could share.  He also chatted with my +1 at the end of the night and, even though we accidentally stayed a little past closing - was chatty and welcoming.

We ordered the calamari strips to share.  I really enjoyed the crust and how large they were (I'd only had calamari slices before).  The sauce was delicious!

After much deliberation (and some apprehension about just HOW spicy the tofu might be..), I ordered the Crabby Yola (crab cake) sandwich. It had a nice blend of flavors, especially with the baby greens and basil sauce.  Knowing it wouldn't keep well without getting soggy the next day, I forced my +1 to finish the rest of it with me! :)  

My +1 got the ROI (Chicken Teriyaki). The flavors were good, but I think the chicken was a tad on the dry side.  The ginger slaw was OK (a bit runnier than I like), but I really enjoyed the home made chips - they had a great spice!

The owner gave me a stamp card for my next visits.  I'll have to come back and try the Wasabi Coleslaw and also see when they have a special on Spicy Tofu, since I'm feeling brave! :)

Love this place!! My family loves this place!! 
Great, fresh, real food - always!

Now, ive only been here once. But man o man was it worth the visit! I ordered the Pork Katsu and my buddy had the Korean Cheesesteak. We were both indulged in the creativity instantly! 

Im staying at a hotel nrar by, here to stay for a few days for work and I can't wait to go back. 

Small little spot, been open for about 6 years. Dont come with the family you wont get a spot to sit. We didnt have to wait for more than 5 munutes for our food to come out. I didnt quite get a chance to peep the apps, was "hangry" upon entry. (Hangry- hungry and angry) but I dont recommend the chips that come with the order. A bit on the soft side. 

All in all BOOM loved it. Recommend it.

Had the Chicken Satay and seaweed salad.All the flavors were on point from the veggies to the chicken. I wish it had more of the chicken though,had more vegetables than anything. The chips on the side,I wasn't a fan of.Will I return? Maybe.

So good. Soo soooo good.
Lettuce wrap sandwiches are like giant delicious spring rolls. My dreams have come true!

This place is absolutely delicious! Their sandwiches are unique and so good! I can guarantee you have never had anything like the food they have here. Most sandwiches have been done before, but these sandwiches have never been done. It is seriously top notch. My favorite was their spicy garlic shrimp. It wasn't that spicy so don't be deterred if you don't like spicy foods. I'm not a fan of anything too hot and this was the perfect balance of sweet and heat. The other sandwich I tried is nothing to sneeze at. I got the pork katsu and that was seriously delicious. My one complaint was that the place was way to small for the amount of customers they receive, so be careful if you are planning on eating there; avoid the mad lunch rush. However, their sandwiches are well worth the hassle. I would suggest you put it on your bucket list... seriously... next to visiting the Eiffel tower.

Great service! Had the Tofu Ping - served with yummy chips. It's located in a strip mall, don't let that deter you!  Healthy choices! We rode our bikes on the prairie path to get here from Glen Ellyn. Great stop!
Been here 3 times now and each time the food has been very very good. The workers have also been very polite. What more can you ask?

Distant from O'Hare airport: Approximately 20 minutes by car

I was looking for a place near O'hare to eat and couldn't resist checking this place after reading all the great reviews.  The restaurant is located in a small strip mall next to a convenient store.  The inside is small with enough seating for about 20 people.  When the weather is cold, it's a bit chilly inside.  I guess you can say, it's a "cool" place to eat.

The boards on the wall showed weekly specials and soup of the day.  There are also pictures of the sandwiches on the other side of the wall.  There's a sign that says the shop is a gourmet sandwich shop and the food is made to order.  I've been here a few times and tried the following:

CRABBY YOLA - $8 - "Japanese style panko crusted homemade crab cake and baby greens topped with homemade creamy garlic basil aioli." This was pretty delicious.  The crab cakes had great texture (slightly crunchy on the outside) and flavors.  The sandwiches some with a pickle and a choice of a side.

ROI - $8 - "Grilled chicken, lettuce, grilled onion and mushroom with wasabi infused teriyaki sauce and honey mustard."  I tried a bite of this and it was good.  Rarely am I in the mood for a chicken sandwich, so this is not something I would order.

Famous Remu - $8 - "Grilled caramelized pork, shredded carrot and daiko, cucumber, red."  This one reminded me a lot of the Vietnamese sandwich (banh mi).  It was fresh and delicious.

SEASONED CHIPS - Kinda BBQish and some other flavors.  Pretty addicting.
PORK SESAME MISO SOUP - $2.50 - Pretty good, has characteristics similar to beef stew with a miso twist.

VEGETABLE TEMPURA -  I'm not sure what kind of vegetables were deep fried, but it was good.  The sauce was on the sweet side, which I normally don't like, but it went very well with the vegetables.

CALAMARI STRIPS - $4 - This was good with the dipping sauce that came with it.  Crispy on the outside and not so chewy on the inside.

The service was fast and friendly!

The crab cake and spicy shrimp sandwiches were delicious!  They are good sized and pack a little late heat!  I don't know which one I'd pick if I went back, maybe the shrimp one or try something new :)  They had great friendly staff and even options for the kiddos.  We'll be back for another lunch boondoggle soon!

OK for starters, the place is small and can be crowded at lunch and weekends! So order ahead.  Ordering online is sublime - great easy system.  Here's the good:  sandwiches  are very tasty. In fact, the first time I tried the Chicken Satay it was like to die for. I went back a week later and tried another sandwich, and while it too was so good, I thought the sauce tasted pretty much the same which disappointed me. Here's the not so good: their signature seasoned chips are not all that great because they seem a bit damp or something.  I have had them several times and would pass them up in a heartbeat. Next, $2 for a 12 ounce bottled water? WHAT? That is just wrong!  Kids meals - pass them up.  YUCK - they cut off the crust on WHITE BREAD and plop on chicken and some sauce which gets soaked up in the bread.  I wasted $9 on two kids sandwiches that came with soggy cold french fries. Never order the kids meals.  I thought they would be smaller versions of the full sized sandwiches but not true.  Finally, while the sandwiches are really overall really nice and tasty @ roughly $9 that is just too much to pay.  I would prefer to go up the street across from Mariano's and get real Thai take out for the same price.

I order from here at least once a month for lunch. Spicy garlic shrimp, curry tofu, fried tofu and the kimchi soup are just a few of my favorites. Quick service, food is fresh and the staff is beyond nice. One of my favorite places for lunch

Delicious! I had the GF spicy shrimp in a rice paper wrap (of course you can get it on bread instead of a paper wrap) and it was so awesome! I called back the restaurant to check if the shrimp was gluten free because the "breading" on it sure did not seem like it. They said it is GF and is coated with corn flour.  The shrimp was perfectly crisp with a nice creamy garlic spice mayo type sauce with a lot of greens packed in it. It also came with a pickle and homemade potato chips.  I will def be back to try other items on this really interesting cross-cultural menu:)

Great tasting sandwiches (at least the Mu Ping pork cutlet sandwich) and really great tasting homemade potato chips here.  We were in area and dropped in for an afternoon snack.  The Mu Ping sandwich and the chips went for $7.75.  The place is no frills, small (maybe 20 seats) and slightly pricey, but you are getting great quality and freshness here.  The homemade chips were really addictive and had a very tasty homemade seasoning (sugar and cinnamon were amongst the flavorings I tasted).  The aioli sauce on the sandwich was surprisingly a little runny but didn't really detract from anything.  I found about all the homemade stuff from chatting a little with Nate, the friendly Thai owner who started this business 5.5 years ago with his wife.   They just recently opened their second store in the city on Van Buren.  If you're looking for good Asian fusion sandwiches, I would highly recommend.

ps - In a totally random coincidence, Yelp just put out this list of Top Places to Eat in the US for 2015: 

http://officialblog.yelp.com/2015/01/yelps-top-100-places-to-eat-in-the-us-for-2015.html

and Zenwich is one of only two IL businesses on the list!  This was courtesy of some Yelp algorithm.

SANDWICH LOVERS LISTEN CLOSELY!!! Extreme quality and the most delicious sandwiches are produced by this restaurant which happen to be located in a non-assuming strip mall.  However, Do Not let the location fool you!!!  This please deserves all the five star reviews it has received.  The service is super friendly, sauces are delicious and the sandwiches are freakin DA BOMB!! Honestly, every bite tasted like heaven!!  Five stars all around.  P.S. Thank you for the free chips.  I will return if I ever find myself within 10 miles!!  Highly recommend to all yelpers. You will not be disappointed.

If you haven't been there you must try this place. My favorite is the spicy shrimp sandwich. So unique. This place really has its own cult following. Lots of people don't know where it is but once they find it they're hooked. Great seasonings and sauces, great calamari although different from what you are used to. I have never had anything I haven't really enjoyed. Pretty cheap too.

I was going to give this a 4 but just the sheer passion for the food and service from the owner makes this a five. You can really tell that he takes pride in his food, and is very hands on in all aspects of the restaurant. Very friendly.

We got the spicy shrimp sandwich and the korean beef sandwich. Both were $9. The korean beef was a little lackluster. Not bad at all, don't get me wrong, but imagine some beef stir fry between some bread, and you've got your korean beef sandwich. 

The spicy shrimp sandwich was spectacular however. Have you ever had the bang bang shrimp at Bonefish? It kind of reminds me of that but better. You get some nice big shrimp and this zingy aioli that just sets it over the top. An absolute must have. 

All sandwiches come with a pickle spear and house made chips, which are fantastic. They put some sugar and spice on them, a very good touch.

Don't sleep on this place! Its great!
Sweet little place to stop by for a quick bite. Their spicy garlic shrimp sandwich was so unbelievable, my mouth waters just remembering it.

Great sandwich place to mix it up at, if you are tired of the same old fast casual places in the suburbs this is a great spot to try.

The Burger and the Reuben are especially fantastic.

We stopped by for a quick bite while driving past Chicago on a roadtrip. Zenwich is conveniently located just off the 290. 

We had the garlic shrimp and mu ping sandwiches. Both are tasty, full of flavor, and have a little heat kick. The chips were not that interesting. 

We will definitely be back to try other sandwiches when we pass by again!

Everything good said about this place is true. The Mu Ping, the Crab Cakes. Every sandwich I've had from here is excellent. Pleasing flavors that you wouldn't necessarily expect. Good with their edamame side. This place is the bomb. The seating space is a little small, and it can be chilly on a cold day, but the food is worth it. The prices are super reasonable too.

Absolutely love this place! Came here today for the third time. Had the Spicy Garlic Shrimp sandwich. Once again, it was AMAZING! The baby spinach tastes fresh, the sauce on the sandwich has a great flavor and the shrimp is perfectly breaded. My mother came here with me today. She enjoyed the Spicy Garlic Shrimp as well. Will DEFINITELY be back here!

I got everyone I work with hooked on this place. The spicy garlic shrimp sandwich is the best sandwich that I have ever eaten, hands down. Also like their homemade chips which are somehow sweet but have a nice kick to them and come with every sandwich you order. This place definitely puts the Zen in My lunch; I find myself wishing my sandwich was never ending and I could continue eating it all day. My second favorite sandwich is the mu ping. Try this place,you won't regret it.
This  is one of the few places that live up to the hype, the crab cake sandwich is silly good. Very cool vibe, the owner is super cool and friendly.  Need one of these in tampa.

Ate here the other night because I read so many good reviews about this place. 
Tried the chicken katsu and server failed to inform me that they drench the katsu with a sauce that is way too tangy. I couldn't even taste the chicken. 
Came home and I started to feel the food coming up; burping constantly. 
Also, price is too high for less than average food. I will not be coming back.
I had heard some great things about this place. I did not enjoy it at all. It find it expensive for what it is and it was greasy. I would not go back.
Great sandwich. Love the options and different flavors than the average sandwich place. Also so great gluten free options. Highly recommend you stop by and try it.

2 city girls on a crazy snow day drive 6 miles from work to get to this hole in the wall place,  the food better be good! we waited a good 20 mins before our food was served and we devoured the Zenwiches!! My friend ordered the chicken satay from the gluten free menu and I had the spicey shrimp along with jasmine tea. The  restrooms are clean, seating area although small is well maintained and open kitchen. The owner Nate was super friendly and made sure the orders were attended to in a timely manner. Will certainly go back maybe in Chicago.

I've been wanting to try this place for awhile and it did not disappoint. I ordered the chicken satay and my husband had the tofu satay. We both enjoyed our sandwich very much - it was fresh and flavorful. I tried a bite of his sandwich and felt that mine had a better flavor overall, however. I don't know if it's because of the difference in how the spices and sauce get absorbed by the chicken vs the tofu or what. He agreed mine tasted better as well.

The pickle spear was fresh and the homemade seasoned chips were definitely different than just regular chips. I tasted a hint of cinnamon and sweet potato in them.

Since this place is so small and busy we took our meal to nearby Wilder Park and had a little picnic lunch. I highly recommend doing this on a nice day.

Visited: August 22, 2015
Staff needs to bring their A game back. I've loved this place since day 1 but they need to step it up and not make mistakes with orders

At my daughter's request we ordered 30 assorted zenwich's (60 1/2) for her bridal shower. WHAT A HIT!  I got half bread and half wrap. Perfect! Everyone raved about them. Not one was left.  Thank you for helping provide a special lunch!

AmazinG!
I had the Korean Beef Cheesesteak today!
I was in Elmhurst and wanted something different so I went on Yelp to see what looked interesting and saw this place and happened to be like .03 miles away.  I'm telling you I'm still thinking about how amazing the sandwich was !  Not to mention the homemade chips and pickle that come with it   Good Job Guys!!

Visited this place because of such high reviews. It's a small joint with 2-3 tables so we preferred to order take out. I ordered a tofu katsu which was good but not something which I would call excellent. My husband ordered crab cake sandwich which he said was delicious. They give chips along with sandwiches which were quite flavorful. Would love to try it again but may be non veg next time. Overall, a good sandwich place!!

This was my first time here and my husband's second time. I really enjoyed talking to the owner. Super friendly and engaging. I tried the Tofu curry sandwich which was delicious. Plenty of veg and non veg options. A great find in Elmhurst! I'll be back!!!

Not your normal sandwich shop. They make fresh, wonderful goodness in a bun. Even though I think they left the Wasabi off my sandwich (which was a Wasabi Beef), the sandwich was amazing. Not a whole lot of room to sit down and enjoy your sandwich, and you miss it if you are traveling south on York Rd, but the food was wonderful and quick.

I was working in Elmhurst for a few weeks and ate here with coworkers several times.  Between all of us, we probably tried the entire menu. It is all delicious. Even the kids chicken tenders were something special.
 
I wish more places like Zenwich existed. Omnomnom
Good food.  1 sandwich can feed 2 people.
I just went here for the first time and it was excellent! I ordered the Korean Cheese Steak and it was absolutely delicious. Definitely coming back again.
I haven't had a bad sandwich yet. Try them all and eat them often!

Went here a long time ago, but would like to inform my fellow Yelpers that this spot is indeed worth stopping for!!!! The couple that own it are so nice, also. Had the crab cake sandwich, was delicious.
Unique sandwiches with a kick!

I have read good things about this place, but never made the trip.  But on Friday night, my wife was hanging out with some friends in the western suburbs.  So on Saturday around lunchtime I was planning to meet up with them for lunch.  I suggested somewhere in Elmhurst as it was close enough between our houses.  The first place we looked into was closed so I suggested Zenwich.

When we got there I was surprised it was a little store front in a strip mall.  But I wasn't going to judge that.  So we enter the restaurant and look at the menu.  It was really hard to come to a decision/conclusion on what we would order.  After spending a few minutes it seemed like my wife and I were going to split two sandwiches.  We did the Korean cheese steak and some braised pork sandwich.

The Korean cheese steak was amazing.  There really is no easy way to describe it (it tastes like bulgogi and a cheese steak at the same time).  Just get it

I went here for the first time today and I thought it was pretty good. The interior is very simple and the place is a little small. 

My mom ordered the crab cake sandwich and I got the spicy garlic shrimp sandwich.  They were both really yummy, but the chips didn't taste that good, they didn't have much flavor. 

Overall, they people were nice and the sandwiches were good and reasonably priced. I'd go there again.

Once upon a time someone farted in a yoga class I was taking. Naturally...I was asked to leave for laughing uncontrollably, but c'mon...can you really blame me that? I haven't done downward dog since said incident, but I'll certainly be saying nomnomnomaste to Zenwich if I'm ever in Elmhurst again. 

They're basically banh mi sandwiches on a baguette with awesome options including crab cake, Korean BBQ, caramelized pork, and a whole bunch of other stuff that sounds super delicious. Pair one of these puppies with an amazing cucumber salad or one of their other sides and you truly will be on a cloud for your entire lunch hour.

The food her is sooo good. I think I've tried literally ever on their menu and I've yet to be disappointed. I recommend trying everything, If you can. It is beyond fantastic. If you love sandwiches and Asian food then you'll adore Zenwhich
Awesome food.  Delicious and completely fresh sandwiches.  The best hot and sour soup we have ever had!  The chips were also great - tasted homemade and seasoned perfectly.

So delicious. 

I ordered the crabby yola - which was delicious. and sampled the shrimp speciality sandwich of the day. Oh em gee. SO good! 

It's a really tiny space, but we went at a time that wasnt too busy and we were able to get a seat. I also like the option of having a lettuce sandwich (if you are trying to limit carbs/bread). I mean, i probably won't ever actually give up bread. But i like having the option. haha. 

The service was friendly! And if you go between 5-7 during the week, it's half off sandwiches! 

Cant wait to be back.

Never physically been to this location but I found it on Yelp and decided to order.

Delivery was quick and food was great. I love that they keep a database of customers who ordered previously. Ordered twice in one week, loved the Italian sub and the lemon chicken soup. Definitely going to keep ordering for lunch at the office. Great prices, quick service, amazing food. Must try!!!

Honestly the best customer service I have ever experienced. I would go back just because the 2 brothers are so nice and considerate. I ordered the Joey sub, and he recommended getting some red onions on it too, It was delicious. The fact that he cared enough to reccomend that and it didnt cost any extra was fantastic.

The short is, go here. The service and home cooked and prepared meals will be worth every penny.

Yes their subs are as 'good as it gets'. Going to add this joint to my 'Best Sub' list.
Made to order subs and hot offerings (Italian beef) along with pizza & pasta and a whole lot more. But I came here for the sub and was not disappointed. Their version uses a softer sub roll. It's not the super crunchy rolls that a lot of other sub joints use. It was packed full of Italian deli meats lettuce, tomato and giardiniera. I only wished I asked for a little onion. They do offer many condiment choices that you can add to your sub and additional cheeses and meats. Plenty of seating for chomping down that 12 inch sub. Soups too.

Best sandwiches ever! The bread is always fresh and they stack the sandwiches with a lot of meat! I always get the joeys special sandwich and the ham and Munster cheese. The owner is so nice and helpful. If you are ordering takeout during the lunch rush, Call ahead of time because it's always packed.
Nicest people you'd ever want to meet and the food is awesome, my favorite spot when I'm in the neighborhood!

We really enjoyed our experience with this place. Our sandwiches were stacked with meats and the bread was fresh. Their pasta salads, and potato salad were delicious. I used Yelp to put in an electronic order and when I arrived it was ready to go. The staff is very friendly and they have a large beverage selection. Will be back!

Mario's is all about the hype of mediocrity in my book.

Order the Italian sub and you'll immediately notice the cuts of meat are strategically folded offering a nucleus of dense compaction That's a visual ploy, or if anything, just try to chew that mass of confusion.

Speaking of confusion...the "Bread' is soft and fluffy. That would be spot on if served on a New Orleans Beef or Shrimp Po' Boy! Not Here! The soft bread has no substance at all. The "Brick" of meat gets continually squeezed with every bite and eventually compressed as a projectile in any direction you desire!

Everything about a deli should be upfront and in your face. Not here...your sandwich is prepared behind a secret wall. That's a visual screw up for a self proclaimed deli.

Ordering at Mario's really tests your patience.  From the time you order until the time it actually makes it into the bag, your life flashes before your eyes... I remembered when I first learned to ride a 2-wheel bike; I remembered learning to drive a stick shift; I remembered slamming my first can of Old Style Beer; I remembered walking in the door over 20 minutes ago!

The fact that your written order is handed off to someone hiding behind a wall to prepare it "secretly" is disappointing and frankly annoying.

Mario's employees walk around casually with smiles on their faces as they fill lunch time catering orders while you do a slow burn...waiting for your sandwich.
Cannot get enough of their Italian Sub. Im coming back this week.

Stopped in here for my second visit to pick up some sandwiches.
Ordered the Italian and Prosciutto subs and their Macaroni salad.
Their macaroni salad is made with the pasta shape that I think is called dialetti  (?) And has some corn, green peas, and a little red onion or shallots in it and it is good. I've had it on both visits and will make it my regular side.
The sandwiches are also very good. Nice bread, fresh ingredients and they don't skimp on them either. Very solid sandwiches. I am looking forward to trying other ones here.
Service was very friendly, always a plus.

I like this place. If you are in the area they are definitely worth checking out.

Cheers to all

This is an excellent sandwich and soup place. I had the chicken tortellini soup which seemed handmade and plenty of ingredients, not all broth like some places. 
I also had a 7 inch Italian sub which had plenty of meat and the bread was super fresh. I highly recommend this place if you're in the mood for soup and sandwiches.

All the food is good. My favorites are eggplant parmesan, beef sandwich (way better than Portillos) and their chicken salad plate. I love their sesame bread for their subs. 

Thanks much! =D yum

I came in here for a sandwich and it was ok. The service on the other hand was great. Very friendly and great conversation. I decided to try other things on the menus since they have more then just sandwiches. The cheese ravioli was very good. I even order a meatball witch was not small at all and tasty.

Haven't been here in years went last night and had a great sandwich. Also got soup and it was excellent. It did how ever take 37 minutes from the time I walked in to the time I left which I was not happy about. The prices are also quite high it cost me just over $32 for two subs and two soups. For that kind of meal for two people I believe it should be around $20

I've never actually been here, but my job orders catering from here at month end every once in a while. The subs are absolutely HUGE!!!! The only ones they order are American & Italian. The Italian is good. The ravioli taste like plastic to me. The meatballs are pretty good. They have this pasta salad with ditallini pasta and corn it's absolutely AMAZING! It's my fave by far.

Great little deli! Ordered the 7 inch Italian and it was wonderful. Fresh meats and love the dressing they put on it. The lettuce was nice and crisp too, which is all too rare these days in delis. Had and pasta salad too, and it was okay. They're very nice and took the time to ask how I was doing, and not in that " I could really care less" way, but genuinely out of kindness. Good food, food people.

Frequent visitor to this joint. You'll find it in the strip mall below a condo building near the Bensenville train station. The cold case has several soups and salads (think pasta, potato, veggie etc) to add to your meal options. They have lots of chips (big bags and individual sizes) and a wall of cold drinks or fountain drinks to choose from. Prices range $5.50 for 7" going up to $9 for 12inch subs. My favorite is the Joey sub.

They recently added a members club through your email which can provide discounts. Wednesdays in the summer are packed for Bensenville's "Music In the Park", so you won't find parking for blocks. 

Come grab a sub and enjoy the festivals.

Love "The Joey" sub. Love the brownies! Love the new pulled pork with coleslaw (you can order it without the bun). So delicious! Staff is friendly and genuinely likes to get to know their customers. So, if you're an impatient person who dislikes small talk - not sure if you will enjoy Mario's Deli. You can probably pre-order your sub and then just pick it up if you are in a hurry to get your sandwich made and handed off to you. Mario's has a booth at Music in the Park every Wednesday night in Bensenville (thru August) - so be sure to check them out there also! They're open until 7pm most evenings! Love this place and its rare to have owners who actually seem to genuinely care about you as a person. You're not just a number at Mario's!
Great service and great food. Their Italian sub is the best I've found - Southside or Northside!

I just placed another order for the company I worked for and must say its always a pleasure ordering there and talking to Joe...he is very efficient and remembers what we like and how we like our order.  

We usually stick with our favorites which are:

*Meat Lasagna
*Cheese Lasagna
These trays are HUGE and heavy and just awesome.  He gives a ton of food and its really good.

*Meatballs
Everyone goes nuts for these.  MUST try!

*Italian Beef
The beef has a definitive spice in it that makes it really yummy.

I will have to go in there for lunch one day and order just an individual meal as we always just cater from here but Im sure its just as good!
6/16/2015 12:30pm, ordered a 12" Italian sub, took 20 minutes. WOW! Nothing spectacular about the sub, next time I'll hit Jimmy Johns, they have better bread.

I'm working in the area for the day and looking for something good and local. I looked up places to eat and saw Mario's on the list. Honestly, Mario's was the closest so I decided to try it out. I'm so glad I did. I ordered the Italian sub lunch combo. The sandwich was delicious! It was full of meat! No paper thin slices of meat but hearty portions. I also ordered the cucumber, tomato, and red onion salad with feta. That was so good, too! I wished I ordered a bigger portion. I will definitely be making a trip out there for some more food.

Love love love Joe and Mario's Delli II !!! They did such a fabulous job catering my daughter's graduation party in 2013 that it was a no-brainer to use them again for my son's graduation party on June 7, 2015! The food is in a league by itself!!! We had their incredible ravioli, mostaccioli, beef sandwiches, deli sandwiches, fruit salad, house salad, chicken tenders, mac & cheese, and their famous rocky road brownies and each dish received rave reviews!! The service is as incredible as the food. Joe, and his daughter, Anna, could not have worked harder, more efficiently, or been more friendly if it was their own party/guests! I couldn't imagine these parties without Joe and would never use anyone else. Thanks Joe - you are beyond the best and we are forever grateful!!! Barb Montagano 6/10/15

They make a great Italian beef with several cheeses available to pick from. They have this amazing garlic pasta that is pretty addicting. I started buying it by the pound.  Just tried a baked mostaccioli today and it was pretty tasty. These guys are versatile and are very friendly. They take pride in their food and you can tell with every bite. Haven't tried their chilies or soups yet but based on their others items I have a feeling their winners.
This place is the real deal. Their homemade pasta salad and olive giardiniera is AMAZING! Such friendly service. Very very reasonable prices. I love it here.

I originally tried this place because it's right next to my job - but boy am I glad I did! Anything that I've ordered is delicious... The Marinated Chicken and Cheese, the Chicken Salad and the Italian Beef are my favorites. The people are really friendly and always remember my name and what I usually order. I have brought friends there and definitely recommend it to others!

Been going here for years. My favorite subs in the area hands down! Generous with the meats too. The staff is super friendly. The owner Joe is a really nice guy and very personable. Great soups too. Very nice desert selection. I would highly recommend this place to anybody.

Def one of my faves. The Joey and Italians subs are tops, but I like to get them rolled in wheat wraps since its a tad bit healthier. Didn't like the fact that I tried ordering ahead and the lady on the phone said it would take a couple of hours! Isn't that the point of calling ahead! To avoid the line! You're better of walking in and placing your order, they can handle lunch rushes better in person. Still, with that complaint, I'm a repeat customer.

My favorite from here is definitely the "Joey".  I usually get it in a wrap (no price difference).  My biggest gripe with this place has nothing to do with the food. Ok, so of course they get busy during the lunch rush but it seems like they need maybe one more person helping out back there.  Ive stopped calling in my order ahead because it absolutely takes them much longer this way. I was quotes 45 minute wait on an order where as a walk in waits about 5-10. Huh???  Just go in and order is my advice. Other than that, this place is the shiz.

I've been going to Mario's my entire life..I'm about to turn 24 and they recently celebrated their 20th year in business. There's a true sense of family there and you can taste the passion that goes into their great food. My personal favorites-- Chicken Parm Sub w marinara on the side (SOO good), and the Joey Sub. If you have a sweet tooth try the Tiramisu, you won't be disappointed.

This deli is almost as good as it gets. The staff is very friendly and makes it a point to remember the regulars. Aside from great bread, quality meat, and fresh ingredients; thier homemade salads are a sleeper. It is very clear that they utilize fresh ingredients and prepare their food daily which sets deli's apart from the chain competetors.
Ordered two 12" Italian  subs that fed 4 adults and tasted very fresh on super soft bread! I will be back and recommend given the price is less than freaky fast place.

Fresh made sandwiches and friendly service keep me coming back to this place. Salads homemade pasta I haven't had a bad meal here. The spinach lasagna is my favorite. Sub sandwiches are excellent. You can dine in and they take credit cards. Right across from the village hall and metra station in Bensenville.
You will not find a better sandwich or a nicer bunch of people.  I HIGHLY recommend Mario's II!!!!

This Deli is fantastic! We ordered lunch here for our office. We placed an order by fax, called in with the credit card number and boom...we had lunch in about an hour. 
The ingredients they used for their 6" and 10" subs are super fresh. The veggies are crisp and ripe and flavorful. The sandwiches aren't covered in dressing, mayo or mustard. They don't need it! Everything else is just seasoned to perfection. 
Even their pasta is good, and the portion is large. The pasta's can be ordered either a la carte or as a meal. The meal includes a salad and roll.
Service was impeccable. Joe was so friendly & helpful & the sandwiches were great. We had an Italian & a Joey. Will definitely be back to visit Joe next time I'm in the area!

Small town Deli with big taste! I'm such a fan of this family owned spot. 
My family got a variety of pastas and they all tasted amazing. Great spot to take-n-go or eat there. The guys at Marios were so friendly even when we had tons of questions. Sandwiches, pasta, antipasto and much more.My kids got a piece of chocolate cake and my 6 yr old daughter preceeded to do a cheer for Marios after eating.

I have been to many sandwich shops, and this one reigns supreme.  From their freshly cooked pastas to their delicious made-to-order subs with imported Italian meats and cheeses; everything is great!  Just walking into the place, smelling the pastas and fresh bread, will make you salivate.  Joey and his brother will make you feel welcome and are great at helping you decide what to get.

Also, I have not had better gnocchi than the gnocchi at Mario's Deli II.  That alone is worth the drive.  

The subs come in to different sizes 6" and 10" with plenty of meat and cheese to satisfy even the hungriest of appetites.  The pastas and sides are all excellent and you get a good amount of food for your money!
 
I highly recommend the Joey's sub, gnocchi and the ravioli. I have to make the drive at least every 3-6 months to get my fix and my friends and brothers get upset if I go without them.

Perfect sandwiches made fresh, Great pastas and salads. Absolutely nothing bad about this place. Have been a customer for years and will continue to shun other deli's in the area that just cant compare. They know who they are!. always warm friendly service, and Joey ROCKS!
Best sandwiches ever! You have to try their Joey special. Salads are very good and fresh. Don't forget the pasta lasagna, spaghetti ravioli  are excellent!

Great sandwich shop! The people are incredible (Joe knew my name by the second visit!).  It's clear that they are committed to using top notch ingredients in their sandwiches; the vegetables are fresh, the bread is soft, and the meats are meticulously sliced.  And their tiramisu is to die for!

Service here is impeccable and fast. Extremely friendly staff and makes the waiting here in the lunch line bearable. A little more money than your normal Subway..but here you can get a huge variety of sammies..you can build your own. I like the beef sandwiches, the pasta salads and the tiramisu. The salads are not that great, tuna/chicken salad are ok. Great if you know what you like on your sammies..they are willing to work with your preferences.

I have always had good experiences with Mario's except for this week when I went there for a turkey submarine sandwich.  This sandwich was terrible.  The bread was stale and there was hardly any turkey on the sandwich.  It was a big disappointment for a place that is usually great.

Came here twice to have lunch.  Great subs.  Try the italian beef or italian sausage.  Even better if you order the eggplant parm sub and add an italian sausage. ;D  Very homemade.  Huge portions.  I can never finish my 6".  It's a lot bigger than they say it is.

Let me start off by saying I was going to give one star. BUT Alex the assistant manager turned me up to a three and I would give him five stars. The wings are good but the way they charge and structure pricing is not so good. I would of given this place 4 stars if all was well. When we arrived the cashier was flirting with pick up customers instead of taking mine and my daughters order. It was nine and she is seven. Anything to move faster would of been nice. She had zero customer service skills. After all the nonsense we went through, Alex made everything great. That kid is awesome and works well with the customers. Also that same cashier was sweeping around people eating and laughing about how she hates to sweep. I would return to try this place again. Kudos Alex! I worked in restaurants my whole life. I don't easily compliment people.

I went a month or two after they opened with my boyfriend. It was not very busy so we ordered right away and our food came out within 10 minutes. We ordered 10 boneless wings and fries to split. 

I cut open my first piece and thank god I looked at it before eating it because THEY SERVED ME RAW CHICKEN!! I couldn't believe it! I cut open my other 3 pieces and what do you know- ALL RAW! My boyfriends pieces were cooked which doesn't make much sense. 

I took my plate to the front where we ordered and the manager apologized a few times and remade our entire order. She also gave us two gift cards to return. There's no way I would ever go back there. Absolutely disgusting. 

I also contacted corporate and explained what happened and they never got back to me. Terrible customer service to say the least. Do not eat here if you're looking to get salmonella or food poisoning.

Worst experiance ever. I am contacting managment tomorrow. And thank you to.the people who stood up and took their money back. I was last didnt bother just walked out. No gloves on hands, attitude, food was not prepared like ot should be. I am never eating there again. Please, if you are the manager contact me via yelp. I would like my money back, i hope tomorrow i dont have stomah issues. 
Ohh and associates are rude, and told me they put some special souce in my dip. WHO DOES THAT! 
Thank you for your service!

My family and I absolutely love wing stop. We order often! We saw one coming to Addison and we were so excited!!! The first time we tried it, it was ok. Gave a second chance and it was horrible. The wings have no meat. The ranch was not made right. This franchise location is a joke. The owners are cheap. The employees are young and ghetto kids.. waste of money. Go to a different location for a real wing stop experience

This is a new wing stop location in Addison near Walmart. The interior is open, clean, and has plenty of seating and large tvs.  The place is actually spotless (probably because it's so new). Stopped in around noon for lunch and was the only person there. I ordered Parmesan garlic wings and Serrano wings with a side of baked beans and potato salad. The wings were good and what you would expect from any wing stop location. The sides were pretty bad. The potatoes were basically raw and the beans had this distinctive bourbon/chemical taste.  Not sure if I would come back. If I do I'll stick with wings and fries only.

You can't beat the prices or the flavor of the food. However, if you order on line for pick up - do NOT trust the time frame. I got to the location to pick up our order at the designated time, but had to wait almost 30 additional minutes!

Way to close early homies!! It says you close at 12...not 11.

Not the first time this has happened at this location. Management needs to step it up

Best wings in town! Service is fast and TV's all around to watch any sports event. 

I recommend the boneless Louisiana rub and the mango habanero.

I've been sitting here waiting for about 20 minutes now. Nothing but chaos & a lack on management. There's two employees who I feel bad for, seems like they just started this week and are getting yelled at by their manager. Lack of leadership skills. I'm going to have to say stay clear of this location, at least until there's a complete staff change or better/longer training time.

Waited 20 minutes for 4 tenders and fries. People who got there after me received their orders before me. Made no sense. My colleagues were waiting for me at Chipotle and they were done eating by the time I GOT my food from here. The service was a joke and food was not even close to worth the wait.

Horrible experience.... 
Food disgusting, customer service is a joke, got boyfriend hanging around and talking to him while taking order. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE!

I have gone to Wingstop at other locations for many years. This was the worst experience I have had. I am very familiar with what the taste and consistency of their sauces should be, so you can imagine my surprise when I requested a 20 piece, boneless, hot and got a batch of grease-laden disgustingness. I have attached a picture of the grease (I removed the wings and literally patted them down with paper towel, they were so saturated) to prove my point. The sauce was flavorless and awful. The wings themselves appeared to have been incorrectly prepared as well, having a color so bright in redness it matched nothing I had previously seen from Wingstop or any other wing joint. To make matters worse, Im guessing the gentleman in the back that prepared them is the owner. If the owner doesn't know how to properly prepare his own food, what are the odds his staff is going to be able to? I love wings and was excited for this location to open but I would avoid them at all costs.

Gross, greasy, poorly prepared. Familiar with the chain and this may be the worst of the bunch. Did I mention they just opened too? Wings are abundant in this area, save your time and tastebuds and keep driving.
First time stopping by this place and was stunned by the service and food.  Amazing wings with different style sauce available. Must Stop!

This place was great when they first opened. Quick and good food. The last couple months they have been going downhill. If I order online and come at the pick up time they haven't even started the order and have to wait another 20-30 minutes. The employees are always giving attitude, act like its an inconvenience that you are there and don't greet you at all when you walk in. And multiple times the food has just been plain not been good. They give the wrong amount of wings, they're overcooked, barely any sauce, etc. I think ill be avoiding this location which stinks because it was closer to our house then the others and we visit a couple times a month!
I come here all the time. Love the lemon pepper and louisiana rub wings - plus, the employees there are always super friendly.

If I could give zero stars, I would. This location is awful! First of all, I attempted to place An order for pickup, but the employee hung up twice after placing me on a "brief" hold. I went inside and was "greeted" with "what's your name?" No "hi, how are you? How can I help you?" I am a manager in customer service so it's very upsetting to see people in the same industry not treating customers the way they should be treated. I came in tonight around 645. I ordered two combos- for the person I was with and myself, but this took 40 minutes to cook 15 wings w/ fries. When my name was finally called, I noticed I am missing half the order! The employee had the nerve to tell me it's my fault and I didn't specify what I wanted when IT CLEARLY STATES MY ORDER CORRECT ON THE RECEIPT I AM WAVING IN YOUR FACE NOW. You're telling me it costs 25.00 for 8 wings? No, so give me the rest of my order. Another 15 minutes goes by as I'm waiting for the second half of my food while the first order I received is getting cold. We took the food to go, but once we get home, the second order is still wrong! Entire order of food was cold and hardly had any flavor due to lack of sauce. I understand being understaffed as I stated I am a manager of a few retail salons and know the pressure of being busy, but treat your PAYING customers correctly. A simple apology and correcting my order would have helped alter my review on this location, but after calling to speak with a manager when I got home to be told "THE FOOD IS HOT AND YOUR ORDER IS CORRECT" from a "manager" when it clearly wasn't(read previous reviews-obv. I'm not the only one) is just awful management. This location lacks everything needed in order to run a successful business. Do your self a favor and drive to the location on lake street in the Hanover park/Roselle area, SO much better!

I have been to the Wing Stop in Carol Stream and Roselle before and loved it.  This was the first time at this new location.  Stopped in at 5:00 pm with one person in front of me.  Ordered 6 wings and fries.  The cashier told me it would be about 9-10 minutes.  At 5:24 my wings were finally ready.  Definitely not worth the wait.  The worst wings I have ever had.  Basically overcooked and hardly any sauce - basically if I had not purchased an extra cup of sauce for $0.89 there would have been no sauce at all on them.  And on top of it the wings are probably the smallest I have ever seen.  I will never go to this location again.
