Overall the wings were OOOK. But the service was terrible! My order came up about 30 minutes after the time they gave me for it to be ready. I probably won't go back.

you can't ask for much more from wings! The boneless are my favorite! So juicy, crisp breading and delish sauces to choose from! The cajun and Louisiana rub are my favorite...soooo good. The staff was super friendly and service was prompt, will definitely be going back and soon!

I was recently in Illinois and have been at other Wingstops in the past so decided to stop by this location - AMAZING! The service was fantastic (friendly, quick and attentive), the atmosphere was great (clean, lots of seating, good views of the TVs) and the food was delicious.  I highly recommend the Garlic Parmesan and Cajun wings (Drooling just thinking about them).  If you haven't tried wingstop wings, you are missing out!
Best food I've had in my life!

Taqueras aplenty on this stretch of Irving. This one is located just west of Barrington on the south side of the street. Located in a strip mall. 

I can't speak for the restaurant itself, as I sent the husbo out into the cold to fetch our meal.  He's not a man of many words when it comes to things like decor, ambiance, etc.

The husbo did comment on how nice staff was. They gave him a free pop for whatever reason. He didn't have to wait long for the carry out order.  

We had been wanting to try their $1 pork or chicken tacos, so we got 5 of each. They did mine and the husbo's autntico (onions and cilantro) and gringo (lettuce, cheese, tomato) for the tween.  We also got an order of chips and salsa.  

Both meats were good, the seasoning was not overpowering. I was able to give the miniature some chicken without worring what I would deal with on the diaper end.  The flour tortillas were fresh and thick.  

The chips were good but a little greasy.  The salsas, picosas!!  The tomatillo was probably the spiciest.  

Everything was of good quality and freshness, especially considering the cost. You're spending $1 for a taco!  These ingrediants are fresher than anything you'd find on a fast food dollar menu. 

A $13 meal for a family of 3.5 is not a bad deal.  We can't wait to dine-in and try more stuff on the menu...which we will probably do soon, as mi cocina est cerrada most of the time. 

Check it out, keep the place open!!

On 12/13/2011 me and my husband went out to eat and we saw this place and well it said grand opening so we thought what the hell and went in. Right off the bat the place was in great shape. You could tell that they were just setting up but for the most part the place was well put together. Well anyways my husband and I had some Delicious chips and homemade salsa really good. It was one of those homemade salsas where the spicy of the salsa doesn't kick in until later. So well after we got our Mexican cokes and decided on what to eat my husband and I decided we both would try the burrito dinner with steak. OMG it was really,really good. The only thing my husband said was they didn't really give you a lot of rice and beans and I said well hon did you see the burrito...it's not small. :) And honestly people in my opinion they give you just the right amount of everything and it does fill you up and it's not expensive at all. And also they are  going to have a karaoke. So for those people who love great Authentic Mexican Food this place is for  you.
I grew up in Bartlett (25 years) eating V&V's pizza. After moving to Denver (where there is NO good pizza) V&V's is my first stop when I come back "home" to visit. BEST PIZZA EVER!!

I was looking for pizza nearby and decided to go w V&V Paesano because their yelp reviews looked pretty good. 

I was not disappointed i ordered a medium thin crust pizza with sausage and ricotta and some cannolis. We ordered delivery, the man on the phone said it would take an hour and the pizza arrived before that, not bad for 9pm on a Saturday. The delivery man was so nice, made small talk and was very polite.  

I think i found my new pizza spot. Our pizza arrived warm. The crust was perfectly crisp, the pizza had the right amount of cheese and sauce. Our cannolis were the perfect ending to our meal. 

Maybe next time ill try double dough and review that.

We tried V&V again and it is like it used to be for us. So I'm not sure what was up but the last few orders have been on par and good. We will still keep it in our pizza rotation!! That, and my son is so obsessed with their panzerotti/calzones that I don't think we have a choice. :)
I absolutely love their wings. I just wish they gave me ranch instated of blue cheese. They do this even after i ask for ranch when i place my order over the phone. Pizza is great too.

After hearing about how good this place is, the hubs and I decided to get pizza delivered from V & V this past Sunday.  I don't know what it is about having a baby, but we have been getting food delivered more than we used to.  And its not like she is a newborn or anything, I think its just pure laziness on our part.... Anywho, not the point.

Ordered a basic Sausage thin crust and we devoured it.  Loved the sauce, loved the crust, and the sausage was amazing, tasted super fresh and packed a ton of flavor.  With the delivery charge and tip it was more than I would like to spend on a regular occasion, but it was worth it.

Next time, we are going for the pan pizza :)  Wish us luck.

Everything I have tried from V&V has been good. My favorite thing to get is the chicken parmesan and the calamari. I always get delivery and they are usually pretty fast. They also have online ordering which is always a plus!

This is the only good pizza place around. We've only been in the area for 3 months and when i tell you we have tried every pizza place that delivers to our home i literally mean i made a list and we had every place deliver to us... This is the best one. We tried fries and cheese fries. Fried shrimp. 3 different kinds of pizza. All of it was good. Try sausage pizza with onions! I was sceptical but it's great! Best tasting burps I've had in a year. Lol not to be gross but I'm serious

Take it from me, I used to work here.  Very clean and well run establishment.  Family owned and operated. This is a great spot for pizza and the food from the kitchen is great as well.  More homemade ingredients than most full service restaurants.  

My favorites:
Everything.  I tried it all.
My family's favorite place to order pizza. It's simply the best. Their cheese and sausage thin crust pizza is to die for!

This place has the best pastas for entrees. Sauces are fresh and homemade. If you are looking for pastas that compare to ones found at places likes Maggianos or another great Italian restaurant then look no further. Check it out!!!

Worst company ever!!!! Terrible attitude!!!! All I did is asked driver that parked in front of my driveway and blocked me, to move his car. He was making delivery to one of  my neighbors. We have a lot of parking spaces right next to our building. At the first time I asked him he was in the car and was able to move easily, but instead he left the car and went to make the delivery and after couple of minutes of waiting I went inside the building to ask him again, his respond was wait, nothing will happen to you. But the main thing happen when he came outside, he starts yelling at me and of course he did use all the bad words he knew (and I am a 26 year old woman). Then I found company website and called them. Lady on the phone said that she will talk to him, I asked her do you know which driver was making this delivery and she said NO, so which driver she will talk to???
Some of the best pizza in the burbs.  I moved back to the area and V&V is going to be my pizza joint.

We order from here regularly and love it! The food has always been good and there is a large menu selection. They are good about substituting items or sauces if you ask. We've never had a bad experience! One of the best places to order from in Bartlett!
I have ordered from V&V over 100 times plus. This place is great and consistent! They always make the food consistently good and have great service. I highly recommend.
Didn't expect this from a pizza place but best chicken Marsala and vesuvio Ive ever had!
This is some of the best pizza you will have.  I like sausage and pepperoni, but when I get V&V, I order just cheese.  It is that tasty that it does not need toppings to make it any better.
Best pizza ever again last night.  Love their website, use it every time I order.  Thanks guys.

Definitely my favorite pizza place in Bartlett. They always get it right and their pizza always taste fresh! They're delivery service is probably the best I've ever used. They're always fast and my food is never cold! We order from V & V's regularly and as an Italian American it's good to eat pizza that taste like the real stuff from Italy! Our favorite combos are sausage and mushroom and pepperoni with pineapple!

Pizza was pretty good, placed the order online on a Saturday evening. After placing the order I was instructed that most orders are available within 30 minutes but to call before arriving as the weekends are busy. Called after 30 minutes and the order was almost done. Picked up the pizza and it was coming straight out of the oven. Ordered their Large pan pizza with sausage and green peppers and the pizza was HUGE! I could only get down 2.5 slices and I can easily eat one of the competitors $5 pizza's all alone in one sitting. Pizza was good, tons of cheese, good sauce, a lot of crust on the edges. Pizza was even better the next day as I had leftovers. If you like your pizza golden color, order it well done.

By far my favorite restaurant to order pizza from!  The sausage is made in house and is fantastic on the pizza!   If you order on a busy night such as weekends or game nights, call ahead of time because they get slammed.  Sometimes the wait can be 2 hours.  I highly recommend ordering pizza from this restaurant!

I like the pizza from V&V. This place is always pretty hopping on the weekends. I always get my pizza cooked well done so that tends to add time, but it is worth it.

Their quality of sausage is excellent, sometimes we know that can be sub-par.

They run coupons pretty frequently so check those out on the website as well.

I love their extra thin pizza here.  Ive tried everywhere else in the Bartlett area and can say this is the best.  Friendly service on the phone and fast delivery as well.  Ive tried the Chicken parm sandwich which was also excellent.  Will definitely continue to order

Absolutely the best pizza, caprese salad, chicken, sausage, pasta,etc. we have never had a bad meal here. Service is great and delivery timely. We've had several events catered as well with the same level of quality.
Pizza is really good!  Crust is crispy and yummy... Sauce is tangy!  Only one small table for 4... They mostly do carry out.

Good pizza the cheapest owner on earth. You get a pizza get your magnifying glass out to find the ingredients. I asked them the second time I ordered put double the ingredients on it I'll pay for it. I get the pizza still has almost no toppings and I was charged for it. You cheap prick put ingredients on your pizza or just sell cheese pizza ingredient nazi
Nice local place to order from, they have daily specials. The pizza is good but we enjoy the pasta more.
Best pizza in Bartlett PERIOD. Delivery always on time and very quick order time.  FYI closed on Mondays.

We have LOVED V&V's for years now!!  BEST pizza in the area!  We usually get the thin crust, but the extra thin crust is great too.  We generally get delivery in less than thirty minutes.  On nights when we know it will be busy, i.e. Bears or Hawks games, we call ahead and request delivery for whatever time we prefer.  Always accommodating, timely and courteous.

Very good food! My favorite dish is the garlic and broccoli linguine. A must try! I order their food almost every Friday night. Delicious! They provide a lot of various toppings at a resonable price. #ChicagoPizza #nomnom
My favorite pizza!!! I seriously can't get enough! Always arrives on time and hot! It's a must when we have company over or family in from out of town. Best pizza in Bartlett- hands down!

Best Pizza place in town. Hands down!

They have the best Vodka sauce. The best Panzerotti, Ravioli, etc... There is nothing I can say about them that is negative. They are fast and they cook delicious food.
The pizza is good. They use homemade ingredients. It is an expensive pizza but quality demands a higher cost. The only thing I would improve on is the dough and crust. I wish it had more flavor.

If you're reading this, you're probably not from Bartlett, because I think everyone in Bartlett knows about this place and the reason they know about this place is because it's the best pizza in town.
Is it because it's the best pizza ever?  No, but it is very good pizza.  It's the best in town because all the other 500 pizza places in Bartlett are pretty much horrible (I'm looking at you Pasta Mia)!
They make their own sausage which is delicious, but I never get to have it because my entire family is full of mutants who hate sausage (hate America while you're at it family).  The pepperoni is very good too though.  Since I'm weird too I always get the pizza bread with the pizza which I love.  As for the ribs and the like....read someone else's  review and get back to me, I've never tried it :)

I can see why this place has a good rep. I called in for a pick up order on stuffed pizza and calamari. I have got to say that this is one of the few places that will give  you plenty of lemons with your order and BOTH sauces to dip your calamari. GENIUS!! The pizza's are not made like your loumalnatis or giordano's where the cheese is on bottom and sauce on top. They actually do the reverse where the cheese stays on top, which doesn't bother me. The pizza was a decent price for a stuffed 12" pizza. 17 bucks I believe for it.

I have no complaints about the service. Everything comes out freshly made, super hot, and tasty. I will be ordering here in the future for pizza.

Definitely the best pizza in town hence why there is typically a decent line waiting for their pick up orders. Does not have restaurant seating so it's pick up only. 

Pizza is their calling card, and hands down its amazing. Also have ordered the BBQ ribs and Chicken and both are great as well.

Been getting food here since I was a kid and with it being family owned, you get the best quality and not some franchise crap.

Love love love! I am very picky about my pizza. They have the best! Their staff is always friendly and if we can't pick up our pizza, they have fast delivery. My favorite thing is artichoke hearts on a pizza and yes they have them.

Great pizza, good ingredients.  Sausage is great. Their veggie pizza only has 4 toppings and green peppers aren't one of them.  If you order on a Friday or Saturday night expect to wait at least an hour even for pick up. It's a bit chaotic but that's what happens when you have a good product.

Our family have been going to v and v for nearly 19 years. Love the pizza, love the Italian chicken, love all the food.  And their catering is the best.  Ask for the Italian chicken as one of the meats chooses, it is so delicious.

It was a good pie! I got it fully cooked and the pizza was flavorful, sauce and ingredients wise, and it was pretty great for the price. I was able to do a half-half specilty pizza for a nice price, also.

First the girl answering the phone answers the phone by asking my number, no greeting, just right to it. 
While I'm ordering she interrupts me talk to someone else. Then when I go to pick up my food she got it wrong.
So I overpaid and still had to wait another 20 minutes for the other half of our order.
So service sucked....
However the food was wonderful and we will order again.
Hope this helps.

OK, let me just say..I love Pizza and I eat wayyyyy to much of it. As far as I am concerned for a thin crust pizza there is zero reason to ever call anyone other than V&V. The sausage is homemade and the sauce is awesome. The topping are always flavorful and thus must be fresh. There are a few things to know..which as far as I'm concerned do not affect the review.

From time to time orders will disappear...not that often but it does happen...I think what happens is that they tell you they will have a pizza to you in an hour when the wait time is actually 2 hours. You heard it right... Friday and Saturday nights can be on a 2 hour wait...delivery or pickup doesn't matter. So Plan ahead!

Best pizza in the Bartlett-Streamwood-Hanover area - and not just pizza.  Their wings, great, their chicken tenders, great - ALL their pasta dinners are amazing.  Chicken Marsala is so damn good!!!  Their baked most. is incredible.  Try stuff other than pizza - you will not be disappointed.
The pizza crust is alright, But the way they placed the toppings were a lil big to fit on the pizza? I don't know it was good overall!

Best pizza in the area. Our entire, extended family orders from V & V. I regularly recommend V & V to anyone asking about pizza. Their appetizers are good and I love their cole slaw. The prices are average and the food is worth every cent.

So, my husband has found a new pan pizza that he likes. V&V has a nice sturdy crust that didn't flop over when he ate it. The sausage was good, but a little scarce. The sauce had a nice flavor and consistency.  It was a little greasier than we would have liked, but it was still delicious. I tried the chicken vesuvio (boneless) for our first carryout order and it was surprisingly nice for a meal that arrived in a plastic container rather than being eaten in an Italian restaurant somewhere. There were two decent sized chicken breasts and about six large potato wedges. The potatoes were cooked just right. Not mushy or underdone. I was pleasantly surprised. We also tried the onion rings and mozzarella sticks. Both are frozen and then fried. Typical and not homemade. $9.95 for 12 mozzarella sticks led me to believe they were going to be something special. It's my fault for not asking first though. 

A couple things to note...  It's very loud when you call to place your order. They can barely hear you, so make sure they repeat the order (and credit card number if you gave it) back to you. Also, the reviews that indicate it's a little pricy for what it is are right. We will not be frequent customers, but for a nice pan pizza less than five minutes from home, we will be back.

Gluten free pizza that is not dry and tasteless?  V and v has it!  I actually really enjoyed their gf pizza. I had it with spinach and they put a good amount on. My husband really enjoyed the sausage on his pizza.  We ordered the family size salad. It was really just a bunch of iceberg lettuce with a few veggies on top. However, we ordered the creamy garlic dressing and it was amazing.  I think I used more of it to dip my pizza in than on the actual salad. 

We live within walking distance to here and I definitely will be going back!

Ohhhh how I miss this place ... I moved out of Bartlett and this is one of the things I miss the MOST ... V & V Pizza ... yum! I have not found a place that compares! Their sauce is amazing and very consistent.

Great gnocchi with Vodka sauce.  I personally love the pizza since it's loaded with cheese and all ingredients are fresh.  Not a bad experience here yet. Living in the burbs there are not many good Italian places out here, in Bartlett this is the place to order from.

I don't get it. 1.5 hours for a pickup order of 2 pizza's at 6:30 on a Friday. I understand delivery can get busy but I was willing to drive to you. I guess business is that good you don't need mine. In 1.5 hours I will thaw out a rib-eye steak and grill it with veggies.
Thanks for trying....

The food is amazing. I love their pizza, pasta and their salads are also great. Minus one star because of the long delivery times. I get that Friday's are busy but I don't think they should answer the phone saying our delivery time is running about an hour and forty five minutes before saying hello. I called they said V&V and went on said delivery time wait. Almost as if they are trying deter me from ordering.

I have been coming to V&V for awhile now. I think their pizzas are pretty good, but my absolute favorite things are the chicken parmigiana dinner, and the vodka sauce pasta. Most people know them best for the pizza, but I suggest you venture out and try some of the dinners they have. Absolutely amazing.

I waited until the 25th time ordering from here before writing a review, just to make sure to be as close to the true data as possible.  I am now prepared to give it 5 stars.  These people perfectly balance sauce, cheese, and toppings to make something perfect and holy.

My wife and I recently moved to the area from Chicago, which was a terrifying prospect a few months ago.  V & V has eased my pain throughout this transition and demonstrates that yes, goodness can and does exist in the Burbs. But seriously though, they make a great pizza, and the staff has this operation down to a science.

We recently had the need to purchase Lasagna for a dinner party.
Since we buy our pizza form V&V and enjoy it, we thought that we would try them for a 1/2 pan of lasagna.
Well it was excellent. Will buy it here again when we j=have the need.

V&V had been my favorite pizza in Bartlett until my last order.  The crust on our stuffed pizza was like plywood.  I thought that I might lose a tooth trying to bite through it.  We also had a thin crust piece of cardboard covered with a pool of tomato sauce, and some tough mozzarella sticks.  I'm done with this place.

Very good pizza, and its fast as well.. Delivery under 30 minutes?
You cant beat it..
I tip my hat off to them..

If you're in Bartlett and want pizza this is the place to go. It's the town staple, don't let Pasta Mia fool you. I suggest the thin crust, double dough just isn't my style, and they don't do deep dish. Seriously if you've got a craving for pizza and are in Bartlett...what are you waiting for?
Phone crew can be very rude but overall good pizza kinda shady when you know they are writing your whole credit card number down with expiration to run it later!

V & V consistently creates the most perfect pizza in the Bartlett area! The only thing better than ordering their pizza is ordering their pizza with a homemade cannoli for dessert!

If you have grown tired of V & V's thin crust pizza and outstanding homemade sausage after ordering it at least once a week for the last five or ten years -- which, admittedly, is highly unlikely because it is so unbelievably good -- then I would recommend experimenting with some of their other crust options. They are all amazing.

Alternatively, if you are new to the Bartlett area, then V & V is the first (and, most likely only) pizzeria that you should try!

Well, for a local pizza place (and there are sooo many across the suburbs), this was really good. I ordered 4 different specialty thin crust pizzas for work tonight. Each one was good, everyone had a favorite, but the most eaten was the Quattro Gusti. An unusual combo of toppings, but all my favorites. The cheese tastes like a blend, at least more than mozzarella? Ordered online, they were ready for the time I requested, and were steaming hot (that means a lot for people who are on a fixed break schedule). You all should make the Italian Beef and giardiniera a regular pizza! They were just asking me to take some of that one home! Thanks and we will be back!

My husband and I are from Chicago and when we moved to Bartlett 11 years ago, we were desperate to find pizza like we would get in our old neighborhoods. We started trying all the places in Bartlett, but none of them were to our liking. That is, until we found V & V. The pizza is exactly like what we would get in the city. We've also tried other menu items and have never been disappointed.
v&v has the best pizza i've ever had. eating their pizza is like eating a delicious circle of heaven. you won't find a better place in the northwest suburbs.
Best pizza in the area, but i do agree.. i wish they were open on Monday! Sausage is home-made and amaaaazing!

My family and I used to order pizza from here a few years ago when we lived closer.  We loved it! It had just the right amount of seasoning and sauce and wasn't overcooked.  Recently,  we started going here again and it's alright.  We've had the mostaccioli, the calamari and pepperoni pizza.  All were good but I thought the pizza didn't match up to how it used to be... It tasted kind of old and wasn't as good as it once was.  But the calamari was reallly  good and tasted like it was from an Italian restaurant.  It came with both marinara and cocktail sauces and lemon.  I would definately recommend it if you love calamari like me :) the prices are pretty decent but I wish there was a yelp coupon.

My friend was raving about a pizza place a few weeks ago that I just *must* try.  I'm always down for a slice!!  So we waited until the "thin crust" mood struck, and it brough our appetites to the likes of V&V!

It was snowing out.  Badly.  Like the first snowfall of the year where people forget how to drive. By the way, in case you were wondering, it goes like this: ease on the gas, ease off the gas and brake slowly and steer, Jeebus...it's not rocket science, guys.

That being said, we were fully ready to pick up our pizza, but we found out that they deliver to our area!  *fist pump* YESSSSSSSSSSSSSSS!!!!

BTW, they missed out on seeing me in my VS PINK sweatpants, but that's their loss...

But now onto the most important part of the part of the review...ME!  And what *I* thought about the food ;)

It was delightful!!!  So here's the rundown of what we got:
A thin crust SAH-SAGE well done with extra sauce 
Dinner Salad w/ Ranch
Garlic Bread
Chocolate Cake

And our total was $23 and some change.  $33 if you include what we gave the driver for foraging through the snow to give us our noms.  It's over a 40% tip, but it was well-deserved!

OK, so onto the somewhat bad (and it's not even that bad).  The salad was $2.95 and all it was was some chopped up iceburg lettuce and two sad little slices of tomato.  I wouldn't order it again for that price.  it wasn't worth it for the size and quality.  The garlic bread was pretty good, but standard.

But the pizza and the cake--WOW!  They were my shining stars of the meal!  Everyone who raved about the sausage was absolutely correct.  They know what they're doing here!  And I liked that I ordered my pizza well done, and it ACTUALLY CAME WELL DONE!  Shocker and a half right there!!  I don't know what the pizza would be like with regular sauce, since we ordered ours with extra, but it was a great amount.  And the sauce is very sweet.

And double wow for the chocolate cake.  Yummy, gooey, delicious, and everything I want in my dessert :)

I know this is going to be one of our go-to places from now on for delicious thin crust and great service!!

The pizza was decent, but the staff is horrible. The girl who answered the phone somehow charged me for something I had ordered two years ago and re ordered it for me this time. When I called after the driver left the owner was extremely rude. I will not go back there again.

This used to be the best pizza in the area key words use to be!  Not sure what happened pizza delivered cold, pizza has been delivered with the cheese all on the corner of the box obviously carried sideways, the sauce has changed its now horrible! The kicker when we call to let them know you can hear the owner screaming rudely in the background he isn't apologetic nor sends replacement. My son and his friends would order at least twice a week needless to say no more! We were talking to a neighbor they've had the same experience including the rude ignorant owner screaming in the background.

My family loves V & V pizza. We have been eating here for over 25 years, since I was a little girl. Their pizza is the best around. We always get the double dough which is the perfect thickness. The ingredients are always fresh and delicious. Our #1 pizza place! And they always cut the pizza into squares for us :)

yeah, v&v is pretty good, but no where near 5-star worthy in my book.

when i think thin crust, i think crispy, light, and crunchy. thin crust here is more like pan pizza on a diet. not quite crispy thin, but not as thick as pan. i'm also a sauce lover....v&v is definitely for cheese lovers. final criticism? you have to avoid the middle pieces of the pizza cause they're drenched in oil and grease. take out the napkins, dabbers. you'll need a ton of them to soak up this mess.

ok, ok. i get it. there aren't THAT many good places to eat in Bartlett. but that's what delivery is for!

disclaimer - even though it's not the best, i would never turn it down haha.
Our favorite pizza around. We have been customers for over a decade now and have never been let down. Delicious!!!

This is not good pizza.  The crust is flavorless, almost like eating cardboard.  The sauce is nothing to rave about.  The cheese appears to be a pre-mixed blend, as they were not able to honor a request for no parmesan or romano.  Look elsewhere for decent pizza, it's not here.

Holy shit good!  Again, holy shit good!

Lesser words are unfair, untrue, and should be stricken from the record.

The best thin crust I have ever had.  I was turned on to this place by an excellent pizzeria owner from my old town.  That's how good this place is.  I guess they aren't competitors, but for a pizzeria owner with great pizza to specifically tell you about how good this place is, you can imagine.  

I was lucky enough to have a friend living in Bartlett at the time, he had been experienced.  It wasn't long before I was seriously impressed.  I've had it three times.  2 of the times were so ridiculous I was telling everyone that would listen, the 3rd time, it was merely fantastic.  

If you live within 10 miles, you should have them on speed dial.

This is hands down best pizza ever. We have had then sent to people who moved out of Bartlett because you just can't get thin crust like this. If you're near Bartlett order this pizza. Mondays are sad days when they are closed.

This IS the best pizza in Bartlett. Hands down. We have a few friends that moved out of town and we always get V&V (at their request) when they come to visit.

I highly recommend the "Special". Sausage, pepperoni, bacon, ground beef, mushrooms, green peppers, onions and green or black olives. Bacon baby! They offer it with black olives but I suggest getting it with green olives. The saltiness adds to the experience. I've been getting nothing but V&V for my takeout pizza fix for almost 20 years (from when they were located in a little hole behind Schultz's Hardware, remember that?)

Ok, so obviously Bartlettarians like this place.  S'alright I guess.  I've only had the pizza.  I'd say a full 4 star rating.  I had to give them another 1/2 star after I tried the bbq chicken pizza.  YUM!

Here's what I like about it:  
-mom n pop joint
-fresh ingredients
-good sausage (and I'm not usually into sausage). 
-amazing bbq chicken pizza
-coupons in the moneysaver, bonus!

Here's what's bogus:
-greasy, especially if  we forget to ask for well done
-phone service is so quick that sometimes it comes off rude
-would usually prefer a thinner crust
-pricey?  kinda sorta maybe?? ($25 for large 1/2 sausage 1/2 shroom).

Thin crust pizza has a big rep here, so I gave it a try. There are better ingredients used than some places, so I can see the point. Fresh mushrooms, delicious sauteed peppers, tasty sausage. - that part is fine.

Otherwise though, it's the same old midwest USA pizza you can get on any street corner. Crust baked hard and tough. Cheese vulcanized into rubber. Pleeeeze! Whatsa mattaU? Haven't learned how to bake?

I'll give them a another try sometime and warn them not to over bake it and see what happens.

Oh geez..I have a feeling I'm going to get in trouble for this review..
I have to honestly say I'm not a fan of  V&V's pizza..I may be the only person in Bartlett that feels this way! Everyone I know loves this place..but for some reason I just don't have the taste for it.
I'm not saying that it's the worst pizza I've had, but it is just so greasy. Maybe that's what everyone likes about it? Not sure but I've had way better pizza then this place. 
The sauce is mediocre, could use more garlic if anything, and the crust is so bland. Not much else to describe about it
I prefer Pasta Mia's pizza over V & V's. Sorry!! :(

RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE!!!! it is unfortunate that they actually do have decent pizza, however if you don't mind RUDE people answering the phones and working the front desk well then go ahead and get your pizza there! I however will NEVER get pizza from there again, why would I want to support a local business that doesn't care if they have business or not! However thanks to the rude girl that I hung up on tonight we tried Taylor Street Pizza and i cost less the people were friendlier and the pizza was very good!!!!!

This place is ALWAYS busy.  They have GREAT pizza.  Home made sausage and their pizza sauce is excellent.

There isn't any place for you to sit down, just pick up or delivery only...

For you meat lovers, try the bacon, sausage and fresh tomato pizza...

Out. Of. This World..  Getting hungry just thinking about it now!!!!

They have excellent thin crust pizza, tastes like a good hearty cracker. Great sauce and cheese combo. Excellent cole slaw, I think they make it fresh. 
I wish they were open on Mondays

Update 11/17/13

Their simple fare such as the Italian Beef Sandwich and Their Grilled Chicken Pesto is wonderful. 
The Cheesecake is good hearty slice, enough for two.
My sinful order includes the fried mushrooms and a thin crust saus, mush, gp and onion.

Update 11/18/13

Ordered fried mushroom appetizer, its the traditional fried mushrooms that are sold in wholesale packs to restaurants, but still good.

BBQ chicken wings are also traditional, and they use Open Pit BBQ sauce which has 

Caprese Salad,(  had fresh mozzarella,roasted peppers, tomatoes and seeded black olives.)

Thin Crust , black olive and onion .

Order arrived hot. Polite delivery.
Only the BEST Pizza Around !

Excellent thin crust, one of the best in the area.  I your in the area and havent tried it, your really missing out. Stop ordering from those awful chains and try some excellent LOCAL pizza from people who care about what they serve.

They have by far the best pizza in the western suburbs, no one even comes close.
Have been going there for 17 years and it is always great. They are pricey but you get what you pay for.
By far the best thin crust in the area.

So happy I found V&V.  For all those bad reviews out there wow... are you sure you ate at V&V?  Frozen pizza crust?  A pizza from the grocery store? Are you kidding me?  This place is so good.  From the crust to the cheese and everything in between.  I order mine well done and it reminds me of my childhood and eating pizza in Chicago.  I have tried several places in the West Burbs and this is my favorite Mom and Pop Pizza joint.  Love it!

If I had a con it would be that it is only a take out place.  But this place is always good.  We moved out of their delivery area and we still make a trip to get our pizza from here.  Love it! Love it! Love it!  

p.s. when we have ordered for a party everyone is always surprised as they are coming from the city and always give compliments to how good the pizza is.  Before we discovered V&V we would get pizza from another place for parties and never got a compliment.  Same group of people and no they weren't just hungry.  Its just good.  So I think it boils down to people have different tastes but give it a shot.  Try a small see how you like it and you may just discover your new favorite pizza place.  I did. So happy I did.
This is absolutely my favorite pizza place around!!! If your in the area you must try this amazing pizza!! best homemade sausage!!!!!!
THE BEST PIZZA AROUND!!! I would give it 5 stars but it's ridiculously expensive. I'm mean ridiculous but so F-ing good!

WOW!!!!!

This place has amazing service and great food! if your looking for some great food here i reccomend the pizza (duh) and the mozzerella sticks but im sure the other food is good as well! Something else i've noticed is that the prices are not crazy......but anyways I extremely reccomend it!!!!!

Gotta say by far this is the BEST pizza in Bartlett! You gotta go here if you are craving pizza.  I love the thin crust cheese and sausage! Definitely recommend to stop by there if you are looking for some good ole pizza in Bartlett!

Best pizza ever...I hope I never have to move far away!  Got takeout for Christmas dinner last year, which was also good, but a bit on the too salty side.  I have to say, though, the staff really went out of their way to help me get everything into the car and make sure I didn't hesitate to call if I had any questions about how to heat stuff up again. Oh, and once, when I came to pick up pizza and paid with my credit card, I was writing a tip on the slip and she said...oh no!!! you don't have to do that!! and she actually crossed the tip off. Wow. Never thought I would see that!  You have to go to V&V...the staff is awesome and the pizza is amazing. Try the spinach, ricotta, & tomato. My fav!!!

Something has changed at this place, different sauce, not fresh sausage, something has tainted the pizza at this joint.  I was a former once a week order, not anymore.  Blows me away how restaurants screw up a good thing.  Shame.  Still no good pizza joints in Bartlett other than Moretti's, but even that place gets old.

This place is hands down one of the best take-out places in the burbs.  My family and I have been getting take-out from here for as long as I can remember (since the 80's) and the food is ALWAYS good.  We ordered religiously (every Sunday) when we still lived in Streamwood and even occasionally pick up still now that we live west of St. Charles.  The pizza, the pastas, sandwiches...there's nothing there that's not to rave about.  I only wish they had a dining room so I could enjoy it more often...

If there is a category for "Best take out pizzeria in the burbs" this place would win w/out a doubt!  Been going here probably about 20 years.  Ok that just made me sound really old but honestly ever since I liked eating pizza as a kid thats how long I've been eating it.  There is one trick though and I dont like mentioning all the secrets to the trade.  :)  Well........I cant, maybe later!  haha...Anyways, the pizza is great here.  They do not use cheap ingreds or even on top of it they do not skimp on anything either.  Pizzas are PHENOM!  Other menu items are great as well!  I would recommend if not the pizza to go w/ their manicotti.  It comes piping hot, baked w/ a nice mound of nicely melted mozzarella on top of  their homemade cheese manicotti.  This is there Sunday special and its be known "by me"  :) to cure any type of hangover possible.  So H or H (hungry or hungover)  you like that I just made it up myself!  haha...Manicotti is great.  Back to the #1 item here.   Fresh ingredients, great sauce, good cheese (not cheap stuff).  Would highly recommend trying their sausage or hot beef and giardeniera.  Either one is great but I have decided to relinquish the almighty secret!  You must order the pizza w/ extra sauce, well done.   Cant believe I just did it!!  Well the secret is out and now you must try!!!  You can thank me later.

We found this pizzeria when we first moved from Chicago to Streamwood about 25 years ago. This carryout pizzeria is the best we have found! We moved to the west side of Saint Charles 10 years ago, but still travel to Bartlett because their pizza and dinners (eggplant parmesan is my favorite!) cannot be beat. I don't think I've ever been disappointed with any of their food or their service.

We get delivery and take out from here probably 1-2 times a month, and have never had a complaint about anything.  Food is always delivered on time, or ready for us when we go pick it up.  Everything we have ordered has been great.  We've gotten several of the apps, different types of pizza, calzones, and the chocolate cake and tiramisu.  We will continue to order from there on a regular basis.
Its the best pizza hands down!!!!!!! Ive been going here forever and NO pizza place compares!!!!

Well, I'm disappointed. I have good memories of the chili mac supreme. Haven't had it in a few years, but I stopped in here today. I asked for, and was charged for, double beef. When it came out I looked at it and thought, "um, I said double beef, not half beef." I told my server and she took the plate back to the kitchen. She came back and told me that they said this IS double beef. ??? It's almost nonexistent. They charge an extra dollar for as much beef as about a quarter of one of their little burger patties? She looked sorry and said she'd ask if they could put more on, and I said thanks, and she did. And they did put more on. But, um... gosh. Disappointing. She had to see me sitting here taking pictures of this plate and she knew I wasn't happy, but the poor kid still came back to ask if everything tasted okay. I bet she was dreading coming back to my table. Totally not her fault, though.

In better news, my turtle shake was good. Don't think I'll come back here though.

I've been going here once a week for about 4 years now. I have never had a bad experience, the wait staff all know us and take great care of us. I will especially call out Judy who was our first waitress and to this day still stops by to say hi every time we come in. 

Of all the Steak 'n Shake's I've been to (probably 7 other steak 'n shakes in my time), I would say this is the best of them all. It's very clean and the service is FAST! The food is the typical steak 'n shake food, so can't say anythings "special" but I will say they customize my burger for me every time and its always perfect. 

If you're looking for a great place to get something quick and fill that comfort food void then don't think twice, stop in and enjoy a jalapeno crunch burger with a really big iced tea. It's my favorite and will keep me coming for years to come.

See you guys on Thursday!

By far the worst service I've ever had at any restaurant. Rude servers, and very rude manager. I won't be giving a single penny back to this place let alone the whole change of steak and shakes again. It took 45 MINUTES TO GET MY FOOD. I had to get menus for myself and had to ask multiple times for drinks. I got my food before the drinks even came... finished my cheap horrible disgusting burger before the water was even served. I continued to give no tip as it was not deserved at all.

I will make this quick and short.

1. The place was clean.

2. It was sort of weird that I was the only one there for breakfast.

3. Sabina did a great job with her service and actually saved me money by selecting the best coupons I brought in. 

Pretty disgusting with the prior picture with the maggots...but I gave this place a chance and it was beyond clean, the kitchen looked very clean, and I think that picture from a few years ago possibly made several changes to this store.

They seem to never have biscuits ready in the morning during the morning rush.  5 of the last 7 times I've gone this has been the case. And selfishly, it sucks because those biscuits are my one cheat breakfast each week. Honestly, I get the 24 hour open thing but have you ever gone to McDonald's in the morning and they say sorry we are out of Egg McMuffins for the next 25 minutes? I guess I'm not getting why there isn't some sort of baking schedule or protocol such as "when there are 3 biscuits left, make some more." I know this is more of a rant than a review, but seriously get with it. You've got a McDonalds, Burger King and Dunkin Donuts on your corner - and while I'm only one person - it's too easy to go there instead and not have to worry about the food even being available. You're losing money with this issue.
Waited a long time in the drive through lane. Cashier was nice, but fried were old and cold and they gave me the wrong burger.

I will not say the name of my server to ensure that this is confidential. We will call him pudding instead. Pudding is a young and semi metro waiter with a bow tie. To ensure that Pudding is serving the correct beverages, Pudding sniffs the beverages with care. Note, this is not a creepy sniff, but more of an endearing and caring sniff to ensure that the customers are deeply satisfied. Pudding uses some "interesting" language while serving crowds of young adults. Pudding is my favorite waiter in the Elk Grove area, and I enjoy seeing Pudding's face every time I return. 
 
#Puddingformanager2016
Great breakfasts, great lunches, great service if you get Jude, Brittany or Allan. Very affordable food.

Burgers were greasy, thin, and old. 

Nothing fresh about this place. 

Customer service was awful today. Only four other in the whole restaurant and our food took over 30 minutes. I can't understand why the long wait if our entire order was cold and stale, I mean who are you kidding there is nothing made to order here  it seemed to be all pre-cooked and kept under a heat lamp. 

My seasoned parmesan fries were smothered in salt so much so they were just plain uneatable. 

Im giving it 2 stars because the shake was half way decent. 

Unfortunate I will not be returning I think I have had better burgers at Denny's.

The bathroom here is disgusting and I'm not talking about someone didn't flush the toilet. I'm talking about everything! The toilet bowl being yellowish in color meaning it hasn't been cleaned. Poop splatter on sides of inner bowl on the other toilet seat. Floor is nasty. To think this is a restaurant and it should be clean because you don't want to the bug in the belly.

If I could give it negative stars I would:
Worst service ever! Staff are rude and obnoxious- they couldn't even be bothered to seat my family: they were too busy chatting!

Avoid this place like the plague!
Absolutely disgusting! The tables were all filthy and there was a line of people waiting to sit down and no wait staff anywhere to be found!!

The only reason I go back is because my kids like the shakes
 Otherwise the service is slow, not enough workers and no one seems to care. We have walked out before because we weren't being helped. People who say down 10 minutes after us: received menus and water, received there food and during that time we weren't even checked in on.

Dirty dirty dirty.  The employees handle food after handling money without washing their hands. The manager acts like he doesn't know so it's okay but he claims he will talk to the employee about that issue they are very slow and if you look at the floor and all their garbage cans inside the kitchen it's dirty and the cans are overflowing and the cashier will insult you if you question her about washing your hands after touching money and handling food I will never go to that establishment again.

Here's the thing: it's Steak 'n Shake. Food is subpar, service is warn out and washed up, and the other patrons are, well, what'd you expect. My roommate dragged me here and I'll get him back somehow. Two stars because it's McDonald's cheap with a more intriguing brand.

I come through here a lot. And for the most part they are consistent. But the biggest problem that I have is why they aren't ready for breakfast at 5:30 in the morning? This isn't the first time either.
Horrible horrible service. WALKED OUT after waiting close to 25 minutes to have someone come over and ask me for my order.
Dirty floors especially under the booths    Edges gave build up so I am sure it is not just today's business. Turn off
Slow slow slow. I've been in the drive thru line for 20 mins. Does anybody work here?

My wife, son and I stopped here last night for dinner. We wanted a little something better than fast food but not the lengthy time of a sit down.  This seemed to be a good compromise.  It's been a couple of years since our last visit to a steak and shake. 

First off, let me start off with why a drive thru.  These burgers are made to order, not a production mode like McDonalds or BK. Your not going to get quick service in a drive thru in a place like this. Just not going to happen. Which leads to my complaint about slow service. Drive thru gets priority and bogs down the sit down portion of the business. 

Now for the food...pleasantly surprised!  We all ordered melts and they were very good. Much better choice than McD and BK. The price was right in line too. The reason we haven't been to SnS because we thought it was a pricy burger. With today's places like 5 Guys and pricy burgers,  it's nice to see SnS staying in line with a realistic burger price.  

We will be back, but make sure we know what to order right away to save time.
If I could give you a zero I would.  Got seated by manager.  Place mats were dirty.  We sat and sat and sat.  Finally after 12 minutes we walked out.  No service no score.

One of the waitresses who is middle-aged with an accent apparently has issues with paying customers.  My son goes there with his friends and she is always rude and provides no service.  They are rushed to place their orders and rushed to get out after paying.  She must not be working for tips.  By the way, the other waiters and waitresses are great to them.

I want to like this location, but the service is way too slow. Servers stand around wasting your lunch minutes, than they come over ask if you want water, walk away before you can order, and generally just waste the time you have for a quick lunch. The menu is Ok, food, flavor OK if you can get you food. I don't see how the district management cannot tell that this place has some issues? You could use the drive thru faster than sitting inside, and several times can't even get orders correct, and when that happens they wasted 20 to 30 minutes of your time.
Really great burger and fries for 4 bucks. I'm quite satisfied. Felt like the burgers used to be a little bigger though.

The burgers are cooked to order.  Had a triple burger with fries for under $4.  
Open 24 hrs, I find it to be worth the money at any time of day.
I recommend it.
This place is a complete train  wreck. Filthy dirty restaurant awful service. Everyone in the restaurant is aggravated about slow staff. STAY AWAY.

Sorry you felt the review  from jesse m was not reliable.  I was there yesterday  and was also in line waiting  to pay. The service was very slow. I watched as who I believe to be the manager refused their payment. I felt bad for them I go to that location often never had service  as bad as it was yesterday. Bad day maybe. But they should probably know more about money.

My lunch crew and I went here for a bite to eat and sat there wondering why we haven't gone before. The food is greasy and good, prices are super cheap, service was super friendly, not too far from work...all in all a good experience.

They have a bunch of lunchtime options for $4 which is awesome~! I had the Portabello and Swiss Hamburger meal which came with fries which I got cheesy and covered in bacon. See picture. Nomz. Now this was a one time heart attack paired with a double chocolate milkshake but man was it all good! It was a big amount of food, too, so had to take fries and half the burger home!

Pro Tip: If you're going to get a milkshake, opt for the regular size. I got a small and my friend got a large. His was at least double the size of mine for like 50 cents more!

My husband and I stopped by for dinner tonight.  Claudia was our waitress and she was the most personable waitress I think I've ever met.  She took our order and it was perfect, including my request for grilled onions, not raw.  She stopped by several times to make sure we didn't need anything!  Such a smile and such a wonderful "teenager"...total class!!  Everyone working there should pay attention on how to be a great waitress!
There is always a waiter who seems high at night. Bathrooms are not so clean too. Food was good. Overall needs some improvement from the staff. Service needs to be faster .

Don't go on a Saturday evening.

I came in with my 3yr old expecting to wait, but not expecting to be ignored. Three servers walked passed me completely ignoring me standing there with my son waiting to be seated. They saw me, and even though semi-occupied, (like bringing silverware to someone) they didn't even acknowledge me. I dress decently, I don't look like a hobo, I try to smile and my cute son is hard to miss. Why would you ignore me and look for ways to stay occupied to avoid seating me??

So the manager comes and helps me out finally. We seat and for another 10 minutes the same treatment! One waiter literally walked by, sees me ready to order, and goes to the table behind me to ask how everyone is doing then leaves. I stood up and vocally told the waiter to get the manager. Another waiter came to me immediately and I reprimanded her on how completely disrespectful it is to be ignored.

Its one thing to be busy, thats understood. Another to be completely IGNORED!!!

She said the meal is completely free, anything free...Ok...Then she properly apologized. Ok, deep breath, I'm cool...Forgiven.

THEN THE MEAL COMES OUT, there's hair in my boy's plate. YGTBFKM. I held the plate in the air and motioned to the waiter to come look. Wow. She was as shocked as I was and says, "When it rains, it pours." Then goes back in the kitchen and yells at everyone about what happened. That made me feel better.

The manager was urgent at making sure this was reconciled, came out to me and got down to my eye level and genuinely apologized. "Its normally not like this". She is right. It isn't. "Please take home whatever you like, order more, everything is on me." She and the waiter both encouraged me to order extra.

I don't know, the waiter and manager both were genuine in their apology and handled it well enough for me to not completely write this place off. I may give it another try. Just not at peak time!!  - Nicholas  visited: 11/09/2013, 6:15pm

I've been going to Steak and Shakes for years, and have stopped going because it always seems to take at least an hour. My family was looking for a fast dinner on our way home from the Burbs. I was very leery about stopping here, but didn't want McDonalds either.

We were pleasantly surprised by the prompt service. Our orders were taken quickly, and the food beat our shakes. The food was just what we expected. I love the Frisco Melt, and the kids ate every bite of theirs.  This was by far the fastest and best overall Steak and Shake experience I've ever had.
I usually have very great experiences at Steak N Shake but today I sat at the counter and waited 15 to 20 minutes before somebody even acknowledge that I was there. Food was great.

I had a great shake from there tonight.  Good thing I did not get any food.  When I was at the drive thru at 9:05pm (8/1/2015) I could see the girl who was cooking the food.  I saw her texting while wearing the plastic gloves she was supposed to use to keep germs off our food. So it worried me that she was touching a phone that has probably been is some very nasty places, then she was grabbing meat and cooking peoples burgers.  I will stick with the shakes, but I will skip the steaks from now on at this place.

Must've been a bad day. Waited forever for a basic chocolate milkshake. Most of the time I am quite satisfied but I must say that the one time was truly horrible. This was my 99 out of 100 that went bad. We'll be back but please learn from your mistakes and don't think this is normal.

I am extremely upset with this place. First of all the service was quite terrible. Very slow and we waited a good 15 minutes for our check. We went to the counter finally to pay our bill and we had to wait since no body was at the register. We hand the lady in a gray shirt and headphones our 100 dollar bill. It was one of the older looking bills. She gets her counterfeit marker and marks our bill. The mark on it turns yellow and she then holds it up to the light. She then tells us that our bill is fake. We are shocked at this. She holds up a newer bill and tells us that our bill doesn't have the blue stripe. Now she's comparing two different bills. Me and my family work in the resturant business and we use the same marker to mark our bills. If the mark turns yellow then the bill is real. If the mark turns brown or black then the bill is fake. Maybe she should read the instructions about the marker and she will do it right. She tells us to take our bill back to the bank because it was fake, we were embarrassed so we hand her a different bill. Now if her logic is to compare the old bill with the newer bill then use the marker wrong then she needs to learn how to handle money the right way. After our experience we took the bill to the bank and it was accepted with no problem. Never trust the lady in gray with the headphones.

Savor and sip! That's my recommendation when you stop by here to indulge on one of their classic shakes. 

I was one of only two cars on the road tonight ... and the other one was ahead of me at the drive thru. 

The guy who took my order not only did it great, but took his time. This insured me of  exactly what I paid for ... a visually spectacular and fabulously tasting mocha shake.

Will I pay for this in time spent on an elliptical. You better believe it! But this is a
naughty pleasure you just gotta have occasionally. 

Gemma's Rules: 1. All things in moderation 2. For these shakes: savor & sip!

Really love and enjoy this stake n shake at Elk Grove. My friends and I always going Thursdays nights for our favorite sever Greg who takes really good care of us and everyone else he serves. the food is always good after a night of drinking or just a late night snack! I highly recommend going on a Thursday night for the great staff that just make it fun
Good food. Fast and cheap.

Ah yes, finally a place where we can get a decent meal for 3 under $25 (including milk shakes). 

Clean, friendly staff, fast service and fresh food - what more can you ask for?

The thing I notice most when I go here is how friendly the staff is. They go above and beyond to be nice to the customer.  otherwise I haven't eaten much of the food here but I've had a few different specialty burgers and they were delicious and of course the milk shakes are always amazing especially during happy hour from 2-4 when they are half priced :)

Hooray for places like this. Old school steak burgers and amazing shakes open 24-7. Where else could I sit in a booth and map out my cross country trip as I chow down on a spicy chicken sandwich, decent chili and awesome raspberry yogurt shake. YUM. Except then I spend hours trying to dig out the raspberry pieces out of my teeth on 
I-80. I think I finally got them all out;-) Plus, I love their cheesy commercials.

Everytime we send one of our associates over to pick up lunch the people working the drive thru are just crazy rude. Today one of my associates went when there was nobody in line at the drive thru and he asked if he could place three separate orders. The manager told him its frowned upon and that he could only place two. So after the first one he had to drive around again and place the last one. We order steak n shake for lunch every so often but the reason we opt out for it is because we don't want to deal with inconveniencing the staff!
Went last night and this Steak N Shake is STILL fantastic. It's incredible.

Why can't Cali have a Steak N' Shake? 

Damn "Frisco Melt", that sandwich stays on my brain.
As described on the SNS website, "Two Steakburgers with American and Swiss cheeses, on buttery grilled sourdough with our sweet 'n tangy Frisco sauce. Served with french fries." Nuff said. 

Holy Moly. My mouth is watering for one now. Everytime I go eastward, (Chicago, Dallas, anywhere but Cali) I gotsta go to SNS. The meat is just different--moist and juicy, and those shoe string fries, let's not even talk about those crispy golden treats.

Might have to take a road trip to Texas for some SNS.

Message to Steak N' Shake Corporate Offices: 
Please come to Cali, at least as far west as Arizona, or Nevada. 
Love: Rell E.
Good prices, friendly staff, yummy shakes. Convenient drive-thru.

To give you some background info, I am allergic to dairy, and had never been to steak n shake before this.

We came here on a Tuesday around 12:30 to eat lunch (an 8th grade "treat" on a band tour). The food got to our table fairly quickly, but almost no one got exactly what they ordered! Now onto the real problem at hand, I had ordered their spicy chipotle grilled chicken sandwich and it came to the table with chili cheese fries I had neither ordered nor could eat. I alerted the waitress and she moved them off the plate. I go to take a bite of the sandwich and I see none other than melted cheese on the sandwich. I again called the waiter over (took several calls from all 10 of us at the table to get her back toward us) and alerted her to the fact that I am allergic to dairy. She takes a look at it and says "Oh honey that's not cheese, it's just "stuff from the grill". Now i'm thinking "What is 'stuff from the grill"?! She then STUCK HER FINGERS IN MY SANDWICH and pulled off some of that mysterious cheese-like substance, and looked at me, expecting me to eat it. I did, against my better judgement. There was indeed cheese on it. I then had an allergic reaction. $9.70 I payed for that meal...

In summary, if you're going to  pay $9.70 for a burger, perhaps you should go to Meatheads. You'll get less "stuff from the grill".

It's been several years since I've visited Steak N' Shake because unfortunately I don't live any where reasonably near a franchise location. Since I was in a college and visiting Illinois, I've tried to make a point to visit Steak N' Shakes when the opportunity arises because of the quality experiences I've had.  This visit was even better, and exceeded the expectations I have had for the past 10 years.  The folks at Steak N' Shake have done something exceptionally brilliant, they've lowered their prices.  It's the same delicious hamburger(s) and specialty sandwiches and fries at a lower price than I recall paying before.  Combo meals were between $3.79 and $5.79.  It appears to me that Steak N' Shake is going after the jugular of mediocre burger chains by delivering a superior product at a better price.  The 3 of us in our party were stuffed, and raving about the experience at $21.09.  How often can you say that these days?

This location in particular was very clean and well maintained, and it had a sit-down feel at lower than walk-up prices.  The manager also made a point to visit our table to make sure our needs were being met.
 
Steak N' Shake come to central Iowa! Please.

Young Jose on the scene, walking through with my swag, main grill opens my door. I me greeted by a smile from the hostess. And we are sat down immediately. Coffee was poured and our waitress, Heather, greats us with a warm and zealous demeanor. We were given our time to look through the menu and drinks were served right away. Over all great service and felt at home. I would not only recommend it but stand behind it, my broskie and I come through after tennis sometimes. #Shout out Jack, Blayne, Ivan, Tim, Adriana, and my daughter Julia of course. Much Love. #Lord Breed.

Our #1 go to for breakfast. My family has been coming here for over 3 years now and we love their small, cozy and friendly atmosphere. We are greeted with the sweetest hostesses and love each one of the waitresses. They are very accommodating with our two small kids and the food is great! I get the bacon egg and cheese on a bagel and it is delicious. It is cooked perfect every time.

Okay, full disclosure here... I love, no, I LOVE little hole in the wall restaurants and this is one of the best.  Now, the last time I was here it was a pretty meh experience but this time?  The food was delicious!  Not only that, the coffee was so good I think I drank a pot by myself.

We went for breakfast so I can't comment on what lunch is like but the omelettes my husband and I had were fluffy and full of flavor!  I had one that was stuffed with chorizo, jalapeno, cheese, & green pepper; my husband's was the meat lover.  I didn't taste his because, well, he never offered because it was so good and to be fair, mine was so good I didn't offer a taste of mine either.  And the pancakes!  Moist, light, fluffy... YUM!  I was recently at another area restaurant for pancakes and they were as dry and tasteless as the Sierra.

The servers were very attentive with refills and we never had to flag someone down to refill our cup.  That's one of my pet peeves.  Nothing's worse than sitting there with your food getting cold because you're waiting for a drink to wash it down with.  Also they were very good at honoring my swap-outs.  Yeah, I wanted tortillas even though they're not offered as a side.

Good portions and good food.  Go get you some!

I've been here a couple times and each time the food isn't good at all. The hash browns are like mashed potatoes, really soggy. The decor is really old fashioned, I feel like I went back in time to some old dingy diner. The wait staff is slow on refills and checking back with customers. Sorry not my favorite spot.

Stopped by last Sunday for breakfast, and was seated & had our order taken fairly quickly. Decent prices, fair wait time, and the food quality was about what I expected. I wasn't a fan of the hash browns (kinda mushy) but our server Marissa was very nice!

A definite Diamond in the rough.  It's a neiborhood restaurant forgotten by time as the decor will surely tell you, but it's like being at a place you went to as a kid on vacation is the memory it evokes in me.  Now to the really important stuff.  The food is fantastic.  I usually get the 2 eggs scrambled, with all sausage links, 2 potato pancakes (each the size of your head,) toast, and a small cranberry juice for less than $8.00 with tax. You get a large portion of food for a great price and the food is fresh.  The service is wonderful too.  I've also had the patty melt and it was perfection.  This is one place I'll keep coming back to again and again.
Diamond in the ruff. Clean, good service, good prices, good food. Will go back without question.

My initial review was filtered. Apparently truthful reviews, although poor are not displayed.

Regardless, my review of Ken's Schaumburg restaurant remains the same. Counting your tips at the door & wearing your kitchen whites, complete with a paper hat  are acceptable. On one hand, the glass of ice water, without requesting it was welcome. Talking about a customer within earshot is also unacceptable.I assume that "it's hard to ruin breakfast" may be true. Unfortunately, I never goes t that far. The rudeness I received sent me out the door before I could eat. 

I'd say to read the filtered review & decide for yourself.

Food was poor, service was poor and slow. Had to repeatably ask for refills on drinks and coffee. Couldn't find server when meals were missing items and  prepared wrong. Decor old and outdated (even for a neighborhood place)

With tons of breakfast options in the area - would pick somewhere else.

Is this the fanciest breakfast place ever?  No, not really.  But, you do get friendly, fast service, good food, and good prices.

Love their classic skillet and their pancakes are great.  Rarely do I have to wait for a table.  I've always found the servers to be very polite and efficient and the prices reasonable.  Also, the bathrooms are clean (yes, I judge places based on bathrooms).

All-in-all, a fine place for breakfast, especially when you can't (or don't feel like) waiting.

I have to admit I was a little turned off realizing the restaurant used to be a BK.  It is ok inside, a bit generic but clean.  The shrimp tempura appetizer was good, nothing special.  The maki rolls were really good. We got the volcano and red dragon.  If you are up for decent sushi but not a date night type place, check it out.

Think of it as a fast good sushi place. It looks like a Burger King turned into a sushi restaurant. Not much to look at, but the food was pretty good and the service was prompt and kind. In the future, we will probably do carry out.

I started with the seaweed soup which was delicious and only a dollar, so there is no reason you shouldn't try it.  We then ordered the vegetable tempura for an appetizer. It was much bigger than we expected for $5.50. I was pretty much full after that, but we had 4 rolls on the way. All the rolls we ordered came with 8 pieces. I thought they would be on the smaller side based on the prices, but I was wrong. We ended up with way too much food and had leftovers. I really enjoyed the dragon roll, but wasn't a big fan of the spicy tuna roll.

I ordered the chicken teriyaki from this place for a quick lunch and I was particularly looking for a place with a drive thru so I settled for this place instead of going to a fast food chain. What a disappointment! The chicken was tasteless and that special sauce doesn't really add too much. Their rice was tasty and those sweet carrots were really good!  I guess if I were a vegetarian, I wouldn't mind it. But I'm a meatatarian ! Now what?

I guess it's not fair to give this review since I only tried 1 thing off the menu but I really doubt that I'll be back to try again.

Great spot for Japanese and sushi. It took over the old Burger King location, but once inside, you'd never guess. 

Service was fantastic! Combo platters and sushi were great. They even had sweet iced tea, which is a plus! 

I ordered the soba noodles with steak. I asked for the steak to be prepared at a medium temp, but many pieces were well done. I also tried the red dragon,  jasmine, and Hollywood rolls. Everything was delicious!

Everything was fresh, except the wasabi. It was dark and didn't look appetizing at all, so I didn't eat it. That was really the only negative. 

Price point, quality, and service were all spot on.

Weird experience, good food.

This used to be a Burger King, and it shows; they changed the wallpaper and lights, but left the tiles and front counter. So I walked in with my daughter expecting to buy something at the counter and take it to a table, but instead we were sat down and served.

I have no idea what the drive thru is being used for right now.

Weird vibes aside, I got a flounder plate, and a kids' shrimp plate. The flounder was excellent; a very crispy exterior around flaky white fish, while the shrimp was cooked properly. Both had good taste, and were served with flavored rice, practically candied carrots and broccoli.

Plates come with a spicy (but not hot) mayo sauce that's best used sparingly.

Lunch ended up being about 3 meals for $20, tip included. Not bad!

Sushi was good however the individual entrees are not as authentic as expected.
Waitress was accomodating. Place has a nice ambience.

To be honest, I would've never considered stopping by this place if it wasn't for a friend recommending it to me. I ordered the Hibachi Steak and Shrimp - it was so good! The steak was tender and perfectly cooked. I, personally, wasn't a fan of the rice. The carrots are sweet and melt in your mouth. My husband and I have been back a few times since and every time our food is fresh, hot and so good. Check them out if you're in the area!

Food at Tokyo Grill is opposite the first glance cheesy fast food Curb appeal.  Their sushi menu is extensive and absolutely delicious.  We had a party of five and each found 1-2 unique rolls to pass and indulge.

Maybe the greatest impact was the experience of wonderful food juxtaposed with 'fast food architecture'...when this place is anything but fast food.

Ascertaining an  alcohol license...would ensure a spot in our top 5.  For now; it will have to settle for a top 10 "go to" restaurant.

Converted BK that is now a Japanese teriyaki place. Good selection of lunch specials under $10. Restaurant is clean with open seating. Ordered chicken and shrimp combo. Big portions and taste was good!

Like Panda Express only better in every way! A legit fast stir fry place!

My colleague and I thoroughly enjoyed our lunch here. Not a hint of indigestion among us. The steak seemed to be high quality. I got the soba noodle plate though the noodles were definitely not soba based. A cup of spicy mayo with every order! I concur with these other guys, the carrots are magically sweet and tasty! I may try the tuna entre ($7.75) next time.

I was scared at first to try this place. Why you ask? Easy, it is in an old Burger King when I am used to Japanese restaurants being in shopping centers or something more authentic looking. Also, the prices! Yeah, seeing rolls for $5, a large Sashimi plate for $20, scared me. So, going in & thinking this was going to be a bad experience all around, I was quickly surprised by the quality of the sushi I got for the price. Volcano Roll, oh my delicious. Granted, I have had better, however for not $10 or $11. Spicy Tuna Roll, pretty darn good. Once again, I have had better, but not for $5/$6. In the area, I prefer their spicy tuna over the competitors because they do it old school & don't use a spicy tuna paste, they use a nice piece of tuna with a wasabi ball on the inside.

I have had better, so why 5 stars? A few reasons. 1) the price is really good & they have food pretty much your entire family will enjoy. Habachi style food is there as well, and crazy cheap, like a full meal for $7/$8. 2) the flavor & quality of the sushi. It might be priced like Jewel Sushi but it definitely doesn't taste like Jewel Sushi, pretty darn good and the bang for the buck is good here. 3) the staff is very friendly. After talking to the owner, or one of the owners, it became apparent to me that people think like I did before I went in there, however others don't give the place a chance. Seriously, if you have been considering a decent local place or want to be introduced to a Japanese cuisine, then you really should try this place out. I can say it has been almost 24 hours since I ate there & had not a single negative effect, so that is a plus :D

I will definitely go back and if my experience changes at all, I will update this. Oh, one negative...their chopsticks! They are the ones that are already separated and are round & really slick. I prefer the ones you break apart and are more square. Of course, personal preference, but just a heads up ;)

UPDATE: 10/25/2016 - almost a year later & I still love this place! I have yet to be disappointed there, and visit a few times months, and some times a few times a week.

I decided to give this place a try given all the good reviews and after going I am scratching my head thinking I may have gone to the wrong place. I was expecting a quickly prepared hibachi style meal (by hibachi, I thought high temperature grill cooked like Benihana's) at a reasonable price.  What we experienced was more like mall court food served by a wait staff. 

It was mid afternoon on Sunday and there was nobody else in the restaurant.  I would soon find out why. My wife had the Teriyaki chicken and I ordered the Hibachi chicken.  The meal was served on  a small oval dish and was not very appealing visually.  One chicken came with mushrooms the other with broccoli. Both had a side of carrot slices. We both found our chicken to be dry and bland.  The only seasoning to stand out was the salt. The carrots were sweet and very soft.  Tasted as if they just came out of a can and were mixed with honey. Very unremarkable.  My wife was not happy with her white rice but I thought it appeared like any other fast food Asian rice. The broccoli was tough. My meal came with fried rice and it was the most unappealing and bland fried rice I have ever tasted.  We did not finish our meal and left the restaurant feeling ripped off and hungry.  

I have to say though that the gentleman who waited on us was very pleasant and professional. 

So if you like bland tasting dry chicken with a kick of salt then this place is for you but as for me I will not venture back. I will stick with Joy Teriyaki!

Just like Chris M. said, I also hope this place makes it as well.  From the moment we entered the restaurant, we were greeted by our server who seemed nice and professional.  Her friendliness was just enough and not over the top.  Because it wasn't busy and still early in the day, we had a choice of a booth or a table.  I thought that was really nice.  

Our host/server was very attentive and constantly asked us if we were ready.  If I was to give her advise, it would be to ask us if we have been there before so that she can give feedback on what most patrons found to be very good on the menu.  For first timers, it's always good to give suggestions on what is good or ask what we were in the mood for.  Plus it shows that she knows her menu.  If anything, I hope the owners highly encourage her to try the food so that she has more knowledge on what the food taste like.  Otherwise, she was friendly and attentive.  

I ordered the Dragon Roll and that was just perfect.  It may not seem like it was enough but it definitely hit the spot.  I think I found my favorite sushi.  I also ordered the house salad with the shrimp dressing.  I wasn't sure what to expect but the dressing was good.  However, it did have a taste of Thousand Island.  Maybe it's just another version of Thousand Island?  My fianc ordered the Soba Noodles and he loved it.  He's typically weary of stir fry foods as for some reason he feels that it's just too bland and not enough flavor to them.  However, he really enjoyed the food here.  I also was able to try it and I thought the balance in flavors was just right.  The seasoning wasn't overpowering and it definitely was not bland.  I didn't feel the need to put any soy sauce to his dish.  

Thank you for a great meal and wonderful service.  We would definitely want to come back here again.  Good luck, Tokyo Grill.  We sincerely hope the best for your restaurant.  :)

We visited Tokyo Grill with some friends from (way) out of town recently.

Lots of parking is available in their private lot.

The decor reminds me of a fast food place, which is probably what it was before. I personally didn't care, but some people might be turned off. "Stark" would be the word that I would use to describe it?

The sushi rolls we ordered were tasty and well presented, on the other hand, the entrees have a monochromatic gray-ish look to them with the exception of the carrots which added some color. I ordered the seaweed soup- it was OK but seemed on the bland side.

I wish that they would have left a pot of tea on the table rather than having to call the waitress each time we wanted a refill. The teacups were slightly on the small side too.

We were at Tokyo Grill for around 2 hours and NO ONE other than ourselves and the waitstaff were in the dining area for that entire length of time.

I was surprised that they brought us fortune cookies with our check- isn't that Chinese?
Food made my wife sick. Greasy and full of sugar. Egg rolls were hot and oily on the outside, frozen in the middle.

Tried carry out for the first time today. 

Hibachi Steak - Benihana quality, fast food price. Delicious!
