Fried rice - Good flavor, without needing to add soy sauce. 
Glazed carrots - Good flavor, a tad overcooked, very sweet but it tastes "naturally sweet", if you know what I mean. 

This stuff smells amazing, looks amazing, and tastes amazing! Will definitely be back!!!

My first impression was inaccurate on my part because it looks super cheesy both inside and out. I was pleasantly surprised with the service and the food that is on point. I recommend this place for a nice sit down sushi lunch or dinner. The server was very pleasant and attentive. Go try this place. I'm glad I did not pass this place up.

Husband and I finally tried this place this week and we weren't disappointed. I got the hibachi steak and he had the chicken.
Portions were just right, steak and chicken cooked well.  For a quick meal, this is a convenient place for us.
Will try sushi next time as suggested.

Our eldest went when the restaurant jut opened and recommended it to us. We went and now  it is our favorite fast food place because:
-the place is clean
-the waiters are professional
-it is not crowded
-food is unique, good and at a good price
Regularly, we have our other kids asking to go there. We will be trying the drive through tonight.

Ordered the hibachi steak, and eggrolls. The entree was a lot better than I expected it to be. The carrots were just as how the previous yelpers described it. The beef and rice were really good. I really like the sauce that goes with it. You do not have to pour it on your food, but you can. The place seems understaffed during lunch time on a Tuesday. And they have drive-thru so the waitress can get busy. I don't care too much about service though; I just want the food and this isn't a fancy restaurant.

I was hoping this would be a typical teriyaki lunch place so I stopped in mid-afternoon to give it a try.  I like to see places like this succeed as it is an alternative to the typical burger/sandwich fare that is in the area.  I had the soba noodles with chicken and a soft drink.  It was oily... as in so oily I was wiping my lips over and over driving down the street after I left.  The portions are not huge but adequate for a lunch.  Still, my total reached $12 and I had to leave a tip so it went to $15 and it is just not worth it in my opinion.  I would much rather visit one of the teriyaki places and pay less for what is essentially a fast food lunch.

My family loves this place! Generous portions, freshly made food to order, and reasonable prices. My husband and daughter love the shrimp sauce that comes with every meal - and they are very picky. Give Tokyo Grill a try...you won't be disappointed!

Hope this place makes it! The food is very good, especially for the price. The Sushi/Sashimi was extremely fresh and tasty.

I usually get the "Imprial" combo dinner. It's hibachi steak, chicken, and shrimp with a mushroom/broccoli mix, fried rice, and boiled carrots. Though it's one of the more expensive meals, the portion is very generous; at least 2 meals.

The only downside to this place is the boiled carrots. They are too sweet and boiled to death and super soft.  They give you a ton with practically every meal, so I started replacing the carrots with more mushroom/broccoli mix (but you can sub any side). The mushrooms and broccoli are amazing, very delicious and cooked perfectly, but the fried rice could use some more flavor.

Finally, the food is ready extremely quickly and the service is great. Definitely a great place to have for a quick hibachi meal.

My friend lives right by this place and keeps raving so we went in for some takeout.  Super clean & friendly.  I got the steak teriaki, the steak was really good and the rice was pretty decent the only thing is that the carrots are realllllly sweet.  Im not sure whats up with that but I was not a fan.

5 stars because its:
1. Good - Fresh as can be. I've  had the terri chicken and soba noodles with steak 
2. Cheap - $10 bucks got me two meals! 
3. Somewhat healthy - depends on what you order but nothing processed. It's honest food. 
4. Friendly - 2 people asked if they could take my order within 2 minutes
5. Fast - In and out in 5.
6. Unique -. All we have in the area is stale Italian food and bar pizza. Kudos to the owners for bringing something different to the community!

With all the 4-5 star reviews, we thought we should try nearby Tokyo Grill. Converted BK with the counter still there- odd. Very friendly waitstaff. We had Red Dragon Roll sushi- good. Eggrolls- average. tempura dish- the tempura was very heavy, like beer batter, not light with panko as I have experienced in other Japanese restaurants. Combo chicken and scallop dish was nothing special. The chicken was overdone, scallops fine. Veggies- boiled sweet carrots and broccoli somewhat overcooked. Fried rice- nothing special. "Special sauce" didn't really matter. (best sauce was the teriyaki for the tempura) Would rather have spent a little more and gone to another place for sushi. Or Panda Express at the mall for tastier fast food.

This is my favorite place to get sushi! Not only is it delicious, but they also have a drive-thru... a huge plus when traveling with a toddler & infant! They have the best eel rolls I've ever had. Prices are reasonable. I also love their veggie entree. The only thing I don't like that they offer is their carrots that come with every entree -- they are WAY too mushy and sweet. Overall, this place is great & I go here once a week.

Excellent food. Had my doubts, but was pleasantly surprised by the high quality of the food. Fresh. Quick. Great flavor. Just found out I like cooked carrots! We will come again. This place beats another option in town!
Love this place! Sushi is fresh and staff is very friendly. The  entree's are amazing!

I have gone 2 times and every time was great and fresh ingredients. I tried the salmon plate and the piece of salmon they give is so large same with the tuna plate. The carrots taste like candy so if you have kids that won't eat their veggies take them here. The last time I went though I asked for my tuna to be medium. Darn they over cooked it but I  told them and they made it right. I would definitely recommend trying. Friendly staff. Maybe I  will try the sushi next time??

First time at Tokyo Grill. The food is good and cheap. We ate the Scallops and hibachi beef. Place is super clean.  I wish they would have different condiments nearby so ww dont have to ask for them. But all in all it was a good visit.
Food is amazing and well priced for very tasty and healthy food options. Don't hesitate to drop in and try it out .

Most suburbanite people I know would rather eat foil than try sushi, but Tokyo Grill has a lot more to offer people.  I thought the value was very good in proportion to the food you receive.

We had all sushi the night we went.. about 8 rolls in total.  I tasted their seaweed soup, I enjoyed it.  All rolls were very tasty and made to order.  Be prepared to wait awhile, as they take time to make and I think only one, maybe two people were making them.  I did not mind the wait at all, just a FYI for you.   My only gripe is a lot of the rolls had the same 'spicy' mayonnaise on them.  The 'spicy' rolls were not very spicy, but maybe you could ask for it more spicy??  Management - do not water down any authenticity of your dishes if you think catering to sensitive tongues is better!!!  Make spicy... SPICY!

The wait staff was very friendly and I can tell they are still getting their feet wet a bit, which is not a problem at all.  

I really hope this restaurant does well in Roselle.  There are not a lot of sushi restaurants in the area and being off of Lake St. is a big plus.  It is very easy to access and leave.  The light they are off of is never busy.  I hope the population supports them here.

Best egg rolls I've ever had. Sushi was pretty good for the price. Would def eat it again. The hibachi chicken was all white meat and the fried rice was less fried but still pretty good. The carrots were sweet and tasty, and soft. Really good. Also, there's mr pib in the soft drink machine. But again.... Such good egg rolls. I literally just stopped by through the drive thru to get 3 orders of them to snack on. GET THE EGG ROLLS. 

I'll also mention my suggestion for management. Leave the little plates, napkins, and chopsticks / utensils on each table. I had to get up and get all these things. Other than these little tweaks that are to be expected from a new restaurant, I highly enjoyed my meal. I'll be coming back

Tried dinner here for the first time tonight. I did carry out for my fiance and I. We both tried the Hibachi chicken and steak. It was really good! The dinners come with rice and sweet carrots. I highly recommend this place to anyone!

I stopped by this restaurant again a week or so ago. This time thru the drive thr, as I was hungry and in a hurry and not looking for a dine in experience.  I ordered the Teriyaki Chicken kids meal and was pleasantly surprised.  The portion was an adult portion with a kids menu price! Not to mention it was delicious! I will be back :)

The food tastes great, made fresh to order, and a great value for the money!

Oh... and there's a drive thru too!

Let me start by saying this: I really wanted to like this place.

I've been here twice now; once carry-out, and once through the drive-thru. It's close to my house, and I love the idea of being able to grab a quick Japanese bite on the way home when I'm exhausted and don't feel like cooking. 

But it's left me underwhelmed both times. For one, it's about as authentic as Benihana (which is to say, not very). For two, holy salt lick, Batman! 

No TL;DR-ness tonight, I'm afraid. I'll simply unpack these two experiences with some star points:

Plus column: 

* The people working here are nice, if a little frazzled. 
* Proteins were prepared well, both times. First time there, I had teriyaki chicken and my SO had hibachi steak (without the sauce, since he's gluten intolerant and their glaze uses soy sauce). I also had an eel roll. Second time there, I had salmon. All those proteins were good.

Minus column:

* The fried rice that comes with every entree is pretty meh unless you dump the "shrimp sauce" that also comes with every entree over it. It's not good-quality rice, and the seasoning is meh. 
* The "sweet carrots" that come with every entree are simultaneously cooked to death and WAY too sweet. Just tossed those both times I ordered here, and I hate wasting food. Still, I couldn't bring myself to eat them because the threat of cavities from all that sugar wouldn't have been worth it.
* The sauce on the teriyaki chicken I had the first time was apparently very liquid, and didn't stick to the chicken at all. I know this because the chicken was flavorful and well-seasoned, but the rice (which was under it, and which sopped up all the sauce as it dripped off the chicken) was basically an inedible salt lick. Since my SO had the hibachi steak with no sauce, I was able to taste his rice and determine that it was probably my sauce that made my rice inedible. His rice was just bland, but with the aforementioned addition of the shrimp sauce, was made merely OK.

*****************************************

If you have two sides that come with ALL your entrees, they should really be good, wouldn't you think? Since the people working here seem really nice, and also like this might be their first time running a restaurant, I wanted to give them another chance. Everyone can have an off day. That's why I waited until I'd been here twice to write this review. I want to give people the benefit of the doubt because I've worked in this industry for awhile, and I know that ups and downs happen. 

But it's just not good. It's inexpensive, definitely, but since I often cook at home, and don't depend on take-out for the majority of my foods, I'll probably spend a couple more bucks and go elsewhere when I'm in the mood.

There's much better legit (and even better Americanized) Japanese food to be had out there. Sorry, guys.

Love this place. You can't go wrong with the soba noodles or the steak. The sushi is amazing especially the deep fried. You can get eel or spicy sauce added with no extra charge. Also the substitutions are endless. They work with you and the service is great. Definitely will be back, and I live all the way in west Chicago. About a 20 min drive but worth it. They also have a drive thru

I love these guys. They know how to do sushi.  Great prices for signature rolls.  And service is amazing!  Friendly and knowledgeable.  They remember you and care that u enjoy.  Great place!  Stands up to the best places in Chicago!
Good food, great price, friendly staff, clean facility. Very happy with my experience so far.  Hope they survive, not many cars in lot.

This restaurant just opened and I can't say I'm disappointed.  I have been here about three times so far and each time was great.  The prices are okay but the portions need to be a little bigger.  But don't let that deter you.  The food is very tasty and the staff is nice.  I recommend you give them a try if you are in the mood for something different. There is a drive thru and the wait time is not to bad.
Odd because it is in the old BK building but food was good, service was great and prices were very reasonable.  Will return for sure.

They're opened not long ago so I decided to try them out last week, I loved the food so much that I went back 2 more times with different friends this week.my friends love the food too.
The soba noodles is the bomb,i cant have enough of it,we shared the sushi plate and it was very delicious also.i love the sweet carrots, it's the best carrots I've ever had and I normally don't like carrots at all.
The staff was very nice and friendly, the place was pretty clean.
Will be returning and recommend this place to more friends.
Nice spot.  Fast, friendly service.  Pleasant atmosphere.  Tasty food.  Sushi was fresh and delicious. I would definietely go back to this place.

Great food and great service!! The manager - Luis - was very friendly and accommodating. Food came out quickly and the order was correct (and we had quite a few unique requests!). The egg rolls are fantastic! Spring roll wrapping which is my personal favorite. Teriyaki chicken was great. The portions are very big too! We will definitely be coming back :)
Not good. Pretty much any place is better. Bad rice, bad fish... Looks like an old pizza joint.

The food was okay, the service atrocious. One person's dish was completely forgotten despite asking about it multiple times, apps served after the food. No apologies or attempts to take the food off the bill for the person who got her food when everybody else was finishing.
Really good food. Worth the money for what you get. Cooked in front of you too. It's in the best location to, easy to get back on to lake st. Friendly service.

Here is a funny place that I had my Chinese dishes. I ordered Beef Wraps for appetizer. It is my first time try this one, so good with the seafood sauce. It looks like sandwiches but tastes fantastic. Then I have a tomato beef brisket soup,  chongqing spicy chicken , fish filet with chili pepper and Thai basil fried rice with shrimp. Those are really good Chinese dishes that I had in Hoffman Estate. The waitress told us that they have new chef from China who can make good Szechwan Food. My mom was much happier that night because she found a place where she can have real Chinese food. Thanks I Chef. We have to come back next time soon.

October 16 update: You can turn in your Groupons if you have one, they stopped offering them and have given several answers when asked if they still take the ones you purchased before. Groupon WILL refund them, credit to your cc not just groupon bucks. We took the deal. Hope they get better soon. Good luck.
_____________

I'm surprised the trend reviews don't reflect the drop in service and traffic we have recently experienced, and it had been falling off before. The trend charts show a stalling 3 but of course it's 3 1/2 stars for some reason. Falling 3 at best.

We've been here many times and find lunch below average so we only do dinners off the Chinese menu. If you come here at 8pm (open till 9) the place is completely empty on a weeknight. Somehow we managed to also get the worst service we've ever had. The server kept trying to rush our order so she could go eat her meal with the staff and stare at videos largely ignoring us.

So we started out with a pot of lukewarm tea, and when we later asked if they had any hot tea she essentially said she would have to make some. I'm not going to beg, I'm just not coming back, and I guarantee that she could care less and probably wasn't surprised at a less than stellar tip. I can't justify rewarding or encouraging that terrible service.

Song Fish Soup appetizer always good, this time we got it with about a bonus 1.5 x 1.5  inch clump of undissolved rice starch. Still tasty. Stir fried green beans good and the spicy cumin lamb not spicy at all, chilis not blackened or even toasted looked like, pretty sure they just threw them in at the end but at least it wasn't over salted. I got some chili oil and boosted it.
I shouldn't have to.

I'll be amazed if this place is open in 6 months. Beware. 
And if all that wasn't bad enough they've dropped their very reasonable wine and beer service.
This was where I would send people instead of the very below average non alcohol Jaded Thai another ugly strip corner over.
Can't recommend it anymore. 
The chinese dinner menu IS good if you want to be ignored in an empty restaurant, and rice starch clumps aren't going to kill you. Kind of play doh in a sinking chinese restaurant on the far NW edge of a shrinking Schaumburg. And Chili Oil cures a lot if not over salted, but screw that, YOU can do better.
We're not coming back. Yu's in Schaumburg does a better cumin lamb now.
We will miss the SongFishSoup, but easy enuf to find in the city. 
We've met the owners kids and like them, too bad. RIP

I went to iChef, because iHungry. And I wanted Chinese food, and had this place bookmarked on my iPhone yelp app, for Iforever. OK, enough of that eh?

So this place is located in a strip mall, near the center corner. The waitress gave us two menus. The "normal" menu with your Americanized dishes, and another menu, that literally has the title "Authentic Chinese" food menu.

I went with my white-boy side, and ordered the Mongolian chicken, light sauce, and it was pretty good. It came on them fancy deep-fried Singapore noodles. I remember when my Dad had his Chinese restaurant, I would love watching him make those noodles. Anyways, chicken was delicious, I'd estimate about 6-oz worth of protein on that plate. Note, unlike Mongolian chicken/beef that I've had in the past, this dish was not overly consumed with green onions, but there were plenty of white onions on it. Very tasty for me.

Service and staff were OK. I'll need to come back here to try out there Authentic Chinese food menu
New owners. The lo mein noodles are linguini. Not as flavorful. The fried rice also lacks flavor. The orange chicken was good though.

Good Chinese food has been hard to come by in the northern suburbs and this place renewed my faith that it still exists. Came here for a very early dinner which allowed us to be the only ones in the restaurant. The food came out quickly. We had ordered the gai lon in garlic sauce, which is one of my favorite dishes. It was perfectly cooked and prepared. My wife ordered the honey walnut chicken. Not a huge sweets person but it was fantastic. It was fried to perfection and the flavor was perfectly balanced. Fried rice had a variety of ingredients. So happy we stopped here before coming back home.

I am torn between a 3.5 and 4. But would I come back? 
Ordered the beef chow fun, it was pretty good, nice flavors on the rice noodle and the beef was succulent and tender enough. A bit greasy though but so are most beef chow funs at other places.
The other party in my group ordered walnut shrimp. The shrimp were big, but the coating on the walnut shrimp was kind of a turn off for me. Looked like a thick layer of glue. It also came with white rice, and a good amount of it too. The honey walnut shrimp came with steamed broccoli. Presentation was good. 

I would come back to see what their dim sum menu has to offer. Service was not bad but the interior of the restaurant was super cold. Please turn on some heat, this is Chicago! Pretty clean and spacious, however when we were there during late lunch on a Saturday, it was just us and another table.

Although the name looks like something Apple rolled out just in time for the holiday season, iChef is pretty awesome.

Previously, we grabbed a groupon to give it a try and went early in the evening to beat the rush....which we definitely did. It was fairly empty. 
They're slightly tucked away, but I learned that they do a lot of carry out (no delivery) and they get busier later in the evenings. Fair enough.

What initially caught our eye was the fact they have two menus: American-Chinese/Asian food & Chinese-Chinese food (the authentic stuff). 
It seems like a great idea for those craving more traditional Chinese dishes versus what we 'gringos' typically go for. 

We opted to get several dishes to share and wash it down with cocktails and beer. (Note: If there was ever a sentence to sum  up what I'd like to do at every restaurant ever for life, that would be it.)

During our second experience, we did carry out, and had an equally pleasant experience with everything we ate.
The beef was once again tender; the fried rice was spot on; the egg rolls were egg-y and rolled.

This is currently our go-to Chinese/Asian restaurant in the area. 
I do wish they had delivery but it's really not a deal breaker in my book. There are closer restaurants to us in the area who do offer delivery, but so far, none have matched the quality of iChef.

As Yelp would say, Yay I'm a fan.
The General Tso's was kind of hard and the Mongolian Beef tasted odd.  Tolerable overall but wouldn't go here again by choice.
Absolutely terrible food and staff.. My food was terrible and when I said something I was told "ur opinion doesn't matter bc ur just complaining". Who says that to a customer?! I will never go back

Never going back. Walked in and an empty dining room at 7:00 on a Friday evening should have been my first clue! The waitress was obnoxious; kept asking us to order our entrees even before our drinks came! Food was average. Next time I'll forgo my Chinese craving until Heng Wing is back from vacation.

Went last night for the first time. Might be the last time.  Service was good, and the food was plentiful.  However, I ordered General Tso's Chicken.  It was dry, and the oil used to fry the chicken was old, as it left an aftertaste.  While there was enough sauce, it was sweet, and definitely not spicy.  I did not finish it, and was happy to see the server asked why.  My dining partner had the iChef Lo Mein.  It was a tad oily (as are many), and while the shrimp and beef were good, the chicken was dry and had an odd taste.  

FYI, they do not accept credit cards for less than $10 (Used groupon, so was under $10)

Who knew a Chinese restaurant serving authentic Shanghai/Hangzhou-style food can be found tucked away in a cornfield-facing strip mall? 

IChef fits the clich-ish profile of authentic Chinese restaurants in the states: most patrons are expats, two menu system, efficient service, etc. 

The weekend brunch menu offers some quintessential Shanghai-style dim sum items such as pan-fried buns, fried dough sticks, sweet rice ball soup, which I have yet to try. The fish congee was average to me. 

Tofu salad made with smoked tofu -- very refreshing and tasty. It should convert most non-believers of tofu. 

Braised duck with tofu skin: tofu skin is one of my favorite ingredients in Chinese food for its show stealing ability. If you are leery about the texture of tofu, give tofu skin a try: in my experience, it tends to be the most fought-over part of any dish it's in and always disappear before everything else on the plate. The duck pieces in this dish could be cut bigger, and not so bony though.

Song's Fish Soup: I only know it's a classic Hangzhou dish but never had it before, so I can't attest to its authenticity. It contains lots of fish bits, clean tasting with a little vinegar flavor. Overall it was just ok to me--perhaps it's the kind of fish used? I might order it again, but not in a hurry.

When I have a hankering for authentic Chinese food and don't feel like driving all the way to Chinatown, IChef is the place to go.

Great food at a reasonable price.  If you're looking for real authentic Chinese food, be adventurous and ask for the traditional Chinese menu.  

We only have one suggestion for the chef/owner.  Easy on the black pepper for the hot and sour soup.  Second time we've tried it.  Can't enjoy it if all you can taste is black pepper.

Really good food, but a LOT OF IT!  Best crab Rangoon we have had in years.  Excellent pot stickers.
Had the beef Lo mein and it was fantastic.
Bathrooms were clean, staff was very nice. Michelle was a great waitress.  Next time I want to try the soup.

This my first time in this restaurant and I was surprised to find a good quality and delicious Chinese restaurant.
Our appetizer was wonton with red oil. It was spicy and tasty. 
We ordered Mongolian beef ( meat was tender and great flavor. It has a  touch of sweetness), King Mushroom with egg tofu. The way that the tofu was fried was great. 
The service was great!
I will definitely come back.

I thought the reviews would mean that the food was good...Worst food ever.  Had the  "sesame chicken"  and it was like jerky, inside a batter that was chewy, and dipped in a chunky sauce that looked stringy and old, like it was scrapped out of the bowl and heated up.  My wife tried it too and said it was terrible. 

 I quit eating and set the plate aside but the smell was making me nauseous, and I was already sick to my stomach from the little bit I ate.  I had to throw the whole order away, so my advice is, if you want value for your money,  do not go here.
You've been warned...it seems like it's the luck of the draw with this place.  I will NEVER BE BACK!  Now excuse me while I go throw up (literally)

Foods are so good .
I loved the services.
People are so kind.
This is the best Chinese restaurant .
I love all the foods in this restaurant.
When I First went to this restaurant I Fall in love.
I like shanghai crispy fish its the best food.

Mostly enjoy the authentic chinese dishes over the american.  They are more flavorful.  Shrimp with lobster sause and chow fun are always good. The American chinese dishes are decent but sometimes bland.
Second time ordering carry out,   Egg rolls were good.  The General Toa's chicken was dried out no sauce nor was it spicy.  Chef fried rice was dried out as well.

A solid and authentic Chinese restaurant in the suburb. I will give 3 and half star if I could, which means I rate it a cut above other Chinese restaurants in the suburb. 

This is a hidden gem in the suburb if you are looking for authentic Southern area Chinese food. They have dishes that is hard to find in other suburb Chinese restaurants.

Will recommend for a visit.

Hard to find location in the corner of a strip mall. Hot & Sour soup was very starchy with a overpowering dash of sesame oil.  Tofu bits looked very tired which means that this soup was from last night. 

The Yu Shan Pork was laced with red and green peppers. The sauce was too sweet with hoisin sauce.....secret sauce for non-Asian customers. I could not find any water chestnuts. Was not authentic, but Panda Express quality. 

Shanghai Fish was 2 long boneless fish strips that was battered and deep fried. The fish quality was very good. The fish was smothered with a dark sauce with peas and carrots. The sauce had a hint of chinkiang vinegar but not sour enough and should be red in color just like the picture in the menu. Again not authentic. 

Rice was a cheaper short grain broken rice. 

Pot of tea had no leaves.

IChef has been around for a while now, but for some reason we'd never tried it. We ordered take-out and it was really fantastic.

Their menu has some pretty diverse items for the suburbs. They don't simply have the typical Lo Mein, Chow Mein, Mu Shu, Sweet and Sour and General Tso's. There are two menus - one the more traditional Americanized Chinese fare, and another with more traditional Chinese.

While there were a few items on the traditional menu that looked interesting, we tried something I've never had before called Yu Shang Pork - spicy with julienne vegetables. It looked a little like Mu Shu Pork, but tasted very different. It was really good. We also ordered Szechwan Beef and had an order of dumplings.

Before I finished ordering, I asked the person on the phone if they had any specials or coupons and was told for this sized order I could get either egg drop or hot and sour soup for free. I chose the hot and sour.

The soup was not as good as the rest of the meal - it could have been spicier. But overall I was very happy with the freshness and quality of the meal. We will be going back.

We often use this restaurant .
We like garlic shrimp over noodle,I chef special fried rice,Beef with broccoli .

Great food, and average food. Good, not great service, but only one waitress working dining room.

I ordered from the traditional Chinese  menu, and was not disappointed.  The beef tripe was tender, spicy & delicious.  The pork belly in tofu skin was braised, flavorful, but could have done without so much  gravy. My wife ordered vegetable  rolls & Mongolian chicken from the "American " menu. The rolls were good, but unremarkable.  The chicken was not bad, but not particularly  flavorful, either. Sophie was friendly, knowledgeable,  made sure we knew what we were ordering, and that it came out right.

A pleasant  experience,  we'll  be back.

This place is tucked away in a small suburban shopping center, but definitely was above my expectations. It's not the best Chinese food I've ever had (Beijing or the Bay Area) but it's DEFINITELY above average and worth a try if you are in the burbs.

I ordered the pork congee for lunch and it was fantastic. I had my hesitations that they wouldn't be using the right rice or have the right broth to make it, but it definitely turned out well. It was super tasty with just a twinge of ginger and green onion in it.

We also had some soy bean milk (sweetened) which I haven't had since I was in Taiwan. This stuff was great! I mean, it doesn't compare to the stuff in Taiwan but it's rare that I find stuff like this.

We also had the hao gao (shrimp dumpling) dim sum which is hard to find in the suburbs. They were rather small but tasted just fine.

Another dish we had was the Shanghai style noodles that are a flat long noodle that is curried with some beef and vegetables in there. This is AMAZING. They cook everything with vegetable oil which is fantastic, and the green onions are fried just long enough so that they are crunchy. The carrots and bean sprouts are the same and make a great compliment to the beef.

The last dish we had was the black garlic beef, which I felt didn't complement the other dishes well. This was the one reason I didn't give it 5 stars. It came out super buttery (too buttery for my taste buds), but the beef was definitely super tender. I didn't think they would use this much butter in Chinese style cooking, but I guess that's what they did.

There are a lot of Chinese people that visit this place and they service is pretty good. I would definitely come here again though it is a little bit pricey.

I've ordered from here a number of times and ordered in tonight to avoid the Snowmageddon or Snowpocalypse...whatever you want to call this crazy weather we have! She told me delivery would take an hour and was very apologetic over the phone but that just seems like a normal wait to me, no issues there.

Tonight I wanted to try some different offerings so I went with sweet & sour chicken, sesame chicken & honey chicken. The honey chicken wasn't on the menu so I just asked about it and she said yes, it can be done. Score! I have a minor obsession with honey chicken and I use that and sweet & sour chicken as my gauge to see how good a place is. The honey chicken was AMAZING! I will be ordering that everytime I order now. Everything I tasted was quite good!

The owners are so friendly and nice there! I'm still a big fan and it's my go to chinese food place.

Went there a couple more times and I'm just as impressed as the first time. 

One good thing about this restaurant is how it offers simple healthier authentic Chinese food in addition to the common staples. For example, fish or beef congee is very difficult to find in the suburbs (I think Hong Kong Cafe is the only other place in the area that makes this item). Hong Sue beef noodle soup and pork noodle soup with preserved vegetables are other dishes people usually go to Chinatown for (Yu's Mandarin and Chef Ping offer more Northern style noodles).  The stews and authentic soups (not always on the menu) are great to eat during the winter.

There is also an authentic weekend brunch menu with delicious Shanghai favorites (all in Chinese unfortunately). Hopefully they will have a translated version soon so the English speaking clients will be able to enjoy these wonderful dishes as well.

Great place if you live around Palatine, Schaumburg, Arlington Heights, Buffalo Grove, Barrington, or Hoffman Estates, not too far away from Harper College or Northern Illinois University - Hoffman.

Dropped by here with my girl to get some authentic Chinese food.  The interior looked nicer than we expected and we were eager to try some of their food.  We were sat in a booth, which was very comfy and cozy.  We ordered a couple of Tsingtao beers and looked through the menu.  The menu is divided into two parts: american chinese and authentic traditional chinese.  We looked through the authentic chinese section and chose the honey walnut shrimp, double cooked pork, and the king mushroom and egg tofu dish.  
The honey walnut shrimp was extremely delicious.  The sauce was on point and there was enough shrimp to justify the price.  The double cooked pork was a bit weird.  I didn't know what to really expect, but I was at least hoping for a good spicy dish(as indicated by the chili pepper graphic next to the dish in the menu).  The dish consisted of strips of thinly sliced pork belly stir fried with bell peppers, scallions, and onions in an extremely mild chili oil sauce.  I really think the dish would have been much better with the addition of actual chili peppers, whether fresh or dry.  The chili oil just didn't do it for me.  The king mushroom and egg tofu dish was made with a tasty sauce, but the whole dish seemed like it was lacking something.  It was just sliced king mushrooms, extra soft tofu battered with egg, and some scallions.  Maybe the addition of some vegetables or something might have been good.  
Well, that's how I felt about the food.  I didn't really feel that the authentic chinese dishes were actually authentic, but maybe a little less americanized than stuff like chop suey and general tso's chicken...?  The service was good, the ambiance was better than expected, and the food was mediocre.  I don't think I'll be returning unless I was in the area and hungry.

Well first off I want to say there home made sauce is amazing wish they gave us more than two since we ordered a large chicken fried rice, lg chicken lo mein and sesame chicken. The food was good just a little dry. All and all not bad!!!

I loved the fake meat vegetarian dishes I had in China, so it was very exciting to find a restaurant here in Chicagoland offering such dishes. Unfortunately there were some issues with the service. Our waitress seemed very new to the job. I ordered an Orange "Beef" but got an Orange "Chicken" instead. Thankfully the chicken was fairly good so I didn't ask for a replacement. The orange sauce was great. Our scallion pancakes needed more scallions, salt, and pan-frying. The house special Mai Tai tasted like Hawaiian Punch. 

Hopefully the service is better next time, as I'd really like to try the faux beef.
Very good authentic Chinese food in the suburb
Great food, nice atmosphere.  Portions could be bigger.  Love the Mongolian beef. Prices are in line with other dine in Chinese places in the area.  Nice hidden gem

Visited this local restaurant as had a groupon. Its at the corner of the strip mall and barely noticable from road. We tried the american version of the chinese food. Food was average ....Quantity was quite good.. Nothing striking about the food.. The taste was quite similar to lot other chinese  carry out places. Would visit this place again with a groupon .. 
Tip. For  apetizers donot go for chicken on stick ..Its not worth it ..

The "i" stands for iron! :( I found a string of metal-like tinsel, about 2 inches long, in my cashew shrimp. So disappointing. 

When iChef opened a few years ago, taking over Lily Garden's spot, they served semi-decent Chinese American food. Prices were a bit high, but that seems to be the norm nowadays for Chinese. Haven't eaten there recently, so we decided to order take out on Saturday at 5pm - not only did the hot and sour soup taste like "end of the day" soup from the bottom of the pot, but the large Mongolian beef was mainly crispy noodles, and I had around 5 whole shrimp in my small cashew shrimp. The egg rolls tasted undercooked too. Everything was just so... bland. 

I found the tinsel the next day when I reheated the shrimp. It didn't arc or spark in the microwave, but it was clearly not edible. The woman who rung me out told me the menu was new, but I'm guessing tinsel wasn't supposed to be part of the revamp. Boo.

Just noticed Barb Z's review - we are not the same person, but obviously feel the same about the current menu.

Your most authentic Chinese restaurant in the area.  Don't fall for anything else - this place has awesome Dim Sum and flavors which will have you coming back for more.  You can tell from the spice and flavor, the flavors are from well seasoned Woks and high temperature fire.  It's a place you won't want to over look!

Good casual food.  Tried it with a group of eight and they got the food out quickly. Very fresh and well cooked (no over cooked shrimp ... Very important). Recommend trying it for a casual night if Chinese

Nice service, terrible food...

This was my first time to IChef....... We had blizzard so I wonder if it was because the chef couldn't make it to work today and the food was prepared by someone else.....

I was thrilled to find a Chinese restaurant that served a variety of traditional dishes besides the more well known items so I had to check it out.

We arrived early in the evening on a weeknight and found only 3 other tables occupied. A member of the wait staff promptly seated us and gave us a specials menu as well as the regular dinner menu. We didn't even bother really looking at the regular menu as we had our hearts set on something different. Dong Po Braised Pork and Hot Wok Chicken is what we ordered and was told the pork would take just a little bit longer than other dishes which was fine.  

The chicken was nice and spicy and came out in a ceramic bowl still sizzling. I really enjoyed the presentation and concept but unfortunately I found the sauce to be overpoweringly salty which forced us to eat large amounts of rice in accompaniment. Another issue was that the chef cuts a whole chicken up in to bite size pieces without taking any of the bones out. I was told that most traditional dishes are made with bone in which I can understand except there were tiny little pieces of bone EVERYWHERE and it was really difficult to eat. I was glad nobody was watching us eat because we were constantly spitting out bits of bone with every bite. When I spoke to the waitress about this at the end of our meal she said it might be possible to request the dish sans bones which is exactly how I'll order it next time... also without any salt.

The braised pork was ultra rich and a perfect match with the little steamed buns that come with it. The actual amount of meat may seem small but the rich nature of the dish paired with the buns is enough to satiate any appetite and we had trouble finishing the entire dish. It was a very unique and tasty change from the shrimp fried rice/battered meats with different sauces that we've grown so pathetically accustomed to.

I want to give this place 4 stars but I'm going to have to go back again and try a few more dishes before I can honestly raise the rating. I had nobody to coach me through this experience so I'll have to stumble my way around until I really discover my true opinion about iChef.

Best Chinese food I have ever had in the suburbs!  They serve both American Chinese **and** traditional Chinese.  I came for lunch on a weekday when no one was there.  Although the server did not seem to know the menu and was not the friendliest, I was willing to overlook it because there aren't many Chinese restaurants in the suburbs trying to do something different.  

I am so glad I did.  I ordered the Singapore noodles.  They are thin rice noodles mixed with vegetables, shrimp and pork.  It was cooked to perfection, the bean sprouts must have been picked the same day - super fresh.  The noodles were lightly flavored with curry rather than drowning in gravy.  I added some chili peppers because I like my food spicy, but anyone else would love it as is.  

The server told me ingredients are brought fresh from Chinatown each day, including some live seafood items.  I think the Chef must be brought in from Chinatown, too, because I just don't find this type of **real** Chinese food in the suburbs.

Bottom line, don't let a bad experience with the wait staff deter you from experiencing the wonderful food here.  Maybe there are better authentic Chinese restaurants in the Chicago area, Chinatown included, but I don't think you'll find one within 15 miles of this place.  Come and enjoy!

It's a decent cheap lunch place. It used to have a buffet which made coming here really worth it but there's not a high volume of customers so they were likely losing a lot of food because of it and was not an option last time I went.

Very good food! Never found a more tasty place in the suburbs. I highly suggest their kung pao beef if you like spicy and their beef skewers- AMAZING. They were tender just enough and had delicious flavor. The staff was SO sweet. I'm definitely going back there again, possibly next week!!!

This is another 3.5.  

IChef replaced the Canto gem, Lily Garden.  The sign is bright and the English name is nonsensical.  The Chinese name "chuan zhe hui" means a fusion cuisine between Sichuan and Zhejiang - two of the eight main regional cuisines in Chinese cooking.  

The menu was divided into two halves -  first half with items written in English only (your standard American Chinese food such as egg foo yang and crab rangoon), and second half with items that have Chinese translation (these are traditional Chinese dishes).  Since it was a family dinner, we ordered from the second half exclusively.  

Dongpo braised pork was pretty spot on - tender pork belly with a nice sweet and savory sauce.  If they skim the sauce, it would have been a great dish.  Water-boiled fish, which might sound super bland and boring to people unfamiliar with Sichuan food; but it's actually a spicy pot of soup with tender fish and napa cabbage.  It's a classic Sichuan dish, and IChef's version was pretty good, with a nice kick, but didn't have enough Sichuan pepper.  Satay beef with noodle casserole was flavorful - the Satay was actually Taiwanese-style, which was a nice nostalgic moment for me.  But the beef was old-school Canto-style, which means it was tender to the point of mushy, likely the result of marination in soda-water.  Pine cone fish came highly recommended by the waitress as their signature (which was weird considering it's a Shangdong-style dish, very different from the alleged specialty of this restaurant).  The flavor and the execution were good, but I couldn't help but compare it to the original version - they used fillet, not whole fish; and they used flounder, which didn't really taste like yellow croaker.  

Decor was rather nondescript, but pleasant enough.  The gender on the bathroom doors was indicated by  either Ken or Barbie - creative but creepy (check out my pic).  Service was amateurish.  The waitstaff was friendly but obviously not well-trained.  Many rookie mistakes throughout.  For example, the four of us ordered four dishes, thinking it was more than enough, but the waitress (who I believe is also the owner) asked if that was all, to which I said yes.  Then she said "are you sure you don't want another vegetarian dish?  You didn't order any vegetables."  Um, give unsolicited advice much?  I will eat my broccoli at home, thank you very much.  

In Chinatown, this restaurant will probably not survive.  But in the suburbs, this place is decent enough, with some authentic dishes hard to find outside of Chinatown.  I will probably go back if I'm too lazy to go to the city or Naperville.

Ok, so walking in to iChef was a little sketchy and there were only about 4 people dining in on a Thursday night. Small, maybe about 10 tables. I think it's more of a take out joint. But due to my groupon it was dine in only. Our server was good and the food came out quick. They also had some TVs with the game on!

Crab Rangoon: Very yummy and fresh tasting.
Egg Rolls: Also fresh but to much cabbage for my liking, I like a little more meat.
Sesame Chicken: My first time having it and won't be the last! My new fav! Very good, meaty and fresh!
Mongolian Beef: Was okay... Tasted a little to sweet for my liking.
Combo Fried Rice: Decent, not a lot of meat. 

Everything was fresh, yummy and hot! I would definitely come back here again but probably do take out.
Food is delicious but quite pricey for exotic meals. Overall it's pretty good.

I just went here last night, they sent a flyer of the menu and I decided to check it out...
Service was not so great, our food took forever to take our order and it took forever for our food to come out, and  our meals did not come out together either, we asked for the dishes spicy, which mine was, my husbands was not at all, he got the sizzling seafood, nothing was sizzling, imitation crab meat-which they did not mention on the description of the menu item, they do mention that on the crab rangoon though...
My dish was pretty tasty, I would order that, the vege pan fried noodles...extra spicy-I asked for that
The server did they they need more people to work there and gave us some watermelon...
I think I am going to stick to Hunan Bejing instead, the service is way better and the food is pretty good too!
The best Chinese restaurant I have ever been to!!!  The authentic Chinese Spicy Chicken is amazing.  Make sure to order off of the Traditional Chinese menu, so good!

Love this restaurant! Best Chinese food I have had in a long time. They have the American Chinese menu which is normal, but what got me was the authentic Chinese food closer to the back of the menu. I tried food from that section and couldn't have been more pleased. I personally love their hot and sour soup. Vegetarian friendly!

I am going to up my review to say that this is perhaps the finest authentic Chinese restaurant in the area and it is because the chef's skill is extraordinary. Delicate touch, as is typical of Shanghai style cooking, but a bit heavy with the minced garlic. Nevertheless, extraordinary cooking. We had lunch here recently and although service was a bit slow, the food was excellent.  Hoffman Estates, you do not know what you have here.

I really, really wanted to like this place..

We went there for lunch today and were the only 2 people in the restaurant. First off it smelled like Raid..ok we should have probably left then but because of the overall good ratings and Yelp decal on the window decided to give it a try.

Started out with egg rolls and order of pot stickers. Egg rolls tasted commercial and pot stickers had a flavorable filling but way to doughy.

Hubby ordered shrimp in garlic sauce and I ordered pan fried noodles with shrimp.

Our server brought out the dishes and realized that the chef made a mistake and brought out a different shrimp dish then what he ordered so his went back to the kitchen. Ok pan fried noodles should be pan fried. I saw a little browning on a bit of the noodles but the rest looked like they were boiled and heaped on the plate. The real turn off was the sauce. It was your typical white sauce that you would get at your takee out place for chicken chop suey. For color they threw on a few pea pods and then topped it off with the shrimp. I have had wonderful pan fried noodles at other places and believe me this was not the way to serve it.

Hubbys shrimp in garlic sauce is now served and as server is walking away I ask should his not come with rice? Oops she forgot rice:) Neither of us cared for the sauce on his dish. We both ended up doctoring up both of our dishes with the sauce they served with the pot stickers and the sweet sour sauce served with the egg rolls. 

We will never go back..

I live off Barrington and Palatine Roads.  Delivery came fast and food was hot and good!

Mongolian Beef was excellent - but I asked for no crispy noodles on the bottom and it came with the noodles.

General Tso' Chix was more sweet than spicy.  The combo fried rice was excellent with big pieces of shrimp!

I am allergic to seafood and nuts and they happily made a concession for my coupon by offering me a small hot and sour soup.  I would definitely order carry out again.  Ask for extra soy sauce and chopsticks!

I bought a Groupon for this restaurant since I love Chinese food and it was close to home. I was a bit dismayed to read some of the negative reviews here before going there. However, I have to say I was pleasantly surprised!! The food is great, the service wonderful and the bar selection excellent!
Great food, great service...highly recommend if in the area and looking for Chinese food.

This restaurant is local and they deliver, so I have used them about 5 times, always hoping that the food would improve. It is horrible. I tried again tonight. Ordered the Appetizer for two and had flavorless beef on a stick, junky frozen style reheated egg roll, flavorless pot sticker and nasty tempura shrimp. I took one bite from each and threw the rest away, wasting $10. I also threw away their horrible Singapore Noodles. I choked on the curry powdery dry noodles and the mushy shrimp fried rice. Will NEVER give them another chance. Next time that I am hungry and don't want to cook, rather than order from here I will eat toast and tea. This place has about the worst Chinese food I have ever eaten. Can't imagine they will stay in business much longer.

One rude incident deleted all the good experiences we had in this restaurant.

We HAD consistent good food & service in this restaurant.  They cook special meals for us & we just pay whatever they charge us.  We averagely spend $100 per visit for 2 adults & $400 or more with guests.  We HAD good service from the owners & our kids were treated very well prior to the disappointing experience we recently had.

Our recent visit made us speechless with the rudeness we experienced.  It was incomprehensible how somebody (moreso, a business owner) can do such thing...Last week, the owner recommended steamed oysters for our dinner. However, after it was served, the waiter came back with a small plate TAKING 2 oysters FROM OUR PLATE because apparently, they were supposed to serve only 6 oysters per order & they gave us 8! 

My husband told the owner the oysters were good & it'd be great to have more of it (he has this gift of saying things tactfully.) The owner said the extra 2 oysters were his & it was erroneously placed on our serving plate!  Such a disgusting response to hear! They could have charged us extra & we would have paid instead of taking the food from our table.  IT WAS SO IMPOLITE & VERY RUDE.  We HAD good relationship w/ the owners but the experience tells us that they do not give respect to their customers.  WE ARE VERY DISAPPOINTED & OFFENDED.  We are NOT GOING BACK TO THIS RESTAURANT.

Great neighborhood chinese restaurant.  I had the orange chicken and the lo mein noodles.  It was very tasty, fresh and the delivery was quick.  Next time I will try a beef dish.    I will order from them again.
dont let the name fool u.  one of the best chinese restaurants in the burbs.  Gotta try the salt and pepper shrimp highly recommended although its not on the menu just ask the server.

A little gem tucked away in suburbia. Price is average for a Chinese restaurant around this area but the food is great and there is usually no wait. My friends ordered a fried tofu dish with this sauce and it was superb.

A friend of mine took me there on my business trip to Chicago. As a new Yorker, I am normally spoiled by all the authentic Chinese food that I have had in New York. After our meal, I had to say this is New York standard Chinese food. 

Great service, even better food.  Thumbs up! Ichef, hope one day you would open a location in New York. You already have one regular now.

There eggrolls tasted like fish. The veggie lao mein smelled like a port-o-potty and tasted like there was no sauce/seasoning on it at all. The sweet and sour chicken was the only edible thing and the chicken was crazy over fried. I have had a lot of crappy chinese food but this was definitely one of the worst.

I went for a nice Sunday brunch with my family.  Ever since I saw their Chinese brunch menu and discovered this place serves Shang Hai style food, couldn't hold myself back.  I tried google translator in attempt to translate their chinese menu, but no success.  I just went hoping a server would help us out.  And Voila! They made the weekend brunch menu in English now.  Below is the list of dishes I tried today.  Onion Pancake (scallion), Potstickers, shrimp dumpling, Pan-fried Pork Bun, Shang Hai stir fried rice cake, Shanghai Spring Roll, Beef Congee, Orange Beef and sugar buns.  Orange Beef was very good, congee was wonderful.  Green Onion Pancake was the best I ever had.  Crunch outside, and had lots of layers with no overwhelming green onion.  I love sugar buns. I thought you could only get these from Chinese Buffet, but you could get them at Ichef. 10 for $3.95, sweet deal.  Shrimp dumpling was so yummy.  It's about 1/2 size of usual Ha Gao, so it's cute and easier to eat at 1 bite.  Shang Hai Stir-friend rice cake was yummy, but rice cakes were stuck in big clump and not that easy to separate.  If a few were stuck together, OK, but when 8 or 9 are stuck like that, it's not easy to eat.   Potstickers and other meat filled buns had tasty fillings, but dough was much thicker than my liking.  However, overall, we enjoyed service very much and food.  I live 3 minutes from this place and we definitely will become regulars.  Can't wait to try other Shang Hai style dishes.
Food was pretty terrible. Thought the reviews would lead to good food. But the fried rice was horrible. Rest of it was just eh. I wouldnt order from here again.
This is place very good and it is the real deal.  Eat here if you enjoy real Chinese food

This place is a novelty for me.

It is a like a subway for pizza. I would give it a 5 because I like the concept and also like the quickness of my food.... but like everyone else the crust was bland. I had one their athena pizza which was just okay.

Horrible service!
Bad food!
The worst service/treatment ever for GF allergy. 

They weren't ready when they opened. Pizzas finished 15 minutes apart. Dough wasn't cooked all the way through.

The food was amazing. What I appreciated most was the pricing. It was $7.49 for a pre-designed pizza, create your own pizza, or a salad. 
The choices for toppings was much bigger than I anticipated. The food was ready in minutes. I was almost expecting it to be more like Pizza Hut where you place your order and it takes 15-20 minutes. I had my pizza within 5 minutes.  
I was also impressed with the fact that the person who made my pizza was not the same person who took my money. I dislike it when I order food and see them make my food, take off the gloves, take my money and then put on a new pair of gloves without washing hands to make the next order. This time it was two different people. 
They have the new Coke machines with all the varieties of drinks! So I could get a Coke Zero with lime. 
The artwork and decor was nice. 
The bathroom was clean.

Meh.. this place has nothing on Blaze in the city. My friend asked for half marinara and half BBQ and the guy just mixed the two! We clarified that we wanted half of each and he's like well the sauces would mix anyway. Uhh, ew. Who TF wants bbq marinara? He was nice enough to start over though. 

As for the toppings, they don't have a lot of the gourmet options. No fresh mozzarella, arugula, etc. Pretty basic toppings.

The crust itself was super super thin. The pan one is too thick. They need a better middle ground. They also don't use a wood-fired brick oven like Blaze. Boo. 

We also got the chocolate brownie pecan thing and they refused to warm it up for us because it would "infect" the oven... what? Not only did they give us a stale, dry last slice but refused to help make it better. smh.

Overall, okay place to get quick pizza, but go to Blaze and then you'll know what you're missing.

I was in the area picking up some furniture, It was past my normal dinner time, so I was hungry. I also wanted to avoid getting back on the tollway right away because of the traffic that I saw coming in. So, I did a quick Yelp search and found this place. 

Set up similar to Subway, where you can choose your toppings, there are quite a few to choose from. You can also choose your crust type, sauce, and cheese. The price is set regardless of the pizza you choose, so if you like a variety of toppings like I do, this can save you some cash. However, if you're like to keep it simple with just cheese or one or two toppings, this may be a tad expensive. 

Once your finished directing the making of your pizza, it gets put in the oven. By the time you finish paying, grabbing your drink, and finding a table, the pizza was ready. Needless to say, I was pleasantly surprised on the quality of pizza for such a fast turnaround.

My husband and I had seen this place for a while now and decided today was the day to try it. We were both surprised at how much we enjoyed it! Both our pizzas were delicious and the dessert pizzas we tried were tasty (but normal cookie pizzas). It was so fun to see your pizza cooked in five minutes. I highly recommend this place.

Hubby and I were in the area and we had a taste of pizza and I had a coupon for a free pie from a yelp event. 
The place is in a strip mall. The side entrance was a little weird on the side of the building to go and place your order you have to go through another door.
The set up was the same as the other location we ordered the following.
Five Star
tuscan marinara / cheddar / pork sausage / pepperoni / beef / green olives / red & green peppers / black olives / red onions
CLASSIC PAN
High Five
tuscan marinara / cheddar / pepperoni / italian sausage / bacon / ham / beef
CLASSIC PAN
Chicago Works with sauce cheese Shredded beef and other yummy goodness.
It's a nice chain, a different concept of how you would like your pizza made like "Subway" make it fresh.  
I'll come back again if I'm in the area and want a personal pizza.

When this place carries vegan cheese I will update to give it 5 stars. Tonight my friend and I stopped in and tried the pizza for the first time. The guys behind the counter helping create a pizza were very friendly and offered many suggestions. If they didn't know an answer to a question about an ingredient they were happy to check for the answer and didn't seem put out at all. The cashier said they are supposed to start carrying a vegan cheese option soon! Hope that's true!

**updated review on 4/18/16**

They now carry Daiya vegan cheese shreds!
I'm very glad the company decided to offer a vegan cheese option. Stopped in today and had a "create my own" pizza which was delicious! My favorite toppings included the kalamata olives, basil, and cilantro. My only suggestion is that the vegan cheese be kept with the veggie toppings instead of next to the dairy cheeses because it would be very easy for some dairy cheese to fall into the vegan cheese in a cross contamination situation. 
Also, a tip for vegans make sure you ask for a clean cutting board and clean pizza cutter!

Since going gluten free a few years ago, it is REALLY difficult to find a good pizza.  In walks Pie Five....YAY!  The gluten free crust is slightly crunchy and chewy...

The cost is pretty good.  A pizza is $6.99...add $2 for gluten free.  For $10 total ($12 GF) you can get pizza, dessert, and drink.  For $11 total ($13 GF) you can get pizza, salad, and drink.

They have a rewards program.  Sign up for the Circle of Crust.  You get half off on your half birthday.  You also accrue points for a free pizza.

The line gets rather long during lunch time.  Plan for extra time!

If you do gluten free...do not get the alfredo sauce....do not get the alfredo sauce.  I did that on my first visit.  Big mistake!  I wish someone working there would have alerted me.  Oh well, live and learn.
The pizza was reasonable but a lot of the employees lacked motivation.

Stopped in for a quick lunch with my husband while visiting the area.  I had the BBQ Pizza and he had the Windy City Works.   The classic pan crust on my pizza was awesome and didn't have that too much bread vibe that many deep dish pizzas give you.  Temptation gave in, so we had the chocolate chip pie and turtle pie as dessert.  Both were delicious, I highly recommend trying at least one.  

Today was a rainy and cold day so it was absolutely freezing inside the restaurant (my toes may have gone numb) but we will definitely return the next time we are in town.

I had heard about this pizza in 5 minutes place, but, hadn't yet been there.  So while driving by I decided to stop in.  I got their thin crust pizza with marinara, mozzarella, cheddar, sausage, ham, green & red peppers, and sun dried tomatoes.  

First off, like I mentioned I have not been here before.  I mentioned this to the guy taking my order and he was super helpful!  He explained everything the whole way through and it was very easy to place my order!  

The pizza & soft drink was about $10.  Not cheap, but not very pricey either, considering all the toppings I picked.  How was it?  Well, it was great!  Tasted super fresh and really good!  I order pizza often (at least 3 times a month, probably more); usually from Lou Malnati's.  Now, I may say Lou's thin crust is slightly better, but, who wouldn't.  I mean Lou's is a Chicago pizza king, everyone knows them and they are awesome.  But, for a fast food pizza, Pie Five Pie Pizza Co is ahead of the curve!  This tastes nothing like fast food pizza.  It actually tastes and looks like quality! 

I am giving 5 stars because this place exceeded my expectations for a fast food pizza place.  Tasty food and friendly service!  Give them a try!
Fresh ingredients, friendly service. First time here; I'd definitely return. We tried one thin and one pan pizza, plus desserts. Scored free Schaumburg Boomers tix from the friendly cashier!
It was delicious. I enjoy dining here. Love the options and customer service. We will keep coming back again and again.

Really cool idea. The subway of pizza. The food was great. The workers were really nice. I like straight forward no bs here's what we do. I only wish there was more meat on the Mediterranean pizza. I'm not sure why but businesses think that every one from the Mediterranean is a vegetarian. I am from that region and I eats the hell out of meat. Love it. Maybe a gyro meat pizza or he'll throw some grilled chicken and feta or something on it.

This place is like a better version of California Pizza Kitchen. Or rather, when you can make your own flat bread pizza, with everything you like on it, there is no need to go to CPK. HOWEVER, $6.99 for a pizza your way, + a drink. You're looking at a $9 lunch.  I come in at 180lbs, and ate a pie and a half, as well as 2 root beer floats at the yelp event. Only then was I pleasantly full. Like I said, this could be a cool lunch spot, but the dollas don't make sense on this one. 
*I rather go to the Beer Market down the road, and call in a pizza to be delivered.

Sometimes we are faced with one of these three scenarios:

1. We want a delicious hot pizza, but we want something fresh instead of a slice that may have been sitting under a heat lamp for a while.
2. We want pizza, but we're trying to be more adventurous and eat something different instead of having the same standard combinations all the time.
3. We're going out with friends, but with a large group it's hard to get just one or two pizzas that will satisfy everyone's dietary needs and food preferences.

Fortunately, Pie Five Pizza Co helps to solve all of these problems. While it's not the most amazing pizza you'll have in your life -- it is surprisingly good for something that's made in 5 minutes, with lots of customization options, fresh ingredients, and is a lot of fun. I enjoyed the classic pan more than the thin crusts (maybe it's the Chicagoan in me) and felt that overall the pizzas could have used a bit more ingredients. But did like the fresh taste and not-too-salty composition of all the pizzas I tried. The cooks were very friendly and the service was excellent (very well kept and clean tables).

The decor is modern and trendy, which is especially noticable in the washrooms. The salads were presented with a well-composed gourmet look to them, although the flavor wasn't anything special and it could've been a bit lighter on the dressing. The cookie pie with a nice rich chocolate touch was a perfect way to end the meal.

Overall, a really cool concept with relatively good food and a great place to take friends. I'll definitely be back again.

Hurray to special preview events! When I saw a new shop go in on my way to work, I had to do some investigating online to find out what this Pie Five place was. Pie Five Pizza Co officially opens April 10th but I was lucky enough to go a special preview event for lunch today. And I'm so kind and generous, I brought along my lunch crew of five fellas to chow down, as well.

When I found out another pizza place was opening, I thought to myself...is this really necessary? But Pie Five has a slightly different twist on the normal pizza experience. It's more of a fast casual pizza dining spot and their whole schtick is your pizza will be done in five minutes (pie FIVE). So basically Pie Five is the Roti/Chipotle/Potbelly's of pizza. 

You can either order one of their speciality pizzas or make your own, you can pick a salad (why would you do that!?), or try one of their three desserts which all sound mouthwatering. Many of their speciality pizza combos sound mighty delicious to me like the Chicken Carbonara pizza - alfredo sauce, mushrooms, chicken, bacon & parmesan?! Yes, please. I actually loved this pizza. It's normally $6.99 and the ingredients went together quite well, fabulous tasting alfredo sauce, solid crust. My coworkers were saying they wished their pizza choices had a bit more meat though. The personal pizza completely filled me up!

They have a Coke Freestyle! I never get tired of these things. I think they are an essential for a fast casual spot like this and I'm very happy they have one! Locked myself up some Mello Yello Zero Cherry baby.

I really wanted to try all three of their dessert options but settled on trying just one as to not be the gluttonous monster I truly am. I went with the Chocolate Chip pie, with the other options being brownie or turtle. They do their desserts in the same round pizza style format in which you can get a slice for $1.69 or the whole shebang for $9.99. I actually loved my slice of cookie yumness. I'm dying to try the other desserts on the menu.

Our overall consensus is it's definitely a place we'd come back. We'd all like to try some of the different menu options but were happy with the prices, the food, the drink options and the service was great. Of course it's pre-opening but it's still kind of funny hearing managers remind employees to smile. These were some super happy employees though I must say. One guy in particular who was taking the pizzas out of the oven, he should get a gold star for friendliness and happiness, he could light up a room! ha! 

Welcome to Schaumburg, Pie Five Pizza! You're going to be a great lunch option for us business folk in the area.

My family has eaten here many times and it's been a very consistent experience. They only serve personal-size pizzas or kids personal pizzas. The price for any type of crust and any ingredients are the same for all pizzas, which is nice, and the price is reasonable. You're going to pay a little more than normal to feed your family than you would if you just got a single pizza, but the variety of options allowing each person to get exactly what they want make it worth it. I've tried a few of their pizzas and all were very good.  The kids pizzas are smaller and cheaper and only one ingredient but just as delicious.

My only complaint is that the process of telling the workers what you want on each pizza is very slow. This is not really a problem if you're showing up outside of a rush time but since we often show up a little earlier than the average person eats, we would always be treated to watching a very long and slow line barely move when 3 or 4 families showed up around the same time. You'll wait about 1-2 minutes per person in front of you in line.

If you want a personal pizza this is the best place in the area to find it.

Came here last night. Got the Windy City pizza. I thought it was going to be dry since they use the whole minimal sauce concept. However much to my surprise, it tasted amazing. Flavors were on point and the crust was perfectly cooked.

I also tried my wife buffalo chicken on thin & a friend's make-your-own pizza, both of which were great. I was blown away with how good & reasonably priced everything is. Additionally, the staff was pleasant and nice. I definitely anticipate returning.

4 stars for location, fast and friendly service, taste, and the ability to choose and add as your heart desires, all for $6.99!

Thank you to yelp event, they opened their doors to yelp elites to sample their menu the night before their grand opening.  It was so great that we came back on the day they opened. 

The idea is to make your pizza within 5 minutes so hey, select your toppings and get that pizza moving. You can make your own pizza or if you're indecisive, they can help with that too. They have a menu of already selected pizza like bbq chicken and Windy City pizza. 

I love making my own and i love their thin crust.  Get creative and get all 3 kinds of cheese or put everything you can think of on your pizza. 

Eat your heart out!!!
They hooked me up and gave me a great first time experience! Will def be coming back here for sure

So, I was one of the privileged few to attend the pre-opening night for some food, we got some samples and made our pizza. I think the two things that works for this place - FAST and AFFORDABLE. The pizza is not that big, a HUNGRY person can easily demolish that. 5 minutes for making a pizza, so you can always go back and get some more. The place has good area and good seating arragements. I think the pies they have here are good as well, though it might be a little hard to eat (with a toothpick - got some samples as well).

Pizza tastes very normal, nothing extra-ordinary, I hope they add a lot more veggies than what they did on PRE-OPENING night, but the service is FANTASTIC and staff is really friendly.

I came here with a group of coworkers for lunch today. A few of my other coworkers have been here and loved it, so I had to try it out. 

This is a genius concept. All pizzas are the same price, no matter how many toppings you put on, what crust you choose, or if you make your own or choose one of theirs. For a few bucks more you can add a drink and dessert or salad. They had plenty of different toppings, sauces, and crusts to choose from (even a gluten free one). Everything is made right in front of you and takes no time at all to make. You can take it to go or eat inside. I ordered the margarita pizza and loved it. Just the right size and delicious! For that price, it's not too shabby at all! 

They also have a rewards program (2 points for every pizza purchased, once you reach 20 points you get a free one!). No bad!

Miracle food! Not sure how I missed knowing about this place, but I'm glad I do now.

Went for lunch with two gluten free kids and one toddler. All of us were well fed and happy by the end of our meal. I do wish they had milk available for the wee ones, but that's a small grievance.

I recommend the Athenian, pan style, hold the olives. Love those banana peppers. And I'll have to try dessert next time.

Now I just need to figure out if there's one closer to home.

I've driven past this place a lot, and after scoping through the Yelp reviews, I knew I had to check it out. I'm so happy I did!

Pie Five is essentially one of those "build it in front of you" places, like Subway and Chipotle, but specializes in pizza. And *everybody* loves pizza! They even have vegetarian/vegan/gluten free options. 

You can choose one of their speciality pizzas or, if you're picky like me, you can build your own. As a first-timer I really wasn't sure what the process was like and the employee didn't care to explain it, but it was simple enough. Pick your crust, then your base (marinara, spicy marinara, Alfredo, olive oil, and some others I can't remember) and then your meats - get as many as you want! Get extra! It's all a set price, so you won't get charged for double meat or extra cheese.

Then you choose your veggies (and there's an ample selection of those). Pile on as many or as little toppings as you want before they put the pizza in the oven. When it's cooked you can choose to add extra Parmesan, feta, and/or mozzarella cheese, oregano, basil, and their signature "Magic Dust," all at no additional charge. 

A single personal pizza with unlimited toppings is $7, but for $10 you can get a large drink and a dessert pizza/side salad as well. It's really a great value for the price, although my pizza tasted so good that I wish I got a second one for later.

Peace out, Subway pizza. I'll definitely be returning!

Cool idea. Fresh ingredients to choose from. You get to pick and choose what you want on the pizza and they throw it in the oven for you. They have preset pizzas if you can't decide what to put together. 

Yes it'll cost more and is smaller than a Little Ceasars pizza but they have better ingredient.

i feel like you can't go wrong with pizza, so when i went here my expectations were met. 

everything was clean and fast... the amount of toppings you can add on was awesome, i almost didn't know where to start. my ONLY "complaint" is i wish there were labels on/above each topping. i know-it's pretty self explanatory but with the variety of options it just would've been a little easier on the eyes.

the pizzas were in and out of the oven within 5 minutes... PERFECT. me and my bf both got the pan crust and were impressed by how soft BUT crispy the crust was (always a pain when the edges of a pizza are a struggle to bite through) and the entire thing tasted fresh! this place is amazing, i'm glad to have stumbled upon it.

oh, the breadsticks were delicious as well as the chocolate chip pie. for the quality of the food here, the price is unbeatable.

Personal pan pizzas aren't a new idea, but getting whatever you want on them for $7 is new to me.  The toppings were pretty basic, but mix and matching them you can come up with some pretty wild ideas.  This particular chain does a good job spelling out your options and streamlining the process so you get through the line in around six minutes.  The pie is okay, probably why I'm giving it only 4 stars.  The price is great, a plus for a guy only looking for a simple lunch, especially when I'm tired of eating at Chipotle every day.

The staff here is very friendly, especially to new customers trying to wrap their heads around endless toppings.  A friendly cheap lunch that is worth a short wait.

This is where magic happens.  Really.

The concept is like this: you create your own pizza from the start, and the employees make it in front of you, kind of like a Chipotle or a Subway.  There are the suggested pies, such as the BBQ Chicken, Farmer's Market, and my favorite, the High Five.  Or you can make your own pizza with as many toppings as you like.  There are also different crusts: I prefer the pan, but there is also thin crust, gluten-free, and whole wheat.  The pizza cooks for a few minutes, and you pay at the counter.  I usually get a combo meal: a pizza, a side salad or dessert, and a fountain pop for about $10. 

The pizza is delicious!  Especially with a sprinkling of the Magic Dust!

Get the Circle of Crust rewards card. Sign up and get 10 points, halfway to a free pie!  And a free pie on your half-birthday!  With so many other places to get freebies on your birthday, why not get a treat 6 months later?

Give them a try!

Saw this place in passing and we decided to stop in. Best decision! Great pizzas, unlimited toppings for a great price, and customer service was awesome. The employees were friendly and funny, and explained how everything worked since it was our first time. Their pop machine ran out of a flavor we wanted and an employee immediately came to refill it for us. We'll definitely be back!

As a former California Pizza Kitchen loyalist, I have shifted my preference in favor of Pie Five. First of all, you can't beat the cost. For a little over $7, you can choose your crust, sauce and add any number of ingredients to personalize your pie. Or, if you prefer, you can stick to one of their signature pies. My recommendation? The Athenian!! Omg, sooooooo good. 
The friendly workers are great as well. They know their product, work productively and professionally, and couldn't be kinder to our two kids. 
I know Pie Five will be a new go-to pizza place.

I love the concept and the presentation.  The pizza looks like a piece of art coming out of the oven and looks beautiful on my plate. BUT the dough, crust, way it is cooked etc. does not work.  Einstein said  "Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results".I have now tried thin crust about 3 times now and come back with the same feeling. I prefer the open hearth ovens of BLAZE any day.  Those pizzas look good and taste good and the ovens cook a pizza like it should be cooked.  It is more on the lines of a wood fired stone oven pizza.
