But then, I am a pizza lover who has to work out 4 days a week to just keep off the pizza fat from places like Moretti's, Lou Malnati's, Domino's etc.  So if you are not that picky about your pizza, celebrate Pie Five's pizza concept. If you know what pizza should taste like, I would recommend giving it a pass.

Forget the 6" give me the 10" one...and you're done in 5 mins....wow

Pizza that is...bwawawawaaaaaa--I mean what else would I be referring to---especially at a place called Pie Five Pizza LOL

Smack it up, rub it down, flip it up----yep the pizza dough.... not too bad---you can get it thin, pan, wheat, or gluten free.

Went with a group of kiddies---perfect place for the picky eater.  The 6" is the kids size and would probably be ok for a kid under 5----any older and might as well just get the regular size--and so glad we did---otherwise there definitely would've been a table of hangry kids.

Parking was ample.  Lots of places to sit at around 5pm on a weekday.  Staff was nice enough, most likely a few newbies--but hey they gotta start somewhere.  The freestyle pop machine was fantastic and let me live out my fantasy of vanilla cherry sprite with a twist of lime.

The kids all made their own pizzas and gobbled them up.  I tried the chicken carbonara (suggested pie)---and what was nice was I was still able to add on other toppings--hooray! The folks behind me ordered a side salad--they can in strange pizza crust shaped bowls---looked alright but probably will not be partaking in that.

Overall nice concept, decent pizza, be sure to join their rewards program---because well----why not?  If we go there enough a free pie could be in our future.  Will be back.

Holy mother of pizza!!
This place is awesome, think Chipotle, but for pizza.

Upon walking in, the first thing I noticed was the extremely friendly employees. I was greeted by a girl and guy behind the counter. They were very nice and patient as I decided what I wanted to order. I also noticed that the restaurant is super clean. 
For $10, you can get a freshly/custom made personal pizza, a drink and a dessert. If you don't want dessert, you can pay an extra dollar and get a salad instead.    

You start by picking your crust: they have artisan thin, pan, whole grain and gluten free crust.  Next you choose your sauce: they have Tuscan marinara, spicy marinara, BBQ, buffalo ranch, olive oil and Alfredo. After that, you pick your cheese: they have mozzarella, parmesan, ricotta and cheddar cheese. Next, you pick your toppings, as many as you want with no additional charge! They have tons of toppings, any meat/veggie topping that I could think of, I saw. They also have specialty pizzas you can pick, like BBQ chicken, chicken Alfredo, margherita, the Athenian, etc. 

I decided on the artisan thin crust, Tuscan marinara sauce, with mozzarella and parmesan cheese. For toppings, I got pepperoni on the whole pizza, and Canadian bacon and pineapple on half. For drinks, they have one of those Coca-Cola freestyle machines. I also saw different flavors of iced tea. For the dessert options, you can get a slice of regular or turtle brownie, or a slice of chocolate chip cookie. I got the turtle brownie.

After you select your toppings, they put your pizza in the oven and it's ready in about two minutes. I was worried that it wouldn't be fully cooked or the crust wouldn't taste right since it cooks so fast. But it was actually cooked perfectly. It was delicious, I have no complaints. By the way, the pizzas are bigger than any other personal pizza I've had at other places. It's a 9 inch pizza, it was definitely filling. The turtle brownie was also delicious. 

While we were eating, an employee came over to our table to make sure we were okay and enjoying our food, which I thought was really nice. I absolutely love the overall concept of this place, all of the employees are very friendly, and the food was delicious. I'll be back for sure!!
The Mrs. and I stop for a quick bite been wanting to stop for a while now. Glad I did we will definitely be back.

I so wanted to attend the Yelp preview event but that didn't quite work out.    However it just so happened that I was in the area following a dentist appointment so I stopped by.    I went in during their non-rush hour after 4pm.    The signage and general interior design reminded me of a few other places like M Burger and Meatheads.   Wonder if they are owned by the same conglomerate.    Though obviously that matters not for now.

 I was greeted right away by a couple of the servers eager to get my order going.    After perusing the options on the wall I decided on one of their specialty pizzas, their chicken carbonara.   I went with their recommended crust style and also requested extra mushrooms on mine which they had no problem adding.   I deliberately timed the order and it wound up being close to five minutes when it came out of their oven.    Pretty cool to have express fresh pizza.   I also ordered a slice of their chocolate chip cookie cake.    

Overall I enjoyed the pizza.   The crust was just a step above frozen pizza.   It won't be replacing my Lou's anytime soon but for a fast quick option, Pie 5 does hit the spot.

It's good pizza for what it is. It's cheap and quality for the price (versus getting a dominos pizza or something). The staff sucks though, they had a crazy line and weren't helpful at all and pretty much screwing off half the time. If you can afford it, Giordano's is just up the road and you'll probably wait less time to get your pizza there than you will here...

Went to the soft opening here for lunch yesterday. The vibe was chill. The pizza was quick (less than 5 min), fresh, & tasty. I got a build your own salad too. Got chicken in it which was an extra $1, but thats ok. It was still good. Everyone was super friendly. They have a cool soda machine. I've seen these before, but I'm still amazed every time I see one.

This place is like a Subway or Chipotle.... but for pizza! 

They have build your own pizzas for $6.99 & salads for $2.99, but the best deal would be to get the meal which includes pizza, salad, & a drink for $9.99. Dont forget to try the Magic Dust! 

I will def be coming back soon! :)

I came for the grand opening. This place was on point and offers a new item to the pizza world. I highly enjoyed the italian beef with giardanera pizza. Basically you chose a bunch of toppings and 5 minutes later get a nice personal sized thin crust pizza. I am a huge fan and will definitely be back.

I get the feeling that this concept, no matter what the company, will be coming to a Loop corner near me, and soon.

We walked in and saw a pretty good variety of pizzas. I got myself a veggie pizza with some extra mushrooms (because I am a fan of mushrooms) while my wife got something with chicken. Pie Five offers different kinds of crusts, and I think I got a whole wheat one. 

I also picked up one of the pieces of "dessert pizza", the turtle one I think. For what it's worth, it was very fudgy and good. 

To summarize: the pizza is very thin because it has to be, and it's sort of miraculous that I'm able to be eating a pizza five minutes after I order it. Despite its thinness the pizza isn't particularly crispy, but this is more than made up by the freshness of the dough, the ingredients and the time it takes to make. 

This won't be replacing deep dish anytime soon (or ever, to be honest) but as a lunch stop, it's pretty awesome. 

I'm looking forward to seeing where this trend goes.

Eh.  Not a fan but it didn't kill me. Pan pizza isn't really pan at all. It's the subway of pizza joints. 

Not a fan

I was given a free small pie by someone, so I decided to come check this place out.  I guess it is pretty new and I am always for checking new plces out.  They have a couple of different selections as far as crust. I was deciding between flatbread and personal pan. I went with the latter. They have a few different sauces. A marinara and a spicy marinara.  There are a HUGE amount of ingredients and you can get as many ingredients as you want on it.  I went with pork sausage, carmelized onions, and "magic dust" which is italian seasoning and parmasean and another cheese or something. The service was quick and friendly (after constructing the pizza, it takes 5 minutes to cook.  The pizza crust (at least the pan) comes out golden brown and crisp.  

I really enjoyed this place and it is worth the usual price of the pizza and you can add a salad or dessert for like $9 total. I will be back to this place for sure

This place opened up in Schaumburg a week ago where you can create your own pizza. Their portions are pretty fair for the price, and their staff is very friendly!
I got the Windy City works and it was pretty good! Though I couldn't taste the Italian beef in it, I got it on a classic pan so the crust made up for it.

Love the concept probably would be a good place if they had the right help and training in place very dirty, tables not wiped down pizza knife was laying out collecting bacteria, dirty and being reused with other dried up food. Kid making pizza had no clue how to do it. I was grossed out by the whole thought of it. Feel like the help had no prior food experience or training in cleanliness or preparation. Prices are very high unless you have a coupon. Will not go back could not eat my food threw it in the garbage. Would only be one star but gave them extra star for concept. I blame owners for no supervision.

Best pizza place especially the concept is amazing I've always had problems ordering pizza because I like to eat with different toppings and sauces and its the place. Recommend it 100% and yes it made me loose my addiction from papa johns

The food is great but the mini-managers customer service are sub par. I went it at opening  and had 2 free pies  and they told me the circle of crust system is down so i showed them my account on my phone that said 2 free, but the manager just kept telling me the system was down not not if i had to pay or not for the pizzas. So long story short it took 10 mins for me to be to say whatever i will pay for this since i drove 15 mins to come get it, then the manager finally tells me that they are free. What makes me mad is that it took 10 and i was gonna pay for them to tell me it ia free, such a waste of time


I give the 2 stars for low customer service

But the food all gets 4 stars



Edited: to 4 stars

Their business owners work really fast and were nice to adress this quickly, within 5 mins of me posting this they messeged me about the experience.

Good toppings to choose from. Had the High Five and it was great. Lots of parking in the rear, that's a big plus but expected in the burbs. Staff was kind and friendly. Check out the hand washing "system" in the bathroom.

I would definitely be back here again - but maybe when it's a bit busier and more people are working. 

The concept is great. You do not need to order a huge about of pizza from Domino's, Pizza Hut, or Papa John's. If you want a personalize sized, somewhat fresh (I say somewhat as the meat options are "heated" when baked) - go to Pie Five! You can choose what type of crust  you get for any type of pizza! Extra cheese? No Prob. It's all inclusive in their 6.99 build your own pizza price. 

Oh and they have their own salads there too, filled in a pizza crust! I haven't tried it yet.. but it looked like a salad?

One downside to it is if you go there at a downtime, there's only 1 person that will be building pizzas - the line will feel like it will never move. There were about 5 people ahead of us and took us literally 15-20 minutes to finally order something. Then you wait an additional 5 (ish) minutes for your pizza to bake. It was a really long wait. If I was there by myself, I would have left. SO with that said, I would go back when they are properly staffed. 

Staffing can be more efficient. Food is great. I would go back.. but not at like 7pm.

The Subway/ Chipotle of pizza! Why hasn't this been around sooner? For $7 you can get one of their signature 10 inch pizzas. There is a whole bunch to choose from and you can even create your own custom pizza. All of the ingredients are laid out in front of you and you just choose whatever and however much you want. You even choose what kind of crust and sauce you want. My favorite is the pan crust as it not only tastes good but has just the right amount of fluff and softness to it. Pizzas take 5 minutes to cook thus the name Pie FIVE. Quality is pretty good for fast food pizza.

I was visiting the area and a cousin suggested picking up Pie Five for lunch. Here's how it went:
Cuz: I'll pick up Pie Five for lunch
Me: What's that?
Cuz: it's a new pizza joint
Me: ok, what toppings do we want on the pizza? (sigh...expecting all the compromises that go with a shared pizza)
Cuz: Oh you pick your own... they are personal pizzas and ready in 5mins!
Me: In 5mins? Pizza? 
Cuz: Yeah they have some new ovens. What toppings do you want?
Me: OK, jalapenos... wait, how many toppings can I get?
Cuz: as many as you want on each pie!
And the rest, as they say, is history. We had a great time picking out 5-6 toppings each (try the Sriracha marinara!) and it was a delicious well-baked (in 5mins!) pizza with a great crust. I really hope they arrive in California soon... that's when I'll add the 5th star!

Five minutes-- that's what the five means. As their marketing guy told me, they want to be the Chipotle of pizza. Fresh ingredients, and made just for you. The experience here is assembly line: you walk by the counter, and the staff makes your pizza to your specifications. They have choices in crust, sauce, cheese, toppings. Unique to Chicago is Italian beef. The spicy marinara sauce actually has a bit of a kick (they did start in Texas). There are three different kinds of tomatoes (fresh, roasted, sun-dried). Your pizza then goes into a conveyor oven. When done, you are offered a choice of more toppings (pesto drizzle, magic dust). You pay and get your drink. There is one Coke Freestyle machine, which has the potential to cause a wait. (Virtually every other place has two: Pei Wei, Five Guys, etc.). The decor is black and red, with many Pie Five pizza logo accents. Their corner unit has two walls of windows, so it's very bright. There's a potential for the line to get tangled up in the vestibule. But you have to have double doors to get through a Chicago winter without freezing your diners!  The staff here is very friendly and efficient. They all seem excited to be part of this new pizza world. Oh, yeah, they also have salads and three desserts. I was particularly excited that they offer a gluten-free crust. It is really good, and blows away any other I've had in a restaurant. However, even though the staff is trying VERY hard not to cross-contaminate (changing gloves, using a different metal plate, boxing your pizza at the end, using a separate brush to apply sauce), your GF pizza is still made on the same line as all the wheat pizzas. Know yourself. I have eaten here three times with no problems. But unless they have a separate line and oven...it's going to be impossible to keep it totally clean. They are right next to BW3 and Five Guys. I'm excited this option is in the greater shopping/dining/working metro IKEA area. Good luck, Pie Five!
I tried pie five and it was just ok.  I love that they have the Coke freestyle machine but the pizza isn't good enough for me to return.  I enjoy Blaze a lot more.

Of the many quick build pizza placed popping up. Pie Five is unique for offering 3 different crust selections including a wheat flax crust for the healthy foodies. Realistically you can build a very healthy meal for one. on the not so good for you but feels good anyway side are dessert pies not normally found at Blaze or U BuildIt.. A clean and cool dining room with freestyle machines help tie it off for a nice lunch or even dinner. If only they had a TV to watch the game.. we would choose this over BDubs next door.

So the food itself was pretty good.  $7 for a personal pizza, comes in 6 slices.  You get to pick as many toppings as you want, choice of crust and sauce, or you can select from one of their many signature combinations.  We went with the Garden Fresh and the Chicken Alfredo Pesto.  Filling, tasty, fresh, and fast... but minus 1 star for the meh service.  None of their employees were smiling or enthusiastic.  Will it kill you to crack a smile?

Was going to go to one of the other places near here, but saw it was open and decided to give it a try.  Glad I did.  We got the High Five and the Athenian.  Both were very tasty.  Prices were good, especially since you can add toppings at no extra charge.  Staff was friendly.   

My only complaint if you will, I think due the pizza's being "personal" size, and the quick cooking time (which is great!), the pizza did not stay hot/warm very long, and by the last few slices may have been bordering on cold.  But, I eat cold pizza all the time!  

Definitely will be back.

Dope concept and it works. Been to other places where they tried this with low quality ingredients and failed. But pie five delivers (no pun intended cause they don't actually deliver). Try the Chicago style and get extra crack (magic dust) sprinkled on ur pizza.

Second visit to this restaurant during a work lunch break. Both times the line has been out the door and it's a bit of a wait. 
The menu has some pizzas and salads and a few desserts but you can also make/choose your own pizza toppings and it bakes in five minutes. Both times I created my own pizza and both times it was great. Will be going back. Wish the wait wasn't so long...

Good (bordering very good) pizza in 5 minutes. 

Fed 2 kids with their own Za, my Chicago Classic (like a beef with giard pizza), 2 dessert pies, three drinks under 25 bucks. 

Work on the red sauce and this could be 5 stars. 

The margherita uses shredded mozzarella instead of buffalo but, still good. 

You could load up a Za with tons of ingredients and easily feed two adults. 

Been here twice in a week. Will be back.

Went here for a late lunch. The BBQ Chicken Pizza had a great flavor and tons of great toppings. I didn't try the deserts but they looked very good. The prices made sense for what your getting. The staff was friendly when you come in and while making your pizza and even ask you if that is enough toppings (they were). Nate did a great job on the pizza. The menu is limited its pizza, salad, desert. But I'm all about pizza so I was good with that :) 

There was plenty of seating, could use more than one soda machine. they have frequent diners card, not sure if you have to have it each time as you have to set it up on-line.

The place was clean, plenty of parking. I would recommend this to friends and would be happy to go back.

Pie Five Pizza Co. is a great business concept.  For those people who want good quality pizza with yummy ingredients, who wish to skip Pizza Hut and Papa Johns, but still be able to enjoy with their family and friends - this is the place!  When you get to choose your own toppings and ingredients on your pizza, there is something just so freeing :)

For my boyfriend and I, I require Gluten Free crust and he prefers thick crust pizza.  We have different tastes and preferences but still wanted to grab a pizza to go after a long day!  This place was perfect for it.  We went after it had just opened.  Great location, customer service was decent, and the pizzas were delicious.
Great place to go get pizza,really quick stop n go. Nate is really cool and the whole staff is awesome! :D

My daughter and I went there for the first time today May 30 2016.  We were so grossed out that they touch everything with their hands.   They wore gloves but touched everything with the gloves on.  We don't eat pork and they made the pizza before us with bacon.   Then used the same dirty glove to make our pizza, after he wiped his nose and opened all the drawers, then went into the back room to fill a tray, then came back to serve us!!!!    I was mortified.    WHY WEAR THE GLOVES AT ALL?   We were so grossed out that we didn't eat our food.  Not going back.  Ewwww

I like this place very much. The service is friendly and helpful and their personal size pizza is much better tasting than pizza huts personal size pies.  They use a fresh selection of toppings that you choose from.

It costs around $7 per pizza, but it is definitely worth.
Similar to chipotle or subway, you make your own pizza based on how you're feeling that day. Fortunately for the healthy conscious, they have wheat pizza crust (and gluten free also!)

Bake time is very short since it is only 5 minutes. Definitely a good choice for those that are on the go!

The pizza was good, service fast and friendly BUT ...the dining area was very dirty. I had to wipe off my seat and table before sitting down. Napkins and food debris all over the floor. Spilled drink puddle by garbage and and it sat there the whole time I was there..this is dangerous! It was very slow at the time I went, but 6 people working behind the counter with no customers ... One of them should have been taking care of the dining room. I don't want to sit and eat in filth, no matter how good the food is.
Pizza is ok. Nothing to write home about.  It's Khios in a pinch when you want a fast pizza fix

Never been here before. I had the Five Star pizza with the classic pan crust. Very good! The crust was soft and crunchy at the same time. They have one of the soda machines with a touch screen that offers many choices. Friendly staff and clean dining room. Coming here again.

This is some of the worst pizza I've ever had. Got the pan crust five star pizza. The crust tasted bad and undercooked. The sauce was very plain tasting, it reminded me of the pizza packets you got in those old lunchables pizzas. The sausage was that kind of tiny gross bits of sausage and the rest of the ingredients were fairly tasteless. Pizza was barely warm and got room temperature in about one minute. I didn't even finish mine. Got the side salad too, which was served in a stale tortilla bowl for some reason. Garden salad is just lettuce, tomatoes and shredded carrots. 2 stars because they have one of those pop machines that can make any kind of pop.

Decided to try this place based on Yelp reviews. Walked in and looked at the menu and thought about leaving. I admit, I'm a picky eater, and every pizza had at least one ingredient I wouldn't eat. The guy at the counter said I could order any pizza with or without the listed ingredients. I said "Cool, then I'll take the Maui Wowwi with no barbecue sauce". My husband said "I'll have the same but with the barbecue sauce". The guy pulls out 2 crust and proceeds to slop barbecue sauce on both. My husband say "one of those was without the barbecue sauce". The guy looks at him and grumps "it's a little late to tell me now".   Even though I know what I told him, I said "I'm sorry, I thought I said no barbecue sauce when I ordered". I work in customer service, I know how things can be misunderstood. Plus, the music was really loud so maybe he didn't hear me. He then slammed the ruined crust into the garbage and proceeds to angrily make our pizzas. Once they were in the oven, he went and hid in the back the rest of the time we were there, refusing to wait on us anymore. The pizza was awesome!  I would have liked to have told him that but he never came back out.

We have gotten burned TWICE by their corporate emails which promise things that this particular restaurant is not willing to deliver on. We were told for instance that we'd get double points if we came in on the Fourth of July. When we did, we were greeted by a sign that they decided to close early. A few days later we received another email that said kids eat free every Sunday in July. We loaded the kids into the car and went there, only to be told that they don't do that. When we showed them the email they said, "oh, that must be a corporate thing. We are not a corporate store." And how was that our fault? How were we, or anyone else, supposed to know that? We received an email from Pie Five. It didn't say anything about corporate stores and franchise stores. This was incredibly disappointing and bait and switch. We will be pursuing this with their corporate offices. But it looks like this particular store does whatever they want and has no accountability to anyone.

Pizza was top notch. All are personal size, with as few or many toppings as you'd like. Tried one of the signature pizzas (5-star) and it was great!  All the ingredients are fresh. Pizza goes into the oven and is back our in no time. The dining area is also nice, clean, and modern!
Its the chipotle of pizza.  I like that you can make whatever topping pizza you want.  Friendly staff and fresh ingredients.  Good price for the value.  I was surprise how fast the pizza cooked.
This place was awesome. The pizza was phenomenal. I got spicy marinara and it was perfectly seasoned. The way they make it is very unique. I recommend this place to anyone!

So delicious! The portion sizes are great and you can customize your pizza anyway you want it! It's a mix between a Subway/Chipotle/Sweet tomato. Definitely my new favorite place. But I did not like the marinara sauce that much.

This review is partly on behalf of my kids as the adults in our household stopped eating pizza for good this year. Visited this place for first time today and it was packed, could be bcoz it was Friday evening. The quantity or size of the pizza felt too small for the pizza. A+ for the toppings and cheese looked yummy to me. My kids said they would love to go back again and they had healthy options and good decor. This kinda reminded me of subway pizza where you choose everything and they make pizza right in front of your while you pay. I recommend to friends to visit this place and decide themselves. Can't go wrong for one visit in my opinion. 

Only TIP - Honestly unless your kid is 3 yr old the kids pizza is like the size of a stretched pancake, that's the only con.

I have been to Pie Five several times, and I do enjoy the pizza and the variety you can get.  I go there during lunch at work and it is fairly quick so long as you don't get there when there is a huge line out the door (happens right around noon).  Also, the one thing I did not like were their deserts.  I have tried each of the desert cookie pizza things and the only one I kind of liked was the normal chocolate chip one.  Honestly get the salad instead, not only is a better for you but it tastes better as well.

I stopped in for lunch on a friday. The menu had a few options that sounded good, but I ended up going with the Windy City Pizza (italian beef, giardiniera, etc). My wife got the margherita pizza. Both were good, but not great. Why? No pizza sauce! Apparently its not standard with every pizza. They have it, but i guess you need to ask. Seems ridiculous to me, like would I ask for a bun if I ordered a cheeseburger. The ingredients looked fresh. The prices are very reasonable. Inside was clean with plenty of seating. I will be back, but I'll order much differently.

If you like burnt crust non-filling pizza this is place for you!  They even have a sign on their napkin holder that says "free napkins"; thanks for the free napkins and stealing my $...never again for me!

Yeh it pretty much sucks.  Tasteless no passion.  Subway on a piece of cardboard crust?  I believe you can do a quick fast casual pizza very well and this is not it.  If you want what it should be go to Minneapolis and stop at punch pizza.  Much better.       Pie five is similar to blaze pizza...

The food was delicious and satisfying (especially for me, being gluten free, it's hard to find good pizza around) but the store seemed mismanaged and chaotic.  The service was friendly at first, but quickly dwindled.  They didn't really seem to know what they were doing, and seemed to be understaffed as there was a line of 3-4 people behind us that could have been helped if there were someone there to tend to them. Once we finally got our food sorted out and everything, we headed to the dining room to find a table to enjoy our pizza, but not to my surprise, every single table was used and left dirty. Piles of napkins and spilled soda, Parmesan cheese and salt sprinkled about and paper straw wrappers everywhere. Not to mention it was probably 65 degrees in there, not a very enjoyable environment, but good pizza. Me and my family enjoyed the food as far away from the building as we could get.
This place is fab!!! U can load up as many veggies meats cheeses etc all for a single price! Definitely will come back!!!
It's like a Chipotles for pizza instead.  Was good, not quite delicious, but good. I'd go back. Staff is courteous and friendly
good - luv the pizza.  hope to return soon
Excellent and made right in front of you! The deep dish crust is great! I wish there was a location near home.

This place is unique. Easy walking in and ordering your pizza (which is ready by the time you get to the cash register). Taste is okay, could be a bit better. Pizza sauce tasted a bit more soury/tart (tried Sriracha Marinara sauce along with the original). Can't wait until they get their Alcohol license so I can enjoy a pizza with the beer.

This place was great the first few weeks it was open, they were very generous with the topping portions.  But the past few times I've been there they have been extremely stingy, almost as if there was a new policy in place.  Also, the pie five website lists "pured tomatoes" as one of the sauce options, but they don't have that at this location.  That's very unfortunate, as I'm trying to watch my sodium and that's the low sodium sauce option listed on their site.
Wow!  I was amazed. Small place, but worth it. Service is great.  food was even better. Definitely a keeper ...... deep fried Oreos.

Even before I got into this place I knew it was going to be a good experience.  There were a couple of customers eating at the only outside table when we pulled up.  Before going in, I asked "How's the food".  "Awesome" was the reply "Wanna try some" and a big container of fabulous looking nachos was offered to me.  I' never pass up an opportunity to try something, so I had a taste--yummo!

Inside we met Sammy.  He made us feel like we'd been coming to his place for years.  It was fun.  I'm not going to get into the food--there's lots of others who had said it was delish and it is.  I did have the chili-cheese dog.  The crispy slab of bacon on top was a pleasant surprise.   My friend had the Chicago dog--a real beauty for the eye and the tongue.  

The deep fried oreos went down easy--almost scary easy.

Big Menu--Big Food--Big Value

First off i'd like to say from the outside the place is a little off putting..  However soon as you  walk inside you feel like you have been coming here for years (my first time there)..

As I was looking at the menu on the wall and deciding what to order... Decided on a couple slices of pizza and a chicago style hot dog..  The owner I assume is very nice, makes you feel like a customer whos been coming there for ages..

Everything seems made to order as I had to wait 5-10  mins for order...No problem was prewarned by owner as he said will be a few mins..

Kind of was hoping they had some lemonade of some sort however is just coke, water, and few others in cans...  Howeever am sure don't  sell a lot so no worries..

So i receive my food and on way..  Get home everything is still piping hot..

I eat the chicago style hot dog its good, nice flavor there is nothing bad to say about it.. Other  than the pickle was an off brand...  Can tell wasn't a food brand pickle..  Would order again really want to try other kinds of dogs they sell.

The pizza.  I had to really let this cool down it was hot hot hot.. The  sauce, the cheese, the sausage was all the perfect amount and tasted great.   The crusted tasted reat as well however for some reason it was a little doughy even thou the pizza was so hot..  Kind of undercooked I suppose..  Will I hold it against them no it happens.

Overall I will definitely be going back here..  Tons more on menu I wanna try and prices are great..  Definetely  the diamond in the rough in bartlett.

The best food not just in Bartlett, but the entire Chicagoland area in my opinion. Everything on the menu is absolutely delicious and made to order. Sam is awesome. Very warm and welcoming and accommodating to his customers. He makes all of his sauces himself at home, you can't beat that level of quality. If you're a burger fan, ask for the pineapple crush. It's not on the in house menu but trust me you will not be disappointed. I won't go anywhere else for take out food. This place really is a rare gem and a must try for anyone who stops in Bartlett.

I love this place so much. The owners are awesome. I am a sucker for creative twists on classics but they have to be done right. This place will not disappoint. The fries are fresh cut and some of the best I've had. The Indian inspired dishes are my favorite. I'm making a trip to Bartlett next week just to try more from the menu. This place is a gem.

Based upon Yelp stopped in for a gyro sandwich & a can of pop today, Sept. 15, 2016.  Owner was very pleasant & was very proud of his gyros & pizza. Pleasure doing business with him.  Gyro was very good but would have preferred it's temperature hotter.  I will be back when in the area.  Oh, and YES, sign said closed 2:00-4:00pm.

I was in the mood for wings and I didn't not want to drive anywhere in this cold. I looked up places near me and Sams is only 1 mile away and had great reviews.
 
I call to place an order for pick up and the gentle man on the phone was very polite and answered all my questions. I had a few since it was my first time ordering from them. He said it would be 25 minutes  because they were working on a catering order which I thought was not a bad wait. I ordered 24 buffalo wings with a side of loaded fries. 
   
We get our order n omg the wings are so juicy and tasty! And the fries where too I will definitely be coming again for the dining experience

Update:  Not only do I love Sam, but now I love his son.

Seriously- if you're having a bad day, go here.  Both Sam and his Son have energy, the gift to gab and smile to help to make anyone feel better.  AND, the food is good.

Both gentlemen try to talk me into trying their fried Twinkie... but I cannot. I cannot fall in love with another thing that will make me fatter.  I'm sure it's amazing.

Adjectives time:

-Amazing fresh fries
-Lemon wings were tangy and awesome
-Tandoor pita was flavorful and spicy!
-The owner and his wife were really hospitable

Overall excellent food

Will definitely go back here

Great wings, great handmade pizza like from the old hood in Chicago, great handmade burgers, great sides (especially the mushrooms)! Call ahead, though. They make everything fresh to order, so figure twenty minutes.

The food here is unique and amazing. They have all the American standards plus they have options with a twist. There is nothing better than well prepared food and this place take the time to do it right. 
There is only a small eat in area so with a group it is better to take it to go.

After recently moving to the area from Chicago, (a.k.a. Food Heaven!), we found ourselves craving unique food establishments, rather than the typical food chains. 

Today, I was looking for a good burger and fresh-cut fries and I came across Sam's Grill.

I have to tell you......YUM! 
My cheeseburger and fries were AWESOME and exactly what I was looking for. I'll definitely return....looking forward to trying the Tandoori Chicken.

Also, make sure you meet Sam. He is a sweetheart and one of the friendliest business owners I have ever met.
Awesome food and amazingly friendly service. I recommend sams to all of my friends and they love it as much as me!
This place is awesome.  Just tried the Jalapeno Burger and Loaded Fries.  Both were excellent.  Fast and friendly service as well.  Give this place a try for sure!

UPDATE - 4/6/2015. Sam's offers deliveries on the weekends now. We have ordered delivery now a couple times and both times received our food promptly from a very chill and polite delivery boy.  The delivery offer is a godsend because now I can order on those lazy weekend days when I'm too hungover to think about driving.

I've eaten more or less everything off the menu at this point and it's all great. The hickory burger and Jalapeno Cheddar Burger are my favorites. and OH MY GOD the buffalo wings are perfect. It's still all about the Chicken Tandoori and mexican pizza's though.

On top of everything, Sam is one of the most sincere and kindest restaurant owners I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. He always makes you feel extremely welcome the second you walk into his restaurant.  My only regret of ordering delivery is not getting to stop in and say hi!

- ORIGINAL REVIEW -


I've been holding off reviewing this place for a bit because I wanted to try a lot of their stuff, but upon eating the Chicken Tandoori Pizza last night, i can no longer stay silent. 

It was among the finest pies I have eaten in my life.

The fresh cut fries they serve manage to be crispy, not soggy, as so many other establishments do. The deep fried taco is stuff of legends.

I will not stop, nay, I CAN'T stop going here until I sample everything on the menu.

The people here are the friendliest dudes, if you have to wait awhile for food, trust me, it is worth it!!!

Not good at all! I really have no idea why this place is rated so high. I ordered the pizza and the best way I can describe it is it tasted like a frozen Totinos. The sauce was ultra sweet, the crust was very undercooked with no flavor and the sausage was just so plain and blah! It was like a frozen pizza cooked in a microwave.. Did not try anything else but after that there's really no reason to...
Really cool ideas in the place.  The tandoori chicken pizza is ridiculous!  The wings are excellent too.  Definitely a place to try and go back to.

My husband and I were craving wings but I did not wanted to take a drive to a BWW that is a little far from us and well it was late, so I looked up wings near me and Sam's came up we decided to give them a try and OMG! Best wings ever, first of all the wings are huge and second they are delicious, we have only tried buffalo and parmesan garlic. The guy at the register was so nice and attentive, he even had sauces on the bag without me asking for them. Will be definitely coming back here for more wings and other delicious things on their menu.

Paid my first visit to Sam's. after seeing it listed as #1 in Bartlett for awhile.  I ordered the Tandoori Chicken Pita.  It was so delicious.  Large portion, yet not to heavy.  The service was fast and courteous as well  I cant wait to go back and explore their diverse menu.  Maybe the Gyros burger or wings.

Having Sam's less than a minute from our house is really dangerous. Their burgers are THE BEST! Their wings are also awesome. We haven't found a thing at Sam's we don't love. Definitely one of the best spots in Bartlett

We went there all the way from palatine and the place got closed an hour before its regular time. There were about 5- 6 people sitting inside but nobody had a courtesy to open the door and serve their customers!! Bummer!

Food it great but if you don't get to eat it then what's the point!!

Have you ever had a fried taco?! No? Well, make your way over to Sam's, introduce yourself to Sam (trust me, you can't miss him) and tell him you need a fried taco....STAT! Let him be creative, because he is innovative and a wonderful cook!

Seriously, I love Sam, his wife and their son, Nick. They are some of the kindest people I have encountered in years. AAAAAND they know how to cook.

They have a few seats inside but it's mostly a takeout place and with the sweetest staff at your service, it can def be a place to grab a bite for lunch or a quickie dinner.

I have only had a fried taco and some fresh cut French fries SO FAR but I have to tell you that their food is delish! They obviously use all fresh ingredients and everything is very well seasoned. I cannot wait to explore Sam's menu further. 

I look forward to my next visit when I hope I can try their Saturday rib special ($18.99/ full slab or $9.99/ half slab) or one of their burgers that I understand Sam mixes with his special combination of seasonings. 

I intend on going back to soon to support our local business owner and get my fix of good food at a place I think I could hang out at for hours and hours.
Great specialty and regular pizzas, wings, sandwiches. Awesome burgers. Everything is super delicious.

Okay, time for an update! The owner reached out to me after my previous review and apologized for the service we got that night. So, when we were hankering for a pizza again, we decided to give Sam's another shot, and I am very glad that we did. This time around, we did get our pizza, and it was delicious. We got the Tandoori Chicken pizza, which wasn't really my cup of tea (I am a total baby when it comes to spicy food), it was obvious that the ingredients were of quality and after shuffling my chicken pieces over to my husband's slice, it was wonderful. We also got some fries, which I did heartily chow down on. I'm particular when it comes to fries. They have to be right. If you're like me, come here, because they definitely do it right.

I'm very glad that Sam got in touch with me. We're all looking forward to trying another pizza (and gettin' down on some more of those fries) in the future.
OMG!!! This place is amazing, great customer service, & The food is great,Yum yum!! Thanks for the beer nuggets ;))

Menu selection is very confusing but they have above average food. I come here because I love the home cut fries. I've tried a bunch of things on the menu including the pizza all were good. Wish they had a daily special

awesome food! friendly staff. 
we asked for the potatoe on a stick, and it was great!
pizza, tandoori pita and loaded fries. everything is just perfect quality and excellent taste.

Update?! Of course I have an update! At this point I have have tried everything on the menu and they have never disappointed. The burgers, the italian beef, the pizza, the fries, it's all good. The Chicken Tandoori: pita, pizza and paratha all amazing. 
The burgers are GREAT! One of my favorites is the Hickory Burger. The man is a surgeon with bacon. It's cooked well, it's constructed tightly so the ingredients aren't sliding out of the burger while you eat it. Something I admire in burgers the same way I do sushi that doesn't fall apart when you pick it up. The hot dogs are delicious and there is a wide variety of options. Consistent through all meal options is the quality of ingredients and the great skill with which they are executed.
Sam's very happily marries American standbys with a couple Indian ingredients as an added bonus which is not something I would have ever expected from a place in a strip mall in Bartlett, IL.

For a hole in the wall place, it's pretty good. My coworker and I both got a burger. Honestly, for the wait and price I'd probably rather hit a Five Guys or Smashburger. The fries we're just ok. It was definitely made fresh when we ordered (2 burgers and fries took a little better than 10 minutes).
I would go back to try something else. Burgers are not something I'd order again.

This place is legit. I honestly laughed at the "Pizza" sign on first sight but after checking it out, it lived up to all of the hype. I ordered the buffalo chicken pita and fries. Both were phenomenal. 

Sam says they aren't able to deliver anymore. Thank god I love a block away! 

Only improvement would be later hours. Like 4 am or so.
Does not look appealing from the outside at all, but it's so much better than you could ever imagine. They need a bit of a facelift, but the food is so amazing! Just give them a try!

The deep-fried Jersey Dog was fantastic!  Yellow mustard and a mix of flattop seared peppers and onions blanketed a perfectly fried weenie on a fluffy sausage roll.  My friend got the BBQ Dog... Also delicious!  I work at a higher-end restaurant and we serve amazing hand-cut fries.  I will say that the fries here were even better.  Furthermore they (the fries) were beautiful (strange to say about a French fry, but see for yourself)!
Heads up:  they are closed from 2:00-4:00.  Get this: they leave for the grocery store to replenish their stock, ensuring the ingredients are as fresh for the dinner rush as they are for the lunch crowd.  Certainly cuts into the owners'profit margin to close during such a time, but I give them props for choosing quality over quantity.  Who does that, especially for a burger & dog place?  Sam's does and the freshness is evident and much appreciated!

I'm done with Sam's. 

Tonight is the third time in the last year that I tried and failed to get dinner! They do not keep true to their own posted operating hours.  Always closing early. Tonight I called at 7pm to order wings, he said it would be just a few min. I said oh it usually takes longer. I can't make it that quick. I asked if they could put the order in so that it was ready to be picked up around 745. He said no, we can't do that and then hung up on me as I was trying to say ok if call back in 30 min to order again.  So fast forward to 7:38 exactly I call again.  They won't answer the phone. I called about 5 times. Finally knowing they are going to close at 8 my husband runs over there to order in person....doors locked and lights off when he gets there at 745 which is still 15 min before they are supposed to be closed. I've had this happen 3 times now!  I'm sorry, but no food is worth that effort and it's just poor customer service. If you post you're open until 8, and your answering machine says your open until 8 you need to be open until 8. Or have a well posted disclaimer that says we close when we please because we don't care about our customers. My husband was in the parking lot at 745 listening to a message saying they are open for another 15 min.  Nice. The first time this happened I called 30 min before closing and the guy said they don't take orders that late.....I said I didn't understand because they were open for another 30 min. Apparently when it says they close at a certain time that's when they plan on walking out the door and has nothing to do with what time they will serve customers. You don't want my business, I understand. That's been made clear. I'll make sure to let anyone I can know not to waste their time checking Sams out anymore, I can't trust I wouldn't be making a jerk out of myself recommending.
Food was great but found a nail in my food. Workers refused to take responsibility saying they knew every nail in the store and didn't recognize the one in my food. Never going back.

This is definitely a take-out place unless you are really starving and have no where to go - then you can utilize one of the 3 stools at their small counter or one of the two tiny tables in the entry area.  The Hubs & I stopped by intending to dine in but upon seeing how small it was decided to take it home.  We shared an order of Beer Nuggets and the Tandoori Chicken Paratha sandwich.  The sandwich comes already split in two so it made sharing easy and was enough to share especially with the addition of the Beer Nuggets.    The sandwich was well-seasoned & quite tasty, spicy but not much heat.  The Beer Nuggets could have used some sort of seasoning in the dough as they seemed rather bland but the marinara sauce it came with for dipping was quite good and made up for it in the flavor department.  Our order was ready in 10 minutes.  They have quite a variety of sandwiches, burgers and 11 or 12 different wing sauces so if we're ever in the area again and wanting take out I'd definitely try some more of their offerings.

One visit to Sams and you're going to be hooked! Great tasting and plentiful servings will make you not want to go anywhere else! Sams and staff are very excited to serve you one of their awesome fresh cooked dishes and they are very humble and ready to spark up a conversation with you about anything! If you like a special touch on anything just ask and you'll be served!  Great place to share about with others!

Amazing tacos special on fridays!!! My husband got the chilli burger and he said was awesome too. What I really love about this place is that it is family owned and run and they are one of the nicest people who I have met that run a food biz.

Having a party this weekend and calling for catering :-)

This small hole in a wall kind of place is in a strip mall near my house.  Sam, the owner is a really nice guy who would always remember your name and possibly previous order(s) too. 
My husband is a vegetarian so we have tried mostly all vegetarian items here- My favorite would be the pao bhaji and for the fish tacos. For everything else that I tried I always find something missing- that would be the freshness. For example- the paneer tikka roll is served in a frozen parantha and that kind of changes the texture and taste of the whole tikka roll for me(chicken or paneer is actually good, it's just the bread I never liked). Apart from that I recently tried the giant cheese pizza slice, it was okay, nothing spectacular.

First time customer for lunch today.  Anticipate this being my go-to place for lunch.  Today's lunch was Italian Beef and Fries.  VERY good!  Beef was tender and juicy.  The fries are wonderful.  Had a great conversation with the guys while I was there.  Its obvious they are very proud of their homemade food.

Can't wait to try the burgers, pizza, ribs, and Tandoor Chicke Parathas...mmm.  Wish I was hungry to I could try more stuff today but now I'm stuffed.

Sam's...it's time for your review update!

Three months into our relationship and my family continues to work our way through their ever-changing menu. Lemme give you a few highlights...

Tandoori Chicken. On a pita. On a pizza. In a taco shell...no, not just any taco shell. It's like the best chalupa shell you've ever had but sooo much better. I'll be honest here. The words 'tandoori chicken' scared me at first. I'm picky. I don't like new things. Except that's all a lie because every time I try something new at Sam's, I like it. Basically, tandoori chicken is well-seasoned chicken breast chunks. It's a little spicy. It's not "burn-your-face-off-spicy", but rather, "I-like-my-taste-buds-to-get-a-workout-spicy". The chicken breast chunks are fabulous and fresh!  They serve it with a homemade sauce that I've tasted. It's good, but I am not a huge fan of dairy, so I get that on the side. The seasoning is not like something that I've ever had before...and that's a good thing. It makes the chicken a bright orange color. I thought it was weird until I tasted it. Now, it's one of my new favorite foods. 

Speaking of favorite foods, have you tried paratha?  I did a couple weeks ago for the first time (under duress) and now I can't get enough!  This is a homemade gluten-free bread, like a flatbread made with wheat flour. I loved it plain!!!  I even liked it with sour cream and, as I mentioned, I'm not a dairy fan.  Filled with tandoori chicken, it's waaaay too filling, but flavorful. I really like the flavors in the onion paratha best (so far).  Again, another thing that I never would have tried back in the day, but Sam, Rachel, Nick and the whole crew have yet to steer me wrong.

BBQ Saturday. It's a great day to eat at Sam's!  Try the ribs with the homemade sauce. Talk about finger lickin' good!!!  I still have the BBQ beef sandwich on my list of things to try. Maybe next weekend?

We've fallen head over heals for their hand packed burgers, the Bari Italian beef sandwiches and their gyros fresh off the spit. The fried taco is sooo bad, yet sooo good in all the right ways!  And when given a choice between their fresh cut fries and their beer nuggets (made from fresh pizza dough), we don't usually choose and we eat both. Shhh, don't tell.

So they've added another table and a few more chairs which is good especially for the regulars. I'm a proud regular. Us regulars like to stand around and chat like we're at Cheers...without the beer...and the bartenders...and we like to share our opinions on our favorite foods with the newbies who've wandered in. Don't worry, they won't be newbies for long. Thus, the reason for more seating. Almost every time that I stop in, I see someone I've seen there before and I usually meet someone new who wants to try what Sam's has to offer. I genuinely love coming in here! Don't get me wrong...it's really nothing to look at when it comes to decor. I know that I come back time and again for the tasty food, the great company and the exceptional service. It's a true hometown eatery that's growing every day. I wouldn't be surprised if they expanded to offer a comfortable dine-in experience for their growing number of clientele one of these days. 

Stop in and try something new. You'll be glad you did.

Read some reviews on Yelp and decided to give it a try. I ordered a fish taco and my girlfriend had a slice of pizza. The pizza was average but the fish taco was very good. I have a healthy appetite and the fish taco was enough to satisfy (along with a few delicious fries).  Will be back to further explore the menu!

Update-

I am in love with their food.  Everything I have tried is amazing!  Please support local business and try this place.  You will not be disappointed. 


Great food, good prices, super friendly staff.  

I had the burger and I really enjoyed it.  My husband had the really hot wings (he is a true spicy foods lover) and he was able to finish the 6 wings. The employee told him that they do challenges on Fridays for the wings. I have a feeling my husband will be going to one very soon.  

The only negative- just like the other reviewer said, they also forgot our chili. :(.

This place is terrific. He needs to open a chain. There's a very friendly family running it. The tandoori pizza is GREAT. I wish they still did deliveries. I heard they started doing it on weekends.

Nobody in the area can hold a candle to these guys.

It's been a while since I've been able to come in again, but I finally got a chance last night.  As always, Sam was happy to see me!  Noticed a few new things since the New Year.  Sam put up an abbreviated menu of some of his more popular Indian dishes (he's always made them, just never advertised them).

I got my regular Royal Burger with Jalapeno added (you gotta try this--it's amazing!).  As always, it was delicious.  I also noticed that he had a 2pc chicken tandoori paratha on his new Indian menu.  I figured what the hell, and went ahead and ordered it.  I've never had paratha before, but this was INCREDIBLE.  

Sam was very excited to describe it to me, and from what I gathered, it's essentially a pita that is cooked with egg batter.  It made it very flaky and flavorful--honestly similar to an egg-roll type of flavor and texture.  Mixed with the already amazing tandoori chicken, it was phenomenal.  

Keeping with tradition, the portion size was also very generous for the price.  

Sam also let me sample his new Hawaiian style spicy pineapple sauce.  I haven't decided what this is going to be best on, but I think it's my favorite sauce of his so far.

5/5 as always.  If you're not eating here yet, you're making a mistake!

I seen Sams a few months ago on yelp and after viewing the reviews I knew I had to come here. I finally made it in today and it definitely was all worth the hype. I had the fried taco which was out of this world, and my girlfriend had the jalapeo burger which was also excellent. Ruben one of the owners was very nice and during my visit made us a fried strawberry Twinkie which wow is all I have to say. This restaurant has a great selection at outstanding prices. Not to mention the owners Sam, Ruben, and the rest of the family are extremely hospitable, knowledgeable and are the definition of what customer service is all about. Will most definitely be back.

Sometimes you're in a greasy-bar-food kind of a mood, but you don't want fast food, and you don't want to actually GO to a bar!

Enter in Sam's Grill.

This is a little restaurant located in a little strip in Bartlett (close to Hanover Park).  It is a little difficult to find--especially in the dark--and it just says PIZZA on the roof of the building, not their actual name.  So be on the lookout!!

There are about five seats in this place TOTAL so take-out is probably best!

Anyway, the service here is PHENOMENAL.  I wish there were more stars I could give this place just based on the service and friendliness of the staff alone.  The food was just as good, but I love a place that has a friendly staff and appreciates your business.  You could just tell they were grateful to have the business from the moment we walked in.

OK, so here is what we originally ordered (to be split among three of us)
12 Hell Raiser Wings (for the husband)
Fries
Gyro Dinner
Italian Beef Sandwich
Loaded Cheese Fries
Cup of Chili

Now after we had ordered that, the nice man behind the counter, Nick, brought it to our attention that nobody has made it through 5 of those wings and offered us a taste to MAKE SURE that's what he wanted (after a burning throat and watering eyes, we determined that NOBODY would enjoy that).  So they made him a spicy buffalo sauce that wasn't even on the menu.  Talk about service!

But other than that, he was really sweet answering all of our questions and after they saw our burning mouths (yikes), a really sweet guy from the back brought out bread with cinnamon, sugar, and honey on it to calm our palates.  How sweet (literally!)

All of the food was really, really good, too.  There was nothing I was eating that I was thinking "I could use some _____" or "I wish it had _____".  It was all very, very good!!

My only complaint is that they forgot my chili :(  I didn't realize it until I got home, so I didn't want to go back.  But honestly, I am more upset about the fact that I missed out on trying some bomb-ass chili (and I know the chili will be amazing if my loaded fries are any indication!!).

So I can't wait to go back...and try the chili. :)

(NOTE: They don't have a menu online, but I uploaded pictures.  I recommend calling ahead since they make everything fresh.  There is also a menu on Facebook on their company page)

Sam's Grill & Pizza is a hole-in-the-wall place in Bartlett that sells bar food. Really good bar food.

I took a lunch group from work over there to try it out. The menu is written in chalk on a giant chalkboard, ordered by a giant grid that's about 10 cells tall by 5 cells wide. It's not the most readable menu out there, so I scanned the paper menu instead.

I ended up getting a Gyro Burger with fries and a drink. I loved the fries... freshly deep fried russets with a good coating of salt. Not greasy at all! The burger itself was excellent. It consisted of a soft bun around a beef patty, shaved lamb (!), lightly grilled onion, tomato and tzatziki sauce. I liked every bit of it.

Really, what tips this from 4.5 stars to 5 is Sam, who clearly has a passion for good food, chatting up the customers, and chicken wings served with ghost chili-enhanced hot sauce. (He kindly provided a sample: Yowsa-hot, but very good. Same deal with the mango habaero!)

So the next time I'm here, I'll be getting the wings. Consider ordering in advance, since everything is made fresh, and we ended up standing around for 30 minutes while everyone's food finished. But trust me; it's worth the wait.

I recommend the Chicken Tandoori... EVERYTHING!  The pita, the prarthana, and yes even the chicken tandoori pizza.  Sams teases with some of the spices and flavors of India on the foundation of the All American Diner.  The combination is WIN!  

I think the name "Sam's Grill" is a misnomer that evokes the standard hot dogs, burgers and gyros.  Though I would pass by it daily, I had not gone into this place for years thinking it was just another dog & burger joint.  Chicagoland is nothing if not overwhelmed by tons of top notch dog & burger joints already.  

I was astonished to find something so unique and unsuspecting hidden in such a inconspicuous location.  After all, it is small and in an off the beaten path strip mall.  It's really for pickup & take out as the front doesn't lend itself to sit down dining.  Although he does have a couple chairs and a stool perched against the wall that is carpet bombed by local merchants business cards and flyers.

The owner and son are very friendly, conversant, and seem to truly appreciate my business.  Though I wouldn't engage much idle chat during lunch rush.  They do have a steady business to run and the staff is small.

The fusion of flavors I found in this place sets this guy apart from everyone else.  Sam's Grill delivers on an unusual blend of oddly addictive Indian flavors and spices with traditional American and Greek foods.

I was stunned at how good my first chicken tandoori pita was and it keeps me coming back for more.  I've now taken it on as a personal challenge to go down the list of Indian fusion creations Sam's has to offer and look forward to more creations.  This flavor is unique, weird, delicious, addictive and something I can't even describe.

I would recommend this to anyone that may think they do not like Indian food due to a bad experience with something a little "too authentic."  Or perhaps to someone that has an interest and wants to try new Indian flavors but might be intimidated or confused by a completely alien menu at an authentic Indian restaurant that may be a bit much. 
 
I wish for nothing but big success to these guys and hope they expand to another couple more locations soon.

Got to get a quick complaint out of the way.  I ordered well ahead of time and was told that it would be 25 minutes.  I get to the place 32.7 minutes later and was told just "5" more minutes before your order is ready...Sure... I ended up waiting another 15 minutes in the shop as the main guy dillywag with his friend.

No apology, no nothing...that kind of irked me, since it was apparent how much bs his estimate of time was.

Anyways, I ordered the chicken tandoori pizza and wings (buffalo/lemon pepper).

Was not that impressed by the pizza.  Indeed, the crust was...fantastic...not sure how to describe it other than pita-ish.  However, the toppings and sauce was meh.  Confuzzle as to why other yelpers raved madly regarding the pizza when it was...alright.

The wings definitely had an awesome crispy texture, but there is a BUT.  Buffalo sauce was leaning too far on the sour side to the point where I would describe that even BDUBs sauce is better.

Lemon Pepper version though was perfect, so I would recommend the wings definitely, albeit, with a different sauce/seasoning other than buffalo.

I am a foodie...I rarely write reviews but this place deserves one!!!
I went for lunch today after reading many reviews about this place...they exceeded my expectations...in both service and taste.
This is a family owned business...Owners are so friendly and after talking with them for few minutes...I can tell they are very passionate about their food and quality..

1) Friench fries with their secret sauce - they are so crispy and goes good with the sauce....these fries are best in town..not exaggerating...
2) Lemon Pepper wings - wowwwwwwwwww...no words to explain and their garlic sauce along with it...never tasted so good anywhere else till now.
3) Tandoor panner on pita - awesome ..paneer is so fresh, tasty and done with right mix of spices.

cant wait to try everything on menu!!!!

My only advice to owners...please patent all your secret sauces :)

Nowadays it's very  hard to find a family own business that  truly knows the meaning of great customer service! The place is very small, but it's kept clean and honestly most of the time I get my food to go.  Now,  about their food... It always tastes fresh, it's delicious and I never been disappointed.  If you can call ahead to place your order you won't have to wait as long for it. Remember they make it fresh, so it takes time.  I love their BBQ sauce, it needs to be sold by the gallons.  Anyways,  we have  tried other places around the area, but always go back to Sam's.
Just had a burger & fries it was amazing! My first time there and would definitely go back . The owner Sam and his staff were great .

Just WOW! I would never thought such great tasteful food could come from a little hidden place like this. 

I had the Buffalo Chicken Pita. Let me just say AMAZING!!! every bite was like the first bite it was that amazing. I cant wait to try more stuff from their menu

So.... I dont get to write many reviews but Sams requires it . 

First off Sam is a rockstar, makes you really feel like he is making the food for love not for money. 

ok lets start

1.) I had there hottest wings ( forgot the name) I eat spicy but those kicked me in the a$$... but not just heat great taste. 

2.) Pau Bhaji & Pau Bhaji Pizza.. I have been to mumbai 4 times in 2 years and Pav Bhaji might be one of my top 3 street foods, and Sams makes it like Bombay, plus at only 6 dollars a plate. I highly recommend it

3.) Tandoori Chicken Pita or Pizza ... Nothing to say here as a restaurant fanatic I have had Tandoori chicken at every restaurant in 30 miles probably and frankly the 15 dollar plates cant touch his 6 dollar pita , perfectly marinated and just tasty. 

4.) Paneer Roll.... First off this is not paneer you get anywhere you cant buy it , this is proper indian paneer dense and just amazing, I got it spicy and it had just the right amount of burn. 

Sam laughs that he has met half my family cause they have all come in with my recommendation, and not one has told me I was wrong. Our family chef has said his Pav Bhaji is the best she has had outside of Bombay ! 


Thank god for this place.

This place a is gem.  It's should be on one of those "hole one the wall" food shows.  Went there tonight for the first time to try something different.  Different is what we got.  Tandoori chicken pizza!!! Who comes up with this.  It was awesome.  The whole family loves it.  It's got to be the only place you can get a hot dog, burger, and Indian food.  I think we found our new pizza joint.
nice little gem! fresh, perfectly cooked. gotta try the homemade ice cream or the chicken tandoori items...found this place with my wife and we love it

Ordered a chicken tandoori pizza five minutes before closing time.  Thought it would be rushed and probably come out tasting bad, whoa was I wrong!!  We decided to try the pizza due to all the positive reviews and we were not disappointed!!  First impression was that this place was stoner heaven, I mean truly the variety of munchies was spectacular.  I honestly didn't expect the pizza to be that good but it was amazing.  The only sad part is that they didn't deliver.

Ordered the Tandoor Chicken Pizza, lemon pepper chicken wings, and chicken nuggets. While we waited Sam brought us potatoes swirl on a stick, French fries & BBQ Sauce, and some marinated chicken. Everything was excellent and very friendly. We will be back

Just tried Sam's on a recommendation. Really good!  Tandoori chicken pita was amazing. Like something you would get in downtown Chicago. This little place really has it going on!  Friendly owners too.

recent order on 2/10. The garlic parmesan chicken wings were perfect. Excellent Tandoori Chicken Pita, Excellent Gyro, perfectly made. I also want to note that I have driven to Barrington Road ( Port's) for a chopped salad and paid $7.99. At Sam's Grill I received a good portion with excellent quality for a far more reasonable price. Its nice to know there is a great eatery so nearby downtown Bartlett.

Sam is the best cook on the planet!!!!!! The Gyro Burger is the greatest thing out there!! Now here's where it gets crazy, I went in there and ordered the Chopped Salad. BEST SALAD EVER!!! Whatever you eat there it is the best!!! 5 STARS!!! Give it a try :) !!!!!

Having seen a number of Yelp reviews with outstanding feedback of Sam's Grill & Pizza, I decided to take the risk and make the journey out from my office to Bartlett to pick up some food here on my lunch break. In looking over their options, I saw they had a Chicago style hot dog and knew I had to give this place a try. They have a fairly diverse menu with lots of different kinds of burgers, hot dogs, alongside pizza, wings and other common to these kinds of establishment menu items like Gyros and Italian beef sandwiches. 

Sam's is located in a small heavily deserted strip mall off of Prospect avenue in Bartlett. When you walk in there's a long counter, a cooler with various types of beverages to your right. And a big menu board on the wall to your left. There's a few tables and a counter if you were to eat in the restaurant itself. A while after stopping in (more on this later) I was ready to leave with the food ordered for myself and my co-workers.

On to the review of the food itself. The hot dog I received came on a Chicago-style poppy seed bun. The bun didn't seem to be steamed, but was soft and showed no signs of dryness. There was a thinly sliced pickle on top of the dog, this pickle slice was a bit more sour than I would like, but certainly didn't taint the flavor of the hot dog. There were two long sport peppers perfectly placed on top so that sport pepper could be had in every bite. The peppers were a good balance of being not too hot and providing the right amount of flavor. The tomato on this hot dog was a bit of a downer, it was slightly soggy and didn't cover the entire length of the hot dog. The big problem with this hot dog was the relish, it wasn't the brand, it was the amount. There was around 2 dogs worth of relish on this hot dog. As a result the relish flavor was the dominant taste here. It overpowered both the mustard and what onion was on the hot dog. As for the sausage itself, it was a skinless dog, it was properly steamed and prepared. There was some celery salt on the dog, but its flavor was again, overpowered by the excessive relish. Overall, this wasn't a bad hot dog, but it was definitely a bit unbalanced.

The final subject to note on Sam's is the time it took for the order to be ready, Between myself and my co-workers there were two burgers, a hot dog, and fries for the two burgers that needed to be made. This took around a half hour from when I placed the phone call to when the food was ready a ways after I arrived. Overall I liked the food and might be back, but for the investment of time it took for my food to be ready I wouldn't say this is quite a five star establishment. I give Sam's Grill & Pizza four stars. My opinion on this establishment can best be summed up in the following rhyme.

Good, but not great and be prepared to wait.

For the past 6 months, I couldn't bring myself to order anything from here--despite living across the street. Mostly because there wasn't a lot of curb appeal.

Last week, I finally ordered a pepperoni pizza and was pleasantly surprised. Im excited to order something else again (and maybe this will go up to 5 stars). 

Note: I liked this pizza more than the local, more famous V&V. just sayin'!!!

Great selection, super good food, especially the sauces.  The Hawaiian pizza was fantastic.  Best of all was the service.  Sam came out, introduced himself with a smile, and offered us a few samples while we waited.  Can't wait to come back and try other things.

Have been back three times since my first visit.  I've tried the ribs, the wings, and three different kinds of hot dogs.  I remain impressed.  Each was wonderful, worth getting again and delicious.  Highly recommend anything with bacon on it.  My all-time favorite is the Jersey dog.  I've never had a better hot dog in my life and suspect I never will.

I love Sam's place.  It's a gem.

We live right behind sams, they have great food. My fav is there loaded fries and Buffalo pita. My boyfriend  loves there gyros. Really fast and food is always consistently great. And their staff is really nice as well. NEEDS TO STAY OPEN LATE FOR THE BAR DOWN THE  WAY!!!!!!!

I love this place! For sure a hidden gem! The food is great, try the wings, they're huge and absolutely delicious. So many different sauces and haven't found one that I don't like yet. Chicken tandoori pita---soooo good! 
The staff is extremely friendly and seems like they truly appreciate your business, so refreshing!
Tip: call ahead for food, like others have said it does take a bit longer than your typical fast food place as they make more from 'scratch'. But it's totally worth it!!!!

After reading all the great reviews I finally made it. Its like a real Joint that is made for and by Foodies. Be prepared for a huge menu they will make any decisions incredibly hard. I had a Gyro and my wife the BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger but the highlight was the enormous loaded Fries. They start with some excellent double fried fresh cut fries and load on chili, bacon cheese Amazing! The Gyro was loaded and very good and my wife really enjoyed the burger. I can wait to eat my way through the rest of the menu. This place is a real gem in the chainstore overloaded suburban landscape.

Best way to describe an experience here: think of the best hole in the wall place you know in the city. How creative, how yummy, how the service is wonderful, times 10! Sam and his family who own and run it know good food! They are also some of the nicest friendliest people! Everything on the menu is amazing! Can't decide on what you might like? Ask! They will give you a great suggestion and make your tummy very happy!!!

Everything is good here but it's the giant $3  fried pita tacos that keep us coming back on a weekly basis. We call and order ahead since fresh food of this caliber takes a few minutes bu it's always worth the wait. Sam makes his own everything right down to the fries and BBQ sauce- no frozen garbage here. 

Sam and his son are so friendly and enthusiastic about creating unusual and delicious new foods. Ask for recommendations, you won't be steered wrong. Who knew tandoori chicken tastes great on pizza?

I had the Chili cheese dog it was so delicious! It had beans,cheese, chili and crispy bacon on top. I then tried the mango kulfi for desert and it was outstanding! It's like an ice cream but a little different but made with fresh mangos! The owners are very friendly and make everything completely homemade.

This food is absolutely delicious. Tried the Bacon and Bleu Burger and 6 BBQ Wings. Without question, the food was fresh. The difference in taste was apparent. Fresh food takes additional time - so be prepared to wait, but it is worth it. Next time I will call ahead. The owner is clearly passionate about his recipes and he even offered us a sample of the fries and sauces. HIGHLY Recommended.

We've been here twice, both times were very impressed.  Really good food.  The first visit we ordered the tandoori chicken pita and the fish taco, which was a special.  Both were well-cooked and delicious.  Good-sized portions, too.

Last night my wife ordered the tandoori chicken pita again, but asked for the components separate so she could make a salad.  They complied and she loved it.  

I ordered the gyro burger, and it was huge, and as good as any burger I could have made at home.  They use fresh beef in their burgers.  The fresh-cut fries were also great.  I'm looking forward to working my way through their menu.
Go for the ribs , best in town , try the fried taco or BBQ beef sandwich. Keep up the good work Sam

OMG, is all I have to say!! I have lived in Bartlett for 6 years and I just found this amazing family owned place. Let me just tell you that the owners are such amazingly nice people that I would make it a regular stop just for that. But, the food is out of this world, my wife had the bacon cheeseburger with the beernuggets and some fries, let me tell you that I have never seen her eat her food sooooo fast because it was soooo good. I had a Coney dog, even though it had beans and in my eyes a true Coney dog has no beans, but the sun stated it was a Jersey Coney not Detroit, the Coney was delicious. Then I had the tandoori chicken and it was out of this world. When you get it on a pita with lettuce, onions, tomatoes and their homemade sauce it rocks your taste buds to a new level. One more thing, their BBQ sauce was some of the best I have ever had, we were licking the cup for the last drop. Come from near to far and try out this epic family run restaurant!!!!!! Thank you Sam and family!!!

We literally just noticed this place earlier today (after moving into our new home blocks away over a year ago), stopped in to pick up a few menus, and then we came back in the evening to order.  I gotta say I agree with the other people -- the place doesn't have any curb appeal and looks rather beat down from the street.  Not exactly appetizing to look at, but we were desperate for a new food place near us and you can only eat so much TL's.  Anyway, glad we went in!!!!  First, Sam has got to be our new favorite person in the world.  Talk about personable. This guy is so animated and friendly; he's got to be the nicest person in the world.  No, I mean it.  Literally.  Secondly, for all his gushing about his food, he wasn't lying.  We played it safe by ordering a few burgers, wings and loaded fries since it was our first time here, but man was it delicious.  Sometimes a good burger just really hits the spot.  We are definitely excited to try all the other varied foods on the menu now, especially given what we just ate and all the other reviews on here. A+ on food, and A++++++ on service.  We finished our food 15 minutes ago, and I am on here writing a review (which you can check, I rarely do).  That's how much I wanted to take a minute and give this guy the praise he deserves.

I happen to live very close by to Sam's Pizza and grill.  I was offered a medium 1topping pizza for special $10 and also asked to add another extra topping which they gladly did and just charged for the extra topping and very kindly accepted my order.  Not like other places where they do not like to bend ways for the customer. 

The owners Sam and his wife a extremely great couple and are great people to talk to.  

They made my pizza fresh and only after the order. So do expect a little extra waiting time for your awesome pizza to get ready, it's worth the wait.  And when you have to wait for the food you know it's getting made fresh from scratch. 

I will definitely be going there again. It's a nice local joint for pizza.

I wanted to like this place. Read the reviews   Tried it for ourselves. The other 18 reviews must be relatives. Friendly guy behind counter. Pizza genetic tasting, salty and crust tough. Skip this place.

We went with another couple when we were in the area to go to the Arlington Million horse race. It was our first time here and we really liked the restaurant.

The food and service were very good, portions large, the prices reasonable for the quality of the food and included all the sides. It was nice to be at a place where the price on the menu is what you pay for a complete meal unlike many of the fancy steakhouse where they nickel and dime you for everything beyond the already expensive steak.

We will not hesitate to go back again when we are in the area.
