The type of attention to detail I've only experienced at restaurants like Gibsons, Capital Grill, etc.  It takes a lot to get an entire wait staff to buy into working together as a team, but they have it figured out here. 

There is so much "ethnic" Mexican like carnitas or there wide variety of Mexican aguas frescas  (fresh waters). I know these very well, my mother literally makes aguas frescas weekly for us and this makes you feel like your dining at mom's or grandma's.  Their Puerto Rican rice and beans is phenomenal,  their shrimp "al mojo de ajo" (garlic shrimp) are crazy good.  

Oh and as if it couldn't get better, it's BYOB which only guarantees the bill will be way lower than your normal dinner out with drinks.  The music is loud enough to "feel" as my 1 year old daughter who loves to dance was dancing away in her high chair but not loud enough where you have to scream.

The owner stopped by to ensure everything was good and stated they have only been open approximately 3 months.   I can't imagine how busy El Bistro Latino will be in 1 year. My guess:  very busy, very clean,  very attentive and very good!

Where do I begin? The atmosphere is amazing. The staff is friendly and welcoming. We felt as if we had been invited into someone's home with a beautiful ambiance and wonderful music. Now, onto what you really care about...the food!!! It was fabulous!!! We enjoyed their signature empanadas and Yuka dish to start with their own special twist and were blown away. Then we enjoyed steak tacos and steak quesadillas. We will most definitely be back to enjoy some of the best Latino food we have ever experienced. We would be back just for the food but combined with the most friendly staff, the ambiance, and the great prices, it is a WIN all the way around! Do yourself a favor and make this place your next visit.

As a Mexican/Puerto Rican I have to say this is unquestionably my favorite home town spot to eat Latino food. To start with, their staff is friendly and I basically see them as family. They know exactly what they're going to give you and can explain every menu item in depth. The taste is amazing, and not to mention a lunch buffet on weekdays! All you can eat Puerto Rican rice, Mexican and Cuban food! My friends and I come here at least once if not twice a week. And I didn't even mention the best part.. BYOB! This place deserves restaurant of the year in Des Plaines and from I can tell it's making great progress. My favorite dishes so far:
-jibarito dinner
-rib tips and chicken wings in homemade salsa with white rice and Puerto Rican beans
-salad bar nice and fresh, also their potato salad is amazing.

First time here and very impressed:

Jibaritos were monster in size, crisp and fresh off the grill! Ordered the beef and chicken jibaritos as entrees which come with Puerto Rican style beans and arroz con gandules and the Cubano sandwich to add.

The Cubano had a very clean flavor, definitely not game-y like some pork sandwiches can be. All sandwiches were thoroughly hot and made to perfection. This is the most important quality to any dish being served at the restaurant.

Best part of this place is its closer to home and not a drive to the city! Even this is better than the city joints that have been around.

Great service at pick-up, looking forward to dining in!
This place will be in business for a long long time.

OMG this place is AMAZING FOOD! We only had apps and were full!! Empanadas very good, yuca Frita yum!!, Lechon slow roasted Pork wow wow so good! 
Only one complaint chair uncomfortable but no way a deal breaking because the good was so good and so was the service!
Been there twice and both great experiences with the good. Jibaritos are so yummy! The rice and beans are also good. Keep up the good work!
Jibarito was best I had in a restaurant outside of my moms. Tacos were great and the staff were very friendly. Will definitely be back.
Try the lime and cucumber flavored water. As well as everything else. So delicious and the staff is so nice! ITS ALSO A BYOB HOW CAN YOU NOT LOVE THIS PLACE!

I never write reviews but I had to for this place. We went out for a date night and discovered El Bistro Latino not too far from home. We had the appetizer platter, a jibarito & a Cubano sandwich. All the food was delicious & the service was great! The owner stopped by our table and was so friendly! It is also BYOB so we got to enjoy our favorite beverages with our yummy meal. Definitely planning on going again!

Great food at a fair price. Buffet starts at 11am and gets mobbed after 12 so come early. Cuban sandwiches are huge and very good! Service can be a tad slow due to everything being cooked fresh. Met the  owner and she was really sweet and as nice as can be.
AMAZING Latin food! Jibaritos and Cubano sandwiches are huge and delicious!! Servers are all very friendly and helpful and its BYOB after 3:00PM! Excellent little spot in Des Plaines!

This is, by far, the best Latin restaurant I've been to in the time I've lived in the area. The place is neat and clean, the service is excellent and the food is beyond amazing! I had the BEST "Jibarito" I've ever had and the Puerto Rican rice is just like I remember it tasting back home in Puerto Rico. Will definitely come back and recommend it.

Tried this new restaurant and it was amazing. The food was GREAT. I had the steak tacos with Puerto Rican rice. The steak was flavorful and easy to chew. I didn't see one piece of fat in it---which is a huge thing for me. 

What's even better about this place was the customer service. Everyone in this restaurant was extremely friendly -- the waitress, the owners, even the customers. 

The only downside to this place was that they are a bit short staffed in the kitchen. Some things that I wanted to try were sold out, such as the empanadas.

I would definitely go back!

Loved the food, loved the service, and loved the owners! I am super excited about this new family-owned BYOB restaurant, not only because it's in my neighborhood, but because it's unique to Des Plaines and the neighboring cities. El Bistro Latino offers Mexican, Puerto Rican, Cuban, and Colombian food! If you've never tried some of these cuisines, you must visit here to experience the perfect bites! We tried the empanadas hecho a mano, yuca frita con ajo fresco (loved), tostones (loved), carnitas estilo Michoacan (loved), lechon, chicharrones en salsa verde (loved, loved, loved), costillas de puerco en salsa roja, chips and salsa (3 different types), the homemade cheesecake, and for beverages we had the aguas frescas de sandia (watermelon-loved ) and sampled the horchata(loved). Everything was delish!!! The service was very friendly, helpful, and attentive as were the owners. The owners were so welcoming; I felt like I was eating in their own kitchen. They let us sample some of the dishes which was so generous of them! The place itself is very clean, with interesting wall decor, and has an outdoor patio. There is also a lunch buffet. Overall, we had the greatest experience here. If you want unique delicious food served in a warm friendly environment with great Latin music in the background, you must give this place a try. Don't forget to BYOB!
The food was great, the owner was very helpful and friendly.  Our waitress was great. The coffee flan was so good. I would come back.. But it's far from Hawaii
Excellent wait staff and good food, but the "specials" were small portions and significantly out-priced the rest of the menu. Best to go when they have the buffet open.
So happy to have this place open up in our neighborhood. Food was delicious and I'm sure it will get better as they get more experienced.

Very nice! Our waitress was wonderful and everything came out perfect. We had empanadas, tostones, costillas en salsa,  and lechon. Costillas en salsa is definitely for those who can take some heat. Can't wait to go back!

Being that they mention Colombian food, I was expecting a few traditional Colombia entrees. I did not see any, so I settled on the Cuban sandwich, very delicious and equal to other top Cuban restaurants in Chicago. I hope in the future they will have some traditonal Colombian food such as Ajiaco, Asado Bogotano and Bandeja Paisa. Arepas would be a great addition to the apetizers. Would rate higher if they had more Colombian dishes. One thing to note that put me off was the fact that while trying to enjoy a conversation and meal with my Mom, one staff member insisted on vacuuming!!!

This is a great place if you want to come with a group of friends or with family when you're starving for some good Mexican food. The portions are huge for the prices and the service is impeccable. There are lots of tables and also an outdoor seating area. We got horchata, empanadas hecho a mano, tostones con ajo fresco, carnitas, y jibarito. The kitchen also sent out alas de pollo rostizado (chicken wings) for us to sample. Everything was tasty and exactly as the menu described and the waitress made sure everything we ordered was satisfactory. Oh by the way, they always make sure to replenish their delicious free chips and salsa as needed!
This place is amazing. Carnitas were so soft and juicy and their flavored waters were very tasty. Definitely give this place a try

These guys deserve a 2nd visit. Went in for a last minute lunch, and had the buffet. Friendly staff, tasty agua frescas (cucumber lime, and horchata), and really good cuban pork and rice. I loved the puerto rican beans. The tortilla chips were delish.  Next time I'll go for dinner.

I'm Cuban and my buddy is Puerto Rican, but we live in the burbs. We can easily find good Latino food in the city, but it's damn near impossible to find anything remotely good in the burbs. That is until we discovered this place. 

The food selection is phenomenal, presentation is great and the actual food & portions were a delight. Waitress brought out some sampler wings and fruit/vegetable drinks. The owner was even there walking around asking folks if they enjoyed the food. Given our Latino backgrounds, we began talking about the seasoning of the food and he asked us to try some food (i.e. Lechon) his father had cooked. It was AWESOME, despite the fact that we had eaten so much food. 

My buddy and I will certainly be back to try the rest of the food on the menu, as well as bring our wife's and kids to enjoy the phenomenal food and quaint environment. Did I mention it's a BYOB

WOW!!  This place is sooo good!  I had a carry out order for lunch today, I ordered the lechon jibarito.  It was the best jibarito I have ever had!  I have been to a lot of Puerto Rican joints and this is the best!  I am so glad there is a place close to home and I don't have to go to the hood to get some authentic food.  The lechon was so flavorful and most importantly it was moist and fresh, there is nothing worse then dry lechon!

How is there not a line out the door for this place?! Their lunch buffet is impressive but every time I walk in the door my heart/stomach tell me the same thing get the steak jibarito and the fried yuca! If you like jibaritos this is your place! They're 1.5-2X the size than the ones downtown (and also better than the ones down the road) at the same price! Their Yuca is unlike any other I've had deliciously crispy outside with soft mushy insides you can't go wrong!!!! Their tacos are big too! You'll be hard pressed to find a place that will beat this! Affordable, great staff, mind blowing Yuca, super friendly family owned business! I love it!

Why go to Miami when you can stop in Des Plaines and have one of the best Cubano's out there. The rice and black bean options are not only fantastic but they taste even better. The Horchata made me weep as its soooo yummy. Can't wait to try the skirt steak next. This is worth a stop. Very friendly, clean and just plain good.

This place has definitely outdone themselves. I've been here twice and I've not been dissapointed yet. I am of colombian descent and the food is on point. Flavors make me want to get up and salsa dance!  And you totally can since the music there is all tropical and all good! They have Mexican, Puerto rican, Cuban, and Colombian flavors here. I've tried everything on the amazing buffet menu. Less than $10 with drink included and what an amazing variety. Lechon, carne con chile, chicken fajita, 3 different types of rice and beans.  You must try the cilantro rice w/a touch of lemon. It's to die for. You will leave there wishing you could fit more into your tummy! Yuca fries are delicious, fresh and crispy! Empanadas are ...well like sitting at home in the kitchen with your abuelita making empanadas and eating them. They ARE that fresh and absolutely full of flavor. We ordered Cubano sandwich today to go. I will update review after tasting that. I have no doubt, it will blow my mind as all of the other items here have. The owners are kind. Genuinely kind good people who greet their guests and truly value their opinions.  They have their daughter as a waitress and she is just as kind and darling as they are. I wish them all the luck and prosperity in growing their business although no luck is needed. They are honest and kind people who are giving this community an opportunity to experience an authentic Latin flavor right here in Des plaines oh amd BYOB after 3pm! If you think my review is overdoing it, try em out yourselves. You'll see what I mean!

Let me just say how hard it's been to find good Latino food in the area, even with many Mexican restaurants all over! I've tried a few of them and had given up completely until I noticed this place looked to be a new business in the old building. The food is so good! I am so happy that the place is literally minutes from me on my way home from work so I can stop by on those days we're far too lazy to cook dinner ourselves. 

They're always so friendly and welcoming and I imagine I'll be eating my way through the menu and will be a repeat customer. Don't change a thing! Well, adding more spectacular food is always good. Thanks for bringing great food to the area! The other Latino restaurants are going to need to really up their game if they want to compete.

Went there today, looked at their menu and the owner told us a bit about the lunch buffet. We were sold. How can you beat a $10 lunch buffet with fountain drink?  Three different kinds of beans, three different kinds of rice, chicken done two ways, lechon, short ribs, salad, chips, salsa, potato salad, coleslaw, fresh fruit.....OMG. This place is dynamite.  So happy to have another great restaurant in the neighborhood.  The fact that it is family owned makes it even better.

Atmosphere is very festive, almost like similar restaurants you find in the city. Customer service is fast yet attentive. Chips and salsa are complimentary. Food portions are large and very filling. Gina, the owner, stopped by our table and was very nice as well as inquiring about our experience to attempt to improve their product; one member of our party had a slight bad experience with his meal but Gina went back and once the problem was discovered, she came back and made every effort to make up for the problem up to and including comping the meal.
This place is sooooo good absolutely love the food ...and it's byob I recommend it to anyone great service staff is so friendly
Delicious and fresh food! Everything we tried on the menu was so yummy.

We tried El Bistro Latino today and I've got to say it's awesome! I'd so love to see this restaurant location make a go of it and I think they have what it takes. There's not been a successful restaurant there in years, although a few have tried.

They serve four ethnic varieties: Colombian, Cuban, Mexican, and Puerto Rican. You can mix and match if you want by ordering singles. There's also appetizers, plates of food, and a buffet. Don't be surprised if your bill isn't very large. Your portions will be, however.

The service was exemplary, the place was immaculate, and nothing could have been better. I'm sure you'll be as pleased as I was!
One of the best meals we've had in a while. Slow cooked pork in a variety of styles, crispy plantains, and savory beans were just a few of the highlights. Friendly and casual atmosphere.

Came here last weekend.. Food was super fresh and the server was polite and knowledgable. Good recommendations were made and even my picky wife was delighted. I will come here often and I am excited to have a good restaurant close to home.

Very friendly staff who care about your dining experience. Only the freshest fruits and vegetables in the buffet. The meats are roasted for hours so you can taste the flavors. The wings and hibiscus are hands down fav.

This place just open 8 weeks ago and as a first timer I have to say the food is outstanding. With the varieties of styles"Cuban,Colombian, Mexican" you will find a great and authentic flavor at very good price. Will come back very soon.

This place is BYOB! We tried the Jibarito and Cuban sandwiches. They were fantastic. They are still new so mistakes happen. When I was there apparently someone's sandwich was missed in a carry out order, but they more than made up for it.  The guy ended up walking out with two bags of food for one missed sandwich!  The owner was there and I was hoping he would come by and greet people as most manager/owners do but he did not acknowledge us. Also, the menu is a small. We asked for a dessert, but they did not have.  Even if it's coming soon... Don't announce it if you do not have.  Overall, I would recommend this place and fact it BYOB makes worth giving it a try. I will be back.

We've been here twice now and we like it! Not a typical Mexican restaurant. This family owned restaurant is about the unexpected. The Latino in the name means Mexican, Puerto Rican, Cuban. You can either order off the menu or from the buffet There are many different types of Rice and Beans to choose from. My husband and son had steak items and loved them.The restaurant is beautiful and has outdoor seating. It is BYOB and many customers had coolers with them. Prices are incredibly low.

Amazing food.  We had the lechon and Puerto Rican rice, jibarito and dinner.  Food is fresh, authentic and amazing flavor.  Atmosphere was fun and staff went out of their way to see that you were satisfied.  Definitely going back.  Love the variety!  This isn't your typical Mexican restaurant where everything tastes precooked.  You feel like your food was created just for you.
Yummy! Much needed infusion to the area, I loved my Lechon, the tostones were great, and the empanada excellent! So glad to see a restaurant with a ethnic flare coming to Des Plaines!
Talk about authentic Latino food from all over I loved this place. My new favorite place!

Back again and this time tried the Chile Relleno. WOW! I have no idea what was in the sauce but that was by far the best I have ever tasted. Everything else was just as excellent as always. What a treat to try so many different items and all so delicious. Thanks, again, for a great meal.
We arrived at 8:10 and the restaurant closes at 9pm. The hostess tells us curtly that the wait would be 40 minutes. In other words " we don't want to seat you it's too late". Very rude!

This new restaurant has delicious food!! The homemade family recipes are outstanding. The owner and servers are so kind, helpful and provide excellent service. A very warming atmosphere and dining experience! Highly recommend this restaurant for either lunch or BYOB at dinner! What a gem in Des Plaines!

Unbelievable!!! This place was amazing in all ways, very nice dcor, staff was SO friendly and helpful. The owner's daughter Odeila (sp?) was super sweet and very concerned as to if we were happy or not. Portions are huge, prices are just right, and the taste is outstanding. I had the jibarito dinner and I took half home, my boyfriend had the cubano sandwich dinner and same thing had to take half home. The chips are fresh and so good, their green salsa has an amazing taste. This is one of the most fresh and delicious Spanish meals I have had. Way better then the many places I've been to in the city. I'm very happy they are there and I hope that there service and food continues to be excellent!

It's great to see BYOB places open up in the burbs. Food is great and had a chance to speak to Owner and she was super nice as well. For sure pop in one night for dinner. They also have an outdoor area as well. You guys rock keep it up.

If I could give this place 10 stars I would.   We started with Yucca fries which were just wonderful - a treat, and empanadas - little bites of heaven.  Two of us had lechon dinners - lots of pork, the rice and beans were great. One of us had the jibarito dinner - one of the best jibaritos I ever had. Equal to El Boriquen.   The service was just wonderful.  I can not wait to go back and try others things on this menu. This is a must place to go.

Food is awesome!  The jabaritos are delicious, as was the tender skirt steak.  However, service was terrible.  We must have gotten the one waitress who didn't want to be there and didn't know how to do her job.  We had to ask multiple times for drinks--"oh, yeah" and she never made eye contact--talking to us as she walked away.  One of us had the short ribs and they were too spicy for him to eat, but she only checked in before we had tasted our food.  So, make sure you sit where you get a good waitress or switch seats.  But do go--the food is delicious!
Great authentic food! The restaurant was very nice and clean. Also our server Amanda was great with a lot of suggestions from the menu.

I ordered for carry-out tonight, and let me tell you that it will one of many, many times that I order from there. The lechon was awesome, and was perfectly seasoned. The rice was a little dry, but I am not complaining by any means. The young lady at the counter recommended the coleslaw, and that was pretty good as well. I also ordered maduros which were perfect! The sauce that comes with it was even better!!! I'm so glad this place is here!!!!! And I was glad to see it pretty busy tonight as well! I can't wait to try something new next time!
Great food, fantastic workers very attentive ...love the lechon $6.50 for a lb of delicious pork cooked to perfection.

We have eaten at this family-owned business twice and have received diligent service both times. The food is very good, and they are looking to expand their menu. They specialize in Puerto Rican, Cuban, and Mexican food and there are menu items to choose from from each of these countries. For example, last night I had lechon (Puerto Rican style pork) and my husband had Michoacan (Mexico) style pork. Sometimes a menu item is not available, especially the fish choices.  Prices extremely reasonable. Nice atmosphere with Cuban/Puerto Rican music playing in the background. They have a lunch buffet from 11-3 weekdays at which you can sample most of their menu items for $9.99.
This place was a complete surprise. Jibaritos was delicious. The Cuban sandwich was perfect. Service was friendly. Bar was clean. Great prices.
Amazing experience! We had Cuban and Jibaritos with steak! Food was delicious! Service was exceptional! Highly recommend! We will be back!

Yum Yum Yum!!! We were so excited to see doors open at this location that is so close to our home - and hoped it would be a good find.  That is an understatement - this food is incredible!  The family behind this all truly want people to enjoy their experience - and experience flavors from their family recipes.  They are all welcoming feedback to ensure they keep improving and they continue to add new items to the menu.  The Tacos are delicious - everything is incredibly fresh - and just an overall happy atmosphere!  We look forward to each meal we have here - and are excited to see lots of success for this newly opened delight!  Hurry up and come try it - you'll be so glad you did!

Wow, was this place good.  First, the service was outstanding.  Since this was our first time, the server made some recommendations.  We started with the Empanadas.  I don't know what is the flavor they use in there, but they were so good.  We also had Tostones.  These were also outstanding but could have used a little more garlic sauce.  
We knew we couldn't eat a big dish each, so we had decided to share.  I had in my mind that I wanted Lechon, but the server talked us into a garlic shrimp dish. To compensate for the missed out Lechon, we opted for a Lechon taco instead.  While the shrimp was outstanding, and I would recommend that, the Lechon is the best pork I have ever tasted.  It melted in our mouth.  Next time I will skip the shrimp and just opt for the Lechon.  
We asked for Puerto Rican rice, and the chef was nice enough to also give us Cuban rice to serve with the beans, too.  The Cuban rice/bean mixture was outstanding, and that will probably be my "go to" going forward instead of the Puerto Rican rice.  
The restaurant is BYOB, and we called again to see if it was strictly beer/wine (it's not), so we pre-made margaritas and brought those.  They were kind enough to provide us with margarita glasses and ice.  We did tip extra for the added effort of providing us with what we needed for our drinks.  
Des Plaines is lacking in good restaurants, and generally go to downtown Arlington Heights for Latin food.  Now that we have found this place, this probably will be our "go to" restaurant, as it's nice and close to home.  And the food is positively outstanding.
Stopped in for lunch. Had the buffet. It was amazing. Service was just as good. Strongly recommend trying this place.

I was looking for a Mexican restaurant in the area and this place showed up on Google. So I came to Yelp and saw all the great 5-star reviews. So, of course, we decided it was worth trying and went for dinner on a Friday evening. Well, the wait for our entrees was 45 minutes (we timed it, something we always do). The manager (owner?) kept apologizing, saying they had just opened four weeks prior and were a bit short-staffed. In fact, she told us that about a week before the wait for the food was as long as 1-1/2 hours! Was that supposed to make us feel good about having to wait only 45 minutes? Well, it didn't! They did make an effort to make up for that wait by giving us samples of all the specialty drinks and making sure our tortilla chip basket and the accompanying salsas were kept replenished. But who wants to fill up on chips (even warm, perfectly salted ones) when you've ordered steaks? Not us, that's for sure. So, our steaks finally came - and were way overcooked! They did offer to re-do them but by then we were very frustrated and didn't want to wait any longer. So we ate the overcooked steaks (one Puerto Rican and one Cuban style) and the sides that came with them. At that point we were pretty sure that all the five-star reviews on Yelp were given by friends and family of the owners because it sure wasn't anywhere near a five-star experience. In fact, we feel it was definitely no more than a one-star experience, if that. So why did I just give it five stars? Read on! 

My husband and I never judge a restaurant the first time there, especially when it's been open for such a short time. We always give a restaurant a second and then a third chance, and we're sure glad we did here, too. It was better the second time around (a week later) but we just ordered sandwiches, which came in 20 minutes; the sandwiches were fine and had I rated the restaurant at that time it would have been three stars. However, it was phenomenal the third time (a week after that). Our entrees came in exactly 13 minutes, my steak was perfectly cooked and my husband's Cubano sandwich was absolutely perfect. We asked about the guacamole and they brought us a good-sized sample - and it's the best I've had in years! The service was efficient and friendly despite the fact that it was very crowded, with at least two parties of eight or more people inside the restaurant and a  party of about 20 people seated on the patio. They very definitely earned the five-star rating I just gave them. We intend to return at least once a month and sincerely hope that they'll continue to earn those five stars but, if they don't, I'll let you know!

Just tried El Bistro Latino for the first time tonight. Des Plaines was in need of a great new restaurant. Well, here it is! Unique menu, amazing food, and awesome family-run service. The owner took the time to chat with my table, and even gave us a couple free samples. Try the Puerto Rican short ribs and the Colombian rice. It's BYOB, so bring some wine!

It's a great place, i have been there twice for lunch and their buffet is the best in the area by far.  They have lechon, puerto rican style rice and beans.  Good salad bar. and the buffet comes with a drink, which not many places include.  Great place, you won't be disappointed.

My new favorite local restaurant.  The tacos are great and reasonably priced.  I like that there are four types of rice to choose from, though the price is high for the small amount on your plate. The servers were attentive and the owners are great and personable people. Give them a try! Hours are limited, so check their website.

Excellent dinning experience.  The owner came to our table to welcome us to the restaurant.  Our server Alicia was vert attentive and pleasant.  Our food was excellent.  We had the Empanada's, Lechon, Tacos and Quesadilla's.  I had a watermelon aqua fresca which was very refreshing.  We will be going back again very soon.  They have a lunch buffet that we will be trying out.

Love this place!   Eat at the bar on a regular basis and get outstanding service every time.   We often split everything because the portions are massive and there is no attitude from the bartender.  

Usually packed with suits on weekdays and special celebrations on weekends and a decent bar crowd on a daily basis.

Make a meal out of the sides alone and you won't break the bank but dine with a friend and split the steak, you wont be disappointed,

I've been putting off writing this review. I think I'm still trying to defend this place in my mind, that it deserves more than 3 stars. But $143 dollars later, I've decided I can't give more than 3. For the price we paid, I wasn't blown away by the food and the service. 

We made a reservation for 7:30 on a Thursday night. Got there 10 mins early but werent seated until almost 7:45 which is fine and I would be more understanding if they were super busy but when we walked in, we saw a ton of empty tables. 

This place is ala carte so you are free to choose as much protein, entree, and sides as you like which can easily add up. I ordered the petit rib eye and my husband got the sea bass. They do warn you that the steak is served on a very hot plate and will continue cooking once served so that's something to keep in mind. The sea bass itself was nothing special but definitely tasted better with the citrus coconut sauce that it came with. The ribeye was flavorful and huge even though I got the petite one. Our server told us the sides are big enough for 2 people so we ordered the brussel sprouts to share. I was not impressed at all. I dont understand how it could be bad, it has bacon in it!!! But they were kinda soggy and the flavor was just weird. 

I would go out on a limb and say that the steak is comparable to what you would get at Longhorn but twice the cost. Our dining experience was good, but nothing to write home about. I would probably come back if I had a gift card or something.

Hands down the best steak I've ever eaten. Yes, I've been to Gibson's, Morton's, and St. Elmo's in Indy. 

What makes this place so great, is how accommodating they are. Went there for an anniversary, and the met every request I had for them. Service when you want it, and attentiveness when you need it. 

The steaks we had were cooked to perfection (as always on the 500 degree plates), sides large enough to feed a HUNGRY man, and the BEST sweet potato casserole. Unless you have tasted it, you can't begin to imagine the mouth-pleasure this dish provides. 

I've never left a steak on my plate in my entire life. Now, between the enormous sides and the fantastic steak, this was a feast that made you move the notches on your belt. 

Make this a place to go. You won't be sorry and will definitely go back.

My fianc and I came here because we received a $25 gift certificate. I know this is a chain restaurant as I have been to the one in St. Louis several years ago. I remember getting the cowboy ribeye and was so amazed by the powerful flavors of it piece by piece!

I kept telling my fianc I would take him to try as he is a avid steak lover. We have done to David Burke's and Prime & Provisions in the city recently and loved their steaks and flavors that we knew it was hard to top!

We ended up ordering the cowboy ribeye and splitting it and then getting the lobster mac & cheese. I felt this ribeye did not satisfy or reach the potential of flavors I was looking for compared to the last time I had it and felt the lobster mac and cheese lacked the cheese flavor. 

We have another $25 gift certificate to use that expires this weekend, but have decided to not.

Ordered their Filet and it came out on a sizzling hot plate and melted in my mouth. It was cooked perfect got it medium rare.  My only complaint was the wine I ordered seemed under poured but I just didn't realize it was a 6oz pour so then I got a Martini and that was very generously poured and strong. The server was very nice and inside it was nice dimly lit romantic.

When in Chicago, we have to grab a great steak dinner. They have so many great steakhouses to consider, but I have been loyal to Gibsons for years. The group we were meeting wanted to try something new in the burbs. I've have been to Ruth's Chris is a few cities, but it's been years. Unfortunately, they terribly disappointed me this trip. The "16oz" ribeye was so skinny and questionable at 16oz. The service was well below par for an empty restaurant 2 days before Christmas. I had an empty martini for over 15 minutes. I was ready to get into the holiday spirit and I was in no mood to wait. I don't care if I am downtown or in the burbs, my expectations is the service matches the price. 

The food:
Seabass-amazing, well cooked
"16oz" steak-cut poorly, so skinny. 
Cream Spanish-Good, nothing special
Lobster Mac and Cheese-best I have ever eaten. Unexpectedly light, not overwhelming with cheese. 

Overall, the food was mediocre and the service was below average for the price. That might not be a fair statement since I found a few outstanding dishes, but I was here for a great steak and they severely disappointed me. It's a steakhouse, screw up on the fish and you will have a good excuse. Screw up my steak and I will not be back.

Ruth's Chris - South Barrington, Il - 2/17/2016

I've been to many  restaurants in many cities but this is my first visit to a Ruth's Chris... I've been looking forward to this for quite some time. Beautifully decorated with white tablecloths thruout the dining room, this is my kind of place! From the service to the dcor, this place screams fine dining... Rich in history, the first Ruth's Chris steakhouse opened on Broad Street in New Orleans in 1965...  All these years later, they have perfected the art of preparing fine meals...

I'm a sucker for baked bread with whipped  butter and this one was baked to perfection. With its firm crust, light body and rich Flavour, this was the perfect way to start the meal...

For my first course, a white bean and chorizo soup prepared in a tomato base garnished with scallions... Delicious!

The aroma of steaks wafting  into the dining room overloaded my senses... Wow!

For my next course... The petite filet and lobster tail with a side of Cremini mushrooms; pan roasted with fresh thyme. First they start the primmest of beef, rub it with salt and pepper and then broil it in an oven at 1,800... Even the plate is served at 500 to ensure that the meals is warm from beginning to end. Who does this?! Each forkful was like an explosion as the flavour saturated every square inch of my mouth... The lobster, seasoned and grilled was also over-the-top...

One of the things I like about this restaurant along with everything that I like about this restaurant is the fact that they tell you how long each course is going to take before it comes out of the kitchen... Setting the expectation just ensures that you're going to have a completely wonderful dining experience...

Dessert..., the crme brle... Classic Creole custard topped with fresh berries accompanied by my signature cappuccino...

What an amazing experience. I will definitely be back and I highly recommend you come here also! It bears repeating... Wow!

My wife and I decided to celebrate our fifth anniversary here two weeks ago. It was extremely packed on a Saturday night with servers and bartenders running in every direction imaginable. We had a reservation for 7pm and I'm assuming that was the worst possible time we could have made our reservation due to the line of people awaiting to get sat in the front room of the restaurant. The vallet wasn't too friendly, but hey it was raining so I might've not been in the best mood myself. The hostesses at the front were busy as could be, trying to organize everything to get ready for their push of people. Jess, was very nice and wanted to make sure that she would get us seated immediately when a table opened up for us. When it came for our time to get sat, Jess walked us to our table and asked us how our night was going, if we were celebrating anything special, overall just a sweetheart. 

When seated, our server Dario approached us in a very friendly, warm-welcomed manner. He recommended a glass of wine for my wife (which she loved), and a nice cocktail for myself. After trying the fried calamari (which he also recommended), we decided to order entrees. We ended up doing the Ruth's Classics to be sure to try as much food as possible. Dario recommended we try the Augratin Potatoes along with the delicious Cremini Mushrooms. They were both delicious. When moving onto dessert we had once again asked for a recommendation and he pointed us towards the Creme Brulee, he brought us out quite the elegant array of desserts on a plate reading "Happy Anniversary" candle-lit and all. 

Everything was fantastic.. from the warm-welcomes beginning at the hostess stand, to our outstanding service I would highly recommend going to this location for any sort of celebration because they will definitely make you feel at home and welcomed.

The most delicious steak dinner I've had in a long time! I ordered the Ruths Classic, which is a great deal... starter, entree, side and desert. I had the filet mignon with a Parmesan crust. Yummmm. Cooked to perfection, exactly how I ordered. Our waiter was very knowledgeable, attentive, helpful and knew when to come back or just stay away for a while. Great service! Nice atmosphere. I don't ever go to "fancy" restaurants, so this was a nice treat. I'd definitely recommend and I'm sad that I don't have the funds to go all the time for that steak. I will dream of it! =P

My husband and I went for our 1st Anniversary celebration last night. It was amazing! Everyone greeted us saying "Happy Anniversary" and our server Anna was on top of everything!
I had the filet and lobster tail. Which was cooked prefect! Very tender and needed no extra seasonings at all. My husband had the cowboy steak, which he quickly devoured. Lol The big baked potato could feed two people! We had an amazing time. We will be back!
Great tasting food, but too expensive for the quality. You can get the same quality for 1/2 the price elsewhere.

O my god! just horrible!

I have only a few regrets in life, 

- My first wife ( - :
- Spending 1200 dollars on crappy Restoration Hardware table showing fading after 2 days
- Spending $300 bucks in this establishment for the worst Steak ever served by man!

I have been to many Steak houses over the years and I know good steaks. Perhaps I am old school but I don't use A1 sauce. In my book, a good Steak should be able to stand on its on flavor and declare to the world that its great..That said, I'm not going to waste your time even talking about the meat served to us and the lack of flavor. It was just terrible.The sides, not much better ) - :

I wish I could say nice things about the staff but I cant. For the most part, everyone was dry and behaved as if someone just shot their dog. The waitress was slow and not helpful. I still gave her a good tip in hopes she would smile at some point later that evening after we left. I will give credit to the ladies at the front desk and the valet service as they all seemed to be very nice.

Everyone remembers how great Ruth used to be years ago, perhaps downtown is still good? Don't waste your time and money on the Barrington location.

Have you ever gone to a restaurant and ordered a drink and wondered if there is any liquor in  the glass? Well you won't have that trouble at Ruth's Chris! They make some of the best (and strongest) drinks in the area.  I've eaten there quite a few times and always leave completely content. 
    Here's a tip... try their HAPPY HOUR specials in the bar area.  You can get some awesome sandwiches AND a specialty drink for around $20 ... and leave REALLY HAPPY.  The service is unparalleled and the food is WONDERFUL.

Our family changed it up this year and celebrated Thanksgiving here. There are only five of us, so this saved my mom a lot of stress from the usual week long prep. 

Dinner was excellent. My dad and I enjoyed the Thanksgiving dinner price fixe. It was $40. I got the Caesar salad, it was excellent, and he got the lobster bisque which he enjoyed. We both raved about the turkey and the gravy. I thought the gravy was amazing! He ordered the creamed spinach, I tried it and it's not my cup of tea, and I order the mashed potatoes. They were excellent, garlicky and so smooth. There was also stuffing and cranberry on the plate. Both were good. We got our pumpkin cheesecake desserts to go, I liked it very much two days later. 
My son also did the kids thanksgiving, he loved his turkey. We got him Mac n cheese as a side, that was a bust. It had jalapeo flavor. He hated it, and honestly, I didn't really like it either, I would ask to substitute fries next time. He loved the vanilla ice cream part of the dessert. 

My mom and husband ordered the other fixe. She the 11oz filet and thought it was delicious, he the 6oz filet and shrimp. There were three shrimp and the portion was small for him. He wished he would have gotten what she did because he enjoyed the meat so much. They both did the house salad and the same sides mentioned earlier. Their dessert was different: a turtle cheesecake with a cranberry bark. The bark was good and the cheesecake was okay. The pumpkin was more to my liking. 

We all liked the bread and butter, but tried not to overindulge on it. I had the moscato, very good if you like a sweet wine and my husband and dad got cocktails. They were appropriately stiff. 

The atmosphere was loud. Not very easy to talk to, but spirited with lots of families filling the dining room. Our server, Tiffany, was so pleasant. She was helpful and attentive. 

I enjoyed my time very much. It's an expensive substitute to home cooked Thanksgiving, but enjoyable at the same time. Next time I want to do happy hour in the bar. That's looks affordable and tasty.
Always excellent and delicious professional service courteous staff and ready to serve and provide top-notch service.

Very very pricey. Seriously, you cannot even comp a dessert for a birthday when I spent $385?!?!?!
Service was sub par. Only thing going for the evening was the seafood tower. Water service, I asked for a lemon wedge at least 4 times!

Cocktails are handsome and served promptly. Atmosphere is very upscale with an abundance of server's, back waiters, managers and others working the dining room. Bread was served warm and fresh (Turano). Server was eager and engaging, but not overly intrusive or in a hurry. Cesar salad was cold and crisp with the perfect amount of dressing. Food was served promptly and cooked to order. Everything was exquisite! Tremendous flavor from both the rib eye and the filet. My wife enjoyed her lobster tail...succulent! Creamed spinach was good, but required a little salt for our taste. The dessert trio (key lime cheese cake, raspberry sorbet and chocolate bark, was the right amount to share and enough sweet without being overly so...enjoyed with a piping hot, freshly made decaf. A lovely evening and plenty of food to take home! Pro-tip: ask for a booth!

We had the privilege of attending the debut of Ruth's Brunch today; only the second in the entire country.  Staff that treats you like family, fantastic food and great ambiance.  Our table ordered the lobster omelette, waffles,  pork belly, short ribs, and of course a filet.  We finished with bananas foster bread pudding.  Simply amazing.  We will return, often.

Let me start off by saying that I love Ruth's Chris steaks.  In fact, they are my favorite! 

If this was my first time having Ruth's Chris Steak at this location - I would not go back.   My husband and I have ate there dozen of times and it seems like they can never get the steak to sizzle!  The plate is not super hot (like its supposed to be) and the butter is not sizzling.  

So, if you want to try Ruth's Chris Steak - go downtown Chicago - this location can not get it right.
Got to admit i wasn't blown away. The steak was good, appetizers pleasant, and service was good but $480.00 for 3 people (and we ordered no wine) was WAY overpriced.
OMG!!! Best piece of filet in years fond perfectly.  Had a dude of mash potatoes and spinach.  Must go again soon

The waiter's assistant was sorta cocky reaching across the table, he couldn't wait for me to hand him the plate, sorta impatent, though he was super friendly and nice to the full table of MEN to the right of our booth ........... LOL

The food well that always taste's good to sum it up after 2 visits.
Atmosphere.......non existent
Decor........way to private and stuffy
What would you expect from a place with a sign that looks like a grade school child made it ...........I won't be back to the Olive Garden of steak houses.

Been to this location in South Barrington many times. This last visit on Christmas Day was no different than any other visit. We had reservations at 12:30 and were seated promptly after we arrived. I had the Ruth Classic filet and shrimp combo, it came with a salad and side of mashed potatoes. The steak was seared and grilled perfectly! For dessert I upgraded to the bread pudding which was enough for 3! Service was on point and what you'd expect at a high end steak house. What surprised me was that the server said that had reservations for more than 700 on Christmas Day! I guess no one cooks anymore!

Wonderful steakhouse with high class attentive staff. They treat you like family and have a phenomenal menu of delicious food that's sure to dazzle whoever is celebrating here. Otherwise an excellent date night or family treat. I recommend thinking of Ruth's Chris whenever the need arises to try something special.

The steaks are outstanding here! My personal opinion better than Gibson's. Tj the waiter is literally one of the best servers we've had. The steak with butter shallots sauce is amazing! It's a must try!

I will not be coming back to this restaurant again. 

Ambiance: We were seated in their special event room, which had the tackiest decor, and made us feel like we were at a cheap buffet instead of an upscale steakhouse. Our table was also in the main walkway for all the staff and patrons to walk through. Of our party of 4, 2 of us were being constantly knocked into every time someone passed us (every 2 minutes). 

Service: Decent service from the waiter, until we requested to change tables because we kept being hit by people walking by, then he cared less about us :/

Food: This is where I was truly disappointed, because we have been here before, and the food was memorable. We ordered the chicken, steak, lobster tail, lobster mac and cheese, crab cakes, creamed spinach, and potatoes au gratin. Chicken was flavorless and dry, steak was good except we ordered it medium well and it came medium, lobster tail was dry and overcooked, lobster mac and cheese was bizarre (it seemed to have canned Rotel green peppers or jalepenos and tasted more like bad velveeta queso dip instead of mac and cheese), crab cakes were mostly bread/filling and not enough crab, creamed spinach was a disturbing puree of green goo, and the potatoes au gratin were dry!!!!! Why!!!! :/ 

This was a birthday celebration, and it disappointed us. The food should have been outstanding instead of turning into a bad Yelp review. Save your $$ and go elsewhere.

My husband and I had reservations here for Valentine's Day weekend. Overall, it was an excellent meal but just an average experience. 

The good: helpful and knowledgable waitress, delicious steak and sides, yummy chocolate duo dessert. 

The bad: waiting area is FREEZING! We arrived a few minutes early and waited by the host stand. The door kept opening and blowing cold air in. The bar was just as cold! There were several young kids in the restaurant, but nothing too disruptive.  Many people were taking pictures during their meals, with flashes. That was more disruptive than the kids. After dinner, we noticed that every other table got a rose for the woman at the table- everyone but us. That was kind of a bummer. 

I'd return for the food, but wouldn't stay if I had to wait for a table. I'd probably pick another steak restaurant over this one.

first time dinning at ruth's chris, and man the steak was fantastic. one of the very few places that cooks their steak just right. I had the cowboy ribeye, a full 22oz steak with a side of mash potatoes. definitely coming back here again in the future.

Since this is a top end priced restaurant I will rate it as so.  I came for my second time, both on Chicago Restaurant Week.  This year they seem to have a focus on profit, and not quality.  For the low price of $44 a person you receive a small nearly tepid warm lobster bisque that makes you wish it was a full serving.  The steak, a filet in my case, was an end piece that was rolled together to resemble an actual filet.  This mangled mess that was presented would be fair for a steak worth $10, it did however come on a hot sizzling plate.  Wow, well I guess a hot plate is worth the up charge?  The dessert came, a little puck of chocolate that had no feeling of quality to it.  I would have been happy to pay $15 for the meal.  

Stop doing Restaurant Week since you have clearly given up on a real enticing menu for it.  I'm disappointed, the point is to gain customers by showing them what you can do.  Instead, I will not be back unless someone else fronts the bill.

Love everything about Ruth's Chris definitely one of my faves. Spectacular service and great food. Normally I'm not that person who orders chicken at a steakhouse but their stuffed chicken is to die for. We've been to the Chicago, Puerto Rico and South Barrington locations and they never let me down.

This place is weird and the food is very ordinary to bad.  Starting out right away I did not like several things.  Choice of napkin color?  Huh?  How am I supposed to answer that?  Choice of water?  Really?  Who cares? It was also a bit too dark inside, hard to read the menu.  The prices are astronomical.  My scalloped potatoes were hard and covered in so much cheese, it was so globby and hard in areas I choked on it at one point.  Just not a good dish.  I have had way better steaks at many places. The dessert, a chocolate torte or cake with graham cracker crust, was too sweet and a weird texture.  I had to squint to find any graham crackers, which was the main reason I ordered this.  Normally chocolate + grahams= good but not in this case.  
Service and drinks were excellent and stellar!  Great job there.  Although I didn't need the server to keep explaining where things were in the menu.  I can read! I have only been here twice now because I had gift cards and would never return.

We came here for my wife's 30th birthday, so it was a special celebration.

What I can tell you is that for me, this is one of those restaurants that is for special occasions only. The other high reviews are spot on. The ambience was classy and sophisticated. I was glad I wore a button up shirt and dress shoes and didn't go with anything too causal, as I would have felt out of place.

The service was personal, professional, and informative. Our server was confident and knowledgeable and it felt like he was being genuine and not just selling himself for a good tip.

The food was excellent. We both had the filet with shrimp combination and we agreed that this could be some of the best meat we've ever sampled. Even our sides (mushrooms and mashed potatoes) were well portioned and flavorful.

So why not 5 stars? Well, the price point of this restaurant makes it one I will not be able to visit very often. If I can come again and verify that another item on the menu is of the same quality, and the service is consistent and not just a lucky surprise, I would easily bump this up to a 5 star experience.

I just need to save up, and give Ruth's Chris another shot... hope it's sooner than later.
Perfect service, awesome aged steaks, amazing side dishes & have always had a great experience here.    Please keep doing what you do so well.

*Steakhouse Hop*

First time dining in Ruth's Chris some years back, I was really impressed. It was the first time I got that Ritz Carlton treatment at a restaurant. Everybody called me by my name and they ushered me to my table like I was the Queen of England. It was pretty cool. 

Service has always been the number one thing here and I always received stellar service. I visited this location the most because again it was close to my work at the time and we did tons of business dinners here. Christi was my go to gal and she was more than awesome in handling our private events here. She remembered me even after awhile and if I were to tell her I was coming in for a personal dinner, she with no fail would send a surprise treat. It was so nice and very memorable.

The steaks itself are definitely delicious in general but it is not my all time favorite. They serve the steak on this really hot plate with melted butter and they warn you profusely about how hot it is. You can see it sizzling literally. However, it gets cold like in a flash. It's the weirdest thing for me. How could it be?

I did like their panzanella salad and the calamari as well. They also offer a pre fixe menu with three courses that's pretty reasonable in price. You get tons of food as well. It's not a bad choice if you're dining on budget and would be happy eating a standard smaller cut. If you're aiming for the grand daddy porterhouse, then go the a la carte way. Oh, they also have good mints. Not sure why but I really love their mints. 

I took my parents, sister, and niece here the last time I dined here. It was such a great time. With the abundance of choices for steakhouse, Ruth's Chris is definitely one of the nicer ones with guaranteed good service. At least, my experience here had always been great and that's why I still come back here once in a great while.

After a couple visits to Ruth's Chris, I think I can give a nice little review about my experiences.  This is pretty much a special occasion restaurant seeing as everything is ala carte unless you opt for the Ruth's Classic Dinner starting at $43.95.  When it's just me for a girl's night out, I would splurge from time to time for this price, but for my family of three with all of their upgrades/substitutions, I think we will keep this to a special occasion spot.

Both visits were for dinner and the restaurant is dimly lit - very romantic actually.  The large booths are walled in so you are not listening to your neighbor's conversation...although we did smell their delicious menu options a few times on the most recent visit.  Everything is just very nice.  White linen napkins are on the table, but when you are seated, the host or hostess will immediately offer you a black napkin in the event you are wearing dark clothing to avoid the white lint.  It's a nice touch.  

There are many options on the menu to suit pretty much everyone I know.  We tried some of their calamari and it was tossed in a sweet & tangy sauce with roasted red peppers.  Of everything we tried, this was the least exciting dish to hit the table, but it was still good.  I've tried their chicken and tortellini soup as well as their corn chowder.  I love a good soup and both of these hit the spot.  The chowder boasted crispy bacon, fresh corn, chunk of potatoes (or maybe cauliflower, but I don't think so) and a wonderfully luscious base.  Their steaks are served on 500 degree plates...don't touch that!  About halfway through my steak, I usually flip it over on the plate to distribute the heat.  It's probably not doing anything, but I like to think it is.    We've had their mashed potatoes, the loaded baked potato and the lyonnaise potatoes.  I enjoy the sauted onions in the lyonnaise potatoes.  Plus dessert is always a winner!  Their chocolate cake is light and fluffy.  It's absolutely scrumptious!

Overall, for a chain steakhouse, it is very good.  The wait staff are trained very well and I truly don't have any complaints.

I have been to this restaurant multiple times over the past 5 years or so. I have to the say that the food here is always top notch and I have never had a complaint. I personally prefer the filet mignon and it is by far my favorite dish here. The staff are extremely polite and always answer any questions you have. Overall the food is amazing and the service superb. Highly recommend.

Awesome place for steak!  What's even better is that service was top notch.  Ginette was our server for the night and she was spot on with her service for our dinner.  She was super nice to us and very accommodating, even our 1 year old daughter liked her.

Our steaks were absolutely delicious, but what else would you expect from Ruth's Chris?  My wife's steak was over cooked and the Manager Chris fixed the problem for us immediately.  she had ordered a Medium and it came out Medium well to well done, yuck!  He actually bagged up the steak for us and sent us out a new steak, which was slightly under cooked this time, but better than being over cooked!

Probably the only downside to the dinner was that the sides weren't all that amazing, but they were still quite serviceable.  We ordered mashed potatoes, creamed spinach and mushrooms.  Nothing spectacular, but we were there for steak.

Overall, I was quite impressed with the service here at Ruth's Chris, and the steak I had was awesome.  This place is quite pricey for steaks, but you'd definitely be pleased after the meal is done.  Thanks again to Ginette and Corey for absolutely wonderful dinner service.

My husband and I just celebrated our 4th anniversary and we had the most wonderful dinner. We love this place so much that we incorporated celebrating our anniversaries at Ruth's Chris into our wedding vows!! Everything was on point. From our drinks to our dinner to the anniversary message written on our dessert plates. 

We each got the Ruth's classics and it's a great deal considering all that you get. My husband got the larger filet and I told him it would probably be an 8oz filet; wrong!! He was pleasantly surprised when we were told it was 11oz. I got the filet and lobster tail and the only problem with it was that there wasn't more! The sides were awesome and plentiful. I do wish that I had ordered my filet medium rare instead of medium but now I have something to look forward to next year.

Jovandi was our server and he was incredibly attentive without being overbearing. From the time he greeted us and told us Happy Anniversary to the very end of the meal, he was an amazing server. I can't write more positive things to say about this restaurant. I just wish that our anniversary could be monthly instead of yearly!

I was SO disappointed with my visit to this restaurant. Our server was awesome, however the food left a lot to be desired. The steak was overdone and not seasoned and the potatoes that came with it were also not seasoned. We told our waiter that we weren't very impressed with the food and he gave us a complimentary dessert of a little fruit sorbet and that was fine. The real problem here is that if I'm going to be paying that much money for a steak, it better be damn impressive! The whole meal, really, should surpass my expectations if the bill is going to be that high. I was hoping for much better things at this restaurant.

Wow. This is as good as it gets. Excellent service. Top notch. Food is amazing. Far surpasses as the rest.  We went for my parents 50th anniversary. The management customized our menu to mark the occasion.  They took our photo and put it in a card for my parents. They graciously served a small cake I brought it without any issues or uncharges.  It was a great meal. Food was served very hot and with lovely manners. This is a true special occasion restaurant.

I have mixed thoughts on this place. The taste of my filet was good, not great. The service was very good. And the price was too expensive. You can get a bigger and better steak that is cheaper at a lot of different places. I would go here again but it won't be my first choice

Excellent anniversary dinner at Ruth's Chris!

For our anniversary, I booked a table through Yelp/OpenTable and put in the notes that we were celebrating our anniversary. Sure enough, the hostess and our waitress (Ana) congratulated us on our anniversary. Very nice touch! We were seated in a quiet booth.

Service was excellent, Ana was very attentive and even made some good menu suggestions. Drinks (French martini and New-Fashioned) were excellent. My wife and I both ordered the petite filets (both perfectly cooked, mine with peppercorn sauce), au gratin potatoes (very good), and asparagus with hollandaise. Everything was perfectly cooked and hot.

We ordered the creme brulee, based on our waitress's suggestion, but also because it's one our favorite desserts. They surprised us with writing Happy Anniversary on the plate! 

All around a very nice experience and definitely something we will consider for our next anniversary or special occasion!

My fiance and I came in for our anniversary this past Sunday night around 6pm. We had never been to this location, but I definitely think it's my favorite. The decor was very nice and more modern than the other locations. Our server was friendly and acknowledged we were celebrating a special occasion. I got the Ruth's classics; I started with the steak house salad which was VERY good. My filet and shrimp was delicious as well. I got the special side as my side, which was fire roasted corn, but I hated it. It was more like a salsa and not at all what I expected. We also got the Lyonaise potatoes, which were good but not as good as Perry's or Joe's. My fiance enjoyed his filet as well. We upgraded the dessert that came with the classic for $4 to get the chocolate cake and it was awesome. I was surprised we were not offered a free dessert or that the fee was waived since it was a celebration because they usually do that, but oh well. We came because my fiance loves it here and we had a gift card, but I definitely think Ruth's Chris has dropped on my list of steak houses.

What better way to celebrate paying off debt than dining at an expensive restaurant?! 

My husband and I have been working SOOOOOO hard lately that we have spent very little time together. Earlier in the week he asked me "What are we doing Friday?? To which I decide that we are having a date night. We have barely seen each other and I have missed him.

While at work the day before, I asked the guys where I could take the hubby for dinner that he might enjoy? I know...the irony that the resident Yelper is asking others for advice. After talking with a group of guys with appetites similar to my husband's, I hopped on Yelp to see if I could make a quick reservation at RCSH which was one of their recommendations and wouldn't you know it...a few moments later, we had a dinner planned.

I honestly hadn't even looked at the menu and I don't like to read other people's reviews before I go so that I allow myself to form my own opinions so I really kinda went into our date night blind. We pulled in to the Arboretum. Damn, I know it's in here somewhere. You may need to drive around a bit but head toward the center of the Arboretum and find Mago...it's behind Mago facing 72. Being a Friday during Lent, we found parking pretty quickly right in front of LL Bean. A short walk and we made our way into this simple-looking building. Greeted by the valet holding the door for us and two lovely ladies at the hostess stand, we were seated immediately. 

I immediately loved the whole feel of Ruth's Chris! The lighting, the polite staff, the comfortable chairs, the WALL of wine, and the scent of beef filled the air. The hostess promptly mentioned that the white linen napkins can leave lint on dark clothing and offered us black napkins instead. Both wearing black and dark jeans (yes, you can wear jeans here), we gladly accepted the black napkins. Thank you RCSH for your thoughtfulness. Its these types of things that make me fall in love with a place. She mentioned Stacey would be our server and moments later, Stacey appeared at our table, smile in tact.

We breezed through the menu and quickly decided on their Ruth's Classic dinner. Although we chatted thoroughly with Stacey about their menu and cuts of meat, we still opted for their special dinner options because you were able to get a little of this and a little of that so we could mix it up and share. Starting at $42.95, you get to select a soup or salad, entree, side and a sample dessert of their coconut and pineapple bread pudding. I selected the chicken tortellini soup, 6 oz. filet with shrimp, mashed potatoes and the hubby chose the steakhouse salad with italian dressing, green beans with garlic and a 14 oz. ribeye.

First, I must say that the soup's temperature was not served to my liking but they quickly resolved this issue and brought me a much hotter soup. My hubby and I enjoyed their warm bread and butter and he really liked his salad. While it was simple, it was very good. We shared our sides that were both perfectly prepared. Green beans a little al dente and mashed potatoes nicely mashed. Almost as good as mine! Every bite was better than the last. Our steaks are served on 500 degree plates ensuring they are hot from start to finish. Seasonly with salt, pepper, parsley and butter. Simple, elegant, nothing more needed. I could have cut my filet with the side of my fork. I almost attempted it but then realized that I might burn my hand (more than I already did because yes, I touched the plated even after getting a lecture about the temperature of it and how we should be VERY CAREFUL NOT TO TOUCH THE PLATES!). 

I did ask Stacey right upfront when we sat down to space out the meal and she truly did an excellent job of doing just that. So thank you, Stacey!!
The meal was spaced out perfectly. We had plenty of time for each course. Stacey allowed us to sit and enjoy each bite.

I sipped on a Ginger snap lemon drop martini (I think I got that name right?) after dinner that packed a punch and was worth the 12 bucks. 

RC is not for money conscious. We kinda threw caution to this wind on this one but we came for an experience and they delivered. We will definitely be back!

Our server was amazing. She suggested the calamari which was different and very good. Had the petite filet.  The steak was amazing. I have yet to find anything better.  It is pricey but well worth it.

Happy hour is THE hour to be here!

The ahi tuna is the best! The chicken is amazing!
The coffee is yummy for my tummy! 

Ribeye is my favorite, but again the chicken is to die for. 

I can't lie I've been to many Ruth's Chris and normally the food and service is great..
But at this one, just the food was on tonight.
Ordered the ribeye, and it was fantastic with the parmesian crust. It is pretty pricey so expect to pay around $50 for a modestly sized meal. Sides are Ala carte too. Food was really good though.

Gina was our server and was full of knowledge! Her suggestions made the meal!! Ambiance was perfect, soft and classy. The booth we sat in was personal and romantic. Amazingly cooked fillets, exactly the way we ordered. Mashed potatoes flavorful and creamy! Brussels were slightly undercooked for our taste but flavor was good. Finished with a delightful white chocolate bead pudding and Irish coffee. Amazing meal with attentive staff. Will definitely be back!!

Very nearly 3 stars. Excellent service, delicious meal. My wife and I each had a version of Ruth's Classic. I had a 16oz steak which was cooked perfectly it was just so very thin. My wife had the filet w/ shrimp, her meal looked to be an exceptional value. A little on the noisy side for me but we had a wonderful meal and enjoyed ourselves. With tip our tab was just under $200.

To celebrate our new found addmissions into the homeowners club, my fiance and I decided it was time to go to Ruth's Chris. I mean after all the references in the rap songs we listened too...I had to be good right?

Tuesday night, we pull up and the parking lot is packed! We had reservations for 7pm. We were seated after 5-10 minutes of waiting. The staff was friendly and didnt seem stuck up.

Now to the most important part..the food. We had the following:

- 2 raspberry rosemary cosmo - delicious, i dont drink often but the alcohol flavor was masked extremely well

- stuffed mushrooms with crab - 4 pieces, big mushrooms, delicious
-fiance had the Ruth's classic - winter veg soup, mashed potatoes, and ribeye. The soup was demolished with a blink of an eye. The steak was cooked perfectly. The mashed potatoes were average.

-I had the 6 oz. sirloin with crab legs - this steak is on my list as one of the best steaks i've ever had. It was cooked perfectly, flavorful, juicy. The crab legs were seasoned well with the garlic butter. 

-side of au gratin potatoes - looks plain, but tasted better than the mashed potatoes
-chocolate lava cake w/ice cream - the worst part of the meal. the cake was too chocolatey and powdery.

I had a complete meal as my leftover. The waitress we had was extremely helpful in recommending things for us to try. I would go back for a special occasion, just cant justify the price. We spent about 170 with tax and tip.

Good serving staff and the manager's table touch saved the night.

I'd be giving 3 stars, however the serving staff who attended our table were adept, and as you'll read, the manager caught a Hail Mary pass.

First, the Cosmo, shaken at the table by the server was big and very good. Always a great start! After that there were a few problems and observations.

Suggestion to management: don't let kitchen staff transport armloads of six packs of beer and buckets of ice through your dining room during the dinner hour. In a pinch, a trip or two might be ok, but they came by our location with kitchen/bar chores so often that I half expected them to wheel out trash through the dining room. Running numerous back of house errands through the front of the house--at dinner hour no less--is something I have never seen at a fine dining restaurant.

The food:

My Ribeye ordered medium came well done. Great piece of meat, and I can eat a well done steak, if it's an nice a piece as the one they gave me, but it wasn't what I ordered. Not even close. Something like a $44 steak should at least be close to your order...IN A STEAK HOUSE.

Potatoes au gratin were somewhere between send-them-back undercooked, and just-eat-them. So we just ate them. Cheesy and for sure you could eat them, but obviously not quite done. Asparagus with bearnaise sauce: the sauce was perfect,  the asparagus was the skinny kind and too fibrous to eat at the last couple of inches. Either serve better or trim them better. 

The bone in filet was ordered medium rare and came out perfectly. That should be harder to cook than a ribeye given how thick it is, but they served a wonderful filet, cooked perfectly. Not an easy feat.

Chocolate explosion cake with ice cream is really a dessert for two...who knew, and it was very nicely presented and tasted good. Creme brule made my other half very happy. Coffee was good. Espresso came out tepid, not even close to hot.

So with all of the above, I was feeling mildly disappointed by this nearly $200 dining experience for two, and then the manager did his table touch. I really would have said nothing about my overcooked steak, but the manager really did seem sincerely interested in our experience. So I showed him the middle of my steak and he was very apologetic and insisted on giving me one properly cooked.

I had eaten 50% of this steak! And he still wanted to replace it which seemed unfair to me, as if I would be taking advantage. If you're sending back a steak, you don't eat half of it first. So the manager told me he'd be bringing me out a ribeye cooked correctly, and packed to go.

Wow. That really impressed me and definitely raised my satisfaction level on the overall experience. So, no 3 stars review here. Four stars earned.

We went here for my boyfriend's birthday. We had looked at the menu ahead of time and made reservations. We arrived right at the time of our reservation and seated right away. I was a little disappointed we had a table rather than a booth, but it wasn't a big deal. The atmosphere is modern, classy and intimate. Our waiter was very professional and introduced us to his assistant for the evening. When we opened the menus we both were surprised to see a birthday message for my boyfriend at the top! We both ordered martinis...The Raspberry Rosemary and the Ginger Coconut Lemon Drop. Both were very good! We ordered the crab stuffed mushrooms for an appetizer and really enjoyed those as well. For dinner my boyfriend did a ribeye, I did lobster tails and a filet and then we split the au gratin potatoes and asparagus. To me, this was a bit disappointing that the dinner did not come with sides and they had to be ordered separately. All the food was great and the side dishes were perfect portions for sharing. My boyfriend then got a free dessert since it was his birthday. He opted for the berries and cream. It was okay, but not a dessert I'd order again. The cream was like a pudding but not as thick. It was almost like a soup with berries. Overall, the service was a bit slow especially being that our waiter had an assistant. The food was great! It was very pricey but we knew this going there since we had looked into the menu ahead of time. Not a place I would frequent just because of the prices; however, a place that is nice for a special occasion.

You won't find a better steak. Great service. Nice atmosphere. When you really want to treat yourself to a fine meal, this is the place. You can rack up a high bill without much effort, though. Who care, you just got a promotion, right!

We went to Ruth's Chris last Saturday night-what a disappointment!  Lobster bisque was cold -very small portion and not that great.  Two people at the table had Chilean sea bass and both portions were extremely fishy-we could all smell it at the table.  Over all a very disappointing experience-we will never frequent this restaurant again-much better restaurants at a lower price point.

Almost everything about this place was overrated, except for two things... The service and the steak. 

The staff was amazing and catered to all our needs swiftly. The glasses were never void of water, and they even went out of their way for a bit extra. 

The Caesar salad was no different than any other place in the area, except for the price. It was about 3 times more. The same goes for the sides. We ordered the broccoli and potatoes au gratin, which were mediocre. The calamari was our appetizer and that was  just okay. Nothing out of the ordinary stood out.

My steak was one of the best I've ever had, however. I got the ribeye and it was perfect. The cut was damn near perfect and I doubt it could've been prepared any better.

Needless to say, I can think of a lot better ways to spend $450.00 on a meal for four.

Best steak I've ever had!  Sadly, due to the price tag we will not be visiting here often.  Since it was a super-special occasion (my father-in-law's retirement!) we decided to splurge & treat the inlaws to a really nice meal.

Do I think it was worth the hefty cost?  Yes and no.  The steaks are obviously quality and most are HUGE!  And as I said before, it was the best steak I've ever had.  But I don't know why most high-end steakhouses have all their sides ala carte.  If you are paying hefty sum for a huge chunk of grilled meat they can at least throw in a potato of some form.  Potato & a veggie would be better.

Okay, down to the nitty gritty:
-Steaks, cooked perfectly - so delicious they are only seasoned while cooking with salt & pepper & some parsley.  Oh, and it's served on a plate of melted butter.  Butter makes everything better!  Our table tried 3 different cuts: the Filet, the Ribeye & the Porterhouse for 2.  Wow!

-Sides - while the sides are just enough for 2 people to share, I still think the price is a bit steep, ranging from $8 - $10.50.  We ordered the sweet potato casserole (hubby said it was a bit dry), mashed potatoes, broccoli au gratin & the asparagus w/hollandaise.  We also tried the calamari as an appetizer.  I was worried it would be mushy since it is tempura fried but then tossed in an Asian-Chili sauce - surprisingly it was still perfectly crispy & delicious!

-Drinks - they have a huge selection of wines, of course.  We tried a Pinot Gris & a Malbec, both excellent.  They didn't have much of a selection of draft beers, however - leaving the men disappointed.

-Decor/Ambiance - gorgeous!  My mother-in-law and I were in love with each and every light fixture in this place.  I also liked how they had real candles around the restaurant.  They have those cozy, inset booths, too - which I love.  But I was glad we were seated by a table near a window as I know my inlaws would not have been able to read their menus in those darkened cozy booths.  AND it wasn't loud in here - just average noise level, but still able to hold a nice, polite conversation (we've been to other "fancy" steakhouses & the noise level is deafening).

-Reservations - My only gripe was we had a 7:15 reservation.  We arrived at 7:07 and were told it would just be a few minutes, no more than 15 minutes wait, for us to be seated.  Okay, I know we were a tiny bit early but perhaps they were packed already.  But no, they weren't!  When we were taken to our table 10 minutes after arriving we passed MANY empty tables for 4.  So I'm not sure what the delay was but we were seated close to our rez time so oh well.  

-Service - the rest of the service was outstanding!  The gentleman who would fill our water and bring bread to the table was very gracious.  Our server, Gina, was very friendly and informative.  The lady who brought our wine (and I wish I could remember her name) was a hoot!  So friendly and funny.
