I liked how everyone (aside from those at the front desk) were very down-to-Earth & fun, not pretentious at all.

-Last, but not least...we had declined coffee or dessert since we had a special dessert waiting for my father-in-law at home.  But, our server Gina surprised us and still brought out a lovely little dessert sampler with "Happy Retirement" written in chocolate sauce on the platter!  There were 3 little ramekins: vanilla bean ice cream, warm chocolate brownie & I believe a bread pudding, complete with a candle in it.  Just enough for us each to take a bite of each. :-)  It was the perfect way to cap off the evening.

Rarely do I ever go to a restaurant and think "I can't wait to go home and write a review".  But this was not a review I needed to "sit on".  I wanna shout it from the rooftops and I don't care who knows it!!!!

Alright, so first of all, service is top notch.  I made the reservation for two on Opentable.  Due to unforeseen circumstances, I had to call a mere twenty minutes before our 6:30 reservation time and see if they were able to accommodate two (little) guests at our supposed-to-be-romantic-dinner.  The woman who answered the phone was amazing and said it was no problem!!  Bless her heart, because my taste buds were set for steak!!  We might have been a little crazy, but rather than cancel our reservation, we took a HUGE gamble and took our six-year old and our three-year old to dinner with us.  And let me make this perfectly clear--Ruth's Chris could not have been more accommodating.  

After arriving and being seated (kids coloring booklets and menus provided!) we were greeted by our wonderful server, Nina.  I learned more about steak from her than I have ever known before.  She answered all of my stupid questions about different cuts of meat and suggested delicious cocktail pairings.  Nina talked to my kids like they were little people--so much so that my daughter turned to me at the end of the meal and said "Mommy, I wish she was part of our family". :)  Waitresses like Nina are few and far between nowadays!!

They had a whole huge craft beer list (which my beer-snob husband appreciated!) and I ordered the Raspberry Rosemary Cosmo and he got the Dragon's Milk.  Actually, he got two.  And my Cosmo was VERY strong with just the one, thankyouverymuch!

Now onto the food!!
Thanks to Nina's advice, we knew we didn't want a "marble cut" but rather, a filet.  So my husband and I ordered one steak among the two of us, and a bunch of sides and an appetizer.

**Stuffed Mushrooms: A-MA-ZING.  I love everything mushrooms.  My husband hates everything mushrooms.  But I was not going to pass up the opportunity to order my favorite appetizer in such a fancy schmancy place :)  So I did, and they did NOT disappoint.  My daughter has never really cared for stuffed mushrooms in the past, either, but even SHE ate them (and, ahem, dipped the bread into the garlic butter at the bottom...as did I...moving on).  The crab stuffing in there was amazing!!  I give it an A!

**Harvest Salad: My husband ordered this, and I snuck a couple of bites.  I *love* salad, and this one did not disappoint.  But c'mon now, you can't ever be mad at a salad with bacon on it, lezjustbehonest.

**Petite Filet:  In one word: In-freaking-credible.  It was the most tender and delicious cut of meat I have ever had and that I probably ever will have.  It was cooked perfectly, and they were nice enough to split it onto two separate plates because they knew my husband and I were splitting.  That was a really nice touch!  But one very important tidbit about this steak--no knives needed:
I
Could
Cut
It
With
A
Fork.

Nuff said.

**The sides were ordered were the broccoli au gratin and the loaded baked potato.  Both were really good, and complimented the steak really well!  I would definitely get both of them again!

**Chocolate Explosion: Of COURSE we had dessert...  We knew we would probably have to be rolled out of there, but it was WELL worth it!  I think this was one of the best cakes I have ever had in my life.  It was hot, delicious, and had just the right balance of chocolate to ice cream.  It was the perfect ending to an amazing evening!!

So all in all, this was a really amazing dining experience.  It's not somewhere you could go all the time, but I am already trying to figure out my next occasion to visit again.  

And I will definitely be requesting Nina--I've never had such amazing service!  She was there when we needed her (but never hovering) and we were never left waiting for anything--she was really on top of it all!  I am really impressed!

I will definitely be back again!

So this was my first time coming here, and I usually go to wildfire every day so we decided to switch it up, this was the best chain steak house I've been to, you definitely pay for what you get amazing service great drink list, fresh meats never frozen, and the lobster mac and cheese was to die for, and the rib eye was fabulous, I just wish i tempered my waiters name cause I would come back just for his world class service

BEST STEAK I HAVE EVER HAD!!!!!

Would recommend this restaurant if you want a great steak, but i would pass on the over priced side dishes they weren't anything special

This is the second time in as many months that I have taken a client here for dinner (last night).  We ordered of the special 'Chicago restaurant week' menu.  The lobster bisque that was "included" in the price was awful.  The serving was less than half the normal amount.  The lobster pieces were literally cold and the bisque itself was slightly less than lukewarm.
Once again, my steak was awful.  I ordered a ribeye pittsburg rare (charred outside, rare inside).  The outside was barely browned, far from charred.  The inside was indeed rare.  I realize a ribeye is marbled and I enjoy that about a ribeye.  This one was sinewy, ultra fatty, and not one cut of the knife yielded an edible piece of meat.
The dessert that was also 'included' was a round hockey puck of chocolate, clearly mass-produced like something you get on a cheap cruise line.

I didn't complain because I didn't want to make an issue of it in front of my client.
Upon leaving my wife said she guessed we wouldn't be returning to that RC again.
I said 'good guess.'

Yum. YUM. yum. 

One of the best steaks I have ever had... the simplicity of salt, pepper, parsley, and tons of butter is a must for an excellent steak.  My filet was cooked perfectly, as was my husbands New York Strip.  They literally melt in your mouth.  Mashed potatoes on the side were creamy and garlic-ly, the best way to have them.  And our calamari appetizer??  OMG we scarfed it down... sweet spicy sauce with added sauteed red peppers.  At first I was upset there wasn't anything to dip them in, but there was plenty of sauce on the pieces.  The calamari appetizer is definitely meant for 4 people, but we had no problem clearing off that plate.

Is it expensive?  Yes, but its worth it, especially for special occasions.  I know the hubs and I aren't going to make this a weekly visit.  It does annoy me, as others have said, that steakhouses make their sides ala carte and definitely at the hefty price, I mean $9.50 for potatoes is pretty steep.  I guess we just take it with a grain of salt cause we dine like this only two or three times a year and one side is big enough for 2 people.

Our server, John was really great.  Very informative and super friendly.  Not in your face 24/7, but always checking in to see how we were doing.  The room we were in was fantastic as well, very cozy and probably sat around 30-40 people.  Not insanely dark, but still had a romantic feel to it.  Also, not as noisy as Wildfire or Ditkas.  

Another great aspect to Ruth's Chris is the location. I love this mall, tons of eateries and cute shops, not to mention iPic.  If you want a great date night out, do a combo of Ruth Chris and iPic.

I was surprised at the volume of business this restaurant was doing on Christmas Day.  I wanted to splurge on a nice holiday dinner, and this place fit the bill exactly.  We sat at the bar; the ambiance was lively fun and, the food was excellent.  The wine list is extensive but there is value if you know your wines.  Bartenders were attentive but not overbearing or trying to rush you out.  Overall, a tad pricey but worth it.

I felt at home noticing the masterfully framed oil painting of Ruth proudly hung above the host station as we checked in for a table without a reservation on a midweek winter evening in the northwest burbs of Chicago.

We were promptly seated in an ample sized booth on the perimeter of the main dining room which afforded us the privacy for great conversation without distractions and attentive service.

The food and drink was A+ starting with a large plate of fried calamari with an incredible Thai chili-red pepper sauce.  We then shared a Ceasar salad before getting down to what we came for:  the "meat and potatoes".  Our filets (what else at R's C) were exactly as ordered, mine with grilled shrimp on top.  The seafood was a worthy companion my petite filet on the hot china.

The nice thing about Ruth's Chris is that you know exactly what you are in for and you get it every time:  an excellent meal in a classy atmosphere at about $75 a head.

I made reservations for 2/13/14 at 7:30 pm. I made them a few weeks in advance. We arrived on time but were told to take a seat. We were there for my boyfriends birthday and I really wanted to make it special. Four groups arrived after us and were seated before us. Finally at 8:05 my boyfriend asked the hostess why we hadn't been seated yet. She didn't apologize and just said we'd be seated next. Then she turned to another worker and started snickering. I tried not to think anything of it but honestly it was extremely unproffessional and off putting. 

We waited around another few minutes then left. We were hungry and now annoyed and the evening was close to ruined. I couldnt believe how rude they were and we wont be attempting to go back. This was the worst customer service ive evet experienced. 

Reservstions mean nothing. Staff is rude. Cant rate the food because we obviously didnt get to try anything.

This place is very good.

While my steak was cooked to perfection, I was paranoid that it would slide off the tiny plate and onto the floor/my lap. Still, my steak was excellent (ordered out the salt), and I liked all of the food I tried.  I wanted a little more variety on the appetizers.  The strawberry basil gimlet was kind of blah.  The feel of the dining room reminds me of a banquet hall more than a restaurant.

The service is very attentive.
Once again... Outstanding!! This time I ate in the bar area and it was excellent as usual!

Disappointed!  I consider Ruth Chris to be a solid and relatively consistent steak house.  Unfortunately this may not be the case with different branches. 

We started with calamari, seared tuna and stuffed mushrooms.  The calamari was great, seared tuna was pretty delicious, and stuffed mushrooms were decent.  The cocktails we had with dinner were pretty weak.  At $12 a pop, they really should put more alcohol in these.

The service was great and friendly throughout the whole dinner.  However, the steaks must've been sitting there a while as they were not sizzling.  Mine in particular was swimming in butter (a little butter glaze is great, but there should not be a pool on my plate).  The cut of meat was not very good, though I'd ordered a ribeye there were a lot of tendon and grisle material.  The sear was not good at all.  This is definitely not the steak I remembered last time I went to a Ruth Chris, though this was in Arizona.

My mother had the chilean bass and this was overly salted.  She couldn't much of it at all.  

The sides were worse than I remembered as well - the sauteed mushrooms were gigantic.  I think they used the same ones they use for stuffed mushrooms.  I thought they usually used the smaller button mushrooms, or maybe I'm thinking of Mastro's?

The bread pudding we got for dinner was just a dense piece of sponge cake or something.  Not very good at all.

All in all, this was not the first impression I wanted to give my parents of Ruth Chris.  We maybe should have driven the extra ten minutes to go to the one in the city.  Or maybe I'll wait to treat them in Scottsdale.

Yesterday for Thanksgiving the family and I came here as we always do for the holiday , we have always received excellent service . However, yesterday was not excellent at all. The food of course was delicious , but our server Dario was horrible. He seemed as though we were an inconvenience anytime we asked a question or asked for a refill of something. A member of our family had some dietary restrictions and when we asked him questions he never would return to the table with an answer. I get that it was a busy day but he seemed to be sucking up to all his bigger tables. Dario you screwed the pooch with us yesterday and we were very disappointed. Luckily the food and bus boy (who was very helpful and friendly) made up for Dario's crappy attitude and lack of service.

The hubby and I ate at Ruth's Chris a couple weeks ago for our Anniversary. My better half was jacked... he had been looking at the online menu for days and talked about it almost non-stop. He had been to a Ruth's Chris Steak House before and was excited to get his hands on a piece of meat again. 

My expectations were much lower. Last year, on our Anniversary, we went to Jameson's Steak House in C'ville... our meal was not good and soon after, the place closed. So, I was worried.

We had a reservation at 5:00 for two... we arrived at 5:00 and we were seated immediately. I ordered a filet with bleu cheese crust, sweet potato casserole and lobster bisque. The hubbster ordered a filet, mashed potatoes, mushrooms and lobster bisque.

The Lobster Bisque was AMAZING. When it arrived, I noticed there was a big chunk of lobster in the bowl... I wasn't sure if I should mix it into the bisque or not... I decided to save "the best for last" and eat the bisque first. I was so surprised to find that the lobster chunk was not the only lobster in the bowl. There were other chunks floating around in the bowl. Ah-Maze-Ing.

The filet was also out of this world... I ordered it medium rare... it came to the table more rare than medium rare however, the plate are so damn hot the filet cooked up to it's medium rare status in no time. It was fantastic. It melted in my mouth. The blue cheese crust was a wonderful addition.  

The Sweet Potato Casserole was just okay. I make a mean sweet potato casserole every year for Thanksgiving (my husband often tells people he married me for my sweet potato casserole) and Ruth's Chris casserole was not even close to the goodness of my own recipe. The hubbies mashed potatoes and mushrooms were seriously delicious. I mis-ordered. 

Believe it or not, we decided to order dessert. The hubby ordered the bread pudding and I ordered the chocolate mousse cheesecake. The cheesecake was good but I was so full, I couldn't fully enjoy it. My hub loved the bread pudding. Loved it!

Ruth's Chris was a wonderful dining experience. It was quite expensive but I enjoyed it so much, I am already making plans to get back there.

Oh, and our waitress was amazing. Top notch and exactly how waitresses are supposed to be.

we were given a gift card to use at Ruth's Chris and since we will celebrate our anniversary tomorrow we said this was a good night to go.  First let me say this restaurant deserves at least a 3 star for service.  We went for the classic dinner where it was a three course meal; we both ordered steaks - a filet (medium)  and a 16 oz ribeye (med. rare).  I ordered the the golden beets and green salad way too much dressing which I did not finish.  My husbands filet came out so rare that he had to send it back so for the next 12 mins I sat eating my dinner while he nibbled on the sides.  The steaks were not impressive I have had so much better. I think the only big notice is that when they serve the steaks on a 500 degree plate it sizzles when it's brought to the table. 
 
Our bill was close to $135 and the meal didn't tempt us to come back for another visit.  
Having said all this about the food - the service was very good, our waiter was attentive and the other staff members were there when the beverages needed to be refreshed.
Would we come back? No, sorry nothing memorable about this restaurant except the overpriced meals.

Went to Ruth's last night for my girlfriends birthday.  The food was great, but most importantly, the service was spectacular!!  We were super impressed with everything.  Martinis rocked,  too! Thank you!

Overall 3.5. Here's why.

Food 4.5 - We ordered three different cuts. The steaks were cooked perfectly, although the cuts could use some improvement. Ribeye was a little salty to me; but otherwise, no complains. Lobster Bisque was good, but I had better ones elsewhere. Same for the salad and dessert. 

Service 3.5 (maybe 3) - The hostess was not friendly at all (looked like she was the "snooty older lady" the other reviewer mentioned in her post). Our server was good, but not the best. I think she needs a little more time management training esp. on a busy weekend night. After we finished our entries and the leftover got wrapped by the other staff, we sat there staring at our empty table with just our drink glasses for about 30 minutes before our server finally came back asking us about dessert, which we expected it to be served fairly quickly as it was part of the classic dinner we ordered.

Felt like the servers and the manager were more attentive to certain tables (maybe the regulars seeing how they greeted each other). The manager never came asking our table like what he did for many others. Well, again, when we were leaving, there was the same weirdness or coldness on the hostess's face. No friendly "goodbye" or anything. For an upscale steakhouse like this, I would certainly expect more esp. on the service part.

The filet mignon was excellent. However, the seared tuna and mashed potatoes were just ok. The lobster bisque was acidic and the creamed spinach tasted spoiled. I would never go there again. The waiter never even asked how we liked our food.
Way too expensive and mediocre steak. I've had better with more flavor that's half the price.

Came here for valentines day with my amazing boyfriend. We made a reservation and we're seated promptly, the serve was phenomenal and very informative. I had never been a fancier steak house so this was really a treat for me and I was extremely satisfied. The food was amazing my boyfriend ordered a ribeye and I ordered a filet they were perfectly cooked to our liking, the asparagus was amazing, I have never been somewhere that every piece of asparagus was made perfectly none were too chewy or soft or crunchy just right. The lobster mac and cheese, even though I was hesitant not being a seafood eater was amazing, the make it with these green chilies,ugh melt in your mouth. But everything was melting in my mouth. We both has drinks and they were made perfectly and went down smooth. I would love to eat here more regularly and would recommend it to anyone.

The lobster bisque was soooo good !!

Food, staff, and service was wonderful.   My husband and I had the Ruth's Classic dinner and it was so good. Had the filet with shrimp, BLT salad and mushrooms.   We really enjoyed our dinner at  Ruth's Chris.

Ruth Chris Steakhouse exceeded our expectations Super Service very professional attitude the ambiance there was outstanding steak done to perfection and our server Stacy was so professional and so helpful. Jim the manager and his associates were very professional and great experience.
The steaks cut like butter.  Was perfect.   We rarely eat out at this level.   They knew we had an anniversary and brought a special dessert with Happy Anniversary written in chocolate.  The staff was so nice.  We will be back.
Another absolutely AMAZING meal here. Everything great. Steak to die for. Seriously. Can't wait to go back....

Three words. Sweet potatoe casserole. 

I have eaten at this location three times and the steaks are always cooked to perfection.

Best meat I ever had. Literally melts in your mouth. I had steak and lobster, my fianc had this cut of meat that wasn't on the menu but recommended by our wait staff. It was this giant piece of meat with a big bone in it. It was definitely a manly piece of steak, he said it was heavenly. All the sides were great too, all a la carte though. It's definitely not within a price range that you can do all the time, but we went for our anniversary and it was worth it.

Great food, impeccable service.

Friday night treat.  I had the petite filet, medium well, along with the asparagus with hollandaise sauce. The steak was done perfectly, which made me very happy, as I usually either get it over or underdone. The asparagus was tender and very tasty.  My wife had the stuffed chicken breast, which she said was deliciious.  She ordered a salad, and didn't realize there was cream in the dressing.  Our server very generously substituted the chicken tortellini soup, which was excellent.  Dessert was cheesecake with fresh berries, and it was tremendous.

They have a very good selection of craft beers, and the wine list looked very good, too.  This is not an every weekend kind of place, definitely special occasion, but certainly worth the price!

Hands down best steakhouse I've ever been to. This is the only location I've been to in the Chicago area. Service is always fantastic as is the food. 

Pricy but you get what you pay for. I don't frequent this place but if I could afford it. I would. 

I got the filet and my husband got the chicken. We also got sweet potatoes and I think green beans. 

Next time I have some extra money lying around I'll be sure to stop by.

We came here for dinner on the evening of Christmas Day, which also happens to be my boyfriend's birthday.  Being that it was Christmas Day, our restaurant choices were limited.  We made a reservation for 7:15PM for 2, we arrived at 7:10PM to a chaotic hosting desk.  They were understandably busy, we were told it would be a few minutes so we stood off to the side of the hostess desk.  15 minutes went by and I hear another couple given the same few minutes wait time for their 7:30PM reservation.  We wait another 10 minutes and to my disbelief the couple with the reservation at 7:30PM who arrived after us, gets called to be seated.  Trying to stay calm, I ask when we will be seated, the hostess says we're next(this is a familiar incident mentioned in at least 2 other help reviews).  By the time the hostess is walking us to our table, I am fuming.  As we are waiting to be seated, I begin to write my 1 star yelp review on my phone.  As we are being seated, I tell the hostess that I was extremely disappointed to see that other people with reservations after us and arrived after us were being seated first, reservations mean nothing to this place.  She had to good sense to send a manager over. 

So why the 5 star review?  The restaurant unexpectedly recovered from this incident throughout the night.  Ruth's Chris should really thank our waitress(Gina) for her great customer service.  Here is how they gained back their stars:
1. The manager came over and genuinely apologized, gave us a free appetizer.  
2. Our waitress was very friendly, gave us great suggestions and was very attentive to our needs.
3. The steak was delicious.  Perfectly done to the right temperature and it came out sizzling.
4. I saw our waitress on my way to the ladies room, I told her we were celebrating my boyfriend's unfortunate Christmas Day birthday, she promptly offered the dessert of our choice on the house.  

I still think the hosting process needs to be revamped here, I'm not sure if reservations mean anything to them, they could have avoided having to give us free food, nonetheless, I would definitely come back here, probably not on a major holiday.
Filet was perfect - mashed potatoes out of this world - dessert (mini apple cheesecakes) fantastic!  A definite place to return.

You know that scene in When Harry Met Sally where Sally fakes an orgasm in the middle of the diner?  THAT is me at Ruth's Chris.  But I'm not faking.  

You obviously do not go here for the prices or the quick service, but Ruth's Chris does provide in many other ways.  First off, the steaks are freaking delicious.  They come to you on a sizzling hot plate of butter.  I could stop there and that alone would be worth 5 stars, but there are so many other reasons I love it here.  1) Not many places have good craft beer.  They do.  2) Every soup, salad, and side I have had here is awesome.  3) The blue cheese crust is the best I have ever had.  It's not a crumby excuse for a crust, but a full half-inch of blue cheese crumbles that are broiled on.  HELL YES.  4) The desserts are the bomb too.  

Now I am no fancy schmancy McPrissy Pants, but I also like that there is valet if you want it.  There are also black napkins for the classy folks who don't want white lint on their suits.  Nice touch, RC.  

I guess my point is that you can make this a fancy night out and pretend you are rich and famous or you can just go there for some good beer and a great steak.  Either way, you need to go.

My expectations were high for this steakhouse, and they did not disappoint. Seating in the side banquet was intimate and quiet, something we value at any restaurant. Our server was gracious and attentive, even though it was apparent we were not regular customers. 
The lobster bisque started came with chunks of lobster floating in it, and was delicious. My husband, the true carnivore, had the Cowboy Steak, a 22 oz. strip steak on the bone. It was tender and served sizzling hot, and was a true medium, as requested. My strip steak was also perfectly done, nota do easy achievement with a thinner steak. And both steaks were perfectly seasoned. I almost always have to salt a steak, but not here! The sweet potato casserole side was good, but very sweet, making me wish I had ordered the creamed spinach instead. Our shared dessert, chocolate sin cake, was to die for. A flour less chocolate cake, it looks small when it comes out, but was rich enough for two people to enjoy. The only thing that would have improved it was a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
This is definitely a special occasion restaurant for us, but we thoroughly enjoyed it.

This is one of my favorite chain steakhouses. You cannot go wrong with any steak entre but my favorite is the filet. I tried the surf and turf for $50 and it was just scrumptious. I always have to order the sweet potato casserole because it is just that good. 

Staff is very attentive, friendly and polite. We celebrated a birthday dinner here and the server and manager gave us a handwritten birthday card thanking us for making them part of a special occasion. Just great service.

We love how they serve their deliciously prepared steak - on a 500F plate to keep the steak warm through out the meal.  Side dishes are great, I'm especially a fan of the sweet potato casserole. 

Atmosphere is good for either a romantic night out or a group outing.  Staff members are very attentive and friendly.  
 
It is pricey, but for the quality of food and service, it is worth it.

If you haven't eaten at Ruth's Chris before you definitely have to plan a special night out. I have a friend who works at one so eating here becomes a little more affordable. I always order the same thing when I go to a steakhouse, the New York Strip. This time I tried the Cowboy cut Ribeye. It was a-m-a-z-i-n-g. My leftovers the next day were still amazing. 

Our server was Jennifer and she was wonderful. It was such a nice change to have a super happy person take care of you. It really adds something special to the evening to see someone who loves her job and enjoys making sure that you get everything you can out of the experience.

Steak soooo good it'll make you smack...SOMEBODY!

Wonderful service. Delectable side dishes. And of course the steak is off the radar.

I just LOVE this place. They had a special this last time I was there that is not always on the menu, a bone in fillet. This was the best steak I have ever had in my life. Better than Mort's, The Sig Room, and better than Gibbs. Their where three of us without any drinks we spent around $325 with a 25% tip in that price. The wait staff was top notch also. 
The Con
Well there is only one con, it was the BBQ shrimp..... It wasn't grilled. I don't know if it was a mistake or that is just how they do it. So just get more steak!!!!!

This is our third time dinning at Ruth Chris.  But this time the food and the service was just exceptional.  Considering that it was new year's eve. For two people there was hardly any wait.  For appetizer we ordered lobster bisque that had lobster chunks and the taste was really good.  The main course was petite fillet with mashed potatoes and broccoli.  The fillet was very moist and juicy and melted in our mouth.  For dessert we ordered berries with cream and cappuccino it was awesome.  That really made our evening memorable.
Enjoyed the Porterhouse for two....have to say it was one of THE best steaks I've ever had.  I had it two weeks ago and I am still thinking about it.  I definitely will be back!

We love this place.
Reception desk is attentive and friendly.
Kansas City strip is hands down the BEST STEAK ANYWHERE ! Grat atmoshere especially in bar area booths.

Can't go too often though as it is a pricey place.

I came here for dinner one night and it was an awesome mix of dim lighting and awesome service! The waiter was super helpful in entree recommendations. We ended up getting the Porterhouse for Two, that came with 3 slices of Filet and 5 slices of Ribeye. It was nothing short of amazing! The filet came out juicy and tender and the ribeye was the same.

If you ever are wondering which sides to get, GET THE SWEET POTATO CASSEROLE!!!!! It's AWESOME! Little bits of pecan crunched into it and it has that type of crumble on the top that yo might expect on a pie, but this thing tops off the meal like no other.

The broccoli might be the only part of the meal that fell short of expectation, as it wasn't crunchy like most good broccoli I've seen. Other than that, you get an awesome experience for going there!

and again the guys at dianas red hots through down with the beat breakfast ever. 
these guys dont even sell breakfast but went out of there way to make what i wanted.
would recommend to every one in the carolstream, glendale hts area

Date of my visit: 31-August-2016
Time of my visit: Lunch

Let me start by saying, this was not my first time here...  I remembered why it took me this long to come back...  It might be awhile before I come back again...

I always liked little moms & pops type places.  My first test is always to try the gyro.  I ordered gyro, fries and a drink.  Total came under $8 with tax, I thought that was reasonable.  My first reaction was to reach for my AMEX, oops they didn't take it.  That was a strike one!  Look, I get it, it's expensive to take that card, but either take them all or be a cash only.  They were busy, so it took them a few minutes to get to me.  I asked my order to be for here and instead I get it to go, at least they apologized.  Normally, it would not be a big deal, but I have yet to get my order correctly at this place (usually I get no onions on my gyro, since I have to go back to work, so either screw no onions up or something like for here or to go).

On to the food, the fries were average and nothing special.  Gyro meat was a bit dry and average.  I have had better gyros.

Honestly, I am not sure when I'll come back again, but I will try something else and some point, I just need to remember not to reach for my AMEX.  Overall C-.

If you're looking for a hot dog joint in the burbs, give this place a shot. It's better than all the others in the Carol Stream area. 

It's a little hole in the wall, with a small dining area. I've been going here for about 10 years. It's family owned, and the staff is very friendly. 

They offer just about everything you would expect from a good hot dog joint, and I've never had anything bad off their menu. 

Their steak sandwich is killer, the burgers are good, they also have really, really good gyros. They also offer tacos, burritos, and that have menudo on the weekends. 

The prices are great too. Another reason I keep going back. Not like Scooby's down the road, who have a two hot dog special for $9.99.....

The burger was alright. I would say they meal was really cheap though. I think the place could use some fixing up. It looked run down and old. They had great combo deals though, which is great for someone on a budget.

Was in the mood for a chili cheese dog and figured with the high marks, this place would shine. Not sure why he wrapped up everything in a bag to-go, I was dining in. Tried to unfold the mess that was the dog. Onion rings are generic and he tried to charge me a $1 for a cup of water. I paid $7.81 for a very disappointing meal. I think they may appeal to a different style customer. At least I can remove them from my bookmarks. No warm fuzzy feeling from the staff.

Decent food for super, super cheap.

I got a cheeseburger and fries with a horchata. Because I could. It set me back $6.72, which is nothing short of amazing if you keep track of beef prices like I do.

The burger was pretty good. It's hard for me to describe a run-of-the-mill, hole-in-the-wall burger without using more hyphens, so I'll just say that it was a good burger. Fresh lettuce and nice, melty cheese.

The fries tasted slightly off. I can't tell you how, because my wife didn't think they tasted off, but to me I thought maybe some of the flavors from other fried foods leaked into the oil.

The horchata was very, very good, cold, cinnamon-y and exactly what I was looking for.

Overall though, it's pretty difficult to beat Diana's - which, by the way, appears to be run by a Hispanic dude, and I wasn't sure if red hots were actually on the menu - at this price point. I'd come back.

I have been here so many times they actually recognize me when I come in.

This place has a really weird menu but I am seeing more of this. They have Mexican, American and a little Greek selection. I have tried a few and am a fan.

The service is super friendly. The food is always perfect. Everything is cooked to order so there is no cold food or old food!

The hot dogs are their specialty. Typical Vienna dog but they do it all so well. It comes with fries at no extra charge. I have had their gyros, tamales and as I mentioned hot dogs. All were good and I trust that everything else in there menu, which is huge by the way, is going to be just as good.

Looking forward to my next visit.

Best fast food restaurant around the area recommend it... I love the hamburgers they got 
Also good deals good price

From the outside this place looks a bit sketchy but their food is really good! Our group had tacos, gyros, and an italian beef & we were all pretty happy with what was ordered. The gyro I had was awesome, I'd definitely come here again next time I want some tasty "cheat" food!

This place has it all.  Anything from Gyros and Hotdogs to Mexican food and steak sandwiches.  Ive tried tons of stuff on the menu and everything is always great.  Try the tacos, believe it or not they are awesome.  The prices are super cheap and the portions are huge.  The owner is very friendly as well.

Good food decent price.
Easy parking 
Easy to get to.
I live this place. Very reasonable prices and in my opinion they might have the best gyro in the west suburbs.
Best gyros on the planet. This place is great and the people who work there are awesome!
I haven't been here in awhile and really wanted a gyro. I'm glad that it's still the same great place, with great people, and great food. I love this place. You will leave full and satisfied.

Diana's Red Hots is a small fast food joint located on the Southeast corner of North Avenue and Schmale Road in Carol Stream. 

When you walk in you'll notice that it's very hot inside as the cooking equipment is very closely packed into the front. When I went to Diana's I ordered the hot dog.

The hot dog comes with fries and is a skinless vienna beef dog. The bun was a regular non-poppy seed bun. The pickle was cut thinly but was not quite long enough to get pickle in every bite. It was light on mustard and relish but had a decent amount of onions. The relish included was not the neon green style found at most Chicago style hot dog joints, but wasn't too sour either. The peppers included weren't too hot and complimented the dog nicely. The bun wasn't particularly soft, but it wasn't hard either.

The fries included were thick, they were fairly cripsy on the outside and had a decent potato filling. They weren't too salty, but were a bit on the greasy side. 

Overall this was an average at best Chicago style hot dog. The light condiments, regular bun and so so fries included keep it from reaching the three star plateau. Not awful, but I've definitely had better.
This place is off the hook with great tasting food and outstanding customer service.l always feel welcome when i stop in. The rib tips and gyros are the bomb.

This place is old school simple. Minimalist decor, food is outstanding, ingredients tasted fresh and everything was delicious and made to order. Grill is in sight if the tables, you watch your meal get prepared. People are super friendly and nice, I'll definitely go back to this diamond in the rough.

First of all this 5 stars for personality and of quality in simplicity. This place is a dive in and out joint, its small not too cozy but packs a punch in food and flavor. Their gyros are awesome, it is a very generous portion of meat, tomato, onion and "gyro sauce" as they like to refer to it, and if you order the plate (comes with fries and a drink) you'll definitely be walking away full (make sure to grab some Louisiana hot sauce for them fries mm mm). 

Their hot dogs and cheese steak sandwiches I would recommend next, the hot dogs are classic nothing extraordinary but their sandwiches are, I definitely recommend a try. Finally, their menudo on Saturday and Sunday is extremely tasty. Although sometimes they sell out quickly due to phone in orders, I got their today at 10:09 am (they open at 10 am) and they were already sold out, yeah its that good. 

Anyways, the location and setting can be a little off putting but the food and service is excellent I highly recommend this place if you like good food at a decent price. 

Oh yeah and they also serve good burritos and tacos. Check em out.

Wonderful hidden gem! Staff is wonderful and everyone is always smiling, even when they are packed, which is nearly every time I walk in. The food is good and fast, and my husband swears it is the best gryo around!

So darn good! A buddy at work recommended this place to me and then I was reading some of the other positive reviews.  The staff was very friendly and the gyro that I ordered was so on point.  I doused my fries in Louisiana Hot Sauce which was a nice touch.  I'll definitely be coming back to this place.

Great (authentic) Chicago dogs, beefs, gyros and authentic Mexican street/fast food. I regularly bring my work associates who visit from Mexico and they love it, they just tell them what they want, forget about the menu. The eating area is kept clean, behind the counter is clean considering the volume going through there. I have always felt welcome and cared for. Space can get tight in the winter, during the summer there are seats outside, in the sun so high heat days are pretty rough
Came arcoss this place looking for a place to eat for my lunch break and instantly got hooked. Great freindly service, had their steak sandwich it was awesome, simple but with lots of flavor.
Been going here for years! Their Gyros keep bringing me back! I haven't found anything else as good as Diana's. Very friendly staff and very good food!

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone... They food is great, especially their gyros, and their service is awesome... I got there five minutes before they were supposed to close .... They had cleaned everything out because they close at ten.... But he just got everything back out because I came in and ordered gyros... I even told him I could order something else if it would help him... And he said that as long as I walk in the door before they close the door... I get anything I want from their menu.... The owner is always so polite and happy... I love this place
super awesome food.  great food.  all of the food here is delish!  fries, beef, and burritos are great, do not forget extra salsa!  pizza puff FTW!

This was our second visit to Meatheads but our first at this location. They have a fairly simple, easy-to-read menu with suggested burger creations and plenty of options to customize and make it your own. My husband and I usually pick out two and split them between us, each are 1/3 lb of beef. 

When you order your burger, you have the choice of beef or chicken breast. The chicken breast is large as well as juicy and equally tasty with the suggested sandwich toppings. I'd recommend getting a side of fries with your burger as they don't come with it unless you order them. You have the option of original or cajun fries but be warned, the cajun fries are a bit more salty than other restaurant chains. 

If you're looking for an alternative to your normal fast-casual dining experience, give it a whirl. The self-serve Coca-Cola Freestyle is also available for your drinking enjoyment with free refills during your stay. And if you sign up for their reward card, you earn points toward free items on future visits and a free burger on your birthday! And who doesn't love free?!

The meatheads drive-through is the worst.  Super slow and they constantly get the order wrong.  This is the third time in a row they forget items.  I'm done.  Last time I come here.  Save yourself the aggravation and go somewhere with competent staff.

For a burger joint, I was surprised to learn that the only way to order your burger is "slightly well". Not my kind of place. Their Cajun fries are great though and they have siracha ketchup which was good too.

After my initial review, I was contacted and sent a gift card so I could come back, and to make up for my bad experience before, which I really appreciated. 

First, I came in here last week to buy a burger for my bf's brother, and neither then or today were we given a receipt. Today we spent almost 30 bucks for both of us, why is it assumed I don't want a receipt? We had to ask for it. (same guy both times, shorter Hispanic manager - he's wearing a headset and a collared shirt. If he checks you out, and you need a receipt, make sure to ask!) 

Today, I got a small meathead, bacon and Bleu cheese, with their new feta fries. The feta fries were good (my boyfriend said he was neutral on them), I think they needed a bit (more?) vinegar to compliment and balance out the flavors. 

My burger was good, it was juicy and I enjoyed it. However, the amount of Bleu cheese was shockingly little. It's $1 for cheese, listed as 2 slices. The amount of cheese I received is not the equivalent of 2 slices, and certainly not worth $1 -  maybe a quarter. My boyfriend order extra Bleu, and got less than I did. (I'm including a photo of the amount of cheese I received). 

I can't bring myself to do 4 stars considering the receipt issue - we weren't even offered one, and the fact that I feel I was vastly overcharged/cheated regarding the Bleu cheese. My burger needed more cheese, or I should have been charged less. I'm open to coming back, but as it stands, I'll never get Bleu cheese on a burger here again. Also, as my photo shows, my boyfriend's bunless burger dripped a shocking amount of grease. I understand that normally the grease gets absorbed by the bun, but it was like a river of grease - the only difference in our burgers was the lettuce bun and avocado. It was unappealing to watch, and if it had been my burger, I'd have quit eating it.

Just eh.... I've been here a few times. The drive thru experience is painful and slow. So I
Do go in now. The salads are nothing special. A lot of money for small portions. The burger wasn't impressive. The only thing that excites me was the mini cups of the cookie dough cafe desserts. You're better off spending your money elsewhere.

Food is good by the drive thru is so painful 
They take forever!
Don't be in a hurry.   They are painfully slow.

In Illinois to attend to another dismal affair and I realize I haven't had any real food since yesterday. So my nephew says 'how about we go to Meatheads?' Figger it can't be any worse than where we were plus we can get fries with that...
I ordered the Cajun Sunrise burger, regular fries and strawberry shake, he got some complex thing with sauted mushrooms, grilled onions and cajun fries which sets us back a little more than $30!
Wunnerful tasty eggy burger with dressing and meat-juice dribbling down my arm and a large pile o' taters but not at all certain if it is $10 dollars more satisfying than J-wop, rings, mellow peach-o

And the "premium" burger joints just keep on coming. Felt like deja vu  here - was this another Smash Burger or The Burger Joint or Steak & Shake??   

Burger was good but nothing exciting or anything new here. Fries were very good but just as good as at Five Guys.

Stopped in to celebrate National Hot Dog Day, Meatheads was offering their "New England Style" hot dogs, with a Vienna Beef frank for a buck and change.  You can add all sorts of interesting fresh condiments and toppings, and the growing chain continues to have some of the best fresh cut fries around.

I've been to the Glenview Meatheads before, so the burger is not new to me. I like the taste - a home cooked freshness - kind of reminds me of what Wendy's was like way back when that chain started. 

On my second visit here, I had seen enough of the drive up to figure out where to go in, so I used it - the entry isn't marked too well. Now, the good thing about Meatheads is the freshness of their food and cooking it. Problem is that their style of cooking each order from the start doesn't lend itself too well to a drive up process. I was the "first one" in the drive up on my visit and the order took 7 minutes. I can only imagine how long the person 2 cars behind me ended up waiting.

If you're in the area, give this place a shot - ultimately I think Meatheads will do well in this location.

I love this burger restaurant. Especially because they have burger lettuce wraps for those of us who need to eat gluten free. Good quality meat. Wish they had the condiments like Hellmans mayo on the table too. I always sit down with the little one and have to get back up to get it. 
Great burgers and fries! And great customer service too!  Very supportive of local businesses and a real family place , and cool environment (with great music) A must try!

Called and ordered ahead for the drive through.
Ordered a Swiss burger and Swiss grilled chicken sandwich both very good. The guy at the drive though couldn't have been nicer.  He asked if we wanted dog treats, we said no because it gets a little messy.  He was nice enough to give us a little to go bag of treats.  We will be back!
Only was here once and ordered a bacon cheeseburger and shake. It took slightly longer than i expected but it was worth it. The burger was very tasty and cooked perfectly. Will go back again.

Since this is my first visit, I kept it simple with burger ,the works, and cheddar just to see if they can do the basics right. And they impressed me. The vegetables were crisp, I can really taste the cheese, and the bread is so soft and tasty. Also, Gotta say I love the Cajun Fries! And Although this might not be a big deal, I always get excited when I see the coca-cola drink machine. Next time I'll try a more adventurous menu items.

I love Meatheads... Just not this Meatheads. 

The location is nice and and clean, but they tried to make up for their poor preparation by over-compensating with the customer service. Seriously, everyone was super nice, but it was the worst Meatheads burger I've ever had. Very skimpy on the condiments that were supposed to be included on the burger. The burger I ordered was supposed to have fries on it, and there was one fry on the burger. Like I said, the customer service was incredible, but I wish they had paid more attention to the food.

Great service, great food, place clean, fresh and delicious. The burgers are great, loved the pattiemelt, the 1/3 pound was plenty of food. The surprise was the chicken sandwich, fresh battered with a moist perfectly cooked chicken breast. My wife said it's was the best she'd ever had. Don't forget the fries, somewhat similar to give guys, but a little thinner and less greasy, the Cajun spice is optional, but go for it. Finally, the service was great. Cashier explained the menu and from delivering the food to the table to coming by to clear plates (tins) the service was friendly and helpful. 
A little hidden in Barrington, this is definitely worth a visit.
Get the Cajun sunrise (I think?) burger and Cajun fries, yummy every time, most of the staff are very friendly.
I have been here a handful of times and each time my order was wrong.  The third time I found hair in my food. So disgusting. Was given a gift card the third time which didn't work.
Clean and inviting! Very friendly staff. But the actual taste of the burger was just ok. I prefer Five Guys or Culver's. But still a fun place to go with lots of menu options.

Had meatheads recently and I've gotta say, one of the best burgers in Barrington.  Nothing beats their third pound burger with the works.  Not to mention, their chicken sandwiches are not to bad themselves.  The people behind the counter are always friendly and always get the order right.

For a fast food burger place Meatheads is about as good as it gets.  You can find cheaper burgers and faster burgers, but for the price to quality ratio for the meal Meatheads is definitely cheaper than Five Guys and about as expensive as the several other premium fast burger places. But, out of all of them I prefer Meatheads the best.  The burgers and the fries taste great.  On top of having the Coke machines with what seems like a million different flavors they have some interesting things in a freezer right when you walk in with things such as a cup of raw cookie dough that you can purchase.
Stopped by to see if the reviews were accurate. They are.... Burgers here are pretty good. Fries were good as well.

Meatheads wins the award for most annoying burger ever. Don't get me wrong, the burger itself was very tasty. The meat was juicy and cooked perfectly. The bun was perfectly toasted. And the toppings were high-quality. What annoyed me? As soon as I picked it up to take the first bite, EVERYTHING slid out of the bottom and I was left with 2 buns... Note to self: don't take the toothpick out of the burger before eating.

its good to see this place in the area. there's hardly anywhere to go for lunch around here. Besides Egg Harbor. Well been a couple of times. The burgers are pretty good. much better than Smash burger or 5 guys. there fries are also way way better than both those places. decent prices and staff pretty friendly. Will def make this one of my new stops for lunch

The burgers here are pretty good with all the yummy toppings but if u eat a piece of the burger on its own it's pretty flavorless and a thin patty almost reminds me of McDonald's gross! But the thing that saved them is the fries theirs are the best in the area I love the Cajun fries I just wish their meat was a little better :( our fav is still smash burger
I didn't expect there to be a drivethru, but there is.

This is my third visit. The price is still a bit higher then i would like, and they once again got my order wrong they remembered my reciept this time around.   Although the atmosphere is still not appealing to me after my last review the management did reach out to me to make the situation better.  I find that although this isnt the place for me, I appreciate a company who takes an active interest in the opinion of there clients.  They will fill a niche in this town for a younger market.

This is my second time here and I loved it!  We split the NY Ruben burger and the new Chopped Wedge salad.  While I wasn't overly impressed with the salad I thought the size was big and we brought home half of it.  The dressing is not your typical blue cheese.

The Ruben Burger was suggested by the manager, Stacey.  She said it was her comfort burger.  OMG she was right!  I loved it. The cheese was melty, the sauerkraut gave it a nice tang and the dressing was warm and savory.  I would give it 10 stars, but sadly can only give it 5!  

The vanilla shake is still one of the best I have ever had!  I will come here every time I have the chance.
Don't have any complaints.  Food is as delicious as any other meatheads restaurant.  This location is very clean and I come here from time to time.

I'm nice, newer restaurant in the chain. They do a really cool thing with local Little League teams where they give out meathead certificates for coaches to hand out. The burgers are really good the staff is really nice and there is always plenty of parking.
I really enjoy this burger place. I know a lot of people complain about the price but this isnt McDonalds, this is real beef and real chicken. Real ingredients cost money.

New location, first day open and not one disappointed taste bud in my mouth. Once again the high quality ingredients were perfectly prepared.  The tomato on my burger really stood out today.  Just another sign that the company uses high end suppliers with direct lines to producers. The staff was attentive and really gave you the feeling that they wanted me to come back.

The company was created here and always gives back to the community. I have never seen any advertising yet they continue to grow, I can only assume it is word of mouth by satisfied customers.
I really like this place.  The chicken tenders are fantastic! The burgers really good too. I like adding a burger to the iceberg wedge. Have been there many times and will continue.
On national hot dog day they are selling hotdogs for a &1.50 w-everything on it and they are HUGE & delicious
Great place to take the kids for a great lunch or dinner. There is something for everyone!  I also love how they support the community and local youth sports programs.

A great burger place in a town that could desperately use an option that isn't McDonald's! Meatheads is like the chipotle of burgers. Very quick, customizable, and delicious. The California burger was great and their fries taste fresh and lightly salted. And the touch screen soda machine didn't hurt!
Super fresh and yummy! And the young woman who took my order was very friendly and made good recommendations. I ended up with the Cajun grilled chicken. YUM.
Good burger.  Had Robbie Gould special a few months ago.  Fresh ingredients.  Big and tasty.

Good Tequila's was good! I have been living here for a while, and still had never stepped into this place. Until last night. 

We were seated right away (like stupid fast). Our waitress came over right away and asked what we wanted to drink. I had a margarita, my friend got a beer. The margarita was decent, not my favorite, but not bad. They have a variety of flavors and sizes, which is nice. 

They also have a large menu. Anything from tacos to fajitas, burritos, taco salad, enchiladas, you name it. I had the steak tacos (supreme), Mexican style. The flavor was great, and they were full of meat, cilantro and onion. IT did come with pico, guac, sour cream, beans, rice, and lettuce on the side. Next time I would just order 3 steak tacos with guac on the side and save myself some money. But they were good!

Service was great the whole time, I really don't have any complaints. Some of the prices are a little high, but overall I would definitely come back for my taco fix.

I really liked the atmosphere and decorations in this restaurant, very authentic. 

We had the large queso with chips, which was your standard white cheese. It was delicious! 

For my meal I had the Arizona burrito. The description listed that it included red peppers, onions, and tomatoes. Unfortunately, I was expecting it to be more small pieces but it was actually huge pieces of these vegetables. I requested only shredded chicken in my burrito for the meat. My burrito was practically only these large vegetables. So I was very disappointed, I wouldn't say it was their fault because it was how I interpreted the description. It really should be called the "Fajita burrito" that would be a more accurate description. 

The service was good and I was glad I was able to use the yelp coupon!

I adore a margarita and Mexican food. So I'm not even embarrassed to say that I did an extensive search online when we moved to the area. Good Tequila is the first place we tried and it's going to be tough to compete with. The white queso (which is hard to find around this region for some reason), had a little kick to it. Best I've ever had. I don't care if white queso isn't as "authentic" as queso fundido. It's delicious. I ordered the large ($6.25?) having no idea how big it was. I weighed risk vs payoff. It was pretty big. Like a cereal bowl. Too much for two people, even if one of them is me. I wasn't disappointed though. Worth the risk. 

We got the 28 oz margaritas and had them made with Grand Marnier. I think they were around $13 each which is a good price. Especially since we were both one and done. Usually my husband and I will have a second, or split one at the very least. We like our margs. Don't judge. But we actually really didn't need more than one. 

We were in the mood for seafood so I got the special which was shrimp and crab enchiladas ($9.99) and my husband got the lobster enchiladas ($13.99?).  Both were very good. We will definitely repeat those orders some other time. I hope they make the shrimp and crab enchiladas a regular menu item. 

THEN, we got fried ice cream, which was also great. Better than expected. I think it was less $5. 
Our daughter loved it. And she's 2 so you know she has a refined palate. 

Not that it's part of Good Tequila's, but it should be mentioned that there's a fountain/splash area right outside past their ample patio seating which was a great place to hang out and watch out daughter play before we walked off all that food and drink!  

So clearly this is a rave. Go in and eat and drink until you can't move. I'll be logging extra time at the gym just to go here on a regular basis.

Decor reminds me of Mexico.  One of a lkind painted tables imported from Mexico.   

My meal was tasty and the pina delicious,  wish I ordered larger size.  This review will focus on decor and I'll give a more detailed review of food next visit.  We were there late on Sunday sI was able to go around snapping pics of tables.

Nice and clean place.
Very good atmosphere.
The price is according with quality. All Staff are very good, they help in the order...,
They are very kind.

It doesn't get any better than this, folks!  We've been coming to Good Tequilas for years and it's not just because everything you eat is my delicioso, but the service is always friendly and genuine.  My go- to is always the Carne Asada, a beautifully tender cut of juicy steak, seasoned and expertly grilled.  The wife loves their spinach enchiladas, and we both agree that their homemade salsa is simply addictive!

We used to be Tapalpa folks, but after just the first visit to GT, we've never looked back.  It's great for the kids to, with ample indoor and outdoor seating.  And the park area in the back is great for a walk after a huge meal in the summertime.
Lunch specials are affordable. Steak was tender and tasty. Decor is very authentic. They serve pretty fast even when busy during lunch.
Went back again, & I was looking forward to another awesome dining experience here,but that didn't happen: (. Slow service,and the dinners were below the good quality I have received previously.

Wow! I was blown away from this place. I took my girlfriend here for our two year anniversary and we had great service and food. Listed here are a few things that went well.

1st - PRICE! When in tapped checked in here on yelp it immediately said that I will get 9 dollars off! So guess what? I GOT 9 DOLLARS OFF MY MEAL! Thanks yelp!

2nd - The waiter's name was Chico and he did an amazing job. He was quick, polite, and beyond super friendly!

3rd - The food was amazing and better then a few others I have been too! My girlfriend, who is first generation Mexican American, said the food is very authentic.

4th - The decor is beautiful. It's very colorful and clean.

We will definitely returning here again a few times in the future. I highly recommend this place.
This place was surprisingly good.  Margaritas were great!  We couldn't get past the Nachos al Carbon they were so big.  Very good...would recommend.

Good Tequila? Great Tequila!!!

Atmosphere, staff, and service; premium.
Food quality is good, not as authentic as my Caucasian tongue prefers, but considering the location in the middle of suburbia, the food is pretty good. 

Guac is pretty a bit white washed, lacking spice and flavor. Their chicken is flavored very well. 

Since I like things with more of a spicy kick, the spice factor here is a little tame.

Sebastian is an outstanding representative of GTs establishment. The service is fast and impeccable. He remembered all of our orders, in which each order had at least 3 substitutions.

When their was a slight mix up on cooks end with the substitution, the quickly took care of the situation with out any rebuttals.

-ask for Sebastian!!!
Very good portions for lunch menu. Good atmosphere , friendly staff. Very fairly priced. I would highly recommend.

Today is the second time I have come here and again was highly satisfied not only with the service, my dinner was on point, I had a T-bone with shrimp, it was very flavorful, excellent. 

I will make this my spot from here on foward. Lucky for me I live down the street.

Get the margaritas!!!!! They're amazing. Been here twice already and I'm definitely coming back with a couple of friends. The staff is friendly and helpful, the decor is beautiful, the food is Americanized but not bad at all, and the drinks are bomb.  Can't wait to come back.

What a fabulous place.  Love the decor, bright colorful makes you smile when you walk in the door.   Food was absolutely delish!   My first time there, but most definitely not my last.     Very very good and very large portions.   Friendly staff.   Try it with confidence!

Love love love love love this place. Did I say I love this place?  The margaritas are strong.  The mango is a fave of mine. My guy always gets the topiquena (probably spelled wrong) but big portions. Never disappointed with anything we have tried. Salsa has a nice kick. Great place to go and enjoy delicious Mexican food!!

Good food and cool decor there nachos with shrimp and steak best I have ever had.
Will become a favorite of mine service good a big plus
Love this place!  Will definitely go back. Love their margaritas, service is excellent and a good food! What more you want?

Great place with great food. Margaritas were fabulous as well! Had a very nice server and we enjoyed the food very much. We decided to get the tacos with the onion and cilantro so it was more authentic to us. It was tasty and we will definitely be back. Can't believe it took us this long to try this great place.

Good Mexican food is hard to find. Excellent Mexican food even harder. But this place is incredible. Great service. Ask for Chico. He is the best! Try the Carne Asada their way. And the chorizo quesadillas are unreal.
Good food! I come here for lunch often with coworkers and alone! Staff is always very nice and friendly. I love the steak tacos!

Myself and 5 other people came here on probably their busiest day of the year last night, cinco de mayo. The entrance was loaded with people waiting, and we were told an hour wait. We ended up waiting a half hour and were greeted with chips and salsa right away. We had their queso which is amazing, and frozen strawberry margaritas which were also delicious. I had the Arizona burrito with the steak shrimp and chicken and it was one of the biggest and tastiest burritos I've ever had. Everyone's plates looked really good actually. They were also giving away free merchandise for cinco de mayo which was nice. All in all it was a great night and I will definitely be back.
Beautiful furniture and decor. Good food, good service! Loved the table, salsa and the Shrimp cocktail Will be back again! :)

There mango margaritas were excellent, but the food was cold and seems old/overcooked. I could make better at home. 
Stars are the median between mediocre food and good drinks.
Great atmosphere, colorful and family friendly. Food good, good Mexican favors. Great drink menu. I'd go there again, recommend to anyone looking for a good Mexican restaurant in this area.

Sooooo thrilled this place is here!!! I'm from Peoria and I always ate at the one there.  I am excited to finally have a place in the Chicagoland area that has the white cheese dip that I love! I will definitely be here weekly!

I will begin by saying that the interior is very bright and colorful.  It is a good sized location and the service we had was very good.  Pretty much your standard free chips and salsa mexican place.  Everything was pretty much what you would expect, nothing above average to speak of, but most importantly they did not doing anything wrong.  Definitely worth a try if you are in the area looking for a bite to eat.

This is a great local Mexican eatery! We had the grilled shrimp & drunken chicken ( I'd use the Spanish but my phone keeps auto correcting it) the chicken was a generous portion cooked to perfection, my grilled shrimp was fabulous served over a cheesy rice and side salad. at first, I thought it was too salty but when paired with the salad and shrimp it was just right. If you are on a restricted sodium diet order the tilapia. Over all 5 stars.
We just moved here from LA and were looking for a good Mexican Restaurant.  And we found it. Great Ceviche and Fish Tacos.
Good food, good portions. Authentic food. Great service for our party of 16. Raspberry margarita was excellent. Definitely recommend and would come back.

Went their on cinco de mayo and got the coronarita which was HUGE.  They had a live mariachi band so the atmosphere was really unique and fun!  Their side of queso was alright, and the beef tacos were slightly bland.  Overall though a fun atmosphere with a-okay food.
As usual delicious food. Great service. Yummy daiquiri(not cheap on the alcohol)  lunch menu great value with lots of food.  Free cup of soup at lunch.  I
So so yummy! Great service and so authentic. Drinks came quick, chip refills came fast, also. My tacos were perfect. I'd come here again and I don't even live here.

We go very often for lunch.  Decided to take the family there for dinner.

During lunch (11:30/noon for us) the salsa is bright and fresh.

We went for dinner today and the salsa was super salty.  I won't explore why this might be.  Use your own imagination.  We mentioned it to the server and he chuckled it off and asked if we would like another.  I don't imagine that someone is making this on demand so we decline.

The dinner menu is double the price of the lunch menu.  This isn't unusual but they are next to a Buffalo Wild Wings that does not charge $12-16 per plate so it looks like they don't understand their market.

Was a loyal customer and won't be going back anytime soon.

First time I went here everything was awful. Service was meh, food was nothing to write home about. Food came kind of cold but we had already waited so long we didn't feel like arguing.

Second time was absolutely awesome. Our waiter was attentive and friendly and the food will bring us back again. Get the Queso Charro, so tasty.

I've been here before and tried their raspberry margarita and it was amazing! On this recent occasion I went there with family and ordered a mango margarita pitcher. Again, it was delicious! I ordered the supreme taco meal and was incredibly disappointed. The rice was hard and crunchy like it was from the bottom of the pot. Beans were an off color, and tasteless. The steak taco meat was off color as well as tasteless. Very disappointing considering you're paying high prices for these meals.

This place has good food and good service.  If you like shrimp, the shrimp tacos are very good.  I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here.  Drinks are always good too, never watered down.  I would recommend this place for a reasonable, good meal.

Delicious margaritas and mojitos. The Tampiquea is my favorite dish, the skirt steak is tender,juicy and flavorfully marinated with peppers. The enchilada it comes with is equally tasty.  Authentic Mexican food, reasonable prices. Also recommend the guacamole.

stopped in tonight and was very dissapointed..  chicken was very and crunchy..   Also had the steak chimi and it had this thin cheese sauce all over it not to good..   then the kicker, they had no sour cream..  and didnt tell us untill the food came.  tge jewel is right across the street.  this might be it for me...

The decor was lively and colorful. A couple came singing around to the tables. It created a wonderful ambiance. We came in a group of 7, all vegetarians. We got 2 pitchers. One frozen mango margarita and one of margarita on the rocks. They kept the chips and salsa coming. They had veggie selections. We got 2 orders of spinach enchiladas and 5 veggie combos. It was a nice place! We really enjoyed ourselves!

Wanted a quiet place to spread out for a business discussion over lunch.  My colleague and I had not been to Good Tequila's in a while, so we decided to go there.

Quiet it was.  We arrived for lunch right at noon and there were probably only three or four tables occupied.  Right next door is China Buffet which had a waiting line out the door.

The food was okay, not outstanding and a little more expensive than I think it was worth.  Two platters and cokes for lunch = $30.  A bit high.  

None the less, it was quiet, so we were able to get out work done. The service was outstanding (possibly because there was one wait staff for every occupied table).  

Not on my list of favorites, but certainly not bad and worth trying.  I think I'll go back and try a few of their margaritas one night.

I would highly recommend this restaurant! The staff is always so courteous and quick to help, and the food! The food is amazing! I'm also not a huge fan of margaritas, but even they kick butt. Great atmosphere, great service and great food!
Carne asada was good, but our waiter-not very friendly. Used their coupon but not happy about it.

Went yesterday for dinner for the first time, and definitely will be back. I had a quesadilla, and my girlfriend had fajitas. Both were very flavorful and came in decent portions. Prices are very reasonable, especially the beers. Rarely will I order a bud light with dinner, but $4 for a 32oz draught is hard to pass up. Service was great, the menu is extensive and somewhat unique, and the atmosphere is pleasant.

Went there for lunch and got the Burrito Loco. It was amazing. The chips and salsa was very good as well. Service was friendly and efficient and my food came just after I finished my first bowl of salsa. I got back from my 1hour lunch with 15 minutes to spare.  Can't wait to try them at dinner.
Really great food !  Quick amnd nice service but a little expensive !

We go here once a week and I really don't know why.  The service is so bad.  Time after time I feel like we are a burden on the staff.  We are not picky and we order the same thing every time.  We don't need much attention, but a drink refill would be nice.  The food is okay, but Taco Bell is better. There are better Mexican options in town like Tapalpa or OK Burrito.
Good food, good service. My family and I have been going here for many years.

Ate here for the first time yesterday and it was pretty good. The margaritas are the reason for coming! I ordered a medium and it was pretty huge and delicious! The fajitas were also a big portion and we're tasty.

My last visit really has me rethinking my patronage. The service was the worst service I have experienced. The waiter seemed disinterested and inattentive. When we arrived to take our order, I mentioned to him I checked in and I wanted to use the check in offer. 

Without looking at the offer, I was told it could not be used. When I inquired about the reason, I was told he would have to speak with the manager. I asked if he could check before we ordered. He left for several minutes and went to the kitchen (the manager who I know was at the bar). He returned and said he needed to my phone to show the manager. 

Fast forward. Manager says of course. Food comes. No extra napkins, additional salsa or return to see if everything was good. When he did return it was near the end of the meal. I had the impression he was upset that a coupon was used, but his demeanor was pretty sour at the outset. 

I am doubtful that I will allow this bad experience keep me from ever returning, but I am sure it will be a while before I go back or suggest any one else does. There are good Mexican joints on every corner. I will happily redeem coupons and spend money someplace else in the immediate future.

Husband ordered one of the very reasonably priced lunch specials--good value, good quality.  Our daughter and I ordered ala carte--tasty cheese enchilada, good steak tacos--tamale  had a bit too much masa. Good chips, good salsa.
I had the Combo Fajitas,  and it was mediocre at best.  Steak was over done, and neither the steak or chicken had much flavor.  Probably  won't give it another try.

For our first time to Good Tequila's, we had a good time! I enjoyed their outdoor patio and the staff was very friendly. The inside decor was bright, funky, and I loved it! 

I ordered cheese enchiladas and my husband ordered a steak burrito. The food was pretty solid, but the chips and salsa...OH MY! I want to buy some bottles of that salsa! It was DELICIOUS, great kick to it and you can definitely taste the cilantro...so good! 

They served a chicken chipotle soup as a starter. My husband loved it...it was a bit heavy for me though. 

I would love to check it out during the week though for some drink specials! It seems like a fun place to get some margaritas!

Came here last Friday and I am pleased! It was a nice evening so my parents and I decided to enjoy our food outside. It was a pleasant little outside area. The food was good and the service was quick. They have a very big menu and a nice margarita and pina colada drink selection. The inside seemed nice as well, very colorful and larger than I thought. I'll be back!

I'm not a big fan of Mexican cuisine, but the every so often that I crave it, this is my place to go. I always go with a rather big group of people and we all leave full and happy. Service is quick and the fajitas are amazing.

I really want to like this place more than I do. The staff is always so nice but the food and drinks are just OK. Margaritas taste like they come from a bottle, food is average. Place can be kind of loud when there are large groups-which seems like it's often. Saturday night has roaming singers/guitar players-nice touch, but not my thing. We continue to go here because 1.) it's not that expensive, 2.) cheap mexican beer on tap, 3.) easy to get a table.
If you are really looking for a good mexican meal, go elsewhere.

Went tonight for dinner after being there Thursday night margarita special. Service was friendly and warm, food was delicious, hot, and generous ($9.99!).  Plus Yelp gave me $9 off. Would recommend it for the price point, easy to find, great overall experience.  Looking forward to warmer weather to dine outside.

I've been here a couple times over the past year.  Went here last night with a friend and had the place pretty much to ourselves.  When we were walking in my friend said, "It's hard to be sad walking in here, the atmosphere can make anyone smile."  The decor is awesome, the hand painted chairs are something to see.

The menu is typical mexican fare, good size portions.  They have several size and flavor margaritas with different quality tequilas.  We didn't feel rushed and the waiters were attentive.

When I checked in on Yelp, I found a $7.99 coupon good off two full meals, great deal!

There is an outdoor patio which I did enjoy last summer and I am looking forward to enjoying it again this year.

Overall, I would recommend this place for typical mexican food, good service, and margaritas.

Found this place browsing through the Save-a-lot mailing, and figured, why not. 

Upon walking in, greeted by a friendly young man who promptly sat us at a cute booth. He immediately took our drink order, a big ass strawberry margarita (STRONG) and a mango daiquiri. both arrived quickly and were good. 

While we were waiting for the drinks, a basket of fresh chips and salsa was delivered. Also, good. 

Time to order. I had the combination fajitas and my husband had the mucho something burrito. He liked his. Mine  came to the table sizzling hot and wasn't bad. The vegetables were cooked well, but it was something about the meat that I didn't care for. I don't know if they boil it or make it ahead of time then just heat it up when ordered because the food came FAST.  

Dessert. The fried ice cream. GOOD. ask for no whip cream.. I've always had fried ice cream with sopapillas on the side so we had an order of those too. They were both good at $3.99 a piece... my kind of prices... 

The place is well decorated with great colors and art on the backs of the chairs, tables, and even walls. They also had a nice seating area outside which seems great for summer nights. 

Overall, not bad. I've had better, but for something quick and reasonably priced, I'd go again. 

Service: The same guy who seated us served us and there were a few other guys walking around making sure everyone had what they needed. They were attentive but didn't rush. 

The search for the perfect mexican place in dupage county continues......

I love the chairs. 

I wish I could love the service I received, which was lackluster and inattentive, at best. 

Food was just meh. The steak in the tacos was a little tough,  the salsa was bland,  the rice and beans were forgettable. Mango margaritas were good, but pretty weak. 

I can't say I would go back, unless someone was treating.

This is hands-down our very favorite Mexican restaurant. The food is fantastic, the service is always great, we love the atmosphere and of course, the margaritas! We always get the 18 oz. one and let me tell you, one will do you. We also had our "meet and greet" dinner here with mine and my fiances family getting together for the first time after the engagement. Pitchers of delicious margaritas and mariachi music definitely helps to break the ice. P.S. Try the Enchiladas Verdes. YUM
