Been a couple of times now, love the food, love the mango margarita's. Service has been consistently wonderful and it's clean, well decorated and friendly staff. Definitely a place I would recommend.

My family and I are visiting my sister and were craving for Mexican.  The other mexican restaurant place we wanted to go to was close.

This place is pretty good. I would have rated it a 3 if the service was good.  Food was excellent.  The soup was great even if I only had the sauce since it had chicken. (i'm pescatarian).  I had the camaromes a la diablo and the scale of spiciness is just right.

Our server wasn't very friendly and didn't seem like he was having a good day. Since we were hungry, we went through the chips really quickly.  We asked for another basket and waited, and waited.  Until I decided to ask another server who was much more attentive.

I'd still go back for the food. Maybe the server just had a bad day...

Good Tequila's?  Maybe if I would have had tequila, I would have had a good experience.

I went in for dinner last week with a girlfriend around 7:00pm.  If you know anything about Elk Grove Village, you know that it is an industrial/business town.  They basically roll up the roads after the 5:00pm whistle blows.  It was pretty quiet when we walked in, so I figured that they would be glad to have customers.  

My girlfriend had a Restaurant.com certificate and she wanted to try it.  I like to use these certificates when we are first trying a new place.  If I like it, obviously I will be back paying full price over and over again.  Especially when I work five minutes away.  I think that some restaurants don't realize this fact.    

We were seated in a brightly painted room.  The look of the room made me feel upbeat.  It was the sort of place that I could see my youngest nieces really enjoying because it looks so fun!

Someone came along and dropped off chips and salsa.  Mexican Restaurants, please pay attention!  Salty chips and spicy salsa should not be dropped at a table without ice water following very shortly thereafter.  Sadly, this cardinal rule was missed.  We waited.  And waited.  And waited.

Finally, a waitress came over and offered to get drinks.  I ordered an iced tea.  My girlfriend ordered a Diet Coke and water.  More waiting.  When it finally arrived, there was no water.  Tea and Diet Coke only.  We asked for the water again.  By now, I have tasted the iced tea which tastes like water with a lemon in it.  The waitress returns.  I request a Coke instead.  

The Coke does not arrive.  She returns to take our order.  I ask about the Coke.  She says that she will get it.

Nothing.

I ask a passing waiter for a Coke.  He miraculously appears just moments later with a Coke in hand.  Ahhh.  Much better.

When the food arrives, it comes from someone other than the waitress which makes me wonder what in the world she has been doing all night.  She doesn't deliver drinks, she doesn't deliver food, she doesn't clear dishes.  I think she only takes orders and brings them to the kitchen.  We may as well have ordered at a counter for the lack of service that we received.  

The food.  The complimentary soup was very good.  It was a chicken chipotle soup.  Kinda creamy.  Not something that I would normally think to try, but the pieces of chicken breast were a nice surprise and I would consider trying that again.  My girlfriend's chimichanga received high praise from her.  She liked the flavor and said that it was fresh.  My chicken and mole enchiladas were okay.  The mole was quite strong.  The chicken was not dry, but the combo wasn't exactly what I was hoping for.  The Mexican rice was dry and clumpy.  I only took a bite or two and the flavor really wasn't there.

I don't plan on returning anytime soon which is a shame.  I would like somewhere to head to right after work for a good dinner.  This just isn't it.
Atmosphere was brilliant!  Waiter was very good.  Did was DELICIOUS! HIGHLY recommend the chicken dish with homemade chorizo. The flavors were phenomenal.

Will definitely visit for their tasty and yummy margaritas and Nachos. Our server was an older gentlemen who seemed to be annoyed with something and was not cheerful but I can understand one can have some bad days. Anyways will visit for sure.

I just don't like this place.  Tried it for the third and last time tonight. The only real plus I can give them is it's really cute inside and they have outdoor seating. Margaritas are ok too.  I'm a huge fan of Mexican, and this place has never done it for me. I've been here 3 times in a two year span. Our last visit ok a weekday night we sat for 10 minutes before we were ever acknowledged. Turns out there was only one waiter, who was also working the bar.  Even though they were slow, he couldn't seem to keep up. Hence we were ignored. My boyfriend order carne asada, and I'd never seen a smaller portion of steak. When they set it down in front of him it was very sad looking.  See photo. I ordered the chimichanga. I came covered in Queso (I hate Queso) which the menu did not say. Also had what can only be described as marinara sauce dumped all over it.  I ended up sending it back and just enjoyed my margarita.

good Mexican food at fair price...plenty of parking...if you are planning on several drinks of margaritas, ask for the table near the bar...and walgreen is next door so you can pick up some hangover medications for tomorrow morning

I love the ambiance and the food at this place!!  Both are amazing, and the other reviewers were right--the hand painted chairs and booths were a really cool touch!

My friend and I went here last night for a girls' night, and I am sure glad we did!!  We started with the cheese dip and the nachos supreme.  Both portions were very generous and delicious!  Especially the nachos--you can't go wrong with nachos that come with both pulled chicken AND beef.  YUM!

We also ordered meals (which we found out after our nachos that we did NOT need to do since we were that full from the appetizers!  But it came with chicken chipotle soup, which in theory sounds good, but in reality, was not very good.  My friend ordered fajitas and was sweet enough to share a bite with me--yum!!  I got the taco salad, and there were SO many delicious ingredients in it, and it was in the flakiest, most delicious taco bowl I have ever eaten.  I would eat it every day if I could!

The only thing that keeps this from being a 5-star rating would be the service.  Our waiter took forever to take our order on anything, and we found out later it's because he was spending more time sitting at the bar watching the Bulls game than anything.  

But with $2.50 margaritas, I didn't really care all THAT much ;)

Excellent food.   The chicken tacos are scrumptious.  
We enjoyed the margaritas too.  
Defintely reccommend.

I really enjoy this place. Several Mexican beers on tap, nice atmosphere, and good service. I have had several different dishes, and all were good.  Saturday there is a couple of Mariachi players.

My favorite dish is chilaqueas Mexicanos. My wife gets a shrimp dish that she really enjoys. Drinks are reasonably priced.

Every dish we have gotten has been amazing. The food is truly incredible. The drinks are nice and strong. The ambience is super fun. It has never been very crowded. Our new favorite Mexican restaurant.
I LOVE this place!  Good food.  Good margaritas.  Beautiful tables and chairs.  Servers are nice.  My family and I come here all the time. You have to check it out.
Really good food. I enjoyed my time here. I love the chairs and booths. Very artistic.

Huge portions. Bought a restaurant.com coupon on sale for this place and used it here. Basically got $25 off our meal. Margaritas were good, cool atmosphere, and great food!

No complaints!

really good mexican food and really nice waitstaff.
Often good deals from Jewel or restaurant.com

My husband, daughter and I had lunch there today and it was great. We both have leftovers for dinner tonight too. I had chicken fajitas and my husband had some pork dish that was delicious.  Prices are good but the drinks are pricey if you are getting margaritas.  Will definitely go again. They have a good kids menu too and friendly staff.

Nice atmosphere. Waitstaff was friendly and knew what they were doing. The Chipolte pepper soup was very good. The food was...eh... so-so.... the sauce on the main course tasted like Ragu. Way too heavy on the tomato.

We came here with a restaurant.com certificate. We did not meet the minimum purchase amount, however they were willing to work out a deal, which was nice.

However, I probably will not come back.

Was excited to try this Mexican restaurant. It looked nice inside, good decor. Had a margarita, my friend had a strawberry margarita. These were good tasting. We had the chips and salsa, which were decent. The waiter made a few suggestions. I went with a quesadilla fajita. I've had something similar before. They stick the meat between two shells with the cheese and cut them into triangles. Unbeknownst to me, on this one they also put cheese on the outside. I couldn't pick it up, because it was in one large, folded large shell. Like a too-big-to-hold taco. What I've had before was in a fried tortilla shell. But you can't do that with cheese on top of them. The steak was inconsistent and the chicken just okay. It was nothing like a quesadilla, nor a fajita, both of which I love. Mine was bad, but my friends was worse. She had steak enchiladas. The red sauce they put on top was oddly flavored. She ate three bites. When asked, the manager said it was standard enchilada sauce. The manager offered to take the meal off the bill, which we agreed to.

This place is fantastic! The food was wonderful, good portions and good pricing. The staff was very friendly and our waiter was right on top of anything we needed. The cheese dip has to be the best I have ever tasted and that says alot coming from a Texas girl who grew up around mexican food!

The environment blew me away. the handcrafted, hand painted chairs and all the art is beautiful! I will definitely be returning alot!

We go here often for lunch. Good food, good chips and queso, though the queso could be warmer. Friendly servers. Good prices, especially if you get the lunch specials. They used to have a really good lunch buffet but don't so it anymore. Overall a good lunch restaurant. Haven't tried it for dinner yet.
The food here is great and the staff is even better. Always smiling and friendly. Food is delicious, hot, fast and huge portions.

Came in for their lunch hour and was not expecting to sit down in a hand crafted chair made out to what looked like palm trees and coconuts. The craftsmanship on the chairs is pretty amazing for this style of restaurant.

We were served with a small chicken chipotle soup which was a bit spicy and a bit greasy as you could see it through the broth. I ordered a shrimp, scallop and meat fajitas meal. Nothing was burned, but it did lack flavor... i kept looking for the salsa to bring something into the mix.  I also ordered a Guacamole which sadly never made its way to my table. The waiter completely forgot about my order. I was trying to feel happy about the fajitas platter I was given but the side of guac would of helped me feel happier. 

I found myself waiting on the waiter a few times for more refreshments and tortillas..... he did say its tortillas all you want and well.... I wanted more but it took way to long to come out.

We ordered the lemonade which was really good but didn't make up for the lack in taste in our food.

I cant say I would come back, although the waiter did say that If we came back they would give a guacamole on the house which i found that to be nice. 

For a lunch time hour it was not to full.... the buffet next door seems to be taking the glory thats for sure. Id go there..

The atmosphere was nice, bright, and friendly. Service was good. drinks and chips and salsa were good as well. The food though...was awful. The plate was so hot it almost burned to touch which leads me to believe it was in the microwave for 5 mins. The rice was luke warm, flavorless, and clumpy. The beans were extremely greasy. The tacos..I have had better from taco bell. The "meat" was like a flavorless paste. It was pretty pricey too considering the quality (or lack there of) of the food. Will not be returning.

Oh boy, I wish I had better news about this place. I was really looking forward to eating here. It's where the old La Magdalena used to be. I was really disappointed all the way around. 

First, it was crowded when we went last night so I figured that there must have been a reason...not to mention that it's the opening week so the food should be good. Well, it wasn't the case. 

We were seated at the only booth they had left, in the corner of the bar...no biggie. It took some time for a server to come around with chips and salsa. The salsa was spicy, which I like but my husband doesn't, but we didn't have water. I had to go to the bar to place a drink order b/c we had been sitting there for over 10 minutes without being greeted by a server. 

The menu wasn't what I was expecting either. I thought that given the name there would be grilled items offered. Nope, it's just your run of the mill Mexican restaurant, serving Americanized Mexican food. 

We placed our order and I expected the service to pick up a little bit since the manager comped our first round of drinks for being slow. That didn't happen, once again we were the forgotten table. I thought it was b/c they seemed to be busy and they're new, but the "chef" came out to greet two guys at the bar and while they were chatting I overheard that most of the servers were from the old restaurant that used to be there. Great, so they're not new just incredibly slow! 

So, despite my irritation at being the forgotten ones I was looking forward to our food, expecting it to be their saving grace. Nope, again! They really need to lay off the salt! There was so much salt in the beans that I actually puckered. We also ordered guacamole, I was expecting fresh guac but it seemed to be packaged...and it had NO flavor other than salt! 

My husband didn't really care for it either, and he's not a picky eater. We will not be returning. 

One good thing about the place that I did like was the decor. They have what appear to be hand painted chairs and booths that are really pretty. However, that's not enough for us to return.

My husband and I started coming here after we'd been going to nearby El Talpapa forever. We thought we'd give it a try and now we've been here at least 5 times. It's nothing spectacular, but the service is good, fast and friendly. The food is decent, is it the best Mexican ever? no, but I'm having a seriously hard time finding good Mexican in the Chicago burbs and this place is a good bet and much better than some other places I've been. I like it and I'll continue to visit.

I've been here a couple of times in the last month, once for dinner with book club and today for lunch.  The place is super bright and cheerful with all bright colors and there is a nice outdoor patio.  Good chips and salsa!  I had shrimp diablo (SPICY! but delicious) when I went for dinner and today I had a breakfast burrito for lunch, also delicious!  Service was good as well.  And it was cheap!  Bill was like $21 for 3 of us.

In my mission to try every taco place I come across, I was pretty excited to check out Good Tequila's.  It's down the street from me, very large, has a nice outdoor area for the summer.  Once I walked inside and saw the bright fun decor I was even more excited for this to be our new local taco place.  Sadly that won't be the case.  To keep the playing field even at all the taco places I go to, I always get steak tacos so as to compare apples to apples, err steak to steak.  Just like a taco place down the road from here, the meat was bland and had no flavor to it.  Very americanized.  I review mentioned how great the salsa was and that being my favorite food I was excited to try it.  It had no real flavor or kick to it at all.  Just cold bland tomato dip essentially.  The saving grace here was the queso.  My friend got it and, if im remembering correctly (we visited here a while ago now) that dip was the best part of our meals.  Maybe I'd come back here to try the margaritas and get a non-salsa dip and chips while catching up, but wouldn't plan a whole meal here.  This place fits a running pattern I've seen that bigger is not better when it comes to taco locations.

Burrito rice and beans no drink $16 
R u kidding. Burrito doesn't come with rice and bean and it was like $12.50
Can't afford to b back

Im gonna give them 3 out of 5 only because $2.50 Margarita they offered. Now in Roselle La Hacienda is our normal Monday Night spot but because it was raining so bad last monday we gave this place a shot.. Was I totaly disappointed no, not really I had the garlic Shrimp and my husband had a fiesta platter, portions are smaller then we get at our normal Roselle spot but the food was good we had a great time I felt great leaving after 4 Margaritas, I wont say it was a total flop but they have room to grow, its sad because im trying to support local  small businesses more and trying to stay away from big franchises when eating out to do my part in the time in need,, I feel comfortable saying that if theres another bad storm on our Monday Margarita night then Yes I would go back ... there I said it !!
Great selection of Mexican food love the orchata..
Great food and good service. The inside is colorful and happy. Reasonable price. Recommend it

Hubby and I went there for lunch because we had a gift certificate, heard good reviews and decided to try it out. Very few customers in the place and our service was very slow. Among the 3 waiters that served us, none of them were attentive. First waiter went home (shift change?). Third waiter didn't have our gift certificate and couldn't find it when he gave us the bill. Situation was amicably resolved, but odd that it wasn't communicated of the server change.

I thought the salsa was good. Guacamole was bland, but our meals were good (enchiladas). Margaritas were good, as the fried ice cream. Rated experience 2 stars due to the slow service.

I liked the brightly painted chairs and booths. Designs reminded me of authentic furniture one might find in a store in Mexico.

Well, I'd like to say I had better news, but there is a fundamental issue with the food at this restaurant. First, this is a non-margarita review (i didn't get tipsy before I ate, so it  pretty much is a non filtered review. 

The nacho chips they brought out , while fresh and nicely chewable, had a very mild taste of an un-natural product...kind of like a very very mild taste of plastic--maybe the oil they used??? Or maybe a cheap plastic bag they were stored in or how they were purchased.

I didn't take the complimentary Chicken Coodle Soup because I was really looking forward to my Hot and Spicey Buritto--but I did take a couple of sips of what my wife had left in her bowl...once again, a very very mild aftertaste of someting odd; didn't enjoy the taste at all.

The Hot and Spicey Burrito was a pretty big dissappointment. The size was ample, but the Chicken and Beef on the inside was bland and appeared to be unseasoned.

If you like Burritos, you can't go wrong with El Sombrero on Elmhurst Road in Mount Prospect or La Hacienda on Lake Street in Roselle. 

Overall: Toluca's in McHenry is the king in my eyes:

http://www.tolucasrestaurant.com/

I visited Good Tequila's for the first time last Friday and had their $7.99 lunch buffet.

It featured chicken, beef, and steak and had all the fixings you need to make an awesome taco, burrito, or taco salad.  Delicious "pre-assembled" items such as chicken and cheese enchiladas were also available.

I was also impressed by the nice selection of simple desserts, such as flan, chocolate cake, churros, and cut fresh fruit.

An excellent value for the money.  I'll be returning soon, making sure to skip breakfast that morning!

I was in town for work, and was looking for a place the locals recommend. i was not disappointed. Heck, I even tried frog legs for the first time. This place is amazing. I'll definitely be back, probably at the end of the month on my next trip out to The Hoff! 

Rob in Seattle

Pretty good!  Stopped by while on break during a volunteer stint. Have wanted to try the place for awhile, especially since there's one not far from where I live too. Ended up ordering 3/4 lb of shrimp and their hush puppies. 

Both were good and overall fairly reasonable price-wise. The shrimp was fairly crispy, maybe a little more than I would have liked even though I kept the bag closed to keep the steam in on the way back to base. Good cocktail sauce to accompany. Wish that there was a 1/2 order of hush puppies available - even though they're pretty cheap ($2.00 for 10 of them), ten is a lot for one person to eat. 

I'll be back and look forward to visiting the Portage Park location as well.

Always have had a bit of anxiety about going here for some some reason, but after a 2 years I just said screw it and I dove in. It was too hot to cook and I was hungry for something I haven't ordered yet from around the neighborhood. Yelp suggested. I took it up on its on offer. 

First off let me break down pounds to pieces of food. Approximately. 

1/2 pound Chicago shrimp = 8 shrimp. 1 person needs 8 if nothing else is ordered. Otherwise get get only a 1/4 pound. 

1/4 pound of catfish = 4 good sized strips. Maybe about a filets worth. 

Clam strips and mushrooms are a set price which I will cover in a moment. I will update you about other items as in frequent the location more. 

Being as it was my first time here, I was a little hesitant and worry about the previous reviewer's stating the employees are rude. Fortunately this was not the case at all. A young teenage girl helped me order what she thought was a good amount of food. Of course it was a bit more than I could eat but that's OK. He was very pleasant as was the lady in the back who is cooking the food. She suggested I get the shrimp, the half pound portion. I guess she did not realize I was going to order more.

After I took one bite of the shrimp and the juices oozed out. This was damn good. Other reviewers complained that it lacks seasoning. To them I say sprinkle some lemon juice on there or some salt if you want. I do understand your concerns but it's a matter of taste. The shrimp itself tasted fresh. Real fresh. The salt flavor came from the ocean it one lived in. The shrimp are also huge. 

The same goes for the catfish. It tastes exactly like how fish is supposed to taste with no smell in just a clean crisp taste in your mouth. It looks as if this batter is the same as the shrimp. Once again it is huge. 

The clam strips barely made it home as I munched on them while driving. The clam in the mushrooms do not seem to be prepared in the store. The batter it's self looks completely different than of the fish and shrimp. I don't know why people are knocking the mushrooms. They are typical mushrooms that you get from any restaurant but they only cost three dollars.

Tips: stick with the quarter pound of portions if you are going to sample. Get the dinner which includes fries and a salad if you know what you want. You get a half pound of food with that so it is a very good deal. 

And of course, keep the bag open if you take it to go and want it crispy. 

I hate myself for not going here years sooner.
first timer to this spot but glad I stopped in! Food was fresh and staff were friendly. I had the Chicago shrimp and the catfish. No complaints.

We thought just okay. I have had fabulous fried shrimp by the bag in Chicago and this paled in comparison. I like lemon squeezed on my shrimp especially when sitting in a restaurant eating and not carry out. They had no lemon. How do you offer fish and seafood without having lemon? The slaw was typical and nothing special. To me the oil seemed like it needed to be changed and quite honestly the indigestion I had afterwards will keep me from returning.
We tried the catfish, Chicago shrimp, and hush puppies. Everything was great and the price was very fair. I think you get the best deal buying per pound instead of getting the meals!

This place is not bad, definitely much needed out in the burbs but I dunno... Something is missing.

I tried the catfish, scallops and shrimp (Chicago style) the catfish was fried perfectly and tasty, however it didn't taste much like catfish, just kinda bland in the seasoning dept I guess. The shrimp are very juicy and good quality, the cocktail sauce is a big plus as well, perfectly spicy and tangy 

The scallops I could've gone without, they were good but I prefer scallops steamed and with Cajun seasoning or lemon pepper. 

Overall I liked it, but for some reason don't think I'll be coming back, maybe it's just not my cup of tea, I'm sure plenty of people would be thrilled, I guess I was hoping for catfish like I get from places out west and south side, this is not that but it's very good. Minus points because the orders don't come with bread or fries or anything. Very friendly service kept them at a solid 3!

This place knows exactly what it is and it executes it's items perfectly. I had the chicago style fried shrimp, light crispy breading and the shrimp were cooked perfect.  The hush puppies were just as good, house Autry mix is the key.  

Check this place out if ur in the mood for some classic fried seafood without all the thrills.

I think I expected too much from the "Chicago Style" shrimp. Definitely taste the quality of the shrimp used, perfect, crisp breading but no "wow" factor in the Chicago Style shrimp. I can't imagine what the regular is like. 

Breaded mushrooms were definitely a generic brand such as "Qualit" brand from the local food service wholesale stores. 

Staff was definitely friendly and well informed. They even gave instructions to not close the bag for at least five minutes to avoid making shrimp soggy. That put a smile on my face because I have a food service background and that showed me that they really cared. 

Also, get with the times and put in a soda fountain! Only canned beverages? I'm sure you know that your margin is much greater on a fountain drink than a bottled drink and also better value for your dine in customers! 

Beef up the Chicago Style shrimp Frank, for 20.00 per pound, I expected a little more "Chicago Style" boldness.

I tried FCS for the first time yesterday. I was craving Fish n Chips and didn't know of any good places to get some in the NW suburbs. 
A coworker recommended FCS to me. 
I tried the Fish n Chips which was a lot better than I had expected!
I also tried Frog Legs for the first time and I was impressed. 
I have heard that the Chicago Shrimp is the best on the menu so I'll be going back there very soon to try it out!
The restaurant is very small and easily missed if you're just driving by. I would recommend calling in your order and picking it up. 

Best Fish n Chips in the suburbs hands down.

We got the fish and the Chicago shrimp and neither were anything special.  Both items were deep fried which is never a bad thing, but flavorless.  The fish I didn't like at all and just ate one bite.  Usually deep fried fish has that light airy texture, this did not.  And the fish had an almost bitter taste to it.     

The shrimp was rubbery and flavorless too from being cooked too long.  I felt like I was just eating deep fried breading.   

We did check on Yelp before going in the place but I guess our tastes differ from the rest of the reviewers here.   We will not be going back.

We came here on a Friday night around 6pm.  It wasn't too busy, and we didn't have to wait too long to order. 

This was our first time going there so we were a little unsure about what to order.  The cashier  (an older lady) was not too friendly, and was a little rude when answering our questions. This totally turned me off, and I was tempted to leave.   

Anyhow, we didn't and opted to order a lb of Chicago gulf shrimp, 1/2 lb of scallops, 1/2 lb of catfish, and 1/2 lb of frog legs, hush puppies, and fries.  It was plenty of food for 3 adults and 3 kids.  The food was great!  The batter is not too heavy, had a great crisp, and not overly seasoned.  The shrimp were a pretty good size, and was so delicious!  The catfish was really good too!  Both are a must try!  We thoroughly enjoyed every last piece.

It's a bummer that the cashier almost ruined our  experience here.  There was another younger lady that definitely made up for her.  She was super friendly, and engaged us in conversation about the food, etc so all was not lost.

Mrs. E and I found this place by accident and were glad we did. Went not knowing what to expect, but tried a pound of the Chicago style shrimp. Terrific to say the least!  Went back the next weekend to try some other menu items. Tried fish chips, scallops and ocean perch. All were pretty good, but I will go back for the Chicago shrimp no doubt....The people behind the counter were very helpful and courteous.

If you're craving fried food, this place is it.  Had the jumbo shrimp, fish n chips, mushrooms, and hush puppies.  Cornmeal batter is a nice change from the beer batter.  Good flavor, may have lacked on the seasoning and doesn't have any strange after tastes.  Everything was fried pretty perfect, not too dry.

The ladies that run this place are great. My fianc and I thought they were fantastic. The bread crumb recipe for the fried fish and shrimp, not so fantastic. Just typical. Tried the "Chicago" style shrimp, it just smelled like there was a little garlic powder, wasn't that great. The Ocean Perch was terrible, the fish must have been old or spoiled, same situation with the catfish. 3 stars just because the fried shrimp was ok, the macaroni salad was great, and the service was fantastic. Too bad the recipe can't be dollied up a little more. And maybe some more selection and fresher fish. Prices are ok..

Frank's Chicago Shrimp House is the real deal! Absolutely fresh shrimp and fish in a no frills setting. Lots of variety of shrimp size and different breading. To bad they don't have a restaurant. They would do much more business if they were a bit south of their current location. Really well worth the stop. The original Frank's has been in Chicago on Irving Park for many many years. Just a small old timey fish shop with lots of fresh fish to purchase to make yourself, but they will prepare certain items. I'm thrilled they open a shop on Barrington Rd in Hoffman Estates.
The shrimp we ordered was so good!!!  They had 6 or 7 different dipping sauces to choose from.   Wasn't a fan of the scallops.

(NOTE:  online maps are wrong.  restaurant is NORTH of I-90, in a small strip mall on the east side of Barrington road.) 

When you think of "Chicago food,"  most likely deep dish pizza and hot dogs come to mind;  but a 'native dish' in Chicago is fried shrimp, and you'll find local chains competing for the best recipes and reviews.  The oldest, and arguably the best, is Frank's Chicago Shrimp House, with four locations.

I lived in Chicago twice and didn't know this, and having lived in New Orleans for some time, I've become kind of a shrimp snob.  There are thousands of shrimp species,  varying in size and color, dependent upon their habitat.  In recent years, methods of farming shrimp have become more developed, and a great deal of the shrimp you purchase in the grocery or at a restaurant was farm raised (not caught in the wild).  Shrimp are sorted by the number per pound, with 10 U (under 10) the largest available in the US.  11-15 would be considered "jumbo" by most any classification system.

I've been lucky to have even bigger, in the hospitable warm and food rich waters of Southeast Asia..   I've also had the pleasure of purchasing shrimp right off the boats in both New Orleans and along the Texas Gulf Coast.  Shrimp boats ply most of the Gulf Coast and you can regularly get the freshest shrimp available anywhere at a bargain price.....bring your cooler.  In addition to fresh Gulf shrimp, my very favorite is Key West shrimp, known by their bright pink color and sweet meat.

All that to say, you won't find any pond raised shrimp at Frank's.  Born in 1946 as the Ship Shape Shrimp Shake the business flourished for thirty years until ill health caused the owner to shut it down.   A few years later, a local businessman got together with the former owner with a plan to reopen. Frank's opened with the old recipes, and the founder's philosophy of selling the freshest seafood as inexpensively as possible, and was an immediate success.  These day's, Frank's daughters run the four current locations while developing more expansion plans.

The menu is brief.  Buy by the plate,  pound, or partial pound.  Fried shrimp (regular), Chicago style (spiced fried), Catfish, Scallops, Perch, Chicken Strips and Frog Legs.  Sides include fries, rings, zucchini, slaw, and a few other items.   The top price on the menu is $20 / pound for the shrimp, a fairly reasonable price.  Eat in or take out.

I opted for some Chicago style shrimp and some cat, with a few fries on the side.  Everything was fried perfectly and the 'seasoned' pieces had a slight hint of heat.  Shrimp are good sized with just the right firmness, and cooked when you order.   A choice of condiments is offered:  seafood sauce, bbq, tartar, lemon juice, and  one other I forgot already.

This is great stuff.

I delayed going to lunch today because I had a late breakfast and sone fruit in between. When My stomach rang the alarm, i was simply going to Drop into Jimmy Johns for a Freaky Fast sammitch (ha ya do'in?). 
Driving into the strip mall where it's at Franks Chicago Shrimp caught my eye. I could barely catch a view of the menu board above the counter. It didn't look all That interesting and I wasn't sure if they had Fish sandwich's. I continued to drive toward JJ's and something drew me backaround toward the front of Franks. 
I thought to myself, "it's Friday and instead Of loading up on carbs, it would be Good to eat healthy today." Good choice! I stepped in and it's far from glitzy but good, clean and functional. It reminds me of places I've eaten at along Lake Michigan, or on the near South side when folks fished the lake or the South Branch in the morning and served their catch to workmen for lunch and dinner. A true home style Chicago restaurant. I ordered  lb. of catfish and was told that they come in strips. Also ordered the potato cakes and macaroni salad. The total was $12.52, a little on the steep side, but if the meal is good, so what? I sat while they prepared My lunch and the three ladies behind the counter were done in about 5 min. Then sent me away with a buh-bye sweetie goodbye. Nice! 
 Jumped into my truck to head back to the office and as I drove away I checked the bag...... HEY! Where is my macaroni salad!??? Ilooked closely and counted the smaller bags and ramakins. It was there in a 4 oz. ramakin. A first look I thought this was a joke it was soooo cute and tiiiiny! And I'm big and HUNGRY! I returned to the restaurant and when I walked through the door, the ladies were caring for another customer and looked surprised at the ramakin in my hand. The lady that packaged my meal earlier asked if everything was all right. "This is all you get for a $1.25? Is this the bite-size portion?"I asked. Hang on she suggested and turned away for a second and retrieved another container. I had my wallet out and she looked at me and said, "don't worry about it, enjoy sweetie." Again the three left me feeling good until I sat at my desk with my lunch. 
 I opened the bag, arranged the meal. I opened the sealed ramakins and whiffed the container of Macaroni salad. Then inhaled the aroma of the catfish. YUUMMM! 
 The catfish was really lighly breaded, what is barely a seasoned breadcrumb mix and not a heavy batter. Just a little crunchy and the way they prepare it, it's not oily from a deep frier and the fish remaining flakey and moist. The cocktail sause is home made in the restaurant And has a great sweet tangy radish flavor to it. The Macaroni salad was sweet and the sauce was not a heavy creamy mess. It too hand a slight zest to it, enough so that I scraped the ramakin empty with my finger as a squegee. Also, i probably could have gotten away with just one ramakin of salad because it was so filling. But it was soooo good I'm glad I was gifted a second. Overall from the outside looking in, there isn't much to draw you to this place because I've driven by a half dozen times and found nothing persuasive to make me go in. This isn't Red Lobster ot Joe's Crabtree Shack.... It's ten thousand times better! I would enciurage them to try and market to the younger crowd to get them to try Franks Shrimp and Fish because I'm certain these kids drive by and don't appreciate what they're missing. After today, that opinion is now changed for me and this place will become a regular stop. Next time I'll try the Shrimp or shallops they serve and share that experience too. Mangia!

First time here. But definitely won't be my last. I got the Chicago jumbo shrimp basket. Omg! It was perfectly fried, seasoned and breaded. And no tails to boot! Nothing to clean. Just sit back and enjoy. The place was also very clean and the staff friendly.

Anyone who has anything negative to say about this place is nuts. I'll keep it short and sweet, the food is amazing, the workers are amazing. Stop in and let this place proove itself to you. Once you go once you'll be hooked!
Everything is fresh and very tasty! What is not to love about fired foods. They them all!

Like many other restaurants I have reviewed, we tried Frank's because of a Groupon. It was nice because we had a whole $20 to make it rain, so we were able to take advantage of the menu and try anything we wanted to. Also, since it's all fried, it didn't take long (we carried out) so we were pleased that we got a variety and it didn't take forever.

The menu is unique to me, because you can order anything you want in any quantity you need. [For example you could get 1/2 lb of Chicago Shrimp, a 1/4 lb of Frog Legs, a 1/4 lb of Catfish Strips.] I'm sure there are countless places like this, but Frank's was my first experience, so at first it was hard to get through what we wanted, but it all worked out as we stumbled through the order. The dude was understanding.

Like I mentioned, we went with the variety to get a sampling. We liked everything we got, but next time we'll target what we really enjoyed. I would go back specifically for the Catfish, and Seasoned Shrimp. Again, it's all fried, so I would order a little bit as a component to the meal versus it being the entire meal....it can be overwhelming. 

The Hush Puppies were awesome. This was my first encounter with them (and the Frog Legs) and I think my life is a little fuller. 

Another honorable mention would be the cocktail sauce. They have 3 to choose from ranging in spiciness and you really can't lose.

I'd go back when I get a craving for fried food (or when I'm completely hungover) but the bottom line is that I would definitely be back. My only wish is this that they would have a sandwich or something, but 4 out of 5 ain't bad.

Check my stats, I'm not in the business of providing outlandish numbers of 1-star reviews (only about 9% of the places I've reviewed have received 1 star). It takes some bogus crap to happen in order to land yourself in that category...so here goes:

My mom and I bought a groupon to try this place out. So excited to have a fried fish joint close to my house.

That's where the glee ends, unfortunately, because Frank's was...the worst and I wish I could give it negative stars. 

We ordered the chicago shrimp, catfish, and hush puppies and after a mixup at the register on prices and amounts, we finally left with our food.

On the way home I was so excited to get my mouth on the catfish, so my mom handed me a piece to try. I PULLED THE CAR OVER, OPENED MY DOOR, AND SPIT IT OUT. It tasted like it was SPOILED!!! It had this weird color and don't get me started on the smell...which should've tipped me off before I put it in my mouth and chewed it.

I have never experienced anything like that in my life. 

The shrimp weren't spoiled, but they weren't tasty either. The breading nor the shrimp itself seemed like they were seasoned at all. Just bland seafood.

It was too too congested on Barrington Road to want to turn around and drive all the way back to shove this food back in their faces, so whatever.

I can't give this place my business anymore and although I'd like folks to form their own opinions based on their own experiences, helping people not waste their time or money is what reviewing is all about and I take it seriously - I'd caution anyone from trying this place. 

No, seriously...don't.

Best fried catfish I've had in ages!  Thank you, Groupon, for reminding me about this place & to give them a try.  I don't know what they put in the breading for their fried items, but I'm guessing it is the crystal-meth of the fried-breading world.  It was so flavorful & came out perfectly crunchy a physical barrier between me & my fried-goodness had to be created to keep me from scarfing it all down.

We tried the catfish, shrimp (Chicago-style), veggie combo basket (cauliflower, shrooms, onion rings & zucchini) & the hushpuppies - all were fan-freakin'-tastic.  I think there was even a little bit of cheese in the fried cauliflower; yum.  I did think some of the strips of catfish were on the small side but I know everything is weighed & I got the 1/2 lb. I ordered...I would have just liked it to be bigger pieces to make up the 1/2 lb.  Next time I'll get the Hubs to try the frog legs.  I like frog legs but he's never been brave enough to try them.  Another family sitting next to us did get the frog legs to try & they seemed far bigger & meatier than any frog legs I've had in the past.

The place is tiny, maybe 8-10 small tables & they do a brisk take-out business.  The food comes out piping hot from the fryer so if you live in the area everything should still be nice & hot by the time you get it home.

A great joint for a little bit of everything. I went for lunch and had the Chicago Shrimp Dinner, which was a portion of Chicago-style shrimp, french fries and either coleslaw or macaroni salad. I ordered the macaroni salad, but I didn't eat it since I'm not a huge fan of either. The breading on the shrimp was good, but overshadowed by the shrimp taste. Not to say that a shrimp taste was bad, but there didn't seem to be a good balance. Fries were pretty great! I plan to go back with someone else and get a spread of quarter pound offerings and different sides.

We ordered the Chicago shrimp and they were done perfectly! Delish. My favorite though are the clam strips! Takes me back to the Ho Jo days. Just wish the order was larger :) Only thing that I dislike is the fact that the coleslaw is ridiculously small for the price. Would definitely recommend!
The food is amazing, the prices are a little high but it was worth it. I got the garlic shrimp dinner with macaroni salad. . .delicious! I can't wait to get some more shrimp!
This was a surprise, I have driven by many times but decided to stop for lunch. The shrimp dinner was very good. I will be coming back in the future.

I know its a shrimp place  but I was hoping for more ,  maybe a fish sandwich to go along with  a 1/2 pound of shrimp.    but other that it was  decent I did have the 1/2 lb. of shrimp. The breading was nothing special  but  good enough. The place was really clean, not the most inviting or  friendliest of people working there I felt like they thought I was a salesman  trying to sell them  something  and they were a little perturbed  that i  walked in,  once they  realized i was a customer  they seamed to  be okay then ,  my recommendations  
fish filet sandwiches  on french bread  with an cheese option 
If Im in the area  at a eating time  Il probably  come back , but  wouldn't  really go out of my way   to  go here.

First, I'll say this place does not hold a candle to Trohas in Chicago, who I consider to have the best fried shrimp in the world.  And while it may not be the best, I don't always need the best.  I'm not a snob about most things.  They're perfectly fine for most people, or they even be awesome to some others.  But they're okay and the price is right.  I've been here a couple times and the food always takes just a couple of minuted to get, since it's fried fresh.  On my most recent visit I came here on the way home around 950pm.  

I got inside and received a blank stare from the employee who told me "We're closed"

Prepare to receive my ire, with all the things I see wrong with this certain statement and situation.

First of all, if you wanted to close early, turn the fucking lights off and lock the door, that way, I don't even get out of my car when I pull into the lot. I'll see the building "looks" closed even though I know there's 10 minutes left on your clock.  So thanks for wasting my fucking time.  

Second, why even attempt to close with 10 minutes left?  Like 10 minutes is such a long ass time to get an early start on your night?  If your business hours state that you're open at this time and close at this time, I expect to receive service until your listed close time.  Which was 10 minutes after I walked in the door.  I seriously hate that.

Third, why should anyone even list a closing time if you're not going to stick to it?  May as well just open whenever you want too.  While you're at it, take a 3 hour lunch!  Don't forget your midday siesta and your afternoon nap! Lazy.

I'll come back here, unfortunately. But if I receive the same crap excuse if I come in at 945, it's not going to be good.

I'm a fan of the Chicago Shrimp and the catfish. Fish Chips are an amazing deal too. Oysters are delish!

I only wish they had homemade tarter sauce. The packets they give you are gross. The cocktail and hot sauce on the other hand are tasty.

Hard to find, but well worth it! 

GOOGLE maps had it on the Barrington Rd. overpass of I90? It's about a quarter mile NORTH of I90, in a strip mall on the east side of the street. I originally discovered this place with a GROUPON. I have returned almost a dozen times. I usually get it to go. (remember: keep the bag open)

Very casual and small (about eight tables). Nothing fancy, but the place is clean. Service is great, and the food is EXCELLENT. The Chicago-Style shrimp is my favorite. Catfish is my OTHER favorite. The hush puppies are awesome, too. I like that they give you free sauces with the shrimp or fish (others places sometimes charge extra). To ensure freshness, everything is measured and fried up at the time of your order, so expect to wait a few minutes for it.

The friendliness of the staff, and the quality of the food, keep me coming back!
The shrimp are Huge & taste awesome,  a 4 piece regular style is the perfect snack size, I'm hooked!

I'm somewhere in the middle of the recommended & not recommended reviewers.

Been several times over the last year-and-a-half.  I've found the place usually devoid of other customers whenever I've been there, usually around 1-2 pm.  Generally, the food has been what I expected, with the exception of not being able to distinguish between the "chicago style" and the "regular" fried wild-caught gulf shrimp.  Its been tasty but I honestly don't find any seasoning difference...and the last time I went I ordered both so I could compare them side-by-side, and watched them prepare it.  There was no difference, and I didn't see the gal do anything different to the shrimp before battering the chicago-style.  I thought it might just "be me" but my two fellow "late lunching dinners" couldn't tell the difference either.

The hush puppies are very tasty, however on to occasions were slightly underdone (doughy in the middle).

Unlike other reviewers, I find the french fries to be just fine, 

The place is clean, and shares a generous parking lot  with other businesses, I have had to walk a bit when the full-service restaurant next door is quite busy.

Note: as other reviewers have commented, the map feature is wrong, the business is a good mile plus north of the I-90 overpass on Barrington Road on the east side, it is the second buiness from the north end of the shopping plaza/strip mall, kind of tucked in there, and easy to miss.  A means to left turn out (to return south) is rather difficult and convoluted, but a northbound continuation on Barrington Road is easily accomplished.

Troha's shrimp is really a tough act to follow... 

I visit Willow Creek Church and sometimes go for lunch in the area. I noticed Frank's Chicago Shrimp House in a mini strip mall and thought, 'okay let's give it a try'. There is overall curb eye appeal, however, once inside it reminded me of a basic shrimp house come to the northwestern burbs. I did expect a bit more, although, since I'm not from the area, I guess I got what I was used to seeing. Everything is clean; there is a sitting area, the counter was tidy. The cooks/counter ladies were also very nice...However the food...

It's not Troha's. It was a bit heavy on the seasonings and the batter was more like a breading. If you haven't had Troha's in Chicago's Little Village, you might say, "Hmmm, this is pretty good shrimp", but since I have; it doesn't compare. 

I will return, simply to give it a far shake and try something else, but since this is what the burbs have to offer; I guess this is as good as it gets, for those who don't venture into Chicago, (let alone the Little Village).

Don't be afraid. Live a little. "Life is a daring adventure, or nothing". (Helen Keller) Do you want, 'as good as it gets? Fine, but if you want the best - there's Troha's in the Little Village.
Shrimp kicks ass. I didn't care for the catfish but was happy with everything else I ordered. Good value, friendly service.
I love the Chicago shrimp, catfish, perch, hush puppies, and the hot sauce!!! Best in the burbs!

Shrimps are very big and good loved the hush puppies
But make sure you check your bag before you leave that
You have everything you ordered

Chicago style fried seafood in the far nor'west burbs? Yes, please.

From the simple menu to the traditional sides, this place really hit the spot for my authentic down and dirty city fried seafood cravings.

I wanted to try a little bit of everything so we ordered a little bit of each of the following: Chicago shrimp, scallops, catfish strips, clam strips, perch, fries, and coleslaw.  I can't say there wasn't anything I didn't like about the entire line up except that I overate and suffered from heartburn as a result.  It was worth it though and I'd do it again.

None of our items were overcooked so everything was tender and just the right amount of chewy or flaky.  All items were made to order so absolutely nothing came out from under a heat lamp. I think the only time they may even use a heat lamp is to keep a partial order warm while the rest of the order is completed.

The lady who took our order was very friendly and suggested different sauces that complimented each item we ordered.  She made sure we had enough hot sauce and other various condiments as well.

If I could handle the heartburn and massive amounts of fatty calories eating at this place imparts, I'd be here all the time loading up on that tender, moist, breaded just right goodness. Definitely one of my area favorites!

I had to make a quick trip out to Hoffman Estates and in was lunch time. I stopped in a Franks Chicago Shrimp House. I had tried some Shrimp & Scallops.I liked the coating. The Staff was friendly and accommodating. The food was delivered to my table (there was only 4 other pople in the place for late lunches. 
Franks is a new esteblishment. It was very clean and the food was very good. he scallops turned out well. Shrimp was good too. If I am back in that area I will stop by and maybe try some fish. Parking was good.
Simply the best jumbo shrimp around.  You can get it Chicago style which is lightly seasoned or plain, either way it's great!

It's tasty, it reasonably priced, and it's on my way home from work :). The shrimp and cat fish are amazing, and everything is cooked to order. The sides are so-so, but that's okay, since I'm really not going there for them. And you can not leave without getting an order of hush puppies. FYI, everything is fried, so this is a cheat day kind of place.

We had  a Groupon and decided to go here. Placed an order for 1/2pound shrimp and a pound of catfish and hush puppies. The order was taken wrong first of all and after receiving our order we headed home. OMG!... WTH! The shrimp were tasteless. The catfish had the weirdest smell and the color was all wrong. The hush puppies  were very oily and  not good. Soooo...disappointed in Frank's. What a waste of travel time and money. I really don't want to give any stars.

So, I drove past this place because I thought it was a mirage, then, I stopped.  From the service to the greasy brown bag.  This is it y'all! Chicago Style Scrimps are in the burbs.  Goose Island, Laurence's, Franks....no need to travel to the Chi anymore.  Franks is the real deal, related to the one on Archer,  the shrimp were hot and fresh and the sauce,mmmmmmm.  I mix mild and hot.  Now that I know it's real, time to get hungry enough for a pound!

Now the 'burbs needs a Harold's Chicken!!!!

The best fried oysters we've had in years! They sell them as a side order and you get (usually) 5 nice sized oysters for $3.50. If you like fried oysters...you've gotta try theirs! We stop by when we're in the area.

Hot, fresh seafood coated in a delicious batter?    Is there anything better?   Sold by the 1/4, 1/2/ 3/4 and 1 full pound..   The shrimp is piping hot and very tasty.   First timers beware.,..  you will be coming back for more.

Bought a Groupon and went with my wife and 10 year old grandson.
Ordered the regular, Chicago style and jumbo shrimp.
All were huge and very, very good.  My personal favorite was just the regular shrimp.
We also ordered the home made onion rings, fries and hush puppies.
My grandson couldn't stop eat the hush puppies, he had never eaten them before.
All the sides were good.
I was born and raised on the Chicago northwest side,  Spent many nights and dollars eating and buying shrimp at the fish shack on Armitage at the river. 
Franks brought me right back to my younger years.
I can't wait to go back!  I want to do the catfish next.
I bought 2 Groupons so look out, here I come!

Hmm. I was really excited about the catfish, but it wasn't what I was expecting. Maybe I am just too southern. Zucchini had an odd cheesy taste.  Calamari was tough and chewy.  Chicago shrimp was good. Hush puppies were great, but fried bread almost always is!  It's better than Joe's, but isn't anything special.

Woo! Man if there's anything I love about the northwest burbs is that there's this plague of Chicago foods moving up. This is one of them, for sure.

Fried shrimp, clam strips, and hush puppies in a brown paper bag? Yes, please! 

The shrimp are jumbo sized and the clam strips are delicious. Their hot sauce is pretty decent too. I think I'm just over excited that there's a place like this right down the street from me.. Love it! I highly suggest if you love fried seafood you should give this a try..

Sometimes, I just want food served in a basket or a greasy, brown paper bag.

I drive by this scrimp place everyday and decided to bring some home one night.  I ordered a pound of Chicago style shrimp, a basket of mixed veggies and hush puppies.  YUM!  We chowed down and loved it so much, we went back the very next day because I needed it.  The same girl was there, and of course had to make a comment to me about 'two days in a row, huh?' Listen honey, why don't you quit ripping on me and get to fryin'.

The third time I went, they didn't have the menus with the coupons anymore and they didn't have any mushrooms for the fried veggie basket.  What!?!?  That's the best part!  I will still go back.  $30 for a big bag of greasy, fried goodness!  Heartburn be damned!

Ok the shrimp is great and all, but really the star here is the catfish. So greasily crunchy on the outside and remarkably moist on the inside, it retains all of its flavor in the fryer and comes out better than the sum of its parts. Dip it in the house-made hot sauce with a side of hush puppies and I'm going to die if I don't eat some of this right the hell now.

Nice no-frills joint that has crunchy seafood!  Clean and simple enough on the inside to eat comfortably....we had a 1/2 lb. of their chicago jumbo shrimp and tried a 1/4 lb. of the catfish.  Have to say that the shrimp were not quite as great as places like Trohas, but still really really yummy....shrimp is crunchy on the outside and crisp + fresh on the inside!  The catfish was surprisingly delicious too....same kind of crunchy outside and the inside was nice and meaty + moist :)  They were super nice too and give us some fries on the side too for free!  Fully enjoyed it as a mid-day bite on a warm day!
This place has great shrimp. We had the Chicago style, delicious, and great sauce too.
Paid $15 for 3/4 lb of shrimp out of which more than half was batter. Extremely small portions and pre frozen ingredients.  Waste of my money!

I grew up going to the Frank's Chicago Shrimp House in Portage Park and was so excited that they opened up a new location in the suburbs! I always order the Chicago Style Shrimp and they are amazing EVERY TIME. The Hoffman location has had the same outstanding quality that I know and love. Seriously, you will not find better fried shrimp anywhere.

Always great Shrimp, shrimp is in the name and shrimp is what I get. My orders always come back correctly, never had a problem. If you like your shrimp with a little extra kick, you can order it Chicago Style and they add garlic and maybe something else to the breading, but the shrimp are the stars, gulf shrimp not farm raised, and very very tasty. Did I mention that the prices are great too?

Ok yes yes I tried Franks Chicago Shrimp and yes it is a little like the Goose Island or other spots in town it was hot and fresh but a little lite on spice for me. i'm going to being going back however because it is a touch of the old city in the burbs where I am mostly now.

Went back a few more times and I am now a fan.  The shrimp look normal now, not split in half and the seasoning is better.  I typically get the Chicago style shrimp with hot sauce.  The shrimp are tender and juicy and the sauce is just the right heat.  Service is quick and always accurate.  Call ahead to walk in and out.

The jumbo fried shrimp were very good as were the hush puppies.  On the flip side - the scallops were poor -  I would have rather had 3 - 6 sea scallops vs.  a pile of watery tiny bay scallops.    The service was prompt,  but not really engaged.   Also the packets of tarter sauce made me feel like I was eating at the company cafeteria,  not at a restaurant.

Love this place,  had dinner here a few nights ago and enjoyed everything so much!  The flavors are spot on every time we come here.  I've tried almost everything on the menu and Naomi's is spot on and fresh.  Unique combinations on rolls and an amazing fried rice on the specials menu too.  And don't forget there is a happy hour menu that also has great options if you can get there in time.  We probably eat here a few time a month for the past couple years.  Bravo Naomi

I hate writing bad reviews, but I must confess that I've never heard one of these two statements at a sushi restaurant, let alone both in the same night:

1. "We don't have any more rice". 
2. "No more miso soup". 

What??

Let's keep in mind that this place is located in a strip mall along with a brand-new Tony's supermarket. If you're really are out of rice, go get some next door and make it. It takes 15 minutes to do so from start to finish.


Mind you, this is a 7:30PM reservation for 6 on a Saturday night.  It's not as if we showed up as the place was closing. 

Food- Subpar at best.  Like many sushi fusion  restaurants, this place is owned and run exclusively by Korean personnel. Usually a good thing, as they are typically some of the best restauranteurs in this biz.  That being said, when you order a bulgogi (Korean staple) appetizer and it's not been marinated like all bulgogi is and must be, you start to get concerned about the rest of the meal.  Instead, it came out dry and was merely drizzled with some ponzu sauce that they had leftover. 

Onto the rolls.  Usually the spicy mayo/sauce  on top of your sushi is mixed with Sriracha or some other spice. Theirs came out pure white and had the flavor of a generic Miracle Whip. 

Chicken Teriyaki dish for in-laws: Way over cooked. 

I felt bad for the poor waiter. He was profusely apologizing for the food (or lack thereof) all while the senior hostess (surely the owner) was barking orders and interrupting him while he was trying to take ours.

I give this place six months before the doors are shut.  Even the water fountains and other Asian-infused decor in the front of the house were shut down and literally roped off with a paper sign.

I think I am going to continue doing "complement sandwiches" for my reviews. They seem to be easier to write, and keep all my thoughts straight without ranting.

+Very nice owner
+Offers happy hour/deals/website coupons
+Quality of ingredients seems 7/10
-Decor is just rubbish. You have to see it to understand.
-Not very busy (guess that could be a pro)
-Due to lack of guests, you will be the focus of an over attentive owner/waitress
-Normal menu prices are high for a place like this
-Crazy slow on the food
+Maki selection is good, overall food is 7/10
+Very nice owner (yes, I know I said that twice)

Just ok. Ambience is cute but a bit tacky. The $24 dragon lobster roll think was definitely not worth it. Only lobster I saw was the empty shell served as decoration. If what's inside that tail was somewhere in the sushi roll it still wasn't my money's worth. Another weird thing is the philly roll featured thin strips of lox. Yes, not sushi quality salmon at all. Service was quite slow as well. Overall not a fan. Too many other great places around.

We've been going here for a couple years now, and Naomi is awesome!  they always have nice specials and the atmosphere is pleasant. The staff is great, too! The only thing is it's a bit pricey, so we've used Restaurant.com coupons, which they've accepted every time...so that always makes the experience GREAT! Love this place!!!

This was a great Yelp suggested date night.  We had a great experience, even though the store is stuck in a strip mall.  The sushi was a little pricey, but that's always the case.  We had a good night and left satisfied.  I'd call ahead if you want to eat here on a Friday night.

I came to this restaurant last June and loved it so much I dragged my boyfriend along for a second visit. I promised him it was great, but it was disappointing. The sushi actually tasted like it had been frozen and then thawed. It didn't taste fresh. 

Still very nice decor and wonderful service.

I love Naomi's, it's my favorite place for sushi in Arlington hts because of its wonderful service and great food! I have never left hungry or upset. Ambiance is cheesy but cute. Sushi and appetizers great. Crunchy spicy crab ($3) roll was just the right amount of crunchy but was not really spicy. The spicy salmon ($4) roll which had a great portion of salmon in there and the kick was great. Finally my favorite the little Godzilla ($10) , it was delicious in all ways. Definitely recommend this to everyone I know. The prices were reasonable and I will come back!

My first time to this place and it was wonderful. Very cute interior with nice seats and soft relaxing music.  Our server was fast, nice, and attentive. 

We order the baby godzilla (12 pcs), king kong, and 2 teriyaki chicken dinners. Everything was excellent to taste and they give a very large portions of sushi! We even have left over teriyaki to take home and what's even better is that they accepts groupons!! Definately coming back again.

I absolutely fell in love with this restaurant! It is so cozy. It has couches, regular tables and tables under fishnet curtains and bamboo for extra privacy. Every table has a candle and the whole place has perfect lighting and japanese decoration. The waiter was extremely polite and attentive. The entire staff was the same and this is not an exaggeration. He took our orders as soon as we were ready. The food was just so delicious. I ordered the Baby Godzilla which is fried shrimp crab roll with cream cheese and avocado. It comes with two different sauces. Every meal is preceded with a salad and then Miso soup. The Japanese wine is sweet with a hint of citrus. They cleaned up our plates as soon as we were done. We were about to leave when the waitress told us to stay because she was bringing us ice-cream on the house! No joke I am ready to go back! The prices are very decent starting at $5 for appetizers  to $12 for regular sized plates. Parking is right next to the door. I love this place!

I love this place! As a native Arlington heights gal I've driven past this place for YEARS. My sister pulled in the parking lot and I'm so glad she did! Their sushi is so reasonable and their miso soup is probably my favorite. Very fresh fish and the cutest seats! My sister said she felt like she was in Thailand! Absolutely delicious, you've got a new customer! Thanks so much for a good experience.

Who says you need to go to Chicago to get the best talents to prepare a wonderful meal for you? Why drive endless hours in traffic to dine in Chicago and later be disappointed by its pretentious ambiance? With it's abundance of parking and lack of city traffic, this local gem is easy to get to. The faade is modest with white curtains hanging from the inside, which might fool a first timer to think it's a hole-in-the-wall. As the saying goes, you cannot judge a book by its cover. When you first open the door, it's like opening the gates to a Japanese heaven, where you are greeted by a Japanese goddess. And her name is Naomi.

I've visited many sushi restaurants around the city for a number of years now. Some were hits, others were misses. Naomi is ranked top 3 sushi restaurants that I've been to. This is surprising since you only hear about good sushi in Chicago and never the burbs. After my visit, Naomi quickly became one of the best sushi experiences I've had in a long time. From the miso soup to the main course, everything was delectable.  The fish used on the sushi was as fresh as it comes. You can easily notice the experience that these sushi chefs have obtain over the years by the quality of each sushi that comes to your table. 

Overall, Naomi is an exceptional restaurant that caters to even the pickiest eaters. If they moved the entire restaurant and placed it on Michigan Avenue, it could easily be one of the best sushi establishments in Chicago. Since I'm only minutes away from its current location, I wouldn't allow it. The service is friendly and attentive.

The owner, Naomi, is a charming host.
This restaurant is beautiful and the food is always fresh and delicious.
Great decor and comfortable seating.
Parking is very easy in their parking lot.

I have been a customer for many years and the food quality has remained consistently high.
I recommend you give Naomi a try.

Great little sushi place for an intimate dinner with your significant other or friends. Food always tastes fresh and delicious. Outstanding service, our second time at the restaurant the waitress remembered us and our preferences. They know what is allowed for pregnant women and will make recommendations as well as use separate knives and boards to make your sushi. We highly recommend Naked Tuna roll, Trio Tartar appetizer, California roll is different, but very good.
We love Naomi. Take out or dine in. Red dragon, black thunder, spider roll. Edamame is best in town!  Trust me, I'm a native Japanese and love their food!

Loved the cozy and relaxed atmosphere! The covered tent seating areas were a neat touch. Happy hour was a bargain! Hot tea and crab poppers were excellent. The Godzilla roll was huge and very yummy! The California roll was average, but still good. Overall, this was a great place for an affordable weeknight dinner date!

Why do these great places always go downhill within a few years? 

I loved Naomi sushi and truly looked forward to coming here, this is one of the first places I went to for sushi and even though I now live closer to other places I prefer I still come around...

So when I saw the groupon I got it! 

Wish that would've been a good idea but it wasn't. I got a reality check today while having dinner here. 

The sushi USED to be top of the line. Now it's subpar even for the discounted price.

We ordered the rainbow and the fish was fishier and kind of off-tasting, there was no avocado this time, just crab salad. Wasn't the tastiest 

We then got the zebra, this one was pretty good, probably the best roll we had but still not as mouth-watering as I remember 

We ordered shrimp tempura and spicy tuna rolls that were just not as good as I expected (reminded me of sushi you pick up at a good grocery store, good but not good enough)

To top it off our waiter was slow and forgetful (horrible combo for a waiter) but he always said sorry for forgetting us haha if that makes it any better


He also didn't know how the groupon  worked so I somehow didn't get my $40 for $25 I ended up just getting a $35 credit and he said there was nothing he could do! That was the last straw! Oh well I'm not coming here anymore there's a sushi place down the street (5th avenue) that I hear is better so I'll give them a shot.
Love coming here, Naomi  is so welcoming. Food is great and always  fresh. Always highly  recommend  this place to my friends.

Been a fan for years but a few concerns have me thinking Naomi's is at risk for a downgrade. GREAT food, overlook the shortcomings.

I just dined here last night and a couple problems they haven't corrected persist. The big one is they have a small staff, resulting in employees taking on multiple duties and dragging out wait time. In our experience the wait wasn't as much an issue after they have your order, the rolls keep coming at a steady pace. The apps, sushi, rolls, are all good and of quality but the cocktails could be better. I tend to order some sake and a saki bomb. It's been a while since stopping by on a Fri or Sat night so I don't know how busy it gets, but the sofa probably acts more as decor than purpose. It would make sense in a lounge setting and there was a lot of business, but with a lacking cocktail selection I don't see it being utilized.

They used to have a website with a menu, but I can't seem to find it which is a bad sign. Did they figure it was an expense worth cutting? I hope not because it doesn't encourage take out or potential customers if people can't see when they are open or what they serve. 

Please Naomi's, don't kill off your own business. This is my 'go to' sushi place and would hate to see it go. I miss seeing who I assumed was the owner, a friendly and outgoing woman who recognized you and made you feel welcome and appreciated.
Great food and price! Only reason I gave a 3 star review is we waited at least 15 minutes to be greeted.
Great Sushi and not to expensive. Generous portion sizes, nice atmosphere, Highly recommended!
The best sushi around!!! Sushi is delicious and fresh. Naomi is a great host! Service is good with a nice interior.

Very rude service.... Waitress was not kind when we asked for separate checks. The octopus nigiri was legitimately frozen when I bit into it. Very overpriced for extremely mediocre sushi... The  crunchy tuna rolls are extremely small so even though its daily special you might as well get specialty roll with more pieces. Drinks are overpriced. Last time I come here.

A Great Experience All Around!

We've driven past Naomi Sushi a number of times since my sister moved into the area, but only just now got around to trying it.  It's absolutely wonderful!  We'd made a reservation, so I was greeted by name at the door.  And they called me by name all through the dinner.  

The decor is very nice - lots of draped fabric, nice cushions with supportive backs for the platform seating, and other nice touches that do wonders to keep down the noise.  The food was great, and the service was amazingly gracious.  

What I found most interesting is that the basics even had great attention to detail.  As at most sushi places, with the Maki, we got miso soup and a salad. Often times at those places, these two are after-thoughts. Not at Naomi.  The miso soup had great flavor, and the salad was fresh with a tastier-than-usual dressing.  And the avocado roll (the avocado roll, for Pete's sake) was both beautiful and very tasty.  

If you're in the neighborhood of Rand and Palatine, or even if you're not, this is a wonderful gem!

I loved this place, i like all the private booths they have. The sushi we tried were all really good and the price was decent! When we came there weren't that many people there, so the service was really good, very attentive. I would definitely come back here again!

I love Naomi's

Anytime I get out to the suburbs this is the sushi spot that I hit up the most.  The sushi and the service is excellent.  The owner is very friendly and personable.  She remembered me after only one visit that was 6 months prior.  She now greets me every time like we are friends.  Always happy and entertaining it only helps with the experience as the food is very good.  

Go during the happy hour and get a good deal on sushi.

This is one of those little gems tucked within a random strip mall, but a perfect place for date night. Beautiful decor and atmosphere. The service was very friendly as well. However I was really pleased with the amount of quality food we got for a good price. We walked out of there stuffed!

Great sushi! We really look forward to coming here, especially for happy hour! But the service is not very good. When I asked to get more wasabi they wanted to charge me extra! I thought that was a bit ridiculous..

I absolutely loved Naomi Sushi. I came here with a deal from restaurant.com and I would definitely come back here again!

The restaurant owner personally helped us. She asked what we liked and picked out an appetizer, three rolls, and a desert for us! Everything was spot-on and we really felt like we were being taken care of. Great atmosphere, great owner, great sushi. I've recently moved to the area and now I've found my new sushi place! I would highly recommend Naomi Sushi to anyone!
Great customer service. Baby gorilla was excellent and shrimp tempura was also fantastic
Great sushi at great price.  The house specials are amazing deals.  Some very imaginative rolls.  The owner is friendly and talkative.  Take her advice on what to try.

The service is terrible and slow. The food tastes old - our yellowtail was frozen! When we were ready to order the woman waitress would ask me a question and walk away. This happened 2 times! Then when I ordered sashimi (fish no rice), she brought nigiri. How long does it take to get your food 30+minutes. And don't order the draft sake - doesn't taste right. Overall a funny experience. And the white tuna was ok.

GOOD FOR SUSHI-ONLY LOVERS, BAD FOR OVERALL RESTAURANT EXPERIENCE

While the sushi quality is still good, everything else has sadly gone downhill over an accelerated pace. My spouse and have been semi-regulars over the past few years, and our experience just last week had us both shaking our heads. Walking in the place, it is just a complete mess of decor. They have an above-ground stone fish pond, so it's impossible to see when seated but you certainly hear it. There are boxes of supplies everywhere, including cleaning supplies, near actual serving tables. Some of the cheap stone sculptures even have cobwebs on them. The lighting inside is very poor and even depressing.

It seems that the only person the owner can afford to have work there is a younger relative, I'm guessing either her son or a nephew. He tries to be polite but he clearly has no serving experience and doesn't seem to really want to be there. Not once during our entire meal did he offer to check on us and see if we needed anything. 

Unfortunately it seems like there's too much of a culture gap for the owner consider any consumer feedback over why her regulars are leaving, and the places always seems to be very sparse with patrons. We're thinking they may not make it another 4 months. It's a shame because they really could be making some changes that wouldn't cost them much that could bring people back in.

UPDATE: THEY HAVE NO ONLINE MENU! When I called to ask where I could find a menu, they told me to drive to their place and wait at least 20 minutes, depending on how busy they were. What's the point of doing take out if they can't even have a take out menu available online???? Geez.
Took my family of five here last Saturday night. 100% satisfied with food, ambiance, service and prices.  We will be back for sure!

I came in on a Thursday night. Placed a to go order. The restaurant is very cozy! I like what they did to the place. At the bar they have a great display of sake! I ordered the marinated Japanese steak as an appetizer, edamame, prawn hibachi, and their signature rolls. Mini me was one of them. They even carry black rice! They even gave me a free ramune!

I got the Groupon so I decided to try the place out.  Always passed by it but never went in. The place itself is interesting. And i havent decided if thats a bad thing or a good one. I am not sure if they are confused about the decor or its supposed to be that way. There are some couches but it's not a lounge. There are some high tops and some regular tables. There are a lot of sapporo boxes that are placed as if to separate the restaurant.  Over all looks like the place of a college student that just moved in and doesn't know what to do with grammie's hand me down couches and other lawn looking furniture. 
The service was not bad, could have have been better but I can live with it. 
The sushi was great, I ordered the dragon and bear roll, my friend had the veggie roll and edemames. My rolls were supposed to come with Miso soup which i never got but there was too much food anyway, I am not sure I needed it. 
Overall a good experience. Will come back :)

Far and away our favorite sushi place. Staff is super friendly and wants to ensure you have a good experience. I come here often for their "happy hour" 1/2 price sushi special. Mayor's roll and Fire Maki are nice options for less adventurous diners as they are cooked. Although I do like other sushi restaurants, you just can't beat Naomi!

Excellent little sushi spot.  You wouldn't know it by the location, but really, really solid.  

The wild dragon (I believe is the name) roll was one of the best rolls I've ever had.  Lobster, king crab, caviar and pretty much just fresh awesomeness.
