I'm by no means a sushi nut or expert, but I've had my fair share.  We will get the craving once every other month and Naomi was our choice mainly because of the yelp and google reviews.  

Generally I'm a spicy tuna kinda guy and not a big adventurer when it comes to sushi although I did eat outside my comfort zone a little @ Naomi.  

We can definitely recommend.  Enjoy!

I love this little place. Its right in front of Ultra Foods in a little strip mall next to a dentist office and it was sooo good. They have unique sushi choices. I would recommend reservations since they do not open until 5pm. We had to wait a little while for our sushi to come out so they ended up giving us a free dessert. It was totally unnecessary but we appreciated it. I have told a few people about this place just because I think its the best tasting reasonably priced sushi places I have had in the area and it has a nice little set up inside the dining area.
Excellent food and service in a timely manner.

The food is okay. The bento boxes (combinations) are pretty huge. It comes with soup, salad, the entree, rice, 3 pieces of nigiri, cucumber and crab salad, various tempura (shrimp, asparagus, squash, sweet potato) and a california roll. They cut large pieces of fish for their sushi and rolls so you get the right size of fish for the price you pay. The food earns itself the 3 stars.

However, the service.....

is.....

so.............

.................

.................

slow.

It is unbearable. I don't know any restaurant that makes the customers wait an hour and ten minutes before receiving their food. I would blame it on the restaurant being full, but there are only ten total tables and two sushi chefs. No matter how you do the math, it doesn't make sense. Also, one of the waitresses looks like she'd be anywhere else than there. Don't get me wrong, everyone has days they don't want to go to work. But when you're in the service industry, you can't bring it to work.

If you have 3 hours to kill on food that is exactly average, this might be the place for you.

Personal Recommendation: Don't get the golden shrimp if you like golden sauce, their's tastes almost purely like egg. Any sushi or roll will probably be your best bet for the money.

Great atmosphere, fantastic food, and the service is very authentic to Asia. 

They have the nicest wait staff and the good is great. I recommend going in with an open mind to try rolls you have never had before, they are as fresh as can be here.
Fabulous food.  Understaffed.  Try the Fire Maki and Naomi Roll.  Very tasty.  Be patient--it may take awhile.

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.  GOT YELLED AT BY THE OWNER FOR NO REASON.

I just had the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant at this place.  We didn't even order due to the way we were treated.  One star is beyond generous for my experience.

Originally their happy hour was from 4-6 but lately they've been cutting it back.  My friend arrived just before 5:20 and the woman (owner) told her she needed to order now because happy hour was over.  She pointed out the sign on the front door said it ends at 5:30 and she was given some odd excuse about "it ends at different times depending on how much fish we have."  Umm...What?

Earlier that day, I had purchased a restaurant.com certificate for $25 for Naomi.  The only stipulation was that you had to spend $37.50 to use it.  There was no mention about it not being valid during happy hour.

Another friend of mine and I joined our previously seated friend at the table.  I had the certificate out so I could tell the server before we ordered but I never even got a chance.  The OWNER came up to us and started YELLING about how they can't accept that saying things like "you're already getting a discount" and "we obviously can't do that, HELLO?!?!?!" and "she was the owner so she makes the rules."  We tried to tell her the certificate doesn't say anything about that (we had kind of expected it to be turned down) but she gave us no time to talk.  She then told us it was expired even though I made the purchase less than an hour before arriving at Naomi and the certificate says it never expires.

We got up and left and warned the people walking in about how horribly we were treated.  It is completely unacceptable to yell at your patrons, especially repeat patrons.  Unbelievably terrible experience.  I will never return and will continue to tell others of my nightmare of an experience.  We went to Sushi Yaki in Buffalo Grove instead.
One of the best sushi places I have been to. Service was great and the sushi was incredible. Definitely our new date spot!

Enjoyed the food, atmosphere.  Had edamame and Bulkoki beef appetizers. Two sushi roll specials, and mochi ice cream.  

The appetizer portions were good for two.  The beef was very tender and flavorful.

The sushi rolls came with salad and miso soup, rounding out the meal nicely.  The sushi was well prepared and nicely presented.  

I like the decor and the traditional jazz playing in the background. Prices were reasonable.  Will definitely return.

Been here several times for dinner dates.  From the outside, it looks like a tiny place in a strip mall, but there's actually plenty of room inside.  I don't personally like the decor... bright green walls, paint splashed floors, random sculptures (including a triceratops if you sit in the back booth near the exit sign).  The turtle at the front, though, is a cute touch. 

I'm giving them a four-star review because their rolls are really good, and they have a bunch of their own rolls that I wouldn't find anywhere else.  For example their black thunder (eel, black rice, scallops) isn't something I could find normally, and it's super good!  

I'd suggest coming during happy hour (4-6 PM on weekdays) for 1/2 price sushi.  Note, though, the deal is not for all of their rolls, which is just a small selection (which they must have recently made even smaller than it previously was...). It still has some good deals.  

P.S. if you like sea urchin (uni), you need to call ahead of time apparently - they don't carry it normally.
The worst experience ever..wait for 10mins to have a seat. And wait 1hr still have not got my food...now still waiting....never come back again!

The sushi here is pretty good but the service is very lacking.  The few times I've been in here it has been maybe 3 tables occupied total and it took them forever to seat us.  One time they had the gall to ask if we had reservations (again the restaurant was practically empty), then told us we needed to wait because we didn't.  I wish we had walked out but we were starving.  Save yourself and get carryout.

Went here on a recent Saturday. The weather was bad, so the place was pretty empty. They still sat us at the table closest to the kitchen... that was kind of annoying! It ended up being fine though, like I said they weren't that busy so there wasn't a lot of noise or rush. 

This place has a LOT of specialty rolls, I only wish we got to try all of them. We usually go to sushi buffets rather than standard restaurants, so I was a bit put off by the prices at first, but our bill - three appetizers, two special rolls, two plain rolls, three servings of sashimi, a bottle of wine, a bottle of sake (what can I say... we're a drinking family), tea, and two desserts - a very reasonable $140 for three people. Service was very prompt, Naomi herself was very pleasant. She picked out one of the special rolls for us and offered us toro, which was not on the menu. Overall, a good first experience.

I have driven past this restaurant a multitude of times.  The sign stating "Best Sushi" always tempted me to try it out.  However, the strip mall location is not very alluring.

Yes, the sushi is good... but the service was sooooo slow.  Naomi is a cute little restaurant, but for some reason when I entered it was completely empty on a Saturday night.  The maki rolls and complementary miso soup were all taste, but the wait between each dish seemed like an eternity.  I also found the rolls to be a bit pricey in comparison to other local sushi restaurants of the same quality.  Maybe I caught them on an off night?  I will have to return and reevaluate.  I just wish Naomi sushi was open for lunch!

By far some of the best sushi I've had and received amazing service!

We ordered a dragon roll, a godzilla roll, 2 salmon sashimi and 2 unagi sashimi. Everything was extremely delicious! The godzilla was so creamy and the small cut pieces were perfect... okay maybe a bit large, but they were cut thin so it was easier to manage. The dragon roll is usually my favorite and it was definitely very tasty. The eel pieces were some of the best I've ever had!

I loved the fact that with our meal we got a free salad and miso soup each! Both were very good! The salad didn't have the wasabi spicy stuff on the top, as most other restaurant do, but I actually liked this better! The miso soup was perfect, not too salty, and the tofu was soft and cut into perfect little squares.

Some of the prices on the menu are a bit steep, like there is aroll for $24, but the rolls that we got were all worth the higher price. PLUS because you get the free salad and miso soup you get more bang for your buck. We ended up paying a very reasonable price for 2 people.

The wait for our food was almost nonexistent. After ordering our sushi, we instantly received our salad, then soup, and as we were finishing our soup we received the sashimi, then dragon and then came the godzilla. I actually really liked how they did things in a certain order.

The decor is so cool! The seats and booths were my favorite part! I like it that on the bench part of the booths were are these soft butt pillows with back on them, very comfy!

We were served by 2 different ladies, and one of the ladies were very cool and kept joking with us. Something triggered a thought to me that the funny knowledgeable lady is the owner, so after we dined we asked the other waitress if it was true, and it was! Oh Naomi is so cool! She did an excellent job with this restaurant.

We were here on a Saturday and the restaurant was pretty empty, which is surprising because the food is great. I assume maybe the hole-in-the-wall look from the outside makes people think that its a lame place. Don't be fooled! Don't judge a book by it's cover and come and try out Naomi's, you will not be disappointed.

Went here a little while ago for a friend's birthday and just getting around to write the review. Honestly, wasn't a fan of the place. It has the dim light, "romantic" setting going on, or at least it TRIES to have that setting going on. For me, the place fails in that respect, it kinda looks cheap, can't exactly explain it, but it's no Wildfish, just another copy cat. 

The sushi was very bland, and I mean maybe we didn't get all the fancy rolls, but I don't think quality of fish should be judged by the big, special rolls. Overall, the ratio of rice to fish was rice overload, so definitely not a fan of that.  The good news is that no one got sick and that we were surrounded by good company, but overall it was just a okay. This is not a place I personally plan on going unless they really change up their sushi quality. I gave them an extra star for decent service, and some of my friends enjoy this place. For hubby and I--it's a no, especially since the prices aren't cheap.

Disclaimer: 3.5 stars... I always round up.

I have been driving past Naomi Sushi on a regular basis for several years now, and had never tried it.  I've seen it on Groupon Now a lot, but, as my cousin Lisa tells me (and I've proclaimed proudly myself) I am a sushi snob.  I don't eat sushi everywhere.  I don't eat grocery store sushi.  I don't eat questionable sushi, and I don't eat buffet sushi.  Call me crazy... just... no.

So, on to Naomi Sushi.  Last night, I caved and purchased the Groupon Now.  $25 for $40, not a bad deal for a last minute meal choice.  We got to the restaurant around 8:15, and it did take awhile to be seated, but I can't fully blame the staff for that.  There was a group of teens trying to pay quickly because their dad's were waiting outside, and a large party group (10+) being served.  The staff seemed a bit flustered at that point, but quickly recovered.

The ambiance and decor of the place is cute and romantic.  No wonder one of my friends got engaged there.  The mood fits.  Like I said, once we were seated, the staff was friendly and attentive.  My absolute favorite thing about the evening was when we ordered, I ordered Ikura nigiri (salmon roe) and the server told me not to get it, because "it wasn't great today."  That is awesome, especially in a sushi restaurant.  Some people may be turned off to the whole experience, but I thanked her, and ordered something else instead.

On to the food:
++ they carry Sapporo, which I prefer to Kirin.
+/- salmon skin roll.  Just okay... I've had better.
+ King Dragon roll.  Soft shell crab w/ cukes topped with salmon. mmm.
+++ I forgot the name of the other roll, but it was shrimp tempura w/ cucumber and avocado topped with white tuna.  AMAZING.  The best roll of the night, and my favorite.
- We ordered a side of white rice and never got it.  They took it off the bill right away for us.
- Miso soup was luke-warm and just broth.

I would go back, but only when I have time for a leisurely meal... as others have said, it is a laid back place with... relaxed service.

My boyfriend and I love coming here for dinner. The interior is very welcoming and nice and the owner always recognizes us and says hi. The waitstaff is pleasant and timely as well as the chefs. I have yet to try a bad roll. This will continue to be our go to for sushi!

This place gets 2 stars for cool ambience. As a whole this is some of the worst sushi i have had in my life. How do you mess up tuna & yellow tail? I think i have had better tuna from a gas station. Wouldn't come back here if my life depended on it.
Terrible service. Took 10 minutes to get drink order after being seated. Waiter kept walking away while trying to order. We left before appetizers came because service was so bad.

sometimes i go on here to read all of the reviews that talk about the decor...they really just hit the spot...i feel like a restaurant shouldnt have toilet seat like chair covers...it really sends the wrong message about the quality of your food. the service is usually crappy, but the sushi can be good depending on who is making it (sometimes the saltiness is enough to land a person with high blood pressure in the er..i asked for raw fish not pickled fish..)...their "happy hour" is also getting shorter everytime i call in..

Life is too short to go to Naomi's.
Took them 3 minutes to greet us
Took them 3 more minutes to seat us
Took us 10 minutes with no service to get the hell out of there.
No, it wasn't a busy night.  

Gave it 2 stars, because the first time here wasn't so bad.

Best hand rolls ever!! Sushi chef is friendly and not to mention their professional waiters. Waiters are polite and make you feel like you're enjoying sushi in Japan. I can go here five days a week if i can. Highly recommend!! Btw, they're closed on Sundays.

I've been going here for over 8 years.  The sushi is always great! The owner Naomi is great & always treats her returning customers well. The only reason I didn't give it 4 stats was because many times the service is very slow. With all the business they're now getting, more staff would help a lot in making things run smoother.
I just want to follow up on on our favorite place for sushi. Hands down the best place on the planet! Thank you Naomi for always taking care of us.

I'm shocked - I thought I had already reviewed this place!

I drove by Naomi Sushi for a few years - it's pretty non-descript next to a doctor and a bike store along with a barely visible tavern. You'll miss the whole strip mall if you blink while driving by.

I finally decided to try it out about a year ago and have been a fan ever since. Some of the best sushi around with interesting specials and custom sushi rolls that a re fresh and crafted with pride. Great appetizers too. Nice decor inside - when I start dating a lady who likes sushi, this is the first place I'll take her. In the meantime, find me at the sushi bar!

Only downside for me is that I drink diet cola with everything and their portions are all out of a bottle and priced per order. I'd take a star off for this if this were a fast food place, but it isn't. Just mentioned it for "buyer beware" purposes.

If you like sushi - Naomi is a must!

The service, while polite, leaves a little to be desired, and the decor needs a little help with makeshift beer case walls and random islands interrupting a room that should flow, but the booths are really cute, bench seats with cushions and gathered drapes that lend a more intimate atmosphere, although there are normal tables with candles if one prefers. 

You know what, though, they could have been selling out of a basement, and I think I'd come back, the sushi was that good. We had wildfire and volcano rolls that were amazing, especially the volcano rolls! So much flavor and texture with the hot cashew, such a beautiful combination, without anything obnoxious or cheap like teriyaki sauce. Filling too! Even my finicky, sushi-connoisseur friend was impressed. Now let's see if I can bring her back! Oh, and salad with vinaigrette was refreshing too!

As far as price, you can probably expect $30 for two on a weeknight if you're ordering specialty rolls. The basic rolls are less (they're a great price, actually, around $7). Pretty reasonable and way tastier than, say, "Spanish-influenced" (yek!) Wildfire or a few other sushi joints in the area. It's between B&N and Randhurst, so after shopping go here rather than one of those mediocre restaurants. Keep your eye out! It's next to Ultra Foods.

I heard about this place from my brother and his wife.  We were in the mood for sushi so we decided to try it out on a Saturday night.

We get there and the place is pretty full.  We noticed a few groups of 6 or more people, so we thought it might be a while to get a seat.  They have a nice little waiting area with leather couches and tons of magazines to read.  Luckily for us we only waited 10 minutes before we were finally seated.  With groups of 5 or more, I would recommend trying to get reservations.

Right away I noticed something was odd about their service, it seemed like someone asked for the night off and they were short a person or two as it seemed all the wait staff was a little flustered.  Still they were nice and very apologetic.  

We order the Fried Soft Shell Crab appetizer as well as the Godzilla, Dragon, and Maki Rolls.  My brother and his wife ordered a few other rolls.  I also ordered the Shrimp Tempura.  Oh and the best dish of the night.. the golden turtle.

As I stated earlier, something was off about their service.  We had to remind our server about drinks, then it took 30 minutes for the soup and salad to come out.  They then bring out our first set of rolls, but we never got our appetizers so we said something to our server.  The manager came by and apologized and gave us free drinks.  

When we finally got our Fried Soft Shell Crab, it was good, but very fishy.  So fishy that 2 hours after the dinner I could still taste the fishiness whenever I burped.  :P

Anyways, I tried a couple rolls, but nothing really wowed me.  My girlfriend said the rolls were very oily.  

We were really hoping for a great place to eat sushi, but we were sadly disappointed.  My brother and his wife on their first go at the place said it was really good, so we're going to try the place out again and see how it fairs to our first outing.  

I really hope that their customer service Saturday night was just a fluke and is not normal.

Great sushi! Great ambience which features privates booths and a trendy Japanese atmosphere.  Their special maki rolls are excellent and are reasonably priced.  Also, salad and soup are served before your meal before you receive your sushi.  When having a sushi craving, this is the first place I look to eat.  They are closed on Sundays and do have Groupon deals.

The good:
+ Half price on SELECTED sushi from 4PM to 6PM on weekdays
+ Sometimes, you can catch a Groupon Now! deal (weekdays only, I believe)
+ Friendly service
+ Sushi is not bad.  It's not phenomenal....but not bad either.  

The bad:
- The decor! Oh my god! It's like a distrubed artist ate a Japanese/Gothic "art how-to book" and threw it up in here! Good god! Floor is part-tile, part-cement? The splashes of paint on the floor, the "doctor's waiting room" area when you come in --- with magazines, the booth with soft lighting.  I don't get what they were going for when decorating this place. Where's the zen?  Where's the elegant/clean and understated way the Japanese decorate? Cue airhead voice: Wha? I don't get it!

- Slow service. We've been here several times and we've always had 2 waitresses run the place.  One of the waitresses is also the owner/manager.

- When you come in during the 4PM - 6PM half price time or if you bring in a groupon, the waitresses and/or owner will try to convince you to order more. (Yeah, Ms. Naomi and Ms. Waitress. I am not Korean but I understand you two when you're talking about your customers in Korean.)  We always get the "friendly" suggestions: "I recommend this lobster sushi.  It's reaaaaally good!" (Not mentioning: And really pricey! That's why I'm recommending this to you!) or "How about appetizers and dessert?"  I can spot an upselling strategy from a mile away, sistah!

The bottomline:
- Go for the sushi when you have a coupon or during half-price sushi time. Make sure you come in early so service is a bit faster. Be careful of the upselling. Do not....I repeat.....do not even try to analyze the "artistic" way this place was designed.  You'll get a headache!
Naomi's is fantastic!  The restaurant is very eclectic, and clean.  The Sushi is very fresh.  The service is top notch and friendly.  Love this place for take out too!!

Absolutely love it here! Atmosphere is very cute and cozy and keeps your dining experience private. Loved that the owner (who I believe is Naomi) was very active and passionate about her job and super welcoming and friendly.  My only complaint, if you could call it that, is that the sushi doesn't all come out at once. Kind of awkward that my rolls came first and I was finished by the time my boyfriend started eating, but it helps that we like to share! Would definitely go back (to try something different on their HUGE menu!) and would recommend to friends.

I drive by this place all the time with "best sushi" plastered on it's store front. Moreover, it was next to a bike shop. I kept driving everyday until I had a unbearable sushi craving one night and decided to check it out. 

Do not be fooled by it's exterior. It is nice and cozy inside with a cute, dim decor. When I came in, i told them I will be dining alone but still preferred a table. The waitress politely smiled, led me to one of the tables, gave me the menu and offered several magazines. She was very attentive. The menu is extensive and lots to choose from. Ultimately, I chose to have the Unagi (see picture I posted). The taste and presentation was wonderful; the prices are reasonable. The staff is very polite and attentive. The food came timely. 

I agree with Bobby's review. I had a sushigasm that night. 

Although I did not feel uncomfortable dining alone, this place would be great to bring a significant other as it is very dimly lit with a romantic atmosphere. 

They did serve their green tea in tea bags. Minor thing but that disappoints me. If they were going to give great presentations on their food, they should at least serve their tea brewed without a bag and string on it. 

This is one place where you should not judge a book by it's cover. The exterior store front does not do justice to what you will experience inside.

Went to this place because of a Groupon and of course near by the house. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. When we went - I think the place was still being renovated. They didn't have space for my family of 5 in the "renovated" area so we sat in an area near by the door. It was very cold and was hard to enjoy dinner. The food was awesome. I didn't order my usual sushi's but went with the beef teriyaki from their menu. Pleased with my order. The beef was cooked exactly as I asked. My kids had the chicken teriyaki and no complaints at all from them. The hot tea was good to me. My cup was never empty. Our server accommodated my 2.5yr old and gave us paper for her to draw on. I didn't notice a kids menu selection - so we were forced to have my older children share and my little one share a big plate with me. The edamame was good to me also. Some places I've been to before here taste as if their edamame came out of a microwaveable bag. The hubby had no complaints with his sushi order.

Recommend this place to check out. Kind of hidden in a small stirp mall like area. Parking seems like it would suck if the dental office next door had alot of patients or if Naomi's was really busy. The original price before my Groupon was of average considering sushi is not cheap.
Great sushi and Naomi herself is a wonderful server! I would highly recommend the naked tuna roll.
The food is amazing.  Atmosphere  is a little strange.  Staff always seems super busy. This is our go to sushi place since the food is so good the other things can be overlooked.

Ok so... I still really love Naomi sushi, it's my fav and the sushi is always fresh. They have a great Groupon Now Deal Mon-Thu $25 for $40 for dinner. But... But .. But!! The service there is sooooooooooooo slowwwwwwwwwwwww! Ugh! The ladies there are so nice but ugh if you want to go there and get in and out... Think again!

We recently moved here from the city, and if this is the best sushi the 'burbs can come up with, I am going to be one very sad suburbanite. 

I just wasn't impressed with this place at ALL. The rolls are overpriced and underinspired. Almost all the specialty maki were either fried or stuffed with cream cheese. And very few of them had any actual raw fish or eggs. The baby godzilla roll? Mushy. Not good. The best roll I had, spicy tuna, was also the cheapest.

The glass of wine I ordered was also overpriced by at least $1.50 and tasted like it had either been sitting in a fridge for a long time or watered down. 

The ambiance was OK and the staff was friendly, but there's just no creativity or specialness about the place at all. I've had better sushi at just about every Chicago joint I've been to. And in other cities, too.

I'm not giving up on suburban sushi just yet, but I don't think this place is the answer.

Wonderful dinner. A great place to introduce the cuisine to a girlfriend that is reluctant to fish let alone raw. Super waitress, really wonderful, but I went on a Monday with a decent crowd. I do wonder how they cope Saturday night.

We had a restaurants.com  coupon & almost didn't choose this place because of the bad reviews. This is my first review because I think they really deserve it. We just came back from our second visit & I have to say we had excellent service. The owner came up a few times making sure everything was ok. I had a Maki Sushi roll, so good! I would have to say one of the best rolls in the suburbs. Great ambiance & atmosphere for a sushi place! Cute romantic booths, chill music playing. I'm happy we gave them a try & we will definitely be regulars!

Domo Arrigato Naomi Sushi!

I've decided after my second visit I can accurately review what I believed to be true from my initial impression. This place is good.

My first visit to Naomi was inspired by their sign out front that advertises "Best Sushi". I saw these words and thought to myself "Well I'll be the judge of that". It was rather empty inside when we arrived so I was initially wary that my evening would become a fishy nightmare but I kept on with my pursuit for happiness.

The wait staff is ultra friendly and almost seem genuinely excited I'm there to eat their sushi. I've had hooters waitresses show me less attention and excitement. 

Food wise the Sushi is tasty. Certainly some of the better sushi in the area. Best? Maybe for the Arlington Heights, Prospect Heights, Mount Prospect area. Both visits the sushi tasted fresh and was quite good. Nothing kills a sushi session more than some semi room temperature dry fish circle stuffed with hardening rice and sticky seaweed. I seem to run into places often that think they can get away with serving that shit to me though. 

Naomi Sushi was so confident in their Baby Godzilla roll's taste that the waitress informed me I shouldn't really put much soy sauce on it, if at all, because it was good just the way it was. She was correct.

Affordable tasty sushi close to home. I'm certainly pleased.

Good setting and amazing food. Only if the ribeye dish Jackie chan was better it would be a five but otherwise great.

Asher O'Hara

Oh Naomi Sushi, what a wonderful place you are. A diamond in the rough, located next to a bike shop in a tiny strip mall in front of an abandoned dominicks (I know I know not the best start so far), but the sushi here is to die for. Truly authentic Japanese restaurant, deemed so by a Japanese friend! And Naomi herself is usually the hostess and/or waitress. She has quite the personality and is very good to her regulars. All the sushi is worth getting here, but definitely branch out to the Special Maki's. Not only are the names fun, but they are TASTY. Godzilla is by far my favorite, but you can't go wrong with any of them! 
The only negative is that there is never enough business inside so its a little too quiet. If Naomi Sushi was in a better location, this would not be the case. But it is what it is!

My friend told me that she was taking me to dinner at this little sushi place in a strip mall... needless to say, I was skeptical. Strip-mall sushi? That seems a little scary to me. However, I was pleasantly surprised and it was really, really good. 

We had the nicest waitress I think I've ever had, the rolls were delicious, and the presentation of the plates is beautiful. The decor is a little over-the-top for me, I'm not a over-decorated, draperied, water fountained restaurant type of chick. I guess they're trying to make you forget you're in a strip mall. Decorations aside, the food was great and service was excellent. I'd definitely go back.

There is too much good to be said of this restaurant. The food was fantastic, the service was impeccable and the atmosphere was very warm and welcoming. 

My first time at Naomi Sushi was on a Friday night, and, as many of the reviews suggest, the place was packed. One tip that I would leave for future diners would be to place a reservation ahead of time. Anyways, back to the good stuff. Their menu is very playful and creative using names like the "godzilla" and "king kong" and it is also very diverse and has something for everyone! If you're not a fan of raw fish, then there's also a grill section which features chicken teriyaki and golden shrimp. 

This was my first time here, and I am definitely coming back in the future! If I could give each section of the restaurant a separate score, I would give them each 5 stars out of 5! I highly recommend this place to any sushi fanatic, or any adventurous people who are willing to try this delicacy.

Naomi Sushi is my favorite sushi spot in the Arlington Heights area, although I have also been know to frequent Wildfish.  Naomi's atmosphere is unique and abstract, and is much more traditionally Asian-styled than other sushi restaurants in the area.  I have never had an issue getting seated immediately with a reservation, which is more than I can say for others.

The menu is extensive and not limited to sushi.  From the miso to the maki rolls, the cuisine is excellent.  It is also more traditional than some of the other sushi restaurants in the area.  The wait staff is very attentive and the experience is a great value.  I strongly recommend that you check it out.

This place from the outside doesn't look fancy. Which is perfect for us! That's right... Keep driving by. It just means no long insane lines for a table. 

Neatly tucked in between a bike shop & a dentist office, you can easily miss it or pass it up. We did for the first 3 years living just 5 mins. from it. 

After trying those all-you-can-eat sushi places we wanted someplace with more fish than rice. We decided to go to Naomi's and we've been back lots of times since. 

The seafood is fresh and the cuts are generous. There isn't a huge hunk of rice underneath to fill you up needlessly. Their rolls are artfully prepared and we've never had to wait an unreasonable time for service or for our food. The waitstaff have all been polite, timely and helpful. Being 4 months pregnant & loving sushi I have to restrain my cravings. They're understanding & they make sure there isn't anything raw or inappropriate for me on my plate. Naomi is a sweet woman who seems to remember everyone who walks in through her door. She greets us like we're family coming over for dinner. 

As the other reviewers said, it is a nice setting for a romantic meal or even just a nice quiet get together meall with some friends. The decor is elegant and there are some artfully draped tables giving you some nice privacy. We went with my family and son (20 months) and everyone had a great time. 

Carry out is good here too! We love eating Naomi Sushi in our jammies while watching a good movie. Carry out is just a fast and artful as dining in.
ok we've been back a few times now.  Some of the distracting and chaotic  table arrangements have been adjusted.  We can now focus on the food again, which IS really, really good.  We'll be back!

Finding good sushi in the suburbs can be a challenge, especially since there is no obvious way to spot it. Imagine my surprise when I found fantastic sushi in this non-descript storefront spot.

Yes, they do get busy. Yes, it can feel understaffed, but the available staff does a tremendous job keeping their tables happy, glasses filled, and plates cleared. It isn't perfect, but I want my money to go towards great sushi, not feeling like a snotty VIP.

And it is great sushi. From their tiny corner kitchen comes sushi magic. The first time there, I stumbled through the menu and made some great discoveries. The next time, I went with the chef's choice and enjoyed tremendous rolls, sashimi, and sushi. Everything fresh. Everything tasty. Everything presented well.

I brought a friend who isn't particularly a sushi fan. He raved about the teriyaki (I was too stuffed with a particularly good dragon roll to try it), so I assume the rest of the menu is just as good.

You must try this place!

Wonderful service and great sushi. My wife got the salmon entry and the portion was huge and cooked to perfection. Although it was in a strip mall and did not look special from the outside, it was a neat cozy place within. Try it out!

I have been here several times and the sushi is great.  The servers are typically good but sometimes it does take longer than I like.  It is difficult to get there for their happy hour but it's worth it if you can make it.

This place has THE BEST sushi ever. Huge slices of fish on top of giant rolls. We can't get enough. I noticed some customers said the service was slow, but they must have stepped that up, because when I went, it was like a 5-star restaurant. Our waiter stood nearby our tables, approaching often to ask if we needed anything and to refresh our drinks, etc. I've been to a ton of sushi places and this one is my favorite!

Have to give it a really good review

Not many very good sushi places that I've found in the suburbs.  As good as Akai Hana in Wilmette; way, way, way, better than Yummy Sushi....best sushi I've found so far in Arlington heights.  I'd put it against anything in Chicago as a price/wait in line performer (I can't imagine anyone ever having to wait in line)

Staff is a little odd... I think it's a combination of not being really busy and an interesting owner...I'm thinking of a certain Seinfeld episode

Been back 4 times and going again tonight

I wanted so badly to like this sushi restaurant. I ordered the Philadelphia, the spicy tuna and the rainbow, which only came out to about $20, being very reasonable! The staff were very nice and accommodating as well. 
The Philadelphia roll was just cream cheese wrapped in rice with a piece of salmon thrown on top. Nothing else! I expected some kind of veggies or avocado or SOMETHING more inside. The spicy tuna was ok. It was actually wrapped in seaweed on the outside, tasting more like kimbob than sushi, but it was good enough. Finally the rainbow roll. Yikes. It wasn't just crab but some kind of crab mix/salad. Maybe it's because they were packing up and it wasn't as fresh as it could have been, but I paid dearly for that one later.  I will definitely be on the lookout for other sushi places in the future.

Naomi Sushi has forced me to add a new word to the English lexicon: sushigasm.

It's that good.  Two full pages of appetizers (hot and cold), one for a nigiri, one for traditional maki rolls, another for special rolls, another for Naomi signatures, another for combinations, and then they have other non-sushi entrees and desserts.  Good drinks too.  It's intense. 

The decor is a cute and darkened, with some of the central tables draped almost like private booths.  You're always well-taken care of and they're willing to help guide you through the menu and make suggestions.  If Naomi herself is working that evening, you'll have an absolute ball.  She's adorable.

We've never tried any of the non-sushi dishes; why would you?  The rolls here are massive, fresh, beautifully presented and delicious. We're not talking those little six piece rolls you can find at the Jewel.  These are full-bodied masterpieces, with healthy portions of fish, not just lots of rice to flesh them out.  The signatures and specials are all great if you're adventurous, but even the standards are done in a way that makes them superior to anywhere else.

And the best part?  The prices run the same as sushi you get at the Jewel or that dumpy little take-out place around the corner from your place.  Honestly, it's kind of a problem. The quality and price of Naomi makes me angry to get sushi anywhere else because I'm paying the same amount as Naomi for inferior food.

I know it seems odd that the best Sushi I've found is in Arlington Heights, thousands of miles from any ocean.  But I'll keep making the trek out there, for sure.

We were hungry,  driving by and thought we'd try it out. We were very happy with the level of service, decor, presentation, and food. 

The nigiri was fresh and delicious. The appetizers were great. And everything made us feel like royalty. Best waiter I've ever had. No lie. They timed everything perfectly.

The food was just beautiful. If ever in the area again I'd go back.

We've been here 3 times in the past 2 weeks, we just can't stay away. The staff is super friendly. 

I believe we might have had Naomi herself today as our server, & she is just so awesome. My husband & i are both vegetarians & on our first visit she noticed from across the room that we were not eating our free Miso soup (we had assumed it would contain some soft of fish) & she came over to inform us that it was completely vegetarian, as she had presumed that we were vegetarians by the order we placed. She's so sweet! 

When we were back today she remembered us & showed us all the options on the menu we had as vegetarians. While there were not all that many vegetarian options for us on the menu, she went out of her way to tell us about a few rolls they could make *specifically* for us. We had one that she made up for us & it was so unbelievably good! Very different, & very tasty. 

i can not say enough good things about this place. I also feel it is very reasonably priced! All around - - highly recommended!

My wife and I found this sushi restaurant several years ago after moving into Mount Prospect.  We would come maybe 2 or 3 times a year, not as often as we'd like as we now have 2 baby boys.  Regardless, we enjoy eating at this restaurant that has great service and great tasting food.  The main host (owner?) with the short hair cut and glasses, is always friendly and inviting.  We look forward to returning back to Naomi Sushi and make it a regular place for us to go out and enjoy each other's company.

I've tried a number of their pasta dishes as well as a few paninis and I'm always satisfied

For dessert, they have delicious gelato and tasty cannolis.

Friendly staff and you definitely get your $ worths (generous portions)

The food here is always amazing, that is why I always return, however, my 2 star update review is due to the customer service that has been steadily declining...

The owner is nice, and hope he takes action in correcting this issue, maybe with a meeting on customer service to his cashiers and a workplace ethic review. The cashiers have too much attitude, with the exception of the male that use to work there, he was always pleasant and the new girl they just hired is friendly too. Here's a couple incidents that led to my updated unsatisfied review:

1. I came in one date before the lunch rush, I walked in on a cashier with her back turned to me giving the cooks attitude, yelling at them. The cooks inform the sassy cashier that a customer has walked in and she needs to turn around and take my order and she responds with "I know someone walked in, I'll turn around when I want to." About 15 seconds of awkward silence with her back still turned to me went by and she then turns around and takes my order. RUDE. I debated saying something, but I decided not to as I come here too often and don't want to be perceived as the crazy customer. 

2. I go through the drive thru and place my order. I get to the window and they hand me my food and quickly close the window on me. I didn't even get to tell them that they forgot to hand me my drink. So I wait there for like 5 minutes knocking on the window, and a nice man comes to the window I tell him that they forgot to give me my Pepsi. He gets me my drink, but it was Diet Pepsi, sigh, I hate Diet Pepsi....I drove away, I didn't feel like knocking on the window and waiting longer.

3. Today I went in and ordered to go. They start making my order to eat in, I see that and quickly inform them that its to go. The cashier then expresses her frustration with a low grunt. I open up my bag when I arrive to my office and I see that the order for a "meatball on the side" was placed in my pasta...which would have been fine if it was just my order. I wanted it on the side to give to a coworker.  

I do have to say this isn't the case every time I come in, as I've been here over a handful of times in the course of several years, but It was just these recent situations that made me feel the need to make Avanti aware. In all the time I've been going here I've never experienced anything like this before, my visits are usually sweet and short.

Stopped by this cafe after reading the reviews on Yelp. We were quickly passing through on our way to Wisconsin for the Ohio State game. I had the meatball sub which was great. Loved the bread they used, the cheese on top, the sauce was amazing, and the meatballs were BIG. Fast, easy service and amazing food. I would definitelystop by.
Best Italian food I have ever had. Just wish I lived closer to try more of their menu! I am going to recommend Avanti to my fellow coworkers who visit the area for training

I really underestimated this restaurant!  It looks like fast food inside and out.  It is very casual with counter service. The food is EXCELLENT!  Dinner entrees cone with soup or salad and a basket of fresh bread.

I must say I really like this place. We just moved into the area about 6 months ago and used them to cater our housewarming party. Not only was the food amazing but it was given to us (we picked up) piping hot and everyone loved it. We got beef, chicken, potatoes, and a noodle I believe. The people behind the desk were super patient with me and very nice too. Would use and WILL BE using again for our holiday party! ONLY downside is that their catering menu is different than the in-house menu so I couldn't try anything before I ordered it, I just had to trust it would be good (which is was)

My friend and I were in the area and happened to find this cute little spot through yelp. My friend ordered the Roma Italian sub and I got their tuna on a bed of house salad with their special Italian dressing. The salad that I ordered isn't on the menu but the man that was taking our orders was really nice and offered to customize my salad for me when I told him I was in the mood for a salad but wasn't really feeling anything on the menu. The portions were really big for the price. My friend really liked her sub and I think that the tuna salad here is one of the best tuna salads I've ever had. I'll definitely come back if I was ever in the neighborhood.

Definitely keep Avanti's in mind for catering for any events you have coming up. We have ordered catering from them for years and they always do a fantastic job! We usually order a salad, roasted vegetables, bowtie vodka pasta, and chicken limon. It's definitely a crowd pleaser and better than any grocery bought wraps!

We also go here a lot just for dinner, usually ordering the same stuff that we order with catering. The pasta is to die for. They serve meals with some focaccia bread which I love for its freshness and it has the perfect amount of olive oil in it. They also have a delicious arancini that really fills you up (they're huge!).
Great locally owned with fantastic food. I have become a lunch regular and love the meatball sandwich. Service is great and food is always delicious.

Very nice place the staff smile at you when you walk in the food very descent the prices are right on the money and the music they have playing in the restaurant is in Italian language very original the reason I give 4 **** is because the table wasn't clean other than that I do recommend this restaurant.
Great food great service!!!
Cute and delicious sandwich shop. Very happy with the food and had very fast service.

A very casual place to go get food! And the food is very good! We will definitely back! However, we came later in the evening about an hour before they closed. I do not recommend the gelato as mine was had a chewy chunks texture. (like day old Spunky Dunker Ice cream.) it was pretty gross. They did try to fix it when I asked, but it was still chewy.  So, Pasta and sandwiches and salads? Fantastic! Gelato? Not so much...

Yummy!! Got spaghetti with vodka sauce, came with a side salad, also got the rice ball, hazelnut gelato and a cannoli! It was a big lunch but very delicious. My husband helped me with some of it. He got the meatball sub and enjoyed it too. Good portion and great taste. Will be going back

The food and friendly staff led by owner Tony makes this the best lunch stop in the Mt Prospect/ Des Plaines area. My favorite dish is the Pasta Diavolo but you can't go wrong with any selection . Make sure to finish your meal with a scoop of gelato. Highly recommended.

My roomie said it was the best sandwich he has ever had! The man knows his food trust me. He had the Diablo I had the Classico. Took some hand made, on the spot, calzones. Owner ensured  us it'd be the best calzone we ever had. Not trying to brag, but living in Jersey City, near Hoboken the home of the Submarine Sandwich, I can tell you this was a great Sub sandwich. Had chocolate biscotti had nice anisette flavor to it. And the price was like 7$ for a loaded 10"sub! Def recommend it. Keep up the good work!

In the last year I've stopped in a few times opting for a nice sit down lunch during my crazy commutes between the city and burbs.  I gotta say, they have really surprised my taste buds.  

Lately, I've been sticking with stuff that's mostly vegetarian, whether they be pastas, salads or Tostinos (grilled panini sandwiches).  I really dig their roasted eggplant and portabello tostinos.  When I'm in the mood for something a little different, I like to look into their display case and order randomly.  So far, all good stuff.

Been coming to this place since it first opened year across the street.  Being here is like being with family Tony and Mario are amazing hosts, always friendly and never shy about offering up a free espresso.  The reason I keep coming besides the above is because you cannot find a better combination of good food at a good price anywhere and obviously customer service is first class.  Kudos to tony and family for maintaining such high standards without sacrificing quality and keeping very reasonable prices.  I will keep coming and recommending Avanti to anyone i can.  Their catering service is also second to none!
Such a cute little family restaurant. I've gone to avanti a few times on weekends and the kids were there helping out. Even the kids were friendly and did a great job serving us.

We just didn't get it. My mom, who's 85, was sick last week. So I called Avanti for delivery. I sent her split pea soup, lasagne and a tuna sub. She raved and raved about the best split pea soup ever, loaded with prosciutto and veggies. And she seriously raved for two days, couldn't wait to get more!. She called to find out when she should buy it again, and went out in sub zero weather to get more today. She was so disappointed. No prosciutto, none,  watery and not much flavor.

We went Saturday, drove 50 mins. Meh. I had the mushy escarole soup which had maybe 7 beans and one piece of thin sliced sausage. I ordered the arancini, which was nuked and ice cold in the middle. We wanted to try a little bit of everything so I ordered the diavolo sub. It came without the Italian dressing or any other condiment.

My husband ordered his favourite Italian sausage sandwich.  It tasted steamed, certainly not grilled. Kind of mushy. 

We also ordered onion rings, they were okay, pricy at almost $5, and took way longer than the rest of the food.
